"anxiety Details Story Dictionary 煩 anxiety Heisig's The existential condition of anxiety that arises from the inevitable frustration of our worldly passions is contained in this character. The head is set afire, causing deep torment of spirit (and a whopper of a headache). Koohii #1 An anxiety feels like FIRE in the HEAD. Koohii #2 Many performers get ""Michael Jackson anxiety"" wherein they fear their head will catch on fire. Primitives anxiety, fire, head, page, one, ceiling, drop, shellfish, clam, oyster, eye, animal legs, eight 煩わしい(わずらわしい): troublesome, annoying, complicated Kunyomi: わずら.う、わずら.わす Onyomi: ハン、ボン Lesson: 8 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 煩雑 (はんざつ), 煩う (わずら.う), 煩わす (わずら.わす)"	"anxiety 煩 画数13 175 Details Story Dictionary 煩 anxiety Heisig's The existential condition of anxiety that arises from the inevitable frustration of our worldly passions is contained in this character. The head is set afire, causing deep torment of spirit (and a whopper of a headache). Koohii #1 An anxiety feels like FIRE in the HEAD. Koohii #2 Many performers get ""Michael Jackson anxiety"" wherein they fear their head will catch on fire. Primitives anxiety, fire, head, page, one, ceiling, drop, shellfish, clam, oyster, eye, animal legs, eight 煩わしい(わずらわしい): troublesome, annoying, complicated Kunyomi: わずら.う、わずら.わす Onyomi: ハン、ボン Lesson: 8 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 煩雑 (はんざつ), 煩う (わずら.う), 煩わす (わずら.わす)"
thin Details Story Dictionary 淡 thin Heisig's The primitives in this kanji read: water . . . inflammation. Taking inflammation in its medical sense, the first water-related inflammation that pops into mind is dehydration, the principal symptom of which is that it makes one shrivel up and look very, very thin. If that is hard to remember, try thinking it backwards: a very thin chap passes by and you imagine him suffering from (being inflamed with) dehydration (hence the element for water). Koohii #1 Drink water and burn twice as many calories as you eat... you´ll definitely get thin. Imagine inside your body, all those calories literally being burned from above and below... THAT´s what it takes to become thin. Koohii #2 Thin girls are twice as hot when they´re wet. Primitives thin, water, water droplets, water pistol, inflammation, fire, fire2 冷淡(れいたん): coolness, indifference 淡水(たんすい): fresh water Kunyomi: あわ.い Onyomi: タン Lesson: 8 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 淡い (あわ.い)	thin 淡 画数11 176 Details Story Dictionary 淡 thin Heisig's The primitives in this kanji read: water . . . inflammation. Taking inflammation in its medical sense, the first water-related inflammation that pops into mind is dehydration, the principal symptom of which is that it makes one shrivel up and look very, very thin. If that is hard to remember, try thinking it backwards: a very thin chap passes by and you imagine him suffering from (being inflamed with) dehydration (hence the element for water). Koohii #1 Drink water and burn twice as many calories as you eat... you´ll definitely get thin. Imagine inside your body, all those calories literally being burned from above and below... THAT´s what it takes to become thin. Koohii #2 Thin girls are twice as hot when they´re wet. Primitives thin, water, water droplets, water pistol, inflammation, fire, fire2 冷淡(れいたん): coolness, indifference 淡水(たんすい): fresh water Kunyomi: あわ.い Onyomi: タン Lesson: 8 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 淡い (あわ.い)
lamp Details Story Dictionary 灯 lamp Heisig's Since it is very hard to read by the fireplace without going blind from the flickering of the flames or burning up from the heat, our ancestors invented a way to nail down a bit of that fire, just enough to light up the text of their evening newspapers and no more. Voilà! The lamp. Koohii #1 Imagine old gas lamps which had a flame to light up the street signs. Koohii #2 A lamp is fire you can hang from a nail. Primitives lamp, fire, street, nail, spike 灯(ともしび): light 蛍光灯(けいこうとう): fluorescent lamp, person who is slow to react 灯台(とうだい): lighthouse 灯油(とうゆ): lamp oil, kerosene 灯(ひ): light 電灯(でんとう): light Kunyomi: ひ、ほ-、ともしび、とも.す、あかり Onyomi: トウ Lesson: 8 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 灯 (ひ)	lamp 灯 画数6 177 Details Story Dictionary 灯 lamp Heisig's Since it is very hard to read by the fireplace without going blind from the flickering of the flames or burning up from the heat, our ancestors invented a way to nail down a bit of that fire, just enough to light up the text of their evening newspapers and no more. Voilà! The lamp. Koohii #1 Imagine old gas lamps which had a flame to light up the street signs. Koohii #2 A lamp is fire you can hang from a nail. farm Details Story Dictionary 畑 farm Heisig's Looking at the primitives, a fireplace and a rice field, we find the essential ingredients for a farm: a warm hearth to sit by at night, and a well-plowed field to grow one's crops in by day. Koohii #1 Many farms are created by first setting FIRE over the land to clear the land for the FIELDS. Koohii #2 When creating a farm, the prospective farmer must first set fire to the forest to clear the ground. Only then can he plow the fields. Fire before fields to make a farm. Primitives farm, fire, rice field, brains 畑(はたけ): field Kunyomi: はた、はたけ、-ばたけ Onyomi: Lesson: 8 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: Compounds: 畑 (はた), 畑 (はたけ)	farm 畑 画数9 178 Details Story Dictionary 畑 farm Heisig's Looking at the primitives, a fireplace and a rice field, we find the essential ingredients for a farm: a warm hearth to sit by at night, and a well-plowed field to grow one's crops in by day. Koohii #1 Many farms are created by first setting FIRE over the land to clear the land for the FIELDS. Koohii #2 When creating a farm, the prospective farmer must first set fire to the forest to clear the ground. Only then can he plow the fields. Fire before fields to make a farm. disaster Details Story Dictionary 災 disaster Heisig's Of all of nature's disasters, this kanji picks out two of the worst: floods and fires. To recall the disposition of the elements, think of nature's solution to nature's own problem: a great flood pouring down over a great forest fire. Koohii #1 What a disaster! First a FIRE, then on top of it came FLOODs. Koohii #2 Don´t know about Japan, but here in Australia, flooding rivers and bushfires are the most common natural disasters. Primitives disaster, stream, flood, fire 災害(さいがい): calamity, disaster, misfortune 戦災(せんさい): war damage 天災(てんさい): natural calamity, disaster 火災(かさい): conflagration, fire 災難(さいなん): calamity, misfortune Kunyomi: わざわ.い Onyomi: サイ Lesson: 8 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 災い (わざわ.い)	disaster 災 画数7 179 Details Story Dictionary 災 disaster Heisig's Of all of nature's disasters, this kanji picks out two of the worst: floods and fires. "ashes Details Story Dictionary 灰 ashes Heisig's The kanji for ashes naturally includes the primitive for fire, or more specifically, a fireplace. Now what do you do with that bucket of ashes you have just cleaned out of the fireplace? You walk to the edge of a cliff and tip it upside down, watching as they are swept away in the wind like a swarm of gray mosquitoes. Thus the fire, once it has turned to ashes, ends up at the bottom of the cliff. Koohii #1 The fire underneath the cliff will eventually turn everything above to ashes. Koohii #2 Scene from ""The Big Lebowski"" : Walter scatters Donny´s ashes, but a wind blows much of the ashes into ""The Dude"" Lebowski´s face. Upset, The Dude lashes out at Walter. Walter apologizes and hugs The Dude, before suggesting ""Fuck it, man. Let´s go bowling."" I bet you that The Dude wanted to cremate (fire) Walter right there and then, at the top of the cliff! (thanks Elktapestry). Primitives ashes, cliff, fire 灰(あく): puckery juice 灰皿(はいさら): ashtray 灰(はい): ash 灰色(はいいろ): grey, ashen 灰皿(はいざら): ashtray Kunyomi: はい Onyomi: カイ Lesson: 8 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 灰 (はい)"	"ashes 灰 画数6 180 Details Story Dictionary 灰 ashes Heisig's The kanji for ashes naturally includes the primitive for fire, or more specifically, a fireplace. Walter apologizes and hugs The Dude, before suggesting ""Fuck it, man. Let´s go bowling."" I bet you that The Dude wanted to cremate (fire) Walter right there and then, at the top of the cliff! spot Details Story Dictionary 点 spot Heisig's If you look into the flickering of a fire for a long time and then turn aside, you will see spots before your eyes. Although nobody ever thought of such a thing before - as least as far as know, they didn't - imagine using those spots as a technique for fortune-telling. The old witch sits before her cauldron and watches the spots that show up when she turns to look at you, and from that tells your fortune. Think of it as a kind of spot-check on your future. Koohii #1 The FORTUNE TELLER was burned by FLAMES on the spot because she was accused of being a witch. Koohii #2 You have to stimulate the G-spot with your magic wand in order to get her on fire. Or you can juste use your mouth... Primitives spot, fortune-telling, magic wand, augury, mouth, oven-fire, barbecue 観点(かんてん): point of view 起点(きてん): starting point 原点(げんてん): origin (coordinates), starting point 減点(げんてん): subtract, give a demerit 視点(してん): opinion, point of view, visual point 点く(つく): be lit, catch fire 点火(てんか): ignition, lighting, set fire to 点検(てんけん): inspection, examination, checking 点線(てんせん): dotted line, perforated line 得点(とくてん): score, points made, marks obtained, runs 盲点(もうてん): blind spot 利点(りてん): advantage, point in favor 句読点(くとうてん): punctuation marks 欠点(けってん): faults, defect, weakness 交差点(こうさてん): crossing, intersection 採点(さいてん): marking, grading, looking over 弱点(じゃくてん): weak point, weakness 終点(しゅうてん): terminus, last stop (e.g train) 重点(じゅうてん): important point, lay stress on, emphasis, colon 焦点(しょうてん): focus, point 地点(ちてん): site, point on a map 頂点(ちょうてん): top, summit 点ける(つける): turn on, switch on, light up 点数(てんすう): marks, points, score, number of items, credits 点々(てんてん): here and there, little by little, sporadically, scattered in drops, dot, spot 満点(まんてん): perfect score 要点(ようてん): gist, main point 零点(れいてん): zero, no marks 点(てん): point, mark, grade Kunyomi: つ.ける、つ.く、た.てる、さ.す、とぼ.す、とも.す、ぼち Onyomi: テン Lesson: 8 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds:	spot 点 画数9 181 Details Story Dictionary 点 spot Heisig's If you look into the flickering of a fire for a long time and then turn aside, you will see spots before your eyes. illuminate Details Story Dictionary 照 illuminate Heisig's Although the range of possible meanings that the kanji for illuminate can have is about as rich as the connotations of the English word, we need to focus on just one of them: to make something shine. If you glaze a pot and put it into the oven to fire it, you in fact illuminate it. Hence the kanji for illuminate compares the kanji for shining with the primitive element for the oven's fire. Koohii #1 SHINING FLAMES illuminate! Koohii #2 The sun was seduced to give us fire, by which we illuminate the night. Primitives illuminate, shining, sun, day, summon, seduce, sword, dagger, mouth, oven-fire, barbecue 参照(さんしょう): reference, consultation, consultation 照合(しょうごう): collation, comparison 照明(しょうめい): illumination 照り返す(てりかえす): to reflect, to throw back light 対照(たいしょう): contrast, antithesis, comparison 照らす(てらす): shine on, illuminate 照る(てる): shine Kunyomi: て.る、て.らす、て.れる Onyomi: ショウ Lesson: 8 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 照らす (て.らす), 照る (て.る), 照れる (て.れる)	illuminate 照 画数13 182 Details Story Dictionary 照 illuminate Heisig's Although the range of possible meanings that the kanji for illuminate can have is about as rich as the connotations of the English word, we need to focus on just one of them: to make something shine. If you glaze a pot and put it into the oven to fire it, you in fact illuminate it. Hence the kanji for illuminate compares the kanji for shining with the primitive element for the oven's fire. Koohii #1 SHINING FLAMES illuminate! Koohii #2 The sun was seduced to give us fire, by which we illuminate the night. Primitives illuminate, shining, sun, day, summon, seduce, sword, dagger, mouth, oven-fire, barbecue 参照(さんしょう): reference, consultation, consultation 照合(しょうごう): collation, comparison 照明(しょうめい): illumination 照り返す(てりかえす): to reflect, to throw back light 対照(たいしょう): contrast, antithesis, comparison 照らす(てらす): shine on, illuminate 照る(てる): shine Kunyomi: て.る、て.らす、て.れる Onyomi: ショウ Lesson: 8 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 照らす (て.らす), 照る (て.る), 照れる (て.れる)
fish Details Story Dictionary 魚 fish Heisig's The composition of this kanji shows three elements, which we list in the order of their writing: bound up . . . rice field . . . cooking fire. Not much to work with at first sight. But we can join them together by thinking of a three-part story: first a fish is caught and bound up on a line with its unfortunate school-mates; when the fisherman gets home, he cuts off the head and tosses it, with the entrails, out into the rice fields for fertilizer; and the rest he sets in a skillet over a cooking fire for his supper. Koohii #1 The elements of this kanji are bound up, rice field and cooking fire. When I think of bound up cooked rice, it makes me think of sushi, which in turn brings to mind fish. Koohii #2 Bind that FISH and cook his brains! Yarhh! Primitives fish, bound up, rice field, brains, oven-fire, barbecue 魚(うお): fish 金魚(きんぎょ): goldfish 魚(さかな): fish Kunyomi: うお、さかな、-ざかな Onyomi: ギョ Lesson: 8 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds: 魚 (うお), 魚 (さかな)	fish 魚 画数11 183 Details Story Dictionary 魚 fish Heisig's The composition of this kanji shows three elements, which we list in the order of their writing: bound up . . . rice field . . . cooking fire. Not much to work with at first sight. But we can join them together by thinking of a three-part story: first a fish is caught and bound up on a line with its unfortunate school-mates; when the fisherman gets home, he cuts off the head and tosses it, with the entrails, out into the rice fields for fertilizer; and the rest he sets in a skillet over a cooking fire for his supper. Koohii #1 The elements of this kanji are bound up, rice field and cooking fire. When I think of bound up cooked rice, it makes me think of sushi, which in turn brings to mind fish. Koohii #2 Bind that FISH and cook his brains! Yarhh! Primitives fish, bound up, rice field, brains, oven-fire, barbecue 魚(うお): fish 金魚(きんぎょ): goldfish 魚(さかな): fish Kunyomi: うお、さかな、-ざかな Onyomi: ギョ Lesson: 8 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds: 魚 (うお), 魚 (さかな)
fishing Details Story Dictionary 漁 fishing Heisig's To the story we have just made about fish, this kanji for the profession of fishing adds yet another element BEFORE the others: namely the water, where the fish was happily at home before being caught, disemboweled, and eaten. Be sure to get a clear image of the water when you put it all together. Koohii #1 You need WATER and FISH for fishing. Koohii #2 If you are confusing this with angling like me, take fishing to mean not the act of catching a fish but the act of being a fish not living but fishing (i.e. in the water). Primitives fishing, water, water droplets, water pistol, fish, bound up, rice field, brains, oven-fire, barbecue 漁船(ぎょせん): fishing boat 漁村(ぎょそん): fishing village 漁業(ぎょぎょう): fishing (industry) 漁師(りょうし): fisherman Kunyomi: あさ.る Onyomi: ギョ、リョウ Lesson: 8 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 漁業 (ぎょぎょう), 漁船 (ぎょせん), 漁村 (ぎょそん)	fishing 漁 画数14 184 Details Story Dictionary 漁 fishing Heisig's To the story we have just made about fish, this kanji for the profession of fishing adds yet another element BEFORE the others: namely the water, where the fish was happily at home before being caught, disemboweled, and eaten. Be sure to get a clear image of the water when you put it all together. Koohii #1 You need WATER and FISH for fishing. Koohii #2 If you are confusing this with angling like me, take fishing to mean not the act of catching a fish but the act of being a fish not living but fishing (i.e. in the water). Primitives fishing, water, water droplets, water pistol, fish, bound up, rice field, brains, oven-fire, barbecue 漁船(ぎょせん): fishing boat 漁村(ぎょそん): fishing village 漁業(ぎょぎょう): fishing (industry) 漁師(りょうし): fisherman Kunyomi: あさ.る Onyomi: ギョ、リョウ Lesson: 8 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 漁業 (ぎょぎょう), 漁船 (ぎょせん), 漁村 (ぎょそん)
"ri Details Story Dictionary 里 ri Heisig's That's right - a ri. Don't bother looking it up in your English dictionary; it's a Japanese word for measuring distances. One ri is about 4 kilometers or 2.5 miles. The kanji depicts how the measure came to be used. Atop we see the rice field, and below the element for land. Those four sections you see in the rice field (and which we made mention of when first we introduced the character in frame 14) are actually measurements of land, much the same as farm-sections in the United States have given us the notion of a ""country mile."" The land division based on the size of a rice field is called a ri. * To get a more concrete primitive meaning for this kanji, we shall refer to it as a computer, a meaning deriving from the kanji for logic, which we will meet in Lesson 12. Koohii #1 The ri is a Japanese way of measuring the area of the GROUND underneath a RICE FIELD. Koohii #2 Hint: Heisig makes here a severe disservice to everyone by using a weird keyword for this character. You´ll save a lot (and I mean, a whole lot) of trouble later by giving it instead its intended meaning: House of the Parents. Primitives ri, computer, rice field, brains, soil, dirt, ground 郷里(きょうり): birth-place, home town Kunyomi: さと Onyomi: リ Lesson: 9 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: Compounds: 里 (さと)"	"ri 里 画数7 185 Details Story Dictionary 里 ri Heisig's That's right - a ri. Don't bother looking it up in your English dictionary; it's a Japanese word for measuring distances. One ri is about 4 kilometers or 2.5 miles. The kanji depicts how the measure came to be used. Those four sections you see in the rice field (and which we made mention of when first we introduced the character in frame 14) are actually measurements of land, much the same as farm-sections in the United States have given us the notion of a ""country mile."" The land division based on the size of a rice field is called a ri. * To get a more concrete primitive meaning for this kanji, we shall refer to it as a computer, a meaning deriving from the kanji for logic, which we will meet in Lesson 12. Koohii #2 Hint: Heisig makes here a severe disservice to everyone by using a weird keyword for this character. You´ll save a lot (and I mean, a whole lot) of trouble later by giving it instead its intended meaning: House of the Parents. black Details Story Dictionary 黒 black Heisig's Like most things electrical, a computer, too, can overheat. Just imagine flames pouring out of it and charring the keyboard, the monitor, and your desk a sooty black color. Koohii #1 If you burn the GROUND of a RICE FIELD with FIRE, eventually it will turn black. Koohii #2 If your parent´s home catches on fire, it will turn black. Primitives black, computer, oven-fire, barbecue 黒字(くろじ): balance (figure) in the black 黒(くろ): the color black (noun) 黒板(こくばん): blackboard 真っ黒(まっくろ): pitch black 黒い(くろい): black, dark Kunyomi: くろ、くろ.ずむ、くろ.い Onyomi: コク Lesson: 9 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds: 黒 (くろ), 黒い (くろ.い)	black 黒 画数11 186 Details Story Dictionary 黒 black Heisig's Like most things electrical, a computer, too, can overheat. black ink Details Story Dictionary 墨 black ink Heisig's Besides meaning black ink, this kanji also appears in the word for an inked string that is pulled taut and snapped to mark a surface, much the same as one might used a chalked string. Here it is used to mark off the dirt with black lines for a foot ballgame (played, I presume, on a white field). Koohii #1 Theres BLACK on the GROUND...most likely someone spilt some black ink. Koohii #2 Anyone who has worked with laserjet ink cartridges will know the black ink looks like powdered dirt. Primitives black ink, black, computer, oven-fire, barbecue 墨(すみ): ink Kunyomi: すみ Onyomi: ボク Lesson: 9 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 墨 (すみ)	black ink 墨 画数14 187 Details Story Dictionary 墨 black ink Heisig's Besides meaning black ink, this kanji also appears in the word for an inked string that is pulled taut and snapped to mark a surface, much the same as one might used a chalked string. Here it is used to mark off the dirt with black lines for a foot ballgame (played, I presume, on a white field). Koohii #1 Theres BLACK on the GROUND...most likely someone spilt some black ink. Koohii #2 Anyone who has worked with laserjet ink cartridges will know the black ink looks like powdered dirt. Primitives black ink, black, computer, oven-fire, barbecue 墨(すみ): ink Kunyomi: すみ Onyomi: ボク Lesson: 9 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 墨 (すみ)
"carp Details Story Dictionary 鯉 carp Heisig's These are the same carp you see in Japanese ""carp streamers."" Only here we find a small home computer or two strung on the line by a father anxious for his son not only to have the courage and determination of a carp swimming upstream, but also the efficiency and memory of a computer. Ugh. Koohii #1 Japanese carp are massive fish - they are measured in ri! Koohii #2 The fish got carpal tunnel syndrome from the computer(I know it´s lame but it´s hard to find a good story for this). Primitives carp, fish, bound up, rice field, brains, oven-fire, barbecue, computer Kunyomi: こい Onyomi: リ Lesson: 9 Jouyou: Names JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"	"carp 鯉 画数18 188 Details Story Dictionary 鯉 carp Heisig's These are the same carp you see in Japanese ""carp streamers."" Only here we find a small home computer or two strung on the line by a father anxious for his son not only to have the courage and determination of a carp swimming upstream, but also the efficiency and memory of a computer. Ugh. Koohii #1 Japanese carp are massive fish - they are measured in ri! Koohii #2 The fish got carpal tunnel syndrome from the computer(I know it´s lame but it´s hard to find a good story for this). Primitives carp, fish, bound up, rice field, brains, oven-fire, barbecue, computer Kunyomi: こい Onyomi: リ Lesson: 9 Jouyou: Names JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"
quantity Details Story Dictionary 量 quantity My Story A quantity can be a measure of time or space (day/ri). Koohii #1 I did such a quantity of work that when NIGHT BREAK came, I was asleep on the COMPUTER. Koohii #2 If you find that by nightbreak, you´re still playing at your computer, chances are your World of Warcraft character has a high quantity of levels. [thanks to ssmoler] ..... To remember that nightbreak appears ABOVE computer, think of looking UP from your computer at the window to realize you´ve been playing until nightbreak. Primitives quantity, nightbreak, sun, day, one, floor, computer 感無量(かんむりょう): deep feeling, inexpressible feeling, filled with emotion 熱量(ねつりょう): temperature 量る(はかる): to measure, to weigh, to survey, to time (sound gauge estimate) 微量(びりょう): minuscule amount, extremely small quantity 重量(じゅうりょう): weight, heavyweight boxer 測量(そくりょう): measurement, surveying 分量(ぶんりょう): amount, quantity 量(りょう): quantity, amount, volume, portion (of food) Kunyomi: はか.る Onyomi: リョウ Lesson: 9 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 量る (はか.る)	quantity 量 画数12 189 Details Story Dictionary 量 quantity My Story A quantity can be a measure of time or space (day/ri). Koohii #1 I did such a quantity of work that when NIGHT BREAK came, I was asleep on the COMPUTER. Koohii #2 If you find that by nightbreak, you´re still playing at your computer, chances are your World of Warcraft character has a high quantity of levels. [thanks to ssmoler] ..... To remember that nightbreak appears ABOVE computer, think of looking UP from your computer at the window to realize you´ve been playing until nightbreak. "rin Details Story Dictionary 厘 rin Heisig's No doubt you will find it in your heart to forgive me for forcing yet another Japanese word on you in this frame. It is not the last time it will happen in this book, but I can assure you they are used only when absolutely necessary. One rin is equal to about 1/1000 of a yen - or rather was worth that much when it still made economic sense to mint them. While inflation took its toll on this kanji as a monetary unit, it survived with the not at all surprising sense of something ""very, very tiny."" The kanji shows a cliff with a computer under it, apparently because it has been pushed over into the abyss by someone fed up with the thing. The total market value of one home computer that has fallen over rock and bramble for several hundred feet: about one rin! Koohii #1 I threw my Rindows computer off a cliff because it kept crashing. Now, after its last crash, it´s worth less than a rin. Koohii #2 A computer dropped off of a cliff would be worth about 1 RIN. Primitives rin, cliff, computer Kunyomi: Onyomi: リン Lesson: 9 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"	"rin 厘 画数9 190 Details Story Dictionary 厘 rin Heisig's No doubt you will find it in your heart to forgive me for forcing yet another Japanese word on you in this frame. It is not the last time it will happen in this book, but I can assure you they are used only when absolutely necessary. One rin is equal to about 1/1000 of a yen - or rather was worth that much when it still made economic sense to mint them. While inflation took its toll on this kanji as a monetary unit, it survived with the not at all surprising sense of something ""very, very tiny."" The kanji shows a cliff with a computer under it, apparently because it has been pushed over into the abyss by someone fed up with the thing. The total market value of one home computer that has fallen over rock and bramble for several hundred feet: about one rin! Koohii #1 I threw my Rindows computer off a cliff because it kept crashing. Now, after its last crash, it´s worth less than a rin. Koohii #2 A computer dropped off of a cliff would be worth about 1 RIN. Primitives rin, cliff, computer Kunyomi: Onyomi: リン Lesson: 9 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"
"bury Details Story Dictionary 埋 bury Heisig's When we speak of burying something (or someone, for that matter), we usually mean putting them under ground. Only here, we are burying our beloved computer that has served us so well these past years. Behind us a choir chants the ""Dies irae, dies illa"" and there is much wailing and grief among the bystanders as they pass by to shovel a little dirt into what will be its final resting place. R.I.P. Koohii #1 You can´t bury computers underground, because of the dangerous heavy metals, so you hide them behind an equally large mound of soil and hope no-one notices. Koohii #2 I used SOIL to BURY my COMPUTER. Primitives bury, soil, dirt, ground, computer 埋まる(うずまる): to be buried, to be surrounded, to overflow, to be filled 埋め込む(うめこむ): to bury 埋蔵(まいぞう): buried property, treasure trove 埋める(うめる): bury (e.g. one´s face in hands) Kunyomi: う.める、う.まる、う.もれる、うず.める、うず.まる、い.ける Onyomi: マイ Lesson: 9 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 埋まる (う.まる), 埋める (う.める), 埋もれる (う.もれる)"	"bury 埋 画数10 191 Details Story Dictionary 埋 bury Heisig's When we speak of burying something (or someone, for that matter), we usually mean putting them under ground. "same Details Story Dictionary 同 same Heisig's The primitives in this kanji show us one and mouth under a hood. Let us take the key word to connote the sameness that characterizes the life in community of the monk. They all have the same habits, including the ""habit"" they wear on their backs. Here we see the monk's cowl, drawn down over the eyes so that all you can see when you look at him is a mouth. But since monks also speak their prayers in common, it is but a short step to think of one mouth under a hood as the kanji for the sameness of monastic life. * As a primitive, this will mean monks dressed in a common habit. Koohii #1 Muslim women wearing veils (HOOD) all look the same, you can just see ONE MOUTH and very little else. Koohii #2 Imagine monks wandering around the monastery. Covered in their hoods and chanting as if with one mouth they all look the same ! Primitives same, monks, hood, one, mouth 一同(いちどう): all present, all concerned, all of us 同い年(おないどし): of the same age 混同(こんどう): confusion, mixing, merger 同(どう): the same, the said, ibid. 同意(どうい): agreement, consent, same meaning, same opinion, approval 同感(どうかん): agreement, same opinion, same feeling, sympathy, concurrence 同級(どうきゅう): the same grade, same class 同居(どうきょ): living together 同志(どうし): same mind, comrade, kindred soul 同士(どうし): fellow, companion, comrade 同情(どうじょう): sympathy, compassion, sympathize, pity, feel for 同調(どうちょう): sympathy, agree with, alignment, tuning 同等(どうとう): equality, equal, same rights, same rank 同封(どうふう): enclosure (e.g. in a letter) 同盟(どうめい): alliance, union, league 共同(きょうどう): cooperation, association, collaboration, joint 合同(ごうどう): combination, incorporation, union, amalgamation, fusion, congruence 同一(どういつ): identity, sameness, similarity, equality, fairness 同格(どうかく): the same rank, equality, apposition 同時(どうじ): simultaneous(ly), concurrent, same time, synchronous 同様(どうよう): identical, equal to, same (kind), like 同僚(どうりょう): coworker, colleague, associate 同じ(おなじ): same, identical, equal, uniform, equivalent, similar, common (origin), changeless Kunyomi: おな.じ Onyomi: ドウ Lesson: 9 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds: 同じ (おな.じ)"	"same 同 画数6 192 Details Story Dictionary 同 same Heisig's The primitives in this kanji show us one and mouth under a hood. "den Details Story Dictionary 洞 den Heisig's The key word den refers to an animal lair hollowed out in the side of a mountain. Now if we keep to the image of the monastic life as an image for same, we can picture a den of wild beasts dressed up in habits and living the common life in a mountain cavern. To bring in the element of water we need only give them a sacred ""puddle"" in the center of their den, the focus of all their pious attentions. Koohii #1 All the animals in the den share the same water. Koohii #2 Den and ""cave"" also make me think of a monk´s cell. Monks take vows of silence and fast. So a den is where you´d find nothing but water (to drink) and a monk. Primitives den, water, water droplets, water pistol, same, monks, hood, one, mouth Kunyomi: ほら Onyomi: ドウ Lesson: 9 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 洞 (ほら)"	"den 洞 画数9 193 Details Story Dictionary 洞 den Heisig's The key word den refers to an animal lair hollowed out in the side of a mountain. Now if we keep to the image of the monastic life as an image for same, we can picture a den of wild beasts dressed up in habits and living the common life in a mountain cavern. To bring in the element of water we need only give them a sacred ""puddle"" in the center of their den, the focus of all their pious attentions. Koohii #1 All the animals in the den share the same water. Koohii #2 Den and ""cave"" also make me think of a monk´s cell. Monks take vows of silence and fast. So a den is where you´d find nothing but water (to drink) and a monk. Primitives den, water, water droplets, water pistol, same, monks, hood, one, mouth Kunyomi: ほら Onyomi: ドウ Lesson: 9 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 洞 (ほら)"
"trunk Details Story Dictionary 胴 trunk Heisig's The word trunk refers to the part of the body that is left when you have ""truncated"" all the limbs. I can hardly think of any reason for doing so, unless one were lumberjacking corpses and needed to have them all properly pruned and made the same so they could be floated downstream without causing a body-jam. Koohii #1 A trunk, a trunk // The body of a monk // The body of a monk in a trunk, a trunk. Koohii #2 Dead flesh all looks the same when you chop off everything but the trunk. Yes, I´m appalled at how gruesome this story is too. Primitives trunk, moon, month, flesh, part of the body, same, monks, hood, one, mouth 胴(どう): trunk, body, frame Kunyomi: Onyomi: ドウ Lesson: 9 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"	"trunk 胴 画数10 194 Details Story Dictionary 胴 trunk Heisig's The word trunk refers to the part of the body that is left when you have ""truncated"" all the limbs. yonder Details Story Dictionary 向 yonder My Story Bruh, there is a pimple (dot) yonder your *goatee* Koohii #1 Look over yonder ! That tiny dot is robin hood at the mouth of his secret cave ! Koohii #2 There was an old woman named Wanda,// Who wanted to make herself blonder.// She covered her くち// With a glass hood from Gucci// And dropped some hair dye on from yonder. esteem Details Story Dictionary 尚 esteem Heisig's Above we see the primitive for little attached to one of those glass canopies you might use to display a family heirloom. The littleness is important, because what is in fact on display is the shrunken, stuffed, and mounted mouth of an esteemed ancestor. We may be used to esteeming the words our forebears leave behind, but here we also esteem the very mouth that spoke them. I leave it to you to imagine a suitable place in your room for displaying such an unusual conversation piece. Koohii #1 An especially esteemed alien has three antennae on his helmet. Koohii #2 Remember that scene from Star Wars, where Luke is wearing that helmet that only his mouth could see, and was swinging at that little thing buzzing around the room? That was Obi-Wan´s trick to get Luke to build his self-esteem, or his confidence in the Force. Primitives esteem, small, little, alien, glass canopy, hood, mouth 高尚(こうしょう): high, noble, refined, advanced 尚(なお): furthermore, still, yet, more, still more, greater, further, less 尚更(なおさら): all the more, still less Kunyomi: なお Onyomi: ショウ Lesson: 9 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	esteem 尚 画数8 196 Details Story Dictionary 尚 esteem Heisig's Above we see the primitive for little attached to one of those glass canopies you might use to display a family heirloom. "character Details Story Dictionary 字 character Heisig's Here is the character for character itself. Not just kanji, but any written character from hieroglyphs to Sanskrit to our own Roman alphabet. It shows us simply a child in a house. But let us take advantage of the double-meaning of the key word to note that just as a child born to a Japanese house is given characters for its name, so it is also stamped with the character of those who raise it from infancy on. Koohii #1 CHILDren learn Kanji characters underneath a HOUSE. Koohii #2 Why do I have to wear this roof on my head all the time father? ""Shut up! It builds character!"". Primitives character, house, child 赤字(あかじ): deficit, go in the red 字(あざ): section of village 当て字(あてじ): phonetic-equivalent character, substitute character 英字(えいじ): English letter (character) 黒字(くろじ): balance (figure) in the black 字体(じたい): type, font, lettering 十字路(じゅうじろ): crossroads 文字(もじ): letter (of alphabet), character ローマ字(ローマじ): romanization, Roman letters 活字(かつじ): printing type 習字(しゅうじ): penmanship 数字(すうじ): numeral, figure 名字(みょうじ): surname, family name ローマ字(ローマじ): Romaji 字(じ): character 漢字(かんじ): Chinese characters, kanji 字引(じびき): dictionary Kunyomi: あざ、あざな、-な Onyomi: ジ Lesson: 9 Jouyou: 1 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds: 字 (あざ)"	"character 字 画数6 197 Details Story Dictionary 字 character Heisig's Here is the character for character itself. Koohii #2 A guard provides a measure of security to those under a roof. "perfect Details Story Dictionary 完 perfect Heisig's In order not to confuse the key word perfect with others nearly synonymous in meaning, pull it apart to have a look at its native Latin roots. Per-factum suggests something so ""thoroughly made or done"" that nothing more needs to be added to it. Now look at the kanji, which does something similar. We see a house that has been made perfectly from its beginnings in the foundation to the roof on the top. Now return to frame 101 and make sure not to confuse this key word with the kanji for complete. Koohii #1 Make the perfect impression in the beginning by removing your shoes upon entering a Japanese home. Koohii #2 In the beginning, Adam and Eve had a home in Eden. It was perfect. Primitives perfect, house, beginning, two, human legs 完璧(かんぺき): perfection, completeness, flawless 完成(かんせい): complete, completion, perfection, accomplishment 完全(かんぜん): perfection, completeness 完了(かんりょう): completion, conclusion Kunyomi: Onyomi: カン Lesson: 9 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds:"	"perfect 完 画数7 199 Details Story Dictionary 完 perfect Heisig's In order not to confuse the key word perfect with others nearly synonymous in meaning, pull it apart to have a look at its native Latin roots. Per-factum suggests something so ""thoroughly made or done"" that nothing more needs to be added to it. Now look at the kanji, which does something similar. We see a house that has been made perfectly from its beginnings in the foundation to the roof on the top. Now return to frame 101 and make sure not to confuse this key word with the kanji for complete. Koohii #1 Make the perfect impression in the beginning by removing your shoes upon entering a Japanese home. Koohii #2 In the beginning, Adam and Eve had a home in Eden. It was perfect. Primitives perfect, house, beginning, two, human legs 完璧(かんぺき): perfection, completeness, flawless 完成(かんせい): complete, completion, perfection, accomplishment 完全(かんぜん): perfection, completeness 完了(かんりょう): completion, conclusion Kunyomi: Onyomi: カン Lesson: 9 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds:"
proclaim Details Story Dictionary 宣 proclaim My Story [Crown + span {亘}] After I got my *crown* I was proclaimed king, I hope for a long *span* Koohii #1 You can proclaim your opinions from the comfort of your HOUSE and have it SPAN the entire globe these days via The Internet. Koohii #2 I heard young Muslims have to memorise the Koran and proclaim it aloud as a kind of rite of passage. Imagine the SPAN of hours spent under a ROOF practising that! It must surely be worse than trying to get through Heisigs RTK - count yourself lucky. Primitives proclaim, house, span, one, ceiling, sun, day, one, floor, one 宣教(せんきょう): religious mission 宣言(せんげん): declaration, proclamation, announcement 宣伝(せんでん): propaganda, publicity Kunyomi: のたま.う、のたま.わく Onyomi: セン Lesson: 9 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	proclaim 宣 画数9 200 Details Story Dictionary 宣 proclaim My Story [Crown + span {亘}] After I got my *crown* I was proclaimed king, I hope for a long *span* Koohii #1 You can proclaim your opinions from the comfort of your HOUSE and have it SPAN the entire globe these days via The Internet. Koohii #2 I heard young Muslims have to memorise the Koran and proclaim it aloud as a kind of rite of passage. Imagine the SPAN of hours spent under a ROOF practising that! It must surely be worse than trying to get through Heisigs RTK - count yourself lucky. Primitives proclaim, house, span, one, ceiling, sun, day, one, floor, one 宣教(せんきょう): religious mission 宣言(せんげん): declaration, proclamation, announcement 宣伝(せんでん): propaganda, publicity Kunyomi: のたま.う、のたま.わく Onyomi: セン Lesson: 9 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:
"wee hours Details Story Dictionary 宵 wee hours Heisig's As the key word hints, the kanji in this frame refers to the late evening or early morning hours, well after one should be in bed asleep. It does this by picturing a house with a candle in it. The reason is obvious: whoever is living there is ""burning the candle at both ends,"" and working night after night into the wee hours. Koohii #1 I burn the CANDLE in my HOUSE until the WEE HOURS reviewing the kanji!!! Koohii #2 I agree with elktapestry. This kanji really means ""early evening"", not ""wee hours"" [Heisig really should have done his homework on this and several other characters (e.g., #145 ""but of course"" -- what the hell???). Oh well.] ""Every house lights candles in the EARLY EVENING which stay lit until the wee hours"". E.G. 宵の口（よいのくち）early evening; 今宵（こよい）this evening; tonight. Primitives wee hours, house, resemblance, spark, candle, small, little, moon, month, flesh, part of the body Kunyomi: よい Onyomi: ショウ Lesson: 9 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 宵 (よい)"	"wee hours 宵 画数10 201 Details Story Dictionary 宵 wee hours Heisig's As the key word hints, the kanji in this frame refers to the late evening or early morning hours, well after one should be in bed asleep. It does this by picturing a house with a candle in it. The reason is obvious: whoever is living there is ""burning the candle at both ends,"" and working night after night into the wee hours. Primitives wee hours, house, resemblance, spark, candle, small, little, moon, month, flesh, part of the body Kunyomi: よい Onyomi: ショウ Lesson: 9 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 宵 (よい)"
relax Details Story Dictionary 安 relax Heisig's To be told that the place of the woman is in the house may not sit well with modern thought, but like all cultural habits the Chinese characters bear the birthmarks of their age. So indulge yourself in a Norman Rockwell image of relaxing after a hard day's work: the scruffy and weary woman of the house slouched asleep in the living room chair, her hair in curlers and a duster lying in her lap. Koohii #1 It´s funny, Hesig gives no Kanji in his book that means cheap/inexpensive... well... if you were wondering what Kanji would carry that meaning, look no further. Sometimes I wonder if Hesig just thinks our little brains would be too easily confused by multiple meanings. Regardless, think of that woman relaxing. Cheapest place to do that is in one´s own home rather than at some fancy resort, eh? 家で休暇を取るは安いですね。. Koohii #2 You can only relax, when you have woman under roof to do all chores. Primitives relax, house, woman 安静(あんせい): rest 治安(ちあん): public order 安っぽい(やすっぽい): cheap-looking, tawdry, insignificant 安易(あんい): easygoing 安定(あんてい): stability, equilibrium 不安(ふあん): anxiety, uneasiness, insecurity, suspense 目安(めやす): criterion, aim 安心(あんしん): peace of mind, relief 安全(あんぜん): safety 安い(やすい): cheap, inexpensive, peaceful, quiet, gossipy, thoughtless Kunyomi: やす.い、やす.まる、やす、やす.らか Onyomi: アン Lesson: 9 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds: 安い (やす.い)	relax 安 画数6 202 Details Story Dictionary 安 relax Heisig's To be told that the place of the woman is in the house may not sit well with modern thought, but like all cultural habits the Chinese characters bear the birthmarks of their age. "banquet Details Story Dictionary 宴 banquet Heisig's To carry on from the last frame, we note the entire day of work that comes between a woman and her house in preparing for a dinner banquet, pictorially ""interrupting"" her relaxation. Koohii #1 The WOMAN spent all DAY preparing a banquet in the HOUSE. Koohii #2 Under the roof, all day long, the woman prepared for the banquet (this wording helps me remember the order of this kanji´s elements). Primitives banquet, relax, house, sun, day, tongue wagging, woman 宴会(えんかい): party, banquet Kunyomi: うたげ Onyomi: エン Lesson: 9 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"	"banquet 宴 画数10 203 Details Story Dictionary 宴 banquet Heisig's To carry on from the last frame, we note the entire day of work that comes between a woman and her house in preparing for a dinner banquet, pictorially ""interrupting"" her relaxation. "draw near Details Story Dictionary 寄 draw near Heisig's Let the idea of drawing near suggest something dangerous or eerie that one approaches with fear and trembling. Here we see a strange house - perhaps the haunted House of Usher that Edgar Allen Poe immortalized, or the enchanted Gingerbread House that lured Hansel and Gretel to draw near. Koohii #1 The strange house has a sign saying ""DRAW NEAR"" in its window, instead of a ´Beware´ sign. It must be a trick! Koohii #2 Imagine a horror movie set in a haunted mansion. The house is very strange. The characters draw near to one another for protection against the unknown. Primitives draw near, house, strange, large, St. Bernard, can, street, nail, spike, mouth 押し寄せる(おしよせる): to push aside, to advance on 寄贈(きそう): donation, presentation 寄与(きよ): contribution, service 立ち寄る(たちよる): to stop by, to drop in for a short visit 年寄り(としより): old people, the aged 取り寄せる(とりよせる): to order, to send away for 寄こす(よこす): to send, to forward 寄り掛かる(よりかかる): to lean against, to recline on, to lean on, to rely on 片寄る(かたよる): be one-sided, partial, prejudiced, biased, lean, be inclined 寄付(きふ): contribution, donation 近寄る(ちかよる): approach, draw near 寄せる(よせる): collect, gather, add, put aside 寄る(よる): drop in, stop by Kunyomi: よ.る、-よ.り、よ.せる Onyomi: キ Lesson: 9 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 寄せる (よ.せる), 寄る (よ.る)"	"draw near 寄 画数11 204 Details Story Dictionary 寄 draw near Heisig's Let the idea of drawing near suggest something dangerous or eerie that one approaches with fear and trembling. wealth Details Story Dictionary 富 wealth Heisig's Here we have the original character on which the primitive element for wealth is based. In keeping with the story introduced back then, note how all the wealth is kept under the roof of the same house. Koohii #1 Remember Ducktales? That rich duck had that room in his house where he kept all the wealth! He had so much in that house you could even swim in it! Koohii #2 In ancient Japan, a RICE FIELD is a unit of wealth as it can produce enough to feed all the MOUTHs in ONE HOUSE. Primitives wealth, house, wealth, one, ceiling, mouth, rice field, brains 富(とみ): wealth, fortune 富む(とむ): to be rich, to become rich 富豪(ふごう): wealthy person, millionaire 豊富(ほうふ): abundance, wealth, plenty, bounty Kunyomi: と.む、とみ Onyomi: フ、フウ Lesson: 9 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 富強 (ふきょう), 富裕 (ふゆう), 貧富 (ひんぷ), 富む (と.む), 富 (とみ)	wealth 富 画数12 205 Details Story Dictionary 富 wealth Heisig's Here we have the original character on which the primitive element for wealth is based. savings Details Story Dictionary 貯 savings Heisig's To avoid confusing this frame with the last one, try to think of savings as actual money. The only difference is that our currency is not paper bills but shells, a not uncommon unit of exchange in older civilizations. The nail under the roof of the house points to a hiding place in the rafters on which one strings up one's shells for safekeeping. Koohii #1 It takes a lot more than one clam of savings to buy a house on a street. Koohii #2 My SAVINGS plan - I nail my moneybags up in the rafters below my roof. I´m very secretive about it, and I wear a disguise with a big mustache (another meaning of this kanji) while I stash my loot. Primitives savings, shellfish, clam, oyster, eye, animal legs, eight, house, street, nail, spike 貯蓄(ちょちく): savings 貯金(ちょきん): (bank) savings 貯蔵(ちょぞう): storage, preservation Kunyomi: た.める、たくわ.える Onyomi: チョ Lesson: 9 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds:	savings 貯 画数12 206 Details Story Dictionary 貯 savings Heisig's To avoid confusing this frame with the last one, try to think of savings as actual money. tree Details Story Dictionary 木 tree Heisig's Here we see a pictograph of a tree, showing the main trunk in the long vertical stroke and the boughs in the long horizontal stroke. The final two strokes sweep down in both directions to indicate the roots. Although it may look similar at first sight to the kanji for water (Frame 137), the order in which it is written is completely different and this affects its final appearance. * As a primitive, this kanji can be used to mean tree or wood. In those cases where the last two strokes are detached from the trunk, we shall change its meaning to pole, or wooden pole. Koohii #1 If you need a story for a tree, then you need to be hit by one. Koohii #2 Pictograph of a tree. Primitives tree, wood 木綿(きわた): cotton 雑木(ざつぼく): various kinds of small trees, assorted trees 樹木(じゅもく): trees and shrubs, arbour 土木(どぼく): public works 木曜(もくよう): Thursday 植木(うえき): garden shrubs, trees, potted plant 材木(ざいもく): lumber, timber 大木(たいぼく): large tree 並木(なみき): roadside tree, row of trees 木材(もくざい): lumber, timber, wood 木綿(もめん): cotton 木(き): tree, wood, timber 木曜日(もくようび): Thursday Kunyomi: き、こ- Onyomi: ボク、モク Lesson: 10 Jouyou: 1 JLPT Level: 5 Compounds: 木石 (ぼくせき), 大木 (たいぼく), 土木 (どぼく), 木 (き)	tree 木 画数4 207 Details Story Dictionary 木 tree Heisig's Here we see a pictograph of a tree, showing the main trunk in the long vertical stroke and the boughs in the long horizontal stroke. grove Details Story Dictionary 林 grove Heisig's Learn this frame in connection with the next one. A grove is a small cluster of trees. Hence the simple reduplication of the kanji for tree gives us the grove. Koohii #1 A grove has at least two TREEs. Koohii #2 Two tree huggers saying that protecting the environment is grovey man...　RTK2:　リン　森林　しんりん(woods and forests). Primitives grove, tree, wood, tree2, wood2 林業(りんぎょう): forestry 山林(さんりん): mountain forest, mountains and forest 森林(しんりん): forest, woods 林(はやし): woods, forest Kunyomi: はやし Onyomi: リン Lesson: 10 Jouyou: 1 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 林 (はやし)	grove 林 画数8 208 Details Story Dictionary 林 grove Heisig's Learn this frame in connection with the next one. "forest Details Story Dictionary 森 forest Heisig's A forest is a large expanse of trees, or ""trees, trees everywhere,"" to adopt the expression we used back in frames 22 and 23. Koohii #1 The higher you go up a mountain the less trees there are, that´s so u dont mess up with their possition like i do. Koohii #2 Another tree planted within a grove turns it into a FOREST. Primitives forest, tree, wood, tree3, wood3 森林(しんりん): forest, woods 森(もり): forest Kunyomi: もり Onyomi: シン Lesson: 10 Jouyou: 1 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 森 (もり)"	"forest 森 画数12 209 Details Story Dictionary 森 forest Heisig's A forest is a large expanse of trees, or ""trees, trees everywhere,"" to adopt the expression we used back in frames 22 and 23. "Japanese Judas-tree Details Story Dictionary 桂 Japanese Judas-tree Heisig's Unless you are a botanist, you are not likely to know what a Japanese Judas-tree looks like, and probably never even heard of it before, but the name is sufficiently odd to make remembering it easy. Using the primitives as our guide, we define it as a tree with ivy growing down its branches in the shape of a hangman's rope. Koohii #1 Simple mnemonic : ""The Japanese Judas-tree is the tree on which Judas hang himself to the ivy"" (Judas the traitor of the Christian bible). Just picture Judas hanging himself, using ivy as a if it was a rope. Koohii #2 A tree covered in poison ivy will quickly betray you, thus the name JAPANESE JUDAS-TREE. Primitives Japanese Judas tree, tree, wood, ivy, square jewel, soil, dirt, ground, soil2, dirt2, ground2 Kunyomi: かつら Onyomi: ケイ Lesson: 10 Jouyou: Names JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"	"Japanese Judas-tree 桂 画数10 210 Details Story Dictionary 桂 Japanese Judas-tree Heisig's Unless you are a botanist, you are not likely to know what a Japanese Judas-tree looks like, and probably never even heard of it before, but the name is sufficiently odd to make remembering it easy. Using the primitives as our guide, we define it as a tree with ivy growing down its branches in the shape of a hangman's rope. Koohii #1 Simple mnemonic : ""The Japanese Judas-tree is the tree on which Judas hang himself to the ivy"" (Judas the traitor of the Christian bible). Just picture Judas hanging himself, using ivy as a if it was a rope. Koohii #2 A tree covered in poison ivy will quickly betray you, thus the name JAPANESE JUDAS-TREE. Primitives Japanese Judas tree, tree, wood, ivy, square jewel, soil, dirt, ground, soil2, dirt2, ground2 Kunyomi: かつら Onyomi: ケイ Lesson: 10 Jouyou: Names JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"
"oak Details Story Dictionary 柏 oak Heisig's This kanji calls to mind the famous myth of the ""golden bough."" As you may recall, what made the sacred oak in the forest of Diana the Huntress outside of Rome ""golden"" were the white berries of the mistletoe that grew in the branches of the tree. When the light of the sun shone through them, they turned yellow and the branch to which they clung appeared to be made of gold. (If you don't know the story, take a break today and hunt it down in a dictionary of myth and fable. Even if you forget the kanji - which of course you won't - the story of the mistletoe and the fate it brought to Balder the Beautiful is most memorable.) Koohii #1 The wood from oak trees can be used to make barrels in which white wine is aged. What´s more, I love white wine with an oaky flavour... Koohii #2 An oak tree is white, from left to right! Primitives oak, tree, wood, white, dove Kunyomi: かしわ Onyomi: ハク、ヒャク、ビャク Lesson: 10 Jouyou: Names JLPT Level: Compounds:"	"oak 柏 画数9 211 Details Story Dictionary 柏 oak Heisig's This kanji calls to mind the famous myth of the ""golden bough."" As you may recall, what made the sacred oak in the forest of Diana the Huntress outside of Rome ""golden"" were the white berries of the mistletoe that grew in the branches of the tree. When the light of the sun shone through them, they turned yellow and the branch to which they clung appeared to be made of gold. (If you don't know the story, take a break today and hunt it down in a dictionary of myth and fable. Even if you forget the kanji - which of course you won't - the story of the mistletoe and the fate it brought to Balder the Beautiful is most memorable.) Koohii #1 The wood from oak trees can be used to make barrels in which white wine is aged. What´s more, I love white wine with an oaky flavour... Koohii #2 An oak tree is white, from left to right! Primitives oak, tree, wood, white, dove Kunyomi: かしわ Onyomi: ハク、ヒャク、ビャク Lesson: 10 Jouyou: Names JLPT Level: Compounds:"
frame Details Story Dictionary 枠 frame Heisig's You might think of the frame this character refers to as the sort of frame we have created by drawing a dark line around this kanji and its explanation. Then think of that line as made of very thin wood; and finally note how each time the line bends it forms a 90° angle, thus giving us the nine and the ten. Koohii #1 wood at 90 (9 * 10) degrees. Koohii #2 Nine out of ten picture frames are made out of wood. The rest are made of metal or plastic. Primitives frame, tree, wood, ninety, nine, baseball, ten, needle 枠(わく): frame, slide Kunyomi: わく Onyomi: Lesson: 10 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 枠 (わく)	frame 枠 画数8 212 Details Story Dictionary 枠 frame Heisig's You might think of the frame this character refers to as the sort of frame we have created by drawing a dark line around this kanji and its explanation. Then think of that line as made of very thin wood; and finally note how each time the line bends it forms a 90° angle, thus giving us the nine and the ten. Koohii #1 wood at 90 (9 * 10) degrees. Koohii #2 Nine out of ten picture frames are made out of wood. The rest are made of metal or plastic. Primitives frame, tree, wood, ninety, nine, baseball, ten, needle 枠(わく): frame, slide Kunyomi: わく Onyomi: Lesson: 10 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 枠 (わく)
treetops Details Story Dictionary 梢 treetops Heisig's As the days grow shorter and shorter, or so the northern European myth goes, the fear grows that the sun will take its leave of us altogether, abandoning the world to total darkness. Fixing candles to the branches of evergreen trees, it was believed, would lure the sun back (like things attracting like things), whence the custom of the lighted tree that eventually found its way into our Christmas customs. The story is a lot longer and more complex than that, but it should help to fix the image of climbing high up into the treetops to fix candles on the tree. Koohii #1 At Christmas time, on the treetops, people used to place great big candles (Now we usually place a star instead). Koohii #2 If you cut off the treetops, they still resemble the trees they used to be part of. Treetops=tree resemblance. Primitives treetops, tree, wood, resemblance, spark, candle, small, little, moon, month, flesh, part of the body 梢(こずえ): treetop Kunyomi: こずえ、くすのき Onyomi: ショウ Lesson: 10 Jouyou: Names JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	treetops 梢 画数11 213 Details Story Dictionary 梢 treetops Heisig's As the days grow shorter and shorter, or so the northern European myth goes, the fear grows that the sun will take its leave of us altogether, abandoning the world to total darkness. Fixing candles to the branches of evergreen trees, it was believed, would lure the sun back (like things attracting like things), whence the custom of the lighted tree that eventually found its way into our Christmas customs. The story is a lot longer and more complex than that, but it should help to fix the image of climbing high up into the treetops to fix candles on the tree. Koohii #1 At Christmas time, on the treetops, people used to place great big candles (Now we usually place a star instead). Koohii #2 If you cut off the treetops, they still resemble the trees they used to be part of. Treetops=tree resemblance. Primitives treetops, tree, wood, resemblance, spark, candle, small, little, moon, month, flesh, part of the body 梢(こずえ): treetop Kunyomi: こずえ、くすのき Onyomi: ショウ Lesson: 10 Jouyou: Names JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:
shelf Details Story Dictionary 棚 shelf My Story A shelf is a *wooden* {木} *companion*{朋} to books. Koohii #1 A shelf is a wooden companion to books. Koohii #2 I think of an Otaku, with a wooden shelf full of anime action figure statures, who are sadly his only companions. Primitives shelf, tree, wood, companion, moon, month, flesh, part of the body, moon2, month2, flesh, 2, part of the body2 戸棚(とだな): cupboard, locker, closet, wardrobe 棚(たな): shelf 本棚(ほんだな): bookshelves Kunyomi: たな、-だな Onyomi: ホウ Lesson: 10 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 棚 (たな)	shelf 棚 画数12 214 Details Story Dictionary 棚 shelf My Story A shelf is a *wooden* {木} *companion*{朋} to books. Primitives shelf, tree, wood, companion, moon, month, flesh, part of the body, moon2, month2, flesh, 2, part of the body2 戸棚(とだな): cupboard, locker, closet, wardrobe 棚(たな): shelf 本棚(ほんだな): bookshelves Kunyomi: たな、-だな Onyomi: ホウ Lesson: 10 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 棚 (たな)
apricot Details Story Dictionary 杏 apricot Heisig's Since apricots can be eaten just as they fall from the trees, picture this mouth agape at the bottom of a tree (just as the elements have it), waiting for apricots to fall into it. Koohii #1 From the tree straight into the mouth is the best way to eat an APRICOT! Koohii #2 Imagine Totoro sleeping under his tree. As he snores a giant apricot falls nicely into his open mouth and he emits a giant burp of satisfaction. I can hear that music alreay....to - to to - to - ro... Primitives apricot, tree, wood, mouth Kunyomi: あんず Onyomi: キョウ、アン、コウ Lesson: 10 Jouyou: Names JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	apricot 杏 画数7 215 Details Story Dictionary 杏 apricot Heisig's Since apricots can be eaten just as they fall from the trees, picture this mouth agape at the bottom of a tree (just as the elements have it), waiting for apricots to fall into it. "paulownia Details Story Dictionary 桐 paulownia Heisig's Since you probably don't know what a paulownia tree is, we shall let the key word suggest the phrase ""the Little Brothers of St. Paulownia."" It is a short step to associate the tree with the monks to its right. (For the curious, the name of this oriental tree really comes from a Russian princess, Anna Pavlovna.) Koohii #1 In Japan, a paulownia (きり）is known as the ""princess tree"". It was once a traditional TREE planted at the SAME time as the birth of a daughter. It would grow fast enough that, at the time of her wedding, it could be used to make a dresser as a wedding present for her. Koohii #2 Paulownia is a Japanese tree which looks same as any other tree. Primitives paulownia, tree, wood, same, monks, hood, one, mouth 桐(きり): paulownia tree Kunyomi: きり Onyomi: トウ、ドウ Lesson: 10 Jouyou: Names JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"	"paulownia 桐 画数10 216 Details Story Dictionary 桐 paulownia Heisig's Since you probably don't know what a paulownia tree is, we shall let the key word suggest the phrase ""the Little Brothers of St. Paulownia."" It is a short step to associate the tree with the monks to its right. (For the curious, the name of this oriental tree really comes from a Russian princess, Anna Pavlovna.) It would grow fast enough that, at the time of her wedding, it could be used to make a dresser as a wedding present for her. Koohii #2 Paulownia is a Japanese tree which looks same as any other tree. plant Details Story Dictionary 植 plant Heisig's You have no doubt seen how people practicing the Japanese art of bonsai take those helpless little saplings and twist them into crippled dwarves before they have a chance to grow up as they should. The more proper way to plant a young tree and give it a fair shake in life is to set it into the earth in such a way that it can grow up straight. Koohii #1 Plants don´t become trees straightaway. Koohii #2 When you plant plants, you use a piece of WOOD to make the plant grow STRAIGHT. Primitives plant, tree, wood, straightaway, ten, needle, eye, fishhook 植わる(うわる): to be planted 植民地(しょくみんち): colony 植木(うえき): garden shrubs, trees, potted plant 植物(しょくぶつ): plant, vegetation 田植え(たうえ): rice planting 植える(うえる): plant Kunyomi: う.える、う.わる Onyomi: ショク Lesson: 10 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 植える (う.える), 植わる (う.わる)	plant 植 画数12 217 Details Story Dictionary 植 plant Heisig's You have no doubt seen how people practicing the Japanese art of bonsai take those helpless little saplings and twist them into crippled dwarves before they have a chance to grow up as they should. chair Details Story Dictionary 椅 chair My Story A *tree*, a really *big* one was made into a chair; it was *possible* in the end. *Possible*: Nail with a mouth under it Koohii #1 To the Japanese, the first time they saw a chair, it looked like a strange use of wood! Probably why they still like to sit on the floor... Koohii #2 A strange kind of tree grows in the shape of a chair. Primitives chair, tree, wood, strange, large, St. Bernard, street, nail, spike, mouth 椅子(いす): chair Kunyomi: Onyomi: イ Lesson: 10 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: Compounds:	chair 椅 画数12 218 Details Story Dictionary 椅 chair My Story A *tree*, a really *big* one was made into a chair; it was *possible* in the end. *Possible*: Nail with a mouth under it Koohii #1 To the Japanese, the first time they saw a chair, it looked like a strange use of wood! wither Details Story Dictionary 枯 wither Heisig's What makes a tree begin to wither up, and perhaps even die, is a kind of arteriosclerosis that keeps its sap from flowing freely. Usually this is due to simple old age, as this character shows us. Be sure to picture a wrinkled old tree, withering away in a retirement center so that the commonsense explanation does not take over. Koohii #1 A tree withers away as it gets old. Koohii #2 When flowers get old they suffer (frame 225), but old trees just WITHER away painlessly. (Picture flowers crying in pain, but a dried up tree silent and sad). Primitives wither, tree, wood, old, tombstone, gravestone, church, ten, needle, mouth 枯れる(かれる): wither, die (plant) Kunyomi: か.れる、か.らす Onyomi: コ Lesson: 10 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 枯らす (か.らす), 枯れる (か.れる)	wither 枯 画数9 219 Details Story Dictionary 枯 wither Heisig's What makes a tree begin to wither up, and perhaps even die, is a kind of arteriosclerosis that keeps its sap from flowing freely. crude Details Story Dictionary 朴 crude Heisig's As all magicians who have passed their apprenticeship know, one makes one's wand out of a hazel branch and is careful not to alter the natural form of the wood. For the magic of the wand derives its power from its association with the hidden laws of nature, and needs therefore to be kept in its crude, natural state. Koohii #1 Wooden wands are the crudest. They are nothng compared to their carbon fibre equivilents. Koohii #2 A beginner magician starts with a crude wooden magic wand. Later he´ll upgrade to magicite, of course. Primitives crude, tree, wood, magic wand, augury 素朴(そぼく): simplicity, artlessness, naivete Kunyomi: ほう、ほお、えのき Onyomi: ボク Lesson: 10 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	crude 朴 画数6 220 Details Story Dictionary 朴 crude Heisig's As all magicians who have passed their apprenticeship know, one makes one's wand out of a hazel branch and is careful not to alter the natural form of the wood. town Details Story Dictionary 村 town Heisig's The character for village was associated with rice fields (Frame 96). That for town, a step up on the evolutionary path to cities, shows a circle of trees glued together to measure off the confines of a town. Koohii #1 If you´ve ever played an old 8 bit or 16 bit RPG, like Dragon Warrior or Final Fantasy or Inindou, you´ll remember that every town was all bordered off by a line of trees with no space in between to get out through. Imagine that the trees were glued together so you could only exit town through the main or side gates, (so you couldn´t escape the important scripted scenes.). Koohii #2 Pfft. At it´s core, a town is just a bunch of wood glued together. Edit - Stop starring this piece of crap story! xD. Primitives town, tree, wood, measure, glue 漁村(ぎょそん): fishing village 農村(のうそん): agricultural community, farm village, rural 村(むら): village Kunyomi: むら Onyomi: ソン Lesson: 10 Jouyou: 1 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 村 (むら)	town 村 画数7 221 Details Story Dictionary 村 town Heisig's The character for village was associated with rice fields (Frame 96). "inter- / partner Details Story Dictionary 相 inter- / partner My Story During intercourse, I accidentally put my *wood* in my #partner#'s *eye* be careful of: {祖} ancestor Koohii #1 The prime minister is having inter-course behind that tree! All you can see are his eyes poking out from the righthand-side of the tree. Koohii #2 ソウ/ショウ/あ INTER /MUTUAL /ASPECT /PHASE /MINISTER. ""Long ago, before there were telephones, people living far from one another would climb trees to eye each other´s aspects and inter-act for their mutual benefit. Those who did this best became government ministers, with the top person (perhaps the one with the longest neck (首, neck (#70)) becoming the prime minister 「首相 (しゅしょう)"". Primitives inter-, tree, wood, eye 相(あい): together, mutually, fellow 相変わらず(あいかわらず): as ever, as usual, the same 相対(あいたい): confrontation, facing, between ourselves, no third party, tete-a-tete 外相(がいしょう): Foreign Minister 真相(しんそう): truth, real situation 相応(そうおう): suitability, fitness 蔵相(ぞうしょう): Minister of Finance 相談(そうだん): consultation, discussion 相場(そうば): market price, speculation, estimation 相応しい(ふさわしい): appropriate 様相(ようそう): aspect 相手(あいて): companion, partner, company, other party, addressee 首相(しゅしょう): Prime Minister, Chancellor (Germany, Austria, etc.) 相撲(すもう): sumo wrestling 相違(そうい): difference, discrepancy, variation 相互(そうご): mutual, reciprocal 相続(そうぞく): succession, inheritance 相当(そうとう): suitable, fair, tolerable, proper, extremely Kunyomi: あい- Onyomi: ソウ、ショウ Lesson: 10 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 相当 (そうとう), 相談 (そうだん), 真相 (しんそう), 相 (あい)"	"inter- / partner 相 画数9 222 Details Story Dictionary 相 inter- / partner My Story During intercourse, I accidentally put my *wood* in my #partner#'s *eye* be careful of: {祖} ancestor Koohii #1 The prime minister is having inter-course behind that tree! desk Details Story Dictionary 机 desk Heisig's We need to fix imagination here on two things to learn the kanji for desk: the wonderful rough wood of which it has been hewn and the wind that blows across it, sending your papers flying all over the room. These two elements, written in that order, dictate how to write the character. Koohii #1 My wooden desk is so messy, it looks like a strong wind blew my things all over it. Koohii #2 Whenever I´m alone at my computer desk, I´m always getting wood and breaking wind. Primitives desk, tree, wood, wind 机(つくえ): desk Kunyomi: つくえ Onyomi: キ Lesson: 10 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 机 (つくえ)	desk 机 画数6 223 Details Story Dictionary 机 desk Heisig's We need to fix imagination here on two things to learn the kanji for desk: the wonderful rough wood of which it has been hewn and the wind that blows across it, sending your papers flying all over the room. "book Details Story Dictionary 本 book Heisig's Recalling that books are made of paper, and paper made of trees, one might think of a book as a slice of a tree. Can you seethe ""cross-cut"" in the trunk of the tree? Picture it as a chainsaw cutting you out a few books with which to start your own private library. Koohii #1 The origin of a book is paper made out of TREEs. ONE tree can make many books. Koohii #2 An axe cutting a tree to make books. Primitives book, tree, wood, one 脚本(きゃくほん): scenario 根本(こんぽん): origin, source, foundation, root, base, principle 台本(だいほん): libretto, scenario 手本(てほん): model, pattern 本格(ほんかく): propriety, fundamental rules 本館(ほんかん): main building 本気(ほんき): seriousness, truth, sanctity 本質(ほんしつ): essence, true nature, reality 本体(ほんたい): substance, real form, object of worship 本当(ほんとう): truth, reality 本音(ほんね): real intention, motive 本の(ほんの): mere, only, just 本能(ほんのう): instinct 本場(ほんば): home, habitat, center, best place, genuine 本文(ほんぶん): text (of document), body (of letter) 本名(ほんみょう): real name 基本(きほん): foundation, basis, standard 資本(しほん): funds, capital 標本(ひょうほん): example, specimen 本人(ほんにん): the person himself 本部(ほんぶ): headquarters 本物(ほんもの): genuine article 本来(ほんらい): essentially, naturally, by nature, in (and of) itself, originally 見本(みほん): sample 本(ほん): book 本棚(ほんだな): bookshelves Kunyomi: もと Onyomi: ホン Lesson: 10 Jouyou: 1 JLPT Level: 5 Compounds: 本 (もと)"	"book 本 画数5 224 Details Story Dictionary 本 book Heisig's Recalling that books are made of paper, and paper made of trees, one might think of a book as a slice of a tree. "tag Details Story Dictionary 札 tag Heisig's The tags you see hanging on trees in public places in Japan are helpful to identify what sort of trees they are. Next time you see one, imagine the bit of wire that fixes the tag to the branch as a large fishhook. REALLY imagine it, illogical as it is, and you will never have trouble with this kanji again. Koohii #1 Botanists like to identify TREEs by HOOKing tags on them. Koohii #2 Might be good to note that this is also the Kanji for ""Paper Money"" w/ the reading さつ (千円札＝1000 Yen paper bill)... It also takes on the meaning of Playing Card with the reading of ふだ as in 花札 (Hanafuda cards) or トランプの札 (""trump"" playing cards). For the tag meaning I like to think of wooden tags hung on hooks from trees... but for these other meanings I like to think of both paper money and playing cards as paper (tree) products with the ability to ""hook you in"" so to speak. Primitives tag, tree, wood, fishhook 名札(なふだ): name plate, name tag 改札(かいさつ): examination of tickets 札(さつ): paper money Kunyomi: ふだ Onyomi: サツ Lesson: 10 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 札 (ふだ)"	"tag 札 画数5 225 Details Story Dictionary 札 tag Heisig's The tags you see hanging on trees in public places in Japan are helpful to identify what sort of trees they are. Next time you see one, imagine the bit of wire that fixes the tag to the branch as a large fishhook. REALLY imagine it, illogical as it is, and you will never have trouble with this kanji again. Koohii #1 Botanists like to identify TREEs by HOOKing tags on them. Koohii #2 Might be good to note that this is also the Kanji for ""Paper Money"" w/ the reading さつ (千円札＝1000 Yen paper bill)... It also takes on the meaning of Playing Card with the reading of ふだ as in 花札 (Hanafuda cards) or トランプの札 (""trump"" playing cards). For the tag meaning I like to think of wooden tags hung on hooks from trees... but for these other meanings I like to think of both paper money and playing cards as paper (tree) products with the ability to ""hook you in"" so to speak. Primitives tag, tree, wood, fishhook 名札(なふだ): name plate, name tag 改札(かいさつ): examination of tickets 札(さつ): paper money Kunyomi: ふだ Onyomi: サツ Lesson: 10 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 札 (ふだ)"
calendar Details Story Dictionary 暦 calendar Heisig's Look at this character in reverse order, from bottom up. First we see the primitive for days, an appropriate enough way to begin a calendar. Next we see a grove of trees growing under a cliff. The laws of nature being what they are, the trees would be stunted under such conditions, unless they were strong enough to keep growing upwards until they passed through the layers of rock and soil, right up to the surface. Now imagine that in those little boxes marking off the days on your wall calendar, you see that very process taking place step by step: 365 or so time-lapse pictures of that grove of trees each month, from January under the cliff to December on top of the cliff. The story is not as complex as it sounds, particularly if you happen to have a calendar nearby and can flip through it with this image in mind. Koohii #1 Years-Months-Days: It takes many years for a cliff to form or erode. A tree takes many months to grow. But days pass by regularly - so in this way, we see the movement of time such as with a CALENDAR. Koohii #2 This is just a picture of a wall calendar with a page for each month. The bottom half has the grid of days, the top half has a pretty picture of a forest this month. The cliff radical here is the top and left edges of the paper. You can see the paper curling up at the lower left where a breeze is trying to turn the page. Primitives calendar, cliff, grove, tree, wood, sun, day, tree2, wood2 還暦(かんれき): 60th birthday 暦(こよみ): calendar, almanac 西暦(せいれき): Christian Era, Anno Domini (A.D.) Kunyomi: こよみ、りゃく Onyomi: レキ Lesson: 10 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 暦 (こよみ)	calendar 暦 画数14 226 Details Story Dictionary 暦 calendar Heisig's Look at this character in reverse order, from bottom up. First we see the primitive for days, an appropriate enough way to begin a calendar. Next we see a grove of trees growing under a cliff. The laws of nature being what they are, the trees would be stunted under such conditions, unless they were strong enough to keep growing upwards until they passed through the layers of rock and soil, right up to the surface. Now imagine that in those little boxes marking off the days on your wall calendar, you see that very process taking place step by step: 365 or so time-lapse pictures of that grove of trees each month, from January under the cliff to December on top of the cliff. The story is not as complex as it sounds, particularly if you happen to have a calendar nearby and can flip through it with this image in mind. Koohii #1 Years-Months-Days: It takes many years for a cliff to form or erode. A tree takes many months to grow. But days pass by regularly - so in this way, we see the movement of time such as with a CALENDAR. Koohii #2 This is just a picture of a wall calendar with a page for each month. The bottom half has the grid of days, the top half has a pretty picture of a forest this month. The cliff radical here is the top and left edges of the paper. You can see the paper curling up at the lower left where a breeze is trying to turn the page. Primitives calendar, cliff, grove, tree, wood, sun, day, tree2, wood2 還暦(かんれき): 60th birthday 暦(こよみ): calendar, almanac 西暦(せいれき): Christian Era, Anno Domini (A.D.) Kunyomi: こよみ、りゃく Onyomi: レキ Lesson: 10 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 暦 (こよみ)
guide/proposal Details Story Dictionary 案 guide/proposal My Story [Cheap/safe {安} + Tree] I can #guide# you *safely/cheaply* to the *tree* I plan to RELAX on top of that TREE. Koohii #1 I plan to RELAX on top of that TREE. Koohii #2 If you bring a woman to your house, generally its not a good plan to stick your wood up her bottom, she may scream in pain あん! Primitives plan, relax, house, woman, tree, wood 案じる(あんじる): to be anxious, to ponder 案の定(あんのじょう): sure enough, as usual 議案(ぎあん): legislative bill 法案(ほうあん): bill (law) 案(あん): plan, suffix meaning draft 案外(あんがい): unexpectedly 案内(あんない): information, guidance 提案(ていあん): proposal, proposition, suggestion 答案(とうあん): examination paper, examination script Kunyomi: つくえ Onyomi: アン Lesson: 10 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	guide/proposal 案 画数10 227 Details Story Dictionary 案 guide/proposal My Story [Cheap/safe {安} + Tree] I can #guide# you *safely/cheaply* to the *tree* I plan to RELAX on top of that TREE. Koohii #1 I plan to RELAX on top of that TREE. Koohii #2 If you bring a woman to your house, generally its not a good plan to stick your wood up her bottom, she may scream in pain あん! Primitives plan, relax, house, woman, tree, wood 案じる(あんじる): to be anxious, to ponder 案の定(あんのじょう): sure enough, as usual 議案(ぎあん): legislative bill 法案(ほうあん): bill (law) 案(あん): plan, suffix meaning draft 案外(あんがい): unexpectedly 案内(あんない): information, guidance 提案(ていあん): proposal, proposition, suggestion 答案(とうあん): examination paper, examination script Kunyomi: つくえ Onyomi: アン Lesson: 10 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:
"parch Details Story Dictionary 燥 parch Heisig's Parchment, made from animal skins, was the most common form of writing material used until the beginning of the nineteenth century. When paper took over, a method was devised to make artificial parchment from wood pulp. The fire at the left and in the ""strong"" position serves to remind us of the root word, ""parch,"" since nothing dries, puckers, wrinkles, and scorches quite like fire. And here is how we put it all together. Take a sheet of paper (a ""wood-good,""), wet it, and hold it over a hearth in your mind's eye. Now watch as it parches the paper, leaving it with a strange and bumpy surface resembling parchment. Koohii #1 Tip: goods + wood/tree : This combination of primitives appears four times in Heisig, so it´s worthwhile giving it a name. I suggest ""furniture"" (a common type of wooden goods). REF: parch (FRAME 215) , maneuver (#671), winding (#1369), seaweed (#2035). Story: It´s been so parched recently that your furniture suddenly catches fire. Koohii #2 The parchment says you need fire to make goods from trees. Primitives parch, fire, furniture, wooden goods, mouth, tree, wood, mouth3 乾燥(かんそう): dry, arid, dehydrated, insipid Kunyomi: はしゃ.ぐ Onyomi: ソウ Lesson: 10 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 2 Compounds:"	"parch 燥 画数17 228 Details Story Dictionary 燥 parch Heisig's Parchment, made from animal skins, was the most common form of writing material used until the beginning of the nineteenth century. When paper took over, a method was devised to make artificial parchment from wood pulp. Now watch as it parches the paper, leaving it with a strange and bumpy surface resembling parchment.
