Primitives parch, fire, furniture, wooden goods, mouth, tree, wood, mouth3 乾燥(かんそう): dry, arid, dehydrated, insipid Kunyomi: はしゃ.ぐ Onyomi: ソウ Lesson: 10 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 2 Compounds:"
not yet Details Story Dictionary 未 not yet Heisig's As the key word suggests, this kanji has to do with something not quite over and done with. More concretely, it shows us a tree that is not yet fully grown. The extra short stroke in the upper branches shows new branches spreading out, leaving one with the feeling that the tree has a ways to go yet before it reaches maturity. In other words, the kanji conveys its meaning pictographically, playing on the earlier pictograph of the tree. Koohii #1 I believe a better version of that by mameha1977: [Cheat] Remember these as a set: The tree (木) does not yet (未) have exremities (末) of vermilion (朱). Koohii #2 [Cheat] Remember these as a set: The tree (木) is not yet (末) vermilion (朱). Primitives not yet, tree, wood, one 未だ(いまだ): as yet, hitherto, not yet (neg) 未(ひつじ): eighth sign of Chinese zodiac (The Ram 1pm-3pm south-southwest June) 未開(みかい): savage land, backward region, uncivilized 未婚(みこん): unmarried 未熟(みじゅく): inexperience, unripeness, raw, unskilled, immature, inexperienced 未知(みち): not yet known 未定(みてい): not yet fixed, undecided, pending 未練(みれん): lingering affection, attachment, regret(s), reluctance 未だ(まだ): yet, still, more, besides 未満(みまん): less than, insufficient 未来(みらい): future tense, the future (usually distant), the world to come Kunyomi: いま.だ、ま.だ、ひつじ Onyomi: ミ、ビ Lesson: 10 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds:	not yet 未 画数5 229 Details Story Dictionary 未 not yet Heisig's As the key word suggests, this kanji has to do with something not quite over and done with. extremity Details Story Dictionary 末 extremity Heisig's This character is best learned in connection with that of the previous frame. The first stroke shows a branch that is longer than the main branch, indicating that the tree has reached the extremity of its growth, so that its branches stop spreading and start drooping downwards. Be sure to keep this imagery in mind, to avoid confusing this key word with synonyms that will appear later. Koohii #1 The tree has reached the extremity of its growth and no longer produces small, new branches at the top. Instead the existing top branch just grows longer and longer. Koohii #2 There are no great stories for this one yet, and I always forget it.. So, let´s try something ridiculous: The man lived by himself in the wilderness, with no females within miles. So, his only way of relief was to stick his extremity into a small hole in a tree.. The poor guy. Which horizontal stroke is the extremity? The longer one or the shorter one? That, my friends, is up to your own imaginations. I´d prefer not to dwell on that point, myself. ;). Primitives extremity, tree, wood, one 末(うら): top end, tip 期末(きまつ): end of term 始末(しまつ): management, dealing, settlement, cleaning up afterwards 粉末(ふんまつ): fine powder 末期(まっき): closing years (period days), last stage 月末(げつまつ): end of the month 末(すえ): end, close, future, finally, tip, top, trivialities, posterity, youngest child 末っ子(すえっこ): youngest child 粗末(そまつ): crude, rough, plain, humble Kunyomi: すえ Onyomi: マツ、バツ Lesson: 10 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 末代 (まつだい), 本末 (ほんまつ), 粉末 (ふんまつ), 末 (すえ)	extremity 末 画数5 230 Details Story Dictionary 末 extremity Heisig's This character is best learned in connection with that of the previous frame. obscure Details Story Dictionary 昧 obscure Heisig's The most obscure ideas are those that the sun of reason has not yet dawned on. Be sure to give the sun a professorial demeanor, complete with spectacles and a pipe. Koohii #1 Something that is obscure has not yet been brought before the light of day. Koohii #2 ´Can´t you go outside and get some sun?´ ´Not yet, I have to learn all these obscure RTK3 kanji!´. Primitives obscure, sun, not yet, one, tree, wood 曖昧(あいまい): vague, ambiguous Kunyomi: くら.い、むさぼ.る Onyomi: マイ、バイ Lesson: 10 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: Compounds:	obscure 昧 画数9 231 Details Story Dictionary 昧 obscure Heisig's The most obscure ideas are those that the sun of reason has not yet dawned on. splash Details Story Dictionary 沫 splash Heisig's The splash this kanji refers to is the dash of water against the rocks, with all the foam and spray that this creates. If you think of a splash in this sense as a wave that has run its full course and reached its extremity, namely the seashore, and if you think of it pictorially in your mind's eye, this somewhat rare (but oh so-easy-to-learn) kanji is yours for good. Koohii #1 The extremity of a wave of water is the splash. Koohii #2 A splash is WATER that has reached its EXTREMITY. Primitives splash, water, water droplets, water pistol, extremity, one, tree, wood Kunyomi: あわ、しぶき、つばき Onyomi: マツ、バツ Lesson: 10 Jouyou: Names JLPT Level: Compounds:	splash 沫 画数8 232 Details Story Dictionary 沫 splash Heisig's The splash this kanji refers to is the dash of water against the rocks, with all the foam and spray that this creates. If you think of a splash in this sense as a wave that has run its full course and reached its extremity, namely the seashore, and if you think of it pictorially in your mind's eye, this somewhat rare (but oh so-easy-to-learn) kanji is yours for good. flavor Details Story Dictionary 味 flavor Heisig's When a tree has not yet finished growing, it produces fruit with a full flavor. When the official taster (the professional mouth to the left) determines that full flavor has been reached, the tree is pruned back so that it remains permanently not yet grown. A neat little agricultural trick and an easy to way see the sense of flavor hidden in this character. Koohii #1 My mouth has not yet swallowed the food because the flavor is so delicious that I keep chewing it. Koohii #2 To enjoy a food´s FLAVOR, it must be in one´s MOUTH but NOT YET swallowed. Primitives flavor, mouth, not yet, one, tree, wood 味わい(あじわい): flavour, meaning, significance 加味(かみ): seasoning, flavoring 吟味(ぎんみ): testing, scrutiny, careful investigation 三味線(さみせん): three-stringed Japanese guitar, shamisen 中味(なかみ): contents, interior, substance, filling, (sword) blade 不味い(まずい): unappetising, unpleasant (taste appearance situation), ugly, unskilful, awkward, bungling, unwise, untimely 味覚(みかく): taste, palate, sense of taste 無意味(むいみ): nonsense, no meaning 味わう(あじわう): to taste, savor, relish 気味(きみ): sensation, feeling 地味(じみ): plain, simple 正味(しょうみ): net (weight) 調味料(ちょうみりょう): condiment, seasoning 味方(みかた): friend, ally, supporter 味噌(みそ): miso (bean paste), key (main) point 味(あじ): taste 興味(きょうみ): interest 趣味(しゅみ): hobby 意味(いみ): meaning, significance Kunyomi: あじ、あじ.わう Onyomi: ミ Lesson: 10 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds: 味 (あじ), 味わう (あじ.わう)	flavor 味 画数8 233 Details Story Dictionary 味 flavor Heisig's When a tree has not yet finished growing, it produces fruit with a full flavor. younger sister Details Story Dictionary 妹 younger sister Heisig's The younger sister in the family is the woman in the family who, like the newest branch in a tree, is not yet old enough or mature enough to do everything the elder sister can do (See frame 442). Koohii #1 My younger sister is NOT YET a fully grown WOMAN. Koohii #2 Is your younger sister a woman? Not yet! Damn! Primitives younger sister, woman, not yet, one, tree, wood 姉妹(きょうだい): sisters 従姉妹(いとこ): female cousin 姉妹(しまい): sisters 妹(いもうと): younger sister Kunyomi: いもうと Onyomi: マイ Lesson: 10 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds: 妹 (いもうと)	younger sister 妹 画数8 234 Details Story Dictionary 妹 younger sister Heisig's The younger sister in the family is the woman in the family who, like the newest branch in a tree, is not yet old enough or mature enough to do everything the elder sister can do (See frame 442). Koohii #1 My younger sister is NOT YET a fully grown WOMAN. Koohii #2 Is your younger sister a woman? Not yet! Damn! Primitives younger sister, woman, not yet, one, tree, wood 姉妹(きょうだい): sisters 従姉妹(いとこ): female cousin 姉妹(しまい): sisters 妹(いもうと): younger sister Kunyomi: いもうと Onyomi: マイ Lesson: 10 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds: 妹 (いもうと)
vermilion Details Story Dictionary 朱 vermilion Heisig's That red-orange color we call vermilion is found in nature during the fall when the leaves lose their sugar and begin to change color. This kanji depicts the very last leaf on a tree in the fall (the drop hung in the first stroke), the leaf that has not yet fallen as it one day must. Look at its color - vermilion. (Well, not really. The truth is, vermilion is made from a mercuric sulfide, but I'm sure you will agree that autumn leaves area lot easier to work with.) Koohii #1 It´s autumn: only one vermilion leaf on the tree has not yet fallen. Koohii #2 [Cheat] Remember these as a set: The tree (木) is not yet (未)[correction wrong character before] vermilion (朱). Primitives vermillion, drop, not yet, one, tree, wood Kunyomi: あけ Onyomi: シュ Lesson: 10 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	vermilion 朱 画数6 235 Details Story Dictionary 朱 vermilion Heisig's That red-orange color we call vermilion is found in nature during the fall when the leaves lose their sugar and begin to change color. This kanji depicts the very last leaf on a tree in the fall (the drop hung in the first stroke), the leaf that has not yet fallen as it one day must. Look at its color - vermilion. (Well, not really. The truth is, vermilion is made from a mercuric sulfide, but I'm sure you will agree that autumn leaves area lot easier to work with.) Koohii #1 It´s autumn: only one vermilion leaf on the tree has not yet fallen. Koohii #2 [Cheat] Remember these as a set: The tree (木) is not yet (未)[correction wrong character before] vermilion (朱). Primitives vermillion, drop, not yet, one, tree, wood Kunyomi: あけ Onyomi: シュ Lesson: 10 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:
"stocks Details Story Dictionary 株 stocks Heisig's The stocks bought and sold on the market by the tens of millions each day get their name from a comparison to a healthy tree, in which one takes ""stock"" in the hopes that it will grow and produce more and more trees like itself. Usually good stocks are referred to as ""blue chip,"" but here we are asked to associate the key word with the color vermilion, perhaps because one can assess the value of a tree from the color of its autumn leaves. Koohii #1 Which tree would you buy stocks in - the healthy one on the left, or the one with only one vermilion leaf left on the right? Koohii #2 Ideally, one buys stocks when a company is young, ""green,"" and rapidly growing -- then sells them just before the last vermillion leaf falls off, and a period of dormancy or limited growth begins. Primitives stocks, tree, wood, vermillion, drop, not yet, one, tree, wood 株式(かぶしき): stock (company) 株(かぶ): share, stock, stump (of tree) Kunyomi: かぶ Onyomi: シュ Lesson: 10 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 株 (かぶ)"	"stocks 株 画数10 236 Details Story Dictionary 株 stocks Heisig's The stocks bought and sold on the market by the tens of millions each day get their name from a comparison to a healthy tree, in which one takes ""stock"" in the hopes that it will grow and produce more and more trees like itself. Usually good stocks are referred to as ""blue chip,"" but here we are asked to associate the key word with the color vermilion, perhaps because one can assess the value of a tree from the color of its autumn leaves. Koohii #1 Which tree would you buy stocks in - the healthy one on the left, or the one with only one vermilion leaf left on the right? Koohii #2 Ideally, one buys stocks when a company is young, ""green,"" and rapidly growing -- then sells them just before the last vermillion leaf falls off, and a period of dormancy or limited growth begins. Primitives stocks, tree, wood, vermillion, drop, not yet, one, tree, wood 株式(かぶしき): stock (company) 株(かぶ): share, stock, stump (of tree) Kunyomi: かぶ Onyomi: シュ Lesson: 10 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 株 (かぶ)"
young Details Story Dictionary 若 young Heisig's Here we see a flower held in the right hand. You can imagine yourself in a magic garden where flowers picked with the right hand grant eternal youth; and those picked with the left, premature senility. Go ahead, pick one with each hand and watch what happens. Koohii #1 The young little girl held a cute flower in her right hand. Koohii #2 In Hawaii, if you wear a flower over your left ear, it means you are taken. A flower over the right means you are not. The younger you are, the more likely you are to have a flower over your right ear…　　　　　　RTK2: 　ニャク　老若　ろうにゃく (young and old)　　　　　　　　　　　　　　 ジャク　若干　じゃっかん(few). grass Details Story Dictionary 草 grass Heisig's Perhaps you know the custom of seeding grass randomly or in some particular pattern with the flower called the crocus, which blooms for a few days each year in early spring. As the grass begins to turn green again after winter has passed, these tiny flowers dot up here and there. Now just look out your window at a patch of grass somewhere and think what a nice idea it would be to have your name spelled out in flowers once as a sort of early harbinger of spring. Koohii #1 Grass grows in earlier than flowers. Koohii #2 This grass is very long. The only flowers you can see are sunflowers – the rest are hidden by the grass. Primitives grass, flowers, sunflower, early, sun, day, ten, needle 草臥れる(くたびれる): to get tired, to wear out 煙草(たばこ): (pt:) (n) (uk) tobacco (pt: tabaco), cigarettes 草履(ぞうり): sandals 草(くさ): grass Kunyomi: くさ、くさ-、-ぐさ Onyomi: ソウ Lesson: 10 Jouyou: 1 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 草 (くさ)	grass 草 画数9 238 Details Story Dictionary 草 grass Heisig's Perhaps you know the custom of seeding grass randomly or in some particular pattern with the flower called the crocus, which blooms for a few days each year in early spring. As the grass begins to turn green again after winter has passed, these tiny flowers dot up here and there. Now just look out your window at a patch of grass somewhere and think what a nice idea it would be to have your name spelled out in flowers once as a sort of early harbinger of spring. Koohii #1 Grass grows in earlier than flowers. Koohii #2 This grass is very long. The only flowers you can see are sunflowers – the rest are hidden by the grass. suffering Details Story Dictionary 苦 suffering My Story [Flower + Old] *Flowers* for the *old* & suffering. Koohii #1 Flowers for the old man suffering in the hospital. Koohii #2 The derivates from opium poppies such as morphine can be used to tame the suffering of the old. Primitives suffering, flowers, old, tombstone, gravestone, church, ten, needle, mouth 苦しめる(くるしめる): to torment, to harass, to inflict pain ご苦労様(ごくろうさま): Thank you very much for your.... 見苦しい(みぐるしい): unsightly, ugly 無茶苦茶(むちゃくちゃ): confused, jumbled, mixed up, unreasonable 滅茶苦茶(めちゃくちゃ): absurd, unreasonable, excessive, messed up, spoiled, wreaked 苦情(くじょう): complaint, troubles, objection 苦心(くしん): pain, trouble, anxiety, diligence, hard work 苦痛(くつう): pain, agony 苦しい(くるしい): painful, difficult 苦しむ(くるしむ): suffer, groan, be worried 苦労(くろう): troubles, hardships 苦手(にがて): poor (at), weak (in), dislike (of) 苦い(にがい): bitter Kunyomi: くる.しい、-ぐる.しい、くる.しむ、くる.しめる、にが.い、にが.る Onyomi: ク Lesson: 10 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 苦しい (くる.しい), 苦しむ (くる.しむ), 苦しめる (くる.しめる), 苦い (にが.い), 苦る (にが.る)	suffering 苦 画数8 239 Details Story Dictionary 苦 suffering My Story [Flower + Old] *Flowers* for the *old* & suffering. Koohii #1 Flowers for the old man suffering in the hospital. Koohii #2 The derivates from opium poppies such as morphine can be used to tame the suffering of the old. bullying Details Story Dictionary 苛 bullying Heisig's A nosegay of flowers make a nice gift, but if those flowers are poison oak, they can amount to bullying. Be sure to emphasize the word can when you repeat this little phrase to yourself. Koohii #1 How many flowers can I stuff in your nostrils? Well I´m just gonna have to go and see. Bullying at its worst! Koohii #2 Flowers, you ask if they can feel pain, do you? ^stomp^ ^stomp^ ^stomp^ They sure -can-!! ^stomp^ ^stomp^ ^stomp^ ^stomp^ ^stomp^ ^stomp^!! Primitives bullying, flowers, can, mouth, street, street, nail, spike 苛める(いじめる): to tease, to torment, to persecute, to chastise Kunyomi: いじ.める、さいな.む、いらだ.つ、からい、こまかい Onyomi: カ Lesson: 10 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: Compounds:	bullying 苛 画数8 240 Details Story Dictionary 苛 bullying Heisig's A nosegay of flowers make a nice gift, but if those flowers are poison oak, they can amount to bullying. Bullying at its worst! Koohii #2 Flowers, you ask if they can feel pain, do you? ^stomp^ ^stomp^ ^stomp^ They sure -can-!! ^stomp^ ^stomp^ ^stomp^ ^stomp^ ^stomp^ ^stomp^!! "tolerant Details Story Dictionary 寛 tolerant Heisig's The house of flowers or ""hothouse"" has become a metaphor for a narrow-minded, biased, and intolerant attitude distrustful of change. Tolerance, in contrast, is open-minded and welcomes novelty. The way to encourage tolerance in those who lack it is first to have them see through their own hothouse attitudes, which is the very counsel we are given in this kanji. Koohii #1 A tolerant person will ignore SEEing GRASS (marijuana) in the HOUSE of a friend. Koohii #2 To be tolerant is to see flowers (meaning ""beautiful things"") in every house, instead of looking for drawbacks. Primitives tolerant, house, flowers, look, see, telescope, eye, human legs 寛容(かんよう): forbearance, tolerance, generosity Kunyomi: くつろ.ぐ、ひろ.い、ゆる.やか Onyomi: カン Lesson: 10 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"	"tolerant 寛 画数13 241 Details Story Dictionary 寛 tolerant Heisig's The house of flowers or ""hothouse"" has become a metaphor for a narrow-minded, biased, and intolerant attitude distrustful of change. Tolerance, in contrast, is open-minded and welcomes novelty. The way to encourage tolerance in those who lack it is first to have them see through their own hothouse attitudes, which is the very counsel we are given in this kanji. Koohii #1 A tolerant person will ignore SEEing GRASS (marijuana) in the HOUSE of a friend. Koohii #2 To be tolerant is to see flowers (meaning ""beautiful things"") in every house, instead of looking for drawbacks. Primitives tolerant, house, flowers, look, see, telescope, eye, human legs 寛容(かんよう): forbearance, tolerance, generosity Kunyomi: くつろ.ぐ、ひろ.い、ゆる.やか Onyomi: カン Lesson: 10 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"
dilute Details Story Dictionary 薄 dilute My Story Her *specialty* is submerging (diluting) fragrant *flowers* in a lot of *water*, to create a very WEAK perfume. Koohii #1 A Dr. missing his needle can only use dilute flower water for medicine. Koohii #2 Note This character belongs to a set of characters which share the flower/water primitive such as:: dilute (#227), fall (#299), clan (#1912), and seaweed (#2035).... (落 薄 藩 藻) It may be helpful to create a primitive keyword for this occurrence (like seaweed or watering can) which can save a lot of time distinguishing them from characters like Sino 満 and Full 満, where the water primitive is larger than the flower primitive. Primitives dilute, flowers, water, water droplets, water pistol, acupuncturist, specialty, drop, ten, needle, rice field, brains, glue 薄弱(はくじゃく): feebleness, weakness, weak 薄暗い(うすぐらい): dim, gloomy 薄める(うすめる): dilute 薄い(うすい): thin, weak, watery, diluted Kunyomi: うす.い、うす-、-うす、うす.める、うす.まる、うす.らぐ、うす.ら-、うす.れる、すすき Onyomi: ハク Lesson: 10 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 薄い (うす.い), 薄まる (うす.まる), 薄める (うす.める), 薄らく (うす.らく), 薄れる (うす.れる)	dilute 薄 画数16 242 Details Story Dictionary 薄 dilute My Story Her *specialty* is submerging (diluting) fragrant *flowers* in a lot of *water*, to create a very WEAK perfume. Koohii #1 A Dr. missing his needle can only use dilute flower water for medicine. Koohii #2 Note This character belongs to a set of characters which share the flower/water primitive such as:: dilute (#227), fall (#299), clan (#1912), and seaweed (#2035).... (落 薄 藩 藻) It may be helpful to create a primitive keyword for this occurrence (like seaweed or watering can) which can save a lot of time distinguishing them from characters like Sino 満 and Full 満, where the water primitive is larger than the flower primitive. Primitives dilute, flowers, water, water droplets, water pistol, acupuncturist, specialty, drop, ten, needle, rice field, brains, glue 薄弱(はくじゃく): feebleness, weakness, weak 薄暗い(うすぐらい): dim, gloomy 薄める(うすめる): dilute 薄い(うすい): thin, weak, watery, diluted Kunyomi: うす.い、うす-、-うす、うす.める、うす.まる、うす.らぐ、うす.ら-、うす.れる、すすき Onyomi: ハク Lesson: 10 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 薄い (うす.い), 薄まる (うす.まる), 薄める (うす.める), 薄らく (うす.らく), 薄れる (うす.れる)
"leaf Details Story Dictionary 葉 leaf Heisig's Three elements are given here: flower . . . generation . . . tree. The first and last seem logical enough, since it is the leaf that feeds the flowers on a tree. The element for generation interposed between the two suggests that the movement of a tree from one generation to the next is like its ""turning over a new leaf."" Koohii #1 On top of the leaves a flower appears, promising new generations for the old tree below. Koohii #2 The flower generation spent far too much time up trees trying to smoke leaves. Primitives leaf, flowers, Tarzan, generation, tree, wood 落ち葉(おちば): fallen leaves, leaf litter, defoliation, shedding leaves 紅葉(こうよう): autumn colours 言葉遣い(ことばづかい): speech, expression, wording 紅葉(もみじ): autumn colours, (Japanese) maple 葉(は): leaf 言葉(ことば): word(s), phrase, language, speech 葉書(はがき): postcard Kunyomi: は Onyomi: ヨウ Lesson: 10 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 葉 (は)"	"leaf 葉 画数12 243 Details Story Dictionary 葉 leaf Heisig's Three elements are given here: flower . . . generation . . . tree. The first and last seem logical enough, since it is the leaf that feeds the flowers on a tree. The element for generation interposed between the two suggests that the movement of a tree from one generation to the next is like its ""turning over a new leaf."" Koohii #1 On top of the leaves a flower appears, promising new generations for the old tree below. Koohii #2 The flower generation spent far too much time up trees trying to smoke leaves. Primitives leaf, flowers, Tarzan, generation, tree, wood 落ち葉(おちば): fallen leaves, leaf litter, defoliation, shedding leaves 紅葉(こうよう): autumn colours 言葉遣い(ことばづかい): speech, expression, wording 紅葉(もみじ): autumn colours, (Japanese) maple 葉(は): leaf 言葉(ことば): word(s), phrase, language, speech 葉書(はがき): postcard Kunyomi: は Onyomi: ヨウ Lesson: 10 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 葉 (は)"
imitation Details Story Dictionary 模 imitation Heisig's Ah, but haven't modern graveyards become a parody of their ancestors! The flowers are plastic, the writing on the stones is unimaginative and cold, and the whole thing looks more like a marble orchard than a right and proper graveyard. This kanji continues with the modernization trend by picturing imitation trees in the graveyard. But of course, how convenient! They don't need pruning or fertilizing, their leaves don't fall, and they remain the same color all year long. Koohii #1 If I find out this furniture you´re selling me is made of imitation wood, I´ll put you in the graveyard. Koohii #2 The Japanese are so enamored of everything plastic, they even put IMITATION plastic trees in their graveyards! (No, not really, but I wouldn´t be surprised). Primitives imitation, tree, wood, graveyard, flowers, sun, day, large, St. Bernard 規模(きぼ): scale, scope, plan, structure 模型(もけい): model, dummy, maquette 模索(もさく): groping (for) 模範(もはん): exemplar, exemplification, exemplum, model, example 模倣(もほう): imitation, copying 模様(もよう): pattern, figure, design Kunyomi: Onyomi: モ、ボ Lesson: 10 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 模範 (もはん), 模型 (もけい), 模倣 (もほう)	imitation 模 画数14 244 Details Story Dictionary 模 imitation Heisig's Ah, but haven't modern graveyards become a parody of their ancestors! Primitives imitation, tree, wood, graveyard, flowers, sun, day, large, St. Bernard 規模(きぼ): scale, scope, plan, structure 模型(もけい): model, dummy, maquette 模索(もさく): groping (for) 模範(もはん): exemplar, exemplification, exemplum, model, example 模倣(もほう): imitation, copying 模様(もよう): pattern, figure, design Kunyomi: Onyomi: モ、ボ Lesson: 10 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 模範 (もはん), 模型 (もけい), 模倣 (もほう)
vague Details Story Dictionary 漠 vague Heisig's Think of the key word as having to do with something viewed through a haze, or in the twilight and from a distance, so that only its outlines are vaguely discernible. Now we are back again to the essence of the true graveyard. The water may be taken as the sound of waves dashing up against the rocks or the dripping of moisture on cold rock - anything that helps you associate vagueness with the graveyard and keep it distinct from the imitation we met in the last frame. Koohii #1 The precise locations of sailors who meet a WATERY GRAVE are vague. Koohii #2 The water in the graveyard has worn away the headstones, so the writing is vague. Primitives vague, water, water droplets, water pistol, graveyard, flowers, sun, day, large, St. Bernard 漠然(ばくぜん): obscure, vague, equivocal 砂漠(さばく): desert Kunyomi: Onyomi: バク Lesson: 10 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	vague 漠 画数13 245 Details Story Dictionary 漠 vague Heisig's Think of the key word as having to do with something viewed through a haze, or in the twilight and from a distance, so that only its outlines are vaguely discernible. Now we are back again to the essence of the true graveyard. The water may be taken as the sound of waves dashing up against the rocks or the dripping of moisture on cold rock - anything that helps you associate vagueness with the graveyard and keep it distinct from the imitation we met in the last frame. Koohii #1 The precise locations of sailors who meet a WATERY GRAVE are vague. Koohii #2 The water in the graveyard has worn away the headstones, so the writing is vague. Primitives vague, water, water droplets, water pistol, graveyard, flowers, sun, day, large, St. Bernard 漠然(ばくぜん): obscure, vague, equivocal 砂漠(さばく): desert Kunyomi: Onyomi: バク Lesson: 10 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:
"grave Details Story Dictionary 墓 grave Heisig's The mounds of soil with crude wooden crosses set at their head suggests those boot-hill graves we all know from cowboy lore. The only odd thing about this kanji is that the soil comes UNDER the graveyard, rather than to its left, where we might expect. Just think of the bodies as ""lying under boot-hill"" if you have any trouble. By the way, this is not the first time, nor will it be the last, that we learn a kanji whose key word is the same, or almost the same, as a primitive element based on it, but whose shape differs somewhat. There is no cause to worry. By using the primitive in a variety of other characters, as we have done here, the confusion will be averted as a matter of course. In most cases, as here, the primitive element is taken from a part of the fuller kanji. Koohii #1 The soil under a graveyard is full of graves. Koohii #2 A grave is a patch of soil in a graveyard. Primitives grave, graveyard, flowers, sun, day, large, St. Bernard, soil, dirt, ground 墓地(はかち): cemetery, graveyard 墓(はか): gravesite, tomb Kunyomi: はか Onyomi: ボ Lesson: 10 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 墓 (はか)"	"grave 墓 画数13 246 Details Story Dictionary 墓 grave Heisig's The mounds of soil with crude wooden crosses set at their head suggests those boot-hill graves we all know from cowboy lore. The only odd thing about this kanji is that the soil comes UNDER the graveyard, rather than to its left, where we might expect. Just think of the bodies as ""lying under boot-hill"" if you have any trouble. By the way, this is not the first time, nor will it be the last, that we learn a kanji whose key word is the same, or almost the same, as a primitive element based on it, but whose shape differs somewhat. There is no cause to worry. By using the primitive in a variety of other characters, as we have done here, the confusion will be averted as a matter of course. In most cases, as here, the primitive element is taken from a part of the fuller kanji. Koohii #1 The soil under a graveyard is full of graves. Koohii #2 A grave is a patch of soil in a graveyard. Primitives grave, graveyard, flowers, sun, day, large, St. Bernard, soil, dirt, ground 墓地(はかち): cemetery, graveyard 墓(はか): gravesite, tomb Kunyomi: はか Onyomi: ボ Lesson: 10 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 墓 (はか)"
livelihood Details Story Dictionary 暮 livelihood Heisig's Imagine that you have chosen the occupation of the keeper of a graveyard and spend your days tending to other's dead hood in order to make your means of livelihood. Koohii #1 He made a livelihood out of robbing GRAVEYARDS in broad DAYlight. Koohii #2 The gravedigger makes his LIVELIHOOD digging in the graveyard all day For graveyard, imagine an idyllic picture: beautiful grass with the sun shining down...and a dog peeing on one of the graves. Don´t confuse with occupation (#1034). Hold onto the irony of making your LIVElyhood from tending dead people. Primitives livelihood, graveyard, flowers, sun, day, large, St. Bernard, sun2, day2 夕暮れ(ゆうぐれ): evening, (evening) twilight 暮らし(くらし): living, livelihood, subsistence, circumstances 暮らす(くらす): live, get along 暮れ(くれ): year end, sunset, nightfall, end 暮れる(くれる): get dark Kunyomi: く.れる、く.らす Onyomi: ボ Lesson: 10 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 暮らす (く.らす), 暮れる (く.れる)	livelihood 暮 画数14 247 Details Story Dictionary 暮 livelihood Heisig's Imagine that you have chosen the occupation of the keeper of a graveyard and spend your days tending to other's dead hood in order to make your means of livelihood. Koohii #1 He made a livelihood out of robbing GRAVEYARDS in broad DAYlight. Koohii #2 The gravedigger makes his LIVELIHOOD digging in the graveyard all day For graveyard, imagine an idyllic picture: beautiful grass with the sun shining down...and a dog peeing on one of the graves. Don´t confuse with occupation (#1034). Hold onto the irony of making your LIVElyhood from tending dead people. Primitives livelihood, graveyard, flowers, sun, day, large, St. Bernard, sun2, day2 夕暮れ(ゆうぐれ): evening, (evening) twilight 暮らし(くらし): living, livelihood, subsistence, circumstances 暮らす(くらす): live, get along 暮れ(くれ): year end, sunset, nightfall, end 暮れる(くれる): get dark Kunyomi: く.れる、く.らす Onyomi: ボ Lesson: 10 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 暮らす (く.らす), 暮れる (く.れる)
"membrane Details Story Dictionary 膜 membrane Heisig's The part of the body first affected by a stroll through a haunted graveyard is the skin, which gets goose bumps. But we save the word ""skin"" for another kanji, and use the odd word ""membrane"" here. Think of being so scared through and through that the goose flesh moves from the outside in, giving you goose membranes. Koohii #1 In the moonlight of the graveyard I hear a zombie say, MMMMM..EMM...BRANEsssss. Koohii #2 The membranes in your flesh rot when placed in the graveyard. Primitives membrane, moon, month, flesh, part of the body, graveyard, flowers, sun, day, large, St. Bernard 膜(まく): membrane, film Kunyomi: Onyomi: マク Lesson: 10 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"	"membrane 膜 画数14 248 Details Story Dictionary 膜 membrane Heisig's The part of the body first affected by a stroll through a haunted graveyard is the skin, which gets goose bumps. But we save the word ""skin"" for another kanji, and use the odd word ""membrane"" here. Think of being so scared through and through that the goose flesh moves from the outside in, giving you goose membranes. Koohii #1 In the moonlight of the graveyard I hear a zombie say, MMMMM..EMM...BRANEsssss. Koohii #2 The membranes in your flesh rot when placed in the graveyard. Primitives membrane, moon, month, flesh, part of the body, graveyard, flowers, sun, day, large, St. Bernard 膜(まく): membrane, film Kunyomi: Onyomi: マク Lesson: 10 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"
"seedling Details Story Dictionary 苗 seedling Heisig's To avoid confusion with the image of rice seedlings to appear later, we shall take these seedlings out of their agricultural setting in the rice fields and into the frame of Brave New World surgery, where ""ideas"" or ""values"" are being implanted into brains like seedlings to insure a harmonious society. Then you need only imagine them taking root and breaking out into flower right through the tops of the skulls of people walking around on the streets. Koohii #1 If you plant seedlings in a FIELD eventually they will FLOWER. Koohii #2 Crap! There are flowers in the rice field... Who let those seedlings get in there?! Primitives seedling, flowers, rice field, brains 苗(なえ): rice seedling Kunyomi: なえ、なわ- Onyomi: ビョウ、ミョウ Lesson: 10 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 苗 (なえ)"	"seedling 苗 画数8 249 Details Story Dictionary 苗 seedling Heisig's To avoid confusion with the image of rice seedlings to appear later, we shall take these seedlings out of their agricultural setting in the rice fields and into the frame of Brave New World surgery, where ""ideas"" or ""values"" are being implanted into brains like seedlings to insure a harmonious society. Then you need only imagine them taking root and breaking out into flower right through the tops of the skulls of people walking around on the streets. Koohii #1 If you plant seedlings in a FIELD eventually they will FLOWER. Koohii #2 Crap! There are flowers in the rice field... Who let those seedlings get in there?! Primitives seedling, flowers, rice field, brains 苗(なえ): rice seedling Kunyomi: なえ、なわ- Onyomi: ビョウ、ミョウ Lesson: 10 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 苗 (なえ)"
portent Details Story Dictionary 兆 portent Heisig's Here we have a pictograph of the back of a turtle, the two sloping vertical strokes representing the central ridge and the four short strokes the pattern. Think of reading turtle shells as a way to foretell the future, and in particular things that portend coming evils. * When this character is used as a primitive in its full form, we keep the key-word sense of a portent. When it appears to the left in its abbreviated form (namely, the left half only), we shall give it the pictographic sense of a turtle. Koohii #1 When your wife´s LEGs get huge hairs on them it is surely a bad portent for things to come. Koohii #2 A bad portent makes the hairs on your legs stand. Primitives portent, turtle, portent 兆し(きざし): signs, omen, symptoms Kunyomi: きざ.す、きざ.し Onyomi: チョウ Lesson: 11 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 兆し (きざ.し), 兆す (きざ.す)	portent 兆 画数6 250 Details Story Dictionary 兆 portent Heisig's Here we have a pictograph of the back of a turtle, the two sloping vertical strokes representing the central ridge and the four short strokes the pattern. Think of reading turtle shells as a way to foretell the future, and in particular things that portend coming evils. * When this character is used as a primitive in its full form, we keep the key-word sense of a portent. When it appears to the left in its abbreviated form (namely, the left half only), we shall give it the pictographic sense of a turtle. Koohii #1 When your wife´s LEGs get huge hairs on them it is surely a bad portent for things to come. Koohii #2 A bad portent makes the hairs on your legs stand. Primitives portent, turtle, portent 兆し(きざし): signs, omen, symptoms Kunyomi: きざ.す、きざ.し Onyomi: チョウ Lesson: 11 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 兆し (きざ.し), 兆す (きざ.す)
peach tree Details Story Dictionary 桃 peach tree My Story A *tree* with only peaches is a very bad *omen* - Beware! Koohii #1 The pits of a peach tree look like turtles. Koohii #2 King Koopa consistently captures Princess Peach. Eventually he´s going to run out of castles and just set her in a tree. Primitives peach tree, tree, wood, portent, turtle Kunyomi: もも Onyomi: トウ Lesson: 11 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 桃 (もも)	peach tree 桃 画数10 251 Details Story Dictionary 桃 peach tree My Story A *tree* with only peaches is a very bad *omen* - Beware! "stare Details Story Dictionary 眺 stare Heisig's To give someone the ""evil eye"" is to stare at them, wishing them evil. The roots of the superstition are old and almost universal throughout the cultures of the world. In this kanji, too, being stared at is depicted as an eye that portends evil. Koohii #1 Sauron´s One fiery eye stare at Frodo and it is a sign of portent. Evil will become whomever the eye is staring upon. Koohii #2 You lost a staring contest with a turtle because you blinked your eye before he did. (The contest wasn´t fair, because turtles have nictitating membranes, and don´t need to blink so often.) Eye comes first, because stare is most associated with eyes. And compare with challenge (#658) where this same obstreperous turtle challenges you to a finger wrestling contest. (Sibyl´s story with some notes that helped me). Primitives stare, eye, portent, turtle 眺め(ながめ): scene, view, prospect, outlook 眺める(ながめる): view, gaze at Kunyomi: なが.める Onyomi: チョウ Lesson: 11 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 眺める (なが.める)"	"stare 眺 画数11 252 Details Story Dictionary 眺 stare Heisig's To give someone the ""evil eye"" is to stare at them, wishing them evil. The roots of the superstition are old and almost universal throughout the cultures of the world. In this kanji, too, being stared at is depicted as an eye that portends evil. Koohii #1 Sauron´s One fiery eye stare at Frodo and it is a sign of portent. Evil will become whomever the eye is staring upon. Koohii #2 You lost a staring contest with a turtle because you blinked your eye before he did. (The contest wasn´t fair, because turtles have nictitating membranes, and don´t need to blink so often.) Eye comes first, because stare is most associated with eyes. And compare with challenge (#658) where this same obstreperous turtle challenges you to a finger wrestling contest. (Sibyl´s story with some notes that helped me). Primitives stare, eye, portent, turtle 眺め(ながめ): scene, view, prospect, outlook 眺める(ながめる): view, gaze at Kunyomi: なが.める Onyomi: チョウ Lesson: 11 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 眺める (なが.める)"
dog Details Story Dictionary 犬 dog Heisig's We know that the character for large takes on the meaning of the St. Bernard dog when used as a primitive. In this frame we finally see why. The drop added as a fourth and final stroke means that we have to do with a normal-sized dog, which compared to the St. Bernard is no more than a drop in the kennel. * As a primitive this character can take two meanings. In the form given here it will mean a very small dog (which we shall refer to as a chihuahua for convenience sake). When it takes the form 犭 to the left of a character, we shall give it the meaning of a pack of wild dogs. Koohii #1 A large dog, dripping drool. Koohii #2 If we remember large (#107) as a man with his arms outstretched, the drop represents man´s best friend - a dog. Primitives dog, large, St. Bernard, drop 犬(いぬ): dog Kunyomi: いぬ、いぬ- Onyomi: ケン Lesson: 11 Jouyou: 1 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds: 犬 (いぬ)	dog 犬 画数4 253 Details Story Dictionary 犬 dog Heisig's We know that the character for large takes on the meaning of the St. Bernard dog when used as a primitive. In this frame we finally see why. The drop added as a fourth and final stroke means that we have to do with a normal-sized dog, which compared to the St. Bernard is no more than a drop in the kennel. * As a primitive this character can take two meanings. In the form given here it will mean a very small dog (which we shall refer to as a chihuahua for convenience sake). When it takes the form 犭 to the left of a character, we shall give it the meaning of a pack of wild dogs. Koohii #1 A large dog, dripping drool. Koohii #2 If we remember large (#107) as a man with his arms outstretched, the drop represents man´s best friend - a dog. Primitives dog, large, St. Bernard, drop 犬(いぬ): dog Kunyomi: いぬ、いぬ- Onyomi: ケン Lesson: 11 Jouyou: 1 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds: 犬 (いぬ)
status quo Details Story Dictionary 状 status quo Heisig's Did you ever hear of the turtle who fell madly in love with a chihuahua but could not have her because their two families did not like the idea of their children intermarrying? Like all classic stories of ill-fated love, this one shows how the young upset the status quo with an emotion older and more powerful than anything their elders have devised to counter it: blind love. Koohii #1 It was left to the turtle to make right with the dog and thus maintain the status quo.. Koohii #2 A turtle mounting a chihuahua clearly disrupts the status quo. Primitives status quo, turtle, chihuahua, dog, large, drop 状(じょう): shape 白状(はくじょう): confession 現状(げんじょう): present condition, existing state, status quo 状況(じょうきょう): state of affairs (around you), situation, circumstances 症状(しょうじょう): symptoms, condition 状態(じょうたい): current status, condition, situation, circumstances, state Kunyomi: Onyomi: ジョウ Lesson: 11 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds:	status quo 状 画数7 254 Details Story Dictionary 状 status quo Heisig's Did you ever hear of the turtle who fell madly in love with a chihuahua but could not have her because their two families did not like the idea of their children intermarrying? "silence Details Story Dictionary 黙 silence Heisig's Oddly enough, the character for silence shows us a black chihuahua. Actually, the cute little critter's name is Darkness, as I am sure you remember from the famous song about silence that begins, ""Hello, Darkness, my old friend...."" Note how the four dots reach all the way across the bottom of the character. Koohii #1 The computer won´t stop beeping, which is making the chihauhua bark, and it´s driving this guy insane. The only solution he can come up with is to throw them both on the fire and finally enjoy the silence. Koohii #2 Your neighbor is so sick of you playing Led Zeppelin that he takes your copy of the song Black Dog and burns it. Finally, silence in the neighborhood. Primitives silence, black, computer, chihuahua, dog, large, drop, oven-fire, barbecue 沈黙(ちんもく): silence, reticence 黙る(だまる): be silent Kunyomi: だま.る、もだ.す Onyomi: モク、ボク Lesson: 11 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 黙る (だま.る)"	"silence 黙 画数15 255 Details Story Dictionary 黙 silence Heisig's Oddly enough, the character for silence shows us a black chihuahua. "sort of thing Details Story Dictionary 然 sort of thing Heisig's The key word in this frame refers to a suffix that gives the word before it an adjectival quality; hence we refer to it as ""sort of thing."" Reverting to the time when dog was more widely eaten than it is today (See frame 127), we see here a large cauldron boiling over an oven flame with the flesh of a chihuahua being thrown into the whole concoction to make it into a ""hot-diggity, dog-diggity"" sort of thing. Koohii #1 Flesh of a dog over a cooking fire = ""hotdog"". There are all sorts of things in hot dogs. Believe me, you don´t want to know what sort of things . Visualize the hotdog curling as it cooks, to remember the unusual way the flesh primitive curves in this kanji. (tweaked version of ziggr´s. Thanks!). Koohii #2 There are all sorts of things in hot dogs. (I use hot dog for this primitive (meat of a dog over a cooking fire). I swear I can actually see the 月 here as a hot dog, with its slight curve and grill marks.). Primitives sort of thing, moon, crescent moon, month, flesh, part of the body, chihuahua, dog, large, drop, oven-fire, barbecue 依然(いぜん): still, as yet 公然(こうぜん): open (e.g. secret), public, official 然も(さも): with gusto, with satisfaction 然しながら(しかしながら): nevertheless, however 整然(せいぜん): orderly, regular, well-organized, trim, accurate 全然(ぜんぜん): wholly, entirely, completely, not at all (with neg. verb) 然して(そして): and 断然(だんぜん): firmly, absolutely, definitely 漠然(ばくぜん): obscure, vague, equivocal 必然(ひつぜん): inevitable, necessary 呆然(ぼうぜん): dumbfounded, overcome with surprise, in blank amazement 偶然(ぐうぜん): chance, accident, fortuity, unexpectedly, suddenly 自然(しぜん): nature, spontaneous 自然科学(しぜんかがく): natural science 天然(てんねん): nature, spontaneity 突然(とつぜん): abruptly, suddenly, unexpectedly, all at once Kunyomi: しか、しか.り、しか.し、さ Onyomi: ゼン、ネン Lesson: 11 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 当然 (とうぜん), 自然 (しぜん), 必然 (ひつぜん)"	"sort of thing 然 画数12 256 Details Story Dictionary 然 sort of thing Heisig's The key word in this frame refers to a suffix that gives the word before it an adjectival quality; hence we refer to it as ""sort of thing."" "reed Details Story Dictionary 荻 reed Heisig's You've no doubt seen cattails, those swamp reeds with a furry flower to them like the tail of a cat. This might just turn out to be a good way to get rid of a troublesome pack of wild dogs: lure them into a swamp of these reeds with the cattail flowers and then set fire to the swamp. Take care to focus on the flower rather than the ""cattail"" to avoid confusion with frame 259 below. Koohii #1 REEDS are the only FLOWERS that WILD DOGS like to FIRE up and smoke while they are playing poker. Koohii #2 A reed is a flower that looks like a hot dog. Primitives reed, flowers, pack of wild dogs, fire Kunyomi: おぎ Onyomi: テキ Lesson: 11 Jouyou: Names JLPT Level: Compounds:"	"reed 荻 画数10 257 Details Story Dictionary 荻 reed Heisig's You've no doubt seen cattails, those swamp reeds with a furry flower to them like the tail of a cat. hunt Details Story Dictionary 狩 hunt Heisig's One of the worst problems you have to face when you go hunting is to guard your take from the wild dogs. If you imagine yourself failing at the task, you will probably have a stronger image than if you try to picture yourself succeeding. Koohii #1 Actually when hunting it may be a good idea to use a pack of dogs as your personal guard. Koohii #2 After a pack of wild dogs hunt some food, they will guard it fiercely. Primitives hunt, pack of wild dogs, guard, house, glue Kunyomi: か.る、か.り、-が.り Onyomi: シュ Lesson: 11 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 狩り (か.り), 狩る (か.る)	hunt 狩 画数9 258 Details Story Dictionary 狩 hunt Heisig's One of the worst problems you have to face when you go hunting is to guard your take from the wild dogs. "cat Details Story Dictionary 猫 cat Heisig's Knowing how much dogs love to chase cats, picture a pack of wild dogs planting ""cat-seedlings,"" watering them, and fertilizing them until they can be harvested as a crop of cats for them to chase and torment. If you begin from the key word and think of a ""crop of cats,"" you will not confuse this story with the apparently similar story of two frames ago. Koohii #1 The cat hid in the FLOWERS of the FIELD from the WILD DOGs. Koohii #2 Dawgs always wanna put their seedlings in pussies. Primitives cat, pack of wild dogs, seedlings, flowers, rice field, brains 猫(ねこ): cat Kunyomi: ねこ Onyomi: ビョウ Lesson: 11 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 猫 (ねこ)"	"cat 猫 画数11 259 Details Story Dictionary 猫 cat Heisig's Knowing how much dogs love to chase cats, picture a pack of wild dogs planting ""cat-seedlings,"" watering them, and fertilizing them until they can be harvested as a crop of cats for them to chase and torment. "cow Details Story Dictionary 牛 cow Heisig's Can you the ""doodle"" of a cow that has just been run over by a steamroller? The small dot in the first stroke shows its head turned to one side, and the next two strokes, the four legs. * As a primitive, the same sense of cow is kept. Note only that when it is placed OVER another element, its tail is cut off. In this case, and when the element appears on the left, the stroke order is changed. Koohii #1 A cow tried to climb up a vermilion tree, but in doing so, it broke its two bottom branches off. Koohii #2 A cow bleeds vermilion when you cut off two of it´s legs. Primitives cow 牛(うし): cattle, cow 牛乳(ぎゅうにゅう): cow´s milk 牛肉(ぎゅうにく): beef Kunyomi: うし Onyomi: ギュウ Lesson: 11 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds: 牛 (うし)"	"cow 牛 画数4 260 Details Story Dictionary 牛 cow Heisig's Can you the ""doodle"" of a cow that has just been run over by a steamroller? The small dot in the first stroke shows its head turned to one side, and the next two strokes, the four legs. * As a primitive, the same sense of cow is kept. Note only that when it is placed OVER another element, its tail is cut off. In this case, and when the element appears on the left, the stroke order is changed. Koohii #1 A cow tried to climb up a vermilion tree, but in doing so, it broke its two bottom branches off. Koohii #2 A cow bleeds vermilion when you cut off two of it´s legs. "special Details Story Dictionary 特 special My Story [Cow + Buddhist temple] This *cow* is special enough to be in the *Buddhist temple*. Koohii #1 Think of not special people, but special animals. The sacred Hindu cows are special - they can wander around the temple without fear of becoming roast beef. Koohii #2 The Church Lady is traveling through Japan and notices with distaste a sacred cow relieving itself inside a Buddhist Temple. ""Well, isn´t that special"". "before Details Story Dictionary 先 before Heisig's Take this key word in its physical, not its temporal, sense (even though it refers to both). If you have a cow with human legs, as the elements show us here, it can only be because you have two people in a cow-suit. I always thought I'd prefer to be the one standing before, rather than the one that holds up the rear and becomes the ""butt"" of everyone's laughter. Koohii #1 I´ve never seen a cow with human legs before! Koohii #2 Nasty story but it keeps the meaning true to the kanji. ""BEFORE you stick it in a COW and SPREAD the legs (the bottom stroke of this cow looks like two legs) make sure she has HUMAN LEGS""-------------sorry, I´ll remove if I get enough reports, but will keep if I get more stars. Primitives before, cow, human legs お先に(おさきに): before, ahead, previously 先に(さきに): before, earlier than, ahead, beyond, away, previously, recently 先行(せんこう): preceding, going first 先代(せんだい): family predecessor, previous age, previous generation 先だって(せんだって): recently, the other day 先着(せんちゃく): first arrival 先天的(せんてんてき): a priori, inborn, innate, inherent, congenital, hereditary 勤め先(つとめさき): place of work 優先(ゆうせん): preference, priority 先程(さきほど): some time ago 先日(せんじつ): the other day, a few days ago 先々月(せんせんげつ): month before last 先々週(せんせんしゅう): week before last 先祖(せんぞ): ancestor 先端(せんたん): pointed end, tip, fine point, spearhead, cusp, vanguard, advanced, leading edge 先頭(せんとう): head, lead, vanguard, first 祖先(そせん): ancestor 先ず(まず): at first 真っ先(まっさき): the head, the foremost, beginning 先輩(せんぱい): one´s senior 先(さき): the future, forward, priority, precedence, former, previous, old, late 先月(せんげつ): last month 先週(せんしゅう): last week, the week before 先生(せんせい): teacher, master, doctor Kunyomi: さき、ま.ず Onyomi: セン Lesson: 11 Jouyou: 1 JLPT Level: 5 Compounds: 先 (さき)"	"before 先 画数6 263 Details Story Dictionary 先 before Heisig's Take this key word in its physical, not its temporal, sense (even though it refers to both). If you have a cow with human legs, as the elements show us here, it can only be because you have two people in a cow-suit. I always thought I'd prefer to be the one standing before, rather than the one that holds up the rear and becomes the ""butt"" of everyone's laughter. Koohii #1 I´ve never seen a cow with human legs before! Koohii #2 Nasty story but it keeps the meaning true to the kanji. ""BEFORE you stick it in a COW and SPREAD the legs (the bottom stroke of this cow looks like two legs) make sure she has HUMAN LEGS""-------------sorry, I´ll remove if I get enough reports, but will keep if I get more stars. Primitives before, cow, human legs お先に(おさきに): before, ahead, previously 先に(さきに): before, earlier than, ahead, beyond, away, previously, recently 先行(せんこう): preceding, going first 先代(せんだい): family predecessor, previous age, previous generation 先だって(せんだって): recently, the other day 先着(せんちゃく): first arrival 先天的(せんてんてき): a priori, inborn, innate, inherent, congenital, hereditary 勤め先(つとめさき): place of work 優先(ゆうせん): preference, priority 先程(さきほど): some time ago 先日(せんじつ): the other day, a few days ago 先々月(せんせんげつ): month before last 先々週(せんせんしゅう): week before last 先祖(せんぞ): ancestor 先端(せんたん): pointed end, tip, fine point, spearhead, cusp, vanguard, advanced, leading edge 先頭(せんとう): head, lead, vanguard, first 祖先(そせん): ancestor 先ず(まず): at first 真っ先(まっさき): the head, the foremost, beginning 先輩(せんぱい): one´s senior 先(さき): the future, forward, priority, precedence, former, previous, old, late 先月(せんげつ): last month 先週(せんしゅう): last week, the week before 先生(せんせい): teacher, master, doctor Kunyomi: さき、ま.ず Onyomi: セン Lesson: 11 Jouyou: 1 JLPT Level: 5 Compounds: 先 (さき)"
wash Details Story Dictionary 洗 wash My Story [Water + Before {先} ] Wash with *water*,.... *before* the slaughter Koohii #1 In Japan, you always wash with water from the shower before you enter the bathtub. Koohii #2 You wash things with WATER to get them back to the clean state they were in BEFORE. Primitives wash, water, water droplets, water pistol, before, cow, human legs 水洗(すいせん): flushing 洗剤(せんざい): detergent, washing material 手洗い(てあらい): restroom, lavatory, hand-washing 洗う(あらう): to wash お手洗い(おてあらい): toilet, restroom, lavatory, bathroom (US) 洗濯(せんたく): washing, laundry Kunyomi: あら.う Onyomi: セン Lesson: 11 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 洗う (あら.う)	wash 洗 画数9 264 Details Story Dictionary 洗 wash My Story [Water + Before {先} ] Wash with *water*,.... *before* the slaughter Koohii #1 In Japan, you always wash with water from the shower before you enter the bathtub. "jammed in Details Story Dictionary 介 jammed in Heisig's The idea of something getting jammed into something else is depicted here by having a walking stick get jammed into an umbrella frame by someone shoving it into an already occupied slot in the umbrella stand at the door. First notice the vertical strokes: on the left is the curved umbrella handle, and on the right the straight walking stick. Now try to imagine the two parties tugging at their respective properties like two kids on a wishbone, creating a scene at the entrance of an elegant restaurant. Koohii #1 The two strokes at the bottom look like a J and I, which stands for ""jammed in."". Koohii #2 Two people jammed in under an umbrella. A woman with a dress and a man (straight). It´s always me that ends up getting wet.... but the tail of the skirt is this time! Primitives jammed in, umbrella, stick, walking cane 介護(かいご): nursing 介入(かいにゅう): intervention 介抱(かいほう): nursing, looking after 厄介(やっかい): trouble, burden, care, bother, worry, dependence, support, kindness, obligation 紹介(しょうかい): introduce Kunyomi: Onyomi: カイ Lesson: 12 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 2 Compounds:"	"jammed in 介 画数4 265 Details Story Dictionary 介 jammed in Heisig's The idea of something getting jammed into something else is depicted here by having a walking stick get jammed into an umbrella frame by someone shoving it into an already occupied slot in the umbrella stand at the door. First notice the vertical strokes: on the left is the curved umbrella handle, and on the right the straight walking stick. world Details Story Dictionary 界 world Heisig's As the world gets jammed with more and more people, there is less and less space. Imagine yourself taking an air flight over a world so densely populated that every bit of it is sectioned off like a gigantic checkerboard (the rice fields). If you look closely at the character, you should be able to see a kind of movement taking place as still more is being jammed into that already narrow space. Koohii #1 One Japanese farmer I know is so small minded that he thinks the entire world is JAMMED IN the borders of his little RICE FIELD. Koohii #2 A famous philosopher once said that his world consisted of all the things he could jam into his brain. Primitives world, rice field, brains, jammed in, umbrella, stick, cane 境界(きょうかい): boundary 限界(げんかい): limit, bound 世界(せかい): world Kunyomi: Onyomi: カイ Lesson: 12 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds:	world 界 画数9 266 Details Story Dictionary 界 world Heisig's As the world gets jammed with more and more people, there is less and less space. "tea Details Story Dictionary 茶 tea Heisig's As everyone knows, tea is made from tea leaves. But the tea plant itself has its own flowers, which can be quite beautiful and add a special flavor to the tea, as the Chinese found out already over 4,598 years ago. With the image of a terrace of flowering tea bushes in mind, picture a number of brightly painted and very l-o-n-g wooden poles (Frame 207) placed here and there in their midst, with a tiny umbrella at the top to shade the delicate-tasting tea flowers. Koohii #1 Some people think drinking tea is boring and quaint. That´s why I spice mine up by adding a cocktail umbrella, which of course is made from a wood-en toothpick supporting a paper umbrella with flowers printed on top. Koohii #2 When I drink herbal tea I like to drink it under a parasol. If it´s too hot I go ""ho, ho, ho !!"" (katakana ホ). Primitives tea, flowers, umbrella, wooden pole 喫茶(きっさ): tea drinking, tea house 焦げ茶(こげちゃ): black tea 茶の間(ちゃのま): living room (Japanese style) 茶の湯(ちゃのゆ): tea ceremony 茶碗(ちゃわん): tea cup, rice bowl 無茶(むちゃ): absurd, unreasonable, excessive, rash, absurdity, nonsense 無茶苦茶(むちゃくちゃ): confused, jumbled, mixed up, unreasonable 滅茶苦茶(めちゃくちゃ): absurd, unreasonable, excessive, messed up, spoiled, wreaked 紅茶(こうちゃ): black tea 茶(ちゃ): tea 茶色い(ちゃいろい): brown (adjective) お茶(おちゃ): tea (green) 喫茶店(きっさてん): coffee shop 茶色(ちゃいろ): light brown, tawny Kunyomi: Onyomi: チャ、サ Lesson: 12 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds: 茶色 (ちゃいろ), 茶番劇 (ちゃばんげき), 番茶 (ばんちゃ)"	"tea 茶 画数9 267 Details Story Dictionary 茶 tea Heisig's As everyone knows, tea is made from tea leaves. "spinal column Details Story Dictionary 脊 spinal column Heisig's The spinal column has sprouted out of the flesh of your back into an umbrella that you always have with you, rain or shine. The pair of 2s on each side are the ""ribs"" of the umbrella. Take care to keep your image of the key word distinct from that for spine (Frame 24). Koohii #1 Look, says the teacher in biology class. ""The spinal column holds your flesh together, just like the metal rod of this umbrella (he demonstrates this with an umbrella covered in I-Ching symbols) holds the umbrella together"". Koohii #2 A pictograph of a spinal column. The umbrella representing the shoulder blades, the I Ching as the shoulder muscles and the part of the body as the spine itself. Primitives spinal column, I Ching, Master Po, umbrella, moon, month, flesh, part of the body Kunyomi: せ、せい Onyomi: セキ Lesson: 12 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: Compounds:"	"spinal column 脊 画数10 268 Details Story Dictionary 脊 spinal column Heisig's The spinal column has sprouted out of the flesh of your back into an umbrella that you always have with you, rain or shine. The pair of 2s on each side are the ""ribs"" of the umbrella. Take care to keep your image of the key word distinct from that for spine (Frame 24). Koohii #1 Look, says the teacher in biology class. ""The spinal column holds your flesh together, just like the metal rod of this umbrella (he demonstrates this with an umbrella covered in I-Ching symbols) holds the umbrella together"". fit Details Story Dictionary 合 fit My Story The umbrella did not fit in his Mouth. Koohii #1 I wouldn´t mind a meeting of mouths with her, she´s really fit ! Koohii #2 He had such a big mouth that he could easily fit one whole umbrella in it. Primitives fit, meeting, umbrella, one, mouth 合間(あいま): interval 合わす(あわす): to join together, to face, to unite, to be opposite, to combine, to connect, to add up, to mix, to match, to overlap, to compare, to check with 合わせ(あわせ): joint together, opposite, facing 打ち合わせ(うちあわせ): business meeting, previous arrangement, appointment 打ち合わせる(うちあわせる): to knock together, to arrange 化合(かごう): chemical affiliation, incorporation 組み合わせ(くみあわせ): combination 組み合わせる(くみあわせる): to join together, to combine, to join up 結合(けつごう): combination, union 合意(ごうい): agreement, consent, mutual understanding 合議(ごうぎ): pagoda Details Story Dictionary 塔 pagoda Heisig's On the left we see a mound of dirt, and to the right flowers made to fit together. The two sides combine to create a great pagoda made of dirt, with flowers by the tens of thousands fitted together for the roofing of each of the layers. Be sure to put yourself in the scene and fit a few of the flowers in place yourself so that the image works its way into memory with full force. Koohii #1 In order to build a pagoda in this small Japanese garden everything has to fit: the soil to the left and the flowers in the upper right corner. Koohii #2 Pictograph-o-rama. This is a corner of a Japanese garden, with a small mound of soil on the left, and a little concrete pagoda in the front with flowers behind it. (To my eye, the fit looks a lot like a little pagoda anyway. This may or may not cause confusion for you, though...). Primitives pagoda, soil, dirt, ground, flowers, fit, meeting, umbrella, one, mouth 塔(とう): tower, pagoda Kunyomi: Onyomi: トウ Lesson: 12 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 2 Compounds:	pagoda 塔 画数12 270 Details Story Dictionary 塔 pagoda Heisig's On the left we see a mound of dirt, and to the right flowers made to fit together. king Details Story Dictionary 王 king Heisig's See what you can do to come up with a pictograph of a king's scepter here that suits your own idea of what it should look like. You might even begin with the basic element for I beam and then try to fit the remaining third stroke in. * As a primitive, this can mean either king or scepter, but it will usually be taken to mean ball, as an abbreviation of the character in the next frame. Koohii #1 To be king you have to be a real crafty one ! Koohii #2 The king unites heaven and earth. (imagine heaven being the top line over the soil). Primitives king, jewel, ball 王(おう): king 王様(おうさま): king 王子(おうじ): prince 王女(おうじょ): princess 国王(こくおう): king 女王(じょおう): queen Kunyomi: Onyomi: オウ、ノウ Lesson: 12 Jouyou: 1 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds:	king 王 画数4 271 Details Story Dictionary 王 king Heisig's See what you can do to come up with a pictograph of a king's scepter here that suits your own idea of what it should look like. "jewel Details Story Dictionary 玉 jewel Heisig's Note the drop here in the king's scepter, which is exactly what you would expect it to be: a precious jewel handed down from of old as a symbol of his wealth and power. * As a primitive, we can use this to mean either jewel or ball. When it appears anywhere other than on the left side of a kanji, it takes the same shape as here. On the left, it will be lacking the final stroke, making it the same as the character in the previous frame. Koohii #1 The king is said to have only one family jewel below the belt... Koohii #2 The king is said to have only one family jewel below the belt...and he hangs left! (I always screw up the direction of the ""drop""). Primitives jewel, king, jewel, ball, earring, drop 玉(ぎょく): king (shogi) 玉(たま): ball, sphere, coin Kunyomi: たま、たま-、-だま Onyomi: ギョク Lesson: 12 Jouyou: 1 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 玉 (たま)"	"jewel 玉 画数5 272 Details Story Dictionary 玉 jewel Heisig's Note the drop here in the king's scepter, which is exactly what you would expect it to be: a precious jewel handed down from of old as a symbol of his wealth and power. * As a primitive, we can use this to mean either jewel or ball. When it appears anywhere other than on the left side of a kanji, it takes the same shape as here. On the left, it will be lacking the final stroke, making it the same as the character in the previous frame. Koohii #1 The king is said to have only one family jewel below the belt... Koohii #2 The king is said to have only one family jewel below the belt...and he hangs left! (I always screw up the direction of the ""drop""). Primitives jewel, king, jewel, ball, earring, drop 玉(ぎょく): king (shogi) 玉(たま): ball, sphere, coin Kunyomi: たま、たま-、-だま Onyomi: ギョク Lesson: 12 Jouyou: 1 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 玉 (たま)"
"treasure Details Story Dictionary 宝 treasure Heisig's Every house has its treasure, as every thief knows only too well. While the things we treasure most are usually of sentimental value, we take the original sense of the term treasure here and make it refer to jewels kept in one's house. Koohii #1 On treasure island is a single house - where all the jewels are stored. Koohii #2 Put a ""roof"" (lid) on your jewels and voila! You´ve got a treasure chest. Primitives treasure, house, king, jewel, ball, earring, drop 重宝(じゅうほう): priceless treasure, convenience, usefulness 宝器(ほうき): treasured article or vessel, outstanding individual 宝(たから): treasure 宝石(ほうせき): gem, jewel Kunyomi: たから Onyomi: ホウ Lesson: 12 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 宝 (たから)"	"treasure 宝 画数8 273 Details Story Dictionary 宝 treasure Heisig's Every house has its treasure, as every thief knows only too well. While the things we treasure most are usually of sentimental value, we take the original sense of the term treasure here and make it refer to jewels kept in one's house. pearl Details Story Dictionary 珠 pearl Heisig's Take care to keep the meaning of this kanji distinct from that for jewel. Think of the most enormous pearl you have ever seen, a great vermilion-colored ball sitting on your ring and making it extremely difficult to move without falling over from the weight of the thing. Koohii #1 The king of the Oysters produces special Vermillion pearls! Koohii #2 King Vermillion is a little queer and likes to wear pearl necklaces. Primitives pearl, king, jewel, ball, vermillion, drop, not yet, one, tree, wood 真珠(しんじゅ): pearl Kunyomi: たま Onyomi: シュ Lesson: 12 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	pearl 珠 画数10 274 Details Story Dictionary 珠 pearl Heisig's Take care to keep the meaning of this kanji distinct from that for jewel. present Details Story Dictionary 現 present My Story [King + see] *The King* can *See* the present state of affairs. Koohii #1 The KING ... can SEE clearly the PRESENT state of affairs in the land. (maybe he hees them in the crystal ball on the left?). Koohii #2 Hey, I want my money back! This crystal ball is out of order, I can see the present instead of the future! Primitives present, king, jewel, ball, see, telescope, eye, human legs 現われ(あらわれ): embodiment, materialization 現われる(あらわれる): to appear, to come in sight, to become visible, to come out, to embody, to materialize, to express oneself 現行(げんこう): present, current, in operation 現場(げんじょう): actual spot, scene, scene of the crime 現像(げんぞう): developing (film) 現地(げんち): actual place, local 再現(さいげん): reappearance, reproduction, return, revival 現す(あらわす): indicate, show, display 現れ(あらわれ): embodiment 現れる(あらわれる): appear, embody, express oneself 現金(げんきん): cash, ready money, mercenary, self-interested 現在(げんざい): present, up to now, nowadays, modern times, current 現実(げんじつ): reality 現象(げんしょう): phenomenon 現状(げんじょう): present condition, existing state, status quo 現代(げんだい): nowadays, modern times, present-day 現に(げんに): actually, really 現場(げんば): actual spot, scene, scene of the crime 実現(じつげん): implementation, materialization, realization 表現(ひょうげん): expression, presentation, (mathematics) representation Kunyomi: あらわ.れる、あらわ.す、うつつ、うつ.つ Onyomi: ゲン Lesson: 12 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 現す (あらわ.す), 現れる (あらわ.れる)	present 現 画数11 275 Details Story Dictionary 現 present My Story [King + see] *The King* can *See* the present state of affairs. toy Details Story Dictionary 玩 toy Heisig's If, at some aboriginal level, Toys Я Us, then the archetypal ball must have been there at the beginning, before evolving into beach balls, ping-pong balls, rugby balls, and marbles. Koohii #1 The ball was the only thing that people at the beginning of time had to use as a toy. Poor cavemen. Koohii #2 And so it was, the ball marked the beginning of all the toys that were to come. "lunatic Details Story Dictionary 狂 lunatic Heisig's A lunatic is literally one driven mad by the light of the moon, and the most famous of the ""looneys"" are the legendary lycanthropes or ""wolfmen."" Sometimes the transformation is only a temporary phenomenon, sometimes it is permanent. In the latter case, the poor chap takes off on all fours to live with the beasts. To remember this kanji, imagine one of these lycanthropes going looney and setting himself up as king of a pack of wild dogs that roams about and terrorizes innocent suburban communities. Koohii #1 Oh no ! A pack of dogs has bitten the king. He has turned into a rabid lunatic ! Koohii #2 Think of King Nebuchadnezzar, who for 7 years lost his sanity and had to live like a wild animal. Primitives lunatic, pack of wild dogs, king, jewel, ball 狂う(くるう): go mad, get out of order Kunyomi: くる.う、くる.おしい、くるお.しい Onyomi: キョウ Lesson: 12 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 狂う (くる.う), 狂おしい (くる.おしい)"	"lunatic 狂 画数7 277 Details Story Dictionary 狂 lunatic Heisig's A lunatic is literally one driven mad by the light of the moon, and the most famous of the ""looneys"" are the legendary lycanthropes or ""wolfmen."" Sometimes the transformation is only a temporary phenomenon, sometimes it is permanent. In the latter case, the poor chap takes off on all fours to live with the beasts. "effulgent Details Story Dictionary 旺 effulgent Heisig's The radiant, effulgent splendor of he sun makes it king of all the planets and other stars. Just to be sure you don't take this too abstractly, picture the sun seated on a throne, flourishing its scepter this way and that. Koohii #1 The Sun King (Louis XIV) was known for his effulgent reign. Koohii #2 [+katsuo] This is the Sun King. Sayeth Wikipedia: ""The Sun King (in French le Roi Soleil) because of the idea that, just as the planets revolve around the Sun, so too should France and the court revolve around [the king] (""http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Louis_XIV_of_France). And just like the sun, he was quite effulgent and actually emitted sunlight. Primitives effulgent, sun, day, king, jewel, ball Kunyomi: かがや.き、うつくし.い、さかん Onyomi: オウ、キョウ、ゴウ Lesson: 12 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"	"effulgent 旺 画数8 278 Details Story Dictionary 旺 effulgent Heisig's The radiant, effulgent splendor of he sun makes it king of all the planets and other stars. emperor Details Story Dictionary 皇 emperor Heisig's An emperor, as we all know, is a ruler - something like a king but higher in status. The white bird perched above the king, elevating him to imperial heights, is the messenger he sends back and forth to the gods to request advice and special favors, something that white birds have long done in folklore throughout the world. Koohii #1 Ancient Rome had Emperors instead of Kings, and they wore white robes. Thus an emperor is a king in white. (make sure you picture a roman emperor not a japanese one and you´ll be ok). Koohii #2 The white dove descended on the king and he was promoted to emperor. Primitives emperor, white, dove, king, jewel, ball 皇居(こうきょ): Imperial Palace 天皇(すめらぎ): Emperor of Japan 天皇(てんのう): Emperor of Japan Kunyomi: Onyomi: コウ、オウ Lesson: 12 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 皇帝 (こうてい), 皇室 (こうしつ), 皇后 (こうごう)	emperor 皇 画数9 279 Details Story Dictionary 皇 emperor Heisig's An emperor, as we all know, is a ruler - something like a king but higher in status. "display Details Story Dictionary 呈 display Heisig's The trick to remembering this character lies in associating the key word with the line from the nursery rhyme about 4 and 20 blackbirds baked in a pie: ""Wasn't this a dainty dish to set before the king?"" If we think of display in terms of that famous line, and the king with his head thrown back and his mouth wide open as 4 and 20 blackbirds fly in one after the other, we shall have satisfied both the elements and their position. Koohii #1 The mouth of the king is displaying his bling. Koohii #2 What a pathetic display! The king is sprawled on his throne, head back and mouth wide open, fast asleep. We should never have let him drink so much at that banquet last night. Primitives display, mouth, king, jewel, ball 進呈(しんてい): presentation Kunyomi: Onyomi: テイ Lesson: 12 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"	"display 呈 画数7 280 Details Story Dictionary 呈 display Heisig's The trick to remembering this character lies in associating the key word with the line from the nursery rhyme about 4 and 20 blackbirds baked in a pie: ""Wasn't this a dainty dish to set before the king?"" "whole Details Story Dictionary 全 whole Heisig's Wholeness suggests physical and spiritual health, ""having your act together."" The kanji-image for wholeness depicts being ""king under your own umbrella,"" that is, giving order to your own life. I know it sounds terribly abstract, but what could be more abstract than the word whole? Koohii #1 The fat king hogs the whole space under his umbrella. (tweaked version of radical tyro´s story. ""fat"" makes a more vivid image for me.). Koohii #2 The king takes up the whole space under his umbrella. Primitives whole, umbrella, king, jewel, ball 健全(けんぜん): health, soundness, wholesome 全快(ぜんかい): complete recovery of health 全盛(ぜんせい): height of prosperity 全然(ぜんぜん): wholly, entirely, completely, not at all (with neg. verb) 全滅(ぜんめつ): annihilation 完全(かんぜん): perfection, completeness 全て(すべて): all, the whole, entirely, in general, wholly 全員(ぜんいん): all members (unanimity), all hands, the whole crew 全(ぜん): all, whole, entire, complete, overall, pan- 全国(ぜんこく): nation-wide, whole country, national 全集(ぜんしゅう): complete works 全身(ぜんしん): the whole body, full-length (portrait) 全体(ぜんたい): whole, entirety, whatever (is the matter) 全般(ぜんぱん): whole, universal, wholly, general 全く(まったく): really, truly, entirely, completely, wholly, perfectly, indeed 安全(あんぜん): safety 全部(ぜんぶ): all, entire, whole, altogether Kunyomi: まった.く、すべ.て Onyomi: ゼン Lesson: 12 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 全く (まった.く)"	"whole 全 画数6 281 Details Story Dictionary 全 whole Heisig's Wholeness suggests physical and spiritual health, ""having your act together."" "plug Details Story Dictionary 栓 plug Heisig's Here we think of plug in the sense of a cork or stopper used to seal the mouth of a bottle, water faucet, or something with liquid running out of it. Forgetting the abstract picture of the former frame, let us work with all the primitive units: tree . . . umbrella . . . ball. Imagine a tree with a faucet in the side out of which tennis balls are flowing, bouncing all over the ground by the hundreds. You fight your way up to it and shove your giant beach umbrella into the tree to plug it up. Koohii #1 The fat king under his umbrella offers useless advice to the workers. ""You´ll need the whole tree to plug that gap"". Imagine a grossly fat, incompetent king under a parasol giving annoying advice to sweating workers who know what they´re doing. (I always have trouble bringing up the ""whole"" primitive. This story reminds me how to build that part. ). Koohii #2 To plug the hole, you need to use a whole piece of wood - like a cork or something. Primitives plug, tree, wood, whole, umbrella, king, jewel, ball 栓(せん): stopper, cork Kunyomi: Onyomi: セン Lesson: 12 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"	"plug 栓 画数10 282 Details Story Dictionary 栓 plug Heisig's Here we think of plug in the sense of a cork or stopper used to seal the mouth of a bottle, water faucet, or something with liquid running out of it. logic Details Story Dictionary 理 logic Heisig's We first referred to this character back in frame 185, to which you might want to return to have a peek. The image of logic we are given is something like a central jewel in a computer, like the jewels in old clocks that keep them running smoothly. Try to picture yourself making your way through all the rams and roms and approaching this shining jewel, a chorus of voice sand a blast of trumpets in the background heralding the great seat of all-knowing logic. Koohii #1 The king of LOGIC is the computer. Koohii #2 Computers are ruled by logic (it is the king of computers). Primitives logic, king, jewel, ball, computer 義理(ぎり): duty, sense of duty, honor, decency, courtesy, debt of gratitude, social obligation 真理(しんり): truth 推理(すいり): reasoning, inference, mystery or detective genre (movie novel etc.) 生理(せいり): physiology, menses 調理(ちょうり): cooking 理屈(りくつ): theory, reason 理性(りせい): reason, sense 理論(りろん): theory 論理(ろんり): logic 管理(かんり): control, management (e.g. of a business) 原理(げんり): principle, theory, fundamental truth 合理(ごうり): rational 修理(しゅうり): repairing, mending 処理(しょり): processing, dealing with, treatment, disposition, disposal 心理(しんり): mentality 整理(せいり): sorting, arrangement, adjustment, regulation 総理大臣(そうりだいじん): Prime Minister 代理(だいり): representation, agency, proxy, deputy, agent, attorney, substitute, alternate, acting (principal, etc.) 物理(ぶつり): physics 理科(りか): science 理解(りかい): understanding, comprehension 理想(りそう): ideal 地理(ちり): geography, geographical features 無理(むり): compulsion 理由(りゆう): reason 料理(りょうり): cooking, cookery, cuisine Kunyomi: ことわり Onyomi: リ Lesson: 12 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds:	logic 理 画数11 283 Details Story Dictionary 理 logic Heisig's We first referred to this character back in frame 185, to which you might want to return to have a peek.
