In the kanji, too, the character for learning (Frame 616) has nothing to do with the schoolhouse. Koohii #1 In the school house there are kids always studying. (BTW, atomiton, this is NOT 字). Koohii #2 Children in schoolhouses are there to study, nothing else!!! Primitives study, schoolhouse, owl, crown, child 学芸(がくげい): arts and sciences, liberal arts 学士(がくし): university graduate 学説(がくせつ): theory 学歴(がくれき): academic background 休学(きゅうがく): temporary absence from school, suspension 共学(きょうがく): coeducation 工学(こうがく): engineering 考古学(こうこがく): archaeology 高等学校(こうとうがっこう): senior high school 修学(しゅうがく): learning 退学(たいがく): dropping out of school 法学(ほうがく): law, jurisprudence 化学(かがく): chemistry 学(がく): learning, scholarship, erudition, knowledge 学者(がくしゃ): scholar 学習(がくしゅう): study, learning 学術(がくじゅつ): science, learning, scholarship 学年(がくねん): year in school, grade in school 学部(がくぶ): department of a university, undergraduate 学問(がくもん): scholarship, study, learning 学力(がくりょく): scholarship, knowledge, literary ability 学科(がっか): study subject, course of study 学会(がっかい): scientific society, academic meeting 学期(がっき): school term 学級(がっきゅう): grade in school 見学(けんがく): inspection, study by observation, field trip 語学(ごがく): language study 在学(ざいがく): (enrolled) in school 自然科学(しぜんかがく): natural science 社会科学(しゃかいかがく): social science 奨学金(しょうがくきん): scholarship 小学生(しょうがくせい): grade school student 進学(しんがく): going on to university 人文科学(じんぶんかがく): social sciences, humanities 大学院(だいがくいん): graduate school 中学(ちゅうがく): middle school, junior high school 通学(つうがく): commuting to school 哲学(てつがく): philosophy 学ぶ(まなぶ): learn, study (in depth) 留学(りゅうがく): studying abroad 医学(いがく): medical science 科学(かがく): science 小学校(しょうがっこう): primary school 数学(すうがく): mathematics 大学生(だいがくせい): university student 中学校(ちゅうがっこう): junior high school 入学(にゅうがく): enter a school 文学(ぶんがく): literature 学生(がくせい): student 学校(がっこう): school 大学(だいがく): university 留学生(りゅうがくせい): overseas student Kunyomi: まな.ぶ Onyomi: ガク Lesson: 15 Jouyou: 1 JLPT Level: 5 Compounds: 学ぶ (まな.ぶ)
memorize Details Story Dictionary 覚 memorize My Story You'll never memorize all the kanji if I keep seeing with that punk hair cut Koohii #1 In a schoolhouse in class: 1) you see something on the blackboard, then 2) you memorize it. Koohii #2 You´ll never memorize all the kanji by seeing them in a school house. You need Heisig and RtK! Primitives memorize, schoolhouse, owl, crown, see, telescope, eye, human legs 覚え(おぼえ): memory, sense, experience 錯覚(さっかく): optical illusion, hallucination 視覚(しかく): sense of sight, vision 自覚(じかく): self-conscious 聴覚(ちょうかく): the sense of hearing 味覚(みかく): taste, palate, sense of taste 目覚しい(めざましい): brilliant, splendid, striking, remarkable 目覚める(めざめる): to wake up 覚悟(かくご): resolution, resignation, readiness, preparedness 感覚(かんかく): sense, sensation 覚ます(さます): awaken, disabuse, sober up 覚める(さめる): wake, wake up 目覚し(めざまし): alarm clock (abbreviation) 覚える(おぼえる): remember, memorize Kunyomi: おぼ.える、さ.ます、さ.める、さと.る Onyomi: カク Lesson: 15 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 覚える (おぼ.える), 覚ます (さ.ます), 覚める (さ.める)	memorize 覚 画数12 347 Details Story Dictionary 覚 memorize My Story You'll never memorize all the kanji if I keep seeing with that punk hair cut Koohii #1 In a schoolhouse in class: 1) you see something on the blackboard, then 2) you memorize it. flourish Details Story Dictionary 栄 flourish Heisig's The botanical connotations of the word flourish (to bud and burst into bloom, much as a tree does) are part of the ideal of the schoolhouse as well. Koohii #1 The TREES FLOURISH in the CLASSROOM, a little too much perhaps, there´s no room for the students any more. Koohii #2 Students are like young trees. They tend to flourish in the schoolhouse. Primitives flourish, schoolhouse, owl, crown, tree, wood 栄える(さかえる): to prosper, to flourish 繁栄(はんえい): prospering, prosperity, thriving, flourishing 栄養(えいよう): nutrition, nourishment Kunyomi: さか.える、は.え、-ば.え、は.える、え Onyomi: エイ、ヨウ Lesson: 15 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 栄える (さか.える), 栄え (は.え), 栄える (は.える)	flourish 栄 画数9 348 Details Story Dictionary 栄 flourish Heisig's The botanical connotations of the word flourish (to bud and burst into bloom, much as a tree does) are part of the ideal of the schoolhouse as well. write Details Story Dictionary 書 write Heisig's The sage talks rapidly with his tongue wagging in his mouth, while the brush of the scribe runs apace to write down the master 'swords. Koohii #1 Make sure you practice writing kanji with a brush every day before the sun goes down. Koohii #2 The calligrapher had a peculiar habit: when using her brush to write, she would stick out her tongue, just slightly. Primitives write, brush, tongue wagging, sun, day 書き取り(かきとり): dictation 書き取る(かきとる): to write down, to take dictation, to take notes 箇条書き(かじょうがき): itemized form, itemization 願書(がんしょ): written application or petition 原書(げんしょ): original document 書評(しょひょう): book review 聖書(せいしょ): Bible, scriptures 著書(ちょしょ): literary work, book 秘書(ひしょ): (private) secretary 文書(ぶんしょ): document, writing, letter, note, records, archives 書留(かきとめ): writing down, putting on record 教科書(きょうかしょ): text book 下書き(したがき): rough copy, draft 書斎(しょさい): study 書籍(しょせき): book, publication 書店(しょてん): bookstore 書道(しょどう): calligraphy 書物(しょもつ): books 書類(しょるい): documents, official papers 清書(せいしょ): clean copy 投書(とうしょ): letter to the editor, letter from a reader, contribution 読書(どくしょ): reading 図書(としょ): books 書く(かく): write 辞書(じしょ): dictionary, lexicon 図書館(としょかん): library 葉書(はがき): postcard Kunyomi: か.く、-が.き、-がき Onyomi: ショ Lesson: 15 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 5 Compounds: 書く (か.く)	write 書 画数10 349 Details Story Dictionary 書 write Heisig's The sage talks rapidly with his tongue wagging in his mouth, while the brush of the scribe runs apace to write down the master 'swords. haven Details Story Dictionary 津 haven Heisig's Seeing the tiny boats of poor mortals tossed about in a stormy sea like so many corks, the All-Merciful took its brush and drew little inlets of water where the hapless creatures might seek shelter. And so it is that we have havens. Koohii #1 A brush laying in dirty water is a haven for bacteria. Koohii #2 The haven for a BRUSH is in WATER.. Otherwise they get dry and withered and cant be used?! Primitives haven, water, water droplets, water pistol, brush 津波(つなみ): tsunami, tidal wave Kunyomi: つ Onyomi: シン Lesson: 15 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 津 (つ)	haven 津 画数9 350 Details Story Dictionary 津 haven Heisig's Seeing the tiny boats of poor mortals tossed about in a stormy sea like so many corks, the All-Merciful took its brush and drew little inlets of water where the hapless creatures might seek shelter. "breed Details Story Dictionary 牧 breed Heisig's When it is time to breed new cattle, the bull is usually willing but the cow is often not. Thus the taskmaster to the right forces the cow into a compromising position, so to speak, so that she and her mate can breed. Koohii #1 Imagine a taskmaster giving a cow the command to ""start breeding, and start doing it now!"", except that the cow takes his advice a bit too literally and starts chasing the taskmaster to carry out this command! instead of finding another cow to breed with. Hence, you see the taskmaster running to the right, trying to stay ahead of the cow. Koohii #2 Hint: This is the kanji from which taskmaster is derived. Actually, this kanji has nothing to do with breed, and a lot to do with pastures and shepherds (also for cowboys, japanese and spanish don´t differenciate between animals). Think of a cowboy (taskmaster) who brings his cows to the pasture. Primitives breed, cow, taskmaster 牧師(ぼくし): pastor, minister, clergyman 遊牧(ゆうぼく): nomadism 牧場(ぼくじょう): farm (livestock), pasture land, meadow, grazing land 牧畜(ぼくちく): stock-farming Kunyomi: まき Onyomi: ボク Lesson: 15 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 牧 (まき)"	"breed 牧 画数8 351 Details Story Dictionary 牧 breed Heisig's When it is time to breed new cattle, the bull is usually willing but the cow is often not. aggression Details Story Dictionary 攻 aggression Heisig's The special craft of successful taskmasters is their ability to remain constantly on the aggressive, never allowing their underlings a moment to ponder a counter-aggression of their own. Koohii #1 Aggression is the craft of a good dominatrix. Koohii #2 AGGRESSION is a well-honed craft for any decent taskmaster. Primitives aggression, craft, taskmaster 攻め(せめ): attack, offence 攻撃(こうげき): attack, strike, offensive, criticism, censure 攻める(せめる): attack, assault 専攻(せんこう): major subject, special study Kunyomi: せ.める Onyomi: コウ Lesson: 15 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 攻める (せ.める)	aggression 攻 画数7 352 Details Story Dictionary 攻 aggression Heisig's The special craft of successful taskmasters is their ability to remain constantly on the aggressive, never allowing their underlings a moment to ponder a counter-aggression of their own. failure Details Story Dictionary 敗 failure Heisig's The taskmaster is acknowledging the failure of a clam to make the grade in some marine school or other. Koohii #1 If you end up in failure, you give money to the taskmaster to train you. Koohii #2 The shell who was defeated before (defeat (#63)) is being chastised by the taskmaster for his failure to win. Primitives failure, shellfish, clam, oyster, eye, animal legs, eight, taskmaster 一敗(いっぱい): one defeat 敗戦(はいせん): defeat, losing a war 腐敗(ふはい): decay, depravity 勝敗(しょうはい): victory or defeat, issue (of battle) 失敗(しっぱい): failure, fail Kunyomi: やぶ.れる Onyomi: ハイ Lesson: 15 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 敗れる (やぶ.れる)	failure 敗 画数11 353 Details Story Dictionary 敗 failure Heisig's The taskmaster is acknowledging the failure of a clam to make the grade in some marine school or other. a sheet of Details Story Dictionary 枚 a sheet of Heisig's English counts thin, flat objects, like bed linen and paper, in sheets. The kanji does this with a taskmaster whipping a tree into producing sheets against its will. Koohii #1 The taskmaster is a strict bathroom monitor who hands out only one sheet of really rough, splintery toilet paper per person. You can see the wood fibers. Koohii #2 This taskmaster is the bathroom nazi: he counts how many sheets of toilet paper and tissue you use, and then tells you what % of a tree you just killed. Primitives sheet of…, tree, wood, taskmaster 枚(まい): counter for flat objects (e.g. sheets of paper) 枚数(まいすう): the number of flat things Kunyomi: Onyomi: マイ、バイ Lesson: 15 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds:	a sheet of 枚 画数8 354 Details Story Dictionary 枚 a sheet of Heisig's English counts thin, flat objects, like bed linen and paper, in sheets. happenstance / accident Details Story Dictionary 故 happenstance / accident My Story The *director* is so *old*, he keeps having #accidents# on set. Koohii #1 An OLD TASKMASTER is no happenstance (coincidence). The older you get the more rigid in your ways. Koohii #2 Need to disambiguate from enemy (#443) as it´s easy to mix up antique and old here. Let´s think of an accidental president -- he is an old taskmaster who has managed to win the election by happenstance . Primitives happenstance, old, tombstone, gravestone, church, ten, needle, mouth, taskmaster 故(こ): the late (deceased) 故人(こじん): the deceased, old friend 其れ故(それゆえ): therefore, for that reason, so 何故(なぜ): why, how 故郷(こきょう): home town, birthplace, old or historic village 故障(こしょう): breakdown 事故(じこ): accident Kunyomi: ゆえ、ふる.い、もと Onyomi: コ Lesson: 15 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 故 (ゆえ)	happenstance / accident 故 画数9 355 Details Story Dictionary 故 happenstance / accident My Story The *director* is so *old*, he keeps having #accidents# on set. "awe Details Story Dictionary 敬 awe Heisig's Standing in awe of someone, you get self-conscious and may try to speak in flowery phrases out of veneration or fear. The taskmaster at the right is drilling you in the practice of your ""honorifics."" Koohii #1 The flowery phrases of the schoolmaster held the students in awe. Koohii #2 敬 【けい】 (n) reverence; respect. 敬語 【けいご】 (n) honorific; term of respect; (P) STORY: The TASKMASTER demands RESPECT. If you don´t talk to him in HONORIFICS and FLOWERY PHRASES you will be sorry. Primitives awe, flowers, phrase, bound up, mouth, taskmaster 敬具(けいぐ): Sincerely yours 敬う(うやまう): show respect, to honour 敬意(けいい): respect, honour 敬語(けいご): honorific, term of respect 尊敬(そんけい): respect, esteem, reverence, honour Kunyomi: うやま.う Onyomi: ケイ、キョウ Lesson: 15 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 敬う (うやま.う)"	"awe 敬 画数12 356 Details Story Dictionary 敬 awe Heisig's Standing in awe of someone, you get self-conscious and may try to speak in flowery phrases out of veneration or fear. say Details Story Dictionary 言 say Heisig's Of all the things we can do with our mouths, speech is the one that requires the greatest distinctness and clarity. Hence the kanji for say has four little sound-waves, indicating the complexity of the achievement. * This kanji, which appears often as a primitive, can mean saying, speech, or words, depending on which is most useful. Koohii #1 A pictogram of someone saying a four letter word from their mouth after the censors have gotten a hold of it. Koohii #2 This is simple a pictogram of a mouth SAYing something. The lines are soundwaves. No need to complicate it. Primitives say, words, keitai, mouth 言い訳(いいわけ): excuse, explanation 一言(いちげん): single word 片言(かたこと): a smattering, talk like a baby, speak haltingly 予言(かねごと): prediction, promise, prognostication 言論(げんろん): discussion 言伝(ことづて): declaration, hearsay 証言(しょうげん): evidence, testimony 助言(じょげん): advice, suggestion 宣言(せんげん): declaration, proclamation, announcement 断言(だんげん): declaration, affirmation 伝言(つてごと): verbal message, rumor, word 発言(はつげん): utterance, speech, proposal 無言(むごん): silence 言い出す(いいだす): start talking, propose, suggest, break the ice 言い付ける(いいつける): tell, tell on (someone), to order, to charge, to direct 言わば(いわば): so to speak, so to call it, as it were 言語(げんご): language 言付ける(ことづける): send word, send a message 言葉遣い(ことばづかい): speech, expression, wording 一言(ひとこと): single word 独り言(ひとりごと): soliloquy, monologue, speaking to oneself 方言(ほうげん): dialect 言う(いう): to say 言葉(ことば): word(s), phrase, language, speech Kunyomi: い.う、こと Onyomi: ゲン、ゴン Lesson: 15 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds: 言行 (げんこう), 言論 (げんろん), 宣言 (せんげん), 言う (い.う), 言 (こと)	say 言 画数7 357 Details Story Dictionary 言 say Heisig's Of all the things we can do with our mouths, speech is the one that requires the greatest distinctness and clarity. Koohii #1 A pictogram of someone saying a four letter word from their mouth after the censors have gotten a hold of it. Koohii #2 This is simple a pictogram of a mouth SAYing something. The lines are soundwaves. No need to complicate it. Primitives say, words, keitai, mouth 言い訳(いいわけ): excuse, explanation 一言(いちげん): single word 片言(かたこと): a smattering, talk like a baby, speak haltingly 予言(かねごと): prediction, promise, prognostication 言論(げんろん): discussion 言伝(ことづて): declaration, hearsay 証言(しょうげん): evidence, testimony 助言(じょげん): advice, suggestion 宣言(せんげん): declaration, proclamation, announcement 断言(だんげん): declaration, affirmation 伝言(つてごと): verbal message, rumor, word 発言(はつげん): utterance, speech, proposal 無言(むごん): silence 言い出す(いいだす): start talking, propose, suggest, break the ice 言い付ける(いいつける): tell, tell on (someone), to order, to charge, to direct 言わば(いわば): so to speak, so to call it, as it were 言語(げんご): language 言付ける(ことづける): send word, send a message 言葉遣い(ことばづかい): speech, expression, wording 一言(ひとこと): single word 独り言(ひとりごと): soliloquy, monologue, speaking to oneself 方言(ほうげん): dialect 言う(いう): to say 言葉(ことば): word(s), phrase, language, speech Kunyomi: い.う、こと Onyomi: ゲン、ゴン Lesson: 15 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds: 言行 (げんこう), 言論 (げんろん), 宣言 (せんげん), 言う (い.う), 言 (こと)
admonish Details Story Dictionary 警 admonish Heisig's Here you have a perfect example of how an apparently impossible snarl of strokes becomes a snap to learn once you know its elements. The idea of being admonished for something already sets up a superior-inferior relationship between you and the person you are supposed to stand in awe of. While you are restricted to answering in honorifics, the superior can use straightforward and ordinary words. Koohii #1 To admonish is to enforce awe by means of words. Koohii #2 Watch in awe as mom admonishes the rude clerk with words that you´ve never heard her use before. Primitives admonish, awe, flowers, phrase, bound up, mouth, taskmaster, say, words, keitai, mouth, mouth2 警戒(けいかい): warning, admonition, vigilance 警部(けいぶ): police inspector 警告(けいこく): warning, advice 警備(けいび): defense, guard, policing, security 警官(けいかん): policeman 警察(けいさつ): police Kunyomi: いまし.める Onyomi: ケイ Lesson: 15 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds:	admonish 警 画数19 358 Details Story Dictionary 警 admonish Heisig's Here you have a perfect example of how an apparently impossible snarl of strokes becomes a snap to learn once you know its elements. plot Details Story Dictionary 計 plot Heisig's Words and a meter's needle combine to form the sense of plot: to talk over plans and to calculate a course of action. Koohii #1 A plot is a summary of a book that can be given in ten words. Koohii #2 Say-ten´s (satan´s) evil plot. Primitives plot, say, words, keitai, mouth, ten, needle 家計(かけい): household economy, family finances 計器(けいき): meter, gauge 集計(しゅうけい): totalization, aggregate 生計(せいけい): livelihood, living 計る(はかる): to measure, to weigh, to survey, to time (sound gauge estimate) 会計(かいけい): account, finance, accountant, treasurer, paymaster, reckoning, bill 計(けい): plan 計算(けいさん): calculation, reckoning 合計(ごうけい): sum total, total amount 設計(せっけい): plan, design 統計(とうけい): statistics 余計(よけい): too much, unnecessary, abundance, surplus, excess 計画(けいかく): plan 時計(とけい): watch, clock Kunyomi: はか.る、はか.らう Onyomi: ケイ Lesson: 15 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds: 計らう (はか.らう), 計る (はか.る)	plot 計 画数9 359 Details Story Dictionary 計 plot Heisig's Words and a meter's needle combine to form the sense of plot: to talk over plans and to calculate a course of action. elucidate Details Story Dictionary 詮 elucidate Heisig's Think of elucidating as presenting something in whole words, as distinct from broken fragmented sentences. Koohii #1 Words that tell you the results of the whole story really elucidate. Koohii #2 Elucidate me. Tell me, in your own words, the whole story. Primitives elucidate, say, words, keitai, mouth, whole, umbrella, king, jewel, ball Kunyomi: せん.ずる、かい、あき.らか Onyomi: セン Lesson: 15 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: Compounds:	elucidate 詮 画数13 360 Details Story Dictionary 詮 elucidate Heisig's Think of elucidating as presenting something in whole words, as distinct from broken fragmented sentences. prison Details Story Dictionary 獄 prison Heisig's Although we did not make note of it at the time, the kanji for dog is also a low-grade term for a spy. And later (Frame 1517) we will meet another association of criminals with dogs. The prison here depicts a pack of wild dogs (the long-timers and hardened criminals) into which the poor little chihuahua (first offender) has been cast. The only thing he has to protect himself against the pack are his shrill and frightened words. Koohii #1 The wild dog family visits their cousin in prison. They exchange words over the interphone at the visiting booth. Koohii #2 The only thing keeping the new chihuahua inmate from being ´initiated´ by the pack of wild dogs were his quick words in prison. Primitives prison, pack of wild dogs, say, words, keitai, mouth, chihuahua, dog, large, drop 地獄(じごく): hell Kunyomi: Onyomi: ゴク Lesson: 15 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	prison 獄 画数14 361 Details Story Dictionary 獄 prison Heisig's Although we did not make note of it at the time, the kanji for dog is also a low-grade term for a spy. "revise Details Story Dictionary 訂 revise Heisig's After completing the first draft, you revise it by nailing down your words and ""hammering"" them into shape. Koohii #1 Revise, revise and revise until you have all the words nailed down. Koohii #2 Remember how Martin Luther revised the words of the catholic church and nailed his 95 Theses at the door of the church in Wittenberg? Primitives revise, say, words, keitai, mouth, street, nail, spike 改訂(かいてい): revision 訂正(ていせい): correction, revision Kunyomi: Onyomi: テイ Lesson: 15 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"	"revise 訂 画数9 362 Details Story Dictionary 訂 revise Heisig's After completing the first draft, you revise it by nailing down your words and ""hammering"" them into shape. obituary Details Story Dictionary 訃 obituary Heisig's The words of this obituary work like a magic wand, conjuring up the desceased. Koohii #1 Obituary. As a famous man lay dying, the media were already preparing the words of his obituary until a magician, with a wave of his wand, restored the man back to health. Koohii #2 In the Harry Potter world, obituary's are magical. If you wave your wand over them you can hear the person's last words. Creepy! Kunyomi: しらせ Onyomi: フ Lesson: 15 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: Compounds:	obituary 訃 画数9 363 Details Story Dictionary 訃 obituary Heisig's The words of this obituary work like a magic wand, conjuring up the desceased. "chastise Details Story Dictionary 討 chastise Heisig's Words spoken to chastise us stick to us like glue in a way no other words can. Koohii #1 I said some bad words, and my mother chastised me by washing my mouth out with glue instead of soap! Koohii #2 In Colonial New England, people who committed adultery had words glued to them. A famous example is the ""A"" worn by Hester Prynn for committing adultery (i.e., not being chaste). In this way, words glued to you are supposed to chastise you and prevent further breaches of chastity. Primitives chastise, say, words, keitai, mouth, glue 討議(とうぎ): debate, discussion 討論(とうろん): debate, discussion 討つ(うつ): attack, avenge 検討(けんとう): consideration, examination, investigation, study, scrutiny Kunyomi: う.つ Onyomi: トウ Lesson: 15 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 討つ (う.つ)"	"chastise 討 画数10 364 Details Story Dictionary 討 chastise Heisig's Words spoken to chastise us stick to us like glue in a way no other words can. Koohii #2 In Colonial New England, people who committed adultery had words glued to them. A famous example is the ""A"" worn by Hester Prynn for committing adultery (i.e., not being chaste). In this way, words glued to you are supposed to chastise you and prevent further breaches of chastity. Primitives chastise, say, words, keitai, mouth, glue 討議(とうぎ): debate, discussion 討論(とうろん): debate, discussion 討つ(うつ): attack, avenge 検討(けんとう): consideration, examination, investigation, study, scrutiny Kunyomi: う.つ Onyomi: トウ Lesson: 15 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 討つ (う.つ)"
"instruction Details Story Dictionary 訓 instruction Heisig's The personalism connoted by the word instruction, as opposed to ""teaching"" or ""discipline,"" suits the picture here of words guiding one's progress like the gentle flowing of a stream. Even the etymology of the word instruction suggests the sense of ""pouring into"". Koohii #1 The best type of Japanese INSTRUCTION is full immersion, which consists of going to Japan and swimming in the stream of words that surrounds you every day. Koohii #2 Listen carefully to the words of instruction before you try swimming in the river. Primitives instruction, say, words, keitai, mouth, stream, flood 教訓(きょうくん): lesson, precept, moral instruction 訓(くん): native Japanese reading of a Chinese character 訓練(くんれん): practice, training Kunyomi: おし.える、よ.む、くん.ずる Onyomi: クン、キン Lesson: 15 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds:"	"instruction 訓 画数10 365 Details Story Dictionary 訓 instruction Heisig's The personalism connoted by the word instruction, as opposed to ""teaching"" or ""discipline,"" suits the picture here of words guiding one's progress like the gentle flowing of a stream. Even the etymology of the word instruction suggests the sense of ""pouring into"". Koohii #1 The best type of Japanese INSTRUCTION is full immersion, which consists of going to Japan and swimming in the stream of words that surrounds you every day. Koohii #2 Listen carefully to the words of instruction before you try swimming in the river. Primitives instruction, say, words, keitai, mouth, stream, flood 教訓(きょうくん): lesson, precept, moral instruction 訓(くん): native Japanese reading of a Chinese character 訓練(くんれん): practice, training Kunyomi: おし.える、よ.む、くん.ずる Onyomi: クン、キン Lesson: 15 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds:"
"imperial edict Details Story Dictionary 詔 imperial edict Heisig's The imperial edict, spoken with the force of unquestionable law, is made up of words intended to seduce the masses - be it through fear or respect - to follow obediently. Koohii #1 The mnemonic ""words to seduce the masses"" was just too vague and I kept forgetting it. So now instead I picture a seductive female reading aloud the imperial edict to the masses, thus ""seducing"" the masses. Koohii #2 The emperor did not need an imperial edict; his words were more than enough to seduce Anakin to the dark side. Primitives imperial edict, say, words, keitai, mouth, summon, seduce, sword, dagger, mouth, mouth2 Kunyomi: みことのり Onyomi: ショウ Lesson: 15 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 詔 (みことのり)"	"imperial edict 詔 画数12 366 Details Story Dictionary 詔 imperial edict Heisig's The imperial edict, spoken with the force of unquestionable law, is made up of words intended to seduce the masses - be it through fear or respect - to follow obediently. "packed Details Story Dictionary 詰 packed Heisig's A piece of writing that is pregnant with meaning and needs to be reread several times to be understood we refer to colloquially as ""packed."" The character sees the words as sealed tightly inside an aerosol can. Koohii #1 WORDS of GOOD LUCK are PACKED into fortune cookies. Koohii #2 Nowadays, grafitti comes pre-packaged. The factory takes a bunch of words and aerosol cans and then makes sure the words get tightly packed inside. All you have to do is spray and everything takes care of itself! Primitives packed, say, words, keitai, mouth, aerosol, good luck, samurai, mouth, mouth2 詰らない(つまらない): insignificant, boring, trifling 詰まり(つまり): in short, in brief, in other words, that is to say, in the long run, after all, blockade, stuffing, ultimate 詰る(なじる): to rebuke, to scold, to tell off 缶詰(かんづめ): canning, canned goods, tin can 詰まる(つまる): be blocked, be packed 詰める(つめる): pack, shorten, work out (details) 瓶詰(びんづめ): bottling, bottled Kunyomi: つ.める、つ.め、-づ.め、つ.まる、つ.む Onyomi: キツ、キチ Lesson: 15 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 詰まる (つ.まる), 詰む (つ.む), 詰める (つ.める)"	"packed 詰 画数13 367 Details Story Dictionary 詰 packed Heisig's A piece of writing that is pregnant with meaning and needs to be reread several times to be understood we refer to colloquially as ""packed."" The character sees the words as sealed tightly inside an aerosol can. Koohii #1 WORDS of GOOD LUCK are PACKED into fortune cookies. Koohii #2 Nowadays, grafitti comes pre-packaged. The factory takes a bunch of words and aerosol cans and then makes sure the words get tightly packed inside. All you have to do is spray and everything takes care of itself! "tale Details Story Dictionary 話 tale Heisig's That the words of the tongue should come to mean a tale is clear from the etymology: a tale is something ""talked,"" not something read from a book. Koohii #1 Tales are always spoken, not written, and because of this, words fly out of your tongue, rather than your pen. Koohii #2 Tales are spoken words, passed on from person to person, eventually being spoken by a thousand mouths. Primitives tale, say, words, keitai, mouth, tongue, thousand, mouth, mouth2 対話(たいわ): interactive, interaction, conversation, dialogue 話し合い(はなしあい): discussion, conference 受話器(じゅわき): telephone receiver 神話(しんわ): myth, legend 童話(どうわ): fairy-tale 話し合う(はなしあう): discuss, talk together 話し掛ける(はなしかける): accost a person, talk (to someone) 話中(はなしちゅう): while talking, the line is busy 話題(わだい): topic, subject 会話(かいわ): conversation 世話(せわ): take care of 電話(でんわ): telephone 話(はなし): talk, speech, chat, story, conversation 話す(はなす): speak Kunyomi: はな.す、はなし Onyomi: ワ Lesson: 15 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 5 Compounds: 話す (はな.す), 話 (はなし)"	"tale 話 画数13 368 Details Story Dictionary 話 tale Heisig's That the words of the tongue should come to mean a tale is clear from the etymology: a tale is something ""talked,"" not something read from a book. Koohii #2 Tales are spoken words, passed on from person to person, eventually being spoken by a thousand mouths. recitation Details Story Dictionary 詠 recitation Heisig's Listening to the words of poets reciting their poetry is like being transported for a moment into eternity where the rules of everyday life have been suspended. Koohii #1 Listening to the words in a recitation of Vogon poetry is worse than spending an eternity in hell. [Note: I assume those 2 reports are to warn against possible confusion with poem (#346) but how can you confuse Vogon poetry with an actual poem? Anyway, it´s the next frame, so it should be easy to keep them straight... Or maybe there´s a kanji for Vogon in RTK3?]. Koohii #2 If you study some words for a recitation, there is a good chance they will be stuck in your memory for all eternity. poem Details Story Dictionary 詩 poem Heisig's Since silence is treasured so highly at a Buddhist temple the words spoken there must be well-chosen. Perhaps this is why the records of the monks often read to us like poems. Before going on, back up a frame and make sure you have kept poem and recitation distinct in your mind. Koohii #1 A poem is a temple of words. Koohii #2 WORDS used in a TEMPLE must be very well chosen. That´s why most people will speak using a poem if they are SAYING something in a TEMPLE. Primitives poem, say, words, keitai, mouth, Buddhist temple, soil, dirt, ground, glue 詩(し): poem, verse of poetry 詩人(しじん): poet Kunyomi: うた Onyomi: シ Lesson: 15 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	poem 詩 画数13 370 Details Story Dictionary 詩 poem Heisig's Since silence is treasured so highly at a Buddhist temple the words spoken there must be well-chosen. Perhaps this is why the records of the monks often read to us like poems. Before going on, back up a frame and make sure you have kept poem and recitation distinct in your mind. Koohii #1 A poem is a temple of words. Koohii #2 WORDS used in a TEMPLE must be very well chosen. That´s why most people will speak using a poem if they are SAYING something in a TEMPLE. Primitives poem, say, words, keitai, mouth, Buddhist temple, soil, dirt, ground, glue 詩(し): poem, verse of poetry 詩人(しじん): poet Kunyomi: うた Onyomi: シ Lesson: 15 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:
word Details Story Dictionary 語 word Heisig's Whereas the character for say focused on the actual talking, that for words stresses the fact that although it is I who say them, the words of a language are not my own. You can see the clear distinction between I and words just by looking at the kanji. Koohii #1 The simplest word to say is I. Koohii #2 May I say a word about that? Primitives word, say, words, keitai, mouth, I, five, mouth, mouth2 漢語(かんご): Chinese word, Sino-Japanese word 語彙(ごい): vocabulary, glossary 語句(ごく): words, phrases 語源(ごげん): word root, word derivation, etymology 標語(ひょうご): motto, slogan, catchword 文語(ぶんご): written language, literary language 略語(りゃくご): abbreviation, acronym 語る(かたる): talk, tell, recite 敬語(けいご): honorific, term of respect 言語(げんご): language 語(ご): language, word 語学(ごがく): language study 国語(こくご): national language 熟語(じゅくご): idiom, idiomatic phrase, kanji compound 主語(しゅご): (grammar) subject 述語(じゅつご): predicate 単語(たんご): word, vocabulary, (usually) single-character word 物語(ものがたり): tale, story, legend 物語る(ものがたる): tell, indicate 用語(ようご): term, terminology 英語(えいご): the English language Kunyomi: かた.る、かた.らう Onyomi: ゴ Lesson: 15 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 5 Compounds: 語らう (かた.らう), 語る (かた.る)	word 語 画数14 371 Details Story Dictionary 語 word Heisig's Whereas the character for say focused on the actual talking, that for words stresses the fact that although it is I who say them, the words of a language are not my own. You can see the clear distinction between I and words just by looking at the kanji. Koohii #1 The simplest word to say is I. Koohii #2 May I say a word about that? Primitives word, say, words, keitai, mouth, I, five, mouth, mouth2 漢語(かんご): Chinese word, Sino-Japanese word 語彙(ごい): vocabulary, glossary 語句(ごく): words, phrases 語源(ごげん): word root, word derivation, etymology 標語(ひょうご): motto, slogan, catchword 文語(ぶんご): written language, literary language 略語(りゃくご): abbreviation, acronym 語る(かたる): talk, tell, recite 敬語(けいご): honorific, term of respect 言語(げんご): language 語(ご): language, word 語学(ごがく): language study 国語(こくご): national language 熟語(じゅくご): idiom, idiomatic phrase, kanji compound 主語(しゅご): (grammar) subject 述語(じゅつご): predicate 単語(たんご): word, vocabulary, (usually) single-character word 物語(ものがたり): tale, story, legend 物語る(ものがたる): tell, indicate 用語(ようご): term, terminology 英語(えいご): the English language Kunyomi: かた.る、かた.らう Onyomi: ゴ Lesson: 15 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 5 Compounds: 語らう (かた.らう), 語る (かた.る)
read Details Story Dictionary 読 read Heisig's In the age of advertising, most words we read are out to sell some product or point of view. Koohii #1 Read the WORDS used to SELL things. Koohii #2 People will say (言) almost anything to make a sale (売); don´t believe everything you read (読). Primitives read, say, words, keitai, mouth, sell, sale, samurai, paper punch, Miss World, crown, human legs 購読(こうどく): subscription (e.g. magazine) 講読(こうどく): reading, translation 読者(どくしゃ): reader 読み上げる(よみあげる): to read out loud (and clearly), to call a roll 朗読(ろうどく): reading aloud, recitation 句読点(くとうてん): punctuation marks 読書(どくしょ): reading 読み(よみ): reading 読む(よむ): read Kunyomi: よ.む、-よ.み Onyomi: ドク、トク、トウ Lesson: 15 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 5 Compounds: 読書 (どくしょ), 音読 (おんどく), 購読 (こうどく), 読本 (どくほん), 読む (よ.む)	read 読 画数14 372 Details Story Dictionary 読 read Heisig's In the age of advertising, most words we read are out to sell some product or point of view. tune Details Story Dictionary 調 tune Heisig's A complete tune is composed not only of a succession of notes but also of one lap of the words that go with it. Koohii #1 To tune an old-fashioned radio, you turn the dial the full range of the circumference, until you can clearly hear what´s being said. Koohii #2 words + circumference The most catchy tunes are words the go round and round the circuference of your head and you can´t get it out of your mind. Primitives tune, say, words, keitai, mouth, circumference, running track, soil, dirt, ground, mouth, mouth2 協調(きょうちょう): co-operation, conciliation, harmony, firm (market) tone 好調(こうちょう): favourable, promising, satisfactory, in good shape 下調べ(したしらべ): preliminary investigation, preparation 失調(しっちょう): lack of harmony 調べ(しらべ): preparation, investigation, inspection 単調(たんちょう): monotony, monotone, dullness 調印(ちょういん): signature, sign, sealing 調停(ちょうてい): arbitration, conciliation, mediation 調理(ちょうり): cooking 調和(ちょうわ): harmony 同調(どうちょう): sympathy, agree with, alignment, tuning 取り調べる(とりしらべる): to investigate, to examine 不調(ふちょう): bad condition, not to work out (ie a deal), disagreement, break-off, disorder, slump, out of form 強調(きょうちょう): emphasis, stress, stressed point 順調(じゅんちょう): favourable, doing well, O.K., all right 調査(ちょうさ): investigation, examination, inquiry, survey 調子(ちょうし): tune, tone, key, pitch, time, rhythm, vein, mood, way, manner, style, knack, condition, state of health, strain, impetus, spur of the moment, trend 調整(ちょうせい): regulation, adjustment, tuning 調節(ちょうせつ): regulation, adjustment, control 調味料(ちょうみりょう): condiment, seasoning 調べる(しらべる): investigate Kunyomi: しら.べる、しら.べ、ととの.う、ととの.える Onyomi: チョウ Lesson: 15 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 調べる (しら.べる), 調う (ととの.う), 調える (ととの.える)	tune 調 画数15 373 Details Story Dictionary 調 tune Heisig's A complete tune is composed not only of a succession of notes but also of one lap of the words that go with it. discuss Details Story Dictionary 談 discuss My Story [Say/Word + Flame {炎}] I hate to DISCUSS religion or politics because people's *WORDS* always become *INFLAMED*. Koohii #1 Think of an online discussion group where misunderstanding someone´s words leads to flaming. An angry discussion = inflamed words. Koohii #2 Internet discussions often involve inflammatory words. Flame war! "consent Details Story Dictionary 諾 consent Heisig's The words of the young do not have legal validity unless backed up by ""parental consent."" Koohii #1 The words of the very young are useless without CONSENT from their elders. Koohii #2 Delores might say, ""Yes!"", but she´s way too young give any legal consent. "rebuke Details Story Dictionary 諭 rebuke Heisig's The stern tone of a rebuke is seen here in the image of words spoken at a meeting of butchers (See frame 307) waving their choppers at one another and ""cutting one another down"" as only butchers can. Koohii #1 A PETA activist speaks at a meeting of butchers to rebuke them. Koohii #2 I imagine Socrates gate-crashing a meeting of butchers and REBUKING them: ´You´ve been killing things again; you have, haven´t you?´ while the embarrassed butchers blush and try to hide their knives behind their backs and stand in front of hanging sides of beef. Primitives rebuke, say, words, keitai, mouth, meeting of butchers, moon, month, flesh, part of the body, sword, sabre, saber Kunyomi: さと.す Onyomi: ユ Lesson: 15 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 諭す (さと.す)"	"rebuke 諭 画数16 376 Details Story Dictionary 諭 rebuke Heisig's The stern tone of a rebuke is seen here in the image of words spoken at a meeting of butchers (See frame 307) waving their choppers at one another and ""cutting one another down"" as only butchers can. "style Details Story Dictionary 式 style Heisig's Take style in its sense of some fashion design or model. Then let the element arrow and craft stand for the well-known style of shirts known as ""Arrow shirts"" because of the little arrow sewn on each one. Koohii #1 Each Indian tribe crafts their arrows in a certain style.. Koohii #2 The latest style is shirts crafted out of arrows. test Details Story Dictionary 試 test My Story [Speaking {言} + style {式}] The Japanese oral exam was a #test# of my *speaking* *style*. The test focused on *speaking* and writing *style* (ceremony) Koohii #1 In an essay test, you are judged on both your choice of words and your writing style. Koohii #2 The Japanese oral exam was a test of my speaking style. II (two) Details Story Dictionary 弐 II (two) Heisig's We use the Roman numeral II here to stress that this kanji is an older form of the kanji for two. Think of two arrows in a quiver, standing up like the numeral II. Koohii #1 II (older form of writing 2). After shooting one arrow (the dash top left), I have 2 arrows left in my quiver (bottom left). Koohii #2 Once you have two old arrows left in your quiver, you better start running...! Primitives II, two, arrows, quiver Kunyomi: ふた.つ、そえ Onyomi: ニ、ジ Lesson: 16 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	II (two) 弐 画数6 379 Details Story Dictionary 弐 II (two) Heisig's We use the Roman numeral II here to stress that this kanji is an older form of the kanji for two. "range Details Story Dictionary 域 range Heisig's From its original meaning of a defined area or zone, a range has also come to mean a grazing land where cowboys roam and do whatever it is they do with cows. When the herds have all been driven to market, there is a great homecoming fiesta like that pictured here. As soon as the cowboys come home, home on the range, the first thing they do is kiss the ground (the mouth on the floor), and then get on with the fiesta. Koohii #1 An astronaut lands back at the launch range, kisses the earth beneath him with his mouth, then heads off to a fiesta to celebrate a safe flight. Koohii #2 Instead of Heisig´s ""Fiesta"" I use ""Spear"". Why? A spear is just a DROP extra on an Arrow. 域, range actually means range as in limits/boundary/border sort of range(In a box it was the old meaning for Country國 (581). Ok way too much etymology here, but back to story. With your SPEAR standing in a HOLE on the FLOOR with SOIL to its left9as you dug some out), you can see the RANGE of the spear in attacking a possible enemy (re Diablo and other RPGs, spear´s have range). Primitives range, soil, dirt, ground, pope, fiesta, mouth, one, floor 域外(いきがい): outside the area 領域(りょういき): area, domain, territory, field, region, regime 区域(くいき): limits, boundary, domain, zone, sphere, territory 地域(ちいき): area, region 流域(りゅういき): (river) basin Kunyomi: Onyomi: イキ Lesson: 16 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds:"	"range 域 画数11 380 Details Story Dictionary 域 range Heisig's From its original meaning of a defined area or zone, a range has also come to mean a grazing land where cowboys roam and do whatever it is they do with cows. burglar Details Story Dictionary 賊 burglar Heisig's From a burglar's point of view, a fiesta is an occasion to takeout the old lock picking needle and break into the unattended safe filled with the family shells (the old form of money, as we saw in frames 84 and 206). Koohii #1 Burglars... those guys!!! Burglars only want money (clams) so that they can get needles (drugs) and party (fiesta)! Koohii #2 After the fiesta, we found out that some burglar had stolen our money, probably breaking in with a lockpick needle... Primitives burglar, shellfish, clam, oyster, eye, animal legs, eight, ten, needle, fiesta Kunyomi: Onyomi: ゾク Lesson: 16 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	burglar 賊 画数13 381 Details Story Dictionary 賊 burglar Heisig's From a burglar's point of view, a fiesta is an occasion to takeout the old lock picking needle and break into the unattended safe filled with the family shells (the old form of money, as we saw in frames 84 and 206). plantation Details Story Dictionary 栽 plantation Heisig's On a fruit plantation it is the trees that one is particularly grateful for at the time of Thanksgiving. Imagine yourself inviting a few representative trees from the fields and orchards to join you around the table to give thanks. Koohii #1 The plantation is where we get our Christmas trees. We pick them out at Thanksgiving to be sure we get a good one. Koohii #2 During Thanksgiving, all the trees on the plantation celebrate the harvest. It´s a good time for them, too. Primitives plantation, Thanksgiving, harvest festival, ten, needle, fiesta, tree, wood 栽培(さいばい): cultivation Kunyomi: Onyomi: サイ Lesson: 16 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	plantation 栽 画数10 382 Details Story Dictionary 栽 plantation Heisig's On a fruit plantation it is the trees that one is particularly grateful for at the time of Thanksgiving. load Details Story Dictionary 載 load Heisig's One loads bales on a wagon or cart in preparation for the great Hay Ride that follows the Thanksgiving dinner each year. Koohii #1 After eating a big Thanksgiving dinner, you have to be careful in the car ride home not to drop a load in your pants. Koohii #2 After ´Thanksgiving´ dinner, my girlfriend gave me a BJ on the drive back home. I blew my ´load´ and ´soiled´ the ´car´. But it was LOADS of fun! Please report this story if this makes you feel uncomfortable :). Primitives load, Thanksgiving, harvest festival, ten, needle, fiesta, car, vehicle 記載(きさい): mention, entry 掲載(けいさい): appearance (e.g. article in paper) 載せる(のせる): to place on (something), to take on board, to give a ride, to let (one) take part, to impose on, to record, to mention, to load (luggage), to publish, to run (an ad) 載る(のる): get on, ride in, board, mount, get up on, be taken in, share in, join, be found in (a dictionary), feel like doing, be mentioned in, be in harmony with, appear (in print), be recorded Kunyomi: の.せる、の.る Onyomi: サイ Lesson: 16 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 載せる (の.せる), 載る (の.る)	load 載 画数13 383 Details Story Dictionary 載 load Heisig's One loads bales on a wagon or cart in preparation for the great Hay Ride that follows the Thanksgiving dinner each year. Koohii #2 After ´Thanksgiving´ dinner, my girlfriend gave me a BJ on the drive back home. I blew my ´load´ and ´soiled´ the ´car´. But it was LOADS of fun! Please report this story if this makes you feel uncomfortable :). Primitives load, Thanksgiving, harvest festival, ten, needle, fiesta, car, vehicle 記載(きさい): mention, entry 掲載(けいさい): appearance (e.g. article in paper) 載せる(のせる): to place on (something), to take on board, to give a ride, to let (one) take part, to impose on, to record, to mention, to load (luggage), to publish, to run (an ad) 載る(のる): get on, ride in, board, mount, get up on, be taken in, share in, join, be found in (a dictionary), feel like doing, be mentioned in, be in harmony with, appear (in print), be recorded Kunyomi: の.せる、の.る Onyomi: サイ Lesson: 16 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 載せる (の.せる), 載る (の.る)
overgrown Details Story Dictionary 茂 overgrown Heisig's The sense of the key word overgrown is of something growing luxuriously, though not necessarily in excess - in this case a whole parade of weeds (outcast flowers). By way of exception, the flowers take their normal place over the enclosure. Koohii #1 The gay parade looks astonishing, as if overgrown with flowers. Koohii #2 When your garden gets OVERGROWN, it´s like the plants are mocking you. Here, you can see the roses actually parading around the yard, wilfully choking out the other, more docile plants. Then they actually go and parade down the street! Primitives overgrown, flowers, parade 茂る(しげる): grow thick, luxuriate, be luxurious Kunyomi: しげ.る Onyomi: モ Lesson: 16 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 茂る (しげ.る)	overgrown 茂 画数8 384 Details Story Dictionary 茂 overgrown Heisig's The sense of the key word overgrown is of something growing luxuriously, though not necessarily in excess - in this case a whole parade of weeds (outcast flowers). By way of exception, the flowers take their normal place over the enclosure. Koohii #1 The gay parade looks astonishing, as if overgrown with flowers. Koohii #2 When your garden gets OVERGROWN, it´s like the plants are mocking you. Here, you can see the roses actually parading around the yard, wilfully choking out the other, more docile plants. Then they actually go and parade down the street! "relatives Details Story Dictionary 戚 relatives Heisig's If you think of a parade of particularly disagreeable relatives, it should not be hard to imagine them as large bodies with little pea-brains above. Koohii #1 Your half-uncle is leading a parade of your relatives. (Note: 上 + 小 makes up part of ""uncle"" 叔, so I´ve called it ""half-uncle"".). Koohii #2 Your uncle organizes a parade of all your relatives, which he himself is only half in because he´s busy taking pictures of it. Primitives relatives, half-uncle, above, small, little, parade 親戚(しんせき): relative Kunyomi: いた.む、うれ.える、みうち Onyomi: ソク、セキ Lesson: 17 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: Compounds:"	"relatives 戚 画数11 385 Details Story Dictionary 戚 relatives Heisig's If you think of a parade of particularly disagreeable relatives, it should not be hard to imagine them as large bodies with little pea-brains above. "turn into Details Story Dictionary 成 turn into Heisig's Let the phrase ""turn into"" suggest some sort of a magical change. What happens here is that the parade marching down main street turns into a dagger-throwing bout between competing bands. Note how only one stroke has to be added to make the change. Koohii #1 It only takes a single stroke of a dagger for a parade to TURN INTO a bloodbath. Koohii #2 The gay parade suddenly TURNED INTO a DAGGER throwing fight. Primitives turn into, parade, sword, dagger 行き成り(いきなり): suddenly 育成(いくせい): rearing, training, nurture, cultivation, promotion 可成(かなり): considerably, fairly, quite 形成(けいせい): formation 結成(けっせい): formation 合成(ごうせい): synthesis, composition, synthetic, composite, mixed, combined, compound 成果(せいか): results, fruits 成熟(せいじゅく): maturity, ripeness 成年(せいねん): majority, adult age 達成(たっせい): achievement 成り立つ(なりたつ): to conclude, to consist of, to be practical (logical feasible viable), to hold true 成る(なる): become 成る丈(なるたけ): as much as possible, if possible 成るべく(なるべく): as much as possible 持て成す(もてなす): to entertain, to make welcome 養成(ようせい): training, development 完成(かんせい): complete, completion, perfection, accomplishment 構成(こうせい): organization, composition 作成(さくせい): frame, draw up, make, producing, creating, preparing, writing, 賛成(さんせい): approval, agreement, support, favour 成功(せいこう): success, hit 成人(せいじん): adult 成績(せいせき): results, record 成長(せいちょう): growth, grow to adulthood 成分(せいぶん): ingredient, component, composition 成立(せいりつ): coming into existence, arrangements, establishment, completion Kunyomi: な.る、な.す、-な.す Onyomi: セイ、ジョウ Lesson: 16 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 成功 (せいこう), 完成 (かんせい), 賛成 (さんせい), 成す (な.す), 成る (な.る)"	"turn into 成 画数6 386 Details Story Dictionary 成 turn into Heisig's Let the phrase ""turn into"" suggest some sort of a magical change. castle Details Story Dictionary 城 castle My Story Bruh, If *Jesus* can do anything, then he can *become* a castle. (you gotta stop doing drugs, man) Koohii #1 The sand castle is just the soil (#150) that turns into a castle. Koohii #2 Someday this mound of dirt here will turn into our CASTLE, the ants think to themselves when scoping out a new ant hill. sincerity Details Story Dictionary 誠 sincerity Heisig's The sure sign of sincerity is that one's mere words are turned into deeds. Koohii #1 Sincerity happens when what you say actually turns into something. Koohii #2 Sincerity is turning your words into actions. Primitives sincerity, say, words, keitai, mouth, turn into, sword, dagger, parade 誠実(せいじつ): sincere, honest, faithful 誠(まこと): truth, faith, fidelity, sincerity, trust, confidence, reliance, devotion Kunyomi: まこと Onyomi: セイ Lesson: 16 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 誠 (まこと)	sincerity 誠 画数13 388 Details Story Dictionary 誠 sincerity Heisig's The sure sign of sincerity is that one's mere words are turned into deeds. "intimidate Details Story Dictionary 威 intimidate Heisig's Here we see a march of women demonstrating on behalf of equal rights, something extremely intimidating to the male chauvinist population. Koohii #1 The march of women - against intimidation in the workplace - is pretty intimidating in itself! Koohii #2 Interesting that this kanji also has the meanings of ""dignity"" and ""threaten."" I can see how a march of women in Japan would be seen as intimidating by most men. Primitives intimidate, march, women, woman 威力(いりょく): power, might, authority, influence 権威(けんい): authority, power, influence 威張る(いばる): swagger, be proud Kunyomi: おど.す、おど.し、おど.かす Onyomi: イ Lesson: 16 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"	"intimidate 威 画数9 389 Details Story Dictionary 威 intimidate Heisig's Here we see a march of women demonstrating on behalf of equal rights, something extremely intimidating to the male chauvinist population. "destroy Details Story Dictionary 滅 destroy Heisig's Picture a march of flames demonstrating against the Fire Department for their right to destroy, but being doused with water by the police riot squads. Koohii #1 Water flows down to destroy the march of fire. Koohii #2 Use a water cannon to destroy a line of marching fire monsters. I keep mixing this one up with disaster (#167) and demolition (#400). Remember, you DESTROY monsters (think of the Godzilla movie ""Destroy All Monsters!""). Fires and floods are natural DISASTERs. And DEMOLITION is something you carefully do while wearing protective garments. (vaguely based on stefanot´s balrog story). Primitives destroy, water, water droplets, water pistol, march, fire 全滅(ぜんめつ): annihilation 滅びる(ほろびる): to be ruined, to go under, to perish, to be destroyed 滅ぼす(ほろぼす): to destroy, to overthrow, to wreck, to ruin 滅茶苦茶(めちゃくちゃ): absurd, unreasonable, excessive, messed up, spoiled, wreaked 滅亡(めつぼう): downfall, ruin, collapse, destruction 絶滅(ぜつめつ): destruction, extinction 滅多に(めったに): rarely (with negative verb), seldom Kunyomi: ほろ.びる、ほろ.ぶ、ほろ.ぼす Onyomi: メツ Lesson: 16 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 滅びる (ほろ.びる), 滅ぼす (ほろ.ぼす)"	"destroy 滅 画数13 390 Details Story Dictionary 滅 destroy Heisig's Picture a march of flames demonstrating against the Fire Department for their right to destroy, but being doused with water by the police riot squads. dwindle Details Story Dictionary 減 dwindle Heisig's A group of unquenchable mouths sets out on a march across the country, drinking water wherever they find it until the water supply has dwindled to a trickle, triggering a national disaster. Koohii #1 When WATER was tossed on the PROTESTORS (a march of mouths), the numbers began to DWINDLE. Koohii #2 When water supplies dwindled, the population became a horde of dry mouths, marching to seize the water in the neighboring kingdom. Primitives dwindle, water, water droplets, water pistol, march, mouth いい加減(いいかげん): moderate, right, random, not thorough, vague, irresponsible, halfhearted 軽減(けいげん): abatement 減少(げんしょう): decrease, reduction, decline 減点(げんてん): subtract, give a demerit 削減(さくげん): cut, reduction, curtailment 加減(かげん): addition and subtraction, degree, extent, measure, chance 増減(ぞうげん): increase and decrease, fluctuation 減らす(へらす): abate, decrease, diminish, shorten 減る(へる): decrease (in size or number), diminish, abate Kunyomi: へ.る、へ.らす Onyomi: ゲン Lesson: 16 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 減らす (へ.らす), 減る (へ.る)	dwindle 減 画数12 391 Details Story Dictionary 減 dwindle Heisig's A group of unquenchable mouths sets out on a march across the country, drinking water wherever they find it until the water supply has dwindled to a trickle, triggering a national disaster. revile Details Story Dictionary 蔑 revile Heisig's The verbal abuse involved in reviling those who do not deserve it can be compared to a march of flowers in full boom having an eyeball of nastiness cast over them (literally, of course). Koohii #1 They gays were reviled by society, so they put flowers above their eyes and marched around. Koohii #2 In Northern Ireland, bitter religious groups revile their opponents by marching defiantly under their very eye, holding flowers that symbolize their beliefs. Primitives revile, flowers, eye, cross-eyed, net, march 軽蔑(けいべつ): scorn, disdain Kunyomi: ないがしろ、なみ.する、くらい、さげす.む Onyomi: ベツ Lesson: 17 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: Compounds: 蔑む (さげす.む)	revile 蔑 画数14 392 Details Story Dictionary 蔑 revile Heisig's The verbal abuse involved in reviling those who do not deserve it can be compared to a march of flowers in full boom having an eyeball of nastiness cast over them (literally, of course). scaffold Details Story Dictionary 桟 scaffold Heisig's Prior to the use of metal, trees were once cut down and bound together for use as scaffolding material. In the case of this kanji, what is being constructed is not a skyscraper but a simple float. Koohii #1 Japanese festival floats are often so tall they need wood scaffolds to be completed. (http://www.japan-guide.com/e/e5909.html). Koohii #2 You need a SCAFFOLD made of WOOD to build a FLOAT if it will be several stories high. Primitives scaffold, tree, wood, float, fiesta 桟橋(さんきょう): wharf, bridge, jetty, pier Kunyomi: かけはし Onyomi: サン、セン Lesson: 16 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	scaffold 桟 画数10 393 Details Story Dictionary 桟 scaffold Heisig's Prior to the use of metal, trees were once cut down and bound together for use as scaffolding material. coin Details Story Dictionary 銭 coin Heisig's Those special gold-colored tokens minted each year for the Mardi Gras and thrown into the crowds from people on the floats give us the kanji for coins. Koohii #1 Political hopefuls in Rome threw gold COINS from floats when they were campaigning for office. Koohii #2 Interesting fact: The Japanese one yen coin is the only coin in the world that can float on water. http://www.hanamiweb.com/floatingyen.jpg. Primitives coin, metal, gold, float, fiesta 小銭(こぜに): coins, small change 金銭(きんせん): money, cash Kunyomi: ぜに、すき Onyomi: セン、ゼン Lesson: 16 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 銭 (ぜに)	coin 銭 画数14 394 Details Story Dictionary 銭 coin Heisig's Those special gold-colored tokens minted each year for the Mardi Gras and thrown into the crowds from people on the floats give us the kanji for coins. Koohii #2 Interesting fact: The Japanese one yen coin is the only coin in the world that can float on water. http://www.hanamiweb.com/floatingyen.jpg. shallow Details Story Dictionary 浅 shallow Heisig's An entourage of floats going from one town to the next must always seek a shallow place to cross the water. Try to picture what happens if they don't. Koohii #1 The water can´t be too SHALLOW if you expect to float. Koohii #2 The water isn´t shallow enough to ford (#372). We´ll have to cross by float! Primitives shallow, water, water droplets, water pistol, float, fiesta 浅ましい(あさましい): wretched, miserable, shameful, mean, despicable, abject 浅い(あさい): shallow, superficial Kunyomi: あさ.い Onyomi: セン Lesson: 16 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 浅い (あさ.い)	shallow 浅 画数9 395 Details Story Dictionary 浅 shallow Heisig's An entourage of floats going from one town to the next must always seek a shallow place to cross the water. Try to picture what happens if they don't. Koohii #1 The water can´t be too SHALLOW if you expect to float. Koohii #2 The water isn´t shallow enough to ford (#372). We´ll have to cross by float! stop Details Story Dictionary 止 stop Heisig's The character for stop is easiest to learn as a pictograph, though you have to take a moment to see it. Take it as a rather crude drawing of a footprint: the first 3 strokes represent the front of the foot and the last the heel. The big toe (stroke 2 sticking out to the right) on the right indicates that this is a left foot. * Although the meaning of stop will be retained, we will return often to the pictographic meaning of footprint. Koohii #1 If you find in the ground a walking stick with a magic wand, STOP! Maybe it´s some kind of macumba/black magic/voodoo bad thing. Koohii #2 If you don´t remember this one from the 10,000,000 STOP signs on roads all over Japan, you´re beyyond help! Primitives stop, footprint 受け止める(うけとめる): to catch, to stop the blow, to react to, to take 静止(せいし): stillness, repose, standing still 阻止(そし): obstruction, check, hindrance, prevention, interdiction 止まる(とどまる): to be limited to 止める(とどめる): to stop, to cease, to put an end to 廃止(はいし): abolition, repeal 止むを得ない(やむをえない): cannot be helped, unavoidable 呼び止める(よびとめる): to challenge, to call somebody to halt 禁止(きんし): prohibition, ban 立ち止まる(たちどまる): stop, halt, stand still 中止(ちゅうし): suspension, stoppage, discontinuance, interruption 停止(ていし): suspension, interruption, stoppage, ban, standstill, deadlock, stalemate, abeyance 引き止める(ひきとめる): detain, restrain 防止(ぼうし): prevention, check 止む(やむ): stop (e.g. rain) 止める(やめる): quit smoking 止す(よす): cease, abolish, resign, give up 止まる(とまる): come to a halt Kunyomi: と.まる、-ど.まり、と.める、-と.める、-ど.め、とど.める、とど.め、とど.まる、や.める、や.む、-や.む、よ.す、-さ.す、-さ.し Onyomi: シ Lesson: 17 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds: 止まる (と.まる), 止める (と.める)	stop 止 画数4 396 Details Story Dictionary 止 stop Heisig's The character for stop is easiest to learn as a pictograph, though you have to take a moment to see it. Take it as a rather crude drawing of a footprint: the first 3 strokes represent the front of the foot and the last the heel. The big toe (stroke 2 sticking out to the right) on the right indicates that this is a left foot. * Although the meaning of stop will be retained, we will return often to the pictographic meaning of footprint. Koohii #1 If you find in the ground a walking stick with a magic wand, STOP! Maybe it´s some kind of macumba/black magic/voodoo bad thing. Koohii #2 If you don´t remember this one from the 10,000,000 STOP signs on roads all over Japan, you´re beyyond help! Primitives stop, footprint 受け止める(うけとめる): to catch, to stop the blow, to react to, to take 静止(せいし): stillness, repose, standing still 阻止(そし): obstruction, check, hindrance, prevention, interdiction 止まる(とどまる): to be limited to 止める(とどめる): to stop, to cease, to put an end to 廃止(はいし): abolition, repeal 止むを得ない(やむをえない): cannot be helped, unavoidable 呼び止める(よびとめる): to challenge, to call somebody to halt 禁止(きんし): prohibition, ban 立ち止まる(たちどまる): stop, halt, stand still 中止(ちゅうし): suspension, stoppage, discontinuance, interruption 停止(ていし): suspension, interruption, stoppage, ban, standstill, deadlock, stalemate, abeyance 引き止める(ひきとめる): detain, restrain 防止(ぼうし): prevention, check 止む(やむ): stop (e.g. rain) 止める(やめる): quit smoking 止す(よす): cease, abolish, resign, give up 止まる(とまる): come to a halt Kunyomi: と.まる、-ど.まり、と.める、-と.める、-ど.め、とど.める、とど.め、とど.まる、や.める、や.む、-や.む、よ.す、-さ.す、-さ.し Onyomi: シ Lesson: 17 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds: 止まる (と.まる), 止める (と.める)
walk Details Story Dictionary 歩 walk Heisig's Footprints that follow one another a few at a time indicate walking. Koohii #1 When walking your pet, you must stop a few times along the way when nature calls. Koohii #2 When you learn to walk, you take your steps a few at a time. Picture a clumsy but happy toddler who falls every few steps but keeps getting up to try again. Primitives walk, stop, footprint, few 歩み(あゆみ): walking 歩む(あゆむ): to walk, to go on foot 譲歩(じょうほ): concession, conciliation, compromise 徒歩(とほ): walking, going on foot 歩(ふ): pawn (in chess or shogi) 進歩(しんぽ): progress, development 歩道(ほどう): footpath, walkway, sidewalk 歩く(あるく): to walk 散歩(さんぽ): walk, stroll Kunyomi: ある.く、あゆ.む Onyomi: ホ、ブ、フ Lesson: 17 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds: 歩道 (ほどう), 徒歩 (とほ), 進歩 (しんぽ), 歩合 (ぶあい), 日歩 (ひぶ), 歩む (あゆ.む), 歩く (ある.く)	walk 歩 画数8 397 Details Story Dictionary 歩 walk Heisig's Footprints that follow one another a few at a time indicate walking. Koohii #2 A ford is a place where one can walk through the water, a place only a few footsteps deep. agreement Details Story Dictionary 肯 agreement Heisig's Seeing footprints on someone's flesh indicates a rather brutal way of having secured that person's agreement. Koohii #1 A secret agreement between a covert gov´t agency and aliens states that we will not step foot on the moon again in return for alien technology. Koohii #2 NASA and Armstrong made an agreement: They´d never tell anyone that no-one actually stepped foot on the moon. levy Details Story Dictionary 賦 levy Heisig's A certain portion of shells (money) is collected by the warrior from the local villages as he passes through to defray the costs of keeping the land safe, and this is called a levy. Koohii #1 A warrior stands guard at a bridge collecting shells as a levy for any who want to pass. Koohii #2 Drove my Chevy to the levy but the levy was dry. And those good old warrior boys, drinking whiskey and rye, said pay up the clams or you´ll die. Pay up the clams or you´ll die.... Primitives levy, shellfish, clam, oyster, eye, animal legs, eight, warrior, one, stop, footprint, arrow 月賦(げっぷ): monthly installment Kunyomi: Onyomi: フ、ブ Lesson: 17 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	levy 賦 画数15 404 Details Story Dictionary 賦 levy Heisig's A certain portion of shells (money) is collected by the warrior from the local villages as he passes through to defray the costs of keeping the land safe, and this is called a levy. "correct Details Story Dictionary 正 correct Heisig's ""A journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step,"" says the Chinese proverb. Here we see one footprint, complementing that proverb with the sound advice that if the first step is not made correctly, the whole point of the journey will be forfeited. This is the ideal that teachers are supposed to have in correcting their students, and parents in correcting their children. Koohii #1 If you do it correct on the first attempt you can stop. Koohii #2 The correct way of learning Japanese? First, stop everything you´re doing. Then, go pick up a copy of Heisig´s book and work from there. Primitives correct, one, ceiling, stop, footprint 正解(せいかい): correct, right, correct interpretation (answer solution) 正規(せいき): regular, legal, formal, established, legitimate 正義(せいぎ): justice, right, righteousness, correct meaning 正常(せいじょう): normalcy, normality, normal 正当(せいとう): just, justifiable, right, due, proper, equitable, reasonable, legitimate, lawful 正門(せいもん): main gate, main entrance 是正(ぜせい): correction, revision 訂正(ていせい): correction, revision 正しく(まさしく): surely, no doubt, evidently 正に(まさに): correctly, surely 改正(かいせい): revision, amendment, alteration 公正(こうせい): justice, fairness, impartiality 修正(しゅうせい): amendment, correction, revision 正午(しょうご): noon, mid-day 正直(しょうじき): honesty, integrity, frankness 正味(しょうみ): net (weight) 正面(しょうめん): front, frontage, facade, main 正(せい): (logical) true, regular 正確(せいかく): accurate, punctual, exact, authentic, veracious 正式(せいしき): due form, official, formality 正方形(せいほうけい): square 不正(ふせい): injustice, unfairness, iniquity, impropriety, irregularity, dishonesty, illegality 正しい(ただしい): right, correct Kunyomi: ただ.しい、ただ.す、まさ、まさ.に Onyomi: セイ、ショウ Lesson: 17 Jouyou: 1 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds: 正義 (せいぎ), 正誤 (せいご), 訂正 (ていせい), 正しい (ただ.しい), 正す (ただ.す), 正 (まさ)"	"correct 正 画数5 405 Details Story Dictionary 正 correct Heisig's ""A journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step,"" says the Chinese proverb. "evidence Details Story Dictionary 証 evidence Heisig's Words that testify to the correctness of some fact are classified as evidence. (Here we see a good example of how the more common primitive element takes the ""strong"" position to the left, even though it has more strokes.) Koohii #1 Your words must be absolutely correct if you plan to use them as evidence. Koohii #2 If what you say is indeed correct, we could use use your testimony as evidence. Primitives evidence, say, words, keitai, mouth, correct, one, ceiling, stop, footprint 証(あかし): proof, evidence 証言(しょうげん): evidence, testimony 証拠(しょうこ): evidence, proof 証人(しょうにん): witness 証明(しょうめい): proof, verification 保証(ほしょう): guarantee, security, assurance, pledge, warranty Kunyomi: あかし Onyomi: ショウ Lesson: 17 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 証 (あかし)"	"evidence 証 画数12 406 Details Story Dictionary 証 evidence Heisig's Words that testify to the correctness of some fact are classified as evidence. "determine Details Story Dictionary 定 determine Heisig's Determination, in the sense of settling on a certain course of action, is likened here to mending one's house. Koohii #1 In The Karate Kid, the boy must prove his determination by MENDING his teacher´s HOUSE in various ways. Koohii #2 People who decide to renovate (ooh, that´s a fancy word, let´s say ""mend"") their houses must be very determined DIYers. (Using DIY helps me remember this story when I see DEtermine). Primitives determine, house, mend 案の定(あんのじょう): sure enough, as usual 一定(いちじょう): fixed, settled, definite, uniform, regularized, defined, standardized, certain, prescribed 改定(かいてい): reform 確定(かくてい): definition (math), decision, settlement 規定(きてい): regulation, provisions 協定(きょうてい): arrangement, pact, agreement 限定(げんてい): limit, restriction 国定(こくてい): state-sponsored, national 固定(こてい): fixation 定まる(さだまる): to become settled, to be fixed 定める(さだめる): to decide, to establish, to determine 所定(しょてい): fixed, prescribed 制定(せいてい): enactment, establishment, creation 設定(せってい): establishment, creation 定義(ていぎ): definition 定食(ていしょく): set meal, special (of the day) 定年(ていねん): retirement age 判定(はんてい): judgement, decision, award, verdict 未定(みてい): not yet fixed, undecided, pending 安定(あんてい): stability, equilibrium 一定(いってい): fixed, settled, definite, uniform, regularized, standardized, prescribed 仮定(かてい): assumption, supposition, hypothesis 勘定(かんじょう): calculation, settlement of an account, allowance 決定(けってい): decision, determination 肯定(こうてい): positive, affirmation 指定(してい): designation, specification, assignment, pointing at 定規(じょうぎ): (measuring) ruler 推定(すいてい): presumption, assumption, estimation 測定(そくてい): measurement 断定(だんてい): conclusion, decision 定員(ていいん): fixed number of regular personnel, capacity (of boat, hall, aeroplane, etc.) 定価(ていか): established price 定期(ていき): fixed term 定期券(ていきけん): commuter pass, season ticket 定休日(ていきゅうび): regular holiday 特定(とくてい): specific, special, particular 否定(ひてい): negation, denial, repudiation 予定(よてい): plan Kunyomi: さだ.める、さだ.まる、さだ.か Onyomi: テイ、ジョウ Lesson: 17 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 定価 (ていか), 安定 (あんてい), 決定 (けってい), 定か (さだ.か), 定まる (さだ.まる), 定める (さだ.める)"	"determine 定 画数8 408 Details Story Dictionary 定 determine Heisig's Determination, in the sense of settling on a certain course of action, is likened here to mending one's house. Koohii #1 In The Karate Kid, the boy must prove his determination by MENDING his teacher´s HOUSE in various ways. Koohii #2 People who decide to renovate (ooh, that´s a fancy word, let´s say ""mend"") their houses must be very determined DIYers. (Using DIY helps me remember this story when I see DEtermine). Primitives determine, house, mend 案の定(あんのじょう): sure enough, as usual 一定(いちじょう): fixed, settled, definite, uniform, regularized, defined, standardized, certain, prescribed 改定(かいてい): reform 確定(かくてい): definition (math), decision, settlement 規定(きてい): regulation, provisions 協定(きょうてい): arrangement, pact, agreement 限定(げんてい): limit, restriction 国定(こくてい): state-sponsored, national 固定(こてい): fixation 定まる(さだまる): to become settled, to be fixed 定める(さだめる): to decide, to establish, to determine 所定(しょてい): fixed, prescribed 制定(せいてい): enactment, establishment, creation 設定(せってい): establishment, creation 定義(ていぎ): definition 定食(ていしょく): set meal, special (of the day) 定年(ていねん): retirement age 判定(はんてい): judgement, decision, award, verdict 未定(みてい): not yet fixed, undecided, pending 安定(あんてい): stability, equilibrium 一定(いってい): fixed, settled, definite, uniform, regularized, standardized, prescribed 仮定(かてい): assumption, supposition, hypothesis 勘定(かんじょう): calculation, settlement of an account, allowance 決定(けってい): decision, determination 肯定(こうてい): positive, affirmation 指定(してい): designation, specification, assignment, pointing at 定規(じょうぎ): (measuring) ruler 推定(すいてい): presumption, assumption, estimation 測定(そくてい): measurement 断定(だんてい): conclusion, decision 定員(ていいん): fixed number of regular personnel, capacity (of boat, hall, aeroplane, etc.) 定価(ていか): established price 定期(ていき): fixed term 定期券(ていきけん): commuter pass, season ticket 定休日(ていきゅうび): regular holiday 特定(とくてい): specific, special, particular 否定(ひてい): negation, denial, repudiation 予定(よてい): plan Kunyomi: さだ.める、さだ.まる、さだ.か Onyomi: テイ、ジョウ Lesson: 17 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 定価 (ていか), 安定 (あんてい), 決定 (けってい), 定か (さだ.か), 定まる (さだ.まる), 定める (さだ.める)"
lock Details Story Dictionary 錠 lock Heisig's Metal of itself doesn't lock. It needs to be so determined by a locksmith. Now make a concrete image of that. Koohii #1 Even if you lock up your GOLD, a DETERMINED thief will get it in the end. Koohii #2 The best stories for this kanji tend to have a thief in them, which always makes me confuse them with the kanji for burglar (357). So, let´s try this one: My girlfriend wears a metal chastity belt with a lock but I am determined to open it! I must get inside! Primitives lock, metal, gold, determine, determined, house, mend 手錠(てじょう): handcuffs, manacles Kunyomi: Onyomi: ジョウ Lesson: 17 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	lock 錠 画数16 409 Details Story Dictionary 錠 lock Heisig's Metal of itself doesn't lock. run Details Story Dictionary 走 run Heisig's Running, we are told here, mends the soil. Observe in the following frames how this kanji can embrace other elements from below, much the same way as the element for road does; and how, in order to do this, the final stroke needs to be lengthened. Koohii #1 Hint: This kanji is NOT soil on top of mend, as Heisig claims - that would duplicate one of the strokes. Instead, it is 10 on top of mend. So my story is: If you run 10 miles, you will need to mend your socks! Koohii #2 The sports ground needs MENDING after the game as the players have been RUNNING around which has caused the ground to be chopped up. Primitives run, soil, dirt, ground, mend 御馳走(ごちそう): feast, treating (someone) ご馳走さま(ごちそうさま): feast 走行(そうこう): running a wheeled vehicle (e.g. car), traveling 逃走(とうそう): flight, desertion, escape 走る(はしる): to run Kunyomi: はし.る Onyomi: ソウ Lesson: 17 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds: 走る (はし.る)	run 走 画数7 410 Details Story Dictionary 走 run Heisig's Running, we are told here, mends the soil. Observe in the following frames how this kanji can embrace other elements from below, much the same way as the element for road does; and how, in order to do this, the final stroke needs to be lengthened. Koohii #1 Hint: This kanji is NOT soil on top of mend, as Heisig claims - that would duplicate one of the strokes. Instead, it is 10 on top of mend. So my story is: If you run 10 miles, you will need to mend your socks! Koohii #2 The sports ground needs MENDING after the game as the players have been RUNNING around which has caused the ground to be chopped up. transcend Details Story Dictionary 超 transcend Heisig's When one is running after something, the goal that seduces one is said to transcend the seeker. Koohii #1 A successful marathon runner needs to be able to transcend seductions, such as the possibility of rest, shelter from the rain, or a cold beer. Koohii #2 To transcend oneself is to reach a higher plane of reality. A head shaven monk is telling me this. We are in a Tibetan monastery. He was once an athlete, a runner. He used to run everywhere, until one day, he saw a beautiful cheerleader along his path. She tried very hard to seduce him, but he forced himself to transcend his urges. He did reach his running goal, and he has became a lonely monk. He wishes now he had just broken down back then and.... Primitives transcend, run, soil, dirt, ground, mend, summon, seduce, sword, dagger, mouth 超える(こえる): to cross over, to cross, to pass through, to pass over (out of) 超(ちょう): super-, ultra-, hyper- 超す(こす): cross, pass, tide over 超過(ちょうか): excess, being more than Kunyomi: こ.える、こ.す Onyomi: チョウ Lesson: 17 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 超える (こ.える), 超す (こ.す)	transcend 超 画数12 411 Details Story Dictionary 超 transcend Heisig's When one is running after something, the goal that seduces one is said to transcend the seeker. "proceed Details Story Dictionary 赴 proceed Heisig's In proceeding to a new city or a new job, something in you runs ahead with excitement, and something else holds you back, like a divining rod built into your psyche warning you to check things out carefully before rushing in too wildly. Koohii #1 Don´t run into trouble, Dumbledore tells Harry. ""Proceed with caution with your wand out."". Koohii #2 While running, my magic wand tells me where to proceed. Primitives proceed, run, soil, dirt, ground, mend, magic wand, augury 赴く(おもむく): to go, to proceed, to repair to, to become 赴任(ふにん): (proceeding to) new appointment Kunyomi: おもむ.く Onyomi: フ Lesson: 17 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 赴く (おもむ.く)"	"proceed 赴 画数9 412 Details Story Dictionary 赴 proceed Heisig's In proceeding to a new city or a new job, something in you runs ahead with excitement, and something else holds you back, like a divining rod built into your psyche warning you to check things out carefully before rushing in too wildly. surpass / go beyond Details Story Dictionary 越 surpass / go beyond My Story By #Going Beyond# the limits of good taste, the Nazis *ran* and *became* extinct. Koohii #1 The person in charge of running the parade surpassed all our expectations (by just a extra drop...). Koohii #2 The parade of runners are all trying to SURPASS each other - and they end up running all the way to Vietnam (note that this kanji is also used for the country of Vietnam). Primitives surpass, run, soil, dirt, ground, mend, parade 越える(こえる): to cross over, to cross, to pass through, to pass over (out of) 優越(ゆうえつ): supremacy, predominance, being superior to 追い越す(おいこす): to pass (e.g. car), outdistance 越す(こす): go over (e.g. with audience) 引越し(ひっこし): moving (dwelling, office, etc.), changing residence 引っ越す(ひっこす): move to (house) Kunyomi: こ.す、-こ.す、-ご.し、こ.える、-ご.え Onyomi: エツ、オツ Lesson: 17 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 越える (こ.える), 越す (こ.す)	surpass / go beyond 越 画数12 413 Details Story Dictionary 越 surpass / go beyond My Story By #Going Beyond# the limits of good taste, the Nazis *ran* and *became* extinct. "just so Details Story Dictionary 是 just so Heisig's In this kanji we are shown someone spending an entire day at mending one stocking, because they want the job done ""just so."" Be sure to make a clear image of a finicky old fusspot to make the abstract idea as concrete as possible. Koohii #1 ´Sun´ ´Mend´ - It just so happens that sunshine can mend your gloomy spirits. Koohii #2 My image here is of Fabrice (the guy who runs this website) spending all day obsessively mending the code so this page looks just so.... Primitives just so, sun, day, mend 是正(ぜせい): correction, revision 是非とも(ぜひとも): by all means (with sense of not taking ""no"" for an answer) 是非(ぜひ): certainly, without fail Kunyomi: これ、この、ここ Onyomi: ゼ、シ Lesson: 17 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"	"just so 是 画数9 414 Details Story Dictionary 是 just so Heisig's In this kanji we are shown someone spending an entire day at mending one stocking, because they want the job done ""just so."" "topic Details Story Dictionary 題 topic Heisig's In many kinds of research, one can find information on a given topic only if the headings are prepared just so. Koohii #1 The ""TOPIC"" of the day´s newspaper must be placed JUST SO at the top of the PAGE to attract attention. Koohii #2 You spend ALL DAY, mending your socks JUST SO. Then you have a look at the HEADING of the newspaper. The topic---FREE SOCKS TO BE GIVEN AWAY!!!! Primitives topic, just so, sun, day, mend, head, page, one, ceiling, drop, shellfish, clam, oyster, eye, animal legs, eight 課題(かだい): subject, theme, task 議題(ぎだい): topic of discussion, agenda 主題(しゅだい): subject, theme, motif 出題(しゅつだい): proposing a question 題(だい): title, subject, theme, topic 題名(だいめい): title 話題(わだい): topic, subject 宿題(しゅくだい): homework 問題(もんだい): problem, question Kunyomi: Onyomi: ダイ Lesson: 17 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds:"	"topic 題 画数18 415 Details Story Dictionary 題 topic Heisig's In many kinds of research, one can find information on a given topic only if the headings are prepared just so. dike Details Story Dictionary 堤 dike Heisig's A dike is a successful bit of engineering only if the amount of earth piled up is measured just so for the height and pressure of the water it is meant to contain. Koohii #1 Making a dike is all about arranging the soil just so.... Koohii #2 The little Dutch boy has his finger stuck in the dike, and that´s the only thing keeping his town from going under. He really really needs to go to the bathroom though, so he devises a plan to carefully add a bit of dirt - there, place individual bits in just so - there, I think it´s good enough. Pull it out -----yes! Success! Primitives dike, soil, dirt, ground, just so, sun, day, mend 堤防(ていぼう): bank, weir Kunyomi: つつみ Onyomi: テイ Lesson: 17 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 堤 (つつみ)	dike 堤 画数12 416 Details Story Dictionary 堤 dike Heisig's A dike is a successful bit of engineering only if the amount of earth piled up is measured just so for the height and pressure of the water it is meant to contain.
