"build Details Story Dictionary 建 build My Story Before you build something you first need to *stretch out* 廴your *brush* 聿 and make plans. 廴 trad. meaning is *move*, so you could say *move* your *brush*. 建設、けんせつ, construction, building: 宇宙ステーションを建設しました, ""They built a space station."" 新体育館はまだ建設中です, ""The new gym is still under construction."" 建てる、たてる, to build: 兄は大きな家を建てました, ""My older brother built a big house."" 建物、たてもの, building. Koohii #1 Build is easy to remember if you can remember that archtiechts have two steps in building. 1. Take a brush and brush out the blueprints. 2. Get a visual image of the blueprints all rolled up like they usually are. The second step is easy, it´s just the architecht stretching out the blueprints and showing it to his clients. Koohii #2 A construction worker´s classic morning. Stretch, brush his teeth, and then start to build. Primitives build, brush, stretch 再建(さいけん): rebuilding, reconstruction, rehabilitation 建前(たてまえ): face, official stance, public position or attitude (as opposed to private thoughts) 封建(ほうけん): feudalistic 建設(けんせつ): construction, establishment 建築(けんちく): construction, architecture 建つ(たつ): build, erect 建てる(たてる): build 建物(たてもの): building Kunyomi: た.てる、た.て、-だ.て、た.つ Onyomi: ケン、コン Lesson: 17 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds: 建築 (けんちく), 建議 (けんぎ), 封建的 (ほうけんてき), 建つ (た.つ), 建てる (た.てる)"	"build 建 画数9 417 Details Story Dictionary 建 build My Story Before you build something you first need to *stretch out* 廴your *brush* 聿 and make plans. 廴 trad. meaning is *move*, so you could say *move* your *brush*. 建設、けんせつ, construction, building: 宇宙ステーションを建設しました, ""They built a space station."" 新体育館はまだ建設中です, ""The new gym is still under construction."" 建てる、たてる, to build: 兄は大きな家を建てました, ""My older brother built a big house."" 建物、たてもの, building. Get a visual image of the blueprints all rolled up like they usually are. The second step is easy, it´s just the architecht stretching out the blueprints and showing it to his clients. key Details Story Dictionary 鍵 key Heisig's The golden key you have been presented by the mayor gives you access to all the buildings in the city. Koohii #1 The metal thing you need in order to enter things you build is a key. Koohii #2 鍵盤key (#2761) ケン, かぎ ... Parts: 金, 建 ... Story: The most important Metal in any building is the lock on the front door, and without a key you ain´t getting in. This kanji means both lock and key to most Japanese people. 錠前 is technically the word for lock but it´s not used in daily conversation. ... 熟語: ... cf: 錠前. Primitives key, metal, gold, build, brush, stretch 鍵(かぎ): key Kunyomi: かぎ Onyomi: ケン Lesson: 17 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: Compounds: 鍵 (かぎ)	key 鍵 画数17 418 Details Story Dictionary 鍵 key Heisig's The golden key you have been presented by the mayor gives you access to all the buildings in the city. Koohii #1 The metal thing you need in order to enter things you build is a key. Koohii #2 鍵盤key (#2761) ケン, かぎ ... Parts: 金, 建 ... Story: The most important Metal in any building is the lock on the front door, and without a key you ain´t getting in. This kanji means both lock and key to most Japanese people. 錠前 is technically the word for lock but it´s not used in daily conversation. ... 熟語: ... cf: 錠前. Primitives key, metal, gold, build, brush, stretch 鍵(かぎ): key Kunyomi: かぎ Onyomi: ケン Lesson: 17 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: Compounds: 鍵 (かぎ)
"prolong Details Story Dictionary 延 prolong Heisig's This character is a kind of pictographic image of how prolonging is a clever way of stopping things by trying to stretch them out a little bit at a time (the extra drop at the top of stop). Be sure to get a concrete image of this process, by imagining yourself prolonging something you can really, physically, stretch. Koohii #1 Stretching correctly prolongs life. Even the top part of 正 is stretching... Koohii #2 Here´s a great mnemonic: ""stop, drop, and stretch (!?)."" Now let´s associate it with ´prolong´: if you´re ever in an uncomfortable spot, like being asked tricky questions or caught in a lie, just PROLONG the situation - stop, drop, and stretch. They may be confused by your odd behaviour, but it´ll buy you a few moments to think up another good lie to get out of the sticky situation! Primitives prolong, drop, stop, footprint, stretch 延ばす(のばす): to lengthen, to stretch, to reach out, to postpone, to prolong, to extend, to grow (beard) 延びる(のびる): to be prolonged 延べ(のべ): futures, credit (buying), stretching, total 延いては(ひいては): not only...but also, in addition to, consequently 延期(えんき): postponement, adjournment 延長(えんちょう): extension, elongation, prolongation, lengthening Kunyomi: の.びる、の.べる、の.べ、の.ばす Onyomi: エン Lesson: 17 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 延ばす (の.ばす), 延びる (の.びる), 延べる (の.べる)"	"prolong 延 画数8 419 Details Story Dictionary 延 prolong Heisig's This character is a kind of pictographic image of how prolonging is a clever way of stopping things by trying to stretch them out a little bit at a time (the extra drop at the top of stop). Be sure to get a concrete image of this process, by imagining yourself prolonging something you can really, physically, stretch. Koohii #1 Stretching correctly prolongs life. Even the top part of 正 is stretching... Koohii #2 Here´s a great mnemonic: ""stop, drop, and stretch (!?)."" Now let´s associate it with ´prolong´: if you´re ever in an uncomfortable spot, like being asked tricky questions or caught in a lie, just PROLONG the situation - stop, drop, and stretch. They may be confused by your odd behaviour, but it´ll buy you a few moments to think up another good lie to get out of the sticky situation! Primitives prolong, drop, stop, footprint, stretch 延ばす(のばす): to lengthen, to stretch, to reach out, to postpone, to prolong, to extend, to grow (beard) 延びる(のびる): to be prolonged 延べ(のべ): futures, credit (buying), stretching, total 延いては(ひいては): not only...but also, in addition to, consequently 延期(えんき): postponement, adjournment 延長(えんちょう): extension, elongation, prolongation, lengthening Kunyomi: の.びる、の.べる、の.べ、の.ばす Onyomi: エン Lesson: 17 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 延ばす (の.ばす), 延びる (の.びる), 延べる (の.べる)"
nativity Details Story Dictionary 誕 nativity Heisig's The key word of course calls to mind the feast of Christmas. As the famous poem at the start of St. John's gospel tells us, the nativity we celebrate at Christmas had its origins at the very start of time and governs all of human history: it represents the prolongation of the eternal Word in time and space. Koohii #1 Nativity = born, being born. Think of birth as a painful and prolonged event. And of course, all the words and curses being yelled at the soon-to-be father for doing this to her! Koohii #2 When you are being born ( nativity ), your mother´s WORDS are PROLONGED. (Thiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiis huuuuuuuuuuuuuurtss a lottttttttt~!! Owwwwwww!!!). Primitives nativity, say, words, keitai, mouth, prolonged, drop, stop, footprint, stretch 誕生(たんじょう): birth 誕生日(たんじょうび): birthday Kunyomi: Onyomi: タン Lesson: 17 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	nativity 誕 画数15 420 Details Story Dictionary 誕 nativity Heisig's The key word of course calls to mind the feast of Christmas. As the famous poem at the start of St. John's gospel tells us, the nativity we celebrate at Christmas had its origins at the very start of time and governs all of human history: it represents the prolongation of the eternal Word in time and space. Koohii #1 Nativity = born, being born. Think of birth as a painful and prolonged event. And of course, all the words and curses being yelled at the soon-to-be father for doing this to her! Koohii #2 When you are being born ( nativity ), your mother´s WORDS are PROLONGED. (Thiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiis huuuuuuuuuuuuuurtss a lottttttttt~!! Owwwwwww!!!). Primitives nativity, say, words, keitai, mouth, prolonged, drop, stop, footprint, stretch 誕生(たんじょう): birth 誕生日(たんじょうび): birthday Kunyomi: Onyomi: タン Lesson: 17 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:
"cornerstone Details Story Dictionary 礎 cornerstone Heisig's This character depicts a cornerstone as a stone set at the end of a wildlife preserve (the ""zoo in the grove""). Koohii #1 Features like stones and groves of trees are the cornerstones of a happy zoo. Koohii #2 A zoo which is still under construction is already full of animals. At the moment, only the cornerstone has been set in place. To temporarily keep the animals from escaping, a closely-packed grove of small trees is planted around the stone. (Note that this zoo needs some serious mending.). Primitives cornerstone, stone, rock, grove, tree, wood, zoo, critters, tree2, wood2 基礎(きそ): foundation, basis Kunyomi: いしずえ Onyomi: ソ Lesson: 17 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 礎 (いしずえ)"	"cornerstone 礎 画数18 421 Details Story Dictionary 礎 cornerstone Heisig's This character depicts a cornerstone as a stone set at the end of a wildlife preserve (the ""zoo in the grove""). Koohii #1 Features like stones and groves of trees are the cornerstones of a happy zoo. Koohii #2 A zoo which is still under construction is already full of animals. At the moment, only the cornerstone has been set in place. To temporarily keep the animals from escaping, a closely-packed grove of small trees is planted around the stone. Primitives cornerstone, stone, rock, grove, tree, wood, zoo, critters, tree2, wood2 基礎(きそ): foundation, basis Kunyomi: いしずえ Onyomi: ソ Lesson: 17 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 礎 (いしずえ)"
"bridegroom Details Story Dictionary 婿 bridegroom Heisig's What makes a man a bridegroom is obviously a woman and her dowry, here presented as a small zoo (animals were often used for this purpose in earlier societies) and a month away from it all (the ""honeymoon""). Koohii #1 The virgin bridegroom tries to understand the new, mysterious part of his woman´s body - but with little success. It´s a zoo down there! (primitives placement: the part of the body is ´down there´ - the woman is ´left´ unsatisfied). Koohii #2 The only reason anyone talks about a bridegroom is if they´re about to or have just gotten married. Of course, then you have to go on your honeymoon. So you take your woman to the zoo for a month. Pretty cool honeymoon. Primitives bridegroom, woman, zoo, critters, moon, month, flesh, part of the body 婿(むこ): son-in-law Kunyomi: むこ Onyomi: セイ Lesson: 17 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 婿 (むこ)"	"bridegroom 婿 画数12 422 Details Story Dictionary 婿 bridegroom Heisig's What makes a man a bridegroom is obviously a woman and her dowry, here presented as a small zoo (animals were often used for this purpose in earlier societies) and a month away from it all (the ""honeymoon""). Koohii #1 The virgin bridegroom tries to understand the new, mysterious part of his woman´s body - but with little success. It´s a zoo down there! (primitives placement: the part of the body is ´down there´ - the woman is ´left´ unsatisfied). Koohii #2 The only reason anyone talks about a bridegroom is if they´re about to or have just gotten married. Of course, then you have to go on your honeymoon. So you take your woman to the zoo for a month. Pretty cool honeymoon. Primitives bridegroom, woman, zoo, critters, moon, month, flesh, part of the body 婿(むこ): son-in-law Kunyomi: むこ Onyomi: セイ Lesson: 17 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 婿 (むこ)"
"garment Details Story Dictionary 衣 garment Heisig's At the top we see the top hat, and at the bottom a pictographic representation of the folds of a garment. If you break the ""4-fold"" fold into 2 sets of 2 strokes, you will find it easier to remember. * Used as a primitive, the additional meanings of cloak or scarf will come in handy. What has to be noted particularly are the changes in shape the kanji can undergo when it becomes an element in other kanji. In fact, it is the most volatile of all the kanji we shall treat, and for that reason deserves special attention here. When it appears to the left, it looks like a hiragana ne (ネ) with an extra drop on the right, and we shall take it to mean cloak. At the bottom, when attached to the stroke immediately above it, the first two strokes (the top hat) are omitted, which we shall take to mean a scarf. On rare occasions, the element can be torn right across the middle, with the first 2 strokes appearing at the top and the last 4 at the bottom of another primitive or cluster of primitive, in which cases we shall speak of a top hat and scarf. And finally, of course, it can keep its original kanji shape, along with its original meaning of garment in general. Note that when any of the above forms have something beneath them (as in frame 429), the third from final stroke is ""unhooked."" Koohii #1 The only garments allowed in this club are top hat and scarf. Koohii #2 The garments most commonly associated with the craft of a magician are the top hat and the magic wand. (It´s a stretch, but the way I remembered this kanji is through that phrase. This way you can remember it through using primitives we have already learned.). Primitives garment, top hat, scarf, cloth, clothes, clothing, garment 衣装(いしょう): clothing, costume, outfit, garment, dress 衣料(いりょう): clothing 衣類(いるい): clothes, clothing, garments 衣食住(いしょくじゅう): necessities of life (food, clothing, etc.) 衣服(いふく): clothes 浴衣(ゆかた): bathrobe, informal summer kimono Kunyomi: ころも、きぬ、-ぎ Onyomi: イ、エ Lesson: 18 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 衣 (ころも)"	"garment 衣 画数6 423 Details Story Dictionary 衣 garment Heisig's At the top we see the top hat, and at the bottom a pictographic representation of the folds of a garment. trial/tailor Details Story Dictionary 裁 trial/tailor My Story [Ten/Needle + Spear + Cloth {衣} ] The decision of the #trial#: *ten* *spears* will rip through the *cloth* of your vest -- while you're wearing it! Koohii #1 The tailor was hard at work making sure all the pilgrims were dressed in their best garments for thanksgiving. Koohii #2 The tailor worked hard after thanksgiving to alter garments so they´d fit people who´d eaten too much at their thanksgiving dinners. Primitives tailor, Thanksgiving, harvest festival, ten, needle, fiesta, top hat, scarf, cloth, clothes, clothing, garment 裁く(さばく): to judge 制裁(せいさい): restraint, sanctions, punishment 体裁(ていさい): decency, style, form, appearance, show, get-up, format 独裁(どくさい): dictatorship, despotism 裁判(さいばん): trial, judgement 裁縫(さいほう): sewing Kunyomi: た.つ、さば.く Onyomi: サイ Lesson: 18 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 裁く (さば.く), 裁つ (た.つ)	trial/tailor 裁 画数12 424 Details Story Dictionary 裁 trial/tailor My Story [Ten/Needle + Spear + Cloth {衣} ] The decision of the #trial#: *ten* *spears* will rip through the *cloth* of your vest -- while you're wearing it! "attire Details Story Dictionary 装 attire Heisig's The character for attire can be remembered as a picture of what we may call a ""turtle-samurai"" sweater. At the top we see the turtle-samurai and at the bottom the element for garment. Koohii #1 The TURTLE SAMURAI needs special GARMENTs for his ATTIRE since his body is much more ROBUST than others. Koohii #2 The ninja turtles tried to go eat at a fancy restaurant, but they were told to come back after their were dressed in proper attire. However, it´s too difficult for them to find proper garments because they bodies are so robust! (sannomiya + drwarrior12). Primitives attire, turtle, samurai, top hat, scarf, cloth, clothes, clothing, garment 衣装(いしょう): clothing, costume, outfit, garment, dress 盛装(せいそう): be dressed up, wear rich clothes 装飾(そうしょく): ornament 装備(そうび): equipment 武装(ぶそう): arms, armament, armed 舗装(ほそう): pavement, road surface 装置(そうち): equipment, installation, apparatus 服装(ふくそう): garments 包装(ほうそう): packing, wrapping Kunyomi: よそお.う、よそお.い Onyomi: ソウ、ショウ Lesson: 18 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 装置 (そうち), 服装 (ふくそう), 変装 (へんそう), 装う (よそお.う)"	"attire 装 画数12 425 Details Story Dictionary 装 attire Heisig's The character for attire can be remembered as a picture of what we may call a ""turtle-samurai"" sweater. back Details Story Dictionary 裏 back My Story If you wear a *beret* in the back part of the *village*, you'll get *kicked in the nuts*. It's a rough 'hood. Koohii #1 The computer had carefully dressed up in clothes to look human. It was n´t until I looked at the back and saw the cables and stuff that I realized what it was. Koohii #2 Can computers be gay? I´m not sure, but mine always wears a top hat and scarf, and for some reason its back door port is always open... demolition Details Story Dictionary 壊 demolition Heisig's The right half of this character shows a garment woven so fine that it can pass through the eye of a needle, fittingly draped around the slithering, ethereal form of a poltergeist. In this frame, our eerie visitor brushes its robes against a nearby block of apartments and completely demolishes them, razing them to the ground. Koohii #1 If you stand too close to a DEMOLITION site, the dust might sting you like NEEDLES in your EYE and get your GARMENTs all dirty. Koohii #2 Since that needle eye thing turns up a lot, I turned it into Darth Vader. It kinda looks like him to me, with the eye being his metal mouth piece thing. So, Darth Vader swings his cape (his garment) demolishing a nearby building, leaving nothing but a pile of dirt. Primitives demolition, soil, dirt, ground, poltergeist, BernaE, ten, needle, eye, cross-eyed, net, top hat, scarf, cloth, clothes, clothing, garment 破壊(はかい): destruction 崩壊(ほうかい): collapse, decay (physics), crumbling, breaking down, caving in 壊す(こわす): break, destroy 壊れる(こわれる): be broken Kunyomi: こわ.す、こわ.れる、やぶ.る Onyomi: カイ、エ Lesson: 18 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 壊す (こわ.す), 壊れる (こわ.れる)	demolition 壊 画数16 427 Details Story Dictionary 壊 demolition Heisig's The right half of this character shows a garment woven so fine that it can pass through the eye of a needle, fittingly draped around the slithering, ethereal form of a poltergeist. "pathetic Details Story Dictionary 哀 pathetic Heisig's A drunken sod in a tattered top hat and soiled silk scarf with a giant mouth guzzling something or other gives us a pathetic character role in which W. C. Fields might find himself right at home. Koohii #1 One of my friends with a crazy sense of fashion loves to wear a tophat and a scarf so that you can´t see his whole face but only his mouth. He thinks it´s cool. I think it´s pathetic. Koohii #2 A poor, homeless child like Oliver Twist, with a hungry open mouth, is pathetic-- in the original sense of the noun ""pathos."" The tattered tophat and scarf he wears only adds to the pathos. Primitives pathetic, top hat, scarf, mouth 可哀想(かわいそう): poor, pitiable, pathetic 哀れ(あわれ): helpless, pathos, pity, sorrow, grief, misery, compassion Kunyomi: あわ.れ、あわ.れむ、かな.しい Onyomi: アイ Lesson: 18 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 哀れ (あわ.れ), 哀れむ (あわ.れむ)"	"pathetic 哀 画数9 428 Details Story Dictionary 哀 pathetic Heisig's A drunken sod in a tattered top hat and soiled silk scarf with a giant mouth guzzling something or other gives us a pathetic character role in which W. distant Details Story Dictionary 遠 distant Heisig's A distant figure on the road is such a blur it looks like a lidded crock wearing a silk scarf. Koohii #1 Keep distant from a lidded crock on the road wrapped in a scarf. It might be a bomb. Koohii #2 When traveling to a distant land, what better way of keeping warm on the road is there than carrying a warm lidded crock and wearing a scarf? Primitives distant, earthenware jar, lidded crock, soil, dirt, ground, mouth, scarf, road 遠方(えんぽう): long way, distant place 遠ざかる(とおざかる): to go far off 遠回り(とおまわり): detour, roundabout way 待ち遠しい(まちどおしい): looking forward to 永遠(えいえん): eternity, perpetuity, immortality, permanence 遠足(えんそく): trip, hike, picnic 遠慮(えんりょ): diffidence, restraint, reserve 望遠鏡(ぼうえんきょう): telescope 遠く(とおく): far 遠い(とおい): far, distant Kunyomi: とお.い Onyomi: エン、オン Lesson: 18 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 遠近 (えんきん), 永遠 (えいえん), 敬遠 (けいえん), 遠い (とお.い)	distant 遠 画数13 429 Details Story Dictionary 遠 distant Heisig's A distant figure on the road is such a blur it looks like a lidded crock wearing a silk scarf. monkey Details Story Dictionary 猿 monkey Heisig's This clever little monkey has captured an entire pack of wild dogs, locked them inside a lidded crock, and wrapped the whole thing up in a silk scarf to present to the dogcatcher. Koohii #1 The MONKEY likes to play hide and seek with the PACK of WILD DOGS by hiding in the LIDDED CROCK. But he is easy to see because the SCARF he always wears is at the base of the LIDDED CROCK. Koohii #2 To catch a monkey, chase him with wild dogs into a lidded crock, then tie it with a scarf. Primitives monkey, pack of wild dogs, earthenware jar, lidded crock, soil, dirt, ground, mouth, scarf 猿(さる): monkey Kunyomi: さる Onyomi: エン Lesson: 18 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 猿 (さる)	monkey 猿 画数13 430 Details Story Dictionary 猿 monkey Heisig's This clever little monkey has captured an entire pack of wild dogs, locked them inside a lidded crock, and wrapped the whole thing up in a silk scarf to present to the dogcatcher. "first time Details Story Dictionary 初 first time Heisig's The primitives here take care of themselves: cloak and dagger .What I leave to you is to decide on an appropriate connotation for ""first time"" to take advantage of them. Koohii #1 This is the first time we´ve been out of the Shire, Mr. Frodo! Says Sam, covering himself with his cloak and clutching his dagger. Koohii #2 On his FIRST TIME, he cloaked his dagger with a Trojan. "linen Details Story Dictionary 布 linen Heisig's The maid, towels by her side, distributes the linen. Koohii #1 A matador holding his red linen by his side. Koohii #2 The first rule of the Hitch-Hiker´s Guide to the Universe is ""DON´T PANIC!"" The second rule, of course, is to always have a towel by your side. Personally, I prefer the linen sort. Primitives linen, by one’s side, towel 配布(はいふ): distribution 布巾(ふきん): tea-towel, dish cloth 布告(ふこく): edict, ordinance, proclamation 座布団(ざぶとん): cushion (Japanese-- square cushion used when sitting on one´s knees on a tatami-mat floor) 布(ぬの): cloth 分布(ぶんぷ): distribution 毛布(もうふ): blanket 財布(さいふ): purse, wallet 布団(ふとん): futon Kunyomi: ぬの Onyomi: フ Lesson: 18 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 布 (ぬの)"	"linen 布 画数5 433 Details Story Dictionary 布 linen Heisig's The maid, towels by her side, distributes the linen. sail Details Story Dictionary 帆 sail Heisig's A sail made of a towel makes a mediocre vessel. Koohii #1 When stranded at sea, we needed a Sail. The best we had was a TOWEL, which was MEDICORE, only catching a DROP of WIND. Koohii #2 A towel makes a mediocre sail. Primitives sail, towel, mediocre, drop, wind Kunyomi: ほ Onyomi: ハン Lesson: 18 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 帆 (ほ)	sail 帆 画数6 434 Details Story Dictionary 帆 sail Heisig's A sail made of a towel makes a mediocre vessel. hanging scroll Details Story Dictionary 幅 hanging scroll Heisig's A towel owned by the wealthiest tycoon in the world is made into a hanging scroll after his death and auctioned off to the highest bidder. Koohii #1 In the west, the rich use $100 bills to light their cigars... In Japan, after showering, when the wealthy don´t have any clean towels, they simply grab a hanging scroll off the wall and use it to dry off! Koohii #2 The towels of the wealthy: hanging scrolls. Primitives hanging scroll, towel, wealth, one, ceiling, mouth, rice field, brains 大幅(おおはば): full width, large scale, drastic 幅(はば): width, breadth Kunyomi: はば Onyomi: フク Lesson: 18 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 幅 (はば)	hanging scroll 幅 画数12 435 Details Story Dictionary 幅 hanging scroll Heisig's A towel owned by the wealthiest tycoon in the world is made into a hanging scroll after his death and auctioned off to the highest bidder. cap Details Story Dictionary 帽 cap Heisig's Because of the risk involved (of getting the sun in one's eyes),one puts together a makeshift cap out of a dirty old towel. Koohii #1 If you wear a towel as a cap, you are at risk of being seized and searched in U.S. airports. Koohii #2 Originally the first cap was a turban which was a towel wrapped around the head to keep the sun out of the eyes. Primitives cap, towel, risk, sun, day, eye 帽子(ぼうし): hat Kunyomi: ずきん、おお.う Onyomi: ボウ、モウ Lesson: 18 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 2 Compounds:	cap 帽 画数12 436 Details Story Dictionary 帽 cap Heisig's Because of the risk involved (of getting the sun in one's eyes),one puts together a makeshift cap out of a dirty old towel. "curtain Details Story Dictionary 幕 curtain Heisig's A dirty towel draped over the entrance to the old graveyard is painted to look like the curtain of death that leads to the otherworld. Koohii #1 There is a graveyard outside my house that scares me, so I put a huge towel over the window to serve as a curtain so I can get a good nights sleep. Koohii #2 When you´re dead in the graveyard, ""it´s curtains for you."". Primitives curtain, graveyard, flowers, sun, day, large, St. Bernard, towel 幕(とばり): curtain, bunting, act (in play) 幕(まく): curtain, screen Kunyomi: とばり Onyomi: マク、バク Lesson: 18 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 幕切れ (まくぎれ), 天幕 (てんまく), 暗幕 (あんまく)"	"curtain 幕 画数13 437 Details Story Dictionary 幕 curtain Heisig's A dirty towel draped over the entrance to the old graveyard is painted to look like the curtain of death that leads to the otherworld. canopy Details Story Dictionary 幌 canopy Heisig's A large towel stretched overhead with only a few of the sun's rays breaking through represents a canopy over one's bed. Koohii #1 A canopy is a towel to block the suns rays. Koohii #2 From the Hitch-Hiker´s Guide to the Universe: A towel is useful, among other things, as a canopy to keep out the sun´s rays from your face while napping. Primitives canopy, towel, limpid, sun, day, ray, small, little, human legs Kunyomi: ほろ、とばり Onyomi: コウ Lesson: 18 Jouyou: Names JLPT Level: Compounds:	canopy 幌 画数13 438 Details Story Dictionary 幌 canopy Heisig's A large towel stretched overhead with only a few of the sun's rays breaking through represents a canopy over one's bed. brocade Details Story Dictionary 錦 brocade Heisig's A strip of white towel and some scraps of metal have the makings of a primitive kind of brocade. Koohii #1 Brocade is the art of sewing gold on a white towel. Koohii #2 Never heard of this word before encountering it here. So it turns out that the fanciest brocade in the world is actually a towel used by a Turkish monarch. It´s embroidered with gold and cocaine. Yes, cocaine - what you thought it´d be something else? That is some true art right there. I think a great many people would want to own this towel. Primitives brocade, metal, gold, napkin, white, dove, towel Kunyomi: にしき Onyomi: キン Lesson: 18 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 錦 (にしき)	brocade 錦 画数16 439 Details Story Dictionary 錦 brocade Heisig's A strip of white towel and some scraps of metal have the makings of a primitive kind of brocade. So it turns out that the fanciest brocade in the world is actually a towel used by a Turkish monarch. It´s embroidered with gold and cocaine. Yes, cocaine - what you thought it´d be something else? That is some true art right there. I think a great many people would want to own this towel. Primitives brocade, metal, gold, napkin, white, dove, towel Kunyomi: にしき Onyomi: キン Lesson: 18 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 錦 (にしき)
market Details Story Dictionary 市 market Heisig's Dressed in nothing but a bath towel and top hat, one sets off to the marketplace in search of a bargain or two. Koohii #1 My recurring nightmare: Walking through the market, and suddenly realizing that I´m wearing only a top hat...and a towel. Koohii #2 At the MARKET you find lots of nice TOP HATS and TOWELS. Primitives market, top hat, towel 市(いち): market, fair 市街(しがい): urban areas, the streets, town, city 市場(いちば): town market, the marketplace (economics) 市(し): market, fair 市民(しみん): citizen, townspeople 都市(とし): town, city, municipal, urban Kunyomi: いち Onyomi: シ Lesson: 18 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 市 (いち)	market 市 画数5 440 Details Story Dictionary 市 market Heisig's Dressed in nothing but a bath towel and top hat, one sets off to the marketplace in search of a bargain or two. persimmon Details Story Dictionary 柿 persimmon Heisig's Imagine a village market with stalls set up around an immense persimmon tree with watermelon-sized fruit. If it weren't for the fact that the tree is sacred to the village, people would get impatient as the persimmons fall from the tree and wreak havoc on buyers and sellers alike. Koohii #1 Nobody buys persimmons at the market, because there´s a tree in the middle where you can pick them for free. Koohii #2 The guy at the market says: I´ll give you one persimmon tree per every Simon you bring me! Primitives persimmon, tree, wood, market, top hat, towel Kunyomi: かき、こけら Onyomi: シ Lesson: 18 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: Compounds: 柿 (かき)	persimmon 柿 画数9 441 Details Story Dictionary 柿 persimmon Heisig's Imagine a village market with stalls set up around an immense persimmon tree with watermelon-sized fruit. "elder sister Details Story Dictionary 姉 elder sister Heisig's Of all the women of the family, it is the elder sister who has the duty to go to market to do the shopping. Koohii #1 Unlike the younger sister (妹), who is not yet old enough to date... the elder sister is on the market! Koohii #2 She´s old enough to be allowed to go to the market. Primitives elder sister, woman, market, top hat, towel 姉妹(きょうだい): sisters 従姉妹(いとこ): female cousin 姉妹(しまい): sisters 姉(あね): older sister お姉さん(おねえさん): (polite) older sister, (vocative) ""Miss?"" Kunyomi: あね、はは Onyomi: シ Lesson: 18 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds: 姉 (あね)"	"elder sister 姉 画数8 442 Details Story Dictionary 姉 elder sister Heisig's Of all the women of the family, it is the elder sister who has the duty to go to market to do the shopping. "lungs Details Story Dictionary 肺 lungs Heisig's One is surprised, strolling through the market, to find among the meats hung out for sale a slab marked: lungs. Koohii #1 LUNGS are a PART of the BODY that can be found at any meat MARKET or black MARKET. Koohii #2 The PART OF THE BODY most important if you work at a MARKET is your LUNGS so that you can shout out at the top of your voice ""IRASSHAIMASEEE"" to attract customers. Primitives lungs, moon, month, flesh, part of the body, market, top hat, towel 肺(はい): lung Kunyomi: Onyomi: ハイ Lesson: 18 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"	"lungs 肺 画数9 443 Details Story Dictionary 肺 lungs Heisig's One is surprised, strolling through the market, to find among the meats hung out for sale a slab marked: lungs. "sash Details Story Dictionary 帯 sash Heisig's The part of the apron where one finds the buckle (represented pictorially by the first 5 strokes) is on the sash. Koohii #1 First, note that the top half of the kanji consists of one and mountain. Of course, the ""number 1"" mountain in Japan is Mt. Fuji. The bottom half, under Mt. Fuji, consists of crown and towel. Now for the story. Archaeologists digging under Mt. Fuji (Japan´s #1 mountain) in an ancient royal tomb (they know it´s royal because of the crown) discover what looks like a towel, but after they clean it up, they see it is actually a splendid royal sash for the king´s kimono. Koohii #2 Beautiful ""Miss Housewife Japan"" is on posters everywhere, cooking right before Mt. Fuji (the number one mountain) while wearing nothing but her crown, and an apron tied with a sash. (hodgepodge of mspertus, zwarte_kat, et al, with a jot of hadaka apron to focus the image.). Primitives sash, buckle, apron, crown, towel 一帯(いったい): a region, a zone, the whole place 帯びる(おびる): to wear, to carry, to be entrusted, to have, to take on, to have a trace of, to be tinged with 携帯(けいたい): carrying something 世帯(せたい): household 連帯(れんたい): solidarity 帯(おび): kimono sash 温帯(おんたい): temperate zone 寒帯(かんたい): frigid zone 地帯(ちたい): area, zone 熱帯(ねったい): tropics 包帯(ほうたい): bandage, dressing Kunyomi: お.びる、おび Onyomi: タイ Lesson: 18 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 帯びる (お.びる), 帯 (おび)"	"sash 帯 画数10 444 Details Story Dictionary 帯 sash Heisig's The part of the apron where one finds the buckle (represented pictorially by the first 5 strokes) is on the sash. Koohii #1 First, note that the top half of the kanji consists of one and mountain. Of course, the ""number 1"" mountain in Japan is Mt. Fuji. The bottom half, under Mt. Fuji, consists of crown and towel. Now for the story. Archaeologists digging under Mt. Fuji (Japan´s #1 mountain) in an ancient royal tomb (they know it´s royal because of the crown) discover what looks like a towel, but after they clean it up, they see it is actually a splendid royal sash for the king´s kimono. Koohii #2 Beautiful ""Miss Housewife Japan"" is on posters everywhere, cooking right before Mt. Fuji (the number one mountain) while wearing nothing but her crown, and an apron tied with a sash. (hodgepodge of mspertus, zwarte_kat, et al, with a jot of hadaka apron to focus the image.). Primitives sash, buckle, apron, crown, towel 一帯(いったい): a region, a zone, the whole place 帯びる(おびる): to wear, to carry, to be entrusted, to have, to take on, to have a trace of, to be tinged with 携帯(けいたい): carrying something 世帯(せたい): household 連帯(れんたい): solidarity 帯(おび): kimono sash 温帯(おんたい): temperate zone 寒帯(かんたい): frigid zone 地帯(ちたい): area, zone 熱帯(ねったい): tropics 包帯(ほうたい): bandage, dressing Kunyomi: お.びる、おび Onyomi: タイ Lesson: 18 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 帯びる (お.びる), 帯 (おび)"
"stagnate Details Story Dictionary 滞 stagnate Heisig's People that have been ""sashed"" to something (whether their mother's apron strings or a particular job) for too long become like water that has stopped moving: they start to stagnate. Koohii #1 History of the first karate blackbelts: In those days, it was often difficult to find fresh, clean water, so samurai usually had to wash their sashes in stagnant puddles. The longer one had been studying martial arts, the older the sash on one´s karate uniform and, therefore, the darker the color. So why weren´t their karate uniforms black too? Never seen a ninja???? Koohii #2 A moat is a stagnate ring of water like an obi (sash) of water tied around the castle. Primitives stagnate, water, water droplets, water pistol, sash, buckle, apron, crown, towel 滞納(たいのう): non-payment, default 停滞(ていたい): stagnation, tie-up, congestion, retention, accumulation, falling into arrears 滞る(とどこおる): to stagnate, to be delayed 渋滞(じゅうたい): congestion (e.g. traffic), delay, stagnation 滞在(たいざい): stay, sojourn Kunyomi: とどこお.る Onyomi: タイ、テイ Lesson: 18 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 滞る (とどこお.る)"	"stagnate 滞 画数13 445 Details Story Dictionary 滞 stagnate Heisig's People that have been ""sashed"" to something (whether their mother's apron strings or a particular job) for too long become like water that has stopped moving: they start to stagnate. Koohii #1 History of the first karate blackbelts: In those days, it was often difficult to find fresh, clean water, so samurai usually had to wash their sashes in stagnant puddles. The longer one had been studying martial arts, the older the sash on one´s karate uniform and, therefore, the darker the color. So why weren´t their karate uniforms black too? Never seen a ninja???? Koohii #2 A moat is a stagnate ring of water like an obi (sash) of water tied around the castle. Primitives stagnate, water, water droplets, water pistol, sash, buckle, apron, crown, towel 滞納(たいのう): non-payment, default 停滞(ていたい): stagnation, tie-up, congestion, retention, accumulation, falling into arrears 滞る(とどこおる): to stagnate, to be delayed 渋滞(じゅうたい): congestion (e.g. traffic), delay, stagnation 滞在(たいざい): stay, sojourn Kunyomi: とどこお.る Onyomi: タイ、テイ Lesson: 18 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 滞る (とどこお.る)"
thorn Details Story Dictionary 刺 thorn Heisig's Thorns grow on a bush here that has wrapped itself around a tree like a belt, cutting into the poor tree like little sabers. Koohii #1 A TREE with a BELT wrapped around the middle. If you tighten the BELT, hundreds of tiny SABERS pop out of the tree in all directions, looking like THORNS. Koohii #2 The BELT TREE has THORNS like SABERS. Primitives thorn, tree, wood, belt, sword, sabre, saber 刺繍(ししゅう): embroidery 刺(とげ): thorn, splinter, spine, biting words 刺さる(ささる): stick, be stuck 刺身(さしみ): sliced raw fish 刺す(さす): pierce, stab, prick, thrust, bite, sting, pin down 刺激(しげき): stimulus, impetus, incentive, excitement, irritation, encouragement, motivation 名刺(めいし): business card Kunyomi: さ.す、さ.さる、さ.し、さし、とげ Onyomi: シ Lesson: 18 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 刺さる (さ.さる), 刺す (さ.す)	thorn 刺 画数8 446 Details Story Dictionary 刺 thorn Heisig's Thorns grow on a bush here that has wrapped itself around a tree like a belt, cutting into the poor tree like little sabers. "system Details Story Dictionary 制 system My Story [Cow body (made up) + realistic sword] The *cow boy* and his *realistic sword* fought off the racist system Koohii #1 The system for making leather belts involves slicing up a cow with a sword. Koohii #2 Why all the gore and violence? How about a samurai cow? He doesn´t have to be a violent samurai, either. He only wears the sword because he´s part of the bushi SYSTEM. Actually, he studies ikebana, shodo, and zen. Imagine him sitting cross-legged in a Zen temple (a very Special Zen temple). The master asks him if a dog has buddha nature and, shifting the swords in his belt, he calmly replies, ""Moo!"". Primitives system, cow, belt, sword, sabre, saber 規制(きせい): regulation 強制(きょうせい): obligation, coercion, compulsion, enforcement 制(せい): system, organization, imperial command, laws, regulation, control, government, suppression, restraint, holding back, establishment 制裁(せいさい): restraint, sanctions, punishment 制する(せいする): to control, to command, to get the better of 制定(せいてい): enactment, establishment, creation 制服(せいふく): uniform 制約(せいやく): limitation, restriction, condition, constraints 統制(とうせい): regulation, control 抑制(よくせい): suppression 制限(せいげん): restriction, restraint, limitation 制作(せいさく): work (film, book) 制度(せいど): system, institution, organization 専制(せんせい): despotism, autocracy 体制(たいせい): order, system, structure, set-up, organization Kunyomi: Onyomi: セイ Lesson: 18 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds:"	"system 制 画数8 447 Details Story Dictionary 制 system My Story [Cow body (made up) + realistic sword] The *cow boy* and his *realistic sword* fought off the racist system Koohii #1 The system for making leather belts involves slicing up a cow with a sword. Koohii #2 Why all the gore and violence? How about a samurai cow? He doesn´t have to be a violent samurai, either. He only wears the sword because he´s part of the bushi SYSTEM. Actually, he studies ikebana, shodo, and zen. Imagine him sitting cross-legged in a Zen temple (a very Special Zen temple). The master asks him if a dog has buddha nature and, shifting the swords in his belt, he calmly replies, ""Moo!"". Primitives system, cow, belt, sword, sabre, saber 規制(きせい): regulation 強制(きょうせい): obligation, coercion, compulsion, enforcement 制(せい): system, organization, imperial command, laws, regulation, control, government, suppression, restraint, holding back, establishment 制裁(せいさい): restraint, sanctions, punishment 制する(せいする): to control, to command, to get the better of 制定(せいてい): enactment, establishment, creation 制服(せいふく): uniform 制約(せいやく): limitation, restriction, condition, constraints 統制(とうせい): regulation, control 抑制(よくせい): suppression 制限(せいげん): restriction, restraint, limitation 制作(せいさく): work (film, book) 制度(せいど): system, institution, organization 専制(せんせい): despotism, autocracy 体制(たいせい): order, system, structure, set-up, organization Kunyomi: Onyomi: セイ Lesson: 18 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds:"
made in... Details Story Dictionary 製 made in... Heisig's A label indicating that a garment was made in U.S.A. or Taiwan or Japan is itself a symbol for the systematization of the garment industry. Koohii #1 Made in china - a system of exploitation . making garments for nothing. Koohii #2 A SYSTEMATICALLY made GARMENT will no doubt have MADE IN on the label. Primitives made in…, system, cow, belt, sword, sabre, saber, hat, scarf, cloth, clothes, clothing, garment 製(せい): -made, make 製鉄(せいてつ): iron manufacture 製法(せいほう): manufacturing method, recipe, formula 作製(さくせい): manufacture 製作(せいさく): manufacture, production 製造(せいぞう): manufacture, production 製品(せいひん): manufactured goods Kunyomi: Onyomi: セイ Lesson: 18 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	made in... 製 画数14 448 Details Story Dictionary 製 made in... revolve Details Story Dictionary 転 revolve My Story #New primitive:# {云} = *rising cloud*, eg. of dust, smoke, vapor etc. The car's wheels revolve, sending up a *rising cloud* of dust. Koohii #1 The REVOLVING wheels of the car (with REVOLVER blaring on the stereo) kicked up RISING CLOUDS of dust. Koohii #2 Just a note to remember the cloud primative: The name of Goku´s pet cloud that he used to help him rise (fly) in the Dragonball anime series (and also the scientific name for a certain type of cloud) is Nimbus [ http://www.rpgclassics.com/shrines/gba/dbztlog/screen2.jpg ]. The katakana-ization of this is {ニム}バス, so the rising cloud primative is just an abbreviation of that name written from top to bottom in the old Japanese style. Primitives revolve, car, rising cloud, two, elbow, wall 逆転(ぎゃくてん): (sudden) change, reversal, turn-around, coming from behind (baseball) 自転(じてん): rotation, spin 転回(てんかい): revolution, rotation 転換(てんかん): convert, divert 転居(てんきょ): moving, changing residence 転勤(てんきん): transfer, transmission 転校(てんこう): change schools 転じる(てんじる): to turn, to shift, to alter, to distract 転任(てんにん): change of post 転落(てんらく): fall, degradation, slump 移転(いてん): moving, transfer, demise 運転(うんてん): operation, motion, driving 回転(かいてん): rotation, revolution, turning 転がす(ころがす): roll (transitive) 転がる(ころがる): roll, tumble 転ぶ(ころぶ): fall down, fall over 転々(てんてん): rolling about, moving from place to place, being passed around repeatedly 運転手(うんてんしゅ): drive 自転車(じてんしゃ): bicycle Kunyomi: ころ.がる、ころ.げる、ころ.がす、ころ.ぶ、まろ.ぶ、うたた、うつ.る、くる.めく Onyomi: テン Lesson: 18 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds: 転がす (ころ.がす), 転がる (ころ.がる), 転げる (ころ.げる), 転ぶ (ころ.ぶ)	revolve 転 画数11 449 Details Story Dictionary 転 revolve My Story #New primitive:# {云} = *rising cloud*, eg. of dust, smoke, vapor etc. The car's wheels revolve, sending up a *rising cloud* of dust. "technique Details Story Dictionary 芸 technique My Story [Flower + rising cloud {云}(primitive)] His technique was graceful, he used a flower to *decapitate twin cows*; his technique, like Hannibal Lecter Used in 芸者 (げいしゃ) and 芸術 (げいじゅつ, see {術} ). Koohii #1 Imagine an old Kung-fu movie: ""Try my rising cloud flower technique!!!"" smash pow crack!! . Koohii #2 One technique to smoke weed is to vaporize it and inhale those rising clouds to create a stronger effect. Primitives technique, flowers, rising cloud, two, elbow, wall 学芸(がくげい): arts and sciences, liberal arts 手芸(しゅげい): handicrafts 園芸(えんげい): horticulture, gardening 芸術(げいじゅつ): fine art, the arts 芸能(げいのう): public entertainment, accomplishments, attainments 工芸(こうげい): industrial arts 文芸(ぶんげい): literature, art and literature Kunyomi: う.える、のり、わざ Onyomi: ゲイ、ウン Lesson: 18 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds:"	"technique 芸 画数7 450 Details Story Dictionary 芸 technique My Story [Flower + rising cloud {云}(primitive)] His technique was graceful, he used a flower to *decapitate twin cows*; his technique, like Hannibal Lecter Used in 芸者 (げいしゃ) and 芸術 (げいじゅつ, see {術} ). rain Details Story Dictionary 雨 rain Heisig's This kanji, also a primitive, is one of the clearest instances we have of a complex pictograph. The top line is the sky, the next 3 strokes a pair of clouds, and the final 4 dots the rain collected there and waiting to fall. * As a primitive it can mean either rain or weather in general. Because it takes so much space, it usually has to be contracted into a crown by shortening the second and third strokes into a crown. Koohii #1 From the ceiling hangs a towel dripping four drops like RAIN. Koohii #2 Towel hung out on a line to ....oops, it´s rain. Primitives rain, rain, weather 雨具(あまぐ): rain gear 雨天(うてん): rainy weather 梅雨(つゆ): rainy season, rain during the rainy season 雨戸(あまど): (sliding) storm door 雨(あめ): rain Kunyomi: あめ、あま-、-さめ Onyomi: ウ Lesson: 18 Jouyou: 1 JLPT Level: 5 Compounds: 雨 (あま), 雨 (あめ)	rain 雨 画数8 451 Details Story Dictionary 雨 rain Heisig's This kanji, also a primitive, is one of the clearest instances we have of a complex pictograph. The top line is the sky, the next 3 strokes a pair of clouds, and the final 4 dots the rain collected there and waiting to fall. * As a primitive it can mean either rain or weather in general. Because it takes so much space, it usually has to be contracted into a crown by shortening the second and third strokes into a crown. Koohii #1 From the ceiling hangs a towel dripping four drops like RAIN. Koohii #2 Towel hung out on a line to ....oops, it´s rain. Primitives rain, rain, weather 雨具(あまぐ): rain gear 雨天(うてん): rainy weather 梅雨(つゆ): rainy season, rain during the rainy season 雨戸(あまど): (sliding) storm door 雨(あめ): rain Kunyomi: あめ、あま-、-さめ Onyomi: ウ Lesson: 18 Jouyou: 1 JLPT Level: 5 Compounds: 雨 (あま), 雨 (あめ)
cloud Details Story Dictionary 雲 cloud Heisig's Here is the full character for cloud from which the primitive for a rising cloud derives. Clouds begin with vapors rising up in small clouds from the surface of the earth, and then gathering to make clouds that eventually dump their rain back on the earth. Koohii #1 Every rising cloud is a potential rain cloud. (Thanks astridtops). Koohii #2 Every cloud is a potential rain cloud. Primitives cloud, rain, weather, rising cloud, two, elbow, wall 雲(くも): the clouds Kunyomi: くも、-ぐも Onyomi: ウン Lesson: 18 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 雲 (くも)	cloud 雲 画数12 452 Details Story Dictionary 雲 cloud Heisig's Here is the full character for cloud from which the primitive for a rising cloud derives. Clouds begin with vapors rising up in small clouds from the surface of the earth, and then gathering to make clouds that eventually dump their rain back on the earth. Koohii #1 Every rising cloud is a potential rain cloud. (Thanks astridtops). Koohii #2 Every cloud is a potential rain cloud. Primitives cloud, rain, weather, rising cloud, two, elbow, wall 雲(くも): the clouds Kunyomi: くも、-ぐも Onyomi: ウン Lesson: 18 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 雲 (くも)
cloudy weather Details Story Dictionary 曇 cloudy weather Heisig's We refer to days when the sun is covered by the clouds as cloudy weather. Koohii #1 Cloudy weather is when a cloud blocks the sun (up above). Koohii #2 In cloudy weather, the sun is still there even if obscured by the clouds...　RTK2:　ドン　曇天　どんてん(cloudy skies). Primitives cloudy weather, sun, day, cloud, rain, weather, rising cloud, two, elbow, wall 曇り(くもり): cloudiness, cloudy weather, shadow 曇る(くもる): become cloudy, become dim Kunyomi: くも.る Onyomi: ドン Lesson: 18 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 曇る (くも.る)	cloudy weather 曇 画数16 453 Details Story Dictionary 曇 cloudy weather Heisig's We refer to days when the sun is covered by the clouds as cloudy weather. thunder Details Story Dictionary 雷 thunder Heisig's The full rumble and roar and terror of thunder is best felt not with your head tucked under your pillow safe in bed, but out in an open rice field where you can get the real feel of the weather. Koohii #1 If it´s raining and you´re standing in the middle of a rice field, you´re sure to soon become acquainted with the thunder up close and personal. Koohii #2 Thunder is a sure sign of rain coming. When you hear the thunder, you´ve got time to get out of the field before it starts raining. Primitives thunder, rain, weather, rice field, brains 雷(いかずち): thunder 雷(かみなり): thunder Kunyomi: かみなり Onyomi: ライ Lesson: 18 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 雷 (かみなり)	thunder 雷 画数13 454 Details Story Dictionary 雷 thunder Heisig's The full rumble and roar and terror of thunder is best felt not with your head tucked under your pillow safe in bed, but out in an open rice field where you can get the real feel of the weather. frost Details Story Dictionary 霜 frost Heisig's Think of frost as a cooperative venture, an inter-action of the malevolent forces of weather that sit around a conference table and finally decide to allow a very light amount of moisture to fall just before a short and sudden freeze. Koohii #1 FROST is kind of an inter-weather, phenomenon, something between rain, snow and freezing temp’s. Koohii #2 The freezing RAIN formed FROST on the TREE right before your EYES. If you want, frost-y then think Frost Tree to get to the mnemonic. SECOND STORY: FROSTY the snowman? It´s RAIN that FROSTS that can then INTER-act with the kids, till he melts of course. Primitives frost, rain, weather, inter, Inter Milan, tree, wood, eye 霜(しも): frost Kunyomi: しも Onyomi: ソウ Lesson: 18 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 霜 (しも)	frost 霜 画数17 455 Details Story Dictionary 霜 frost Heisig's Think of frost as a cooperative venture, an inter-action of the malevolent forces of weather that sit around a conference table and finally decide to allow a very light amount of moisture to fall just before a short and sudden freeze. Koohii #1 FROST is kind of an inter-weather, phenomenon, something between rain, snow and freezing temp’s. Koohii #2 The freezing RAIN formed FROST on the TREE right before your EYES. If you want, frost-y then think Frost Tree to get to the mnemonic. SECOND STORY: FROSTY the snowman? It´s RAIN that FROSTS that can then INTER-act with the kids, till he melts of course. Primitives frost, rain, weather, inter, Inter Milan, tree, wood, eye 霜(しも): frost Kunyomi: しも Onyomi: ソウ Lesson: 18 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 霜 (しも)
winter Details Story Dictionary 冬 winter Heisig's Walking legs slipping on the ice are a sure sign of winter. Koohii #1 Don´t slip off your legs in winter, strap two skis to your feet. Koohii #2 In winter my walking legs feel like blocks of ice. Primitives winter, walking legs, ice 冬眠(とうみん): hibernation, winter sleep 冬(ふゆ): winter Kunyomi: ふゆ Onyomi: トウ Lesson: 18 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds: 冬 (ふゆ)	winter 冬 画数5 456 Details Story Dictionary 冬 winter Heisig's Walking legs slipping on the ice are a sure sign of winter. Primitives winter, walking legs, ice 冬眠(とうみん): hibernation, winter sleep 冬(ふゆ): winter Kunyomi: ふゆ Onyomi: トウ Lesson: 18 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds: 冬 (ふゆ)
heavens Details Story Dictionary 天 heavens Heisig's This character is meant to be a pictograph of a great man, said to represent the Lord of the Heavens. (You may, of course, use the elements ceiling and St. Bernard instead.) * The primitive can mean either the heaven of eternal bliss or the general term for sky, the heavens. Pay special attention to the fact that in its primitive form the first stroke is written right to left, rather like the first stroke of thousand (Frame 40), rather than left to right. From the next character, we shall give it the primitive meaning of a witch. Koohii #1 If you think of the sky as a ceiling above our heads, here you have the heavens as the largest ceiling you could ever imagine. As Heisig pointed out, nothing comes above the ceiling primitive thus the order of primitives is taken care of. Koohii #2 The ceiling that all large dogs aspire to go to is known as heaven. After all, All Dogs Go to Heaven. Primitives heavens, heavens, one, ceiling, large 天(あまつ): heavenly, imperial 天地(あめつち): heaven and earth, the universe, nature, top and bottom, realm, sphere, world 雨天(うてん): rainy weather 天皇(すめらぎ): Emperor of Japan 晴天(せいてん): fine weather 先天的(せんてんてき): a priori, inborn, innate, inherent, congenital, hereditary 天国(てんごく): paradise, heaven, Kingdom of Heaven 天才(てんさい): genius, prodigy, natural gift 天災(てんさい): natural calamity, disaster 天井(てんじょう): ceiling, ceiling price 天体(てんたい): heavenly body 天候(てんこう): weather 天然(てんねん): nature, spontaneity 天皇(てんのう): Emperor of Japan 天気予報(てんきよほう): weather forecast 天気(てんき): weather, the elements, fine weather Kunyomi: あまつ、あめ、あま- Onyomi: テン Lesson: 18 Jouyou: 1 JLPT Level: 5 Compounds: 天 (あめ)	heavens 天 画数4 457 Details Story Dictionary 天 heavens Heisig's This character is meant to be a pictograph of a great man, said to represent the Lord of the Heavens. bewitched Details Story Dictionary 妖 bewitched Heisig's You are bewitched by a woman who is, of course, a witch. Koohii #1 If you don´t want to get bewitched (and who would?), then avoid any woman you see carrying what might appear to be a sapling. It´s really a wand in disguise, and if you´re not aware you might get bewitched. Koohii #2 I was bewitched by the woman fairy (like an angel, but not as tall). Primitives bewitched, woman, sapling Kunyomi: あや.しい、なま.めく、わざわ.い Onyomi: ヨウ Lesson: 18 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: Compounds: 妖しい (あや.しい)	bewitched 妖 画数7 458 Details Story Dictionary 妖 bewitched Heisig's You are bewitched by a woman who is, of course, a witch. irrigate Details Story Dictionary 沃 irrigate Heisig's Suffering from a drought, the farmers call on a witch who conjures up water to irrigate their crops. Koohii #1 You use water to irrigate your saplings. Koohii #2 A fairy needs a lot of water to irrigate those beating wings, so you have make sure they drink a lot to be well irrigated (see bewitched (#2078). "bridge Details Story Dictionary 橋 bridge Heisig's The bridge shown here is made of trees in their natural form, except that the trunks have been carved into the forms of angels, a sort of ""Ponte degli Angeli."" Koohii #1 The nicest bridge is not in Hollywood or Los Angeles, but in San Francisco. Koohii #2 A small 5 year old child has lost her mother in a tragic death. Her family tells her, ""Don´t worry, your mom is an angel now, in heaven, watching over you."" The small girl takes this very literally and is found one day, gathering pieces of wood. Her dad asks her, ""What are you doing with that wood?"" ""I´m trying to build a bridge to heaven to visit the angels."". Primitives bridge, tree, wood, angel, heavens, mouth, hood, mouth, mouth2 桟橋(さんきょう): wharf, bridge, jetty, pier 橋渡し(はしわたし): bridge building, mediation 鉄橋(てっきょう): railway bridge, iron bridge 橋(はし): bridge Kunyomi: はし Onyomi: キョウ Lesson: 18 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 橋 (はし)"	"bridge 橋 画数16 460 Details Story Dictionary 橋 bridge Heisig's The bridge shown here is made of trees in their natural form, except that the trunks have been carved into the forms of angels, a sort of ""Ponte degli Angeli."" Koohii #1 The nicest bridge is not in Hollywood or Los Angeles, but in San Francisco. Koohii #2 A small 5 year old child has lost her mother in a tragic death. Her family tells her, ""Don´t worry, your mom is an angel now, in heaven, watching over you."" The small girl takes this very literally and is found one day, gathering pieces of wood. Her dad asks her, ""What are you doing with that wood?"" ""I´m trying to build a bridge to heaven to visit the angels."". Primitives bridge, tree, wood, angel, heavens, mouth, hood, mouth, mouth2 桟橋(さんきょう): wharf, bridge, jetty, pier 橋渡し(はしわたし): bridge building, mediation 鉄橋(てっきょう): railway bridge, iron bridge 橋(はし): bridge Kunyomi: はし Onyomi: キョウ Lesson: 18 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 橋 (はし)"
attractive Details Story Dictionary 嬌 attractive Heisig's Associating a particularly attractive woman you know with an angel should be no problem. Koohii #1 The most attractive woman in the world is obviously Angelina Jolie. Koohii #2 The most attractive of women are said to resemble angels. Similarly, angelic women tend to be attractive. stand up Details Story Dictionary 立 stand up Heisig's This picture of a vase standing up has its meaning extended to represent the general posture of anything standing up. * Used as a primitive, it can also mean vase. Using its kanji meaning, think of something standing up that is normally lying down, or something standing up in an unusual way. Koohii #1 A vase that can´t stand up won´t be a vase for long. Koohii #2 He was a stand up guy: he´d lend you the top hat he wears everyday if you asked, and he will turn everything upside down to help you find your tools. Primitives stand up, vase, stand up 確立(かくりつ): establishment 気立て(きだて): disposition, nature 公立(こうりつ): public (institution) 孤立(こりつ): isolation, helplessness 逆立ち(さかだち): handstand, headstand 仕立てる(したてる): to tailor, to make, to prepare, to train, to send (a messenger) 樹立(じゅりつ): establish, create 自立(じりつ): independence, self-reliance 設立(せつりつ): establishment, foundation, institution 創立(そうりつ): establishment, founding, organization 立方(たちかた): dancing (geisha) 立ち寄る(たちよる): to stop by, to drop in for a short visit 中立(ちゅうりつ): neutrality 取り立てる(とりたてる): to collect, to extort, to appoint, to promote 成り立つ(なりたつ): to conclude, to consist of, to be practical (logical feasible viable), to hold true 腹立ち(はらだち): anger 役立つ(やくだつ): to be useful, to be helpful, to serve the purpose 立体(りったい): solid body 立法(りっぽう): legislation, lawmaking 両立(りょうりつ): compatibility, coexistence, standing together 組み立てる(くみたてる): assemble, set up, construct 国立(こくりつ): national 献立(こんだて): menu, program, schedule 私立(しりつ): private (establishment) 成立(せいりつ): coming into existence, arrangements, establishment, completion 対立(たいりつ): confrontation, opposition, antagonism 立ち上がる(たちあがる): stand up 立ち止まる(たちどまる): stop, halt, stand still 立場(たちば): standpoint, position, situation 独立(どくりつ): independence, self-support 目立つ(めだつ): be conspicuous, stand out 夕立(ゆうだち): (sudden) evening shower (rain) 立派(りっぱ): splendid, fine, handsome, elegant, imposing, prominent, legal, legitimate 立てる(たてる): raise, set up 役に立つ(やくにたつ): useful 立つ(たつ): to stand Kunyomi: た.つ、-た.つ、た.ち-、た.てる、-た.てる、た.て-、たて-、-た.て、-だ.て、-だ.てる Onyomi: リツ、リュウ、リットル Lesson: 18 Jouyou: 1 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds: 立案 (りつあん), 起立 (きりつ), 独立 (どくりつ), 立つ (た.つ), 立てる (た.てる)	stand up 立 画数5 462 Details Story Dictionary 立 stand up Heisig's This picture of a vase standing up has its meaning extended to represent the general posture of anything standing up. * Used as a primitive, it can also mean vase. vie Details Story Dictionary 競 vie Heisig's Two teenagers are seen here standing up to one another, vying for the attention of their peers. Koohii #1 TWO twin BROTHERS are competing (VYING) for the title of who is the older BROTHER. The game is that they must balance a VASE on their head and the one who drops his looses and becomes the younger BROTHER! Koohii #2 Two crazy brothers vying for the guiness records books of stupidity by trying to stand on their heads the longest. "sovereign Details Story Dictionary 帝 sovereign My Story [Stand up + towel {巾}] Koohii #1 The crazy sovereign stands up from his throne, wearing nothing but a crown and a towel. That´s why they try to keep him locked up in the castle away from the public. Koohii #2 This one is so tricky for me. The key is to remember that the bottom stroke on the standing element takes those little crown ""winglets"" on the right and left. The most effective image might be of QEII (who is quite short) using her crown as a kind of stool. She´s standing on her crown rummaging through a high cupboard looking for her apron. I guess the sovereign´s servants have the day off. Primitives sovereign, vase, stand up, apron, crown, towel Kunyomi: みかど Onyomi: テイ Lesson: 18 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"	"sovereign 帝 画数9 466 Details Story Dictionary 帝 sovereign My Story [Stand up + towel {巾}] Koohii #1 The crazy sovereign stands up from his throne, wearing nothing but a crown and a towel. "renunciation Details Story Dictionary 諦 renunciation Heisig's The key word renunciation has to do with the wisdom and clarity of mind in knowing when to ""let go."" This is what makes the words of acquiescense sovern. Koohii #1 The words of the sovereign king inspire the people: never give up! Never surrender! Okay...maybe it wasn´t a king. Koohii #2 Anytime I think to give up Japanese, I remember giving my word that I would become sovereign of Japanese! And I watch あきら to get pumped about it. Note: to give up - 諦める is read あきらめる). Primitives give up, say, words, keitai, mouth, sovereign, vase, stand up, apron, crown, towel 諦め(あきらめ): resignation, acceptance, consolation 諦める(あきらめる): give up, abandon Kunyomi: あき.らめる、あきら.める、つまびらか、まこと Onyomi: テイ、タイ Lesson: 18 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: Compounds: 諦める (あきら.める)"	"renunciation 諦 画数16 467 Details Story Dictionary 諦 renunciation Heisig's The key word renunciation has to do with the wisdom and clarity of mind in knowing when to ""let go."" juvenile Details Story Dictionary 童 juvenile Heisig's This frame shows up the image of a juvenile hacker standing on top of a computer, or rather jumping up and down on it, because it refused to come up with the right answer. Koohii #1 The juvenile stood on top of his computer and broke it. Noob. Koohii #2 The movie Zoolander is a little JUVENILE and silly, but I love it nonetheless. Just remember Owen Wilson standing on the desk, hitting the computer like a monkey. (The files are IN the computer - IN the computer...). "pupil Details Story Dictionary 瞳 pupil Heisig's Begin with the double meaning of the key word pupil: ""student"" and the ""the apple of one's eye."" Now all you have to do is dwell on the phrase ""juvenile of one's eye"" (the meaning here) until it provides you with an image. Koohii #1 In Japanese comics, the eye´s of juvenilles all have enormouse pupils. Koohii #2 WARNING: This kanji only means the pupil of the eye. It can be confusing to use a story that has pupil meaning student in it. "bell Details Story Dictionary 鐘 bell Heisig's This bell is made of cheap metal, and so badly made that when you ring it, it lets out a noise like the ""bellowing"" of juveniles who aren't getting their own way. "make a deal Details Story Dictionary 商 make a deal Heisig's See the peddlar standing atop his motorcycle helmet as if it were a soapbox, hawking his wares to passersby. The legs and mouth represent the tools of the trade of making a deal any way you can. Koohii #1 I use what I think is the real etymology for this kanji which is so shocking it sticks. The STANDING member at the top is a certain part of the body that all men have and it is approaching the HOLE between TWO LEGS (the HOOD) with extra marks to show they are FLESHY - ie a womans legs. So this shows the oldest DEAL of all time - prostitution. Koohii #2 Slick Willy standing on the motorcycle helmet he´s trying to sell you to demonstrate how rugged it is. His legs crash through the top of it and after a moment of awkward silence his mouth opens and says, ""hey, we can still make a deal."". Primitives make a deal, vase, stand up, alien, hood, human legs, mouth 商人(あきうど): trader, shopkeeper, merchant 商(しょう): quotient 商業(しょうぎょう): commerce, trade, business 商社(しょうしゃ): trading company, firm 商店(しょうてん): shop, business firm 商人(しょうにん): trader, shopkeeper, merchant 商売(しょうばい): trade, business, commerce, transaction, occupation 商品(しょうひん): commodity, goods, stock, merchandise Kunyomi: あきな.う Onyomi: ショウ Lesson: 18 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 商う (あきな.う)"	"make a deal 商 画数11 471 Details Story Dictionary 商 make a deal Heisig's See the peddlar standing atop his motorcycle helmet as if it were a soapbox, hawking his wares to passersby. "legitimate wife Details Story Dictionary 嫡 legitimate wife Heisig's The phrase legitimate wife would have no meaning if there were not such things as ""illegitimate wives,"" taken because one's legal woman has turned into an antique. The very offense of the idea should help you remember the kanji. Koohii #1 Legitmate wifes tend to be women who are antiques in contrast to the young bit of illigitmate fluff on the side. Koohii #2 Your legitimate wife is like an antique bong. Its not your favorite but you still hit it sometimes... What program could be more suitable for the whole family than the ""antiques road(show)"". Koohii #2 That old thing in your attic might be suitable to be shown on the Antiques Roadshow. enemy Details Story Dictionary 敵 enemy My Story [Yosemite Sam/Antique(prim) {啇} + Director] Bugs Bunny was the *ENEMY* of *Yosemite Sam*. (as was the director of the cartoon, which is why Sam always lost!) Koohii #1 The taskmaster became my enemy for life when he smashed the antique vase holding my wife´s ashes. Koohii #2 Indiana Jones is an enemy of taskmasters in search of antique artifacts. RTK2: 　テキ　敵地　てきち(enemy territory)...　　　　　　　　　　　Pure Group:　嫡440　適441　滴442 　摘657. (as was the director of the cartoon, which is why Sam always lost!) Koohii #1 The taskmaster became my enemy for life when he smashed the antique vase holding my wife´s ashes. Koohii #2 Indiana Jones is an enemy of taskmasters in search of antique artifacts. RTK2: 　テキ　敵地　てきち(enemy territory)...　　　　　　　　　　　Pure Group:　嫡440　適441　滴442 　摘657. Primitives enemy, antique, vase, stand up, hood, old, tombstone, gravestone, church, ten, needle, mouth, taskmaster 敵(かたき): enemy, rival 素敵(すてき): lovely, dreamy, beautiful, great, fantastic, superb, cool, capital 匹敵(ひってき): comparing with, match, rival, equal 敵(てき): foe, enemy, rival Kunyomi: かたき、あだ、かな.う Onyomi: テキ Lesson: 18 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 敵 (かたき)
spoon Details Story Dictionary 匕 spoon Heisig's This character, a pictograph of a spoon, is easy enough to remember, provided you keep it distinct from that for seven, where the first stroke is written left to right (the opposite of here) and cuts noticeably across the second. * As a primitive, this kanji can take on the additional meaning of someone sitting on the ground, of which it can also be considered a pictograph. In general, the second stroke does not cut through the first - or if it does in some fonts, only slightly. Koohii #1 To remember the primitive meaning, picture someone sitting on the ground performing Seppuku...with a spoon. http://tinyurl.com/co48k. Koohii #2 Not only is stroke order important, but also be sure to note the direction of a stroke. In both ´spoon´ and ´seven´, the first stroke is the horizontal one - but here it is written right to left in a downward flick, while in ´seven´ it is a strong line from left to right. Primitives spoon, sitting on the ground Kunyomi: さじ、さじのひ Onyomi: ヒ Lesson: 18 Jouyou: JLPT Level: Compounds:	spoon 匕 画数2 476 Details Story Dictionary 匕 spoon Heisig's This character, a pictograph of a spoon, is easy enough to remember, provided you keep it distinct from that for seven, where the first stroke is written left to right (the opposite of here) and cuts noticeably across the second. * As a primitive, this kanji can take on the additional meaning of someone sitting on the ground, of which it can also be considered a pictograph. In general, the second stroke does not cut through the first - or if it does in some fonts, only slightly. Koohii #1 To remember the primitive meaning, picture someone sitting on the ground performing Seppuku...with a spoon. http://tinyurl.com/co48k. Koohii #2 Not only is stroke order important, but also be sure to note the direction of a stroke. In both ´spoon´ and ´seven´, the first stroke is the horizontal one - but here it is written right to left in a downward flick, while in ´seven´ it is a strong line from left to right. Primitives spoon, sitting on the ground Kunyomi: さじ、さじのひ Onyomi: ヒ Lesson: 18 Jouyou: JLPT Level: Compounds:
scold Details Story Dictionary 叱 scold Heisig's Recall some particularly harsh scolding you got as a child in school. This character has you sitting on the ground in the corner as your teacher stands over you, her mouth wide open as she reprimands you in front of the entire class. Koohii #1 A kid gets scolded if they don´t put the spoon properly into their mouth when eating. Koohii #2 If I got scolded, I could expect a spoon of castor oil in my mouth. "aroma Details Story Dictionary 匂 aroma Heisig's You will have to imagine ""capturing"" a favorite aroma by having it gagged and bound up in a spoon. Koohii #1 The muchacho sits down bound up to enjoy his own aroma. Koohii #2 If you bind up a person and let him sit for several days, an unpleasant aroma will result. Koohii #2 After spooning for hours it´s about that time he got some head. Dayum woman. north Details Story Dictionary 北 north Heisig's The cold air from the north is so strong that we see two people sitting on the ground back to back, their arms interlocked so they don't blow away. (Pay special attention to the drawing of the first 3 strokes.) Koohii #1 Warning: The left part is NOT the primitive turtle! The stroke order is different. Sometimes it will look exactly the same but not always depending on the font / style used to draw this character. Be sure to study the difference! Koohii #2 In the north, the weather is so cold that people are often seen sitting back to back to preserve warmth. Primitives north, spoon, sitting on the ground 南北(なんぼく): south and north 北極(ほっきょく): North Pole 北(きた): north Kunyomi: きた Onyomi: ホク Lesson: 18 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 5 Compounds: 北 (きた)	north 北 画数5 480 Details Story Dictionary 北 north Heisig's The cold air from the north is so strong that we see two people sitting on the ground back to back, their arms interlocked so they don't blow away. "stature Details Story Dictionary 背 stature Heisig's One's stature is measured according to the ""northern-most"" part of the body. Koohii #1 While japanese people are generally small, people in the northern contryes have taller stature because of all the flesh they eat! Koohii #2 Up in the Great White North, we eat a lot of meat - thus giving us great STATURE. Mmmm.... baby seals. "descendants Details Story Dictionary 昆 descendants Heisig's By comparing apes with anthropoids, we not only discover the latter have descended from those progenitors educated in the higher branches, but that the very idea of seeing everything descended from everything else, one way or another, means that there is ""nothing new UNDER the sun."" Koohii #1 Grandparent spends all DAY COMPARING photos of their DESCENDANTS. Koohii #2 Japanese people have compared themselves as being descendants of the sun. (Amaterasu, the sun godesss). Sun, comparing = descendants. "all Details Story Dictionary 皆 all Heisig's Think of the housewives in TV commercials ""comparing the whiteness"" of their laundry across the fence, a typical advertisement for the popular detergent known as All. (If you don't know the brand, surely you've heard the phrases ""all-purpose detergent"" or ""all-temperature detergent."") Koohii #1 If you compare colors, you will find that white is produced from the mix of all the others. Koohii #2 Sometimes, Dr. Heisig´s keyword choices are really quite bizarre. This doesn´t mean all, it means everyone!! Picture two ku klux klansmen comparing whose skin is whiter...finally, they agree that everyone there is white. Primitives all, compare, spoon, sitting on the ground, white, dove, spoon2, sitting on the ground2 皆(みな): all, everything 皆さん(みなさん): everyone Kunyomi: みな、みんな Onyomi: カイ Lesson: 18 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 皆 (みな)"	"all 皆 画数9 484 Details Story Dictionary 皆 all Heisig's Think of the housewives in TV commercials ""comparing the whiteness"" of their laundry across the fence, a typical advertisement for the popular detergent known as All. "block letters Details Story Dictionary 楷 block letters Heisig's The key word refers to kanji that are written in full, squared form, as opposed to cursive writing which is more flowing andabbreviates some of the strokes. Here block letters are pictured as tidy rows of trees that are all the same size and can be read easily by all, whatever calligraphic skills they possess. Koohii #1 Block letters (as opposed to cursive) are rigid and lifeless like wood; they're all the same size so that all can read them. Koohii #2 all the hiragana are in ""block letters"" on wooden blocks, like children's toys. Kunyomi: Onyomi: カイ Lesson: 18 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: Compounds:"	"block letters 楷 画数13 485 Details Story Dictionary 楷 block letters Heisig's The key word refers to kanji that are written in full, squared form, as opposed to cursive writing which is more flowing andabbreviates some of the strokes. Here block letters are pictured as tidy rows of trees that are all the same size and can be read easily by all, whatever calligraphic skills they possess. Koohii #1 Block letters (as opposed to cursive) are rigid and lifeless like wood; they're all the same size so that all can read them. Koohii #2 all the hiragana are in ""block letters"" on wooden blocks, like children's toys. Kunyomi: Onyomi: カイ Lesson: 18 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: Compounds:"
"orderliness Details Story Dictionary 諧 orderliness Heisig's The harmoney of ""a place for everything and everything in its place"" is applied here to the orderliness of all the words one speaks. Koohii #1 To have orderliness, your words must be in all the right places. Koohii #2 起立(きりつ)！ Hearing these words, all the students immediately stand at attention. The orderliness of classes in Japan is incredible. thirst Details Story Dictionary 渇 thirst Heisig's As you pass by the muchacho taking the siesta, he cries out that he is thirsty and asks for something to drink. So you turn the water hose on him. Koohii #1 You awaken from your siesta because you feel extremely thirsty so you go looking for some water. Koohii #2 The muchacho taking his SIESTA cries out that he is THIRSTY. So you pull out a bottle of WATER and pretend you´re going to give it to him...but then you dump it all on the ground before his eyes. HAHA, sucked in muchacho!! audience Details Story Dictionary 謁 audience Heisig's Imagine an audience with the emperor or the pope in which all those in attendance are sitting down, leaning against the wall, sleeping like our muchacho on siesta as the honorable host delivers his speech. Koohii #1 The talk was so boring the audience took a siesta. Koohii #2 The man talking during his siesta (in his sleep) is saying strange things and drawing an audience. brown Details Story Dictionary 褐 brown Heisig's The color of the serape or cloak of our muchacho on siesta is a dull brown, the color this kanji indicates. Koohii #1 Why is my package late? Imagine a UPS driver dressed in BROWN garments taking a siesta. What can BROWN do for you? Koohii #2 Mexicans use a cloak (pancho) for their siestas. Their color is usually brown. hoarse Details Story Dictionary 喝 hoarse Heisig's When the muchacho on siesta looks up at you and opens his mouth to talk, his voice is so hoarse that you cannot understand him. Koohii #1 If you have a siesta with your mouthopen, you will wake up with a hoarse voice. Koohii #2 After taking a siesta, you find that your mouth is hoarse (after all you ARE thirsty remember). "kudzu Details Story Dictionary 葛 kudzu Heisig's Kudzu is a word taken over from Japanese to name the crawling vines that creep up and completely take over trees. Seeing it at its worst in the Georgia countryside makes it easy to understand why it has a reputation as the ""plague of the South."" From there it should not be hard to arrange the primitives, flowers and siesta into a memorable image. Koohii #1 Flower, siesta: The muchacho was not careful. He passed the warning signs and decided to hold a siesta in the kudzu field. The kudzu grew so fast, he was completely covered by it in a few hours and not able to escape. Now, the kudzu flowers mark his grave. Koohii #2 The muchacho takes a siesta under the flowers of the kudzu. Primitives kudzu, flowers, mexican bandit, muchacho, siesta, sun, day, aroma, bound up, spoon, sitting on the ground Kunyomi: つづら、くず Onyomi: カツ、カチ Lesson: 18 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: Compounds: 葛 (くず)"	"kudzu 葛 画数11 492 Details Story Dictionary 葛 kudzu Heisig's Kudzu is a word taken over from Japanese to name the crawling vines that creep up and completely take over trees. Seeing it at its worst in the Georgia countryside makes it easy to understand why it has a reputation as the ""plague of the South."" From there it should not be hard to arrange the primitives, flowers and siesta into a memorable image. Koohii #1 Flower, siesta: The muchacho was not careful. He passed the warning signs and decided to hold a siesta in the kudzu field. The kudzu grew so fast, he was completely covered by it in a few hours and not able to escape. Now, the kudzu flowers mark his grave. Koohii #2 The muchacho takes a siesta under the flowers of the kudzu. Primitives kudzu, flowers, mexican bandit, muchacho, siesta, sun, day, aroma, bound up, spoon, sitting on the ground Kunyomi: つづら、くず Onyomi: カツ、カチ Lesson: 18 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: Compounds: 葛 (くず)"
delicious Details Story Dictionary 旨 delicious Heisig's Something is so downright delicious that one spends the entire day with a spoon in hand gobbling it up. Koohii #1 Use a spoon to eat a DELICIOUS hot fudge sundae. Duh.. Koohii #2 It´s sooo delicious I could spoon it in all day. fat Details Story Dictionary 脂 fat Heisig's This kanji tells us that if you feed the flesh with too many delicious things, it soon picks up a thick layer of fat. Koohii #1 Every chef will tell you, fat is what make the meat taste delicious. Koohii #2 Fat is the most delicious part of the flesh. (Note this refers to physical fat, not the concept of obesity obese (#494)). "visit a shrine Details Story Dictionary 詣 visit a shrine Heisig's Here you ""savor your words"" as something delicious when you describe your recent visit to a shrine or pilgrimage site. Koohii #1 To fat, effete Japanophiles (cheerily munching on 肉まん in the back of the tour bus) hearing the words of the tour guide ""Now we will visit a shrine"" elicits squeals of joy. ""Oooooh, how absolutely delicious!"". Koohii #2 You visit a shrine to say your wishes and offer delicious offering to the gods. "I (one) Details Story Dictionary 壱 I (one) Heisig's The Roman numeral I - like that for II we met earlier in frame 379 - is only rarely used now. In the midst of all the samurai, we notice one in particular sitting on the ground with a crown on his head, indicating that he is ""number I"" in the current rankings. Koohii #1 I am ´the one´ , says the samurai with the crown around his waist and a spoon up his a***. Koohii #2 The samurai who has been crowned number one is so good he uses a spoon to fight with rather than a sword. Primitives 1 (one), samurai, crown, spoon, sitting on the ground Kunyomi: ひとつ Onyomi: イチ、イツ Lesson: 18 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"	"I (one) 壱 画数7 496 Details Story Dictionary 壱 I (one) Heisig's The Roman numeral I - like that for II we met earlier in frame 379 - is only rarely used now. plum Details Story Dictionary 梅 plum Heisig's Behind every Jack Horner's pie maker, a tree full of plums. Koohii #1 Plums actually grow on every single tree. What, you didn´t know that? They do. Orange trees, apple trees, cantaloupe trees. Plums are simply mutant fruits that have been installed in the root software of every single tree. I hear that some plum-loving scientists are working on a way to hack every tree´s genetic code so that every tree will bear nothing _but_ plums. Koohii #2 EVERY Japanese person asks you if you like UMEBOSHI. No I say, I prefer to eat my PLUMS fresh from the TREE. sea Details Story Dictionary 海 sea Heisig's Behind every drop of water, a sea from which it originated. Koohii #1 Every drop of water will eventually return to the sea. Koohii #2 As depicted in the classic SF film Fantastic Voyage, every drop of water is a sea, if you look close enough. Imagine peering through a microscope at a vast sea teeming with microbial life (and perhaps a minaturized submarine). Note: Take care not to confuse with ocean (#549). drought Details Story Dictionary 乾 drought Heisig's In times of drought anything at all will do. Here we see the victims begging for just a little mist for relief. Koohii #1 During a drought, everything begs for even a mist for relief. Koohii #2 Beggar has to drink mist because there is no water in the drought. I get this one confused with thirst 451 but try to remember that there is no water element beacuse it is a drought.
