abdomen Details Story Dictionary 腹 abdomen Heisig's If you double back (fold over) most animals - or people, for that matter - in the middle, the part of the body where the crease comes is the abdomen. Koohii #1 The only body part that doubles over. Koohii #2 Imagine getting punched in the abdomen, a fairly tender part of flesh, and instead of doubling forward, you double back. That would be pretty painful. "duplicate Details Story Dictionary 複 duplicate Heisig's In its original and etymologically transparent sense, to duplicate something means to double it back with a fold, like the fold of a cloak. Koohii #1 My girlfiend saw someone wearing the exact same (duplicate) outfit at a party, so she doubled back to change! Koohii #2 In Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban, Hermione uses a device called a ""time-turner"" to double back in time, but this creates duplicates. The smart thing to do would be to combine Hermione´s time-turner with Harry´s invisibility cloak. That way, one could double back in time without creating any visible duplicates. Primitives duplicate, cloak, fold back, double back, reclining, lying down, sun, day, walking legs 重複(じゅうふく): duplication, repetition, overlapping, redundancy, restoration 複合(ふくごう): composite, complex 複写(ふくしゃ): copy, duplicate 複数(ふくすう): plural, multiple 複雑(ふくざつ): complicated Kunyomi: Onyomi: フク Lesson: 18 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds:"	"duplicate 複 画数14 504 Details Story Dictionary 複 duplicate Heisig's In its original and etymologically transparent sense, to duplicate something means to double it back with a fold, like the fold of a cloak. lack Details Story Dictionary 欠 lack My Story To me, this kanji looks like a person with two arms and two legs, but who lacks a head. * As a primitive, it can mean either yawn or lack. Koohii #1 To me, this kanji looks like a person with two arms and two legs, but who lacks a head. Koohii #2 When your body lacks oxygen you yawn. blow Details Story Dictionary 吹 blow Heisig's To blow is really no more than a deliberate effort to make one's mouth lack all the air that is in it. Koohii #1 This is clearly a BLOWJOB, we can see the MOUTH and the LACK OF condom. (I am sorry for the image, but it sticks forever in your mind). Koohii #2 I keep confusing this with suck (#689). Consider someone blowing bubbles using their chewing gum because they´re lacking attention in class. Primitives blow, mouth, lack, yawn 吹奏(すいそう): playing wind instruments 吹雪(ふぶき): snow storm 吹く(ふく): blow (wind, etc.), emit Kunyomi: ふ.く Onyomi: スイ Lesson: 18 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 吹く (ふ.く)	blow 吹 画数7 506 Details Story Dictionary 吹 blow Heisig's To blow is really no more than a deliberate effort to make one's mouth lack all the air that is in it. cook Details Story Dictionary 炊 cook Heisig's Better to picture what happens when you do not pay attention to your work in the kitchen. Here we see a blazing fire and an inattentive, yawning cook who let things get out of control. Koohii #1 Japanese cooking sometimes lacks fire, e.g., sashimi. Koohii #2 This character shows the difference between a cook and a chef: a chef prepares food with passion and love; a cook only stands there with a pan over a fire, with no passion and just yawning. Primitives cook, fire, lack, yawn 炊事(すいじ): cooking, culinary arts 炊く(たく): boil, cook Kunyomi: た.く、-だ.き Onyomi: スイ Lesson: 18 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 炊く (た.く)	cook 炊 画数8 507 Details Story Dictionary 炊 cook Heisig's Better to picture what happens when you do not pay attention to your work in the kitchen. Koohii #2 This character shows the difference between a cook and a chef: a chef prepares food with passion and love; a cook only stands there with a pan over a fire, with no passion and just yawning. Primitives cook, fire, lack, yawn 炊事(すいじ): cooking, culinary arts 炊く(たく): boil, cook Kunyomi: た.く、-だ.き Onyomi: スイ Lesson: 18 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 炊く (た.く)
song Details Story Dictionary 歌 song Heisig's The song in this kanji is being sung by a chorus line of can-can girls. Why it should be eliciting nothing but yawning from the audience, I leave to you to decide. Koohii #1 Can-Can-ers lack the ability to sing a song, so they just dance. Koohii #2 Can-can dancers are supposed to be big-bosomed girls who dance. Yet these so called can-can dancers are flat-chested and singing a song, so audience of men is yawning in boredom. Primitives song, cancan, can, mouth, street, nail, spike, lack, yawn, can2, mouth2, street2, nail2, spike2 短歌(たんか): tanka, 31-syllable Japanese poem 歌手(かしゅ): singer 歌謡(かよう): song, ballad 歌(うた): song, poetry 歌う(うたう): sing Kunyomi: うた、うた.う Onyomi: カ Lesson: 18 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds: 歌 (うた), 歌う (うた.う)	song 歌 画数14 508 Details Story Dictionary 歌 song Heisig's The song in this kanji is being sung by a chorus line of can-can girls. Why it should be eliciting nothing but yawning from the audience, I leave to you to decide. Koohii #1 Can-Can-ers lack the ability to sing a song, so they just dance. Koohii #2 Can-can dancers are supposed to be big-bosomed girls who dance. Yet these so called can-can dancers are flat-chested and singing a song, so audience of men is yawning in boredom. Primitives song, cancan, can, mouth, street, nail, spike, lack, yawn, can2, mouth2, street2, nail2, spike2 短歌(たんか): tanka, 31-syllable Japanese poem 歌手(かしゅ): singer 歌謡(かよう): song, ballad 歌(うた): song, poetry 歌う(うたう): sing Kunyomi: うた、うた.う Onyomi: カ Lesson: 18 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds: 歌 (うた), 歌う (うた.う)
soft Details Story Dictionary 軟 soft Heisig's If the cushions of one's car are too soft, one may begin yawning at the wheel. Koohii #1 Cars are rough steel things, lacking softness. Koohii #2 If your car has really soft seats, you may start yawning and eventually fall asleep at the wheel (imagine that this seat is a huge soft beanbag that nearly swallows the driver, and it will be easier to remember). Primitives soft, car, lack, yawn 柔軟(じゅうなん): flexible, lithe 軟らかい(やわらかい): soft, tender, limp Kunyomi: やわ.らか、やわ.らかい Onyomi: ナン Lesson: 18 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 軟らか (やわ.らか), 軟らかい (やわ.らかい)	soft 軟 画数11 509 Details Story Dictionary 軟 soft Heisig's If the cushions of one's car are too soft, one may begin yawning at the wheel. Koohii #1 Cars are rough steel things, lacking softness. Koohii #2 If your car has really soft seats, you may start yawning and eventually fall asleep at the wheel (imagine that this seat is a huge soft beanbag that nearly swallows the driver, and it will be easier to remember). Primitives soft, car, lack, yawn 柔軟(じゅうなん): flexible, lithe 軟らかい(やわらかい): soft, tender, limp Kunyomi: やわ.らか、やわ.らかい Onyomi: ナン Lesson: 18 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 軟らか (やわ.らか), 軟らかい (やわ.らかい)
"next Details Story Dictionary 次 next Heisig's This key word connotes the ""next in line"" of a succession of people or things. Let there be a lack of ice on the hottest day of summer, and you stand impatiently in line waiting for the distributor to call out ""Next!"" * As a primitive, this character can either retain its key word meaning of next or the related meaning of second. Koohii #1 Is this store lacking ice? Let´s try the next one, then. Koohii #2 A rapper called ""Ice"" went for auditions but was told he lacked talent. Next... Primitives next, ice, lack, yawn 次(し): order, sequence, times, next, below 次いで(ついで): next, secondly, subsequently 取り次ぐ(とりつぐ): to act as an agent for, to announce (someone), to convey (a message) 次第(しだい): order, precedence, circumstances, immediate(ly), as soon as, dependent upon 次々(つぎつぎ): in succession, one by one 次ぐ(つぐ): rank next to, come after 目次(もくじ): table of contents 次(つぎ): next, stage station, stage, subsequent Kunyomi: つ.ぐ、つぎ Onyomi: ジ、シ Lesson: 18 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 次回 (じかい), 次元 (じげん), 目次 (もくじ), 次ぐ (つ.ぐ), 次 (つぎ)"	"next 次 画数6 510 Details Story Dictionary 次 next Heisig's This key word connotes the ""next in line"" of a succession of people or things. Let there be a lack of ice on the hottest day of summer, and you stand impatiently in line waiting for the distributor to call out ""Next!"" * As a primitive, this character can either retain its key word meaning of next or the related meaning of second. Koohii #1 Is this store lacking ice? Let´s try the next one, then. Koohii #2 A rapper called ""Ice"" went for auditions but was told he lacked talent. Next... Primitives next, ice, lack, yawn 次(し): order, sequence, times, next, below 次いで(ついで): next, secondly, subsequently 取り次ぐ(とりつぐ): to act as an agent for, to announce (someone), to convey (a message) 次第(しだい): order, precedence, circumstances, immediate(ly), as soon as, dependent upon 次々(つぎつぎ): in succession, one by one 次ぐ(つぐ): rank next to, come after 目次(もくじ): table of contents 次(つぎ): next, stage station, stage, subsequent Kunyomi: つ.ぐ、つぎ Onyomi: ジ、シ Lesson: 18 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 次回 (じかい), 次元 (じげん), 目次 (もくじ), 次ぐ (つ.ぐ), 次 (つぎ)"
"briar Details Story Dictionary 茨 briar Heisig's Earlier we made mention of the story of Briar Rose (or ""Sleeping Beauty,"" as we called her in frame 165) and drew attention to the briar hedge that grew up all about her castle. But in the second part of the story, these briars blossomed into flowers. Hence her name, Briar Rose. Be careful not to confuse this character with that for thorn (Frame 446). Koohii #1 To prevent animals from eating the beautiful flowers in your garden, the best thing to do is to plant briar bushes immediately next to them. Koohii #2 The briar patch may look unremarkable now before it blooms, but there will be flowers next, and it will be beautiful. Primitives briar, flowers, next, ice, lack, yawn Kunyomi: いばら、かや、くさぶき Onyomi: シ、ジ Lesson: 18 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: Compounds: 茨 (いばら)"	"briar 茨 画数9 511 Details Story Dictionary 茨 briar Heisig's Earlier we made mention of the story of Briar Rose (or ""Sleeping Beauty,"" as we called her in frame 165) and drew attention to the briar hedge that grew up all about her castle. But in the second part of the story, these briars blossomed into flowers. Hence her name, Briar Rose. Be careful not to confuse this character with that for thorn (Frame 446). Koohii #1 To prevent animals from eating the beautiful flowers in your garden, the best thing to do is to plant briar bushes immediately next to them. Koohii #2 The briar patch may look unremarkable now before it blooms, but there will be flowers next, and it will be beautiful. Primitives briar, flowers, next, ice, lack, yawn Kunyomi: いばら、かや、くさぶき Onyomi: シ、ジ Lesson: 18 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: Compounds: 茨 (いばら)"
assets Details Story Dictionary 資 assets Heisig's The first shells (money) you earn, you use to pay your debts. From then on, the next shells you accumulate become your assets. Koohii #1 Assets are the next best thing to money. Koohii #2 The first SHELLS you get you obviously spend, but the NEXT SHELLS are your ASSETS, you should bury them in a low safe place (placement!). Primitives assets, next, ice, lack, yawn, shellfish, clam, oyster, eye, animal legs, eight 資格(しかく): qualifications, requirements, capabilities 資金(しきん): funds, capital 資産(しさん): property, fortune, means, assets 投資(とうし): investment 物資(ぶっし): goods, materials 融資(ゆうし): financing, loan 資源(しげん): resources 資本(しほん): funds, capital 資料(しりょう): materials, data Kunyomi: Onyomi: シ Lesson: 18 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds:	assets 資 画数13 512 Details Story Dictionary 資 assets Heisig's The first shells (money) you earn, you use to pay your debts. figure Details Story Dictionary 姿 figure Heisig's This kanji depicts a woman's figure as a sort of second self. Koohii #1 The next woman always has a better figure! Thinking like that, you´ll end up alone in an old folks home longing for the good old days! Koohii #2 Whenever I am next to a woman, I can´t help but take notice of her figure. Primitives figure, next, ice, lack, yawn, woman 姿勢(しせい): attitude, posture 姿(すがた): figure, shape, appearance Kunyomi: すがた Onyomi: シ Lesson: 18 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 姿 (すがた)	figure 姿 画数9 513 Details Story Dictionary 姿 figure Heisig's This kanji depicts a woman's figure as a sort of second self. consult with Details Story Dictionary 諮 consult with Heisig's To seek the words of a second mouth is to consult with someone about something. Koohii #1 Having a word with the next mouth over, like a neighbor, is usually a good way to consult with somebody for cheap. Because, you know, actual consultants charge huge sums. Koohii #2 Consulting with is having words with the next mouth. Primitives consult with, say, words, keitai, mouth, next, ice, lack, yawn, mouth, mouth2 諮る(はかる): to consult with, to confer Kunyomi: はか.る Onyomi: シ Lesson: 18 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 諮る (はか.る)	consult with 諮 画数16 514 Details Story Dictionary 諮 consult with Heisig's To seek the words of a second mouth is to consult with someone about something. Koohii #2 Consulting with is having words with the next mouth. compensation Details Story Dictionary 賠 compensation Heisig's Picture a clam used as a muzzle to quiet the complaints of a fisherman's widow asking compensation for her husband lost at sea. Koohii #1 Compensation is money you give to someone to shut them up (i.e. muzzle their mouth). Koohii #2 Compensation is a kind of euphemism for hush money here. Money that muzzles. Primitives compensation, shellfish, clam, oyster, eye, animal legs, eight, muzzle, vase, stand up, mouth 賠償(ばいしょう): reparations, indemnity, compensation Kunyomi: Onyomi: バイ Lesson: 19 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	compensation 賠 画数15 515 Details Story Dictionary 賠 compensation Heisig's Picture a clam used as a muzzle to quiet the complaints of a fisherman's widow asking compensation for her husband lost at sea. cultivate Details Story Dictionary 培 cultivate Heisig's The barrel hoops used by many Japanese farmers to stretch clear plastic over row of vegetables in a garden patch in the hopes of cultivating bigger and bigger vegetables is a way of muzzling the soil. Koohii #1 To cultivate the land is to tame it, control it. In short, you muzzle it´s unruly, chaotic nature. Koohii #2 The illegal immigrants cultivate the land but are socially and politically muzzled (wear muzzles while they work too). Primitives cultivate, soil, dirt, ground, muzzle, vase, stand up, mouth 栽培(さいばい): cultivation Kunyomi: つちか.う Onyomi: バイ Lesson: 19 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 培う (つちか.う)	cultivate 培 画数11 516 Details Story Dictionary 培 cultivate Heisig's The barrel hoops used by many Japanese farmers to stretch clear plastic over row of vegetables in a garden patch in the hopes of cultivating bigger and bigger vegetables is a way of muzzling the soil. "divide Details Story Dictionary 剖 divide Heisig's To ""divide and conquer"" you use a saber and a muzzle. Koohii #1 When you DIVIDE someone, there is sure to be a lot of screaming. That´s why you should use a MUZZLE before using the SABER. Koohii #2 Divide and conquer - first you cut them up (saber) , then you shut them up (muzzle). Primitives divide, muzzle, vase, stand up, mouth, sword, sabre, saber 解剖(かいぼう): dissection, autopsy Kunyomi: Onyomi: ボウ Lesson: 19 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"	"divide 剖 画数10 517 Details Story Dictionary 剖 divide Heisig's To ""divide and conquer"" you use a saber and a muzzle. Koohii #2 Divide and conquer - first you cut them up (saber) , then you shut them up (muzzle). sound Details Story Dictionary 音 sound Heisig's The kanji for sound depicts something standing in the air over a tongue wagging in a mouth, much the same as a sound does for the briefest of moments before disappearing. * The primitive from this kanji also means simply a sound. Koohii #1 If you were standing on the sun, believe me, you´d be making sound. Koohii #2 The tongue wagging in a mouth produces a very high-pitched sound, breaking a nearby vase. Primitives sound, vase, stand up, sun, day, tongue wagging 音色(おんいろ): tone color, tone quality, timbre, synthesizer patch 音(ね): sound, note 本音(ほんね): real intention, motive 音(おん): sound, (music) note 五十音(ごじゅうおん): the Japanese syllabary 雑音(ざつおん): noise (jarring, grating) 騒音(そうおん): noise 物音(ものおと): sounds 録音(ろくおん): (audio) recording 音(おと): sound 発音(はつおん): pronunciation 音楽(おんがく): music, musical movement Kunyomi: おと、ね Onyomi: オン、イン、ノン Lesson: 19 Jouyou: 1 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds: 音楽 (おんがく), 発音 (はつおん), 騒音 (そうおん), 音 (おと), 音 (ね)	sound 音 画数9 518 Details Story Dictionary 音 sound Heisig's The kanji for sound depicts something standing in the air over a tongue wagging in a mouth, much the same as a sound does for the briefest of moments before disappearing. * The primitive from this kanji also means simply a sound. Koohii #1 If you were standing on the sun, believe me, you´d be making sound. Koohii #2 The tongue wagging in a mouth produces a very high-pitched sound, breaking a nearby vase. Primitives sound, vase, stand up, sun, day, tongue wagging 音色(おんいろ): tone color, tone quality, timbre, synthesizer patch 音(ね): sound, note 本音(ほんね): real intention, motive 音(おん): sound, (music) note 五十音(ごじゅうおん): the Japanese syllabary 雑音(ざつおん): noise (jarring, grating) 騒音(そうおん): noise 物音(ものおと): sounds 録音(ろくおん): (audio) recording 音(おと): sound 発音(はつおん): pronunciation 音楽(おんがく): music, musical movement Kunyomi: おと、ね Onyomi: オン、イン、ノン Lesson: 19 Jouyou: 1 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds: 音楽 (おんがく), 発音 (はつおん), 騒音 (そうおん), 音 (おと), 音 (ね)
"darkness Details Story Dictionary 暗 darkness Heisig's When ""darkness covered the earth"" at the beginning of time, there was neither sun nor sound. Koohii #1 Picture the sun exploding - there would be a gigantic noise and then...nothing. Everything would plunge into darkness. Koohii #2 In places of complete darkness, such as caves where the sun can´t reach, creatures such as bats have learned to navigate by sound rather than sight. The poor guys must have to fly around screaming ""Marco!"" and ""Polo!"" all the time. Primitives darkness, sun, day, sound, vase, stand up, sun, day, sun2, day2 暗殺(あんさつ): assassination 暗算(あんざん): mental arithmetic 暗示(あんじ): hint, suggestion 暗記(あんき): memorization 薄暗い(うすぐらい): dim, gloomy 真っ暗(まっくら): total darkness, pitch dark, shortsightedness 暗い(くらい): dark, gloomy Kunyomi: くら.い、くら.む、くれ.る Onyomi: アン Lesson: 19 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 暗い (くら.い)"	"darkness 暗 画数13 519 Details Story Dictionary 暗 darkness Heisig's When ""darkness covered the earth"" at the beginning of time, there was neither sun nor sound. Koohii #1 Picture the sun exploding - there would be a gigantic noise and then...nothing. Everything would plunge into darkness. Koohii #2 In places of complete darkness, such as caves where the sun can´t reach, creatures such as bats have learned to navigate by sound rather than sight. The poor guys must have to fly around screaming ""Marco!"" and ""Polo!"" all the time. Primitives darkness, sun, day, sound, vase, stand up, sun, day, sun2, day2 暗殺(あんさつ): assassination 暗算(あんざん): mental arithmetic 暗示(あんじ): hint, suggestion 暗記(あんき): memorization 薄暗い(うすぐらい): dim, gloomy 真っ暗(まっくら): total darkness, pitch dark, shortsightedness 暗い(くらい): dark, gloomy Kunyomi: くら.い、くら.む、くれ.る Onyomi: アン Lesson: 19 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 暗い (くら.い)"
"rhyme Details Story Dictionary 韻 rhyme Heisig's Poetry restricted to verses that rhyme often finds it has to abandon clarity of thought in order to make the rhyme of the words work. In this kanji's picture, one becomes a kind of ""sound-employee."" Koohii #1 What is a RHYME but some SOUND that EMPLOYEES say to get them through work. Koohii #2 Dr Seuss´s employee finally rebels against him: ""I´m tired of odd sounds all the time, I will not, cannot, speak in RHYME!"". Primitives rhyme, sound, vase, stand up, sun, day, employee, mouth, shellfish, clam, oyster, eye, animal legs, eight Kunyomi: Onyomi: イン Lesson: 19 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"	"rhyme 韻 画数19 520 Details Story Dictionary 韻 rhyme Heisig's Poetry restricted to verses that rhyme often finds it has to abandon clarity of thought in order to make the rhyme of the words work. In this kanji's picture, one becomes a kind of ""sound-employee."" Koohii #1 What is a RHYME but some SOUND that EMPLOYEES say to get them through work. Koohii #2 Dr Seuss´s employee finally rebels against him: ""I´m tired of odd sounds all the time, I will not, cannot, speak in RHYME!"". Primitives rhyme, sound, vase, stand up, sun, day, employee, mouth, shellfish, clam, oyster, eye, animal legs, eight Kunyomi: Onyomi: イン Lesson: 19 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"
discriminating Details Story Dictionary 識 discriminating Heisig's A person of discriminating intellect can tell the difference between mere kazoo-buzzing and words spoken wisely. Koohii #1 Words are difficult to discriminate/discern from sounds in the middle of a fiesta. Koohii #2 I have discriminating taste. I´d rather listen to the words of a lecture than attend a kazoo concert. (Picture some snobby guy in a tweed jacket turning up his nose at entering a loud raucous kazoo recital). Primitives discriminating, say, words, keitai, mouth, kazoo, sound, vase, stand up, sun, day, fiesta 認識(にんしき): recognition, cognizance 良識(りょうしき): good sense 意識(いしき): consciousness, senses 常識(じょうしき): common sense 知識(ちしき): knowledge, information 標識(ひょうしき): sign, mark Kunyomi: し.る、しる.す Onyomi: シキ Lesson: 19 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds:	discriminating 識 画数19 521 Details Story Dictionary 識 discriminating Heisig's A person of discriminating intellect can tell the difference between mere kazoo-buzzing and words spoken wisely. Koohii #1 Words are difficult to discriminate/discern from sounds in the middle of a fiesta. Koohii #2 I have discriminating taste. I´d rather listen to the words of a lecture than attend a kazoo concert. (Picture some snobby guy in a tweed jacket turning up his nose at entering a loud raucous kazoo recital). Primitives discriminating, say, words, keitai, mouth, kazoo, sound, vase, stand up, sun, day, fiesta 認識(にんしき): recognition, cognizance 良識(りょうしき): good sense 意識(いしき): consciousness, senses 常識(じょうしき): common sense 知識(ちしき): knowledge, information 標識(ひょうしき): sign, mark Kunyomi: し.る、しる.す Onyomi: シキ Lesson: 19 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds:
mirror Details Story Dictionary 鏡 mirror Heisig's After lakes but before glass, polished metal was used for mirrors. These metal mirrors are recalled in this character for a mirror. Koohii #1 Mirror should suggest vanity. Imagine a spoiled girl who gets her parents to buy her a Golden mirror so she can stand in front of it all day vainly admiring her lovely human legs. Koohii #2 metal + stand up + sun + legs remember the legend of Amaterasu who retired in a cave. the other Gods brought a MIRROR made of polished METAL at the entrance of the cave. Amaterasu who was STANDING UP saw her image of the SUN and began to dance with her LEGS. Primitives mirror, metal, gold, mirror, vase, stand up, sun, day, human legs 眼鏡(がんきょう): spectacles, glasses 顕微鏡(けんびきょう): microscope 望遠鏡(ぼうえんきょう): telescope 鏡(かがみ): mirror 眼鏡(めがね): spectacles, glasses Kunyomi: かがみ Onyomi: キョウ、ケイ Lesson: 19 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 鏡 (かがみ)	mirror 鏡 画数19 522 Details Story Dictionary 鏡 mirror Heisig's After lakes but before glass, polished metal was used for mirrors. These metal mirrors are recalled in this character for a mirror. Koohii #1 Mirror should suggest vanity. Imagine a spoiled girl who gets her parents to buy her a Golden mirror so she can stand in front of it all day vainly admiring her lovely human legs. Koohii #2 metal + stand up + sun + legs remember the legend of Amaterasu who retired in a cave. the other Gods brought a MIRROR made of polished METAL at the entrance of the cave. Amaterasu who was STANDING UP saw her image of the SUN and began to dance with her LEGS. Primitives mirror, metal, gold, mirror, vase, stand up, sun, day, human legs 眼鏡(がんきょう): spectacles, glasses 顕微鏡(けんびきょう): microscope 望遠鏡(ぼうえんきょう): telescope 鏡(かがみ): mirror 眼鏡(めがね): spectacles, glasses Kunyomi: かがみ Onyomi: キョウ、ケイ Lesson: 19 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 鏡 (かがみ)
boundary (border) Details Story Dictionary 境 boundary (border) My Story [Jesus + Stand + see (Day + human legs)] If *Jesus* *stands* on the earth over there, he can *see* all the way to the border*. 竟 = tsui (final, end). So 境 = SOIL + END, or the end of the land. End of the land = its perimeter, the boundary! Koohii #1 In the dense cities of Japan even a small garden is a luxury. In this house, the owner has put mirrors on the boundary of his land so it feels much bigger. Koohii #2 This is an old trick to keep out migrants. You put a bunch of dirty mirrors on the boundary of your land and theirs. When they approach the boundary, what they see in the mirror is their own land and someone that looks like themselves, only dirtier, so they figure your country isn´t any better than their own and they head back home. Primitives boundary, soil, dirt, ground, mirror, vase, stand up, sun, day, human legs 境遇(きょうぐう): environment, circumstances 国境(くにざかい): national or state border 環境(かんきょう): environment, circumstance 境界(きょうかい): boundary 国境(こっきょう): national or state border 境(さかい): border, boundary, mental state Kunyomi: さかい Onyomi: キョウ、ケイ Lesson: 19 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 境界 (きょうかい), 境地 (きょうち), 逆境 (ぎゃっきょう), 境 (さかい)	boundary (border) 境 画数14 523 Details Story Dictionary 境 boundary (border) My Story [Jesus + Stand + see (Day + human legs)] If *Jesus* *stands* on the earth over there, he can *see* all the way to the border*. 竟 = tsui (final, end). So 境 = SOIL + END, or the end of the land. End of the land = its perimeter, the boundary! Koohii #1 In the dense cities of Japan even a small garden is a luxury. In this house, the owner has put mirrors on the boundary of his land so it feels much bigger. Koohii #2 This is an old trick to keep out migrants. You put a bunch of dirty mirrors on the boundary of your land and theirs. When they approach the boundary, what they see in the mirror is their own land and someone that looks like themselves, only dirtier, so they figure your country isn´t any better than their own and they head back home. Primitives boundary, soil, dirt, ground, mirror, vase, stand up, sun, day, human legs 境遇(きょうぐう): environment, circumstances 国境(くにざかい): national or state border 環境(かんきょう): environment, circumstance 境界(きょうかい): boundary 国境(こっきょう): national or state border 境(さかい): border, boundary, mental state Kunyomi: さかい Onyomi: キョウ、ケイ Lesson: 19 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 境界 (きょうかい), 境地 (きょうち), 逆境 (ぎゃっきょう), 境 (さかい)
deceased Details Story Dictionary 亡 deceased My Story Looks like a bathtub * In addition to deceased, the primitive meaning of to perish will also be used for this character. Koohii #1 The top hat hanging on a hook belonged to the now deceased Charlie Chaplin. Koohii #2 The recently DECEASED are said to hang their hats on a hook by the door to the afterlife. Primitives deceased, perish, top hat, fishhook 逃亡(とうぼう): escape 滅亡(めつぼう): downfall, ruin, collapse, destruction 死亡(しぼう): death, mortality 亡くす(なくす): lose something or someone, get rid of 亡くなる(なくなる): die Kunyomi: な.い、な.き-、ほろ.びる、ほろ.ぶ、ほろ.ぼす Onyomi: ボウ、モウ Lesson: 19 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 亡父 (ぼうふ), 亡命 (ぼうめい), 存亡 (そんぼう), 亡い (な.い)	deceased 亡 画数3 524 Details Story Dictionary 亡 deceased My Story Looks like a bathtub * In addition to deceased, the primitive meaning of to perish will also be used for this character. Koohii #1 The top hat hanging on a hook belonged to the now deceased Charlie Chaplin. Koohii #2 The recently DECEASED are said to hang their hats on a hook by the door to the afterlife. blind Details Story Dictionary 盲 blind Heisig's If one's eyes perish before death, one remains blind for the rest of life. Koohii #1 Deceased eyes! Easy ;). Koohii #2 A person with deceased eyes is blind. Primitives blind, deceased, perish, top hat, fishhook, eye 盲点(もうてん): blind spot Kunyomi: めくら Onyomi: モウ Lesson: 19 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	blind 盲 画数8 525 Details Story Dictionary 盲 blind Heisig's If one's eyes perish before death, one remains blind for the rest of life. "delusion Details Story Dictionary 妄 delusion Heisig's The ""ideal woman"" one daydreams about is no more than a delusion. Hence, perish the thought of her. Koohii #1 I had a problem with remembering that ""deceased"" went over the ""woman"". So, here´s my story: The delusional woman was carrying her deceased husband on her back. Koohii #2 If you think you should perish for that woman, you have a major delusion. Primitives delusion, deceased, perish, top hat, fishhook, woman Kunyomi: みだ.りに Onyomi: モウ、ボウ Lesson: 19 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 妄信 (もうしん), 妄想 (もうそう), 迷妄 (めいもう)"	"delusion 妄 画数6 526 Details Story Dictionary 妄 delusion Heisig's The ""ideal woman"" one daydreams about is no more than a delusion. "laid waste Details Story Dictionary 荒 laid waste Heisig's The flowers that perish in the flood are taken here as symbols of an area that has been laid waste. Koohii #1 After Godzilla laid waste to the city, the survivors put some flowers on the bodies of the deceased and floated their bodies down the stream. Koohii #2 Laying waste is just a euphamism for flushing poop down the toilet. It smells nothing like flowers, more like deceased flowers, and it´s flushed down into a stream of sewage. Use ""waste"" to avoid destroy (#365) demolition (#400). Primitives laid waste, wreath, flowers, deceased, perish, top hat, fishhook, stream, flood 荒らす(あらす): to lay waste, to devastate, to damage, to invade, to break into 荒っぽい(あらっぽい): rough, rude 荒廃(こうはい): ruin 荒い(あらい): rough, rude, wild Kunyomi: あら.い、あら-、あ.れる、あ.らす、-あ.らし、すさ.む Onyomi: コウ Lesson: 19 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 荒らす (あ.らす), 荒れる (あ.れる), 荒い (あら.い)"	"laid waste 荒 画数9 527 Details Story Dictionary 荒 laid waste Heisig's The flowers that perish in the flood are taken here as symbols of an area that has been laid waste. Koohii #1 After Godzilla laid waste to the city, the survivors put some flowers on the bodies of the deceased and floated their bodies down the stream. Koohii #2 Laying waste is just a euphamism for flushing poop down the toilet. It smells nothing like flowers, more like deceased flowers, and it´s flushed down into a stream of sewage. Use ""waste"" to avoid destroy (#365) demolition (#400). Primitives laid waste, wreath, flowers, deceased, perish, top hat, fishhook, stream, flood 荒らす(あらす): to lay waste, to devastate, to damage, to invade, to break into 荒っぽい(あらっぽい): rough, rude 荒廃(こうはい): ruin 荒い(あらい): rough, rude, wild Kunyomi: あら.い、あら-、あ.れる、あ.らす、-あ.らし、すさ.む Onyomi: コウ Lesson: 19 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 荒らす (あ.らす), 荒れる (あ.れる), 荒い (あら.い)"
ambition Details Story Dictionary 望 ambition My Story [Dying + Moon/Organ + King] Think of the ambition of Macbeth and Lady Macbeth - making the old *King* *deceased* under the light of the *moon*. Koohii #1 You´re dead meat, buddy, my ambition is to be king. Koohii #2 The ambitions of kings often result in dead bodies. Primitives ambition, deceased, perish, top hat, fishhook, moon, month, flesh, part of the body, king, jewel, ball 志望(しぼう): wish, desire, ambition 絶望(ぜつぼう): despair, hopelessness 待望(たいぼう): expectant waiting 展望(てんぼう): view, outlook, prospect 望ましい(のぞましい): desirable, hoped for 待ち望む(まちのぞむ): to look anxiously for, to wait eagerly for 有望(ゆうぼう): good prospects, full of hope, promising 要望(ようぼう): demand for, request 欲望(よくぼう): desire, appetite 希望(きぼう): hope, wish, aspiration 失望(しつぼう): disappointment, despair 望み(のぞみ): wish, desire, hope 望む(のぞむ): to desire, wish for, see, command (a view of) 望遠鏡(ぼうえんきょう): telescope Kunyomi: のぞ.む、もち Onyomi: ボウ、モウ Lesson: 19 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 望郷 (ぼうきょう), 希望 (きぼう), 人望 (じんぼう), 望む (のぞ.む)	ambition 望 画数11 528 Details Story Dictionary 望 ambition My Story [Dying + Moon/Organ + King] Think of the ambition of Macbeth and Lady Macbeth - making the old *King* *deceased* under the light of the *moon*. direction Details Story Dictionary 方 direction Heisig's Spinning a dagger about on its hilt on the top of a top hat - waiting to see in which direction it points when it comes to rest - one leaves to fate where one is going next. Take care in writing this character. * As a primitive, this character will take the sense of a compass, the instrument used to determine direction. Koohii #1 Note: The primitives are top hat and bound up. Compare ten thousand (#64). Story: A rich man wearing a top hat and bound up from head to toe hobbles up to you and asks for directions to the nearest police station because he just escaped from his kidnappers. Koohii #2 I always keep my directions bound to the bottom of my top hat so I won´t lose them. Primitives direction, compass, direction 彼方此方(あちこち): here and there 彼方(あちら): there, yonder, that 彼方此方(あちらこちら): here and there 遠方(えんぽう): long way, distant place 大方(おおかた): perhaps, almost all, majority 方(かた): polite way of indicating person 地方(じかた): area, locality, district, region, the coast 其方(そちら): over there, the other 外方(そっぽ): look (or turn) the other way 立方(たちかた): dancing (geisha) 他方(たほう): another side, different direction, (on) the other hand 何方(どちら): which, who 平方(へいほう): square (e.g. metre), square 方(ほう): side 方策(ほうさく): plan, policy 方式(ほうしき): form, method, system 見方(みかた): viewpoint 目方(めかた): weight 明け方(あけがた): dawn 一方(いっぽう): one side, one way, one direction, one party, the other party, on the other hand, meanwhile, only, simple, in turn 方々(かたがた): persons, all people, this and that, here and there, everywhere, any way, all sides 正方形(せいほうけい): square 地方(ちほう): area, locality, district, region, the coast 長方形(ちょうほうけい): rectangle, oblong 方角(ほうがく): direction, way, compass point 方言(ほうげん): dialect 方向(ほうこう): direction, course, way 方針(ほうしん): objective, plan, policy 方程式(ほうていしき): equation 方法(ほうほう): method, process, manner, way, means, technique 方々(ほうぼう): persons, this and that, here and there, everywhere, any way, all sides, all people 方面(ほうめん): direction, district, field (of study) 味方(みかた): friend, ally, supporter 仕方(しかた): method, way 両方(りょうほう): both 夕方(ゆうがた): evening Kunyomi: かた、-かた、-がた Onyomi: ホウ Lesson: 19 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds: 方 (かた)	direction 方 画数4 529 Details Story Dictionary 方 direction Heisig's Spinning a dagger about on its hilt on the top of a top hat - waiting to see in which direction it points when it comes to rest - one leaves to fate where one is going next. disturb Details Story Dictionary 妨 disturb Heisig's Imagine a compass that is disturbed every time a woman passes by, sending the needle spinning madly round and round. Koohii #1 Capt. Jack Sparrow´s compass gets disturbed every time a beautiful woman walks by him (just picture Keira Knightley in her sexy asian outfit as Elizabeth and the image will be fixed forever). Koohii #2 One way to Disturb a woman is to give her directions while she is in the middle of driving -- she just can´t take that kind of stress. Primitives disturb, compass, direction, woman 妨害(ぼうがい): disturbance, obstruction, hindrance, jamming, interference 妨げる(さまたげる): disturb, prevent Kunyomi: さまた.げる Onyomi: ボウ Lesson: 19 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 妨げる (さまた.げる)	disturb 妨 画数7 530 Details Story Dictionary 妨 disturb Heisig's Imagine a compass that is disturbed every time a woman passes by, sending the needle spinning madly round and round. boy Details Story Dictionary 坊 boy Heisig's The character for a boy shows us a Boy Scout cleaning the dirt out of his compass - the more dirt, the better. Koohii #1 Little boys always head in the direction of mud and dirt. Koohii #2 Boys thoughts often head in dirty directions. Primitives boy, soil, dirt, ground, compass, direction 坊ちゃん(ぼっちゃん): son (of others) 寝坊(ねぼう): sleeping in late 坊さん(ぼうさん): Buddhist priest, monk 坊や(ぼうや): boy 赤ん坊(あかんぼう): baby 朝寝坊(あさねぼう): over sleep Kunyomi: Onyomi: ボウ、ボッ Lesson: 19 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: Compounds: 坊主 (ぼうず), 朝寝坊 (あさねぼう), 赤ん坊 (あかんぼう)	boy 坊 画数7 531 Details Story Dictionary 坊 boy Heisig's The character for a boy shows us a Boy Scout cleaning the dirt out of his compass - the more dirt, the better. perfumed Details Story Dictionary 芳 perfumed Heisig's Here we see a special compass used to pick out those flowers most suited for making good perfumes. Koohii #1 She used a perfume so strong, that you can track her by following the direction of the smell of flowers. Koohii #2 People always seem to overdo it with their perfume. It seems that whenever I am at school, somebody walks by with their cheap flowery perfume. If I close my eyes, I can actually use that floweriness as a compass - it tells me which direction they´re in. Primitives perfume, flowers, compass, direction Kunyomi: かんば.しい Onyomi: ホウ Lesson: 19 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 芳しい (かんば.しい)	perfumed 芳 画数7 532 Details Story Dictionary 芳 perfumed Heisig's Here we see a special compass used to pick out those flowers most suited for making good perfumes. obese Details Story Dictionary 肪 obese Heisig's If you eat too much, you may need a compass to find your way around the obese mass of flesh that piles up in the midsection. Compare this with your stories for round (Frame 44) and fat (Frame 494), similar in meaning but distinct in imagery. Koohii #1 Flesh in all directions = obese. Koohii #2 Yo momma so obese, she changed the direction of the moon. Primitives obese, moon, month, flesh, part of the body, compass, direction 脂肪(しぼう): fat, grease, blubber Kunyomi: Onyomi: ボウ Lesson: 19 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	obese 肪 画数8 533 Details Story Dictionary 肪 obese Heisig's If you eat too much, you may need a compass to find your way around the obese mass of flesh that piles up in the midsection. call on Details Story Dictionary 訪 call on Heisig's When making a courtesy call on a dignitary, one has to gauge one's words with great care. Hence the need for a compass. Koohii #1 When you call on someone, you point your words in their direction. Koohii #2 When calling on a girl, you´d better what what sweet words will turn her fancy in your direction. (Image: last century teenagers on a frilly couch in the sitting room, she with her back to him, and he fumbling for the right words to turn her around). Primitives call on, say, words, keitai, mouth, compass, direction 訪れる(おとずれる): to visit 訪問(ほうもん): call, visit 訪ねる(たずねる): visit Kunyomi: おとず.れる、たず.ねる、と.う Onyomi: ホウ Lesson: 19 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 訪れる (おとず.れる), 訪ねる (たず.ねる)	call on 訪 画数11 534 Details Story Dictionary 訪 call on Heisig's When making a courtesy call on a dignitary, one has to gauge one's words with great care. set free Details Story Dictionary 放 set free Heisig's The taskmaster sets an unruly servant free, giving him no more than a quick glance at the compass and a boot from behind. Koohii #1 Go in any direction away from your taskmaster when you are set free. Koohii #2 When slaves were set free from their masters, they set off in all directions… RTK2:　ホウ　放射　ほうしゃ(radiation)… Pure group: 倣979. Primitives set free, compass, direction, taskmaster 追放(ついほう): exile, banishment 放棄(ほうき): abandonment, renunciation, abdication (responsibility right) 放射(ほうしゃ): radiation, emission 放射能(ほうしゃのう): radioactivity 放出(ほうしゅつ): release, emit 放置(ほうち): leave as is, leave to chance, leave alone, neglect 放り込む(ほうりこむ): to throw into 放り出す(ほうりだす): to throw out, to fire, to expel, to give up, to abandon, to neglect 解放(かいほう): release, liberation, emancipation 開放(かいほう): open, throw open, liberalization 放す(はなす): separate, set free, turn loose 放れる(はなれる): leave, get free, cut oneself off 放る(ほうる): let go, abandon, leave undone, throw, toss, fling 放送(ほうそう): broadcasting Kunyomi: はな.す、-っぱな.し、はな.つ、はな.れる、こ.く、ほう.る Onyomi: ホウ Lesson: 19 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 放す (はな.す), 放つ (はな.つ), 放れる (はな.れる)	set free 放 画数8 535 Details Story Dictionary 放 set free Heisig's The taskmaster sets an unruly servant free, giving him no more than a quick glance at the compass and a boot from behind. violent Details Story Dictionary 激 violent Heisig's Some cosmic taskmaster hovering overhead whips up the waves to make them dash violently against the shore. In the white foam that covers the water we see a broken compass floating, all that remains of a shipwreck. Koohii #1 When the taskmaster found his favorite white compas damaged by water, he became the most violent taskmaster there ever was. Koohii #2 Overnight the slave got Violent and was Set Free. Overnight....Set Free. Primitives violent, water, water droplets, water pistol, white, dove, compass, direction, taskmaster 激励(げきれい): encouragement 感激(かんげき): deep emotion, impression, inspiration 急激(きゅうげき): sudden, precipitous, radical 激増(げきぞう): sudden increase 刺激(しげき): stimulus, impetus, incentive, excitement, irritation, encouragement, motivation 激しい(はげしい): violent, vehement, intense, furious, tempestuous Kunyomi: はげ.しい Onyomi: ゲキ Lesson: 19 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 激しい (はげ.しい)	violent 激 画数16 536 Details Story Dictionary 激 violent Heisig's Some cosmic taskmaster hovering overhead whips up the waves to make them dash violently against the shore. In the white foam that covers the water we see a broken compass floating, all that remains of a shipwreck. Koohii #1 When the taskmaster found his favorite white compas damaged by water, he became the most violent taskmaster there ever was. Koohii #2 Overnight the slave got Violent and was Set Free. Overnight....Set Free. Primitives violent, water, water droplets, water pistol, white, dove, compass, direction, taskmaster 激励(げきれい): encouragement 感激(かんげき): deep emotion, impression, inspiration 急激(きゅうげき): sudden, precipitous, radical 激増(げきぞう): sudden increase 刺激(しげき): stimulus, impetus, incentive, excitement, irritation, encouragement, motivation 激しい(はげしい): violent, vehement, intense, furious, tempestuous Kunyomi: はげ.しい Onyomi: ゲキ Lesson: 19 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 激しい (はげ.しい)

pointed Details Story Dictionary 鋭 pointed Heisig's Metal that has been pointed (as an awl, a pick, a nail, or a knife) tends to serve the devil's purposes as well as civilization's: our tools are also our weapons. Koohii #1 Pointed is the metal devil´s pitchfork. Koohii #2 The Horny teenager who worked part time at a gold smelting plant always had uncontrollable errections that pointed out all the time, this is not a good thing to have when you work in a gold smelting plant, surely he will one day end up with a Goldmember! "formerly Details Story Dictionary 曽 formerly Heisig's This primitive (named for its associations with the kanji of the following frame) is composed of a pair of horns growing out of a brain with a tongue wagging in the mouth beneath. Think of ""former"" in connection with administrators or heads of state who have just left office but continue to make a nuisance of themselves by advertising their opinions on public policy. * The primitive meaning, increase, comes from the next frame. Always think of something multiplying wildly as you watch. Koohii #1 The Artist formerly Known as Prince has the horniest brain around, and I think you can imagine what his wagging tongue is doing... Koohii #2 Formerly, horned animals were used to plough the ricefield, and it took all day. Nowadays it´s done by machine. Primitives formerly, increase, horns, rice field, brains, sun, day Kunyomi: かつ、かつて、すなわち Onyomi: ソウ、ソ、ゾウ Lesson: 19 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: Compounds:"	"formerly 曽 画数11 540 Details Story Dictionary 曽 formerly Heisig's This primitive (named for its associations with the kanji of the following frame) is composed of a pair of horns growing out of a brain with a tongue wagging in the mouth beneath. increase Details Story Dictionary 増 increase Heisig's This kanji depicts an increase of soil, multiplying so fast that it literally buries everything in its path. Koohii #1 Prices always INCREASE for LAND that was FORMERLY cheaper. Koohii #2 Farmers work the land so they can INCREASE their formerly puny crop supply. "presents Details Story Dictionary 贈 presents Heisig's The presents offered here are money that increases each time you give it away. Do not confuse with the temporal word ""present"" (Frame 275). Koohii #1 Presents represent money that was formerly yours. Koohii #2 Imagine if the number of presents you get increases with each birthday. So on your first birthday, you receive just one shell as a present, but the next year it increases to two shells as presents, and so on, increasing and increasing so by the time you´re elderly, the number of shells you´ll get as presents will have increased to an awful lot of presents. GOT IT YET? PRESENTS = SHELLS + INCREASE. Primitives presents, shellfish, clam, oyster, eye, animal legs, eight, increase, formerly, horns, rice field, brains, sun, day 寄贈(きそう): donation, presentation 贈る(おくる): send, give to, award to, confer on 贈り物(おくりもの): gift Kunyomi: おく.る Onyomi: ゾウ、ソウ Lesson: 19 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 贈与 (ぞうよ), 贈呈 (ぞうてい), 贈答 (ぞうとう), 贈る (おく.る)"	"presents 贈 画数18 542 Details Story Dictionary 贈 presents Heisig's The presents offered here are money that increases each time you give it away. "east Details Story Dictionary 東 east Heisig's As a ""Western"" language, English identifies the east with the rising sun. In more fanciful terms, we see the sun piercing through a tree as it rises in the east. * Both the direction east and the part of the world called ""the East"" are primitive meanings of this character. Koohii #1 Traditionally seen as a pictograph of the sun rising behind a tree. Koohii #2 The sun pierces through the trees as it rises in the east…　　　　　　RTK2:　トウ　東北　とうほく (the northeast)　東京　とうきょう(Tokyo)… MIXED GROUP　凍506　(ﾁﾝ):陳1301　(ﾚﾝ): 練1343　錬2030. ridgepole Details Story Dictionary 棟 ridgepole Heisig's If the piece of wood in the roof known as the ridgepole points east, the sunrise will be visible from the front door. Koohii #1 Feng Shui states that the ridgepole of a house should be made of wood and face east. Koohii #2 Ok just a note to the ´ridgepole facing east story´ im making up a story to JUSTIFY why that is the case. Assuming that 99% of you guys use the age old story of a ´sun rising through a tree tells you were the east is´, back in those days when people used ridgepoles they wanted to align their houses in such a way that they face the rising sun, so they wake up with a bright day, and wake up early with the sun seeping through in a perpendicular manner( as the ridge pole faces the sun in the morning). Primitives ridgepole, tree, wood, east, tree, wood, sun, day, tree2, wood2 棟(とう): place, section, building Kunyomi: むね、むな- Onyomi: トウ Lesson: 19 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 棟 (むね)	ridgepole 棟 画数12 544 Details Story Dictionary 棟 ridgepole Heisig's If the piece of wood in the roof known as the ridgepole points east, the sunrise will be visible from the front door. Assuming that 99% of you guys use the age old story of a ´sun rising through a tree tells you were the east is´, back in those days when people used ridgepoles they wanted to align their houses in such a way that they face the rising sun, so they wake up with a bright day, and wake up early with the sun seeping through in a perpendicular manner( as the ridge pole faces the sun in the morning). Primitives ridgepole, tree, wood, east, tree, wood, sun, day, tree2, wood2 棟(とう): place, section, building Kunyomi: むね、むな- Onyomi: トウ Lesson: 19 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 棟 (むね)
"frozen Details Story Dictionary 凍 frozen Heisig's The whole secret to breaking the ice with the East is to peek behind those mysteriously ""frozen smiles."" Koohii #1 Eastern Siberia is often frozen by ice. According to wikipedia, Yakutia (in Eastern Siberia) holds the record as the coldest town on Earth. Check it out yourself...it made it stick for me! Koohii #2 The ice will stay frozen until the sun is visible through the trees. Primitives frozen, ice, east, tree, wood, sun, day 凍る(こおる): freeze, be frozen over, congeal 凍える(こごえる): freeze, be chilled, be frozen 冷凍(れいとう): freezing, cold storage, refrigeration Kunyomi: こお.る、こご.える、こご.る、い.てる、し.みる Onyomi: トウ Lesson: 19 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 凍る (こお.る), 凍える (こご.える)"	"frozen 凍 画数10 545 Details Story Dictionary 凍 frozen Heisig's The whole secret to breaking the ice with the East is to peek behind those mysteriously ""frozen smiles."" "burn Details Story Dictionary 燃 burn Heisig's Hearth . . . sort of thing. Beware of letting the simple reading off of the primitive elements do your work for you. Unless you make a vivid image of something burning and relate it just as vividly to those primitive meanings, you can count on forgetting this character very quickly. Koohii #1 Any sort of thing can burn in the fire. Koohii #2 Somebody from PETA is really angry that they sell dog meat in China, so they´ve gone to burn down the whole cart (my mnemonic for ""sort of thing"" was seeing strips of dog flesh roasting, and saying ""well, that´s just the sort of thing they do here in China). Primitives burn, fire, sort of thing, moon, crescent moon, month, flesh, part of the body, chihuahua, dog, large, drop, oven-fire, barbecue, fire2 燃焼(ねんしょう): burning, combustion 燃料(ねんりょう): fuel 燃える(もえる): to burn 燃やす(もやす): to burn Kunyomi: も.える、も.やす、も.す Onyomi: ネン Lesson: 20 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 燃える (も.える), 燃す (も.す), 燃やす (も.やす)"	"burn 燃 画数16 549 Details Story Dictionary 燃 burn Heisig's Hearth . . . sort of thing. Beware of letting the simple reading off of the primitive elements do your work for you. Unless you make a vivid image of something burning and relate it just as vividly to those primitive meanings, you can count on forgetting this character very quickly. Koohii #1 Any sort of thing can burn in the fire. Koohii #2 Somebody from PETA is really angry that they sell dog meat in China, so they´ve gone to burn down the whole cart (my mnemonic for ""sort of thing"" was seeing strips of dog flesh roasting, and saying ""well, that´s just the sort of thing they do here in China). V.I.P. Details Story Dictionary 賓 V.I.P. Heisig's The V.I.P. indicated here is an important guest making a visit. The elements are: house . . . ceiling . . . few . . . shells. Koohii #1 This house is reserved to V.I.P. only. If you are not one of the few with enough money to call you that way, keep out! Koohii #2 The V.I.P. visits your house, but your ceiling is too low for his inflated head, which he bumps and hurts. You have to give him your few shells as compensation. Primitives V.I.P., house, one, ceiling, few, shellfish, clam, oyster, eye, animal legs, eight Kunyomi: Onyomi: ヒン Lesson: 20 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	V.I.P. 賓 画数15 550 Details Story Dictionary 賓 V.I.P. Heisig's The V.I.P. indicated here is an important guest making a visit. The elements are: house . . . ceiling . . . few . . . shells. Koohii #1 This house is reserved to V.I.P. only. If you are not one of the few with enough money to call you that way, keep out! Koohii #2 The V.I.P. visits your house, but your ceiling is too low for his inflated head, which he bumps and hurts. You have to give him your few shells as compensation. Primitives V.I.P., house, one, ceiling, few, shellfish, clam, oyster, eye, animal legs, eight Kunyomi: Onyomi: ヒン Lesson: 20 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:
year-end Details Story Dictionary 歳 year-end Heisig's Stop . . . march . . . little. Be sure not to forget that final dot in the element for march. Koohii #1 Santa had to put his foot down to stop a march of little guys, namely elves. They were protesting the harsh treatment they get every year-end when Santa asks them to step up toy production for the holiday season. Koohii #2 At the year-end, everything seems to come to a stop. However, there´s still enough time for a little march to celebrate. Primitives year end, stop, footprint, one, little, small, march 歳(さい): -years-old 万歳(ばんざい): strolling comic dancer 二十歳(はたち): 20 years old, 20th year Kunyomi: とし、とせ、よわい Onyomi: サイ、セイ Lesson: 20 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 歳末 (さいまつ), 歳月 (さいげつ), 二十歳 (はたち)	year-end 歳 画数13 551 Details Story Dictionary 歳 year-end Heisig's Stop . . . march . . . little. Be sure not to forget that final dot in the element for march. Koohii #1 Santa had to put his foot down to stop a march of little guys, namely elves. They were protesting the harsh treatment they get every year-end when Santa asks them to step up toy production for the holiday season. Koohii #2 At the year-end, everything seems to come to a stop. However, there´s still enough time for a little march to celebrate. Primitives year end, stop, footprint, one, little, small, march 歳(さい): -years-old 万歳(ばんざい): strolling comic dancer 二十歳(はたち): 20 years old, 20th year Kunyomi: とし、とせ、よわい Onyomi: サイ、セイ Lesson: 20 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 歳末 (さいまつ), 歳月 (さいげつ), 二十歳 (はたち)
prefecture Details Story Dictionary 県 prefecture Heisig's Above, an eye and a fishhook, and below the primitive for little. Although apparently the simplest of these first six kanji, when you begin to work on its plot and story you will soon find out that the number of strokes and visual complexity of a kanji does not make it easier or harder to remember. It is the primitives you have to work that are the critical factor, as in this case where the meaning of the key word is so seemingly distant from the elements. Remember, you can always break larger elements down (eye of a needle into eye and fishhook) if you think it helps. Koohii #1 In Japanese this is KEN, as in Barbie´s boyfriend. He has lovely blue eyes, a girlfriend who is as thin as a straightened out fish hook. But, down where it counts, he has very little to show... Koohii #2 After sticking a fishhook in your eye, the yakuza boss probably has little more to do to convince you to move to a different prefecture. Primitives prefecture, eye, fishhook, small, little 県(けん): prefecture 県庁(けんちょう): prefectural office Kunyomi: か.ける Onyomi: ケン Lesson: 20 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds:	prefecture 県 画数9 552 Details Story Dictionary 県 prefecture Heisig's Above, an eye and a fishhook, and below the primitive for little. Koohii #2 After sticking a fishhook in your eye, the yakuza boss probably has little more to do to convince you to move to a different prefecture. Primitives prefecture, eye, fishhook, small, little 県(けん): prefecture 県庁(けんちょう): prefectural office Kunyomi: か.ける Onyomi: ケン Lesson: 20 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds:
horse chestnut Details Story Dictionary 栃 horse chestnut Heisig's A tree . . . cliff . . . ten thousand. Koohii #1 There are a bunch of HORSE CHESTNUT TREES on top of this CLIFF above the beach. Chestnuts keep rolling off the cliff and falling on people´s heads. So far TEN THOUSAND people have been killed by falling chestnuts, and the Japanese government still ain´t did shit about it. Koohii #2 There is a horse chestnut tree that has grown by a cliff for so long, it has deposited 10,000 horse chesnuts that lie at the bottom. Don´t worry over this one too much, you´ll spend so much time trying to figure out the right story for it, you probably won´t forget it. Primitives horse chestnut, tree, wood, Wimbledon, cliff, ten thousand, one, bound up Kunyomi: とち Onyomi: Lesson: 20 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: Compounds: 栃 (とち)	horse chestnut 栃 画数9 553 Details Story Dictionary 栃 horse chestnut Heisig's A tree . . . cliff . . . ten thousand. So far TEN THOUSAND people have been killed by falling chestnuts, and the Japanese government still ain´t did shit about it. "ground Details Story Dictionary 地 ground Heisig's Soil and a scorpion (an ""earth animal""). This is, of course, the full character from which the primitive for ground derives. Koohii #1 Picture the ground as an extent of soil where scorpions are buried like land mines. Imagine a sign post saying ´no trespassing, scorpion mines´ if that helps, and how it is dangerous to walk there. Koohii #2 The soil is littered with scorpions everywhere and no ones dares put their foot on the ground. Primitives ground, soil, dirt, ground, scorpion 天地(あめつち): heaven and earth, the universe, nature, top and bottom, realm, sphere, world 意地(いじ): disposition, spirit, willpower, obstinacy, backbone, appetite 位地(いち): place, situation, position, location 見地(けんち): point of view 現地(げんち): actual place, local 心地(ここち): feeling, sensation, mood 地方(じかた): area, locality, district, region, the coast 地形(じぎょう): terrain, geographical features, topography 地獄(じごく): hell 下地(したじ): groundwork, foundation, inclination, aptitude, elementary knowledge of, grounding in, prearrangement, spadework, signs, symptoms, first coat of plastering, soy 地主(じぬし): landlord 地元(じもと): local 植民地(しょくみんち): colony 農地(のうち): agricultural land 墓地(はかち): cemetery, graveyard 余地(よち): place, room, margin, scope 領地(りょうち): territory, dominion 意地悪(いじわる): malicious, ill-tempered, unkind 各地(かくち): every place, various places 生地(きじ): cloth, material, texture, one´s true character, unglazed pottery 基地(きち): base 耕地(こうち): arable land 産地(さんち): producing area 敷地(しきち): site 地盤(じばん): the ground 地味(じみ): plain, simple 団地(だんち): multi-unit apartments 地(ち): earth 地位(ちい): (social) position, status 地域(ちいき): area, region 地下(ちか): basement, underground 地下水(ちかすい): underground water 地球(ちきゅう): the earth 地区(ちく): district, section, sector 地質(ちしつ): geological features 地帯(ちたい): area, zone 地点(ちてん): site, point on a map 地平線(ちへいせん): horizon 地方(ちほう): area, locality, district, region, the coast 地名(ちめい): place name 土地(とち): plot of land, lot, soil 番地(ばんち): house number, address 盆地(ぼんち): basin (e.g. between mountains) 無地(むじ): plain, unfigured 遊園地(ゆうえんち): amusement park 地震(じしん): earthquake 地理(ちり): geography, geographical features 地下鉄(ちかてつ): underground train, subway 地図(ちず): map Kunyomi: Onyomi: チ、ジ Lesson: 21 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds: 地下 (ちか), 天地 (てんち), 境地 (きょうち)"	"ground 地 画数6 554 Details Story Dictionary 地 ground Heisig's Soil and a scorpion (an ""earth animal""). "pond Details Story Dictionary 池 pond Heisig's Water . . . scorpion. It would be easy to slip into a ""lazy image"" in cases like this one, picturing, let us say, a scorpion near the water. But if you picture rather a scorpion letting its venom out drop by drop until it has made a whole pond of the stuff, the image is more likely to remain fixed. Koohii #1 Remember the story of the scorpion that begged the turtle for a ride across the pond? Halfway across the water, the scorpion stung the turtle on the neck and they both sank to the bottom. Koohii #2 Water scorpions loves to live in the pond. Primitives pond, water, water droplets, water pistol, scorpion 乾電池(かんでんち): dry cell, battery 電池(でんち): battery 池(いけ): pond Kunyomi: いけ Onyomi: チ Lesson: 21 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 池 (いけ)"	"pond 池 画数6 555 Details Story Dictionary 池 pond Heisig's Water . . . scorpion. rainbow Details Story Dictionary 虹 rainbow My Story [Insect {虫} + craft {工}] The *insects* *craft*ed the rainbow through magic and drugs Koohii #1 Little is it known that a rainbow is actually created by insects of different colours flying in formation, a craft they have perfected to create the rainbows we see today. Koohii #2 Rainbow is of course created by billions of colored insects (what? you really thought it was an optical illusion?). However I had problems remembering that the insect primitive goes on the left. If you have similar difficulties, try this: rainbow is an Insect-Craft. Mnemonic: I.C. Rainbow (I see rainbow). silkworm Details Story Dictionary 蚕 silkworm Heisig's Heavens . . . insect. Be sure to do something about the position of the two elements. Koohii #1 There are no insects in heaven - well, that is, except for silkworms. What, do you expect Jesus to import his fancy robes from China? Koohii #2 In China it was believed that the silkworms were insects sent from heaven because of the beautiful material they produced. Primitives silkworm, heavens, insect Kunyomi: かいこ、こ Onyomi: サン、テン Lesson: 21 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 蚕 (かいこ)	silkworm 蚕 画数10 562 Details Story Dictionary 蚕 silkworm Heisig's Heavens . . . insect. wind Details Story Dictionary 風 wind Heisig's Windy . . . drops of . . . insects. Hint: think of the last two primitives as representing a swarm of gnats, those tiny drops of pesky insects. Koohii #1 They say that when an INSECT flaps its wings even the single DROP of WIND that it creates is sometimes enough to create a hurricane on the other side of the Earth. Koohii #2 The WIND usually carries things around in it - drops of rain or snow, and lots of insects. Primitives wind, gnats, drop, insect 風車(かざぐるま): windmill, pinwheel 気風(きふう): character, traits, ethos 風習(ふうしゅう): custom 風俗(ふうぞく): manners, customs, sex service, sex industry 風土(ふうど): natural features, topography, climate, spiritual features 暴風(ぼうふう): storm, windstorm, gale 洋風(ようふう): western style 和風(わふう): Japanese style 風邪(かぜ): common cold 扇風機(せんぷうき): electric fan 風景(ふうけい): scenery 風船(ふうせん): balloon 風呂(ふろ): bath 風呂敷(ふろしき): wrapping cloth, cloth wrapper 台風(たいふう): typhoon 風(かぜ): wind, cold Kunyomi: かぜ、かざ-、-かぜ Onyomi: フウ、フ Lesson: 21 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds: 風力 (ふうりょく), 風俗 (ふうぞく), 強風 (きょうふう), 風 (かぜ)	wind 風 画数9 563 Details Story Dictionary 風 wind Heisig's Windy . . . drops of . . . insects. "self Details Story Dictionary 己 self Heisig's The kanji carries the abstract sense of the self, the deep-down inner structure of the human person that mythology has often depicted as a snake - which is what the kanji shows pictographically. Be sure to keep it distinct from the similar keywords, oneself (frame 36) and I (frame 17). * As a primitive element, this kanji can be used for the snake - of which it is a pictograph - or any of the various concrete symbolic meanings the snake has in myth and fable. Koohii #1 This kanji looks like the ""s"" of ""self"", looking at its own reflection in a mirror (reversed sideways), as if pondering about his ""self"". Koohii #2 When Superman looks at himself in the mirror, this is what he sees on his chest. Primitives self, snake, self 自己(じこ): self, oneself Kunyomi: おのれ、つちのと、な Onyomi: コ、キ Lesson: 21 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 自己 (じこ), 利己 (りこ), 己 (おのれ)"	"self 己 画数3 564 Details Story Dictionary 己 self Heisig's The kanji carries the abstract sense of the self, the deep-down inner structure of the human person that mythology has often depicted as a snake - which is what the kanji shows pictographically. Be sure to keep it distinct from the similar keywords, oneself (frame 36) and I (frame 17). * As a primitive element, this kanji can be used for the snake - of which it is a pictograph - or any of the various concrete symbolic meanings the snake has in myth and fable. Koohii #1 This kanji looks like the ""s"" of ""self"", looking at its own reflection in a mirror (reversed sideways), as if pondering about his ""self"". Koohii #2 When Superman looks at himself in the mirror, this is what he sees on his chest. Primitives self, snake, self 自己(じこ): self, oneself Kunyomi: おのれ、つちのと、な Onyomi: コ、キ Lesson: 21 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 自己 (じこ), 利己 (りこ), 己 (おのれ)"
rouse (wake up) / occur Details Story Dictionary 起 rouse (wake up) / occur My Story [Run {走} + Snake/myself] If you rouse (awaken) a *snake* you better *RUN*! Koohii #1 Be careful when you´re RUNNING through the jungle, because you might step on and ROUSE a sleeping SNAKE. Then you´ll have to RUN like hell before it bites you! Koohii #2 Nothing will rouse you quite as much as finding a snake in your bed. You will run away like you´ve never run before! Primitives rouse, run, soil, dirt, ground, mend, snake, self 起源(きげん): origin, beginning, rise 起点(きてん): starting point 起伏(きふく): undulation 引き起こす(ひきおこす): to cause 起す(おこす): raise, cause, wake someone 起こる(おこる): occur, happen 起床(きしょう): rising, getting out of bed 起こす(おこす): wake (up) 起きる(おきる): get up, rise Kunyomi: お.きる、お.こる、お.こす、おこ.す、た.つ Onyomi: キ Lesson: 21 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds: 起きる (お.きる), 起こす (お.こす), 起こる (お.こる)	rouse (wake up) / occur 起 画数10 565 Details Story Dictionary 起 rouse (wake up) / occur My Story [Run {走} + Snake/myself] If you rouse (awaken) a *snake* you better *RUN*! reformation Details Story Dictionary 改 reformation Heisig's Pluralizing the snake and focusing on a single taskmaster may help recommend the image of Ireland's most famous reformer, St. Patrick, who, legend has it, drove away the snakes from the land. Koohii #1 The taskmaster of Slytherin ( wizardry house symbolized by a snake ) plans a reformation of Hogwarts, disallowing the study of magic to all muggle-born. こわいですね！. Koohii #2 This is a Meiji reformation taskmaster, trying to force usage of the Roman alphabet in Japan in place of Kanji. He holds a snake in the shape of the letter S and tries to explain how much simpler this is (j/k). Primitives reformation, snake, self, taskmaster 改まる(あらたまる): to be renewed 改悪(かいあく): deterioration, changing for the worse 改革(かいかく): reform, reformation, innovation 改修(かいしゅう): repair, improvement 改定(かいてい): reform 改訂(かいてい): revision 改良(かいりょう): improvement, reform 改めて(あらためて): again 改める(あらためる): to change, alter, reform, revise 改札(かいさつ): examination of tickets 改正(かいせい): revision, amendment, alteration 改善(かいぜん): betterment, improvement, incremental and continuous improvement 改造(かいぞう): remodeling Kunyomi: あらた.める、あらた.まる Onyomi: カイ Lesson: 21 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 改まる (あらた.まる), 改める (あらた.める)	reformation 改 画数7 567 Details Story Dictionary 改 reformation Heisig's Pluralizing the snake and focusing on a single taskmaster may help recommend the image of Ireland's most famous reformer, St. Patrick, who, legend has it, drove away the snakes from the land. scribe Details Story Dictionary 記 scribe My Story *Saying* things to *yourself* honestly is the KEY to a successful diary (#scribe). Koohii #1 A scribe writes down the words spoken by a snake (i.e. a lawyer). Koohii #2 Snakes have no hands. So, when a snake needs to write down something, it has to call in a SCRIBE, who will write down all the sayings of the snake. "wrap Details Story Dictionary 包 wrap My Story [Bind + Snake/myself] The *snake* bound up its prey by wrapping his body around it. * The primitive meaning of wrap should always be used with the snake in mind to avoid confusion with similar terms. Just let ""wrap"" mean ""with a snake coiled about it."" Koohii #1 The snake bound up its prey by wrapping his body around it. Koohii #2 Imagine Jessie sending in her Ekans (snake pokemon), and telling it to use bind attack to wrap up pikachu. Primitives wrap, bound up, snake, self 包む(くるむ): to be engulfed in, to be enveloped by, to wrap up, to tuck in, to pack, to do up, to cover with, to dress in, to conceal 小包(こづつみ): parcel, package 包み(つつみ): bundle, package, parcel, bale 包装(ほうそう): packing, wrapping 包帯(ほうたい): bandage, dressing 包む(つつむ): wrap, pack Kunyomi: つつ.む、くる.む Onyomi: ホウ Lesson: 21 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 包む (つつ.む)"	"wrap 包 画数5 569 Details Story Dictionary 包 wrap My Story [Bind + Snake/myself] The *snake* bound up its prey by wrapping his body around it. * The primitive meaning of wrap should always be used with the snake in mind to avoid confusion with similar terms. "tortoise Details Story Dictionary 亀 tortoise Heisig's This is not a turtle (See frame 250) but a tortoise, however you wish to picture the difference. Let the ""bound up"" at the to prefer to the head, and the two suns, with a long tail running through it, to the shell. * As a primitive, this kanji is abbreviated to its bottom half, ⻲, and comes to mean eel. (If it is any help, this kanji in its full form can also be remembered through its abbreviation's primitive meaning.) Koohii #1 It seems bizarre, but tortoises are a genetic cross with the head of a fish and the tail of an eel. Where the shell comes from, no one knows. Koohii #2 A tortoise is prosperity bound up with a tail. They are very lucky creatures. Primitives tortoise, bound up, eels, sun, day Kunyomi: かめ Onyomi: キ、キュウ、キン Lesson: 21 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 亀 (かめ)"	"tortoise 亀 画数11 573 Details Story Dictionary 亀 tortoise Heisig's This is not a turtle (See frame 250) but a tortoise, however you wish to picture the difference. electricity Details Story Dictionary 電 electricity Heisig's Rain/weather . . . eel. Koohii #1 Think of a two natural sources of electricity: electrical storms (a form of weather) and electrical eels. 電話 でんわ phone, call. Koohii #2 This kanji was invented by the first Chinaman to discover electricity. He was so unfortunate, he stepped on an electric eel and got struck by lighting at the same time. Primitives electricity, rain, weather, eel, sun, day 電源(でんげん): source of electricity, power (button on TV etc.) 電線(でんせん): electric line 乾電池(かんでんち): dry cell, battery 停電(ていでん): failure of electricity 電球(でんきゅう): light bulb 電子(でんし): electron, (as a prefix) electronic, electronics 電池(でんち): battery 電柱(でんちゅう): telephone pole, telegraph pole, lightpole 電波(でんぱ): electro-magnetic wave 電流(でんりゅう): electric current 電力(でんりょく): electric power 発電(はつでん): generation (e.g. power) 電灯(でんとう): light 電報(でんぽう): telegram 電気(でんき): electricity, (electric) light 電車(でんしゃ): electric train 電話(でんわ): telephone Kunyomi: Onyomi: デン Lesson: 21 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 5 Compounds:	electricity 電 画数13 574 Details Story Dictionary 電 electricity Heisig's Rain/weather . . . eel. consummate Details Story Dictionary 遂 consummate Heisig's The horns atop the sow suggest a boar at work in the background. Add the element for a road. Now create a story whose meaning is: consummate. Koohii #1 This is still Miss Piggy only she´s gotten horny (as she often does) and now she´s pursuing Kermit to help her consummate her desires. Koohii #2 In association with pursue (#539), our sow has tracked down a suitable mate, they´ve consummated their relationship, and now the little sow is all grown up into a boar with horns. "house Details Story Dictionary 家 house Heisig's This is the full character whose primitive form we learned already. To help a little, this kanji recalls the times when the ""domestic"" animals were, as the word itself suggests, really kept in the house. Hence: house . . . sow. Koohii #1 Think of ""The Three Little Pigs"". There was a house made of straw, another made of sticks, and a third made of bricks, each occupied by a pig. So, naturally, housetop over pig means house, the central element of that story. Koohii #2 Man, ever hear of cleaning? This house is a pig sty. Primitives house, sow, pig 家出(いえで): running away from home, leaving home 家主(いえぬし): landlord 家計(かけい): household economy, family finances 家畜(かちく): domestic animals, livestock, cattle 家来(けらい): retainer, retinue, servant 実業家(じつぎょうか): industrialist, businessman 一家(いっか): house, home, a family, a household, one´s family, one´s folks, a style 大家(おおや): landlord, landlady 家屋(かおく): house, building 画家(がか): painter, artist 家具(かぐ): furniture 家事(かじ): housework, domestic chores 貸家(かしや): house for rent 家庭(かてい): home, family, household 国家(こっか): state, country, nation 作家(さっか): author, writer, novelist, artist 農家(のうか): farmer, farm family 家賃(やちん): rent 家主(やぬし): landlord 家(いえ): house, family 家族(かぞく): family, members of a family 家内(かない): (my) wife Kunyomi: いえ、や、うち Onyomi: カ、ケ Lesson: 21 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds: 家屋 (かおく), 家庭 (かてい), 作家 (さっか), 家 (いえ), 家 (や)"	"house 家 画数10 580 Details Story Dictionary 家 house Heisig's This is the full character whose primitive form we learned already. To help a little, this kanji recalls the times when the ""domestic"" animals were, as the word itself suggests, really kept in the house. Hence: house . . . sow. Koohii #1 Think of ""The Three Little Pigs"". There was a house made of straw, another made of sticks, and a third made of bricks, each occupied by a pig. So, naturally, housetop over pig means house, the central element of that story. Koohii #2 Man, ever hear of cleaning? This house is a pig sty. Primitives house, sow, pig 家出(いえで): running away from home, leaving home 家主(いえぬし): landlord 家計(かけい): household economy, family finances 家畜(かちく): domestic animals, livestock, cattle 家来(けらい): retainer, retinue, servant 実業家(じつぎょうか): industrialist, businessman 一家(いっか): house, home, a family, a household, one´s family, one´s folks, a style 大家(おおや): landlord, landlady 家屋(かおく): house, building 画家(がか): painter, artist 家具(かぐ): furniture 家事(かじ): housework, domestic chores 貸家(かしや): house for rent 家庭(かてい): home, family, household 国家(こっか): state, country, nation 作家(さっか): author, writer, novelist, artist 農家(のうか): farmer, farm family 家賃(やちん): rent 家主(やぬし): landlord 家(いえ): house, family 家族(かぞく): family, members of a family 家内(かない): (my) wife Kunyomi: いえ、や、うち Onyomi: カ、ケ Lesson: 21 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds: 家屋 (かおく), 家庭 (かてい), 作家 (さっか), 家 (いえ), 家 (や)"
marry into Details Story Dictionary 嫁 marry into Heisig's The kanji in this frame demonstrates the traditional Japanese approach to marriage: it is the woman who leaves her family for another household, thus marrying into a man's family. Koohii #1 Since the Nihonjin man is hardly ever home, the woman feels more like she´s married into the house than into a relationship. Koohii #2 Traditionally, it was the women who would marry into the households of their husband´s families. Primitives marry into, woman, house, sow, pig 花嫁(はなよめ): bride 嫁(よめ): bride, daughter-in-law Kunyomi: よめ、とつ.ぐ、い.く、ゆ.く Onyomi: カ Lesson: 21 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 嫁ぐ (とつ.ぐ), 嫁 (よめ)	marry into 嫁 画数13 581 Details Story Dictionary 嫁 marry into Heisig's The kanji in this frame demonstrates the traditional Japanese approach to marriage: it is the woman who leaves her family for another household, thus marrying into a man's family. Koohii #1 Since the Nihonjin man is hardly ever home, the woman feels more like she´s married into the house than into a relationship. Koohii #2 Traditionally, it was the women who would marry into the households of their husband´s families. overpowering Details Story Dictionary 豪 overpowering Heisig's Tall . . . crowned . . . sow. Koohii #1 In Orwell´s ´Animal Farm´ the pigs overpowered every other animals. They crownded themselves as ruler of the farm and walked tall on their rear legs, a crime strictly forbidden in the animal republic. Koohii #2 Ganon, the tall crowned pig, has been overpowering ther land of Hyrule for decades. intestines Details Story Dictionary 腸 intestines Heisig's Flesh . . . piggy bank. Koohii #1 Intestines are the part of the body that is taken out of piglets to make piggy banks. Just imagine factory workers scraping out the intestines of real piglets and packaging them up for little children. Koohii #2 Taking things too literally, you used a real piglet as a piggy bank. Now when you smash it open to get your coins out, you have to dig out your coins from its intestines. ew. Primitives intestines, moon, month, flesh, part of the body, piggy bank, sun, day, piglets 腸(ちょう): guts, bowels, intestines Kunyomi: はらわた Onyomi: チョウ Lesson: 21 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	intestines 腸 画数13 583 Details Story Dictionary 腸 intestines Heisig's Flesh . . . piggy bank. location Details Story Dictionary 場 location Heisig's Soil . . . piggy bank. Koohii #1 You´re looking for a good location to bury your piggy bank savings. It has to be in some soft soil that´s easy to dig up, well hidden, and easy to remember like this kanji. Koohii #2 Don´t confuse with place (#1127). Think of location not as a single fixed spot, but as the act of locating. You´ve buried your piggy bank in the dirt in your backyard, but you can´t remember where. You frantically dig everywhere in a process of location to find your piggy bank. Primitives location, soil, dirt, ground, piggy bank, sun, day, piglets 現場(げんじょう): actual spot, scene, scene of the crime 式場(しきじょう): ceremonial hall, place of ceremony (e.g. marriage) 相場(そうば): market price, speculation, estimation 道場(どうじょう): dojo, hall used for martial arts training, mandala 農場(のうじょう): farm (agriculture) 本場(ほんば): home, habitat, center, best place, genuine 満場(まんじょう): unanimous, whole audience 役場(やくば): town hall 来場(らいじょう): attendance 市場(いちば): town market, the marketplace (economics) 劇場(げきじょう): theatre 現場(げんば): actual spot, scene, scene of the crime 工場(こうば): factory, plant, mill, workshop 酒場(さかば): bar, bar-room 立場(たちば): standpoint, position, situation 登場(とうじょう): entry (on stage), appearance (on screen), entrance, introduction (into a market) 入場(にゅうじょう): entrance, admission, entering 場(ば): place, (physics) field 場所(ばしょ): place, location 場面(ばめん): scene, setting (e.g. of novel) 広場(ひろば): plaza 牧場(ぼくじょう): farm (livestock), pasture land, meadow, grazing land 売り場(うりば): selling area 会場(かいじょう): the place of meeting 工場(こうじょう): factory 駐車場(ちゅうしゃじょう): parking lot 場合(ばあい): case, occasion 飛行場(ひこうじょう): airfield, airport Kunyomi: ば Onyomi: ジョウ、チョウ Lesson: 21 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds: 場 (ば)	location 場 画数12 584 Details Story Dictionary 場 location Heisig's Soil . . . piggy bank. "hot water Details Story Dictionary 湯 hot water Heisig's Water . . . piggy bank. Koohii #1 Imagine a hot water kettle for your tea, except this one is a pink piggy bank that pours the water from its snout (and squeals when the water is piping hot). Make sure to use a potholder! Koohii #2 Hot water is a phrase that can mean ""getting into trouble."" This kanji pictures just one of the many meanings of that phrase: it´s water that you get into (with creditors and the like) when your piggy bank is empty! Primitives hot water, water, water droplets, water pistol, piggy bank, sun, day, piglets 茶の湯(ちゃのゆ): tea ceremony 熱湯(ねっとう): boiling water 湯気(ゆげ): steam, vapour 湯飲み(ゆのみ): teacup 湯(ゆ): hot water Kunyomi: ゆ Onyomi: トウ Lesson: 21 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 湯 (ゆ)"	"hot water 湯 画数12 585 Details Story Dictionary 湯 hot water Heisig's Water . . . piggy bank. "sheep Details Story Dictionary 羊 sheep Heisig's This pictograph shows the animal horns at the top attached to the head (3rd stroke), the front and back legs (strokes 4 and 5) and body (final stroke). * The primitive meaning of sheep can add the further connotations given in the following frame. As we saw with the cow, the ""tail"" is cut off when it is set immediately over another element: ⺷. Note the change in stroke order, as exemplified in the following frame. Koohii #1 Picture of a sheep run over by a steam roller. Must have been a ram, note the horns. Koohii #2 Our Lord and King put on ears and a tail to become a lowly sheep for the slaughter. Primitives sheep, horns 羊毛(ようもう): wool Kunyomi: ひつじ Onyomi: ヨウ Lesson: 21 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 羊 (ひつじ)"	"sheep 羊 画数6 586 Details Story Dictionary 羊 sheep Heisig's This pictograph shows the animal horns at the top attached to the head (3rd stroke), the front and back legs (strokes 4 and 5) and body (final stroke). * The primitive meaning of sheep can add the further connotations given in the following frame. As we saw with the cow, the ""tail"" is cut off when it is set immediately over another element: ⺷. Note the change in stroke order, as exemplified in the following frame. Koohii #1 Picture of a sheep run over by a steam roller. Must have been a ram, note the horns. Koohii #2 Our Lord and King put on ears and a tail to become a lowly sheep for the slaughter. Primitives sheep, horns 羊毛(ようもう): wool Kunyomi: ひつじ Onyomi: ヨウ Lesson: 21 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 羊 (ひつじ)"
beauty Details Story Dictionary 美 beauty My Story A *horny king* (who is *big*) is a sign of beauty Koohii #1 I guess this kanji proves it´s not just the Welsh whose idea of beauty is a large sheep. Koohii #2 A Sheep on top of a dog is NOT a beautiful thing.
