ocean Details Story Dictionary 洋 ocean Heisig's Water . . . sheep. Be sure to keep the stories and key word of this kanji distinct from those for sea. (Frame 500). Koohii #1 This kanji refers to the waters of the Pasheephic ocean. Koohii #2 Remember the story of Jason and the Argonauts from Greek myth? Jason travelled across oceans of water in order to recover the fleece of a certain sheep. Primitives ocean, water, water droplets, water pistol, sheep 洋風(ようふう): western style 海洋(かいよう): ocean 東洋(とうよう): Orient 洋品店(ようひんてん): shop which handles Western-style apparel and accessories 西洋(せいよう): West, Western countries 洋服(ようふく): Western-style clothes Kunyomi: Onyomi: ヨウ Lesson: 21 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds:	ocean 洋 画数9 588 Details Story Dictionary 洋 ocean Heisig's Water . . . sheep. "detailed Details Story Dictionary 詳 detailed Heisig's Words/speaking . . . sheep. Koohii #1 Trembling from head to hoof from such a traumatic experience, the sheep gives a very detailed worded account to the detective about his wolf attack. ""We need more details Mr. Sheep. Tell us exactly where the baaad man touched you"". Koohii #2 Say! detailed sheep, not like that! DE-TAILED sheep. Got it? Primitives detailed, say, words, keitai, mouth, sheep 詳細(しょうさい): detail, particulars 詳しい(くわしい): knowing very well, detailed, full, accurate Kunyomi: くわ.しい、つまび.らか Onyomi: ショウ Lesson: 21 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 詳しい (くわ.しい)"	"detailed 詳 画数13 589 Details Story Dictionary 詳 detailed Heisig's Words/speaking . . . sheep. "fresh Details Story Dictionary 鮮 fresh Heisig's Fish . . . sheep. Koohii #1 The freshest fish is caught in the middle of the night while most people are ""counting sheep."" (If you´ve ever been to Tsukiji fish market, you know what I mean). Koohii #2 This one´s easy to remember. The kanji gives 2 examples of foods that should be purchased fresh. To remember which foods, take the first letter of fresh, ""F"", to stand for fish and the final sound of fresh, ""SH"", to stand for sheep: FreSH. It even puts the primitives in the right order. Primitives fresh, fish, bound up, rice field, brains, oven-fire, barbecue, sheep 鮮やか(あざやか): vivid, clear, brilliant 新鮮(しんせん): fresh Kunyomi: あざ.やか Onyomi: セン Lesson: 21 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 鮮やか (あざ.やか)"	"fresh 鮮 画数17 590 Details Story Dictionary 鮮 fresh Heisig's Fish . . . sheep. Koohii #2 This one´s easy to remember. The kanji gives 2 examples of foods that should be purchased fresh. accomplished / plural/delivery Details Story Dictionary 達 accomplished / plural/delivery My Story [Jesus + Sheep + Movement/] *Jesus* moved around with his *pack* of sheep; the catholic *movement* is built, he felt #accomplished# Koohii #1 Dolly (the first cloned sheep ever) grow tired of being a celebrity and escaped from the labs by digging a tunnel. She turned out to be an ACCOMPLISHED escapist, as she managed to dig a road under the soil. /Imagine Dolly performing a escape, like those movies where the main character has to escape from jail. Koohii #2 The dirty sheep had come far down this road and had accomplished many things. Primitives accomplished, soil, dirt, ground, sheep, road 達者(たっしゃ): skillful, in good health 達成(たっせい): achievement 伝達(でんたつ): transmission (e.g. news), communication, delivery 到達(とうたつ): reaching, attaining, arrival 上達(じょうたつ): improvement, advance, progress 速達(そくたつ): express, special delivery 達する(たっする): reach, get to 配達(はいたつ): delivery, distribution 発達(はったつ): development, growth 友達(ともだち): friend Kunyomi: -たち Onyomi: タツ、ダ Lesson: 21 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds:	accomplished / plural/delivery 達 画数12 591 Details Story Dictionary 達 accomplished / plural/delivery My Story [Jesus + Sheep + Movement/] *Jesus* moved around with his *pack* of sheep; the catholic *movement* is built, he felt #accomplished# Koohii #1 Dolly (the first cloned sheep ever) grow tired of being a celebrity and escaped from the labs by digging a tunnel. envious Details Story Dictionary 羨 envious My Story A *devil king* (sheep) that *lacks* *water* is destined to be envious of others Koohii #1 A very thirsty sheep, who always lacked water, spends his days watching his fellow sheep (in the farm next door or in another pen) and being very envious of their water. Koohii #2 Envious of the greener grass on the other side of the fence, the sheep looks down in disgust at his own dry grass lacking water. Primitives envious, sheep, water, water droplets, water pistol, lack, yawn 羨ましい(うらやましい): envious, enviable 羨む(うらやむ): envy Kunyomi: うらや.む、あまり Onyomi: セン、エン Lesson: 21 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: Compounds: 羨ましい (うらや.ましい), 羨む (うらや.む)	envious 羨 画数13 592 Details Story Dictionary 羨 envious My Story A *devil king* (sheep) that *lacks* *water* is destined to be envious of others Koohii #1 A very thirsty sheep, who always lacked water, spends his days watching his fellow sheep (in the farm next door or in another pen) and being very envious of their water. Koohii #2 Envious of the greener grass on the other side of the fence, the sheep looks down in disgust at his own dry grass lacking water. distinction Details Story Dictionary 差 distinction Heisig's Wool . . . craft. Koohii #1 This New-Zealand pro-gamer has won many distinctions playing WoolCraft (a massively multi-user game in which the goal is to shear sheep). Koohii #2 Noob players make no distinction between what games they play, whether it´s the geniune thing or a bootleg fake copy. The biggest example of course, would be the legit World of Warcraft and the biggest ripoff there is: World of Wool-craft! "don Details Story Dictionary 着 don Heisig's I cannot resist doing this one for you, since it clearly describes donning (putting on) one's clothes as ""pulling the wool over one's eyes."" Koohii #1 A pullover is donned by pulling wool over your eyes. Koohii #2 Someone who is donning a disguise does that in order to pull the wool over your eyes. Primitives don, wool, sheep, eye 落ち着き(おちつき): calm, composure 着飾る(きかざる): to dress up 執着(しゅうじゃく): attachment, adhesion, tenacity 先着(せんちゃく): first arrival 辿り着く(たどりつく): to grope along to, to struggle on to, to arrive somewhere after a struggle 着(ちゃく): counter for suits of clothing, arriving at .. 着手(ちゃくしゅ): embarkation, launch 着色(ちゃくしょく): colouring, coloring 着席(ちゃくせき): sit down, seat 着目(ちゃくもく): attention 着陸(ちゃくりく): landing, alighting, touch down 着工(ちゃっこう): start of (construction) work 着ける(つける): to arrive, to wear, to put on 落着く(おちつく): calm down, settle in, be steady 着替え(きがえ): changing clothes, change of clothes 着せる(きせる): put on clothes 着々(ちゃくちゃく): steadily 到着(とうちゃく): arrival 肌着(はだぎ): underwear, lingerie, singlet, chemise 着物(きもの): Japanese traditional dress 下着(したぎ): underwear 上着(うわぎ): coat, tunic, jacket, outer garment 着る(きる): to wear, put on (from shoulders down) 着く(つく): arrive at, reach Kunyomi: き.る、-ぎ、き.せる、-き.せ、つ.く、つ.ける Onyomi: チャク、ジャク Lesson: 21 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds: 着用 (ちゃくよう), 着手 (ちゃくしゅ), 土着 (どちゃく), 着せる (き.せる), 着る (き.る), 着く (つ.く), 着ける (つ.ける)"	"don 着 画数12 594 Details Story Dictionary 着 don Heisig's I cannot resist doing this one for you, since it clearly describes donning (putting on) one's clothes as ""pulling the wool over one's eyes."" "solely Details Story Dictionary 唯 solely Heisig's Mouth . . . turkey. Koohii #1 The mouth of a turkey is used solely for saying, ""Gobble."" Likewise, your mouth, full of turkey, is solely used to gobble it up. Koohii #2 Sadly my mouth gets to taste turkey solely on Christmas Day. piled high Details Story Dictionary 堆 piled high Heisig's Soil . . . turkey. Koohii #1 After our pre-Thanksgiving massacre, we piled high all the turkey corpses atop the soil of the farmyard. Koohii #2 During the Turkey Holocaust (this is what the animal kingdom calls Thanksgiving - they have really short memories and thus don´t recall that it actually happens every single year), turkeys are killed en masse, and their bodies are piled high. To keep them from tumbling down, a pile of dirt is piled high right next to them to keep them standing upright so that they will be fresh when it is time to eat them. Primitives piled high, soil, dirt, ground, turkey Kunyomi: うずたか.い Onyomi: タイ、ツイ Lesson: 21 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: Compounds:	piled high 堆 画数11 596 Details Story Dictionary 堆 piled high Heisig's Soil . . . turkey. "who Details Story Dictionary 誰 who Heisig's Words . . . turkey. Koohii #1 Do you remember that song where they say ""Who let the turkeys out!? Gobble.. gobble.. gobble""? Koohii #2 [who; someone; somebody] You´re alone when, suddenly, you think you hear someone speaking. ""Who´s there?"", you say, but there is no answer. Then you find out it was only a turkey gobbling. You feel relieved (and ashamed to tell this story). (Based on raulir). Primitives who?, who, say, words, keitai, mouth, turkey 誰(たれ): adjectival suffix for a person 誰(だれ): who 誰か(だれか): someone, somebody Kunyomi: だれ、たれ、た Onyomi: スイ Lesson: 21 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: Compounds: 誰 (だれ)"	"who 誰 画数15 598 Details Story Dictionary 誰 who Heisig's Words . . . turkey. char Details Story Dictionary 焦 char Heisig's Turkey . . . oven fire. Koohii #1 When I put the turkey over the oven fire, it always ends up being charred beyond recognition. I´m not a very good cook. Koohii #2 Char could be any meat over oven fire. So why is it a turkey in this kanji? Because charred turkey is what sticks out most in your mind as the thing that ruined Thanksgiving dinner. gather Details Story Dictionary 集 gather My Story Gather the *turkeys* for Thanksgiving. Gather the *trees* for Christmas. In that order... Koohii #1 Hunter-gathers, searching all along the ground for food. They never look up and see the Turkeys that have gathered on top of the trees to hide. Those were some smart turkeys! Koohii #2 Gather the turkeys for Thanksgiving. Gather the trees for Christmas. In that order... "miscellaneous Details Story Dictionary 雑 miscellaneous My Story Only in the miscellaneous department can you buy *9* *wooden* *turkeys* Koohii #1 Newscast: ""Among today´s miscellaneous stories, we have a report on a baseball team that was chased up a tree by a turkey. Stay tuned for this and more!"". Koohii #2 On the left we have baseball and wood, which obviously means a baseball bat. Instead of balls, there are miscellaneous other objects you may hit with it. While beating people may be one favorite use, in this case we see it used for making turkey mash. female Details Story Dictionary 雌 female Heisig's This character for female forms a pair with that for male, which we will learn later (Frame 804). The elements: footprint . . . spoon . . . turkey. Koohii #1 Stop | spooning | turkeys. Spoon females. Koohii #2 To become feminine you must stop using a spoon to eat turkey and use a knife and fork like a proper lady. semi- / (prepare / criteria) Details Story Dictionary 準 semi- / (prepare / criteria) My Story [Water + Turkey + Ten/needle] For thanks giving, I first *water* down the *turkeys*, then I shoot a *needle* into it. Used in: 準備 (じゅんび) Koohii #1 The anhinga, or water turkey, has a needle-like nose, so really it´s only a semi-turkey http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anhinga. Koohii #2 At the turkey fighting semi-final, turkeys are injected with drugs via needles and splashed with water to help them last the match. Primitives semi-, water, water droplets, water pistol, turkey, ten, needle 基準(きじゅん): standard, basis, criteria, norm 準急(じゅんきゅう): local express (train slower than an express) 準じる(じゅんじる): to follow, to conform, to apply to 準ずる(じゅんずる): to apply correspondingly, to correspond to, to be proportionate to, to conform to 規準(きじゅん): standard, basis, criteria, norm 水準(すいじゅん): water level, level, standard 標準(ひょうじゅん): standard, level 準備(じゅんび): prepare Kunyomi: じゅん.じる、じゅん.ずる、なぞら.える、のり、ひと.しい、みずもり Onyomi: ジュン Lesson: 21 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds:	semi- / (prepare / criteria) 準 画数13 606 Details Story Dictionary 準 semi- / (prepare / criteria) My Story [Water + Turkey + Ten/needle] For thanks giving, I first *water* down the *turkeys*, then I shoot a *needle* into it. stirred up Details Story Dictionary 奮 stirred up Heisig's St. Bernard dog . . . turkey . . . rice field/brains. Koohii #1 The St. Bernard dog pounces on a turkey in a rice field and stirs up all the other birds around. See them all gobble gobbling in fear? Koohii #2 Gruesome, but it makes it easy to remember. Here goes: The St. Bernard stirred up a crowd of turkeys and caught one. It bit the head, brains spilling onto the rice field. Primitives stirred up, large, St. Bernard, turkey, rice field, brains 興奮(こうふん): excitement, stimulation, agitation, arousal 奮闘(ふんとう): hard struggle, strenuous effort Kunyomi: ふる.う Onyomi: フン Lesson: 21 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 奮う (ふる.う)	stirred up 奮 画数16 607 Details Story Dictionary 奮 stirred up Heisig's St. Bernard dog . . . turkey . . . rice field/brains. rob Details Story Dictionary 奪 rob Heisig's Whereas burglary (Frame 381) implies clandestine appropriation of another's property, robbery refers to taking by force. The primitive elements: St. Bernard dog . . . turkey . . . glue. Koohii #1 Remember the scene in A Christmas Story where the big dogs robbed the family of their Christmas turkey? Well, the following year Ralphie´s mom glued the holiday bird to the kitchen table, just as a precaution. Koohii #2 Don´t let the neighbor´s St.Bernard rob tonight´s turkey....glue it to the table if you must. Primitives rob, large, St. Bernard, turkey, glue 略奪(りゃくだつ): pillage, plunder, looting, robbery 奪う(うばう): snatch away Kunyomi: うば.う Onyomi: ダツ Lesson: 21 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 奪う (うば.う)	rob 奪 画数14 608 Details Story Dictionary 奪 rob Heisig's Whereas burglary (Frame 381) implies clandestine appropriation of another's property, robbery refers to taking by force. "assurance Details Story Dictionary 確 assurance My Story I assure you these crown shaped turkey nuggets are cooked on STONE Koohii #1 To assure that no one will get into the Turkey coop, put a huge rock in the entrance! Koohii #2 You´ve heard the expression ""killing two birds with one stone."" (一石二鳥 is-seki-ni-chou). We´ll, there´s another one that roughly translates as ""killing an entire coop with a giant boulder. "" That´s the method that hunters use when they want absolute assurance of taking home a bird. Primitives assurance, stone, rock, turkeyhouse, house, turkey 確信(かくしん): conviction, confidence 確定(かくてい): definition (math), decision, settlement 確保(かくほ): guarantee, ensure, maintain, insure, secure 確立(かくりつ): establishment 確り(しっかり): firmly, tightly, reliable, level-headed, steady 的確(てきかく): precise, accurate 適確(てきかく): precise, accurate 確実(かくじつ): certainty, reliability, soundness 確認(かくにん): affirmation, confirmation 確率(かくりつ): probability 正確(せいかく): accurate, punctual, exact, authentic, veracious 確かめる(たしかめる): ascertain 明確(めいかく): clear up, clarify, define 確か(たしか): sure, certain Kunyomi: たし.か、たし.かめる Onyomi: カク、コウ Lesson: 21 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 確か (たし.か), 確かめる (たし.かめる)"	"assurance 確 画数15 609 Details Story Dictionary 確 assurance My Story I assure you these crown shaped turkey nuggets are cooked on STONE Koohii #1 To assure that no one will get into the Turkey coop, put a huge rock in the entrance! noon Details Story Dictionary 午 noon Heisig's With a bit of stretching, you might see a horse's head pointing leftwards in this character. That gives the primary meaning of the Chinese zodiacal sign of the horse, which corresponds to the hour of noon. Note how this kanji primitive differs from that for cow (Frame 260). * As a primitive, this character gets the meaning of a horse. Any horse image will do, except that of a team of horses, which will come later (Frame 2132) and get its own primitive. Koohii #1 Noon is a good time for a ten minute nap (using lie down as nap). Koohii #2 Noon is the hour of the horse. Primitives noon, horse, pantomime horse, noon, sign of the horse 正午(しょうご): noon, mid-day 午後(ごご): afternoon, P.M. 午前(ごぜん): morning, A.M. Kunyomi: うま Onyomi: ゴ Lesson: 21 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 5 Compounds:	noon 午 画数4 610 Details Story Dictionary 午 noon Heisig's With a bit of stretching, you might see a horse's head pointing leftwards in this character. That gives the primary meaning of the Chinese zodiacal sign of the horse, which corresponds to the hour of noon. Note how this kanji primitive differs from that for cow (Frame 260). * As a primitive, this character gets the meaning of a horse. Any horse image will do, except that of a team of horses, which will come later (Frame 2132) and get its own primitive. Koohii #1 Noon is a good time for a ten minute nap (using lie down as nap). Koohii #2 Noon is the hour of the horse. Primitives noon, horse, pantomime horse, noon, sign of the horse 正午(しょうご): noon, mid-day 午後(ごご): afternoon, P.M. 午前(ごぜん): morning, A.M. Kunyomi: うま Onyomi: ゴ Lesson: 21 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 5 Compounds:
permit Details Story Dictionary 許 permit My Story Keep Your Opinions to yourself until I allow you to *say* them at *noon*. Koohii #1 If horses could speak, you might have to ask their permission before mounting them. Koohii #2 Mr Ed ( a famous talking horse ) was finally at a loss for words when told he would need a permit for public speaking. "delight Details Story Dictionary 歓 delight Heisig's Again I cannot resist sharing my own associations. If you've ever seen Disney's animated interpretation of classical music, ""Fantasia,"" you will recall what was done there with Beethoven's ""Pastoral Symphony"" (the 6th), and the flying horses that figured in it. The mares are bathing in the stream and the stallions begin to gather. As dusk sets in, the flying horses all start yawning and pair off for the night: a perfectly delightful portrait of delight. Koohii #1 Imagine a spoiled little girl. Her delight when she gets a Pegasus for her birthday... and then like all spoilt little girls she gets bored of it quickly... hence the yawn. Koohii #2 I would be delighted if Japanese lacked the Pegasus kanji. Primitives delight, pegasus, horse, pantomime horse, noon, sign of the horse, turkey, lack, yawn 歓声(かんせい): cheer, shout of joy 歓迎(かんげい): welcome, reception Kunyomi: よろこ.ぶ Onyomi: カン Lesson: 21 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"	"delight 歓 画数15 612 Details Story Dictionary 歓 delight Heisig's Again I cannot resist sharing my own associations. The mares are bathing in the stream and the stallions begin to gather. As dusk sets in, the flying horses all start yawning and pair off for the night: a perfectly delightful portrait of delight. Koohii #2 I would be delighted if Japanese lacked the Pegasus kanji. Primitives delight, pegasus, horse, pantomime horse, noon, sign of the horse, turkey, lack, yawn 歓声(かんせい): cheer, shout of joy 歓迎(かんげい): welcome, reception Kunyomi: よろこ.ぶ Onyomi: カン Lesson: 21 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"
authority Details Story Dictionary 権 authority Heisig's Tree . . . Pegasus. Koohii #1 I have Eric Cartman of the “South Park” animated series, wearing a cop uniform, riding a wooden Pegasus (such as on a funfair), and yelling “RESPECT MY AUTHORITAH!!!”. Koohii #2 No one has the authority to tie up a pegasus to a tree! Primitives authority, tree, wood, pegasus, horse, pantomime horse, noon, sign of the horse, turkey 棄権(きけん): abstain from voting, renunciation of a right 権威(けんい): authority, power, influence 権(けん): authority, the right (to do something) 権限(けんげん): power, authority, jurisdiction 権力(けんりょく): power, authority, influence 主権(しゅけん): sovereignty, supremacy, dominion 政権(せいけん): administration, political power 特権(とっけん): privilege, special right 権利(けんり): right, privilege Kunyomi: おもり、かり、はか.る Onyomi: ケン、ゴン Lesson: 21 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 権利 (けんり), 権威 (けんい), 人権 (じんけん)	authority 権 画数15 613 Details Story Dictionary 権 authority Heisig's Tree . . . Pegasus. Koohii #1 I have Eric Cartman of the “South Park” animated series, wearing a cop uniform, riding a wooden Pegasus (such as on a funfair), and yelling “RESPECT MY AUTHORITAH!!!”. Koohii #2 No one has the authority to tie up a pegasus to a tree! outlook Details Story Dictionary 観 outlook Heisig's Pegasus . . . see. Koohii #1 Microsoft Outlook works about as well as a pegasus that can´t see: they both crash all the time. Koohii #2 I used to hate birds.They´re loud, stupid and worst of all they shit on your head. Used to think birds were the most vile creatures on earth. Then I encountered a pegasus. I was just walking down the road, minding my own business when I happened to look up. I saw it there, braying noisily, ivory wings outstretched like an angel, back leg raised ever so slightly. It dropped a steaming brown load right on my face. It changed my outlook completely. Birds are the second most vile creatures on earth. Primitives outlook, pegasus, horse, pantomime horse, noon, sign of the horse, turkey, see, telescope, eye, human legs 外観(がいかん): appearance, exterior, facade 観(かん): look, appearance, spectacle 観衆(かんしゅう): spectators, onlookers, members of the audience 観点(かんてん): point of view 観覧(かんらん): viewing 客観(きゃっかん): objective 主観(しゅかん): subjectivity, subject, ego 悲観(ひかん): pessimism, disappointment 楽観(らっかん): optimism 観客(かんきゃく): audience, spectator(s) 観光(かんこう): sightseeing 観察(かんさつ): observation, survey 観測(かんそく): observation 観念(かんねん): idea, notion, conception, sense (e.g. of duty), resignation, preparedness, acceptance Kunyomi: み.る、しめ.す Onyomi: カン Lesson: 21 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds:	outlook 観 画数18 614 Details Story Dictionary 観 outlook Heisig's Pegasus . . . see. Used to think birds were the most vile creatures on earth. Then I encountered a pegasus. I was just walking down the road, minding my own business when I happened to look up. I saw it there, braying noisily, ivory wings outstretched like an angel, back leg raised ever so slightly. It dropped a steaming brown load right on my face. It changed my outlook completely. Birds are the second most vile creatures on earth. feathers Details Story Dictionary 羽 feathers Heisig's From the pictograph of two bird-wings, we get feathers. * The related image of wings can be added as a primitive meaning. It can also take the form ョョ when used as a primitive, as we shall see in frames 618 and 619. Koohii #1 Pictograph. Easy enough. Koohii #2 These days the biggest concern in airline safety is ICE on the WINGS of the plane. Birds that fly long distances also have to worry about getting ICE on their FEATHERS. Primitives feathers, wings 羽(はね): feather, wing 羽根(はね): shuttlecock Kunyomi: は、わ、はね Onyomi: ウ Lesson: 21 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 羽 (は), 羽 (はね)	feathers 羽 画数6 615 Details Story Dictionary 羽 feathers Heisig's From the pictograph of two bird-wings, we get feathers. * The related image of wings can be added as a primitive meaning. It can also take the form ョョ when used as a primitive, as we shall see in frames 618 and 619. Koohii #1 Pictograph. Easy enough. Koohii #2 These days the biggest concern in airline safety is ICE on the WINGS of the plane. Birds that fly long distances also have to worry about getting ICE on their FEATHERS. learn Details Story Dictionary 習 learn My Story [Feathers {羽} + White] The feather-weight white-belt has a lot to learn... Koohii #1 Imagine a white bird loosing a couple feathers as it is learning to fly. You learn a lesson as you watch it doing so, maybe you learn that “nothing comes for free” or that “one has to be prepared to loose in order to gain”... Koohii #2 Learning is all about adding more feathers to your cap and the most prestigious of all is the beautiful pure white feather you´ll receive when you have learned the kanji! Primitives learn, feathers, wings, white, dove 演習(えんしゅう): practice, exercises, manoeuvers 慣習(かんしゅう): usual (historical) custom 教習(きょうしゅう): training, instruction 講習(こうしゅう): short course, training 風習(ふうしゅう): custom 学習(がくしゅう): study, learning 自習(じしゅう): self-study 実習(じっしゅう): practice, training 習字(しゅうじ): penmanship 習慣(しゅうかん): habit, custom 復習(ふくしゅう): review 予習(よしゅう): preparation 習う(ならう): learn 練習(れんしゅう): practice Kunyomi: なら.う、なら.い Onyomi: シュウ、ジュ Lesson: 21 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds: 習う (なら.う)	learn 習 画数11 616 Details Story Dictionary 習 learn My Story [Feathers {羽} + White] The feather-weight white-belt has a lot to learn... Koohii #2 Your feathers would also stand up if you were a hen in a slaughter house and you heard: ""The following!"". "weekday Details Story Dictionary 曜 weekday Heisig's Day . . . feathers . . . turkey. Koohii #1 Tip: feathers + turkey : This combination of primitives appears six times in Heisig, so it´s worthwhile giving it a name. I suggest ""futon"" (your futon is made from turkey feathers). REF: weekday (FRAME 576) , laundry (#577), leap (#1285), outstanding (#2272), twinkle (#2534), shimmering (#2880). Story: On weekdays you hang your futon out in the sun. Koohii #2 The poor farmer spends every weekday while the sun shines, plucking turkey feathers. Primitives weekday, sun, day, futon, feathers, wings, turkey 火曜(かよう): Tuesday 金曜(きんよう): Friday 月曜(げつよう): Monday 水曜(すいよう): Wednesday 土曜(どよう): Saturday 木曜(もくよう): Thursday 曜日(ようび): day of the week 火曜日(かようび): Tuesday 金曜日(きんようび): Friday 月曜日(げつようび): Monday 水曜日(すいようび): Wednesday 土曜日(どようび): Saturday 日曜日(にちようび): Sunday 木曜日(もくようび): Thursday Kunyomi: Onyomi: ヨウ Lesson: 21 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds:"	"weekday 曜 画数18 618 Details Story Dictionary 曜 weekday Heisig's Day . . . feathers . . . turkey. Koohii #1 Tip: feathers + turkey : This combination of primitives appears six times in Heisig, so it´s worthwhile giving it a name. I suggest ""futon"" (your futon is made from turkey feathers). REF: weekday (FRAME 576) , laundry (#577), leap (#1285), outstanding (#2272), twinkle (#2534), shimmering (#2880). Story: On weekdays you hang your futon out in the sun. Koohii #2 The poor farmer spends every weekday while the sun shines, plucking turkey feathers. Primitives weekday, sun, day, futon, feathers, wings, turkey 火曜(かよう): Tuesday 金曜(きんよう): Friday 月曜(げつよう): Monday 水曜(すいよう): Wednesday 土曜(どよう): Saturday 木曜(もくよう): Thursday 曜日(ようび): day of the week 火曜日(かようび): Tuesday 金曜日(きんようび): Friday 月曜日(げつようび): Monday 水曜日(すいようび): Wednesday 土曜日(どようび): Saturday 日曜日(にちようび): Sunday 木曜日(もくようび): Thursday Kunyomi: Onyomi: ヨウ Lesson: 21 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds:"
laundry Details Story Dictionary 濯 laundry My Story [Water + Day of week (with no day kanji) {曜}] I do my laundry on Wednesday, because that is the *day* of *water* Koohii #1 At the laundry you stuff your large futon (made from turkey feathers) in the machine, thereby causing it to break -- as shown by the water spurting out the side. Koohii #2 When turkeys do the laundry, they put their feathers in water (they don´t have clothes). Primitives laundry, water, water droplets, water pistol, futon, feathers, wings, turkey 濯ぐ(すすぐ): to rinse, to wash out 洗濯(せんたく): washing, laundry Kunyomi: すす.ぐ、ゆす.ぐ Onyomi: タク Lesson: 21 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 2 Compounds:	laundry 濯 画数17 619 Details Story Dictionary 濯 laundry My Story [Water + Day of week (with no day kanji) {曜}] I do my laundry on Wednesday, because that is the *day* of *water* Koohii #1 At the laundry you stuff your large futon (made from turkey feathers) in the machine, thereby causing it to break -- as shown by the water spurting out the side. Koohii #2 When turkeys do the laundry, they put their feathers in water (they don´t have clothes). "sayeth Details Story Dictionary 曰 sayeth Heisig's Pent in . . . one. The key word refers to famous sayings of famous people, and is the origin for the primitive meaning of a tongue wagging in the mouth that we learned in frame 12. The size of this kanji, a relatively rare one, is what distinguishes it from day. Koohii #1 Sayeth?! Who the hell says ""sayeth""? Doesn´t seem quite right...just like this kanji, which is just like ""day"" but doesn´t seem ""quite right."". Koohii #2 When pent up alone, one sayeth little. Primitives sayeth, pent in, one Kunyomi: いわ.く、のたま.う、のたま.わく、ここに、ひらび Onyomi: エツ Lesson: 22 Jouyou: JLPT Level: Compounds:"	"sayeth 曰 画数4 620 Details Story Dictionary 曰 sayeth Heisig's Pent in . . . one. quandary Details Story Dictionary 困 quandary Heisig's Pent in . . . trees. Koohii #1 I´m supposed to make an enclosure for my tree, but if I use its wood for the enclosure, there won´t be anything left to be pent-in. What a quandary! Koohii #2 You are pent in the garden of eden with one tree, but outside is the whole world to explore! What a quandary -- should you stay in paradise with the tree of knowledge or should you go out into the world? Primitives quandary, pent in, tree, wood 貧困(ひんこん): poverty, lack 困難(こんなん): difficulty, distress 困る(こまる): be troubled, be worried, be bothered Kunyomi: こま.る Onyomi: コン Lesson: 22 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 困る (こま.る)	quandary 困 画数7 621 Details Story Dictionary 困 quandary Heisig's Pent in . . . trees. harden Details Story Dictionary 固 harden My Story [Mouth/Pent (closed in) + Old] Fossils are *old* things *pent in* that have hardened Koohii #1 Fossils are old things pent in that have hardened. Koohii #2 Remember Metapod from Pokemon? All it used was harden, which kept it pent in until it grew old enough to evolve into Butterfree.. Primitives harden, pent in, old, tombstone, gravestone, church, ten, needle, mouth 固める(かためる): to harden, to freeze, to fortify 頑固(がんこ): stubbornness, obstinacy 固体(こたい): solid (body) 固定(こてい): fixation 固有(こゆう): characteristic, tradition, peculiar, inherent, eigen- 固い(かたい): firm (not viscous or easily moved), stubborn, certain, solemn 固まる(かたまる): harden, solidify, become firm, become certain Kunyomi: かた.める、かた.まる、かた.まり、かた.い Onyomi: コ Lesson: 22 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 固い (かた.い), 固まる (かた.まる), 固める (かた.める)	harden 固 画数8 622 Details Story Dictionary 固 harden My Story [Mouth/Pent (closed in) + Old] Fossils are *old* things *pent in* that have hardened Koohii #1 Fossils are old things pent in that have hardened. weld Details Story Dictionary 錮 weld Heisig's Metal . . . harden. Koohii #1 You weld metal in the knowledge that it will harden again. Koohii #2 By welding metal and then subjecting it to refrigeration, it will become very hard by the process known as annealing. Kunyomi: ふさ.ぐ Onyomi: コ Lesson: 22 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: Compounds:	weld 錮 画数16 623 Details Story Dictionary 錮 weld Heisig's Metal . . . harden. country Details Story Dictionary 国 country Heisig's Jewels . . . pent in. Koohii #1 In my country (England) the crown jewels are kept pent-in in the Tower of London. Which happens to be where enemies of the state were once also pent-in (probably for trying to steal those jewels). Koohii #2 Just think of Japan, a country which is like a jewel but historically very enclosed. Primitives country, pent in, king, jewel, ball, earring, drop 国境(くにざかい): national or state border 国産(こくさん): domestic products 国定(こくてい): state-sponsored, national 国土(こくど): realm 国防(こくぼう): national defence 国有(こくゆう): national ownership 国連(こくれん): U.N., United Nations 国交(こっこう): diplomatic relations 天国(てんごく): paradise, heaven, Kingdom of Heaven 国王(こくおう): king 国語(こくご): national language 国籍(こくせき): nationality 国民(こくみん): people, citizen 国立(こくりつ): national 国家(こっか): state, country, nation 国会(こっかい): National Diet, parliament, congress 国境(こっきょう): national or state border 全国(ぜんこく): nation-wide, whole country, national 国際(こくさい): international 外国(がいこく): foreign country 外国人(がいこくじん): foreigner 国(くに): country Kunyomi: くに Onyomi: コク Lesson: 22 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 5 Compounds: 国 (くに)	country 国 画数8 624 Details Story Dictionary 国 country Heisig's Jewels . . . pent in. "group Details Story Dictionary 団 group Heisig's Glued . . . pent in. Koohii #1 When you are admitted into a group like the Yakuza, you´re well and truly done (だん) for. You must stick to the group like glue, and you will be pent-in for life, never being able to leave. Koohii #2 A pent-in group will naturally be more cohesive, or ""glued together."". Primitives group, pent in, glue 団扇(うちわ): fan 劇団(げきだん): troupe, theatrical company 公団(こうだん): public corporation 団結(だんけつ): unity, union, combination 座布団(ざぶとん): cushion (Japanese-- square cushion used when sitting on one´s knees on a tatami-mat floor) 集団(しゅうだん): group, mass 団体(だんたい): party of tourists 団地(だんち): multi-unit apartments 布団(ふとん): futon Kunyomi: かたまり、まる.い Onyomi: ダン、トン Lesson: 22 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 団結 (だんけつ), 団地 (だんち), 集団 (しゅうだん)"	"group 団 画数6 625 Details Story Dictionary 団 group Heisig's Glued . . . pent in. origin/cause Details Story Dictionary 因 origin/cause My Story [Mouth + Big] The show *big* *mouth* talks the #cause/origin# of adulthood (puberty) A *big* *mouth* is the cause of many problems... Koohii #1 We once had a dog with big paws // and oh what great trouble he´d cause // we built a huge pen // to keep him pent in // and stop him from breaking more laws //. Koohii #2 Why is there poop on the kitchen floor? Oh, the cause is that you kept the dog pent in the house all day. Next time remember to walk him. Primitives cause, pent in, large, St. Bernard 要因(よういん): primary factor, main cause 因る(よる): come from 原因(げんいん): cause Kunyomi: よ.る、ちな.む Onyomi: イン Lesson: 22 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 因る (よ.る)	origin/cause 因 画数6 626 Details Story Dictionary 因 origin/cause My Story [Mouth + Big] The show *big* *mouth* talks the #cause/origin# of adulthood (puberty) A *big* *mouth* is the cause of many problems... "matrimony Details Story Dictionary 姻 matrimony Heisig's Woman . . . cause. Think here of the ""state of matrimony"" and you will not confuse it with other characters involving marriage, one of which we have already met (Frame 581). Koohii #1 Matrimony is the state in which the woman has got you pent in like a dog so that you cannot go after other bitches. Koohii #2 When the woman gets angry, she treats her man like a pent in dog (i.e., puts him in the doghouse). It´s a perfect metaphor for the state of matrimony. Primitives matrimony, woman, cause, pent in, large, St. Bernard Kunyomi: Onyomi: イン Lesson: 22 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"	"matrimony 姻 画数9 627 Details Story Dictionary 姻 matrimony Heisig's Woman . . . cause. Koohii #2 When the woman gets angry, she treats her man like a pent in dog (i.e., puts him in the doghouse). It´s a perfect metaphor for the state of matrimony. "windpipe Details Story Dictionary 咽 windpipe Heisig's Mouth . . . cause. Koohii #1 You can´t breathe very well, so the doc looks inside your mouth to find the cause. ""Oh, I see the cause of your windpipe blockage. There´s a St Bernard penned up in there!"". Koohii #2 Imagine a group of windpipes chatting: “That mouth is the cause of all my problems, you know, always breathing in germs, etc.”. Primitives windpipe, mouth, cause, pent in, large, St. Bernard Kunyomi: むせ.ぶ、むせ.る、のど、の.む Onyomi: イン、エン、エツ Lesson: 22 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: Compounds:"	"windpipe 咽 画数9 628 Details Story Dictionary 咽 windpipe Heisig's Mouth . . . cause. Koohii #2 There was a homeless man living in a box at the park so I gave him a lidded crock filled with hot curry tied with a scarf... "-times Details Story Dictionary 回 -times Heisig's The suffix ""-times"" refers to a number of repetitions. Its elements: a mouth . . . pent in. Hint: you may find it more helpful to forget the primitives and think of one circle revovling inside of another. Koohii #1 Write mouth two -times. Koohii #2 Pretty much a pictograph, see book. Keyword meanings : to turn round, counter for number of times, counter for rounds. Some simple compounds using previously learned kanji : 次回 (next time), 毎回 (every time/each round), 回る (to wander around). Primitives times, pent in, mouth 後回し(あとまわし): putting off, postponing 上回る(うわまわる): to exceed 回収(かいしゅう): collection, recovery 回送(かいそう): forwarding 回覧(かいらん): circulation 回路(かいろ): circuit (electric) 掻き回す(かきまわす): to stir up, to churn, to ransack, to disturb 手回し(てまわし): preparations, arrangements 転回(てんかい): revolution, rotation 遠回り(とおまわり): detour, roundabout way ねじ回し(ねじまわし): screwdriver 根回し(ねまわし): making necessary arrangements 回(かい): counter for occurrences 回数(かいすう): number of times, frequency 回数券(かいすうけん): book of tickets 回転(かいてん): rotation, revolution, turning 回答(かいとう): reply, answer 回復(かいふく): recovery (from illness), improvement, rehabilitation, restoration 今回(こんかい): now, this time, lately 回す(まわす): turn, revolve 回り(まわり): circumference, surroundings, circulation 回り道(まわりみち): detour, diversion 回る(まわる): go round Kunyomi: まわ.る、-まわ.る、-まわ.り、まわ.す、-まわ.す、まわ.し-、-まわ.し、もとお.る、か.える Onyomi: カイ、エ Lesson: 22 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 回答 (かいとう), 転回 (てんかい), 次回 (じかい), 回す (まわ.す), 回る (まわ.る)"	"-times 回 画数6 630 Details Story Dictionary 回 -times Heisig's The suffix ""-times"" refers to a number of repetitions. Its elements: a mouth . . . pent in. Hint: you may find it more helpful to forget the primitives and think of one circle revovling inside of another. Koohii #1 Write mouth two -times. Koohii #2 Pretty much a pictograph, see book. Keyword meanings : to turn round, counter for number of times, counter for rounds. Some simple compounds using previously learned kanji : 次回 (next time), 毎回 (every time/each round), 回る (to wander around). podium Details Story Dictionary 壇 podium Heisig's Soil/ground . . . top hat . . . -times . . . nightbreak. With kanji as difficult as this one, it generally pays to toy with the various connotations of its primitives before settling on one image. Aim for as much simplicity as you can. Koohii #1 A man on the podium announce the rules for the contest: You must fill a top hat with dirt as many times as you can by nightbreak. Koohii #2 Abraham Lincoln used a simple mound of soil for a podium, when he wore his top hat and gave the speech he had practiced many times until nightbreak. But it was so magnificent that no one noticed. Primitives podium, soil, dirt, ground, Churchill, top hat, -times, pent in, mouth, nightbreak, sun, day, one, floor 花壇(かだん): flower bed 壇(だん): platform, podium, rostrum, (arch) mandala Kunyomi: Onyomi: ダン、タン Lesson: 22 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 壇上 (だんじょう), 花壇 (かだん), 文壇 (ぶんだん)	podium 壇 画数16 631 Details Story Dictionary 壇 podium Heisig's Soil/ground . . . top hat . . . -times . . . nightbreak. With kanji as difficult as this one, it generally pays to toy with the various connotations of its primitives before settling on one image. Aim for as much simplicity as you can. Koohii #1 A man on the podium announce the rules for the contest: You must fill a top hat with dirt as many times as you can by nightbreak. Koohii #2 Abraham Lincoln used a simple mound of soil for a podium, when he wore his top hat and gave the speech he had practiced many times until nightbreak. But it was so magnificent that no one noticed. Primitives podium, soil, dirt, ground, Churchill, top hat, -times, pent in, mouth, nightbreak, sun, day, one, floor 花壇(かだん): flower bed 壇(だん): platform, podium, rostrum, (arch) mandala Kunyomi: Onyomi: ダン、タン Lesson: 22 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 壇上 (だんじょう), 花壇 (かだん), 文壇 (ぶんだん)
store Details Story Dictionary 店 store Heisig's Cave . . . fortune-telling. Koohii #1 Try to remember all those stores from Zelda that were inside caves and had fortune-teller like vendors. Koohii #2 The fortuneteller has a store in a cave. Primitives store, cave, fortune-telling, magic wand, augury, mouth 店(てん): store, shop, establishment 支店(してん): branch store (office) 商店(しょうてん): shop, business firm 書店(しょてん): bookstore 売店(ばいてん): shop, stand 店屋(みせや): store, shop 洋品店(ようひんてん): shop which handles Western-style apparel and accessories 店員(てんいん): salesclerk 喫茶店(きっさてん): coffee shop 店(みせ): store, shop, establishment Kunyomi: みせ、たな Onyomi: テン Lesson: 22 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds: 店 (みせ)	store 店 画数8 632 Details Story Dictionary 店 store Heisig's Cave . . . fortune-telling. Koohii #1 Try to remember all those stores from Zelda that were inside caves and had fortune-teller like vendors. Koohii #2 The fortuneteller has a store in a cave. "government office Details Story Dictionary 庁 government office Heisig's Cave . . . a spike. bed Details Story Dictionary 床 bed Heisig's Cave . . . tree. Koohii #1 The two safe places to sleep in the wilderness are in a tree and in a cave. So these can be considered as beds. Koohii #2 (based on mspertus:) The two safe places to sleep in the wilderness are in a tree and in a cave. So to be on the safe side it is best to put a tree in a cave and use it as a bed. "heart Details Story Dictionary 心 heart Heisig's This character, a pictographic representation of the heart, is among the most widely used primitives we shall meet. * As a primitive, it can take three forms, to which we shall assign three distinct meanings. In its kanji-form, it appears BENEATH or to the RIGHT of its relative primitive and means th physical organ of the heart. To the LEFT, it is abbreviated to three strokes, ⺖, and means a wildly emotional state of mind. And finally, at the very BOTTOM, it can take the form ⺗, in which case we give it the meaning of a valentine. Koohii #1 The four chambers in the heart. In the West, we point to our head when asked about the mind. In the East, they point to the heart. So then, the radical for ""state of mind""…　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　RTK2:　シン　安心　あんしん(peace of mind). Koohii #2 Heart needs three drops of blood to work. Primitives heart, drops, fishhook, heart 一心(いっしん): one mind, wholeheartedness, the whole heart 肝心(かんじん): essential, fundamental, crucial, vital, main 心地(ここち): feeling, sensation, mood 心得(こころえ): knowledge, information 心掛け(こころがけ): readiness, intention, aim 心掛ける(こころがける): to bear in mind, to aim to do 心強い(こころづよい): heartening, reassuring 心細い(こころぼそい): helpless, forlorn, hopeless, unpromising, lonely, discouraging, disheartening 自尊心(じそんしん): self-respect, conceit 下心(したごころ): secret intention, motive 心中(しんじゅう): double suicide, lovers suicide 心情(しんじょう): mentality 心配(しんぱい): worry, concern, anxiety, care 真心(まこころ): sincerity, devotion 野心(やしん): ambition, aspiration, designs, treachery 良心(りょうしん): conscience 感心(かんしん): admiration, Well done! 関心(かんしん): concern, interest 苦心(くしん): pain, trouble, anxiety, diligence, hard work 決心(けっしん): determination, resolution 心当たり(こころあたり): having some knowledge of, happening to know 心得る(こころえる): be informed, have thorough knowledge 心身(しんしん): mind and body 心臓(しんぞう): heart 心理(しんり): mentality 中心(ちゅうしん): center, core, heart, pivot, emphasis, balance 都心(としん): heart of city 用心(ようじん): care, precaution, caution 安心(あんしん): peace of mind, relief 心(こころ): mind, heart 熱心(ねっしん): eagerness Kunyomi: こころ、-ごころ、りっしんべん Onyomi: シン Lesson: 22 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds: 心 (こころ)"	"heart 心 画数4 639 Details Story Dictionary 心 heart Heisig's This character, a pictographic representation of the heart, is among the most widely used primitives we shall meet. * As a primitive, it can take three forms, to which we shall assign three distinct meanings. forget Details Story Dictionary 忘 forget My Story [Bath tub + heart] If you always forget to take a *bath* {亡} , your heart will never love. A *dead* heart forgets everything Koohii #1 You only truly forget her when she has perished in your heart. Koohii #2 To forget means that something perishes from your heart. Primitives forget, perish, deceased, top hat, fishhook, heart 度忘れ(どわすれ): lapse of memory, forget for a moment 忘れ物(わすれもの): a thing left behind 忘れる(わすれる): forget, leave carelessly Kunyomi: わす.れる Onyomi: ボウ Lesson: 22 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 忘れる (わす.れる)	forget 忘 画数7 640 Details Story Dictionary 忘 forget My Story [Bath tub + heart] If you always forget to take a *bath* {亡} , your heart will never love. endure Details Story Dictionary 忍 endure Heisig's Blade . . . heart. Endure here means long-suffering patience. Koohii #1 A ninja must be able to endure the pain of clinging to a ceiling, motionless, for hours at a time, waiting for just the right moment to drop down and thrust the blade of his sword into the hearts of his enemies. By the way, this character is used in the compound 忍者 (ninja) which is why I choose to use ninja as its primitive meaning. Koohii #2 Someone with a razor blade stuck in their heart has to endure the pain wherever they go and can tell no one about it. Primitives endure, blade, sword, dagger, drop, heart Kunyomi: しの.ぶ、しの.ばせる Onyomi: ニン Lesson: 22 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 忍ばせる (しの.ばせる), 忍ぶ (しの.ぶ)	endure 忍 画数7 642 Details Story Dictionary 忍 endure Heisig's Blade . . . heart. "acknowledge Details Story Dictionary 認 acknowledge Heisig's Words . . . endure. Koohii #1 You are given a speech about some serious mistakes of yours, and you have to endure the whole thing, because all you can do is acknowledge. Koohii #2 I never read the ""acknowledgements"" section of books or theses, because they are mostly just boring words that i must endure reading, before i can get to the interesting part. :). Primitives acknowledge, say, words, keitai, mouth, endure, blade, sword, dagger, drop, heart 公認(こうにん): official recognition, authorization, licence, accreditation 認める(したためる): to write up 認識(にんしき): recognition, cognizance 確認(かくにん): affirmation, confirmation 承認(しょうにん): recognition, acknowledgement, approval, consent, agreement 認める(みとめる): recognize, appreciate, approve, admit, notice Kunyomi: みと.める、したた.める Onyomi: ニン Lesson: 22 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 認める (みと.める)"	"acknowledge 認 画数14 643 Details Story Dictionary 認 acknowledge Heisig's Words . . . endure. document (magazine) Details Story Dictionary 誌 document (magazine) My Story Look here, this document (magazine) *says* Jesus is in your *heart*. Koohii #1 A will is an important document that contains your final word on how you intend to distribute your assets. Koohii #2 This is quite simple: a document is a set of words describing your intentions. grace Details Story Dictionary 恩 grace Heisig's Take grace in its sense of a favor freely bestowed, not in its meaning of charming manners or fluid movement. The primitives: cause . . . heart. Koohii #1 Grace here is a favor freely bestowed, like a good deed. So to remember this kanji, go to the local shelter, find a big dog pent up in a small cage and adopt him. That will cause a warm feeling in your heart! Koohii #2 This kanji tells us that wherever heart is the cause, grace is the consequence. Think of “grace” as a graceful act: something benevolent that comes from the heart. Primitives grace, cause, pent in, large, St. Bernard, heart 恩(おん): favour, obligation, debt of gratitude 恩恵(おんけい): grace, favor, blessing, benefit Kunyomi: Onyomi: オン Lesson: 22 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	grace 恩 画数10 652 Details Story Dictionary 恩 grace Heisig's Take grace in its sense of a favor freely bestowed, not in its meaning of charming manners or fluid movement. "apply Details Story Dictionary 応 apply Heisig's Cave . . . heart. The sense of the key word here is of something appropriate that fills a particular need, and hence ""applies."" Koohii #1 In the videogame Zelda, Link enters a CAVE to visit a fairy that will APPLY magic to fill his HEART containers. Koohii #2 [bravo, scottamus!] To apply for the job as a (replacement) Batman, you have to make it to the heart of the cave past all the traps he set up to test you. There, you see a table with the application form on it. Now that you think about it, the ad in the paper did say ""Those who don´t make it to the heart of the cave need not apply."". Primitives apply, cave, heart 応急(おうきゅう): emergency 応募(おうぼ): subscription, application 相応(そうおう): suitability, fitness 対応(たいおう): interaction, correspondence, coping with, dealing with 適応(てきおう): adaptation, accommodation, conformity 反応(はんのう): reaction, response 相応しい(ふさわしい): appropriate 一応(いちおう): once, tentatively, in outline, for the time being 応援(おうえん): aid, assistance, help, reinforcement, support, cheering 応じる(おうじる): respond, satisfy, accept, comply with, apply for 応ずる(おうずる): answer, respond, meet, satisfy, accept 応接(おうせつ): reception 応対(おうたい): receiving, dealing with 応用(おうよう): application, put to practical use Kunyomi: あた.る、まさに、こた.える Onyomi: オウ、ヨウ、ノウ Lesson: 22 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"	"apply 応 画数7 653 Details Story Dictionary 応 apply Heisig's Cave . . . heart. idea Details Story Dictionary 意 idea My Story A good idea will always sound right in your heart. Koohii #1 When you get a good IDEA you get excited and you can hear the SOUND of your HEART, it´s pounding so hard. Koohii #2 Picture someone who´s just had a great idea, but in place of a blinking light bulb over their head, you see a heart thumping with great noise. Imagine the greater the idea, the louder the sound of the beating heart. Primitives idea, sound, vase, stand up, sun, day, heart 意気込む(いきごむ): to be enthusiastic about 意向(いこう): intention, idea, inclination 意地(いじ): disposition, spirit, willpower, obstinacy, backbone, appetite 意図(いと): intention, aim, design 意欲(いよく): will, desire, ambition 決意(けつい): decision, determination 好意(こうい): good will, favor, courtesy 合意(ごうい): agreement, consent, mutual understanding 他意(たい): ill will, malice, another intention, secret purpose, ulterior motive, fickleness, double-mindedness 同意(どうい): agreement, consent, same meaning, same opinion, approval 熱意(ねつい): zeal, enthusiasm 不意(ふい): sudden, abrupt, unexpected, unforeseen 無意味(むいみ): nonsense, no meaning 意外(いがい): unexpected, surprising 意義(いぎ): meaning, significance 意思(いし): intention, purpose 意志(いし): will, volition 意識(いしき): consciousness, senses 意地悪(いじわる): malicious, ill-tempered, unkind 敬意(けいい): respect, honour 得意(とくい): pride, triumph, prosperity, one´s strong point, one´s forte, one´s specialty, customer, client 生意気(なまいき): impertinent, saucy, cheeky, conceit, audacious, brazen 意見(いけん): opinion 注意(ちゅうい): advise, pay attention 用意(ようい): prepare 意味(いみ): meaning, significance Kunyomi: Onyomi: イ Lesson: 22 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds:	idea 意 画数13 654 Details Story Dictionary 意 idea My Story A good idea will always sound right in your heart. recess Details Story Dictionary 憩 recess Heisig's Tongue . . . nose . . . heart. The sense of breath from the last frame should not be used; it could lead you to put only the nose over the heart and leave the tongue off to one side. Koohii #1 Recess to me is a school break. At recess some kiddies are comparing their latest body piercings. Tongues and noses are nothing special. The new cool is to have your heart done! Koohii #2 Ah recess; tongues slandering, noses being turned up, and beneath it all, young hearts being broken. Dominant in playgrounds is the noise of tongues, which helps me remember that in this kanji tongue comes first. Primitives recess, tongue, thousand, mouth, nose, drop, eye, heart 休憩(きゅうけい): rest, break, recess, intermission Kunyomi: いこ.い、いこ.う Onyomi: ケイ Lesson: 22 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 憩い (いこ.い), 憩う (いこ.う)	recess 憩 画数16 658 Details Story Dictionary 憩 recess Heisig's Tongue . . . nose . . . heart. (""Oops, I think I left my scissors in there""). Koohii #2 My deep dark fear at the bottom of my heart is that I am mediocre at my craft. beguile (be misguided or tempted Details Story Dictionary 惑 beguile (be misguided or tempted My Story a certain {或} heart {心} is #uncertain#. Don't mistake with {感} Koohii #1 She was beguiled/mislead by his charm: at the party he kissed her on the mouth, they did it on the floor and thus he stole her heart. Poor girl! Koohii #2 The same cowboy from frame # 356 (elements mouth, floor and fiesta), kisses the floor with his mouth, once again, before going to the fiesta. There, he uses his good looks to beguile women (gets them to buy him drinks or such), by playing with their hearts. Primitives beguile, a, pope, fiesta, mouth, one, floor, heart 疑惑(ぎわく): doubt, misgivings, distrust, suspicion 誘惑(ゆうわく): temptation, allurement, lure 惑星(わくせい): planet 迷惑(めいわく): trouble, bother, annoyance Kunyomi: まど.う Onyomi: ワク Lesson: 22 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 惑う (まど.う)	beguile (be misguided or tempted 惑 画数12 661 Details Story Dictionary 惑 beguile (be misguided or tempted My Story a certain {或} heart {心} is #uncertain#. Don't mistake with {感} Koohii #1 She was beguiled/mislead by his charm: at the party he kissed her on the mouth, they did it on the floor and thus he stole her heart. Poor girl! Koohii #2 The same cowboy from frame # 356 (elements mouth, floor and fiesta), kisses the floor with his mouth, once again, before going to the fiesta. There, he uses his good looks to beguile women (gets them to buy him drinks or such), by playing with their hearts. emotion Details Story Dictionary 感 emotion Heisig's Mouths . . . marching . . . heart. Koohii #1 Emotion is a march of mouths inside your heart telling you what to feel. Koohii #2 Strong EMOTIONS don´t stay hidden. They march right out of one´s heart (below) and out one´s mouth (shouted, snarled, or gently whispered - depending on exactly what kind of emotion it is!). Primitives emotion, march, mouth, heart 感慨(かんがい): strong feelings, deep emotion 感触(かんしょく): sense of touch, feeling, sensation 感染(かんせん): infection, contagion 感度(かんど): sensitivity, severity (quake) 感無量(かんむりょう): deep feeling, inexpressible feeling, filled with emotion 共感(きょうかん): sympathy, response 直感(ちょっかん): intuition 痛感(つうかん): feeling keenly, fully realizing 同感(どうかん): agreement, same opinion, same feeling, sympathy, concurrence 鈍感(どんかん): thickheadedness, stolidity 反感(はんかん): antipathy, revolt, animosity 敏感(びんかん): sensibility, susceptibility, sensitive (to), well attuned to 予感(よかん): presentiment, premonition 感覚(かんかく): sense, sensation 感激(かんげき): deep emotion, impression, inspiration 感じ(かんじ): feeling, sense, impression 感謝(かんしゃ): thanks, gratitude 感情(かんじょう): emotion(s), feeling(s), sentiment 感じる(かんじる): feel, sense, experience 感心(かんしん): admiration, Well done! 感ずる(かんずる): feel, sense 感想(かんそう): impressions, thoughts 感動(かんどう): being deeply moved, deep emotion, excitement, impression 実感(じっかん): feelings (actual, true) Kunyomi: Onyomi: カン Lesson: 22 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds:	emotion 感 画数13 662 Details Story Dictionary 感 emotion Heisig's Mouths . . . marching . . . heart. melancholy Details Story Dictionary 憂 melancholy My Story *100* *mustaches*, with *each* *heart* are grieving in melancholy. Koohii #1 Melancholy makes me think of Hamlet cause he was so ´emo´. In order to play up his feelings he bares his head and holds his crown over his heart then walks (on walking legs) around the palace making everyone see how melancholy he is. What a wuss. Koohii #2 This is an image of the crucifixion. Jesus is on the cross. His crown of thorns has slipped down and is around his neck, right between his head and his heart. His walking legs can be seen dangling from the cross as well. How MELANCHOLY! Primitives melancholy, summer, head, page, crown, heart, walking legs 憂鬱(ゆううつ): depression, melancholy, dejection, gloom Kunyomi: うれ.える、うれ.い、う.い、う.き Onyomi: ユウ Lesson: 22 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 憂い (う.い), 憂い (うれ.い), 憂える (うれ.える)	melancholy 憂 画数15 663 Details Story Dictionary 憂 melancholy My Story *100* *mustaches*, with *each* *heart* are grieving in melancholy. widow Details Story Dictionary 寡 widow Heisig's House . . . head . . . dagger. Immediately we get another instance of a very odd exception. Notice how the final stroke of the head is lengthened, giving the final two strokes a chance to stretch out and make room for the dagger that fits in beneath. Koohii #1 The new widow sits in the house, her head in her lap (the extended stroke), her dagger in her husband. Koohii #2 The house´s head, her husband, was murdered with a dagger. You can still see the drops of blood above the dagger. She is now a widow. Primitives widow, house, head, page, animal legs, eight, sword, dagger Kunyomi: Onyomi: カ Lesson: 22 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	widow 寡 画数14 664 Details Story Dictionary 寡 widow Heisig's House . . . head . . . dagger. Koohii #2 ^^^Make the ""state of mind"" primitive Data (from Star Trek) instead right now and save yourself the headache; ´state of mind´ is too vague! (Data can stay so busy as not to sleep without dying. He´s a robot). lament Details Story Dictionary 悼 lament Heisig's To keep this character distinct from others of similar connotation, one need only think of the Prophet Jeremiah whose poetry gave an eminence to the state of mind we call lamentation. Koohii #1 When the world´s most eminent magician died, everyone´s state of mind became that of lamentation. He was buried with his famous sun-flower wand in his hand. Koohii #2 Data laments that he could never see his eminent father, his creator, ever again. He paints a picture of his father, that looks like a sunflower in the shape of a magic wand. Primitives lament, Freud, state of mind, eminent, magic wand, augury, sun, day, ten, needle Kunyomi: いた.む Onyomi: トウ Lesson: 22 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 悼む (いた.む)	lament 悼 画数11 668 Details Story Dictionary 悼 lament Heisig's To keep this character distinct from others of similar connotation, one need only think of the Prophet Jeremiah whose poetry gave an eminence to the state of mind we call lamentation. "enlightenment Details Story Dictionary 悟 enlightenment Heisig's I know of an Indian religious sect which teaches that enlightenment is to be had by covering the eyes with one's index fingers, the ears with the thumbs, and the mouth with the little fingers. While these differ a bit from the five holes that we used to represent the ""I"" (frame 17), the idea of achieving a special state of mind by covering those five places can help you learn this kanji. You might try the position out while you are learning this character. Koohii #1 Enlightenment is a state of mind that goes beyond the five senses. Koohii #2 Data finds enlightenment when he discovers the answer to the question, ""Who am I?"". (Image: Data meditating in a sitting lotus position). Primitives enlightenment, Freud, state of mind, I, five, mouth 悟る(さとる): to attain enlightenment, to perceive, to understand, to discern 覚悟(かくご): resolution, resignation, readiness, preparedness Kunyomi: さと.る Onyomi: ゴ Lesson: 22 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 悟る (さと.る)"	"enlightenment 悟 画数10 669 Details Story Dictionary 悟 enlightenment Heisig's I know of an Indian religious sect which teaches that enlightenment is to be had by covering the eyes with one's index fingers, the ears with the thumbs, and the mouth with the little fingers. "disconcerted Details Story Dictionary 慌 disconcerted Heisig's State of mind . . . laid waste. Koohii #1 (re: wazzab) The state of mind of the people of New Orleans as they examined their city´s concert hall laid waste can best described as disconcerted. Koohii #2 Data walks in and sees Picard weeping. ""What is the matter, Captain?"" Picard looks up, and replies that his entire home planet has been laid to waste. Data, the master of tact, offers up this consolation: ""Ah. I can see how that would be DISCONCERTing"". It turns out that the flow of tears was really just because Picard had lost his chance at getting at some rare (and thus valuable) flowers on his home planet. Primitives disconcerted, Freud, state of mind, laid waste, wreath, flowers, deceased, perish, top hat, fishhook, stream, flood 慌ただしい(あわただしい): busy, hurried, confused, flurried 慌てる(あわてる): to become confused (disconcerted disorganized) Kunyomi: あわ.てる、あわ.ただしい Onyomi: コウ Lesson: 22 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: Compounds: 慌ただしい (あわ.ただしい), 慌てる (あわ.てる)"	"disconcerted 慌 画数12 671 Details Story Dictionary 慌 disconcerted Heisig's State of mind . . . laid waste. "accustomed Details Story Dictionary 慣 accustomed Heisig's State of mind . . . pierce. Koohii #1 It took him awhile, but Data finally got ACCUSTOMED to his nipple/breast piercings. They were constantly rubbing up against his shirt and his heart-shaped locket. Picture Data, shirtless, squeezing his nipples in front of Picard and saying ""Yes, at first they were a bit shelly, but I´ve grown quite ACCUSTOMED to them"". That last bit should do it for you. Koohii #2 Some hardcore monks have a state of mind that has become accustomed to their self-torture through piercing themselves. "lazy Details Story Dictionary 惰 lazy Heisig's State of mind . . . left (i.e. ""sinister"") . . . flesh. Koohii #1 When I am in a LAZY state of mind I use my left hand to play with my meat...it feels like someone else is doing it, which is good cause I´m to lazy to get a date. Koohii #2 When in a lazy state of mind, the things you need to do are left for next month. Primitives lazy, Freud, state of mind, left-handed, left, by one’s side, craft, moon, month, flesh, part of the body Kunyomi: Onyomi: ダ Lesson: 22 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"	"lazy 惰 画数12 676 Details Story Dictionary 惰 lazy Heisig's State of mind . . . left (i.e. ""sinister"") . . . flesh. humility Details Story Dictionary 慎 humility Heisig's State of mind . . . truth. Koohii #1 Humility is the state of mind of accepting the truth about yourself - both favorable and unfavorable. (tweaked version of Raichu´s). Koohii #2 Humility is a state of mind when you consider yourself in accordance with the truth (you neither boast nor demean yourself). "remorse Details Story Dictionary 憾 remorse Heisig's State of mind . . . emotion. Hint: the etymology of ""remorse"" indicates a memory that returns again and again to ""bite at"" one's conscience and disturb one's peace of mind. Koohii #1 Remorse is the state of mind where I feel bad for what I did while I was tired and emotional! Koohii #2 Tip: If you are confusing this keyword, remorse, with repent (#625) and regret/resentment (#1460), then note that rEMOrse contains EMOtion. yearn Details Story Dictionary 憧 yearn Heisig's Think of the state of mind you were in as a child with a particularly juvenile yearning. Koohii #1 A paedophile´s state of mind is to yearn for juveniles. Koohii #2 A juvenile´s state of mind tends to go apeshit when they see something they yearn for. Usually involving jumping up and down, tantrums, and other bullshit. (Imagine giving them a big backhand across the face.). pining Details Story Dictionary 慕 pining Heisig's Graveyard . . . valentine. Note carefully the stroke order of the valentine primitive. Koohii #1 Pining, yearn for... etc. Presumably for lost love. An easy one here, someone standing in the graveyard, placing an old valentine card amonst all the existing tributes. Koohii #2 Morticia and Gomez (of the “Addams Family”) are spending their Valentine´s Day at the graveyard, pining for each other´s affection. annexed Details Story Dictionary 添 annexed Heisig's Water . . . heavens . . . valentine. Koohii #1 Hawaii is a little drop of heaven nestled in the waters of the Pacific, most often visited by honeymooners and valentines. It was annexed to the U.S.A. in 1959, and more recently to Japan as well-- albeit only unofficially, and through private commercial holdings. Koohii #2 Annexed to the U.S.A. in 1898, Hawaii is nestled in the waters of the Pacific, a little drop of heaven, often visited on Valentines.. (from Ihatobu with the date corrected. Hawaii became a state in 1959)...　RTK2:　テン　添付　てんぷ(appendix). "invariably Details Story Dictionary 必 invariably Heisig's First note the stroke order of this character, which did not really evolve from the heart, even though we take it that way. If one takes it as a pictograph ""dividing"" the heart in half, then one has one of those invariably true bits of human anatomy: the fact that each heart is divided into two halves. Koohii #1 You swear you´ll be in love forever, but invariably there comes a time when your heart is divided. Koohii #2 For this kanji I invariably got the stroke order wrong. I nearly lost heart, but decided to stick (pun) to it. Then I noticed the order is 1) katakana ソ (altered slightly); 2) fishhook; 3) two drops. Now I invariably get it right. Primitives invariably, heart, stick, drop, fishhook, drop3 必修(ひっしゅう): required (subject) 必然(ひつぜん): inevitable, necessary 必ずしも(かならずしも): (not) always, (not) necessarily, (not) all, (not) entirely 必死(ひっし): inevitable death, desperation, frantic, inevitable result 必需品(ひつじゅひん): necessities, necessary article, requisite, essential 必ず(かならず): certainly 必要(ひつよう): necessary Kunyomi: かなら.ず Onyomi: ヒツ Lesson: 22 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 必ず (かなら.ず)"	"invariably 必 画数5 685 Details Story Dictionary 必 invariably Heisig's First note the stroke order of this character, which did not really evolve from the heart, even though we take it that way. hand Details Story Dictionary 手 hand Heisig's Any way you count them, there are either too many or too few fingers to see a good pictograph of a hand in this character. But that it is, and so you must. * Keep to the etymology when using this kanji as a primitive: a single hand all by itself. Koohii #1 This pictograph actually really works if you look at it as a hand with fingers spread and middle finger pointing down. see the very top stroke as the edge of a shirt cuff, and it will all come together. Koohii #2 A hand is useful for 千一(1001) things. Primitives hand 上手(うわて): upper part, upper stream, left side (of a stage), skillful (only in comparisons), dexterity (only in comparisons) お手上げ(おてあげ): all over, given in, given up hope, bring to knees 小切手(こぎって): cheque, check 手芸(しゅげい): handicrafts 手法(しゅほう): technique 着手(ちゃくしゅ): embarkation, launch 手当て(てあて): allowance, compensation, treatment, medical care 手遅れ(ておくれ): too late, belated treatment 手掛かり(てがかり): contact, trail, scent, on hand, hand hold, clue, key 手掛ける(てがける): to handle, to manage, to work with, to rear, to look after, to have experience with 手数(てかず): number of moves, trouble 手軽(てがる): easy, simple, informal, offhand, cheap 手際(てぎわ): performance, skill, tact 手順(てじゅん): process, procedure, protocol 手錠(てじょう): handcuffs, manacles 手近(てぢか): near, handy, familiar 手配(てはい): arrangement, search (by police) 手筈(てはず): arrangement, plan, programme 手引き(てびき): guidance, guide, introduction 手本(てほん): model, pattern 手回し(てまわし): preparations, arrangements 手元(てもと): on hand, at hand, at home 手分け(てわけ): division of labour 取っ手(とって): handle, grip, knob 土手(どて): embankment, bank 入手(にゅうしゅ): obtaining, coming to hand 相手(あいて): companion, partner, company, other party, addressee 握手(あくしゅ): handshake お手伝いさん(おてつだいさん): maid 歌手(かしゅ): singer 手術(しゅじゅつ): surgical operation 手段(しゅだん): means, way, measure 助手(じょしゅ): helper, assistant, tutor 選手(せんしゅ): player (in game), team 手洗い(てあらい): restroom, lavatory, hand-washing 手入れ(ていれ): repairs, maintenance 手首(てくび): wrist 手頃(てごろ): moderate, handy 手品(てじな): sleight of hand, conjuring trick, magic, juggling 手帳(てちょう): notebook 手伝い(てつだい): help, helper, assistant 手続き(てつづき): procedure, (legal) process, formalities 手拭い(てぬぐい): (hand) towel 手間(てま): time, labour 手前(てまえ): before, this side, we, you 苦手(にがて): poor (at), weak (in), dislike (of) 拍手(はくしゅ): clapping hands, applause 派手(はで): showy, loud, gay, flashy, gaudy 運転手(うんてんしゅ): drive 手伝う(てつだう): help 手袋(てぶくろ): gloves お手洗い(おてあらい): toilet, restroom, lavatory, bathroom (US) 切手(きって): stamp 上手(じょうず): skill, skillful, dexterity 手(て): hand 手紙(てがみ): letter 下手(へた): unskillful, poor, awkward Kunyomi: て、て-、-て、た- Onyomi: シュ、ズ Lesson: 23 Jouyou: 1 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds: 手 (て)	hand 手 画数4 687 Details Koohii #1 It´s a hot day of summer with a clear sky, you´re sitting outside a cafe (or maybe on a reclining chair in the garden), and you watch over the kids with a hand covering your eyes from the sunlight (next time, don´t forget the sunglasses). Koohii #2 Think of the monster from Pan´s Labrynth, that watched over the poor girl with eyes in the palm of his hands. "chafe Details Story Dictionary 摩 chafe Heisig's Hemp . . . hand. Koohii #1 If you grind the hemp without a stone but use your hand instead it will chafe. (Image: ""Robin, why are your hands all chafed?"" ´Uh... (I´ve been grinding hemp all day)´). Koohii #2 When the feds came to bust your little hemp grove, you jumped out the back side of the cave and tried to repel down with a hemp rope. Unfortunately, the rope chafed your hands and you fell .. ouch! Primitives chafe, hemp, cave, grove, tree, wood, hand, tree2, wood2 摩擦(まさつ): friction, rubbing, rubdown, chafe Kunyomi: ま.する、さ.する、す.る Onyomi: マ Lesson: 23 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"	"chafe 摩 画数15 689 Details Story Dictionary 摩 chafe Heisig's Hemp . . . hand. "ego Details Story Dictionary 我 ego Heisig's Hand . . . fiesta. Note how the second stroke of the hand is stretched across to double up as the first stroke of the tasseled arrow we use for fiesta. Compare to frames 17, 36, and 564. Koohii #1 Someone with a huge EGO is too good for any romantic partner and as such has nothing but personal ""hand fiestas"" with himself every night. Koohii #2 Did you hear about the guy who had such a big EGO that he threw a fiesta for his left hand? Primitives ego, hand, fiesta 怪我(けが): injury, get hurt, be injured 自我(じが): self, the ego 我がまま(わがまま): selfishness, egoism, wilfulness, disobedience, whim 我慢(がまん): patience, endurance, perseverance, tolerance, self-control, self-denial 我々(われわれ): we Kunyomi: われ、わ、わ.が-、わが- Onyomi: ガ Lesson: 23 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 我 (わ), 我 (われ)"	"ego 我 画数7 690 Details Story Dictionary 我 ego Heisig's Hand . . . fiesta. Note how the second stroke of the hand is stretched across to double up as the first stroke of the tasseled arrow we use for fiesta. Compare to frames 17, 36, and 564. righteousness Details Story Dictionary 義 righteousness My Story [Horny King + We] *We* are most righteous when we act like conformist *sheep*. Koohii #1 Righteous Christians are sheep with egos (reworked from raulir, fixes word order to match radical order). Koohii #2 On the other hand, Woman tend to have too much self-righteousness to allow any man to touch their wooly black sheep this results in similar hand fiestas. Primitives righteousness, sheep, ego, hand, fiesta 義理(ぎり): duty, sense of duty, honor, decency, courtesy, debt of gratitude, social obligation 主義(しゅぎ): doctrine, rule, principle 正義(せいぎ): justice, right, righteousness, correct meaning 定義(ていぎ): definition 意義(いぎ): meaning, significance 義務(ぎむ): duty, obligation, responsibility 講義(こうぎ): lecture Kunyomi: Onyomi: ギ Lesson: 23 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	righteousness 義 画数13 691 Details Story Dictionary 義 righteousness My Story [Horny King + We] *We* are most righteous when we act like conformist *sheep*. deliberation / disscussion Details Story Dictionary 議 deliberation / disscussion My Story [Say + righteousness(Horny King + We){義}] Take {義} and think of it in terms of justice. A jury needs #deliberation# before a verdict is given. We humans cannot #deliberately# combine *words* with *sheep*, *we* arent magic Koohii #1 Careful deliberation produces words of righteousness. Koohii #2 At the worst of times, a jury´s deliberation descends into a war of words between competing self-righteous, power-tripping bastards. Primitives deliberation, say, words, keitai, mouth, righteousness, sheep, ego, hand, fiesta 異議(いぎ): objection, dissent, protest 議案(ぎあん): legislative bill 議決(ぎけつ): resolution, decision, vote 議事堂(ぎじどう): Diet building 議題(ぎだい): topic of discussion, agenda 協議(きょうぎ): conference, consultation, discussion, negotiation 決議(けつぎ): resolution, vote, decision 抗議(こうぎ): protest, objection 合議(ごうぎ): consultation, conference 参議院(さんぎいん): House of Councillors 衆議院(しゅうぎいん): Lower House, House of Representatives 審議(しんぎ): deliberation 討議(とうぎ): debate, discussion 物議(ぶつぎ): public discussion (criticism) 論議(ろんぎ): discussion 議員(ぎいん): member of the Diet, congress or parliament 議会(ぎかい): Diet, congress, parliament 議長(ぎちょう): chairman 議論(ぎろん): argument, discussion, dispute 不思議(ふしぎ): wonder, miracle, strange, mystery, marvel, curiosity 会議(かいぎ): meeting Kunyomi: Onyomi: ギ Lesson: 23 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds:	deliberation / disscussion 議 画数20 692 Details Story Dictionary 議 deliberation / disscussion My Story [Say + righteousness(Horny King + We){義}] Take {義} and think of it in terms of justice. "yank Details Story Dictionary 拉 yank Heisig's The sense of this key word is to pull or jerk, as in opening a door or making ""ramen"" noodles. Its elements: fingers . . . vase. Koohii #1 He quickly yanked his fingers out of the vase. Maybe no one noticed the attempt to steal the cookies... Koohii #2 He yanked his finger out of the vase upon discovering it had a venus fly trap in it. Kunyomi: くだ.く、 ひし.ぐ、 らっ.する Onyomi: ラ、 ラツ、 ロウ Lesson: 23 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: Compounds:"	"yank 拉 画数8 696 Details Story Dictionary 拉 yank Heisig's The sense of this key word is to pull or jerk, as in opening a door or making ""ramen"" noodles. "embrace Details Story Dictionary 抱 embrace Heisig's Fingers . . . wrap. Koohii #1 When embracing someone, wrap your fingers around her butt for added effect. "board Details Story Dictionary 搭 board Heisig's The key word refers to boarding vessels for travel. Its elements are: finger . . . flowers . . . fit together (See frame 270). Koohii #1 Ok, this is a little wierd, but i took this back to the kanji for pagoda (#254). I think it helps simplify the image, and also helps anchor the pagoda kanji in memory better as an added bonus. say this aloud once, and i think it will bring out a vivid image very quickly: ""Now boarding the pagoda ride. Please keep your fingers inside at all times..."". Koohii #2 When you board the ship on the way out from Hawaii a beautiful crewmember takes her fingers and fits a lei around you ....a lei is flowers fitted together with your fingers. Primitives board, finger, fingers, flowers, fit, meeting, umbrella, one, mouth Kunyomi: Onyomi: トウ Lesson: 23 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"	"board 搭 画数12 698 Details Story Dictionary 搭 board Heisig's The key word refers to boarding vessels for travel. criticism Details Story Dictionary 批 criticism Heisig's Finger . . . compare. Koohii #1 Think of the two most famous critics, Ebert and Roeper. On their show, they compare thumbs (which are technically fingers) with each other before dispensing criticism. Koohii #2 My criticism earned me the FINGER when I COMPARED her cooking to my mother´s. beckon Details Story Dictionary 招 beckon My Story Damn it! *MOe* *summoned* another demon {召} summon Koohii #1 A Geisha beckons you with her index finger, and as you approach she runs her fingers all over her body in an attempt to seduce you. Keyword meaning : “invite”. Koohii #2 I bet you all know the Maneki Neko, or beckoning cat, who with its raised fingers tries to seduce all good things (success, happiness and harmony) to its owner. clear the land Details Story Dictionary 拓 clear the land Heisig's Fingers . . . rocks. Koohii #1 A huge index finger coming down from the sky is kicking boulders of rock, clearing the land. Maybe it´s the finger of God preparing a place for his little people to live. Koohii #2 I imagine clearing the land in order to set up your tent after a long day of backpacking. Using your fingers, you pick up all of the rocks and get them out of the way so that you can get a comfortable night sleep. If you don´t clear the land you can just picture the rock sticking into your back as you toss and turn all night long. Primitives clear the land, finger, fingers, stone, rock 開拓(かいたく): reclamation (of wasteland), cultivation, pioneer Kunyomi: ひら.く Onyomi: タク Lesson: 23 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	clear the land 拓 画数8 703 Details Story Dictionary 拓 clear the land Heisig's Fingers . . . rocks. "strike Details Story Dictionary 打 strike Heisig's Finger . . . spike. Koohii #1 You´re using a hammer to drive a nail into a plank, but you miss and strike your fingers, ouch ! PS: the character does not mean ""to go on strike"", it will be very helpful in the long run to create images that convey the proper sense of the character! Koohii #2 My teacher used to strike my fingers with a street sign. Primitives strike, finger, fingers, street, nail, spike 打ち合わせ(うちあわせ): business meeting, previous arrangement, appointment 打ち合わせる(うちあわせる): to knock together, to arrange 打ち切る(うちきる): to stop, to abort, to discontinue, to close 打ち消し(うちけし): negation, denial, negative 打ち込む(うちこむ): to drive in (e.g. nail stake), to devote oneself to, to shoot into, to smash, to throw into, to cast into 打開(だかい): break in the deadlock 打撃(だげき): blow, shock, strike, damage, batting (baseball) 値打ち(ねうち): value, worth, price, dignity 打付ける(ぶつける): to knock, to run into, to nail on, to strike hard, to hit and attack 打合せ(うちあわせ): business meeting, appointment, previous arrangement 打ち消す(うちけす): deny, negate, contradict 打つ(ぶつ): hit, strike 打つ(うつ): hit, beat Kunyomi: う.つ、う.ち-、ぶ.つ Onyomi: ダ、ダアス Lesson: 23 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 打つ (う.つ)"	"strike 打 画数5 705 Details Story Dictionary 打 strike Heisig's Finger . . . spike. "arrest Details Story Dictionary 拘 arrest Heisig's Fingers . . . phrase. Koohii #1 You approach the thief from behind, stick your finger at his back to fake a gun, and say the phrase ""You´re under arrest"". Koohii #2 Giving the police the finger and a colorful phrase is a surefire way to get arrested. hold Details Story Dictionary 持 hold Heisig's Fingers . . . Buddhist temple. Koohii #1 At the BUDDHIST TEMPLE you´ll see wonderous things, such as the priest that can HOLD himself upside down with just a FINGER. Koohii #2 In Kyaiktiyo, there is rocking stone which sits on the edge of a cliff, and there is a Buddhist temple built on the top of it. You can rock the stone by pushing it with your finger, but it still holds in place. It´s true, see here: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kyaiktiyo. conjecture Details Story Dictionary 推 conjecture Heisig's Fingers . . . turkey. Koohii #1 In mathematics, a conjecture is a mathematical statement which has been proposed as a true statement, but which no one has yet been able to prove or disprove. Have you heard of the Finger-Turkey conjecture ? It states that if turkeys had fingers, they would be able to count. Be sure to imagine a turkey with fingers at the tip of its wings, counting from one to ten. Koohii #2 In the midst of conjecture on whether it was done or not, mom stuck her fingers in the turkey to check. Primitives conjecture, finger, fingers, turkey 推進(すいしん): propulsion, driving force 推測(すいそく): guess, conjecture 推理(すいり): reasoning, inference, mystery or detective genre (movie novel etc.) 類推(るいすい): analogy 推薦(すいせん): recommendation 推定(すいてい): presumption, assumption, estimation Kunyomi: お.す Onyomi: スイ Lesson: 23 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 推す (お.す)	conjecture 推 画数11 716 Details Story Dictionary 推 conjecture Heisig's Fingers . . . turkey. hoist (deep fat fry) Details Story Dictionary 揚 hoist (deep fat fry) My Story *Mo* *easily* {易} hoisted the thing below the sun Koohii #1 My piggy bank is so heavy that I cannot HOIST it using just my fingers. Koohii #2 Picture a major robbery where some dudes are breaking into a bank to steal their money. They get their man in the vault through the ceiling - now he´s hanging from a rope a few feet from the ground (like in the movies, dodging laser beams). He reports back that he has found the loot, and its all in a large piggy bank in the center of the vault. The alarm sounds and he´s got to think fast. He jams the four fingers of his right hand in the piggy bank slot and tells his team to hoist him up, he´s got the loot! Primitives hoist, finger, fingers, piggy bank, sun, day, piglets Kunyomi: あ.げる、-あ.げ、あ.がる Onyomi: ヨウ Lesson: 23 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 揚がる (あ.がる), 揚げる (あ.げる)	hoist (deep fat fry) 揚 画数12 717 Details Story Dictionary 揚 hoist (deep fat fry) My Story *Mo* *easily* {易} hoisted the thing below the sun Koohii #1 My piggy bank is so heavy that I cannot HOIST it using just my fingers.
