propose Details Story Dictionary 提 propose Heisig's Fingers . . . just so. Koohii #1 When a man PROPOSES to a lady, he takes her FINGER and places the ring on it JUST SO, and the moment sweeps her away. Koohii #2 I tried to propose to my girlfriend, but the ring was too small to fit her finger. Instead of saying yes, she just uttered an annoyed sigh. So I rushed to the jeweler where he made it bigger. But now it was too big, so I rushed back to make it smaller. This spiel kept going on until the ring was finally just so. Her eyes lit up and she said yes. Primitives propose, finger, fingers, just so, sun, day, mend 前提(ぜんてい): preamble, premise, reason, prerequisite 提供(ていきょう): offer, tender, program sponsoring, furnishing 提携(ていけい): cooperation, tie-up, joint business, link-up 提示(ていじ): presentation, exhibit, suggest, citation 提案(ていあん): proposal, proposition, suggestion 提出(ていしゅつ): presentation, submission, filing Kunyomi: さ.げる Onyomi: テイ、チョウ、ダイ Lesson: 23 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 提げる (さ.げる)	propose 提 画数12 718 Details Story Dictionary 提 propose Heisig's Fingers . . . just so. shouldering Details Story Dictionary 担 shouldering Heisig's The key word of this frame refers to shouldering a burden of some sort. Its elements are: fingers . . . nightbreak. Koohii #1 One of Hercules´ labors was to hold the world in his fingers for Atlas and not move until nightbreak, shouldering the considerable burden. Koohii #2 One of the classic stories of shouldering a heavy burden is that of the kid who had to stick his finger on a dam until nightbreak to prevent it from breaking down. Primitives shouldering, finger, fingers, nightbreak, sun, day, one, floor 担架(たんか): stretcher, litter 担う(になう): to carry on shoulder, to bear (burden), to shoulder (gun) 負担(ふたん): burden, charge, responsibility 分担(ぶんたん): apportionment, sharing 担ぐ(かつぐ): carry on shoulder 担当(たんとう): (in) charge Kunyomi: かつ.ぐ、にな.う Onyomi: タン Lesson: 23 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 担ぐ (かつ.ぐ), 担う (にな.う)	shouldering 担 画数8 721 Details Story Dictionary 担 shouldering Heisig's The key word of this frame refers to shouldering a burden of some sort. Its elements are: fingers . . . nightbreak. Koohii #1 One of Hercules´ labors was to hold the world in his fingers for Atlas and not move until nightbreak, shouldering the considerable burden. Koohii #2 One of the classic stories of shouldering a heavy burden is that of the kid who had to stick his finger on a dam until nightbreak to prevent it from breaking down. Primitives shouldering, finger, fingers, nightbreak, sun, day, one, floor 担架(たんか): stretcher, litter 担う(になう): to carry on shoulder, to bear (burden), to shoulder (gun) 負担(ふたん): burden, charge, responsibility 分担(ぶんたん): apportionment, sharing 担ぐ(かつぐ): carry on shoulder 担当(たんとう): (in) charge Kunyomi: かつ.ぐ、にな.う Onyomi: タン Lesson: 23 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 担ぐ (かつ.ぐ), 担う (にな.う)
foothold Details Story Dictionary 拠 foothold Heisig's Fingers . . . dispose. Koohii #1 When rockclimbing, when your weight disposes of the valuble foothold, all that´s left is your fingers keeping you from death. Meanwhile, your walking legs are left dangling in the wind. Koohii #2 Once you have a good foothold, you can dispose of your fingerhold. Primitives foothold, finger, fingers, dispose, walking legs, wind 根拠(こんきょ): basis, foundation 証拠(しょうこ): evidence, proof Kunyomi: よ.る Onyomi: キョ、コ Lesson: 23 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 拠点 (きょてん), 占拠 (せんきょ), 根拠 (こんきょ)	foothold 拠 画数8 722 Details Story Dictionary 拠 foothold Heisig's Fingers . . . dispose. Koohii #2 I´m bad at drawing, so when I try to sketch the kanji for cat, you can sort of recognize it, but I don´t get the curve of the ""wild dogs"" just right. "maneuver Details Story Dictionary 操 maneuver Heisig's Fingers . . . goods . . . tree. Koohii #1 Tip: goods + wood/tree : This combination of primitives appears four times in Heisig, so it´s worthwhile giving it a name. I suggest ""furniture"" (a common type of wooden goods). REF: parch (#215) , maneuver (FRAME 671), winding (#1369), seaweed (#2035). Story: Using just a finger you are trying to maneuver your furniture round your room. Koohii #2 Luke skywalker points his fingers and uses the force to maneuver the goods through the tree branches and up over the tree. Primitives maneuver, finger, fingers, wooden goods, furniture, goods, mouth, tree, wood, mouth3 操る(あやつる): to manipulate, to operate, to pull strings 操縦(そうじゅう): management, handling, control, manipulation 操作(そうさ): operation, management, processing 体操(たいそう): gymnastics, physical exercises, calisthenics Kunyomi: みさお、あやつ.る Onyomi: ソウ、サン Lesson: 23 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 操る (あやつ.る), 操 (みさお)"	"maneuver 操 画数16 724 Details Story Dictionary 操 maneuver Heisig's Fingers . . . goods . . . tree. touch Details Story Dictionary 接 touch Heisig's Fingers . . . vase . . . woman. Koohii #1 A pervert meets a woman. The pervert tries to touch the women with his lustful fingers. The woman takes a vase, lifts it over her head and smashes it on the pervert´s head... Koohii #2 CHIKAN!! These are the perverts who use their fingers to touch standing women on crowded trains. Primitives touch, finger, fingers, concubine, vase, stand up, woman 接触(せっしょく): touch, contact 接続詞(せつぞくし): conjunction 接ぐ(つぐ): to join, to piece together, to set (bones), to graft (trees) 密接(みっせつ): related, connected, close, intimate 応接(おうせつ): reception 間接(かんせつ): indirectness 接近(せっきん): getting closer, approaching 接する(せっする): come in contact with, connect, attend, receive 接続(せつぞく): connection, union, join, link, changing trains 直接(ちょくせつ): direct, immediate, personal, firsthand 面接(めんせつ): interview Kunyomi: つ.ぐ Onyomi: セツ、ショウ Lesson: 23 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 接ぐ (つ.ぐ)	touch 接 画数11 725 Details Story Dictionary 接 touch Heisig's Fingers . . . vase . . . woman. "put up a notice Details Story Dictionary 掲 put up a notice Heisig's Fingers . . . siesta. Koohii #1 A muchacho puts up a notice that says “NO FINGER SNAPPING ALLOWED. MUCHACHOS ON SIESTA”. The muchachos are sleeping soundly, completely oblivious to the sound of dogs barking, guitar playing and even gun shots. Now imagine one tourist passing by and snapping his fingers and waking up all the muchachos at once. Koohii #2 Just as I was finished putting up a ""no siestas"" notice on my property, a muchacho gave me the finger, sat down, and promptly fell asleep. Primitives put up (a notice), finger, fingers, mexican bandit, muchacho, siesta, sun, day, aroma, bound up, spoon, sitting on the ground 掲げる(かかげる): to publish, to print, to carry (an article), to put up, to hang out, to hoist, to fly (a sail), to float (a flag) 掲載(けいさい): appearance (e.g. article in paper) 掲示(けいじ): notice, bulletin Kunyomi: かか.げる Onyomi: ケイ Lesson: 23 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 掲げる (かか.げる)"	"put up a notice 掲 画数11 726 Details Story Dictionary 掲 put up a notice Heisig's Fingers . . . siesta. hang Details Story Dictionary 掛 hang Heisig's Fingers . . . ivy . . . magic wand. Koohii #1 Think RPG. The wizard points his finger to the guard and the ivy he has just animated with his magic wand climbs down the wall to hang the poor guy, opening the way for the adventurers into the dungeon. Koohii #2 3 ways you could hang something: 1) the normal way, with your finger putting something on a hook or whatever, 2) hanging from a vine the natural way, or 3) by means of the magic of the wand. Primitives hang, finger, fingers, ivy, square jewel, soil, dirt, ground, magic wand, augury, soil2, dirt2, ground2 掛かる(かかる): take (time), need, cost 掛け(かけ): credit 切っ掛け(きっかけ): chance, start, cue, excuse, motive, impetus, occasion 心掛け(こころがけ): readiness, intention, aim 心掛ける(こころがける): to bear in mind, to aim to do 差し掛かる(さしかかる): to come near to, to approach 仕掛け(しかけ): device, trick, mechanism, gadget, (small) scale, half finished, commencement, set up, challenge 仕掛ける(しかける): to commence, to lay (mines), to set (traps), to wage (war), to challenge 手掛かり(てがかり): contact, trail, scent, on hand, hand hold, clue, key 手掛ける(てがける): to handle, to manage, to work with, to rear, to look after, to have experience with 引っ掛ける(ひっかける): to hang (something) on (something), to throw on (clothes), to hook, to catch, to trap, to ensnare, to cheat, to evade payment, to jump a bill, to drink (alcohol), to spit at (a person), to hit the ball off the end of the bat (baseball) 見掛ける(みかける): to (happen to) see, to notice, to catch sight of 寄り掛かる(よりかかる): to lean against, to recline on, to lean on, to rely on 追い掛ける(おいかける): pursue, chase お出掛け(おでかけ): about to start out, just about to leave or go out お目に掛かる(おめにかかる): to see or meet someone 思い掛けない(おもいがけない): unexpected, casual 掛け算(かけざん): multiplication 掛ける(かける): wear, put on, hang, cover, sit down, make a phone call, multiply, turn on (a switch), play (a record), begin to 腰掛け(こしかけ): seat, bench 腰掛ける(こしかける): sit (down) 出掛ける(でかける): depart, set out, start, be going out 通り掛かる(とおりかかる): happen to pass by 話し掛ける(はなしかける): accost a person, talk (to someone) 引っ掛かる(ひっかかる): be caught in, be stuck in, be cheated 見掛け(みかけ): outward appearance 呼び掛ける(よびかける): call out to, accost, address (crowd), make an appeal Kunyomi: か.ける、-か.ける、か.け、-か.け、-が.け、か.かる、-か.かる、-が.かる、か.かり、-が.かり、かかり、-がかり Onyomi: カイ、ケイ Lesson: 23 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 掛かる (か.かる), 掛ける (か.ける), 掛 (かかり)	hang 掛 画数11 727 Details Story Dictionary 掛 hang Heisig's Fingers . . . ivy . . . magic wand. Koohii #1 Come on people, the only way to make headway in this business is to let your fingers do the walking! bust out the yellow pages and dial as many numbers as possible, surely someone is a sucker for a cold call sell. Koohii #2 Thing from the Addams Family has difficulties in making headway because, well, he has no head. Only walking fingers. "polish Details Story Dictionary 研 polish My Story [Stone + ""A""/Both hands {开}] The connotation of ""polish"" here is as in refining skills; polishing your skills; etc... So for a story, think more like a *stone* being polished by *both your hands* (with an abstract stone of knowledge). This kanji is for the most part just used in けんきゅう [研究] (n, vs) study, research, investigation. Koohii #1 My stones are so huge that it takes two hands to polish them! Koohii #2 You use two hands to polish a stone: one to hold it and the other to rub it. Primitives polish, stone, rock, two hands 研ぐ(とぐ): to sharpen, to grind, to scour, to hone, to polish, to wash (rice) 研修(けんしゅう): training 研究(けんきゅう): study, research 研究室(けんきゅうしつ): study (room) Kunyomi: と.ぐ Onyomi: ケン Lesson: 23 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds: 研ぐ (と.ぐ)"	"polish 研 画数9 729 Details Story Dictionary 研 polish My Story [Stone + ""A""/Both hands {开}] The connotation of ""polish"" here is as in refining skills; polishing your skills; etc... So for a story, think more like a *stone* being polished by *both your hands* (with an abstract stone of knowledge). "commandment Details Story Dictionary 戒 commandment Heisig's Two hands . . . fiesta. Koohii #1 Two hands, fiesta.....when moses received the ten commandments with two hands, he went back down the mountain and threw a fiesta with the jews, celebrating the arrival of the commandments. Koohii #2 When Moses returned with the commandments in his hands he saw that his people were throwing a fiesta. At first he was excited. Then he looked around and got pissed. ""Awww, c´mon guys. Golden idols? Really?"". punish Details Story Dictionary 刑 punish My Story The death penalty is when they *open* up your whole torso with a *realistic sword* to punish you. Koohii #1 This kanji is for severe punishment. A man has his shackled hands placed on a wood block and they´re chopped off with a saber. No more stealing bread in the Middle East... Koohii #2 In Arab countries they punish theives by cutting off BOTH HANDS with a SABRE. Primitives punish, two hands, sword, sabre, saber 刑(けい): penalty, sentence, punishment 刑罰(けいばつ): judgement, penalty, punishment 死刑(しけい): death penalty, capital punishment 刑事(けいじ): criminal case, (police) detective Kunyomi: Onyomi: ケイ Lesson: 23 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	punish 刑 画数6 734 Details Story Dictionary 刑 punish My Story The death penalty is when they *open* up your whole torso with a *realistic sword* to punish you. Koohii #1 This kanji is for severe punishment. A man has his shackled hands placed on a wood block and they´re chopped off with a saber. No more stealing bread in the Middle East... Koohii #2 In Arab countries they punish theives by cutting off BOTH HANDS with a SABRE. Primitives punish, two hands, sword, sabre, saber 刑(けい): penalty, sentence, punishment 刑罰(けいばつ): judgement, penalty, punishment 死刑(しけい): death penalty, capital punishment 刑事(けいじ): criminal case, (police) detective Kunyomi: Onyomi: ケイ Lesson: 23 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:
mould Details Story Dictionary 型 mould Heisig's Punish . . . soil. In cases like this, you might find it easier to break the character up into its more basic elements, like this: two hands . . . saber . . . soil. Koohii #1 A famous ninja once pressed his two hands and saber into the soil of his temple, before going onto a mission from which he never came back. Think of some sort of signature that he left behind him. The mould of his two hands and saber has since become a popular attraction in the area. Koohii #2 As a PUNISHMENT they made me lay face down in the DIRT leaving a nice imprinted MOULD of my whole BODY. Primitives mould, punish, two hands, sword, sabre, saber, soil, dirt, ground 模型(もけい): model, dummy, maquette 型(かた): mold, model, style, shape, data type 典型(てんけい): type, pattern, archetypal Kunyomi: かた、-がた Onyomi: ケイ Lesson: 23 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 型 (かた)	mould 型 画数9 735 Details Story Dictionary 型 mould Heisig's Punish . . . soil. "genius Details Story Dictionary 才 genius Heisig's Whatever one is particularly adept at - one's special ""genius"" - one can do very easily, ""with one finger"" as the phrase goes. This kanji is a pictograph of that one finger. Note how its distinctive form is created by writing the final stroke of the element for fingers backwards. * The primitive meaning, genie, derives from the roots of the word genius. Use the genie out in the open when the primitive appears to the right of or below its relative primitive; in that case it also keeps its same form. At the left, the form is altered, and the meaning becomes a genie in the bottle. Koohii #1 Spinal tap: ""Every other band´s amps go to ten. But you see my extra stroke of genius - these go to eleven."". Koohii #2 A TEN year old had a STROKE of GENIUS and wrote this joke: 何歳ですか？　　　。。。天才です！. Primitives genius, genius, genie 天才(てんさい): genius, prodigy, natural gift 才能(さいのう): talent, ability Kunyomi: Onyomi: サイ Lesson: 23 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds:"	"genius 才 画数3 736 Details Story Dictionary 才 genius Heisig's Whatever one is particularly adept at - one's special ""genius"" - one can do very easily, ""with one finger"" as the phrase goes. This kanji is a pictograph of that one finger. At the left, the form is altered, and the meaning becomes a genie in the bottle. Koohii #1 Spinal tap: ""Every other band´s amps go to ten. property Details Story Dictionary 財 property Heisig's Clam . . . genie. Koohii #1 If you´re a money genius, you can afford a lot of property. Koohii #2 The keyword refers to property in the sense of money or funds rather than of buildings or real estate. Keep this one distinct from frame 193 (“wealth”) and frame 473 (“assets”). Here we have a genie, gulping down oysters. Someone tries to grab an oyster and the genie puts his big arms around his oysters and states his “right of ownership” : “They´re mines, my property!”. Primitives property, shellfish, clam, oyster, eye, animal legs, eight, genie 財(ざい): fortune, riches 財源(ざいげん): source of funds, resources, finances 財政(ざいせい): economy, financial affairs 文化財(ぶんかざい): cultural assets, cultural property 財産(ざいさん): property, fortune, assets 財布(さいふ): purse, wallet Kunyomi: たから Onyomi: ザイ、サイ、ゾク Lesson: 23 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 財産 (ざいさん), 私財 (しざい), 文化財 (ぶんかざい)	property 財 画数10 737 Details Story Dictionary 財 property Heisig's Clam . . . genie. Koohii #2 Just when the were about to turn the last tree into lumber, the Lorax (the tree-genie) jumps out and puts a stop to the whole affair. Primitives lumber, tree, wood, genie 教材(きょうざい): teaching materials 取材(しゅざい): choice of subject, collecting data 人材(じんざい): man of talent 素材(そざい): raw materials, subject matter 材木(ざいもく): lumber, timber 材料(ざいりょう): ingredients, material 木材(もくざい): lumber, timber, wood Kunyomi: Onyomi: ザイ Lesson: 23 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds:	lumber 材 画数7 738 Details Story Dictionary 材 lumber My Story the first guy to make lumber from a *tree* must have been a *genius* Koohii #1 A TREE GENIUS is a LUMBER jack. "suppose Details Story Dictionary 存 suppose Heisig's Genie in the bottle . . . a child. Hint: focus on the key word's connotation of ""make believe"". Koohii #1 How do you suppose they manage to cram a genie inside a bottle? Well, I suppose they put him in there while he´s still a little child... Koohii #2 Villagers on a little remote island one day find a bottle washed out by the sea onto the beach. After wiping the bottle and taking a closer look, they are amazed to see a (very small) child in it. The villagers suppose that the child is a genie in a bottle. Primitives suppose, genie, child 依存(いそん): dependence, dependent, reliance 共存(きょうそん): coexistence 存続(そんぞく): duration, continuance 生存(せいぞん): existence, being, survival 存在(そんざい): existence, being 存じる(ぞんじる): (humble) to know 存ずる(ぞんずる): (humble) to think, feel, consider, know, etc. 保存(ほぞん): preservation, conservation, storage, maintenance ご存じ(ごぞんじ): know Kunyomi: Onyomi: ソン、ゾン Lesson: 23 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 存在 (そんざい), 存続 (そんぞく), 既存 (きぞん)"	"suppose 存 画数6 739 Details Story Dictionary 存 suppose Heisig's Genie in the bottle . . . a child. exist Details Story Dictionary 在 exist Heisig's Genie in the bottle . . . soil. Koohii #1 Genie in the bottle does exist but you need to dig deep into the soil to find one. Koohii #2 You wipe the soil from the bottle, only to have a genie float out above you, saying: ´I am the genie in a bottle, what is your wish?´ So now you know that they do exist. Primitives exist, genie, soil, dirt, ground 健在(けんざい): in good health, well 在庫(ざいこ): stockpile, stock 自在(じざい): freely, at will 所在(しょざい): whereabouts 不在(ふざい): absence 在る(ある): to live, to be 現在(げんざい): present, up to now, nowadays, modern times, current 在学(ざいがく): (enrolled) in school 存在(そんざい): existence, being 滞在(たいざい): stay, sojourn Kunyomi: あ.る Onyomi: ザイ Lesson: 23 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 在る (あ.る)	exist 在 画数6 740 Details Story Dictionary 在 exist Heisig's Genie in the bottle . . . soil. "from Details Story Dictionary 乃 from Heisig's This pictograph of a clenched fist is another of the ""hand primitives."" Take note of its rather peculiar drawing. Try to think of drawing a fist (the primitive meaning) ""from"" this character to give yourself a connotation for the otherwise abstract key word. * The primitive meaning is taken from the pictograph: a fist. Koohii #1 FROM a pictograph of a thumbs up. That´s how it also gets the primitive meaning of fist. Koohii #2 Think Charlton Heston: ""From my cold, dead fists"". Speech given to the National Boxing Association, in response to stricter control on boxing gloves. Primitives from, fist, from 乃至(ないし): from...to, between...and, or Kunyomi: の、すなわ.ち、なんじ Onyomi: ナイ、ダイ、ノ、アイ Lesson: 23 Jouyou: Names JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"	"from 乃 画数2 741 Details Story Dictionary 乃 from Heisig's This pictograph of a clenched fist is another of the ""hand primitives."" "portable Details Story Dictionary 携 portable Heisig's Fingers . . . turkey . . . fist. Koohii #1 This character is the ""kei"" in ""keitai"" (cell phone), a word you will no doubt hear often in Japan, since everyone has one. Imagine you´ve just arrived in Japan, but don´t have a cell phone yet, so instead you´re carrying around a portable turkey you can hold in your fist. To dial a number, just poke it with your fingers. Koohii #2 Because they have no fingers, turkeys must use their fists when dialing on a portable phone. Primitives portable, finger, fingers, turkey, fist, from 携帯(けいたい): carrying something 携わる(たずさわる): to participate, to take part 提携(ていけい): cooperation, tie-up, joint business, link-up Kunyomi: たずさ.える、たずさ.わる Onyomi: ケイ Lesson: 23 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 携える (たずさ.える), 携わる (たずさ.わる)"	"portable 携 画数13 742 Details Story Dictionary 携 portable Heisig's Fingers . . . turkey . . . fist. reach out Details Story Dictionary 及 reach out Heisig's The addition of a final stroke transforms this character from the primitive for a clenched fist into the kanji for reaching out, much as a stroke of kindness can often turn anger into acceptance. * As a primitive, this shall stand for outstretched hands. Only take care not to confuse it with that for beg (Frame 501) Koohii #1 I like to think of this as a fist with with brass knuckles because of the extra line. An old school thug reaches out to help you up but then with his other hand ( with the brass knuckles) punches you. Koohii #2 Reach out and fist someone (Do you see the person primitive?). Primitives reach out, fist, from, drop 及び(および): and, as well as 及ぶ(およぶ): to reach, to come up to, to amount to, to befall, to happen to, to extend, to match, to equal 追及(ついきゅう): gaining on, carrying out, solving (crime) 及ぼす(およぼす): exert, cause, exercise 普及(ふきゅう): diffusion, spread Kunyomi: およ.ぶ、およ.び、および、およ.ぼす Onyomi: キュウ Lesson: 23 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 及び (およ.び), 及ぶ (およ.ぶ), 及ぼす (およ.ぼす)	reach out 及 画数3 743 Details Story Dictionary 及 reach out Heisig's The addition of a final stroke transforms this character from the primitive for a clenched fist into the kanji for reaching out, much as a stroke of kindness can often turn anger into acceptance. * As a primitive, this shall stand for outstretched hands. "length Details Story Dictionary 丈 length My Story ナ + ノ = length Koohii #1 Both a meter and a yard are about one arm-length. Koohii #2 This kanji reminds me of the kanji for big (I think it looks the same kinda of except for the last stroke). Maybe this works for guys, but when you were growing up you would compare ""length"" with your friends trying to show how BIG you were. You wouldn´t show ""it"" but you would spread your arms out as wide as possible to exaggerate your length. Maybe even so wide that you trip (I the 3rd stroke getting pushed over)! I just find it easier to relate this to the previous kanji. Primitives length, stick, tucked under the arm 頑丈(がんじょう): solid, firm, stout, burly, strong, sturdy 丈夫(じょうふ): hero, gentleman, warrior, manly person, good health, robustness, strong, solid, durable 丈(たけ): height, stature, length, measure, all (one has) 丈(だけ): only, just, as 成る丈(なるたけ): as much as possible, if possible 丈夫(じょうぶ): good health, robustness, strong, solid, durable, hero, gentleman, warrior, manly person 大丈夫(だいじょうぶ): safe, all right, O.K. Kunyomi: たけ、だけ Onyomi: ジョウ Lesson: 23 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: Compounds: 丈 (たけ)"	"length 丈 画数3 746 Details Story Dictionary 丈 length My Story ナ + ノ = length Koohii #1 Both a meter and a yard are about one arm-length. Maybe this works for guys, but when you were growing up you would compare ""length"" with your friends trying to show how BIG you were. You wouldn´t show ""it"" but you would spread your arms out as wide as possible to exaggerate your length. Maybe even so wide that you trip (I the 3rd stroke getting pushed over)! grow late Details Story Dictionary 更 grow late Heisig's The implication behind the meaning of grow late is that things are changing in the same way that the day turns into night. The elements: ceiling . . . sun . . . tucked under the arm. Koohii #1 At nightbreak (#30) the sun rises above the floor, so it is logical that when it is growing late, the sun would rise to the ceiling. Time to pack up your things and take your belongings under your arm. Koohii #2 It´s starting to GROW LATE, so God will take the SUN, and TUCK IT UNDER HIS ARM, and walk away. In the morning, he´ll bring it back, so don´t worry. Primitives grow late, Ameratasu, one, ceiling, sun, tucked under the arm 今更(いまさら): now, at this late hour 尚更(なおさら): all the more, still less 夜更かし(よふかし): staying up late, keeping late hours, sitting up late at night, nighthawk 夜更け(よふけ): late at night 更に(さらに): furthermore, again, after all, more and more, moreover 更ける(ふける): get late, advance, wear on, 変更(へんこう): change, modification, alteration Kunyomi: さら、さら.に、ふ.ける、ふ.かす Onyomi: コウ Lesson: 23 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 更 (さら), 更かす (ふ.かす), 更ける (ふ.ける)	grow late 更 画数7 749 Details Story Dictionary 更 grow late Heisig's The implication behind the meaning of grow late is that things are changing in the same way that the day turns into night. The elements: ceiling . . . sun . . . tucked under the arm. Koohii #1 At nightbreak (#30) the sun rises above the floor, so it is logical that when it is growing late, the sun would rise to the ceiling. Time to pack up your things and take your belongings under your arm. Koohii #2 It´s starting to GROW LATE, so God will take the SUN, and TUCK IT UNDER HIS ARM, and walk away. In the morning, he´ll bring it back, so don´t worry. Primitives grow late, Ameratasu, one, ceiling, sun, tucked under the arm 今更(いまさら): now, at this late hour 尚更(なおさら): all the more, still less 夜更かし(よふかし): staying up late, keeping late hours, sitting up late at night, nighthawk 夜更け(よふけ): late at night 更に(さらに): furthermore, again, after all, more and more, moreover 更ける(ふける): get late, advance, wear on, 変更(へんこう): change, modification, alteration Kunyomi: さら、さら.に、ふ.ける、ふ.かす Onyomi: コウ Lesson: 23 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 更 (さら), 更かす (ふ.かす), 更ける (ふ.ける)
stiff Details Story Dictionary 硬 stiff Heisig's Rocks . . . grow late. Koohii #1 A stiff drink on the ROCKs after it GROWS LATE is a way to unwind after a long day... Koohii #2 Stones are so stiff that even if you spent all day straining trying to change their shape, it would grow late far before you ever accomplished your task. Primitives stiff, stone, rock, grow late, Ameratasu, one, ceiling, sun, tucked under the arm 強硬(きょうこう): firm, vigorous, unbending, unyielding, strong, stubborn 硬い(かたい): solid, hard (especially metal, stone), unpolished writing 硬貨(こうか): coin Kunyomi: かた.い Onyomi: コウ Lesson: 23 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 硬い (かた.い)	stiff 硬 画数12 750 Details Story Dictionary 硬 stiff Heisig's Rocks . . . grow late. spiny Details Story Dictionary 梗 spiny Heisig's This character refers originally to a deciduous, rough tree that grows on mountain plains. From this it gets the secondary sense of rugged or spiny. Its primitive elements: tree . . . grow late. Koohii #1 I learned this one from the movie Evil Dead, but when it grows late, trees change shape and become spiny creatures! Lesson: don´t go out at night. Koohii #2 With the safety of darkness as it grows late, spiny little insects start crawling out of the trees. Primitives spiny, tree, wood, grow late, Ameratasu, one, ceiling, sun, tucked under the arm Kunyomi: ふさぐ、やまにれ、おおむね Onyomi: コウ、キョウ Lesson: 23 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: Compounds:	spiny 梗 画数11 751 Details Story Dictionary 梗 spiny Heisig's This character refers originally to a deciduous, rough tree that grows on mountain plains. "or again Details Story Dictionary 又 or again Heisig's Like the several abbreviations in Roman script to indicate ""and"" (+, &, etc.), this short two-stroke kanji is used for the similar meaning of or again. * As a primitive, it will mean crotch, as in the crotch of the arm. Or whatever. Koohii #1 After her boyfriend´s crotch has been satisfied, a woman might suggest they cuddle. The boyfriend, on the other hand, might say, ""Or again, we could fool around . . . "". Koohii #2 This keyword should really be ""again"" not ""or again"" Here is some context: think of the phrase ""Jya mata"" ""じゃ又"" which is a farewell similar to ""then again"". Also ""Mata ne"" ""又ね"" and mata ashita (again tomorrow) ""又明日""。 Note this kanji is rarely used, most of the time JP people spell it out ""mata"" except for in the last example: 又明日. Primitives or again, crotch 又(また): again, and 又は(または): or, the other Kunyomi: また、また-、また.の- Onyomi: ユウ Lesson: 23 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 又 (また)"	"or again 又 画数2 752 Details Story Dictionary 又 or again Heisig's Like the several abbreviations in Roman script to indicate ""and"" (+, &, etc.), this short two-stroke kanji is used for the similar meaning of or again. * As a primitive, it will mean crotch, as in the crotch of the arm. Or whatever. Koohii #1 After her boyfriend´s crotch has been satisfied, a woman might suggest they cuddle. The boyfriend, on the other hand, might say, ""Or again, we could fool around . . . "". Koohii #2 This keyword should really be ""again"" not ""or again"" Here is some context: think of the phrase ""Jya mata"" ""じゃ又"" which is a farewell similar to ""then again"". Also ""Mata ne"" ""又ね"" and mata ashita (again tomorrow) ""又明日""。 Note this kanji is rarely used, most of the time JP people spell it out ""mata"" except for in the last example: 又明日. Primitives or again, crotch 又(また): again, and 又は(または): or, the other Kunyomi: また、また-、また.の- Onyomi: ユウ Lesson: 23 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 又 (また)"
pair Details Story Dictionary 双 pair Heisig's The crotch reduplicated gives us a pair. Koohii #1 Crotch to crotch is how many pairs spend their private time together. . . Koohii #2 The animals boarding Noah´s Ark all came in pairs – but Noah had to carefully check the two crotches in each pair to ensure that the animals were of different sexes and thus able to further their species after the flood. Primitives pair, crotch, crotch2 双子(ふたご): twins, a twin Kunyomi: ふた、たぐい、ならぶ、ふたつ Onyomi: ソウ Lesson: 23 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 双 (ふた)	pair 双 画数4 753 Details Story Dictionary 双 pair Heisig's The crotch reduplicated gives us a pair. "mulberry Details Story Dictionary 桑 mulberry Heisig's Crotches, crotches everywhere . . . tree. Hint: think of a group of children playing an original version of ""Here We Go 'Round the Mulberry Bush."" Koohii #1 Children going around the mulberry tree singing ""This is the way we wash our crotch, wash our crotch, wash our crotch..."". Koohii #2 Imagine kids all over the top of a mulberry tree, sitting astride limbs so that their weight is on their crotches. (Mulberry trees have big sprawling limbs that run horizontally or at shallow angles making them easy to climb and sit in. I have an old mulberry in my yard, and my kids are in it constantly). Primitives mulberry, crotch, tree, wood, crotch3 Kunyomi: くわ Onyomi: ソウ Lesson: 23 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 桑 (くわ)"	"mulberry 桑 画数10 754 Details Story Dictionary 桑 mulberry Heisig's Crotches, crotches everywhere . . . tree. vessels Details Story Dictionary 隻 vessels Heisig's The key word indicates the Japanese generic term for counting ships. Its elements: turkey . . . crotch. Koohii #1 On Vessels that travel long distances, sailors often get quite lonely. They keep TURKEYS on the VESSELS, but not for use as food. The lonely sailors take turns enjoying the turkey´s CROTCH. Koohii #2 Donald Duck is a big bird that does not wear pants. It´s good to use him as a mnemonic because he is a sailor, and this kanji is used to count vessels. Primitives vessels, turkey, crotch Kunyomi: Onyomi: セキ Lesson: 23 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 2 Compounds:	vessels 隻 画数10 755 Details Story Dictionary 隻 vessels Heisig's The key word indicates the Japanese generic term for counting ships. safeguard Details Story Dictionary 護 safeguard Heisig's Words . . . flowers . . . vessels. Koohii #1 Think of the flower-vessels as a the Greenpeace vessel “Arctic Sunrise”, only instead of a rainbow there is a big flower painted on the hull (this will come back in seize (#701) and harvest (#908)). Think of “flower-power” and of the “peace” in “Greenpeace” and it will make some sense hopefully. -- In this kanji, we see an inauguration speech being given before the Greenpeace vessel is set afloat and sent to safeguard our planet. Koohii #2 (With sarcasm) A Bush speech telling how all the US vessels are always welcomed, covered with flowers and words of gratitude for safeguarding democracy from the evil doers. Primitives safeguard, say, words, keitai, mouth, radio caroline, flowers, vessels, turkey, crotch 介護(かいご): nursing 看護(かんご): nursing, (army) nurse 護衛(ごえい): guard, convoy, escort 弁護(べんご): defense, pleading, advocacy 保護(ほご): care, protection, shelter, guardianship, favor, patronage 養護(ようご): protection, nursing, protective care 看護婦(かんごふ): nurse Kunyomi: まも.る Onyomi: ゴ Lesson: 23 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	safeguard 護 画数20 756 Details Story Dictionary 護 safeguard Heisig's Words . . . flowers . . . vessels. seize Details Story Dictionary 獲 seize Heisig's A pack of wild dogs . . . flowers . . . vessels. Do not confuse this with the character for arrest (Frame 706). Koohii #1 A pack of genetically-modified wild dogs is seized by a group of Greenpeace activists and taken onboard the Greenpeace vessel (the flower vessel, see safeguard (#700)). Koohii #2 Customs just seized a crate of poppies (flowers) detected by trained wild dogs who inspected the vessel. angry Details Story Dictionary 怒 angry Heisig's Guy . . . heart. Koohii #1 This woman is angry because of the guys in the previous frame who pay more attention to her crotch than her heart. I prefer to decompose the kanji in three elements here because it is easier to read like a mnemonic. Koohii #2 WOMEN get very ANGRY over the thought that GUYS are more interested in her CROTCH than her HEART. friend Details Story Dictionary 友 friend Heisig's By one's side . . . crotch. Koohii #1 A good friend is always at your side. ---- I teach at a Japanese High School, and I often see chummy male students grabbing each other´s crotches in a joking manner. It´s still weird to me, but apparently reaching to your side and grabbing you neighbor´s crotch is a great way to express friendship. Koohii #2 Think of a sex friend (a fuck buddy if you will). The benefit of such a relationship is that there will always be a crotch by your side. (the Japanese refer to such a friend as セフレ, just as we do). Primitives friend, by one’s side, crotch 友(とも): friend, companion, pal 親友(しんゆう): close friend 友好(ゆうこう): friendship 友情(ゆうじょう): friendship, fellowship 友人(ゆうじん): friend 友達(ともだち): friend Kunyomi: とも Onyomi: ユウ Lesson: 23 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 5 Compounds: 友 (とも)	friend 友 画数4 760 Details Story Dictionary 友 friend Heisig's By one's side . . . crotch. slip out Details Story Dictionary 抜 slip out Heisig's Fingers . . . friend. Koohii #1 Don´t let good friends slip out between your fingers. Koohii #2 Imagine a cliché Hollywood situation: one person is lying on the edge of the abyss and another (presumably his friend) is hanging, only thing holding him is the grip of their hands. Then fingers slip out of the grip and he falls in said abyss. Primitives slip out, finger, fingers, friend, woman, crotch 海抜(かいばつ): height above sea level 抜かす(ぬかす): to omit, to leave out 抜け出す(ぬけだす): to slip out, to sneak away, to excel 抜く(ぬく): extract, omit, surpass, draw out, unplug 抜ける(ぬける): come out, fall out, be omitted, be missing, escape Kunyomi: ぬ.く、-ぬ.く、ぬ.き、ぬ.ける、ぬ.かす、ぬ.かる Onyomi: バツ、ハツ、ハイ Lesson: 23 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 抜かす (ぬ.かす), 抜かる (ぬ.かる), 抜く (ぬ.く), 抜ける (ぬ.ける)	slip out 抜 画数7 761 Details Story Dictionary 抜 slip out Heisig's Fingers . . . friend. "throw Details Story Dictionary 投 throw My Story [My nigga MO + missile] My nigga *Mo* actually #threw# a *missile* with his fingers, what a G!!! Koohii #1 Well, you usually use your fingers to throw objects used as missile weapons. Easy. By the way, for those of you looking for a less anachronistic image for the missile primitive as a modern rocket, try a slingshot. it´s a crotch (originally a tree branch) that sends missile projectiles flying into/like the wind. And for this present kanji, it is something you naturally use with your fingers... Koohii #2 If you use the primitive ""semen"" (flying in the wind from your crotch) instead of missile then all kanjis with this primitive will hilariously create a perfect story. Primitives throw, finger, fingers, cruise missile, missile, wind, crotch 投資(とうし): investment 投入(とうにゅう): throw, investment, making (an electrical circuit) 投げ出す(なげだす): to throw down, to abandon, to sacrifice, to throw out 投書(とうしょ): letter to the editor, letter from a reader, contribution 投票(とうひょう): voting, poll 投げる(なげる): throw Kunyomi: な.げる、-な.げ Onyomi: トウ Lesson: 23 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 投げる (な.げる)"	"throw 投 画数7 762 Details Story Dictionary 投 throw My Story [My nigga MO + missile] My nigga *Mo* actually #threw# a *missile* with his fingers, what a G!!! Koohii #1 Well, you usually use your fingers to throw objects used as missile weapons. Easy. By the way, for those of you looking for a less anachronistic image for the missile primitive as a modern rocket, try a slingshot. it´s a crotch (originally a tree branch) that sends missile projectiles flying into/like the wind. And for this present kanji, it is something you naturally use with your fingers... Koohii #2 If you use the primitive ""semen"" (flying in the wind from your crotch) instead of missile then all kanjis with this primitive will hilariously create a perfect story. "drown Details Story Dictionary 没 drown Heisig's Water . . . missile. Koohii #1 (Note: this kanji is more collapse/cave-in/sink (#1888) than humans drowning) A water missile? A torpedo! And when it hits it´s target? The ship collapses then sinks and everyone drowns! Koohii #2 The submarine´s hull was breached after being struck by a torpedo (""water missile""), causing the entire crew to drown. Koohii #2 My thigh is the part of the body that my missile smacks against. Koohii #2 Think 3 methods of attack all combined into 1 kanji: 1. Vehicle to transport troops 2. Once troops have disembarked they have their missiles 3. If they run out of missiles they resort to hand to hand combat to beat the enemy. branch Details Story Dictionary 支 branch Heisig's Needle . . . crotch. Koohii #1 Picture sliding down the branch of a tree (in this case a pine tree or any tree with needles) and getting a bunch of needles stuck in your crotch--ouch!! Koohii #2 A special branch of the military called the Needle Crotch Unit. Their only weapon is the needle embedded in their crotches, and they´re quite adept at using them. bough Details Story Dictionary 枝 bough Heisig's Tree . . . branch. Take a moment to focus on the differences between a bough, a branch, and a twig (Frame 319). Koohii #1 The tree´s primary branch is known as the bough. Koohii #2 Differentiate between BOUGH and branch (#711): ´branch´ is smaller, and can also refer to the branch of a store (支店), which has nothing to do with a tree. But a BOUGH is a main part of a tree, perhaps where the trunk splits into several large boughs, and so it logically utilizes the 木 radical. Primitives bough, tree, wood, branch, ten, needle, crotch 枝(えだ): branch Kunyomi: えだ Onyomi: シ Lesson: 23 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 枝 (えだ)	bough 枝 画数8 770 Details Story Dictionary 枝 bough Heisig's Tree . . . branch. Take a moment to focus on the differences between a bough, a branch, and a twig (Frame 319). Koohii #1 The tree´s primary branch is known as the bough. Koohii #2 Differentiate between BOUGH and branch (#711): ´branch´ is smaller, and can also refer to the branch of a store (支店), which has nothing to do with a tree. But a BOUGH is a main part of a tree, perhaps where the trunk splits into several large boughs, and so it logically utilizes the 木 radical. Primitives bough, tree, wood, branch, ten, needle, crotch 枝(えだ): branch Kunyomi: えだ Onyomi: シ Lesson: 23 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 枝 (えだ)
"limb Details Story Dictionary 肢 limb Heisig's Part of the body . . . branch. Koohii #1 The limbs that this kanji represents are parts of the body that are connected to the trunk, like the main branches to a tree (“arms and legs” is the second meaning of this kanji). In other words, limbs are ""flesh branches"". Koohii #2 Limbs are body parts that branch off. Primitives limb, moon, month, flesh, part of the body, branch, ten, needle, crotch Kunyomi: Onyomi: シ Lesson: 23 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"	"limb 肢 画数8 771 Details Story Dictionary 肢 limb Heisig's Part of the body . . . branch. "stalk Details Story Dictionary 茎 stalk Heisig's Flower . . . spool. Koohii #1 Suggestion: Replace ""spool"" with ""toilet paper/roll"". Reasons: (1) Toilet paper/roll usually comes on a spool. (2) Toilet paper is used to clean the soil off your crotch. Story: Just get a flower and carefully wrap some toilet paper around its stalk. Spool also appears in suspicious (#716), lightly (#717), diameter (#882), sutra (#1360). Koohii #2 PRIMITIVE: soiled crotch = soiled underwear. To precent anyone from picking the beautiful flower, the gardner hung soiled underwear on the stalk. Primitives stalk, flowers, spool, clod, toilet paper, crotch, soil, dirt, ground 茎(くき): stalk Kunyomi: くき Onyomi: ケイ、キョウ Lesson: 23 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 茎 (くき)"	"stalk 茎 画数8 772 Details Story Dictionary 茎 stalk Heisig's Flower . . . spool. Koohii #2 Imagine a loud farting sound on The Enterprise (sorry). Everyone looks around trying to find who did it. The one looking most suspicious is Data. His soiled crotch gives him away. lightly Details Story Dictionary 軽 lightly My Story [Car + jesus taking a dump] Yo I heard Jesus pulled up in a low-rider (car) and he lightly took a dump on CAS. Koohii #1 Fact: this kanji is used to denote a certain class of vehicles in Japan whose engines are under a certain size (less than 750cc I think) and are called light vehicles here. Imagine a so-called light vehicle or a light-truck with a load of spools driving down a road ever so lightly, careful not to let any of the spools roll out onto the street. Koohii #2 I want to tread lightly on the environment.... That´s why I CAR-SPOOL to work everyday.... I know, lame. Primitives lightly, car, spool, clod, toilet paper, crotch, soil, dirt, ground 気軽(きがる): cheerful, buoyant, lighthearted 軽快(けいかい): rhythmical (e.g. melody), casual (e.g. dress), light, nimble 軽減(けいげん): abatement 軽率(けいそつ): rash, thoughtless, careless, hasty 軽蔑(けいべつ): scorn, disdain 手軽(てがる): easy, simple, informal, offhand, cheap 軽い(かるい): light, non-serious, minor Kunyomi: かる.い、かろ.やか、かろ.んじる Onyomi: ケイ Lesson: 23 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 軽い (かる.い), 軽やか (かろ.やか)	lightly 軽 画数12 774 Details Story Dictionary 軽 lightly My Story [Car + jesus taking a dump] Yo I heard Jesus pulled up in a low-rider (car) and he lightly took a dump on CAS. uncle Details Story Dictionary 叔 uncle Heisig's Above . . . little . . . crotch. Koohii #1 Oh come on people - say what we´ve all been thinking: the uncle is that creepy guy towering above a little one´s crotch. Koohii #2 Four straight kanji here with 叔 in it, so let´s make one story: Your UNCLE was full of loneliness (#720) (寂), and he lived by himself. He was naturally graceful (#721) (淑) in the water, and you knew he was once on the Olympic synchronized swimming team). You knew that there was something different about him, but you joined his youth team and he watched over you carefully as coach (#719) (督). It was uncomfortable, though, how your uncle (#718) often touched you just a little above the crotch (叔) when coaching... anti- Details Story Dictionary 反 anti- Heisig's Cliff . . . crotch. Koohii #1 I think of an anti-hero (Dirty Harry etc.) for this primitive, whose trademark for disposing of villians is not an honorable fight, but a kick in the crotch and then a shove off a cliff (perhaps whilst the villain´s back is turned). Koohii #2 Many cultures are so anti-sex you´d think they just want people to throw their crotches over a cliff. Primitives anti-, demonstation, cliff, crotch 反り(そり): warp, curvature, curve, arch 反(たん): roll of cloth (c. 10 yds.), .245 acres, 300 tsubo 反感(はんかん): antipathy, revolt, animosity 反響(はんきょう): echo, reverberation, repercussion, reaction, influence 反撃(はんげき): counterattack, counteroffensive, counterblow 反射(はんしゃ): reflection, reverberation 反する(はんする): to be inconsistent with, to oppose, to contradict, to transgress, to rebel 反応(はんのう): reaction, response 反発(はんぱつ): repelling, rebound, recover, oppose 反乱(はんらん): insurrection, mutiny, rebellion, revolt, uprising 違反(いはん): violation (of law), transgression 反る(かえる): change, turn over, turn upside down 反映(はんえい): reflection, influence 反抗(はんこう): opposition, resistance, insubordination, defiance, hostility, rebellion 反省(はんせい): reflection, reconsideration, introspection, meditation, contemplation 反対(はんたい): oppose Kunyomi: そ.る、そ.らす、かえ.す、かえ.る、-かえ.る Onyomi: ハン、ホン、タン、ホ Lesson: 23 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 反映 (はんえい), 反対 (はんたい), 違反 (いはん), 謀反 (むほん), 反らす (そ.らす), 反る (そ.る)	anti- 反 画数4 779 Details Story Dictionary 反 anti- Heisig's Cliff . . . crotch. slope Details Story Dictionary 坂 slope My Story Bruh! *Jesus* is *anti-*slope, Bruh! *Jesus* will throw any *anti-*believers down the hill Koohii #1 As the villain (pushed off by the anti-hero) is tumbling down the slope, he activates gadget skis to escape, spraying soil everywhere as he flies down the slope. Koohii #2 This kanji depicts a classic enviornmental problem: erosion. Erosion occurs when all of the soil washes of the side of the cliff, eventually causing the cliff to disappear, leaving a slope (an anti- cliff if you will) in its place. Primitives slope, soil, dirt, ground, anti-, demonstration, cliff, crotch 坂(さか): slope, hill Kunyomi: さか Onyomi: ハン Lesson: 23 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 坂 (さか)	slope 坂 画数7 780 Details Story Dictionary 坂 slope My Story Bruh! *Jesus* is *anti-*slope, Bruh! *Jesus* will throw any *anti-*believers down the hill Koohii #1 As the villain (pushed off by the anti-hero) is tumbling down the slope, he activates gadget skis to escape, spraying soil everywhere as he flies down the slope. Erosion occurs when all of the soil washes of the side of the cliff, eventually causing the cliff to disappear, leaving a slope (an anti- cliff if you will) in its place. Koohii #2 Trees are naturally opposed to, or anti, the making of planks. "return Details Story Dictionary 返 return My Story [Anti + Movement/motion] *Anti*FA's *movement* did not return any benefits to society Koohii #1 Pretty obvious: to return is to turn back on the road you´re on and go the opposite way. Koohii #2 In ""The Return of the anti-hero"", Clint Eastwood kicks the villain in the crotch, pushes them off the cliff and onto a busy highway. A tiring movie franchise to say the least.... Primitives return, anti-, demonstration, cliff, crotch, road 裏返し(うらがえし): inside out, upside down 折り返す(おりかえす): to turn up, to fold back 返る(かえる): to return, to come back, to go back 宙返り(ちゅうがえり): somersault, looping-the-loop 照り返す(てりかえす): to reflect, to throw back light 返還(へんかん): return, restoration 返済(へんさい): repayment 返事(へんじ): reply, answer 返答(へんとう): reply 裏返す(うらがえす): turn inside out, turn the other way, turn over 繰り返す(くりかえす): repeat, do over again 引返す(ひきかえす): repeat, send back, bring back, retrace one´s steps 引っ繰り返す(ひっくりかえす): turn over, overturn, knock over, upset, turn inside out 引っ繰り返る(ひっくりかえる): be overturned, be upset, topple over, be reversed 返す(かえす): return (something) Kunyomi: かえ.す、-かえ.す、かえ.る、-かえ.る Onyomi: ヘン Lesson: 23 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 返す (かえ.す), 返る (かえ.る)"	"return 返 画数7 782 Details Story Dictionary 返 return My Story [Anti + Movement/motion] *Anti*FA's *movement* did not return any benefits to society Koohii #1 Pretty obvious: to return is to turn back on the road you´re on and go the opposite way. marketing Details Story Dictionary 販 marketing Heisig's Shells/money . . . anti-. Koohii #1 The goal of marketing is to get people who are naturally anti-buying to spend their shells (money). Koohii #2 『MARKETING: MONEY, ANTI』 The wide presence of MARKETING in our society has led people to become ANTI-MONEY. Primitives marketing, shellfish, clam, oyster, eye, animal legs, eight, anti-, demonstration, cliff, crotch 販売(はんばい): sale, selling, marketing Kunyomi: Onyomi: ハン Lesson: 23 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 2 Compounds:	marketing 販 画数11 783 Details Story Dictionary 販 marketing Heisig's Shells/money . . . anti-. claw Details Story Dictionary 爪 claw Heisig's This character is a pictograph of a bird's claw, and from there comes to mean animal claws in general (including human fingernails). * As a primitive, we shall use the graphic image of a vulture, a bird known for its powerful claws. It generally appears above another primitive, in which case it gets squeezed into the form ⺥. Koohii #1 A pictograph of Wolverine´s adamantium claws. Koohii #2 Pictograph, see book. * I prefer the primitive meaning of an eagle rather than vulture. Somehow vulture makes me think more about meat and dead corpses than claws. An eagle however immediately brings to my mind the image of an eagle plunging into a stream catching fish in his claws, or that of the great eagles rescuing Bilbo and his party in Jrr Tolkien´s novel “Bilbo the Hobbit”. Primitives claw, vulture 爪(つめ): fingernail or toenail, claw, talon, hoof Kunyomi: つめ、つま- Onyomi: ソウ Lesson: 23 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: Compounds: 爪 (つめつま)	claw 爪 画数4 784 Details Story Dictionary 爪 claw Heisig's This character is a pictograph of a bird's claw, and from there comes to mean animal claws in general (including human fingernails). * As a primitive, we shall use the graphic image of a vulture, a bird known for its powerful claws. Koohii #2 Pictograph, see book. * I prefer the primitive meaning of an eagle rather than vulture. Somehow vulture makes me think more about meat and dead corpses than claws. Koohii #2 An eagle must be extra gentle to pick up a dainty woman in its sharp claws. milk Details Story Dictionary 乳 milk My Story Milk is a hook that the mother uses to keep the child in the nest. Koohii #1 A fledgling is being nursed at a zoo, it is fed milk through a small tube that is bent in the shape of a hook (so that it fits inside its beak). The fledgling soon becomes addicted to milk, giving us this very catchy mnemonic: “fledgling hooked on milk”. Koohii #2 Drinking milk not only reduces cavity (#96)´s but also strengthens nails (claws) thanks astgtciv. Primitives milk, fledgling, claw, vulture, child, fishhook 乳(ちち): milk, breast, loop 牛乳(ぎゅうにゅう): cow´s milk Kunyomi: ちち、ち Onyomi: ニュウ Lesson: 23 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 乳 (ち), 乳 (ちち)	milk 乳 画数8 786 Details Story Dictionary 乳 milk My Story Milk is a hook that the mother uses to keep the child in the nest. floating Details Story Dictionary 浮 floating Heisig's Water . . . fledglings. Koohii #1 Floating rubber ducky!!! Koohii #2 A nest of fledglings somehow fell into the water (maybe it was perched on a tree bending over the river), but they are safe for now as the nest is floating. The fledglings are enjoying the cruise but they are soon coming to a great waterfall... ( a little drama to help us remember the story). lewd Details Story Dictionary 淫 lewd Heisig's Water . . . vulture . . . porter. Koohii #1 The vulture is on top of the porter and appears to be commiting a lewd act, so I throw water over the pair of them. Koohii #2 Claw marks across the porters back from engaging in lewd acts in the shower. He is tipped well for carrying the lady´s bags to her room. It appears he has covered the vulture’s feet in glue, so that the vulture cannot get off the starting block. Koohii #2 X-men and TMNT join forces: Their new leader is an awsome asshole. He is simply Wolverine and Raphael glued together back to back (the biggest assholes from both groups combined). exhort Details Story Dictionary 奨 exhort Heisig's Leader . . . St. Bernard dog. Do not confuse with urge (Frame 300). Koohii #1 It´s easy to picture a LEADER that uses a BIG dog to EXHORT his people to do more. Koohii #2 Here we have a St.Bernard exhorting the vulture to become the leader in the race against the turtle, but he can´t because of the glue. see leader (#731). grab Details Story Dictionary 采 grab Heisig's Vulture . . . tree. Koohii #1 You ever wondered why this appeared as a primitive in so many RTK1 kanji? Well, you should know that once a vulture grabs hold of a tree, he can never let go. Even Heisig couldn´t shake him loose. Koohii #2 A common meaning for this kanji is ´DICE´. --- Ever wonder what vultures do up in the trees? They play DICE. But of course, being vultures, they are always grabbing the dice away from each other. Primitives grab, claw, vulture, tree, wood Kunyomi: と.る、いろどり Onyomi: サイ Lesson: 23 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	grab 采 画数8 791 Details Story Dictionary 采 grab Heisig's Vulture . . . tree. Even Heisig couldn´t shake him loose. Koohii #2 A common meaning for this kanji is ´DICE´. --- Ever wonder what vultures do up in the trees? They play DICE. "pick Details Story Dictionary 採 pick Heisig's Unlike pick up (Frame 720), this character is used for picking fruits from trees. Its elements: finger . . . grab. Koohii #1 You pick cheries with your fingers, then along comes a giant vulture and picks up the whole tree with its claws. Koohii #2 Tip: vulture + tree : Heisig later combines these into a single kanji 采 called grab (#2090). Story: As you go to pick your nose, your parent grabs your finger and pulls it away (& gives you a lecture on social etiquette). REF: ""grab"" also appears in vegetable (#734), coloring (#1714). Primitives pick, finger, fingers, grab, claw, vulture, tree, wood 採掘(さいくつ): mining 採決(さいけつ): vote, roll call 採算(さいさん): profit 採集(さいしゅう): collecting, gathering 採択(さいたく): adoption, selection, choice 採用(さいよう): use, adopt 採点(さいてん): marking, grading, looking over 採る(とる): adopt (measure, proposal), pick (fruit), assume (attitude) Kunyomi: と.る Onyomi: サイ Lesson: 23 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 採る (と.る)"	"pick 採 画数11 792 Details Story Dictionary 採 pick Heisig's Unlike pick up (Frame 720), this character is used for picking fruits from trees. Its elements: finger . . . grab. Koohii #1 You pick cheries with your fingers, then along comes a giant vulture and picks up the whole tree with its claws. Koohii #2 Tip: vulture + tree : Heisig later combines these into a single kanji 采 called grab (#2090). Story: As you go to pick your nose, your parent grabs your finger and pulls it away (& gives you a lecture on social etiquette). REF: ""grab"" also appears in vegetable (#734), coloring (#1714). Primitives pick, finger, fingers, grab, claw, vulture, tree, wood 採掘(さいくつ): mining 採決(さいけつ): vote, roll call 採算(さいさん): profit 採集(さいしゅう): collecting, gathering 採択(さいたく): adoption, selection, choice 採用(さいよう): use, adopt 採点(さいてん): marking, grading, looking over 採る(とる): adopt (measure, proposal), pick (fruit), assume (attitude) Kunyomi: と.る Onyomi: サイ Lesson: 23 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 採る (と.る)"
vegetable Details Story Dictionary 菜 vegetable Heisig's Flower . . . grab. Koohii #1 A vegetarian vulture is munching on a flower, perched on a tree, patiently waiting for a patch of vegetables to grow. Koohii #2 Wolverine is turning into total hippie. He said he only eats vegetables now and last time I saw him sitting in a tree with flowers in his hair. Koohii #1 A vegetarian vulture is munching on a flower, perched on a tree, patiently waiting for a patch of vegetables to grow. Koohii #2 Wolverine is turning into total hippie. He said he only eats vegetables now and last time I saw him sitting in a tree with flowers in his hair. Primitives vegetable, flowers, grab, claw, vulture, tree, wood お菜(おかず): side dish, accompaniment for rice dishes 野菜(やさい): vegetable Kunyomi: な Onyomi: サイ Lesson: 23 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 菜 (な)
accept Details Story Dictionary 受 accept Heisig's Birdhouse . . . crotch. Koohii #1 The bird house is the brothel (someone else said so) and of course everyone is welcome - thay accept any crotch. Koohii #2 A birdhouse is a whorehouse that will accept any crotch even those with STDs. (Image: a birdhouse whorehouse with every kind of bird coming and going. Some old madam at the front hole accepts everyone, even the nasty old crows). Koohii #1 If you really love someone, you won´t keep them in a cage-like bird house relationship, but rather open the door and let their heart walk around freely. Think less about ""I"" (あい) and more about ""we"". "pedestal Details Story Dictionary 台 pedestal Heisig's Elbow . . . mouth. Koohii #1 When someone´s elbow is above your mouth he/she is probably standing on a pedestal. Koohii #2 After training your whole life, you manage to get a bronze medal in the Olympics. You´re extremely proud of your accomplishment as you step up to receive your medal. The guy in first place is up on a pedestal, towering above you, his elbow level with your mouth. Being a smug bastard, he ""accidentally"" knocks his elbow into your mouth, causing you to bleed and lose a tooth. Just cause he won the gold doesn´t mean he can place himself on such a high pedestal and do whatever he wants! Primitives pedestal, elbow, mouth 台無し(だいなし): mess, spoiled, (come to) nothing 台本(だいほん): libretto, scenario 土台(どだい): foundation, base, basis 寝台(しんだい): bed, couch 台(だい): stand, rack, table, support 灯台(とうだい): lighthouse 舞台(ぶたい): stage (theatre), scene or setting (e.g. of novel, play, etc.) 台風(たいふう): typhoon 台所(だいどころ): kitchen Kunyomi: うてな、われ、つかさ Onyomi: ダイ、タイ Lesson: 23 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds: 台地 (だいち), 灯台 (とうだい), 一台 (いちだい)"	"pedestal 台 画数5 805 Details Story Dictionary 台 pedestal Heisig's Elbow . . . mouth. commence Details Story Dictionary 始 commence Heisig's Woman . . . pedestal. Koohii #1 Many men, before they commence their relationship with the woman of their desires, place her on something of a pedestal, which often leads to disappointment later on. Koohii #2 If you want to commence a relationship, just put a woman on a pedestal and she´ll love ya forever. "window Details Story Dictionary 窓 window My Story [Hole {穴} + ム + Heart] Koohii #1 The top primitive is similar to hole (#1316). A window is a hole (#1316) in your house that you occassionally sit next to while leaning on your ELBOW and gazing out, a picture of a lonely HEARTedness. Koohii #2 Anna stood inside the house 宀 on her human legs 儿 enjoying some private 厶 time, looking out the window and communing with the feelings that were in her heart 心. The first five strokes are actually 穴、あな, ""hole,"" introduced later. 窓、まど, window; 窓口、まどぐち, ticket window; 車窓、しゃそう, car window. Primitives window, hole, house, human legs, elbow, heart 窓口(まどぐち): ticket window 窓(まど): window Kunyomi: まど、てんまど、けむだし Onyomi: ソウ、ス Lesson: 23 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 窓 (まど)"	"window 窓 画数11 811 Details Story Dictionary 窓 window My Story [Hole {穴} + ム + Heart] Koohii #1 The top primitive is similar to hole (#1316). method Details Story Dictionary 法 method Heisig's Water . . . gone. Koohii #1 This kanji shows up in a lot of words related to the legal process. Try this image: using a very outdated judicial method, the people of Salem dunked accused witches in the water until they were all gone. Koohii #2 There already was a system (#418) for butchering cows, a technique (#421) for turning smoke into flowers - why can´t there be a method of about the same relevance for making water gone? Evaporation anyone? meeting Details Story Dictionary 会 meeting Heisig's Meeting . . . wall. This is the full character for meeting, from which the abbreviated primitive that we met back in lesson 12 gets its name. Koohii #1 At the local company they have a very gory way of getting rid of incompetent personnel : they arrange a business meeting in a very special room where the walls are ... meeting. Not surprisingly the boss is never present at these meetings, he´s the one who pushes the button that sets the walls in motion. Koohii #2 The only thing created in most meetings is a lot of hot air. Imagine a cloud of it rising to the roof. Primitives meeting, meeting, one, wall, umbrella, rising cloud, two, elbow, wall 会(え): understanding 会(かい): meeting, assembly, party, association, club 会見(かいけん): interview, audience 会談(かいだん): conversation, conference, discussion, interview 協会(きょうかい): association, society, organization 再会(さいかい): another meeting, meeting again, reunion 座談会(ざだんかい): symposium, round-table discussion 総会(そうかい): general meeting 出会う(であう): to meet by chance, to come across, to happen to encounter, to hold a rendezvous, to have a date 面会(めんかい): interview 宴会(えんかい): party, banquet 会員(かいいん): member, the membership 開会(かいかい): opening of a meeting 会館(かいかん): meeting hall, assembly hall 会計(かいけい): account, finance, accountant, treasurer, paymaster, reckoning, bill 会合(かいごう): meeting, assembly 学会(がっかい): scientific society, academic meeting 議会(ぎかい): Diet, congress, parliament 国会(こっかい): National Diet, parliament, congress 司会(しかい): chairmanship 社会科学(しゃかいかがく): social science 集会(しゅうかい): meeting, assembly 大会(たいかい): convention, tournament, mass meeting, rally 出会い(であい): meeting, rendezvous, encounter 都会(とかい): city 閉会(へいかい): closure 会議(かいぎ): meeting 会場(かいじょう): the place of meeting 会話(かいわ): conversation 機会(きかい): opportunity, chance 教会(きょうかい): church 社会(しゃかい): society 展覧会(てんらんかい): exhibition 会う(あう): to meet, to interview 会社(かいしゃ): company, corporation Kunyomi: あ.う、あ.わせる、あつ.まる Onyomi: カイ、エ Lesson: 23 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds: 会話 (かいわ), 会計 (かいけい), 社会 (しゃかい), 会う (あ.う)	meeting 会 画数6 814 Details Story Dictionary 会 meeting Heisig's Meeting . . . wall. climax Details Story Dictionary 至 climax Heisig's Wall . . . soil. The key word allows for the full variety of connotations: to peak, to arrive at the end, and the like. Koohii #1 Sexual climaxes don´t always happen on the bed; they sometimes happen against a wall or on the ground! Koohii #2 The climax of the Berlin Wall affair was the tearing of it to ground. "doth Details Story Dictionary 致 doth Heisig's The archaic English form for ""does"" indicates a humble form of the verb ""to do."" It is made up of climax and taskmaster. Koohii #1 To reach climax I doth the bidding of my dominatrix taskmaster. Koohii #2 This character is used in two very high-frequency words: ""you are welcome"" (どう致しまして) and the honorific form of onegaishimasu (お願い致します; おねがいいたします). Can´t you just picture this ridiculously polite S&M picture? A businessman, who DOTH the bidding of his taskmistress, is climaxing and yelling out ""お願い致します"" while she whips and says ""どう致しまして"". (This kanji also means ""to bring about"" and ""do humbly"", which is perfect for this image). Primitives doth, climax, wall, one, ceiling, elbow, soil, dirt, ground, taskmaster 雅致(がち): artistry, good taste, elegance, grace 合致(がっち): agreement, concurrence, conforming to 一致(いっち): coincidence, agreement, union, match, conformity, consistency, cooperation 致す(いたす): do Kunyomi: いた.す Onyomi: チ Lesson: 23 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 致す (いた.す)"	"doth 致 画数10 818 Details Story Dictionary 致 doth Heisig's The archaic English form for ""does"" indicates a humble form of the verb ""to do."" It is made up of climax and taskmaster. Koohii #1 To reach climax I doth the bidding of my dominatrix taskmaster. Koohii #2 This character is used in two very high-frequency words: ""you are welcome"" (どう致しまして) and the honorific form of onegaishimasu (お願い致します; おねがいいたします). Can´t you just picture this ridiculously polite S&M picture? A businessman, who DOTH the bidding of his taskmistress, is climaxing and yelling out ""お願い致します"" while she whips and says ""どう致しまして"". (This kanji also means ""to bring about"" and ""do humbly"", which is perfect for this image). Primitives doth, climax, wall, one, ceiling, elbow, soil, dirt, ground, taskmaster 雅致(がち): artistry, good taste, elegance, grace 合致(がっち): agreement, concurrence, conforming to 一致(いっち): coincidence, agreement, union, match, conformity, consistency, cooperation 致す(いたす): do Kunyomi: いた.す Onyomi: チ Lesson: 23 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 致す (いた.す)"
mutually Details Story Dictionary 互 mutually Heisig's When you draw this character think of linking two walls together, one right side up and the other upside down. Koohii #1 The 69 position allows both parties to mutually give themselves pleasure. Koohii #2 If you can combined your walls with another house´s walls, both houses would mutually benefit, by the increase in size.... abandon Details Story Dictionary 棄 abandon Heisig's Infant . . . buckle (See frame 444) . . . tree. Koohii #1 Think of a really loud and annoying baby, you want to abandon it but it keeps coming back...so you take of your belt by the buckle, and buckle the baby to a tree! Koohii #2 As in sash (#415), I treat the one mountain in the middle to mean Mt. Fuji (Japan´s ichiban mountain). Now we see an infant being abandoned on top of Mt. Fuji well above the tree line to die of exposure. Primitives abandon, infant, toddler, top hat, elbow, buckle, tree, wood 棄権(きけん): abstain from voting, renunciation of a right 廃棄(はいき): annullment, disposal, abandon, scrap, discarding, repeal 破棄(はき): revocation, annulment, breaking (e.g. treaty) 放棄(ほうき): abandonment, renunciation, abdication (responsibility right) 棄てる(すてる): throw away, cast aside, abandon, resign Kunyomi: す.てる Onyomi: キ Lesson: 23 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	abandon 棄 画数13 820 Details Story Dictionary 棄 abandon Heisig's Infant . . . buckle (See frame 444) . . . tree. Koohii #1 Think of a really loud and annoying baby, you want to abandon it but it keeps coming back...so you take of your belt by the buckle, and buckle the baby to a tree! Fuji well above the tree line to die of exposure. bring up Details Story Dictionary 育 bring up My Story Bring up your *infant* well, so that he doesn't follow any *moon* cults [An infant is simply *MUlan* wearing a *beret*] Koohii #1 Bringing up your offspring means raising them from infant until they are meat ready to be harvested. What, cannibalism is in poor taste? Forget I ever brought it up. But bring up will forver be infant meat to me. I want my baby back baby back baby back ribs! Koohii #2 I will bring up my infants to eat meat. I´ll not endure any vegetarian children in my house! Primitives bring up, infant, toddler, top hat, elbow, moon, month, flesh, part of the body 育成(いくせい): rearing, training, nurture, cultivation, promotion 飼育(しいく): breeding, raising, rearing 生育(せいいく): growth, development, breeding 育ち(そだち): breeding, growth 発育(はついく): (physical) growth, development 保育(ほいく): nursing, nurturing, rearing, lactation, suckling 育児(いくじ): childcare, nursing, upbringing 育つ(そだつ): bring up, be brought up, grow (up) 体育(たいいく): physical education, gymnastics, athletics 教育(きょういく): education 育てる(そだてる): bring up Kunyomi: そだ.つ、そだ.ち、そだ.てる、はぐく.む Onyomi: イク Lesson: 23 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 育つ (そだ.つ), 育てる (そだ.てる)	bring up 育 画数8 821 Details Story Dictionary 育 bring up My Story Bring up your *infant* well, so that he doesn't follow any *moon* cults [An infant is simply *MUlan* wearing a *beret*] Koohii #1 Bringing up your offspring means raising them from infant until they are meat ready to be harvested. "fill up / allot Details Story Dictionary 充 fill up / allot My Story [Infant + Human Legs] An *infant* will only be Allotted 2 walking *legs* by the human genome. Koohii #1 Scene at the baby factory: Manager: ""Good news! Your infant has been allotted human legs"". Parent to be: ""Thanks a lot!"". Koohii #2 In China, to prevent too many human legs walking around, couples are alloted only one infant…　RTK2:　ジュウ　補充　ほじゅう(supplement)…　Semi-Pure Group:　銃762　(ﾄｳ): 統1347. gun Details Story Dictionary 銃 gun Heisig's Metal . . . allot. Koohii #1 Everyone is allotted a metal gun (US constitution according to the NRA). Koohii #2 What is a gun but a device for allotting pieces of metal? One for you - BANG!...One for you - BANG!...One for you - BANG!...One for you - BANG!...etc. Primitives gun, metal, gold, allot, infant, toddler, top hat, elbow, human legs 銃(つつ): gun 銃(じゅう): gun Kunyomi: つつ Onyomi: ジュウ Lesson: 23 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	gun 銃 画数14 824 Details Story Dictionary 銃 gun Heisig's Metal . . . allot. current Details Story Dictionary 流 current My Story Water + infant + river The *water* carried the *infant* along the *river's* current Koohii #1 INFANT Moses placed in the WATER and sent down the current of the STREAM. Koohii #2 A water-breathing infant (genetically modified?) is caught in a flood, and drifts with the current, apparently enjoying himself in the process. Primitives current, water, water droplets, water pistol, lifebelt, infant, toddler, top hat, elbow, stream, flood 海流(かいりゅう): ocean current 気流(きりゅう): atmospheric current 流し(ながし): sink 流れる(ながれる): stream, flow, be washed away, run (ink) 流行(はやり): fashionable, fad, in vogue, prevailing 流(りゅう): styleof, method of, manner of 流通(りゅうつう): circulation of money or goods, flow of water or air, distribution 一流(いちりゅう): foremost, top-notch, unique 交流(こうりゅう): alternating current, intercourse, (cultural) exchange, intermingling 合流(ごうりゅう): confluence, union, linking up, merge 流石(さすが): clever, adept, good, expectations, as one would expect 直流(ちょくりゅう): direct current 電流(でんりゅう): electric current 流す(ながす): drain, float, shed (blood, tears) 流れ(ながれ): stream, current 流行る(はやる): flourish, thrive, be popular, come into fashion 流域(りゅういき): (river) basin 流行(りゅうこう): fashionable, fad, in vogue, prevailing Kunyomi: なが.れる、なが.れ、なが.す、-なが.す Onyomi: リュウ、ル Lesson: 23 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 流行 (りゅうこう), 流動 (りゅうどう), 電流 (でんりゅう), 流す (なが.す), 流れる (なが.れる)	current 流 画数10 826 Details Story Dictionary 流 current My Story Water + infant + river The *water* carried the *infant* along the *river's* current Koohii #1 INFANT Moses placed in the WATER and sent down the current of the STREAM. license Details Story Dictionary 允 license Heisig's Elbow . . . human legs. Koohii #1 In some Asian kung-fu version of James Bond, the main protagonist has a “License To Kill” with his deadly elbows and human legs. His suit is always stained of red blood at the elbows and lower legs (this to help create an image that distinguish the two elements). Koohii #2 A midget driver trying to pass the road test to get their driver´s license. Their elbows are too short to turn the wheel and their legs are too short to reach the gas and breaks. Primitives license, elbow, human legs Kunyomi: じょう、まこと.に、ゆるす Onyomi: イン Lesson: 23 Jouyou: Names JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	license 允 画数4 827 Details Story Dictionary 允 license Heisig's Elbow . . . human legs. tempt Details Story Dictionary 唆 tempt Heisig's Mouth . . . license . . . walking legs. Koohii #1 I named the right part legal prostitute has it represents a walker [walking legs] with the license. It´s easy to imagine a legal prostitute tempting a man with her mouth. Koohii #2 Prostitutes in Amsterdam have a license to show off their walking legs and tempt customers with their mouths. Primitives tempt, mouth, streetwalker, Ministry of silly walks, John Cleese, license, elbow, human legs, walking legs Kunyomi: そそのか.す Onyomi: サ Lesson: 23 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 唆す (そそのか.す)	tempt 唆 画数10 828 Details Story Dictionary 唆 tempt Heisig's Mouth . . . license . . . walking legs. exit Details Story Dictionary 出 exit Heisig's The kanji for exit pictures a series of mountain peaks coming out of the earth. Learn it together with the following frame. Koohii #1 Suddenly, a cactus comes out of the ground with a sign that reads: exit. Now you can leave the desert! (Note: giving this primitive the meaning ´cactus´ can be useful later). Koohii #2 The exit lays between these two mountains. Primitives exit 家出(いえで): running away from home, leaving home 売り出し(うりだし): (bargain) sale 売り出す(うりだす): to put on sale, to market, to become popular 演出(えんしゅつ): production (e.g. play), direction 追い出す(おいだす): to expel, to drive out お出でになる(おいでになる): to be お目出度う(おめでとう): (ateji) (int) (uk) Congratulations!, an auspicious occasion! 差し出す(さしだす): to present, to submit, to tender, to hold out 産出(さんしゅつ): yield, produce 出演(しゅつえん): performance, stage appearance 出血(しゅっけつ): bleeding, haemorrhage 出産(しゅっさん): (child)birth, delivery, production (of goods) 出社(しゅっしゃ): arrival (in a country at work etc.) 出生(しゅっしょう): birth 出世(しゅっせ): promotion, successful career, eminence 出題(しゅつだい): proposing a question 出動(しゅつどう): sailing, marching, going out 出費(しゅっぴ): expenses, disbursements 出品(しゅっぴん): exhibit, display 進出(しんしゅつ): advance, step forward 脱出(だっしゅつ): escape 出会う(であう): to meet by chance, to come across, to happen to encounter, to hold a rendezvous, to have a date 出合う(であう): to meet by chance, to come across, to happen to encounter, to hold a rendezvous, to have a date 出入り口(でいりぐち): exit and entrance 出来物(できもの): able man, tumour, growth, boil, ulcer, abcess, rash, pimple 出切る(できる): to be out of, to have no more at hand 出くわす(でくわす): to happen to meet, to come across 出鱈目(でたらめ): irresponsible utterance, nonsense, nonsensical, random, haphazard, unsystematic 出直し(でなおし): adjustment, touch up 投げ出す(なげだす): to throw down, to abandon, to sacrifice, to throw out 逃げ出す(にげだす): to run away, to escape from 抜け出す(ぬけだす): to slip out, to sneak away, to excel 引き出す(ひきだす): to pull out, to take out, to draw out, to withdraw 振り出し(ふりだし): outset, starting point, drawing or issuing (draft) 噴出(ふんしゅつ): spewing, gushing, spouting, eruption, effusion 放出(ほうしゅつ): release, emit 放り出す(ほうりだす): to throw out, to fire, to expel, to give up, to abandon, to neglect 申出(もうしで): proposal, request, claim, report, notice 申し出る(もうしでる): to report to, to tell, to suggest, to submit, to request, to make an offer, to come forward with information 言い出す(いいだす): start talking, propose, suggest, break the ice お出掛け(おでかけ): about to start out, just about to leave or go out 思い出(おもいで): memories, recollections, reminiscence 外出(がいしゅつ): outing, going out 貸し出し(かしだし): lending, loaning 支出(ししゅつ): expenditure, expenses 出勤(しゅっきん): going to work, at work 出身(しゅっしん): person´s place of origin, institution from which one graduated, director in charge of employee relations 出張(しゅっちょう): official tour, business trip 出版(しゅっぱん): publication 出合い(であい): an encounter 出会い(であい): meeting, rendezvous, encounter 提出(ていしゅつ): presentation, submission, filing 出入り(でいり): in and out, coming and going, free association, income and expenditure, debits and credit 出掛ける(でかける): depart, set out, start, be going out 出来上がり(できあがり): finish, completion, ready, made for, cut out 出来上がる(できあがる): be finished, be ready, by definition, be very drunk 出来事(できごと): incident, affair, happening, event 出来るだけ(できるだけ): if at all possible 出迎え(でむかえ): meeting, reception 出迎える(でむかえる): to meet, to greet 飛び出す(とびだす): jump out, rush out, fly out, appear suddenly, protrude, project 取り出す(とりだす): take out, produce, pick out 引出す(ひきだす): pull out, take out, draw out, withdraw 日の出(ひので): sunrise 見出し(みだし): heading, caption, subtitle, index 呼び出す(よびだす): summon, call (e.g. via telephone) 思い出す(おもいだす): recall, remember 出席(しゅっせき): attend 出発(しゅっぱつ): depart 引き出し(ひきだし): drawer 輸出(ゆしゅつ): export 出す(だす): take out, put out, send 出かける(でかける): depart, go out (e.g. on an excursion or outing), set out, start 出口(でぐち): exit, gateway, way out, outlet, leak, vent 出る(でる): appear, come forth, leave Kunyomi: で.る、-で、だ.す、-だ.す、い.でる、い.だす Onyomi: シュツ、スイ Lesson: 24 Jouyou: 1 JLPT Level: 5 Compounds: 出入 (しゅつにゅう), 出現 (しゅつげん), 提出 (ていしゅつ), 出す (だ.す), 出る (で.る)	exit 出 画数5 829 Details Story Dictionary 出 exit Heisig's take out, put out, send 出かける(でかける): depart, go out (e.g. on an excursion or outing), set out, start 出口(でぐち): exit, gateway, way out, outlet, leak, vent 出る(でる): appear, come forth, leave Kunyomi: で.る、-で、だ.す、-だ.す、い.でる、い.だす Onyomi: シュツ、スイ Lesson: 24 Jouyou: 1 JLPT Level: 5 Compounds: 出入 (しゅつにゅう), 出現 (しゅつげん), 提出 (ていしゅつ), 出す (だ.す), 出る (で.る)
mountain Details Story Dictionary 山 mountain Heisig's Note the clearer outline of a triangular mountain here. Koohii #1 Pictograph, see book. * As a primitive this element appears equally as well at the top or bottom of the kanjis (besides appearing to the left). Since a mountain often brings to mind towering peaks, I will consider it implied that the element is placed at the top of the kanji. When this primitive appears at the bottom, I will arrange my story in a way that other elements are said to be at the very top of the mountain (see FRAME 775 for an example). Koohii #2 YOU CAN´T POSSIBLY NEED A MNEMONIC FOR THIS!!!! Primitives mountain 鉱山(こうざん): mine (ore) 山岳(さんがく): mountains 山腹(さんぷく): hillside, mountainside 山脈(さんみゃく): mountain range 不山戯る(ふざける): to romp, to gambol, to frolic, to joke, to make fun of, to flirt 火山(かざん): volcano 山林(さんりん): mountain forest, mountains and forest 登山(とざん): mountain climbing 山(やま): mountain, pile, heap, climax, critical point Kunyomi: やま Onyomi: サン、セン Lesson: 24 Jouyou: 1 JLPT Level: 5 Compounds: 山 (やま)	mountain 山 画数3 830 Details Story Dictionary 山 mountain Heisig's Note the clearer outline of a triangular mountain here. bungling Details Story Dictionary 拙 bungling Heisig's Fingers . . . exit. Koohii #1 With fingers fumbling around trying to get the key in the door so he could exit, the bungling husband woke his wife as he tried to leave for a rendezvous with his mistress. Koohii #2 Here we see mountain rocks rolling down the mountain, gathering into a single monstrous boulder crushing everything in its path. Think snowball effect, even if it wouldn´t work with rocks. branch off Details Story Dictionary 岐 branch off Heisig's Mountains . . . branch. Koohii #1 On the left, there are three mountains. The road branches off to each of them. (Note: This kanji is mostly used for branches in the road). Koohii #2 In a lot of Super Nintendo-era RPGs, there are mountain levels to get through. You view them from overhead, so you can see a mazelike path with many branches. Picture your sprite characters at one such fork in the mountain path, as it branches off in two directions. Primitives branch off, mountain, branch, ten, needle, crotch Kunyomi: Onyomi: キ、ギ Lesson: 24 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	branch off 岐 画数7 834 Details Story Dictionary 岐 branch off Heisig's Mountains . . . branch. "mountain pass Details Story Dictionary 峠 mountain pass Heisig's Mountain . . . above . . . below. Koohii #1 Heisig mentions at kanjiclinic.com that he wishes he´d chosen mountain pass for this keyword as it´s closer to what the word means. If we do this, the kanji makes complete sense because a mountain pass is just below the mountain top. Koohii #2 To the north of Lorien lies the Misty Mountains, and below their towering peaks are the Mines of Moria. The Fellowship of the Ring first tried for the MOUNTAIN PASS that goes above, but were halted by the wizardry of Saruman at Caradhras, and so are forced to take the MOUNTAIN PASS that goes below, through the mountain - a path long feared by Gandalf for the ancient evil that lurks there. Note : the kanji does in fact refer to a ""mountain pass"". Primitives mountain peak, mountain, above, below 峠(とうげ): ridge, (mountain) pass, difficult part Kunyomi: とうげ Onyomi: Lesson: 24 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 峠 (とうげ)"	"mountain pass 峠 画数9 835 Details Story Dictionary 峠 mountain pass Heisig's Mountain . . . above . . . below. Koohii #1 To maintain secrecy, secret societies invariably have to house themselves in the moutains. Koohii #2 To maintain secrecy, secret societies invariably have to house themselves on top of the moutains. (Slight tweak of chamcham´s story, using fuaburisa´s idea for remembering where to put the mountain primitive.). Koohii #2 Winds are gathering at the base of the mountain (note the hint to primitive placement), going up, and turning into a huge mountain storm.
