promontory Details Story Dictionary 崎 promontory Heisig's Mountain . . . strange. Hint: you might save yourself the trouble of a story here simply by recalling the kanji for cape (Frame 164) and toying around with the differing images suggested by the key words promontory and cape. Koohii #1 This is “Cape Strange” from FRAME 153, only with mountain in place of soil. Interestingly, there is also 碕 which is made of the primitives stone and strange. The three kanjis 碕, 埼 and 崎 all have the same meanings and pronunciations. They have very little uses other than names, for which promontory is the clear winner with over 2300 uses in place and people names, while the other two kanjis account for less than 200 names. Koohii #2 A promontory is a small, strange mountain that juts out into the sea. Primitives promontory, mountain, strange, large, St. Bernard, can, street, nail, spike, mouth Kunyomi: さき、さい、みさき Onyomi: キ Lesson: 24 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 崎 (さき)	promontory 崎 画数11 840 Details Story Dictionary 崎 promontory Heisig's Mountain . . . strange. Hint: you might save yourself the trouble of a story here simply by recalling the kanji for cape (Frame 164) and toying around with the differing images suggested by the key words promontory and cape. Koohii #1 This is “Cape Strange” from FRAME 153, only with mountain in place of soil. Interestingly, there is also 碕 which is made of the primitives stone and strange. The three kanjis 碕, 埼 and 崎 all have the same meanings and pronunciations. They have very little uses other than names, for which promontory is the clear winner with over 2300 uses in place and people names, while the other two kanjis account for less than 200 names. Koohii #2 A promontory is a small, strange mountain that juts out into the sea. "bluffs Details Story Dictionary 崖 bluffs Heisig's Mountain . . . cliff . . . ivy. Koohii #1 Standing at the base of the bluffs I announce, ""I´m going to climb those ivy-covered cliffs, and then the mountain on top of them."" My friends don´t believe me, ""He bluffs!"" they say. Koohii #2 The ivy-covered cliff we saw on the horizon (#157) ... the sheer beauty of the mountain that overlooks these bluffs is enough to make you want to swim for shore yourself! "enter Details Story Dictionary 入 enter Heisig's This character is meant to be a picture of someone walking leftwards, putting one leg forward in order to enter someplace. Since the ""in"" side of a character is the left, it should be easy to remember the writing of this character. * As a primitive, the meaning of the key word is expanded to include: to go in, to put in, to come in, and the like. It generally appears atop its relative primitive, where, unlike the element for umbrella, the two strokes do not touch each other, making it virtually the same as the kanji for eight. When it appears in any other position, however, it retains its original form. Koohii #1 Pictograph, see book. * As a primitive, using the image of going through a door, even one that stands alone with the frame and no wall around, helps flesh out the primitive “enter”. Koohii #2 Person enters stage left…　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　RTK2:　ニュウ　入院　にゅういん(admittance into a hospital). Primitives enter 入口(いりくち): entrance, gate, approach, mouth 入る(いる): to get in, to go in, to come in, to flow into, to set, to set in 受け入れ(うけいれ): receiving, acceptance 受け入れる(うけいれる): to accept, to receive 恐れ入る(おそれいる): to be filled with awe, to feel small, to be amazed, to be surprised, to be disconcerted, to be sorry, to be grateful, to be defeated, to confess guilt 介入(かいにゅう): intervention 加入(かにゅう): becoming a member, joining, entry, admission, subscription, affiliation, adherence, signing 購入(こうにゅう): purchase, buy 仕入れる(しいれる): to lay in stock, to replenish stock, to procure 新入生(しんにゅうせい): freshman, first-year student 潜入(せんにゅう): infiltration, sneaking in 出入り口(でいりぐち): exit and entrance 投入(とうにゅう): throw, investment, making (an electrical circuit) 導入(どうにゅう): introduction, bringing in, leading in 入手(にゅうしゅ): obtaining, coming to hand 入賞(にゅうしょう): winning a prize or place (in a contest) 入浴(にゅうよく): bathe, bathing 納入(のうにゅう): payment, supply 申し入れる(もうしいれる): to propose, to suggest 入れ物(いれもの): container, case, receptacle 気に入る(きにいる): be pleased with, to suit 記入(きにゅう): entry, filling in of forms 四捨五入(ししゃごにゅう): rounding up (especially fractions) 収入(しゅうにゅう): income, receipts, revenue 侵入(しんにゅう): penetration, invasion, raid, aggression, trespass 出入り(でいり): in and out, coming and going, free association, income and expenditure, debits and credit 手入れ(ていれ): repairs, maintenance 取り入れる(とりいれる): harvest, take in, adopt 入社(にゅうしゃ): entry to a company 入場(にゅうじょう): entrance, admission, entering 日の入り(ひのいり): sunset 輸入(ゆにゅう): importation, import, introduction 押し入れ(おしいれ): closet 入院(にゅういん): enter hospital 入学(にゅうがく): enter a school 入口(いりぐち): entrance, gate, approach, mouth 入れる(いれる): put in, take in, bring in, let in, admit, introduce, usher in, insert, employ, listen to, tolerate, comprehend, include, pay (interest), cast (votes) 入る(はいる): enter, break into, join, enroll, contain, hold, accommodate, have (an income of) Kunyomi: い.る、-い.る、-い.り、い.れる、-い.れ、はい.る Onyomi: ニュウ、ジュ Lesson: 24 Jouyou: 1 JLPT Level: 5 Compounds: 入る (い.る), 入れる (い.れる), 入る (はい.る)"	"enter 入 画数2 842 Details Story Dictionary 入 enter Heisig's This character is meant to be a picture of someone When it appears in any other position, however, it retains its original form. 入院(にゅういん): enter hospital 入学(にゅうがく): enter a school 入口(いりぐち): entrance, gate, approach, mouth 入れる(いれる): put in, take in, bring in, let in, admit, introduce, usher in, insert, employ, listen to, tolerate, comprehend, include, pay (interest), cast (votes) 入る(はいる): enter, break into, join, enroll, contain, hold, accommodate, have (an income of) Kunyomi: い.る、-い.る、-い.り、い.れる、-い.れ、はい.る Onyomi: ニュウ、ジュ Lesson: 24 Jouyou: 1 JLPT Level: 5 Compounds: 入る (い.る), 入れる (い.れる), 入る (はい.る)"
crowded Details Story Dictionary 込 crowded Heisig's Enter . . . road. Koohii #1 During a traffic jam it is impossible to get your car to enter the roadway as it is crowded with cars. Think of a grid lock so bad cars are litterally scraping up against each other like people on a Japanese train during rush hour. Koohii #2 Everybody tries to enter the road during rush hour. That´s why it´s so crowded. Primitives crowded, enter, road 意気込む(いきごむ): to be enthusiastic about 打ち込む(うちこむ): to drive in (e.g. nail stake), to devote oneself to, to shoot into, to smash, to throw into, to cast into 埋め込む(うめこむ): to bury 追い込む(おいこむ): to herd, to corner, to drive 押し込む(おしこむ): to push into, to crowd into 落ち込む(おちこむ): to fall into, to feel down (sad) 組み込む(くみこむ): to insert, to include, to cut in (printing) 込める(こめる): to include, to put into 飲み込む(のみこむ): to gulp down, to swallow deeply, to understand, to take in, to catch on to, to learn, to digest 乗り込む(のりこむ): to board, to embark on, to get into (a car), to ship (passengers), to man (a ship), to help (someone) into, to march into, to enter 放り込む(ほうりこむ): to throw into 見込み(みこみ): hope, prospects, expectation 申し込み(もうしこみ): application, entry, request, subscription, offer, proposal, overture, challenge 割り込む(わりこむ): to cut in, to thrust oneself into, to wedge oneself in, to muscle in on, to interrupt, to disturb 思い込む(おもいこむ): be under impression that, be convinced that, imagine that, set one´s heart on, be bent on 突っ込む(つっこむ): thrust something into something, plunge into, go into deeply, meddle, interfere 溶け込む(とけこむ): melt into 飛び込む(とびこむ): jump in, leap in, plunge into, dive 払い込む(はらいこむ): deposit, pay in 引っ込む(ひっこむ): draw back, sink, cave in 人込み(ひとごみ): crowd of people 申し込む(もうしこむ): apply for, propose, offer, challenge, request 込む(こむ): be crowded Kunyomi: こ.み、 -こ.み、 -こ.む、 こ.む、 こ.める Onyomi: Lesson: 24 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 込む (こ.む), 込める (こ.める)	crowded 込 画数5 843 Details Story Dictionary 込 crowded Heisig's Enter . . . road. "part Details Story Dictionary 分 part Heisig's Go in . . . dagger. Koohii #1 When something is entered by a dagger, it ends up being cut in several parts. Koohii #2 (This kanji also has the meanings of ""understand"" and ""minute""). It´s important to understand that were you to enter an hour with a dagger and cut it into parts, those parts would be minutes. Primitives part, eight, sword, dagger 一部分(いちぶぶん): a part 十分(じっぷん): 10 minutes 処分(しょぶん): disposal, dealing, punishment 随分(ずいぶん): pretty much, very much 多分(たぶん): perhaps, probably 手分け(てわけ): division of labour 取り分(とりわけ): especially, above all 配分(はいぶん): distribution, allotment 引き分け(ひきわけ): a draw (in competition), tie game 分(ふん): minute 分業(ぶんぎょう): division of labor, specialization, assembly-line production 分散(ぶんさん): dispersion, decentralization, variance (statistics) 分子(ぶんし): numerator, molecule 分担(ぶんたん): apportionment, sharing 分配(ぶんぱい): division, sharing 分母(ぶんぼ): denominator 分離(ぶんり): separation, detachment, segregation, isolation 分裂(ぶんれつ): split, division, break up 申し分(もうしぶん): objection, shortcomings 分かる(わかる): to be understood 幾分(いくぶん): somewhat 区分(くぶん): division, section, compartment, demarcation, (traffic) lane, classification, sorting 水分(すいぶん): moisture 成分(せいぶん): ingredient, component, composition 大分(だいぶ): very, many, a lot 大部分(だいぶぶん): most part, greater part, majority 大分(だいぶん): considerably, greatly, a lot 等分(とうぶん): division into equal parts 何分(なにぶん): anyway, please 引分け(ひきわけ): tie game, draw 分(ぶ): rate, part, percentage, one percent, thickness, odds, chance of winning, one-hundredth of a shaku, one-quarter of a ryou 分野(ぶんや): field, sphere, realm, division, branch 部分(ぶぶん): portion, section, part 分(ぶん): part, segment, share, ration, rate, degree, one´s lot, one´s status, relation, duty, kind, lot, in proportion to, just as much as 分解(ぶんかい): analysis, disassembly 分数(ぶんすう): (mathematics) fraction 分析(ぶんせき): analysis 分布(ぶんぷ): distribution 分量(ぶんりょう): amount, quantity 分類(ぶんるい): classification 身分(みぶん): social position, social status 養分(ようぶん): nourishment, nutrient 余分(よぶん): extra, excess, surplus 分かれる(わかれる): branch off, diverge from, fork, split, dispense, scatter, divide into 分ける(わける): divide, separate, make distinctions, differentiate (between) 気分(きぶん): mood 十分(じゅうぶん): enough 自分(じぶん): myself, oneself 半分(はんぶん): half 分る(わかる): be understood Kunyomi: わ.ける、わ.け、わ.かれる、わ.かる、わ.かつ Onyomi: ブン、フン、ブ Lesson: 24 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: Compounds: 分解 (ぶんかい), 自分 (じぶん), 水分 (すいぶん), 分別 (ふんべつ), 分銅 (ふんどう), 三十分 (さんじゅうふん), 分かつ (わ.かつ), 分かる (わ.かる), 分かれる (わ.かれる), 分ける (わ.ける)"	"part 分 画数4 844 Details Story Dictionary 分 part Heisig's Go in . . . dagger. poverty Details Story Dictionary 貧 poverty Heisig's Part . . . shells/money. Koohii #1 In the case of true poverty, not having money is only part of the problem. There are other components as well, like lack of education, class structuring, etc., but that doesn´t really matter. Just remember that the money is only part of it, not the whole. Koohii #2 Parting with your money will lead to poverty. Primitives poverty, part, eight, sword, dagger, shellfish, clam, oyster, eye, animal legs, eight 貧困(ひんこん): poverty, lack 貧弱(ひんじゃく): poor, meagre, insubstantial 貧乏(びんぼう): poverty, destitute, poor 貧しい(まずしい): poor, needy Kunyomi: まず.しい Onyomi: ヒン、ビン Lesson: 24 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 貧富 (ひんぷ), 貧弱 (ひんじゃく), 清貧 (せいひん), 貧しい (まず.しい)	poverty 貧 画数11 845 Details Story Dictionary 貧 poverty Heisig's Part . . . shells/money. public Details Story Dictionary 公 public Heisig's Come in . . . elbows. Use the key word in its adjectival sense, not as a noun. Koohii #1 I always open the doors to the public restrooms with my elbows because I don´t want to touch the door with my hands. Koohii #2 I always enter the doors to the public restrooms with my elbows because I don´t want to touch the door with my hands. Primitives public, eight, elbow 公(おおやけ): official, public, formal, open, governmental 公演(こうえん): public performance 公開(こうかい): presenting to the public 公然(こうぜん): open (e.g. secret), public, official 公団(こうだん): public corporation 公認(こうにん): official recognition, authorization, licence, accreditation 公募(こうぼ): public appeal, public contribution 公務(こうむ): official business, public business 公用(こうよう): government business, public use, public expense 公立(こうりつ): public (institution) 主人公(しゅじんこう): protagonist, main character, hero(ine) (of a story), head of household 公害(こうがい): public nuisance, pollution 公共(こうきょう): public, community, public service, society, communal 公式(こうしき): formula, formality, official 公衆(こうしゅう): the public 公正(こうせい): justice, fairness, impartiality 公表(こうひょう): official announcement, proclamation 公平(こうへい): fairness, impartial, justice 公務員(こうむいん): public servant 公園(こうえん): (public) park Kunyomi: おおやけ Onyomi: コウ、ク Lesson: 24 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds: 公 (おおやけ)	public 公 画数4 847 Details Story Dictionary 公 public Heisig's Come in . . . elbows. "pine tree Details Story Dictionary 松 pine tree Heisig's Tree . . . public. Koohii #1 Following up with the ""entering public restrooms"" story for the right-hand primitive: public restrooms always reek of pine tree scented disinfectant. Koohii #2 A pine tree is a public tree: they are frequently planted in public squares, in commemoration of the respect Conficius held for them. Primitives pine tree, tree, wood, public, eight, elbows 松(まつ): pine tree, highest (of a three-tier ranking system) Kunyomi: まつ Onyomi: ショウ Lesson: 24 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 松 (まつ)"	"pine tree 松 画数8 848 Details Story Dictionary 松 pine tree Heisig's Tree . . . public. venerable old man Details Story Dictionary 翁 venerable old man Heisig's Public . . . feathers. Koohii #1 The venerable old man is the public figure head of the Native American Village, answering all questions and solving all problems. The higher in rank you get in this tribe, the more feathers decorate you. Imagine this old man covered in beautiful feathers. Koohii #2 The venerable old man is using the public restroom in the park where he feeds the pigeons. But, alas, there is no toilet paper! So, he´s caught a pigeon and is using it to wipe his bottom. (note the feathers on the bottom of the kanji, this helps remember placement). Can you see the feathers flying everywhere? Primitives venerable old man, public, eight, elbows, feathers, wings Kunyomi: おきな Onyomi: オウ Lesson: 24 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	venerable old man 翁 画数10 849 Details Story Dictionary 翁 venerable old man Heisig's Public . . . feathers. sue Details Story Dictionary 訟 sue Heisig's Words . . . public. Koohii #1 Take care what words you say in public lest you be sued. Koohii #2 [+radical_tyro] Socrates was giving a speech in public. Things were going rather well, until his robe opened a bit and people saw his, well, not-public area. He was promptly sued for public indecency. Certain things shouldn´t be made public in public, you know? Primitives sue, say, words, keitai, mouth, public, eight, elbows 訴訟(そしょう): litigation, lawsuit Kunyomi: Onyomi: ショウ Lesson: 24 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	sue 訟 画数11 850 Details Story Dictionary 訟 sue Heisig's Words . . . public. valley Details Story Dictionary 谷 valley Heisig's Go in . . . an umbrella . . . a mouth. Because of space restrictions, the element for go in is shortened in this character. If you stand on your head and look at this kanji, the image of a valley stands out more clearly: the mouth of the river whose water flows down at the intersection of the two mountains, with the final two strokes adding the element of perspective. Now get back on your feet again and see if the image still remains clear. If not, then return to the primitives and make a story in the usual way. Koohii #1 This could be seen as a very accurate pictograph of another type of valley: a valley mouth open under the umbrella of inner labia, with the outer labia parted above. There are even more connections to be made among the primitive keywords and the visuals, but i will enter no further... Koohii #2 Think of the classic anime 風の谷のナウシカ (Nausicaa of the Valley of the Wind). We see Nausicaa entering the valley mouth gliding on an umbrella. Primitives valley, eight, umbrella, mouth 谷(たに): valley Kunyomi: たに、きわ.まる Onyomi: コク Lesson: 24 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 谷 (たに)	valley 谷 画数7 851 Details Story Dictionary 谷 valley Heisig's Go in . . . an umbrella . . . a mouth. Because of space restrictions, the element for go in is shortened in this character. If you stand on your head and look at this kanji, the image of a valley stands out more clearly: the mouth of the river whose water flows down at the intersection of the two mountains, with the final two strokes adding the element of perspective. Now get back on your feet again and see if the image still remains clear. If not, then return to the primitives and make a story in the usual way. bathe Details Story Dictionary 浴 bathe Heisig's Water . . . valley. Koohii #1 This story is quite lascivious, sorry... Now, imagine you are at a 混浴　（こんよく） [two kanjis we now know] Onsen (温泉), and you are watching a woman bathe. Just picture the water dripping down her cleavage (that valley in between her breasts). Note: cleavage in Japanese is 谷間. Koohii #2 The mountain man uses the water from the valley to bathe. Primitives bathe, water, water droplets, water pistol, valley, eight, umbrella, mouth 浴びる(あびる): bathe, take a shower, bask in the sun 入浴(にゅうよく): bathe, bathing 浴室(よくしつ): bathroom, bath 海水浴(かいすいよく): sea bathing, seawater bath 浴衣(ゆかた): bathrobe, informal summer kimono Kunyomi: あ.びる、あ.びせる Onyomi: ヨク Lesson: 24 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 浴びせる (あ.びせる), 浴びる (あ.びる)	bathe 浴 画数10 852 Details Story Dictionary 浴 bathe Heisig's Water . . . valley. Koohii #1 This story is quite lascivious, sorry... Now, imagine you are at a 混浴　（こんよく） [two kanjis we now know] Onsen (温泉), and you are watching a woman bathe. Just picture the water dripping down her cleavage (that valley in between her breasts). Note: cleavage in Japanese is 谷間. Koohii #2 The mountain man uses the water from the valley to bathe. Primitives bathe, water, water droplets, water pistol, valley, eight, umbrella, mouth 浴びる(あびる): bathe, take a shower, bask in the sun 入浴(にゅうよく): bathe, bathing 浴室(よくしつ): bathroom, bath 海水浴(かいすいよく): sea bathing, seawater bath 浴衣(ゆかた): bathrobe, informal summer kimono Kunyomi: あ.びる、あ.びせる Onyomi: ヨク Lesson: 24 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 浴びせる (あ.びせる), 浴びる (あ.びる)
"contain Details Story Dictionary 容 contain My Story My house is so big, it contains an entire valley! Koohii #1 Imagine a house big enough to contain an entire valley. might want to live there. And now imagine cleaning it. . . . Maybe not . . . Koohii #2 Biodome. Primitives contain, house, valley, eight, umbrella, mouth 寛容(かんよう): forbearance, tolerance, generosity 許容(きょよう): permission, pardon 収容(しゅうよう): accommodation, reception, seating, housing, custody, admission, entering (in a dictionary) 容易い(たやすい): easy, simple, light 形容詞(けいようし): ""true"" adjective 形容動詞(けいようどうし): adjectival noun, quasi-adjective 内容(ないよう): subject, contents, matter, substance, detail, import 美容(びよう): beauty of figure or form 容易(ようい): easy, simple, plain 容器(ようき): container, vessel 容積(ようせき): capacity, volume Kunyomi: い.れる Onyomi: ヨウ Lesson: 24 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds:"	"contain 容 画数10 853 Details Story Dictionary 容 contain My Story My house is so big, it contains an entire valley! melt Details Story Dictionary 溶 melt Heisig's Water . . . contain. Koohii #1 Think of what happens when the snow on top of the mountains melts: it turns into water and flows down onto the rooftops of all the houses in the valley below. Koohii #2 [melt; dissolve; thaw] An ice cube is melting, loosing the water it contained. Primitives melt, water, water droplets, water pistol, contents, contain, house, valley, animal legs, eight, umbrella, mouth 溶液(ようえき): solution (liquid) 溶かす(とかす): melt, dissolve 溶く(とく): dissolve (e.g. paint) 溶け込む(とけこむ): melt into 溶ける(とける): melt, thaw, fuse, dissolve 溶岩(ようがん): lava Kunyomi: と.ける、と.かす、と.く Onyomi: ヨウ Lesson: 24 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 溶かす (と.かす), 溶く (と.く), 溶ける (と.ける)	melt 溶 画数13 854 Details Story Dictionary 溶 melt Heisig's Water . . . contain. longing Details Story Dictionary 欲 longing Heisig's Valley . . . yawn. Be sure to keep the key word distinct from pining (Frame 683). Koohii #1 Guess what? Japanese has dirty words too! (In fact, a lot of them) A sexual story is NOT inappropriate here, as this kanji is very sexual, such as in 性欲; lust. As for a story: the lack of contact with a woman´s valley will leave a man LONGING for love. Koohii #2 The valley has something my life is lacking.... something I´ve been longing for.. peace and quiet. Primitives longing, valley, eight, umbrella, mouth, lack, yawn 意欲(いよく): will, desire, ambition 欲深い(よくふかい): greedy 欲望(よくぼう): desire, appetite 食欲(しょくよく): appetite (for food) 欲張り(よくばり): avarice, covetousness, greed 欲しい(ほしい): wanted, wished for, in need of, desired Kunyomi: ほっ.する、ほ.しい Onyomi: ヨク Lesson: 24 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 欲しい (ほ.しい), 欲する (ほっ.する)	longing 欲 画数11 855 Details Story Dictionary 欲 longing Heisig's Valley . . . yawn. "abundant Details Story Dictionary 裕 abundant Heisig's This character shows the typical cloak of valley folk, which, unlike the tailor-made, high-fashion overcoats of city folk, is loose-fitting and free-form. Hence the key word's meaning of abundant. Koohii #1 Again using the fact that cleavage in Japanese is called ""valley of the chest"": a woman with abundant cleavage tightly wraps up her bosom in a form-fitting cloak, but leaving her valley exposed. Another unforgettable image (thank you, thank you, I´ll be here all week). Koohii #2 Welcome to cloak-valley, the valley where everyone wears cloaks and every shop sells cloaks. Mnemonic : “cloaks are abundant in the valley”. Primitives abundant, cloak, valley, eight, umbrella, mouth 余裕(よゆう): surplus, composure, margin, room, time, allowance, scope, rope Kunyomi: Onyomi: ユウ Lesson: 24 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"	"abundant 裕 画数12 856 Details Story Dictionary 裕 abundant Heisig's This character shows the typical cloak of valley folk, which, unlike the tailor-made, high-fashion overcoats of city folk, is loose-fitting and free-form. Koohii #2 Lead -> Dental fillings -> Metal that enters the mouth to fill a hole in a tooth. run alongside Details Story Dictionary 沿 run alongside Heisig's Water . . . gully. The key word is meant to refer to things like rivers and railway tracks that run alongside something else. Koohii #1 Water in a gully runs alongside the path. Koohii #2 Picture one of those idiots that run alongside the bicyclists in the Tour de France trying to give them water. Watch as the cyclist shoves the person into a gully that runs alongside the road. Primitives run alongside, water, water droplets, water pistol, gully, eight, mouth 沿岸(えんがん): coast, shore 沿線(えんせん): along railway line 沿い(ぞい): along 沿う(そう): to run along, to follow Kunyomi: そ.う、-ぞ.い Onyomi: エン Lesson: 24 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 沿う (そ.う)	run alongside 沿 画数8 858 Details Story Dictionary 沿 run alongside Heisig's Water . . . gully. prize Details Story Dictionary 賞 prize Heisig's Outhouse . . . shellfish. Koohii #1 This is a bit silly.. or maybe not only a bit, but.. You know some foodstuffs (cereals come to mind) sometimes have prizes mixed in them? Well, in this case, the prize was a shell (money, remember) and you only notice in the outhouse... (see also secret (#904)). Koohii #2 As a prize for being the 1,000,000th person to use the restaurant´s outhouse, I got all the clams I could eat. party Details Story Dictionary 党 party Heisig's Think of this key word as referring to a political party, not a gala affair. Its elements: human legs . . . sticking out of an outhouse window. Koohii #1 Every major political party, if personified, would look like a giant outhouse walking around with human legs spewing out a constant stream of bullshit. Koohii #2 Every political party is full of shit. But nobody ever says how they get that way. Well, here´s your answer - a political party memer is in the outhouse, greedily chowing down on the contents inside. He´s grown so accustomed to the taste that he´s in all the way, and all you can see are his legs through the window. He´ll come inside later to the auditorium to make a speech and spew everything out. Primitives party, outhouse, small, little, crown, mouth, human legs 野党(やとう): opposition party 与党(よとう): government party, (ruling) party in power, government 政党(せいとう): (member of) political party 党(とう): party (political), faction, -ite Kunyomi: なかま、むら Onyomi: トウ Lesson: 25 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds:	party 党 画数10 860 Details Story Dictionary 党 party Heisig's Think of this key word as referring to a political party, not a gala affair. hall Details Story Dictionary 堂 hall Heisig's Outhouse . . . land. Koohii #1 There is a secret hall buried in the soil underneath the outhouse. Koohii #2 In most communities you will be hauled into city hall if you use the ground as an outhouse. usual Details Story Dictionary 常 usual Heisig's Outhouse . . . towel. Koohii #1 It´s usual to take your towel with you when you go to the outhouse at the onsen (hot springs bath in Japan) so everybody doesn´t see your stuff. Koohii #2 In the outhouse toilet you´d usually hope to find toilet paper to wipe your ass. If it´s already gone, which is usually the case, simply use the towel. Primitives usual, outhouse, small, little, crown, mouth, towel 正常(せいじょう): normalcy, normality, normal 通常(つうじょう): common, general, usually 平常(へいじょう): normal, usual 異常(いじょう): strangeness, abnormality, disorder 常識(じょうしき): common sense 常に(つねに): always, constantly 日常(にちじょう): ordinary, regular, everyday, usual 非常(ひじょう): emergency, extraordinary, unusual 非常に(ひじょうに): very, greatly Kunyomi: つね、とこ- Onyomi: ジョウ Lesson: 25 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 常 (つね), 常 (とこ)	usual 常 画数11 862 Details Story Dictionary 常 usual Heisig's Outhouse . . . towel. "skirt Details Story Dictionary 裳 skirt Heisig's The key word refers to an ancient skirt once used as part of a woman's costume. The primitives you have to work with are: outhouse . . . garment. Koohii #1 Compared to pants, a SKIRT is the GARMENT to be wearing when you want to use one of those Japanese toilets. It makes it so much easier: you just walk in the OUTHOUSE hike it up, and do your business. Koohii #2 Haven´t you ever noticed that the men / women signs on the front of outhouses are sometimes very similar? The silhouettes are usually the same, but one will decidedly be wearing a garment in the shape of a SKIRT. Also, we´ve already learned the kanji for ""woman"", so if the signs are only in kanji you have no right to wander in and claim ignorance, perv! Primitives skirt, outhouse, small, little, crown, mouth, cloth, clothes, clothing, garment Kunyomi: も、もすそ Onyomi: ショウ Lesson: 25 Jouyou: Names JLPT Level: Compounds:"	"skirt 裳 画数14 863 Details Story Dictionary 裳 skirt Heisig's The key word refers to an ancient skirt once used as part of a woman's costume. Koohii #2 Haven´t you ever noticed that the men / women signs on the front of outhouses are sometimes very similar? Also, we´ve already learned the kanji for ""woman"", so if the signs are only in kanji you have no right to wander in and claim ignorance, perv! Primitives skirt, outhouse, small, little, crown, mouth, cloth, clothes, clothing, garment Kunyomi: も、もすそ Onyomi: ショウ Lesson: 25 Jouyou: Names JLPT Level: Compounds:"
manipulate Details Story Dictionary 掌 manipulate Heisig's Outhouse . . . hand. Koohii #1 If you´re going to manipulate your body with your hand, then go do it in an outhouse, at least! Koohii #2 Instead of magazines, we keep a Rubiks Cube in the outhouse to manipulate with your hands while you do your business. "pelt Details Story Dictionary 皮 pelt Heisig's The simplest way to remember this character is to see it as built up from that for branch. The first stroke can then stand for something ""hanging"" down from the branch, namely its bark or pelt. The barb at the end of the second stroke is the only other change. Merely by concentrating on this as you write the following small cluster of characters should be enough to fix the form in your mind. By way of exception, you might doodle around with the kanji's form to see what you can come up with. Koohii #1 A pelt is hooked on a branch. A small tent is made with a pelt and a branch planted in the ground. The mnemonic hints at the first stroke (the hanging pelt) and the hook at the end of the second stroke. This is chinese radical #107 meaning “skin”. Koohii #2 To be honest, this is one of those cases where I have found it easier to ""just remember it"" as a radical, as it occurs so frequently: 彼（かれ him）波（なみ wave）and so on. Primitives pelt, branch, ten, needle, crotch, hook 皮(かわ): skin, hide, leather, fur, pelt, bark, shell 毛皮(けがわ): fur, skin, pelt 皮肉(ひにく): cynicism, sarcasm, irony, satire 皮膚(ひふ): skin Kunyomi: かわ、けがわ Onyomi: ヒ Lesson: 25 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 皮 (かわ)"	"pelt 皮 画数5 865 Details Story Dictionary 皮 pelt Heisig's The simplest way to remember this character is to see it as built up from that for branch. The first stroke can then stand for something ""hanging"" down from the branch, namely its bark or pelt. The barb at the end of the second stroke is the only other change. Merely by concentrating on this as you write the following small cluster of characters should be enough to fix the form in your mind. By way of exception, you might doodle around with the kanji's form to see what you can come up with. Koohii #1 A pelt is hooked on a branch. A small tent is made with a pelt and a branch planted in the ground. The mnemonic hints at the first stroke (the hanging pelt) and the hook at the end of the second stroke. This is chinese radical #107 meaning “skin”. Koohii #2 To be honest, this is one of those cases where I have found it easier to ""just remember it"" as a radical, as it occurs so frequently: 彼（かれ him）波（なみ wave）and so on. Primitives pelt, branch, ten, needle, crotch, hook 皮(かわ): skin, hide, leather, fur, pelt, bark, shell 毛皮(けがわ): fur, skin, pelt 皮肉(ひにく): cynicism, sarcasm, irony, satire 皮膚(ひふ): skin Kunyomi: かわ、けがわ Onyomi: ヒ Lesson: 25 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 皮 (かわ)"
waves Details Story Dictionary 波 waves Heisig's Water's . . . pelt. Koohii #1 Waves are the ocean´s pelt (skin). Koohii #2 The Inuit used water-proof seal pelts for their kayaks, to travel the waves. "old woman Details Story Dictionary 婆 old woman Heisig's Waves . . . woman. Koohii #1 An old woman is seen here as a woman with waves (i.e. wrinkles, creases). Koohii #2 You know ""The Old Man and the Sea."" Well, this is the sequel, ""The Old Woman and the Sea Waves."". Primitives old woman, wave, water, water droplets, water pistol, pelt, branch, ten, needle, crotch, hook, woman Kunyomi: ばば、ばあ Onyomi: バ Lesson: 25 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"	"old woman 婆 画数11 867 Details Story Dictionary 婆 old woman Heisig's Waves . . . woman. Koohii #1 An old woman is seen here as a woman with waves (i.e. wrinkles, creases). Koohii #2 You know ""The Old Man and the Sea."" Well, this is the sequel, ""The Old Woman and the Sea Waves."". Primitives old woman, wave, water, water droplets, water pistol, pelt, branch, ten, needle, crotch, hook, woman Kunyomi: ばば、ばあ Onyomi: バ Lesson: 25 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"
expose Details Story Dictionary 披 expose Heisig's Fingers . . . pelt. Koohii #1 You expose holes in a pelt by passing your fingers through them and wiggling them on the other side. The sense of the kanji here is to reveal something that was hidden, to make known, to open your heart (thus revealing it, exposing it to others), express your opinion, etc. Koohii #2 Think of it in this vulgar way. You really want her to expose her “beaver” pelt, so you have to encourage her with your fingers to expose it. Primitives expose, finger, fingers, pelt, branch, ten, needle, crotch, hook Kunyomi: Onyomi: ヒ Lesson: 25 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	expose 披 画数8 868 Details Story Dictionary 披 expose Heisig's Fingers . . . pelt. rend Details Story Dictionary 破 rend My Story [Stone + Skin] Koohii #1 Before the invention of scissors or knives, sharp STONES were used to REND PELTs, so that caveman designers could complete new styles for the upcoming year. Koohii #2 Rend is a violent, primitive kind of word. (Image: cavemen rending pelts right off live animals with stone tools). Primitives rend, stone, rock, pelt, branch, ten, needle, crotch, hook 突破(とっぱ): breaking through, breakthrough, penetration 破壊(はかい): destruction 破棄(はき): revocation, annulment, breaking (e.g. treaty) 爆破(ばくは): blast, explosion, blow up 破損(はそん): damage 破裂(はれつ): explosion, rupture, break off 破産(はさん): (personal) bankruptcy 破片(はへん): fragment, splinter, broken piece 破く(やぶく): tear, violate, defeat, smash, destroy 破る(やぶる): tear, violate, defeat, smash, destroy 破れる(やぶれる): get torn, wear out Kunyomi: やぶ.る、やぶ.れる Onyomi: ハ Lesson: 25 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 破る (やぶ.る), 破れる (やぶ.れる)	rend 破 画数10 869 Details Story Dictionary 破 rend My Story [Stone + Skin] Koohii #1 Before the invention of scissors or knives, sharp STONES were used to REND PELTs, so that caveman designers could complete new styles for the upcoming year. martyrdom Details Story Dictionary 殉 martyrdom Heisig's Bones . . . decameron. Koohii #1 Think of the early Christian martyrs who suffered martyrdom because of their faith. See them held in cells for 10 days (a decameron) before being fed to the lions. They appear before the chanting Roman crowds as bones to be devoured. Think of what was leftover after the lions finished them off....nothing, not even a pile of bones to bury. Koohii #2 The boney man martyred himself during his 10 day hunger-strike. Primitives martyrdom, bones, one, ceiling, evening, decameron, bound up, sun, day Kunyomi: Onyomi: ジュン Lesson: 25 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	martyrdom 殉 画数10 872 Details Story Dictionary 殉 martyrdom Heisig's Bones . . . decameron. augment Details Story Dictionary 殖 augment Heisig's Bones . . . straightaway. Koohii #1 Advertisement for Breast Implants -- Tired of nights all alone? Want to get boned straightaway? AUGMENT your breasts and all your troubles will be solved! Koohii #2 In the movie “Gattaca”, Vincent Freeman (played by Ethan Hawke) augments his size by straightening his bones (his legs), in order to match up with the genetically “perfect” population, and reach his goal of travelling in space. The stretching of his lower leg bones involved multiplying the bone cells, another sense of this key word. Primitives augment, bones, one, ceiling, evening, straightaway, ten, needle, eye, fishhook 繁殖(はんしょく): breed, multiply, increase, propagation 殖やす(ふやす): to increase, to add to, to augment 殖える(ふえる): increase, multiply Kunyomi: ふ.える、ふ.やす Onyomi: ショク Lesson: 25 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 殖える (ふ.える), 殖やす (ふ.やす)	augment 殖 画数12 874 Details Story Dictionary 殖 augment Heisig's Bones . . . straightaway. split Details Story Dictionary 裂 split Heisig's File . . . garment. Koohii #1 They tried issuing the skeleton warriors with proper garments to wear, but they kept getting split by the sharp bones or by their sabres. In the end, it was decided they look scarier naked anyway. Koohii #2 Someone takes a sword made of bone to split the garment right down the middle. Very effective. "death Details Story Dictionary 死 death Heisig's Bones . . . spoon. Note how the first stroke is extended to the right, forming a sort of ""roof"" overhead. Koohii #1 Ok, this is where knowing some Eastern culture comes in handy! In Japanese society, when someone dies they creamate the body and pick out the remaining bones with special chopsticks. In this case, they´re out of chopsticks so they decide to use (gasp!) a spoon instead. Koohii #2 Imagine the grim reaper (the bringer of death), carrying a spoon made of human bones instead of a scythe. Primitives death, bones, one, ceiling, evening, spoon, sitting on the ground 死(し): death, decease 死刑(しけい): death penalty, capital punishment 生死(せいし): life and death 死体(したい): corpse 死亡(しぼう): death, mortality 必死(ひっし): inevitable death, desperation, frantic, inevitable result 死ぬ(しぬ): to die Kunyomi: し.ぬ、し.に- Onyomi: シ Lesson: 25 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds: 死ぬ (し.ぬ)"	"death 死 画数6 878 Details Story Dictionary 死 death Heisig's Bones . . . spoon. interment Details Story Dictionary 葬 interment Heisig's Flowers . . . death . . . two hands. Do not confuse with bury (Frame 191). Koohii #1 I imagine an interment as a funeral. At this funeral it´s an open casket, and the dead body (death) is holding flowers with both of its hands. Koohii #2 During the interment ceremony, the grandchildren placed flowers over the dead body while the widow sat praying with two hands. ear Details Story Dictionary 耳 ear Heisig's The pictograph for the ear looks much like that for eye, but note how the stroke order gives it a different look. Koohii #1 Your ear is like the eye on the side of your head for seeing things, but there is hair around it that creates jagged lines. Koohii #2 Pictograph, see book. * The primitive meaning can easily be extended to ear plugs. Primitives ear 耳鼻科(じびか): otolaryngology 初耳(はつみみ): something heard for the first time 耳(みみ): ear Kunyomi: みみ Onyomi: ジ Lesson: 25 Jouyou: 1 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 耳 (みみ)	ear 耳 画数6 881 Details Story Dictionary 耳 ear Heisig's The pictograph for the ear looks much like that for eye, but note how the stroke order gives it a different look. "take Details Story Dictionary 取 take Heisig's Ear . . . crotch. Koohii #1 You put your ear next to a womans crotch...and somehow, from it, you hear the words ""Take me...."". Koohii #2 Fuaburisu´s with a twist: You know that classic trick where someone pretends to take something out of an someone else´s ear (such as a coin). Instead of a cigarette or a pen he pulls the person’s crotch out of their ear. Very painful! Primitives take, ear, crotch 受け取り(うけとり): receipt 書き取り(かきとり): dictation 書き取る(かきとる): to write down, to take dictation, to take notes 聞き取り(ききとり): listening comprehension 下取り(したどり): trade in, part exchange 取材(しゅざい): choice of subject, collecting data 塵取り(ちりとり): dustpan 取っ手(とって): handle, grip, knob 取りあえず(とりあえず): at once, first of all, for the time being 取り扱い(とりあつかい): treatment, service, handling, management 取り扱う(とりあつかう): to treat, to handle, to deal in 取り替え(とりかえ): swap, exchange 取り組む(とりくむ): to tackle, to wrestle with, to engage in a bout, to come to grips with 取り締まり(とりしまり): control, management, supervision 取り締まる(とりしまる): to manage, to control, to supervise 取り調べる(とりしらべる): to investigate, to examine 取り立てる(とりたてる): to collect, to extort, to appoint, to promote 取り次ぐ(とりつぐ): to act as an agent for, to announce (someone), to convey (a message) 取り除く(とりのぞく): to remove, to take away, to set apart 取り引き(とりひき): transactions, dealings, business 取り巻く(とりまく): to surround, to circle, to enclose 取り混ぜる(とりまぜる): to mix, to put together 取り戻す(とりもどす): to take back, to regain 取り寄せる(とりよせる): to order, to send away for 取り分(とりわけ): especially, above all 乗っ取る(のっとる): to capture, to occupy, to usurp 引き取る(ひきとる): to take charge of, to take over, to retire to a private place 日取り(ひどり): fixed date, appointed day 受け取る(うけとる): to receive, to get, to accept, to take, to interpret, to understand 取り上げる(とりあげる): take up, pick up, disqualify, confiscate, deprive 取り入れる(とりいれる): harvest, take in, adopt 取り消す(とりけす): cancel 取り出す(とりだす): take out, produce, pick out 取れる(とれる): come off, be taken off, be removed, be obtained, leave, come out (e.g. photo), be interpreted 取り替える(とりかえる): exchange 取る(とる): take, pick up, harvest, earn, choose Kunyomi: と.る、と.り、と.り-、とり、-ど.り Onyomi: シュ Lesson: 25 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 取る (と.る)"	"take 取 画数8 882 Details Story Dictionary 取 take Heisig's Ear . . . crotch. "snapshot Details Story Dictionary 撮 snapshot Heisig's Finger . . . utmost. This character is used for taking photographs. Note how, conveniently, the element for ""take"" is included in it. Koohii #1 Take the utmost care that you don´t have your finger in the way when you take a snapshot. Koohii #2 When I learned photography from my dad as a little girl, he explained the basics to me: ""when you take a snapshot, be careful not to put your fingers before the lens, and don´t look towards the sun (this was in the days that photographs would be spoiled by direct sunlight). Primitives snapshot, finger, fingers, utmost, sun, day, take, ear, crotch 撮影(さつえい): photographing 撮る(とる): take (a photo), make (a film) Kunyomi: と.る、つま.む、-ど.り Onyomi: サツ Lesson: 25 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 撮る (と.る)"	"snapshot 撮 画数15 885 Details Story Dictionary 撮 snapshot Heisig's Finger . . . utmost. shame Details Story Dictionary 恥 shame Heisig's Ear . . . heart. It is most rare to have the heart at the right, rather than at the bottom. Take advantage of this fact when you compose your story. Koohii #1 Amelia Ear-Heart (sic) brought shame to those who said women couldn´t fly. Koohii #2 Vincent Van Gogh´s greatest shame was cutting off his ear to win the heart of a woman. Primitives shame, ear, heart 恥(はじ): shame, embarrassment 恥じらう(はじらう): to feel shy, to be bashful, to blush 恥じる(はじる): to feel ashamed 恥ずかしい(はずかしい): shameful, be ashamed Kunyomi: は.じる、はじ、は.じらう、は.ずかしい Onyomi: チ Lesson: 25 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 恥じらう (は.じらう), 恥じる (は.じる), 恥ずかしい (は.ずかしい), 恥 (はじ)	shame 恥 画数10 886 Details Story Dictionary 恥 shame Heisig's Ear . . . heart. post Details Story Dictionary 職 post Heisig's The key word refers to one's occupation, or position of employment. Its elements: ear . . . kazoo. Koohii #1 Worst post in history: quality checker at the kazoo factory. Imagine the toll on your ears! Koohii #2 Buckingham Palace guards are famous for staying at their post no matter what, even if you blow a kazoo in their ear! holy Details Story Dictionary 聖 holy Heisig's Ear . . . mouth . . . king. Koohii #1 The trick for me is to remember that the 耳 is to the left of the 口. However, this is easy because a true holy man uses his ear to listen (i.e., to God or his supplicant) before he opens his mouth to speak, unlike a charlatan who just makes something up. Of course, kings are often true holy men and prophets (e.g., King David in the bible). Koohii #2 A holy man hears with his ears before he speaks with his mouth, which places him higher than a king in people´s esteem. Primitives holy, ear, mouth, king, jewel, ball 神聖(しんせい): holiness, sacredness, dignity 聖書(せいしょ): Bible, scriptures Kunyomi: ひじり Onyomi: セイ、ショウ Lesson: 25 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	holy 聖 画数13 888 Details Story Dictionary 聖 holy Heisig's Ear . . . mouth . . . king. "listen Details Story Dictionary 聴 listen Heisig's Ear . . . needle . . . eye . . . heart. Compare frame 427 for this and the following kanji, and then once again when you get to frame 950. Koohii #1 I promise to use my ear to do nothing but listen ... stick a needle in my eye, cross my heart and hope to die! (Intentionally said backwards to get the order of the primitives correct). Koohii #2 Listening to others is different from hearing [1626] with the ear. One must allow the words to pierce through the eyes (the window of the soul) and reach deep into the heart...a symbol of thinking about and contemplating on what was said, not just the sounds of words spoken. A married man while reading his newspaper, his wife going on about something suddenly, says, ""You´re not listening to me, are you?"" He replies, ""I heard every word you said. You said..."" “Yes, but you´re not listening."". Primitives listen, ear, stethoscope, camel, ten, needle, eye, cross-eyed, net, heart 聴覚(ちょうかく): the sense of hearing 聴講(ちょうこう): lecture attendance, auditing 聴診器(ちょうしんき): stethoscope Kunyomi: き.く、ゆる.す Onyomi: チョウ、テイ Lesson: 25 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 聴く (き.く)"	"listen 聴 画数17 890 Details Story Dictionary 聴 listen Heisig's Ear . . . needle . . . eye . . . heart. "pocket Details Story Dictionary 懐 pocket Heisig's State of mind . . . needle . . . eyes . . . garment. Koohii #1 (re: taijuando) When you are in New York City you have to be alert, i.e. in the ""New York State of Mind"": you need ten eyes to make sure no one will go through your garments and pick your pockets. Koohii #2 Imagine Darth Vader´s state of mind when he discovers his garment has not pockets. "" D O NOT WANT!"". "ridicule Details Story Dictionary 慢 ridicule Heisig's State of mind . . . mandala. Koohii #1 I´ll focus on the mandala primitive here. I guess Heisig chose this keyword for phonetic reasons and as a character it´s the ""man"" in mandara/mandala (曼荼羅). A mandala is a graphic representation of the universe, here split in 3 planes of existance, the sun representing the cosmos, the eye represents the human observer, the crotch represents the animal instincts. Koohii #2 He´ s often ridiculed for having his eye on crotches all day. Primitives ridicule, Freud, state of mind, mandala, sun, day, eye, cross-eyed, net, crotch 怠慢(たいまん): negligence, procrastination, carelessness 我慢(がまん): patience, endurance, perseverance, tolerance, self-control, self-denial 自慢(じまん): pride, boast Kunyomi: Onyomi: マン Lesson: 25 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"	"ridicule 慢 画数14 892 Details Story Dictionary 慢 ridicule Heisig's State of mind . . . mandala. loose Details Story Dictionary 漫 loose Heisig's Water . . . mandala. Koohii #1 One obscure Tibetan sect-- the Otaku cult-- has an unusually loose interpretation of mandala drawing practice. Instead of traditional mandalas they draw mangas (漫画). They then pour water on the image to wash it away, and begin anew. Koohii #2 Even NELSON MANDALA dreams of drops of WATER glistening on comic book/ anime girls with LOOSE morals. (This story has been edited in response reports). placement Details Story Dictionary 置 placement Heisig's Eye . . . straightaway. Koohii #1 On the JET Programme, many people have their eye on a placement in Tokyo, Osaka or another big city, and write it on their application form. They are usually sent to the countryside straightaway. Koohii #2 Working in retail you learn the placement of any item should be at eye level so it´s seen straightaway. Primitives placement, eye, cross-eyed, net, straightaway, ten, needle, eye, fishhook 位置(いち): location, position 処置(しょち): treatment 設置(せっち): establishment, institution 措置(そち): measure, step 配置(はいち): arrangement (of resources), disposition 放置(ほうち): leave as is, leave to chance, leave alone, neglect 前置き(まえおき): preface, introduction 物置き(ものおき): storeroom 装置(そうち): equipment, installation, apparatus 物置(ものおき): storage room 置く(おく): put, place Kunyomi: お.く、-お.き Onyomi: チ Lesson: 25 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 置く (お.く)	placement 置 画数13 895 Details Story Dictionary 置 placement Heisig's Eye . . . straightaway. penalty Details Story Dictionary 罰 penalty Heisig's Eye . . . words . . . saber. Koohii #1 For Japanese, when the mind´s eye (the sideways eye) feels guilty for something bad that the body has done, there are two penaltys to choose from. One, you can say I´m sorry. Two, you can commit suicide by sabre. Why, oh why, do so many Japanese executives commit suicide at the first sign of scandal when all the have to do is say I´m sorry to get off the hook. (on yomi: バチ, バツ). Koohii #2 There is a 3-way masterplan for every goalkeeper to prevent a goal at penalty shootout: 1. Look directly into the eyes of the player --- 2. Confuse him by screaming senseless words --- 3. Pull out you your saber and ... (that´s up to you). Primitives penalty, eye, cross-eyed, net, say, words, keitai, mouth, sword, sabre, saber 刑罰(けいばつ): judgement, penalty, punishment 処罰(しょばつ): punishment 罰(ばち): (divine) punishment, curse, retribution 罰する(ばっする): punish, penalize Kunyomi: ばっ.する Onyomi: バツ、バチ、ハツ Lesson: 25 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 罰金 (ばっきん), 処罰 (しょばつ), 天罰 (てんばつ)	penalty 罰 画数14 896 Details Story Dictionary 罰 penalty Heisig's Eye . . . words . . . saber. "rather Details Story Dictionary 寧 rather Heisig's House . . . heart . . . eye . . . spike. Koohii #1 A pretty tough kanji. Think of elegant old housewives with English accents dining together at a HOUSE party. The hostess brings out a dish of hors d´oeuvres: a SPIKE of metal with an EYEBALL and a HEART skewered on it. Upon being offered this treat, one of the housewives says in her English accent, ""I´d RATHER not."". Koohii #2 Rather a house with a heart than an eye with a spike. "voiced Details Story Dictionary 濁 voiced Heisig's The key word for this kanji connotes the ""muddying"" effect on a soft consonant brought about by vibrating the vocal chords. For example, in English a ""j"" is voiced while a ""sh"" is unvoiced. In Japanese, the し is changed to じ when it is voiced. The primitives are: water . . . eye . . . bound up . . . insect. Koohii #1 The fly is wrapped in a spiderweb voicing ""Help me, Help Me"" under the watchful eye of the spider who´s venom is dripping like water from her fangs. Koohii #2 Pour water over the eyes of a bound up insect if you want to hear a pitiful buzz that is very similar to a VOICED consanant. Primitives voiced, water, water droplets, water pistol, spider, eye, cross-eyed, net, bound up, insect 清濁(せいだく): good and evil, purity and impurity 濁る(にごる): become muddy or impure Kunyomi: にご.る、にご.す Onyomi: ダク、ジョク Lesson: 25 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 濁す (にご.す), 濁る (にご.る)"	"voiced 濁 画数16 898 Details Story Dictionary 濁 voiced Heisig's The key word for this kanji connotes the ""muddying"" effect on a soft consonant brought about by vibrating the vocal chords. For example, in English a ""j"" is voiced while a ""sh"" is unvoiced. In Japanese, the し is changed to じ when it is voiced. The primitives are: water . . . eye . . . bound up . . . insect. Koohii #1 The fly is wrapped in a spiderweb voicing ""Help me, Help Me"" under the watchful eye of the spider who´s venom is dripping like water from her fangs. ring (environment) Details Story Dictionary 環 ring (environment) My Story [King + one net + enderman {遠}] The *KING* has *ONE NET* and one *ENDERMAN* to protect his environment Koohii #1 Together with the next kanji, the keywords spell “send back the ring”. First we have a jewel. Next we have the great eye of Sauron searching for the fellowship hiding under the many ceilings during their journey. The fourth and fifth primitives are the mouth of Gollum always mumbling “My preciousss”; and Pippin´s scarf! Placement: the eye appears at the top similarly to how the Great Eye of Sauron is perched atop the Dark Tower. Koohii #2 In conjunction with send back (#837)....... When I tried to give her the jewel ring, she eyed me, threw it to the floor, opened her mouth and tried to speak, she said nothing. She grabbed her scarf and left. Primitives ring, king, jewel, ball, trampoline, eye, cross-eyed, net, one, ceiling, mouth, scarf 環境(かんきょう): environment, circumstance 循環(じゅんかん): circulation, rotation, cycle Kunyomi: わ Onyomi: カン Lesson: 25 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	ring (environment) 環 画数17 899 Details Story Dictionary 環 ring (environment) My Story [King + one net + enderman {遠}] The *KING* has *ONE NET* and one *ENDERMAN* to protect his environment Koohii #1 Together with the next kanji, the keywords spell “send back the ring”. "husband Details Story Dictionary 夫 husband Heisig's The kanji for a husband or ""head of the family"" is based on the kanji for large and an extra line near the top for the ""head."" Recall the kanji for heavens already learned back in frame 457, and be sure to keep your story for this kanji different. Koohii #1 Even though it is argued size is not important, I´m sure most women would like their husband to have a big one. Koohii #2 Homer Simpson, as a primitive. Primitives husband, husband, one, large 丈夫(じょうふ): hero, gentleman, warrior, manly person, good health, robustness, strong, solid, durable 夫(おっと): (humble) (my) husband 工夫(くふう): device, scheme 夫婦(ふうふ): married couple, spouses, husband and wife, couple, pair 夫妻(ふさい): man and wife, married couple 夫人(ふじん): wife, Mrs., madam 丈夫(じょうぶ): good health, robustness, strong, solid, durable, hero, gentleman, warrior, manly person 大丈夫(だいじょうぶ): safe, all right, O.K. Kunyomi: おっと、そ.れ Onyomi: フ、フウ、ブ Lesson: 25 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 夫妻 (ふさい), 農夫 (のうふ), 凡夫 (ぼんおっと), 夫 (おっと)"	"husband 夫 画数4 901 Details Story Dictionary 夫 husband Heisig's The kanji for a husband or ""head of the family"" is based on the kanji for large and an extra line near the top for the ""head."" mountain stream Details Story Dictionary 渓 mountain stream Heisig's Water . . . vulture . . . husband. Koohii #1 The Simpsons are on vacation. Homer stops to take a leak in a mountain stream but gets snatched by an eagle. Hear his scream? Koohii #2 A husband who went fishing at the mountain stream to feed his family, fell in the rapids (we´ll assume this is a large mountain stream). He is saved from the waters by a great eagle. He comes back home with nothing to feed the family, his clothes still dripping wet as he tells his wife of how he was saved by a great eagle, and of course she does not believe him. The story continues in chicken (#1947). standard Details Story Dictionary 規 standard Heisig's Husband . . . see. Koohii #1 In the male-dominated world of yesterday, the husband´s way of seeing things was considered the standard point of view. Women who dared to disagree were frowned upon. Koohii #2 Unfortunately, Homer Simpson is the standard model of a husband in American society. (Placement: You have to look in the RIGHT places to find one that doesn´t fit that mold.). Unfortunately, he isn´t very good at fixing things and after a few failed attempts the entire apartment is submerged in water. "lose Details Story Dictionary 失 lose Heisig's ""To lose"" here takes the sense of ""misplace,"" not the sense of defeat, whose kanji we learned in frame 67. It pictures a husband with something falling from his side as he is walking along, something he loses. * As a primitive, this character can also mean to drop. Koohii #1 The drop falling here is the husband´s toupee... he´s already lost his hair once, now he´s losing it again. Such is life, I suppose. Koohii #2 Note: Heisig´s stroke order is wrong. It´s the same as vermilion, drop first. Homer loses/drops his wedding ring. Primitives lose, drop, husband 失格(しっかく): disqualification, elimination, incapacity (legal) 失調(しっちょう): lack of harmony 損失(そんしつ): loss 紛失(ふんしつ): losing something 失う(うしなう): lose, part with 過失(かしつ): error, blunder, accident 失業(しつぎょう): unemployment 失望(しつぼう): disappointment, despair 失恋(しつれん): disappointed love, broken heart, unrequited love, be lovelorn, 失敗(しっぱい): failure, fail Kunyomi: うしな.う、う.せる Onyomi: シツ Lesson: 25 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 失う (うしな.う)"	"lose 失 画数5 908 Details Story Dictionary 失 lose Heisig's ""To lose"" here takes the sense of ""misplace,"" not the sense of defeat, whose kanji we learned in frame 67. It pictures a husband with something falling from his side as he is walking along, something he loses. * As a primitive, this character can also mean to drop. Koohii #1 The drop falling here is the husband´s toupee... he´s already lost his hair once, now he´s losing it again. Such is life, I suppose. Koohii #2 Note: Heisig´s stroke order is wrong. It´s the same as vermilion, drop first. Homer loses/drops his wedding ring. Primitives lose, drop, husband 失格(しっかく): disqualification, elimination, incapacity (legal) 失調(しっちょう): lack of harmony 損失(そんしつ): loss 紛失(ふんしつ): losing something 失う(うしなう): lose, part with 過失(かしつ): error, blunder, accident 失業(しつぎょう): unemployment 失望(しつぼう): disappointment, despair 失恋(しつれん): disappointed love, broken heart, unrequited love, be lovelorn, 失敗(しっぱい): failure, fail Kunyomi: うしな.う、う.せる Onyomi: シツ Lesson: 25 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 失う (うしな.う)"
iron Details Story Dictionary 鉄 iron My Story He was digging for *gold*, but *missed out* {失} and found only iron ore. Koohii #1 Iron is a metal that gradually becomes lost due to oxidation and rust. Koohii #2 Compare with pig-iron (#270). In moving from pig-iron to iron, some of the metal´s maleability is LOST. (The only difference between the two kanji is that IRON has knee-less, unbending legs, while PIG-IRON (270) has very supple, bendable legs.). Primitives iron, metal, gold, lose, drop, husband 鉄棒(かなぼう): iron rod, crowbar, horizontal bar (gymnastics) 製鉄(せいてつ): iron manufacture 鉄鋼(てっこう): iron and steel 鉄片(てっぺん): iron scraps 私鉄(してつ): private railway 鉄(てつ): iron 鉄橋(てっきょう): railway bridge, iron bridge 鉄道(てつどう): railroad 鉄砲(てっぽう): gun 地下鉄(ちかてつ): underground train, subway Kunyomi: くろがね Onyomi: テツ Lesson: 25 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds:	iron 鉄 画数13 909 Details Story Dictionary 鉄 iron My Story He was digging for *gold*, but *missed out* {失} and found only iron ore. alternate Details Story Dictionary 迭 alternate Heisig's To drop . . . road. Koohii #1 When you get lost, you just take an alternate road to get back on track. Koohii #2 When you lose your way, you can always try to tell the wife that you merely took an alternate road. To save time you know. I´m not LOST, I´m just taking an alternate road. Ahem. "retainer Details Story Dictionary 臣 retainer Heisig's This kanji is actually a pictograph for an eye, distorted to make it appear that the pupil is protruding towards the right. This may not be an easy form to remember, but try this: Draw it once rather large, and notice how moving the two vertical lines on the right as far right as possible gives you the pictograph of the eye in its natural form. The ""pop-eye"" image belongs to an Emperor's retainer standing in awe before his ruler. * As a primitive, the meaning of the key word becomes slave. Koohii #1 Its a pictograph of a teeth with a retainer in the middle. Koohii #2 Retainer = A slave (for the purposes of this kanji.) This is a pictograph of a slave collar with two handcuffs dangling from it. Primitives retainer, slave 総理大臣(そうりだいじん): Prime Minister 大臣(だいじん): cabinet minister Kunyomi: Onyomi: シン、ジン Lesson: 25 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 臣下 (しんか), 君臣 (くんしん)"	"retainer 臣 画数7 911 Details Story Dictionary 臣 retainer Heisig's This kanji is actually a pictograph for an eye, distorted to make it appear that the pupil is protruding towards the right. This may not be an easy form to remember, but try this: Draw it once rather large, and notice how moving the two vertical lines on the right as far right as possible gives you the pictograph of the eye in its natural form. The ""pop-eye"" image belongs to an Emperor's retainer standing in awe before his ruler. * As a primitive, the meaning of the key word becomes slave. Koohii #1 Its a pictograph of a teeth with a retainer in the middle. Koohii #2 Retainer = A slave (for the purposes of this kanji.) This is a pictograph of a slave collar with two handcuffs dangling from it. Primitives retainer, slave 総理大臣(そうりだいじん): Prime Minister 大臣(だいじん): cabinet minister Kunyomi: Onyomi: シン、ジン Lesson: 25 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 臣下 (しんか), 君臣 (くんしん)"

"storehouse Details Story Dictionary 蔵 storehouse Heisig's Flowers . . . parade . . . slaves. Koohii #1 The storehouse is overgrown with slaves. The slaves are to be sold in the store, to differentiate from a warehouse, which doesn´t have the word ""store"" in it. Koohii #2 Slaves moved flowers from the storehouse in preparation for the parade. entrails Details Story Dictionary 臓 entrails Heisig's Part of the body . . . storehouse. Koohii #1 You signed your organ donor card, right? So, when you die, your entrails and other body parts will be placed in a storehouse. Koohii #2 Again with the Pyramids, each Pharaoh had their entrails taken out and put into little jars that were shaped in the forms of their Gods and entombed along with the preserved body. So, the entrails are the parts of the body that are placed in the storehouse along with the Pharaoh! Damnit, why can´t they always be this easy? :(. Primitives entrails, moon, month, flesh, part of the body, storehouse, flowers, parade, retainer, slave 内臓(ないぞう): internal organs, intestines, viscera 心臓(しんぞう): heart Kunyomi: はらわた Onyomi: ゾウ Lesson: 25 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds:	entrails 臓 画数19 914 Details Story Dictionary 臓 entrails Heisig's Part of the body . . . storehouse. "strict Details Story Dictionary 堅 strict Heisig's Slave . . . crotch . . . soil. Koohii #2 I´m very strict about not just sleeping with anyone. People who are slaves to their crotches often end up with dirty genitalia and I don´t want to get their VD. (on yomi=ケン). "look to Details Story Dictionary 臨 look to Heisig's Slave . . . reclining . . . goods. The key word suggests both looking ahead to something and ""seeing to"" what is at hand. Consistent with everything we have learned about the role of the key word, this means that you must choose ONE meaning and stick to it. Koohii #1 The slave is look to the future, ""One day"" he thinks ""I will be able to recline with all my goods, a tv, stereo and washing machine, and when that day comes I shall be truly happy"" he sighs. Koohii #2 Imagine a slave(or in this case, a female porn star) looking to her new gangbang film where she reclines and gets all 3 holes filled at the same...........OK. Very vulgar, but I was inspired by raulir´s clever use of ""3 holes""......... Primitives look to, retainer, slave, reclining, lying down, goods, mouth, mouth3 臨む(のぞむ): to look out on, to face, to deal with, to attend (function) 臨時(りんじ): temporary, special, extraordinary Kunyomi: のぞ.む Onyomi: リン Lesson: 25 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 臨む (のぞ.む)"	"look to 臨 画数18 918 Details Story Dictionary 臨 look to Heisig's Slave . . . reclining . . . goods. "perusal Details Story Dictionary 覧 perusal Heisig's Slaves . . . reclining . . . floor . . . see. Koohii #1 The slave reclines on the floor at night to watch the stars. Since that´s the only thing the slave is allowed to “read”, he does so very thoroughly and diligently, hence perusal. Koohii #2 [+scottamus] ""Please, come in and peruse this fine selection of slaves, all reclining here on the floor for your perusal. "gigantic Details Story Dictionary 巨 gigantic Heisig's This kanji depicts a gigantic ""pop-eye,"" which accounts for its shape. Be sure not to confuse it with the slave (retainer) we just learned. "power Details Story Dictionary 力 power Heisig's With a little imagination, one can see a muscle in this simple, two-stroke character meaning power. * As a primitive, either muscle or power can be used. Koohii #1 I always refer to the power of the KATAKANA ""KA"". Koohii #2 I have a very powerful muscle カ in my driveway! Primitives power, muscle, arnold 圧力(あつりょく): stress, pressure 威力(いりょく): power, might, authority, influence 権力(けんりょく): power, authority, influence 勢力(せいりょく): influence, power, might, strength, potency, force, energy 戦力(せんりょく): war potential 速力(そくりょく): speed 体力(たいりょく): physical strength 弾力(だんりょく): elasticity, flexibility 動力(どうりょく): power, motive power, dynamic force 浮力(ふりょく): buoyancy, floating power 武力(ぶりょく): armed might, military power, the sword, force 暴力(ぼうりょく): violence 有力(ゆうりょく): influence, prominence, potent 労力(ろうりょく): labour, effort, toil, trouble 引力(いんりょく): gravity 学力(がくりょく): scholarship, knowledge, literary ability 活力(かつりょく): vitality, energy 強力(きょうりょく): powerful, strong 協力(きょうりょく): cooperation, collaboration 効力(こうりょく): effect, efficacy, validity, potency 実力(じつりょく): merit, efficiency, arms, force 重力(じゅうりょく): gravity 力強い(ちからづよい): reassuring, emboldened 電力(でんりょく): electric power 努力(どりょく): great effort, exertion, endeavour, effort 能力(のうりょく): ability, faculty 魅力(みりょく): charm, fascination, glamour 力(ちから): strength, power Kunyomi: ちから Onyomi: リョク、リキ、リイ Lesson: 25 Jouyou: 1 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds: 権力 (けんりょく), 努力 (どりょく), 能力 (のうりょく), 力 (ちから)"	"power 力 画数2 922 Details Story Dictionary 力 power Heisig's With a little imagination, one can see a muscle in this simple, two-stroke character meaning power. * As a primitive, either muscle or power can be used. man Details Story Dictionary 男 man Heisig's Rice fields . . . power. This character is the gender-specific man, not the generic human person of frame 951. Koohii #1 Male is seen here as muscles working in the field, in other words working in the rice fields is the work of the male who are usually stronger. This is more or less the meaning of the original Chinese character. Koohii #2 When it comes to choosing a MAN, I prefer brains over muscles. Primitives male, rice field, brains, power, muscle, arnold 男の人(おとこのひと): man 男子(だんし): youth, young man 長男(ちょうなん): eldest son 男性(だんせい): male 男(おとこ): man 男の子(おとこのこ): boy Kunyomi: おとこ、お Onyomi: ダン、ナン Lesson: 25 Jouyou: 1 JLPT Level: 5 Compounds: 男子 (だんし), 男女 (だんじょ), 男性 (だんせい), 男 (おとこ)	man 男 画数7 923 Details Story Dictionary 男 man Heisig's Rice fields . . . power. This character is the gender-specific man, not the generic human person of frame 951. "erect Details Story Dictionary 架 erect Heisig's Add . . . trees. Just add Viagra. Koohii #2 I´m not sure I know about erector sets or tinker toys but I do know about jenga. "armpit Details Story Dictionary 脇 armpit Heisig's Part of the body . . . muscles (three of which give us ""triceps"" or ""muscles on top of muscles""). You will want to keep the kanji distinct from the one that follows by paying attention to the positioning of the elements. Koohii #1 What part of the body has a very, very, very powerful smell? The armpit, of course! Koohii #2 (no important on yomi) The part of Conan´s body that is three times more effective at defeating foes than his muscles are his stinky ARMPITs. [Note: Typically, when the flesh primitive is on the left side it refers to a body part - this helps distinguish in from threaten (#871)]. Primitives armpit, moon, month, flesh, part of the body, triceps, power, muscle, arnold, power3, muscle3, arnold3 脇(わき): side Kunyomi: わき、わけ Onyomi: キョウ Lesson: 25 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: Compounds: 脇 (わき)"	"armpit 脇 画数10 935 Details Story Dictionary 脇 armpit Heisig's Part of the body . . . muscles (three of which give us ""triceps"" or ""muscles on top of muscles""). threaten Details Story Dictionary 脅 threaten Heisig's Triceps . . . part of the body. Koohii #1 Compare the primitive positions of armpit (#870) and threaten (#871). When your triceps rest alongside your body, they fit snugly against your armpit. When you hold them above your body, however, your posture becomes quite threatening. Koohii #2 Don´t threaten a warewolf. He´s three times as powerful ON a full moon.　RTK2:　キョウ　脅迫　きょうはく (blackmail)…　Pure Group:　協872. Primitives threaten, triceps, power, muscle, arnold, moon, month, flesh, part of the body, power3, muscle3, arnold3 脅かす(おどかす): to threaten, to coerce 脅す(おどす): to threaten, to menace 脅迫(きょうはく): threat, menace, coercion, terrorism Kunyomi: おびや.かす、おど.す、おど.かす Onyomi: キョウ Lesson: 25 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 脅かす (おど.かす), 脅す (おど.す), 脅かす (おびや.かす)	threaten 脅 画数10 936 Details Story Dictionary 脅 threaten Heisig's Triceps . . . part of the body. Note: both co- and cooperate are meanings for this kanji. Koohii #2 Co-operation: 3 persons can have the power of ten if they co-operate. Primitives co-, ten, needle, triceps, power, muscle, arnold, power3, muscle3, arnold3 協会(きょうかい): association, society, organization 協議(きょうぎ): conference, consultation, discussion, negotiation 協調(きょうちょう): co-operation, conciliation, harmony, firm (market) tone 協定(きょうてい): arrangement, pact, agreement 妥協(だきょう): compromise, giving in 協力(きょうりょく): cooperation, collaboration Kunyomi: Onyomi: キョウ Lesson: 25 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds:	co- 協 画数8 937 Details Story Dictionary 協 co- My Story *Ten* loners vs 3 *strong* dudes cooperating, I know who is gonna win Koohii #1 The nurse says : “If you co-operate, that needle (syringe) in your triceps won´t hurt”. Note: both co- and cooperate are meanings for this kanji. Koohii #2 Co-operation: 3 persons can have the power of ten if they co-operate. Primitives co-, ten, needle, triceps, power, muscle, arnold, power3, muscle3, arnold3 協会(きょうかい): association, society, organization 協議(きょうぎ): conference, consultation, discussion, negotiation 協調(きょうちょう): co-operation, conciliation, harmony, firm (market) tone 協定(きょうてい): arrangement, pact, agreement 妥協(だきょう): compromise, giving in 協力(きょうりょく): cooperation, collaboration Kunyomi: Onyomi: キョウ Lesson: 25 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds:
going Details Story Dictionary 行 going Heisig's By joining the top four strokes, you should get a picture of the front current of a river, the stream trailing behind. Hence the character for going. * As a primitive, this character has two forms. Reduced to the left side only, it can mean a column, going, or a line of something or other. When the middle is opened up to make room for other elements, it means a boulevard. Koohii #1 I use The Flash for for this primitive; a superhero who is always going very fast. Koohii #2 To me, this looks like a bridge going over a body of water, being supported by columns underneath it. Being that I live near the ocean, I see tourists and vacationers coming and going constantly on the bridge. Because the bridge is so long, it forms an arc to support the structural integrity. You can see that arc here. Primitives going, boulevard, going 行き(いき): going 行き違い(いきちがい): misunderstanding, estrangement, disagreement, crossing without meeting, going astray 行き成り(いきなり): suddenly 行く(いく): to go 移行(いこう): switching over to 売れ行き(うれゆき): sales 行い(おこない): deed, conduct, behavior, action, asceticism 行う(おこなう): to perform, to do, to conduct oneself, to carry out 慣行(かんこう): customary practice, habit, traditional event 刊行(かんこう): publication, issue 行(ぎょう): line, row, verse 強行(きょうこう): forcing, enforcement 行政(ぎょうせい): administration 決行(けっこう): doing (with resolve), carrying out (i.e. a plan) 現行(げんこう): present, current, in operation 行為(こうい): act, deed, conduct 行員(こういん): bank clerk 行進(こうしん): march, parade 施行(しぎょう): execution, enforcing, carrying out 修行(しゅうぎょう): pursuit of knowledge, studying, learning, training, ascetic practice, discipline 徐行(じょこう): going slowly 進行(しんこう): advance 先行(せんこう): preceding, going first 走行(そうこう): running a wheeled vehicle (e.g. car), traveling 流行(はやり): fashionable, fad, in vogue, prevailing 非行(ひこう): delinquency, misconduct 平行(へいこう): (going) side by side, concurrent, abreast, at the same time, occurring together, parallel, parallelism 夜行(やぎょう): walking around at night, night train, night travel 行儀(ぎょうぎ): manners 行事(ぎょうじ): event, function 行列(ぎょうれつ): line, procession, matrix (mathematics) 孝行(こうこう): filial piety 行動(こうどう): action, conduct, behaviour, mobilization 実行(じっこう): practice, performance, realization, execution (e.g. program) 通行(つうこう): passage, passing 発行(はっこう): issue (publications) 流行る(はやる): flourish, thrive, be popular, come into fashion 飛行(ひこう): flying, flight, aviation 並行(へいこう): (going) side by side, concurrent, abreast, at the same time, occurring together, parallel, parallelism 夜行(やこう): walking around at night, night train, night travel 流行(りゅうこう): fashionable, fad, in vogue, prevailing 行う(おこなう): do, act 急行(きゅうこう): express train 飛行場(ひこうじょう): airfield, airport 銀行(ぎんこう): bank 飛行機(ひこうき): airplane 旅行(りょこう): travel, trip Kunyomi: い.く、ゆ.く、-ゆ.き、-ゆき、-い.き、-いき、おこな.う、おこ.なう Onyomi: コウ、ギョウ、アン Lesson: 25 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 5 Compounds: 行進 (こうしん), 行為 (こうい), 旅行 (りょこう), 行列 (ぎょうれつ), 行政 (ぎょうせい), 修行 (しゅぎょう), 行く (い.く), 行う (おこな.う), 行く regulation (law) / rhythm Details Story Dictionary 律 regulation (law) / rhythm My Story [GO + Brush] To be a #law#yer, you need to *go* and *brush* up your people skills Koohii #1 The calligrapher´s brush is moving down a column of a script, in rhythm with his meditation. Koohii #2 The army COLUMN walked to the RHYTHM made by the drummer using a cool BRUSH like drum stick. Picturing the brush as a drum stick is not difficult if you´ve seen such a thing in jazz videos. gain Details Story Dictionary 得 gain My Story Go to the temple of the sun to obtain a blessing! Koohii #1 To gain more knowledge of what´s goin on in the world I´m reading column after column of articles in the newspapers, and it takes so much time I´m glued to it till nightbreak. Koohii #2 Imagine fat people......they avoid going outside to exercise and stay glued to their TV set until nightbreak....so of course they gain weight. "diameter Details Story Dictionary 径 diameter Heisig's Line . . . spool. Koohii #1 Scientists recently measured the diameter of Earth by drilling a deep hole and dropping a line of thread off a humongous spool until it got to the other side. Koohii #2 Suggestion: Replace ""spool"" with ""toilet paper/roll"". Reasons: (1) Toilet paper/roll usually comes on a spool. (2) Toilet paper is used to clean the soil off your crotch. Story: Measure the diameter of a column (maybe Nelson´s Column in London?) using a roll of toilet paper. Spool also appears in stalk (#715), suspicious (#716), lightly (#717), sutra (#1360). Primitives diameter, Nelson, column, going, line, spool, clod, toilet paper, crotch, soil, dirt, ground 直径(ちょっけい): diameter 半径(はんけい): radius Kunyomi: みち、こみち、さしわたし、ただちに Onyomi: ケイ Lesson: 25 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"	"diameter 径 画数8 947 Details Story Dictionary 径 diameter Heisig's Line . . . spool. he Details Story Dictionary 彼 he Heisig's Going . . . pelt. This kanji refers to the third person singular personal pronoun, generally in its masculine form. Koohii #1 What´s the main difference between a he and a she? The he has a column covered in a pelt... a penis. Badum-ching. Koohii #2 The ultimate he-man is the Neanderthal cave man. His club is as big as a pillar (column), and he wears a ragged pelt as his only clothing. To remember the column, imagine the cave man resting the club vertically like a column when not in use. Primitives he, Nelson, column, going, line, pelt, branch, ten, needle, crotch, hook 彼処(あそこ): (uk) there, over there, that place, (X) (col) genitals 彼方此方(あちこち): here and there 彼方(あちら): there, yonder, that 彼方此方(あちらこちら): here and there 彼此(あれこれ): one thing or another, this and that, this or that 彼等(かれら): they (usually male) 彼女(かのじょ): she 彼(かれ): he 彼ら(かれら): they Kunyomi: かれ、かの、か.の Onyomi: ヒ Lesson: 25 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 彼 (かれ)	he 彼 画数8 948 Details Story Dictionary 彼 he Heisig's Going . . . pelt. This kanji refers to the third person singular personal pronoun, generally in its masculine form. Koohii #1 What´s the main difference between a he and a she? The he has a column covered in a pelt... a penis. Badum-ching. Koohii #2 The ultimate he-man is the Neanderthal cave man. His club is as big as a pillar (column), and he wears a ragged pelt as his only clothing. To remember the column, imagine the cave man resting the club vertically like a column when not in use. Primitives he, Nelson, column, going, line, pelt, branch, ten, needle, crotch, hook 彼処(あそこ): (uk) there, over there, that place, (X) (col) genitals 彼方此方(あちこち): here and there 彼方(あちら): there, yonder, that 彼方此方(あちらこちら): here and there 彼此(あれこれ): one thing or another, this and that, this or that 彼等(かれら): they (usually male) 彼女(かのじょ): she 彼(かれ): he 彼ら(かれら): they Kunyomi: かれ、かの、か.の Onyomi: ヒ Lesson: 25 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 彼 (かれ)
duty Details Story Dictionary 役 duty My Story [Go {彳} + Missile] It is your duty to *go* stop that *missile* Koohii #1 Japanese kamikaze pilots (and the American from Dr. Strangelove) are so devoted to their duty that they go with their missiles. Koohii #2 Imagine those poor saps in charge of nuclear silos, responsible for ICBMS, those towering column missiles. When the order comes they must decide whether to obey their concience or do their duty and damn the world to atomic annihilation. Primitives duty, Nelson, column, going, line, cruise missile, missile, wind, crotch 役(えき): war, campaign, battle 重役(おもやく): heavy responsibilities, director 役職(やくしょく): post, managerial position, official position 役立つ(やくだつ): to be useful, to be helpful, to serve the purpose 役場(やくば): town hall 重役(じゅうやく): heavy responsibilities, director 主役(しゅやく): leading part, leading actor or actress 役(やく): use, service, role, position 役者(やくしゃ): actor, actress 役所(やくしょ): government office, public office 役人(やくにん): government official 役目(やくめ): duty, business 役割(やくわり): part, assigning (allotment of) parts, role, duties 役に立つ(やくにたつ): useful Kunyomi: Onyomi: ヤク、エキ Lesson: 25 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 役所 (やくしょ), 役目 (やくめ), 荷役 (かやく)	duty 役 画数7 949 Details Story Dictionary 役 duty My Story [Go {彳} + Missile] It is your duty to *go* stop that *missile* Koohii #1 Japanese kamikaze pilots (and the American from Dr. Strangelove) are so devoted to their duty that they go with their missiles. Benevolence is a good listener who is willing to go the distance to help. Koohii #2 In a rare act of benevolence, the Sparten column removes the needle from the cyclops´s eye, and he repays them by eating their hearts. "penal Details Story Dictionary 懲 penal Heisig's Indications . . . heart. Koohii #1 Penal servitude is served until indications show that one has had a change of heart (learned one´s lesson). Easily confused with punish (#679) and penalty (#833). Concentrate on the reasons behind the penal system (""changing people´s hearts"" here), instead of the penalty itself or the punishment (revenge) aspect. It may help to note that there´s no sword, but a heart :-) (Note: 懲りる = learn from one´s bad experiences). Koohii #2 Judge: You will serve a penal sentence until indications show you have a heart. Primitives penal, indications, sherpa, Nelson, column, going, line, mountain, king, jewel, ball, taskmaster, heart 懲りる(こりる): to learn by experience, to be disgusted with Kunyomi: こ.りる、こ.らす、こ.らしめる Onyomi: チョウ Lesson: 25 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 懲らしめる (こ.らしめる), 懲らす (こ.らす), 懲りる (こ.りる)"	"penal 懲 画数18 953 Details Story Dictionary 懲 penal Heisig's Indications . . . heart. equilibrium Details Story Dictionary 衡 equilibrium Heisig's Boulevard . . . bound up . . . brains . . . St. Bernard dog. Koohii #1 To maintain the social equilibrium in a future dystopian society, the brains of citizens are bound up (hypnotized). The government is using mental wave emitting statues shaped like St. Bernard´s dogs put alongside the boulevards. Koohii #2 I think BALANCE is an easier keyword. I was walking down a busy French boulevard when between the rushing traffic I saw the wierdest thing. BALANCING on the central crash barrier was a St. Bernard dog, BALANCING a fish on its nose. As I looked closer, I realised it was a trick; it was holding the fish´s tail in its teeth, and only pretending to BALANCE it. (keeps the position of the elements!). Primitives equilibrium, boulevard, going, bound up, rice field, brains, large, St. Bernard 均衡(きんこう): equilibrium, balance Kunyomi: Onyomi: コウ Lesson: 25 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	equilibrium 衡 画数16 957 Details Story Dictionary 衡 equilibrium Heisig's Boulevard . . . bound up . . . brains . . . extent Details Story Dictionary 程 extent Heisig's Wheat . . . display. Do not confuse with extremity (Frame 230) or boundary (Frame 523). Koohii #1 The extent to which some people will go to create ´wheat displays´, or as some call them ´crop circles´, is truly amazing. Koohii #2 The wheat crop has come in, and the mouth of the king is gobbling it all up. Everyone is waiting to see... to what extent will the king manage to eat it this year? Primitives extent, wheat, cereal, display, mouth, king, jewel, ball 左程(さほど): (not) very, (not) much 其れ程(それほど): to that degree, extent 程度(ていど): degree, amount, grade, standard, of the order of (following a number) 中程(なかほど): middle, midway 程(ほど): limit, the more ~ the more 余程(よっぽど): very, greatly, much, to a large extent, quite 課程(かてい): course, curriculum 過程(かてい): a process 先程(さきほど): some time ago 日程(にってい): agenda 方程式(ほうていしき): equation Kunyomi: ほど、-ほど Onyomi: テイ Lesson: 26 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 程 (ほど)	extent 程 画数12 960 Details Story Dictionary 程 extent Heisig's Wheat . . . display.
