tax Details Story Dictionary 税 tax Heisig's Wheat . . . devil. Koohii #1 Nobody likes the tax man, so here it is only fitting that the person who comes over to take some of your wheat is depicted here as a devil. Keep in mind that in feudal societies there was no kind of money to speak of, so taxes were paid by serfs in wheat to the devils who came over to keep them poor. Koohii #2 This is an easy one. Taxes is like the devil taking away your hard earned wheat. Primitives tax, wheat, cereal, devil, horns, elder brother, teenager, mouth, human legs 関税(かんぜい): customs, duty, tariff 税務署(ぜいむしょ): tax office 課税(かぜい): taxation 税(ぜい): tax 税関(ぜいかん): customs house 税金(ぜいきん): tax, duty 免税(めんぜい): tax exemption Kunyomi: Onyomi: ゼイ Lesson: 26 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds:	tax 税 画数12 961 Details Story Dictionary 税 tax Heisig's Wheat . . . devil. harmony Details Story Dictionary 和 harmony Heisig's Wheat . . . mouth. Koohii #1 The first step to harmony is having enough wheat to feed every mouth in the world. Once we are all fed it is easier to get a long in harmony. Koohii #2 People who live in harmony with nature live in the country. they are yokels or hillbillys. See Billy-bob sitting on the porch in their denhim dungarees a sheaf of wheat, sticking from their mouth. "distress Details Story Dictionary 愁 distress Heisig's Autumn . . . heart. Koohii #1 In AUTUMN, the farmer´s HEART is in DISTRESS as to if he has enough crops. Even better, the farmer will experience great DISTRESS in his HEART if his WHEAT catches FIRE! Koohii #2 Here we have distressed (think ""gloomy"") people with ""seasonal mood disorder"" during the autumn season. Hence ""autumn heart"" is distressed (gloomy). "private Details Story Dictionary 私 private Heisig's Wheat . . . elbow. Like the characters for I (Frame 17) and ego (Frame 690), this kanji is also representative of the subject, with the special connotation of privacy. Koohii #1 Warning sign: ""Private wheat, trespassers will be elbowed"". Koohii #2 I already know this as watashi, or ""I"". In order to associate the keyword of private, I´ll think of this one as ""Private I"", like a detective. Primitives private, wheat, cereal, elbow 私(あたし): I (fem) 私物(しぶつ): private property, personal effects 私有(しゆう): private ownership 私用(しよう): personal use, private business 私鉄(してつ): private railway 私立(しりつ): private (establishment) 私(わたくし): I (formal), myself, private affairs Kunyomi: わたくし、わたし Onyomi: シ Lesson: 26 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds: 私 (わたくし)"	"private 私 画数7 968 Details Story Dictionary 私 private Heisig's Wheat . . . elbow. "ear of a plant Details Story Dictionary 穂 ear of a plant Heisig's Wheat . . . favor. Koohii #1 The pilgrims only had wheat, so they asked the Indians to do them a favor and trade them for some ears of corn. Koohii #2 The ""ear of a plant"" is the seed-bearing spike of a cereal plant, such as corn. In other words, it is the part which feeds us. Hence -- ""the ear (of a plant) is the favor of the wheat"". Primitives ear (of a plant), wheat, cereal, favour, favor, ten, needle, rice field, brains, heart 穂(ほ): ear (of plant), head (of plant) Kunyomi: ほ Onyomi: スイ Lesson: 26 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 穂 (ほ)"	"ear of a plant 穂 画数15 975 Details Story Dictionary 穂 ear of a plant Heisig's Wheat . . . favor. incense Details Story Dictionary 香 incense Heisig's Wheat . . . sun. germ Details Story Dictionary 菌 germ Heisig's Flowers . . . pent in . . . wheat. Koohii #1 Can also mean bacteria.....imagine the wheat pent in your fridge growing to the point where they resemble flowers.......I actually had something similar happen to onions...they grew footlong legs after about 2 or 3 years......OR just think of that Cowboy Bebop episode with the lobster in the fridge... :-). Koohii #2 Actually it means germs as in microorganisms. So for example, you have to keep wheat enclosed so it isn´t exposed to other plants. That way it can´t catch any germs (like fungi) from them. Primitives germ, flowers, pent in, wheat, cereal 細菌(さいきん): bacillus, bacterium, germ 黴菌(ばいきん): bacteria, germ(s) Kunyomi: Onyomi: キン Lesson: 26 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	germ 菌 画数11 985 Details Story Dictionary 菌 germ Heisig's Flowers . . . pent in . . . wheat. "numb Details Story Dictionary 萎 numb Heisig's Flowers . . . committee. Koohii #1 Oh, the committee´s in for a surprise: I put some nightshades into their drinks. They´ll be numb for sure, probably worse. Koohii #2 The keyword numb makes no sense. I choose 萎む（しぼむ）""to fade away"". A girl lies in a wheat field at the same time every day. A photo is taken every day showing this scene and a time lapse video shows the wheat growing through the year until the wheat is tall and the top sprouts to look like its flowers. At this point, the girl can no longer be seen in the photos and she fades away. Primitives numb, flowers, committee, wheat, cereal, woman 萎びる(しなびる): to wilt, to fade 萎む(しぼむ): to wither, to fade (away), to shrivel, to wilt Kunyomi: な、しお.れる、しな.びる、しぼ.む、な.える Onyomi: イ Lesson: 26 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: Compounds: 萎える (な.える)"	"numb 萎 画数11 986 Details Story Dictionary 萎 numb Heisig's Flowers . . . committee. rice Details Story Dictionary 米 rice Heisig's This kanji has a pictographic resemblance to a number of grains of rice lying on a plate in the shape of a star. * As a primitive, it keeps its meaning of rice, and is meant to connote a very ordinary, commonplace grain, in contrast to the primitive for wheat that we just learned. (This meaning accords well with Japan, where the output of rice far exceeds that of wheat.) It occasionally takes a different shape when it stands on its own, or is joined to a line above. In this case, we shall have it refer specifically to grains of rice. This primitive is not to be confused with the similar-looking primitive for water. While the stroke orders are nearly alike, grains of rice has 5 strokes, while water only has 4 because it joins the second and third strokes into one. Finally, we may note that by itself the kanji for rice is an abbreviation used for the United States, which can then also serve as an alternate reading for the main primitive form, if you so wish. Koohii #1 Stroke order: I like to think of the first two strokes as “chop sticks” with which one eats the rice. The rest then is the “tree” meaning “plant” in this contexct. also: USA. Koohii #2 Two drops of rice in a tree, simple. Primitives rice 欧米(おうべい): Europe and America, the West 南米(なんべい): South America 米(こめ): rice Kunyomi: こめ、よね Onyomi: ベイ、マイ、メエトル Lesson: 26 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 米作 (べいさく), 米価 (べいか), 米食 (べいしょく), 米 (こめ)	rice 米 画数6 987 Details Story Dictionary 米 rice Heisig's This kanji has a pictographic resemblance to a number of grains of rice lying on a plate in the shape of a star. * As a primitive, it keeps its meaning of rice, and is meant to connote a very ordinary, commonplace grain, in contrast to the primitive for wheat that we just learned. (This meaning accords well with Japan, where the output of rice far exceeds that of wheat.) It occasionally takes a different shape when it stands on its own, or is joined to a line above. chrysanthemum Details Story Dictionary 菊 chrysanthemum Heisig's Flower . . . bound up . . . rice. Koohii #1 Chrysanthemum flower consists of many tiny petals, just like many rice grains bound up together. Koohii #2 [+astgt] Chrysanthemum is a terrorist orginization whose sole objective is to tie up Condi Rice. One day, Condi Rice is standing outside when a group of chrysanthemum agents swoop in from the sides, bound her up with chrysanthemum rope, and dash off. They leave a lone yellow chrysanthemum flower on top of the bound Condi Rice as a sign to let her discoverers know who committed this brave and noble act. Primitives chrysanthemum, flowers, rice cooker, bound up, rice Kunyomi: Onyomi: キク Lesson: 26 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	chrysanthemum 菊 画数11 996 Details Story Dictionary 菊 chrysanthemum Heisig's Flower . . . bound up . . . rice. "core Details Story Dictionary 奥 core My Story [GM's moustache (with a drop) + Rice + Big] Koohii #1 In the core of a nuclear reactor, scientists have discovered a way to get power from rice, by penting it in under high pressure. It´s very dangerous, so they´ve trained a st. bernard dog to run things, he´s adding more drops of rice as necessary. Koohii #2 奥さん　（おくさん) is a common way to say ""wife"". In the innermost core of the house, the bored pent up housewife drops her chores and consumes so much rice she becomes a very large housewife. Primitives core, drop, pent in, rice, large, St. Bernard 奥(おく): interior 奥さん(おくさん): (polite) wife, your wife, his wife, married lady, madam Kunyomi: おく.まる、くま Onyomi: オウ、オク Lesson: 26 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 奥 (おく)"	"core 奥 画数12 997 Details Story Dictionary 奥 core My Story [GM's moustache (with a drop) + Rice + Big] Koohii #1 In the core of a nuclear reactor, scientists have discovered a way to get power from rice, by penting it in under high pressure. Primitives core, drop, pent in, rice, large, St. Bernard 奥(おく): interior 奥さん(おくさん): (polite) wife, your wife, his wife, married lady, madam Kunyomi: おく.まる、くま Onyomi: オウ、オク Lesson: 26 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 奥 (おく)"
"number Details Story Dictionary 数 number My Story [Rice + Woman + Director] *Rice*-*women* are nothing but numbers to the *director*. Koohii #1 Young taskmaster is learning numbers by watching women haul sacks of rice past him. ""One... two... four! No, wrong! Go back, go back!"". Koohii #2 Women toil in the rice fields carrying heavy sacks of rice to be numbered and counted by the taskmaster. Primitives number, rice, woman, taskmaster 奇数(きすう): odd number 少数(しょうすう): minority, few 数詞(すうし): numeral 多数決(たすうけつ): majority rule 手数(てかず): number of moves, trouble 回数(かいすう): number of times, frequency 回数券(かいすうけん): book of tickets 数(かず): number, figure 数える(かぞえる): count 過半数(かはんすう): majority 偶数(ぐうすう): even number 算数(さんすう): arithmetic 小数(しょうすう): fraction (part of), decimal 数(すう): number, (mathematics) function 数字(すうじ): numeral, figure 整数(せいすう): integer 単数(たんすう): singular (number) 点数(てんすう): marks, points, score, number of items, credits 複数(ふくすう): plural, multiple 分数(ぶんすう): (mathematics) fraction 枚数(まいすう): the number of flat things 無数(むすう): countless number, infinite number 数学(すうがく): mathematics Kunyomi: かず、かぞ.える、しばしば、せ.める、わずらわ.しい Onyomi: スウ、ス、サク、ソク、シュ Lesson: 26 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 数字 (すうじ), 数量 (すうりょう), 年数 (ねんすう), 数 (かず), 数える (かぞ.える)"	"number 数 画数13 998 Details Story Dictionary 数 number My Story [Rice + Woman + Director] *Rice*-*women* are nothing but numbers to the *director*. "sort / variety Details Story Dictionary 類 sort / variety My Story [Rice + Big + Head/Page] There are many sorts of *rice* in Japan. Some are as *big* as your *head*! Koohii #1 Note this character means sort in the sense of what kind, I believe a better keyword would be ""variety"" and this character does appear in some dictionaries with the primary meaning as variety, my story: I´m in a Chinese restaurant and the waiter says ""What sort of rice would you like with your dog head?"". Koohii #2 Condi Rice is the SORT of person that would give HEADaches to a BIG DOG.....This story has been edited because of people reporting it. I like it better without ""aches"", but whatever works for you! Primitives sort, rice, large, St. Bernard, head, page, one, ceiling, drop, shellfish, clam, oyster, eye, animal legs, eight 衣類(いるい): clothes, clothing, garments 類(たぐい): a kind 類似(るいじ): analogous 類推(るいすい): analogy 種類(しゅるい): variety, kind, type, category, counter for different sorts of things 書類(しょるい): documents, official papers 親類(しんるい): relation, kin 人類(じんるい): mankind, humanity 分類(ぶんるい): classification Kunyomi: たぐ.い Onyomi: ルイ Lesson: 26 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds:"	"sort / variety 類 画数18 1000 Details Story Dictionary 類 sort / variety My Story [Rice + Big + Head/Page] There are many sorts of *rice* in Japan. lacquer Details Story Dictionary 漆 lacquer Heisig's Water . . . tree . . . umbrella . . . grains of rice. Koohii #1 LACQUER is a type of WATERY type of liquid used to protect items made from TREES, sort of an UMBRELLA of protection. So protective, you can carry around RICE in the LACQUERED, WOODEN product. Koohii #2 Water is falling from a tree onto the umbrella underneath which is protecting the rice underneath it. But it´s completely dry since the umbrella is lacquered. Primitives lacquer, water, water droplets, water pistol, tree, wood, umbrella, grains of rice Kunyomi: うるし Onyomi: シツ Lesson: 26 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 漆 (うるし)	lacquer 漆 画数14 1001 Details Story Dictionary 漆 lacquer Heisig's Water . . . tree . . . umbrella . . . grains of rice. So protective, you can carry around RICE in the LACQUERED, WOODEN product. Koohii #2 Water is falling from a tree onto the umbrella underneath which is protecting the rice underneath it. But it´s completely dry since the umbrella is lacquered. knee Details Story Dictionary 膝 knee Heisig's Flesh . . . tree . . . umbrella . . . rice grains. Koohii #1 Before lacquer (#932) was made with water, it was made by draining this body part of fluid: the knee! Koohii #2 Back in ancient Japan, people didn´t have knee pads for things like rollerblading and such (what, come on. Ninjas on rollerblades. Ultimate 90s flashback). Instead, they would simply dip their knees in laquer, and wait until it dried (hence the flesh, and the abscence of any drops of water). Unfortunately, this meant that you would have to wait about 30 minutes after deciding to go rollerblade until you could actually do it (took some time to dry) - and removing it was a serious pain. Primitives knee, moon, month, flesh, part of the body, tree, wood, umbrella, grains of rice 膝(ひざ): knee, lap Kunyomi: ひざ Onyomi: シツ Lesson: 26 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: Compounds: 膝 (ひざ)	knee 膝 画数13 1002 Details Story Dictionary 膝 knee Heisig's Flesh . . . tree . . . umbrella . . . rice grains. Koohii #1 Before lacquer (#932) was made with water, it was made by draining this body part of fluid: the knee! Koohii #2 Back in ancient Japan, people didn´t have knee pads for things like rollerblading and such (what, come on. Ninjas on rollerblades. Ultimate 90s flashback). Instead, they would simply dip their knees in laquer, and wait until it dried (hence the flesh, and the abscence of any drops of water). Unfortunately, this meant that you would have to wait about 30 minutes after deciding to go rollerblade until you could actually do it (took some time to dry) - and removing it was a serious pain. Primitives knee, moon, month, flesh, part of the body, tree, wood, umbrella, grains of rice 膝(ひざ): knee, lap Kunyomi: ひざ Onyomi: シツ Lesson: 26 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: Compounds: 膝 (ひざ)
Esq. Details Story Dictionary 様 Esq. Heisig's The abbreviation Esq. will help associate this character with the honorific form of address to which it belongs. Its elements are: tree . . . sheep . . . grains of rice. Note that the final vertical stroke in the element for sheep is extended to form the first stroke for grains of rice. Koohii #1 Here we have the requirements to be counted among the ranks of the noble Esq. You must posses a forested estate, herds of sheep, and granary full of grains of rice. Koohii #2 This is -Sama, a generic high term of respect for someone in an unusual profession. If you met a person that created a wooden sheep that was squeezing a single grain of rice out of its ass, you´d definitely call that person -sama. Because that is impressive. Primitives Esq., tree, wood, sheep, grains of rice 有様(ありさま): state, condition, circumstances, the way things are or should be, truth 一様(いちよう): uniformity, evenness, similarity, equality, impartiality お蔭様で(おかげさまで): Thanks to god, thanks to you ご苦労様(ごくろうさま): Thank you very much for your.... 様(さま): Mr. or Mrs., manner, kind, appearance 左様なら(さようなら): good-bye 仕様(しよう): way, method, resource, remedy, (technical) specification 多様(たよう): diversity, variety 殿様(とのさま): feudal lord 様式(ようしき): style, form, pattern 様相(ようそう): aspect 王様(おうさま): king 神様(かみさま): god 逆様(さかさま): inversion, upside down 様々(さまざま): varied, various 同様(どうよう): identical, equal to, same (kind), like 模様(もよう): pattern, figure, design 様(よう): way, manner, kind, sort, appearance, like, such as, so as to, in order to, so that 様子(ようす): aspect, state, appearance Kunyomi: さま、さん Onyomi: ヨウ、ショウ Lesson: 26 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 様 (さま)	Esq. 様 画数14 1003 Details Story Dictionary 様 Esq. "request Details Story Dictionary 求 request Heisig's Let the drop in the upper right-hand corner of this character close the right angle off to make an arrowhead. Whenever we find the needle with that drop in an element that has no other special meaning, we will take advantage of this primitive meaning. At the bottom, we see the grains of rice, the vertical line doubling up for the two elements. Do not confuse with petition (Frame 143). Koohii #1 Enemy: ""Any final requests?"" // MacGyver: ""Just an arrowhead and some grains of rice."" (MacGyver then throws the grains of rice at the enemy and uses the arrowhead to cut his hands free from the rope.). Koohii #2 Robin Hood holds his rich victim at arrowpoint and kindly requests that he hands over his grains of rice. Primitives request, arrow, grains of rice 請求(せいきゅう): claim, demand, application, request 求める(もとめる): seek, request, demand, want, wish for, search for 要求(ようきゅう): request, demand, requisition Kunyomi: もと.める Onyomi: キュウ、グ Lesson: 26 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 求める (もと.める)"	"request 求 画数7 1004 Details Story Dictionary 求 request Heisig's Let the drop in the upper right-hand corner of this character close the right angle off to make an arrowhead. bamboo Details Story Dictionary 竹 bamboo Heisig's Bamboo grows upwards, like a straight nail, and at each stage of its growth (which legend associates with the arrival of the new moon) there is a jointed rootstock (the first stroke). Two such bamboo stalks are pictured here. * As a primitive, the meaning remains the same, but the vertical lines are severely abbreviated so that they can take their place at the top where, like flowers, they are always to be found. Koohii #1 Pandas like to eat bamboo. I´m using panda as the primitive name when it fits the story. ^__^. Koohii #2 Two reclining victims impaled on bamboo spheres...　　　　　　　　　RTK2:　チク　松竹梅　しょうちくばい(pine, bamboo, plum). Primitives bamboo 竹(たけ): bamboo, middle (of a three-tier ranking system) Kunyomi: たけ Onyomi: チク Lesson: 26 Jouyou: 1 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 竹 (たけ)	bamboo 竹 画数6 1007 Details Story Dictionary 竹 bamboo Heisig's Bamboo grows upwards, like a straight nail, and at each stage of its growth (which legend associates with the arrival of the new moon) there is a jointed rootstock (the first stroke). Just look at him laugh! Koohii #1 When the people tried to build a tower of bamboo to reach the heavens, the gods just laughed and laughed. Koohii #2 That Panda is in bamboo heaven! bamboo hat Details Story Dictionary 笠 bamboo hat Heisig's Bamboo . . . vase. Koohii #1 The bamboo vase was beautifully crafted, but the tourist didn´t know what it was and wore it as a little bamboo hat. Koohii #2 The bamboo part is easy. Just remember that this kanji refers to those particular bamboo hats that are worn primarily by Buddhist monks, who always seem to stand outside of train stations, collecting alms. Primitives bamboo hat, bamboo, vase, stand up Kunyomi: かさ Onyomi: リュウ Lesson: 26 Jouyou: Names JLPT Level: Compounds:	bamboo hat 笠 画数11 1009 Details Story Dictionary 笠 bamboo hat Heisig's Bamboo . . . vase. "bamboo grass Details Story Dictionary 笹 bamboo grass Heisig's Bamboo . . . generation. Koohii #1 The bamboo generation smokes bamboo grass. Koohii #2 “One of the most attractive aspects of bamboo is that it is a renewable resource; it takes less than a year for a stalk to reach maturity, compared to the decades for most trees, whether needle or broadleaf.” -- Mnemonic : ""bamboo grass is the next bamboo generation"". Primitives bamboo grass, bamboo, generation Kunyomi: ささ Onyomi: Lesson: 26 Jouyou: Names JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"	"bamboo grass 笹 画数11 1010 Details Story Dictionary 笹 bamboo grass Heisig's Bamboo . . . generation. Koohii #2 “One of the most attractive aspects of bamboo is that it is a renewable resource; it takes less than a year for a stalk to reach maturity, compared to the decades for most trees, whether needle or broadleaf.” -- Mnemonic : ""bamboo grass is the next bamboo generation"". Primitives bamboo grass, bamboo, generation Kunyomi: ささ Onyomi: Lesson: 26 Jouyou: Names JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"
stationery Details Story Dictionary 箋 䇳 stationery Heisig's Bamboo . . . float. Note that the drawing of the primitive for float uses the abbreviated form that has become standard in the general-use kanji and as we met it earlier (Frames 393-95). Until such time as typesetting fonts make the adjustment, only the older form has been approved. Here we have opted for the simpler, avant garde drawing. Koohii #1 Note: the spelling should be stationery (= paper, office supplies), not stationary (= not moving). The error is in the original book. Koohii #2 The two fiestas communicated to each other on their respective floats by using bamboo stationery. Primitives stationery, bamboo, float, fiesta, float*, fiesta2 便箋(びんせん): writing paper, stationery Kunyomi: ふだ Onyomi: セン Lesson: 26 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: Compounds:	stationery 箋 䇳 画数12 1011 Details Story Dictionary 箋 䇳 stationery Heisig's Bamboo . . . float. Note that the drawing of the primitive for float uses the abbreviated form that has become standard in the general-use kanji and as we met it earlier (Frames 393-95). Until such time as typesetting fonts make the adjustment, only the older form has been approved. Here we have opted for the simpler, avant garde drawing. Koohii #1 Note: the spelling should be stationery (= paper, office supplies), not stationary (= not moving). The error is in the original book. Koohii #2 The two fiestas communicated to each other on their respective floats by using bamboo stationery. Primitives stationery, bamboo, float, fiesta, float*, fiesta2 便箋(びんせん): writing paper, stationery Kunyomi: ふだ Onyomi: セン Lesson: 26 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: Compounds:
muscle Details Story Dictionary 筋 muscle Heisig's Bamboo . . . part of the body . . . power. Here we see how the primitive meaning of muscle was derived from the kanji for power. Koohii #1 Muscle is part of the body that gives strength, and can be both supple and tense like the bamboo. Koohii #2 Lifting BAMBOO STICKS is an old way for your BODY to put on lots of MUSCLE. box Details Story Dictionary 箱 box My Story Take the 2 *rifles* off your *partners* ammo box, so that you can reload. GO! GO! GO! Koohii #1 The best kind of BOX is made from BAMBOO sticks that are INTER-laced to make it air tight. Just picture such a box and you´ve mastered this kanji. Koohii #2 I think of a box made of inter-locking of bamboo strips. calculate Details Story Dictionary 算 calculate Heisig's Bamboo . . . eyes . . . two hands. Koohii #1 Before the time of digital calculators, people used old school calculators made of bamboo (abacus). It´s not as easy as a calculator, but you don´t need any batteries either. All you need are your eyes and your two hands. Koohii #2 Tip : you may see this as an Abacus, which is used to calculate. This particular ancient chinese Abacus has eyeballs in place of beads, and its frame is made of bamboo. You´d be amazed at how fast people can calculate with this, especially if they can use both hands at once to move the ... eyeballs. Primitives calculate, bamboo, eye, two hands 暗算(あんざん): mental arithmetic 換算(かんさん): conversion, change, exchange 決算(けっさん): balance sheet, settlement of accounts 採算(さいさん): profit 清算(せいさん): liquidation, settlement 足し算(たしざん): addition 割り算(わりざん): division (math) 掛け算(かけざん): multiplication 計算(けいさん): calculation, reckoning 算数(さんすう): arithmetic 算盤(そろばん): abacus 引算(ひきざん): subtraction 予算(よさん): estimate, budget 割算(わりざん): (mathematics) division Kunyomi: そろ Onyomi: サン Lesson: 26 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds:	calculate 算 画数14 1017 Details Story Dictionary 算 calculate Heisig's Bamboo . . . eyes . . . two hands. Koohii #2 For the frustrated housewife the solution came in form of a BAMBOO stick that FITS her well. scheme Details Story Dictionary 策 scheme Heisig's Bamboo . . . belted tree (See frame 446). Koohii #1 (Elaboration of jameserb´s story:) A clever scheme from Wile E Coyote -- he ties one of those rubber belts to some trees and uses it to launch a bamboo spear at the roadrunner... Koohii #2 The temples in kyoto belt bamboo around trees in a scheme to protect them from the huge number of tourists. (true story)-----------対策　　たいさく　　measure, countermeasure. Primitives scheme, bamboo, tree, wood, belt 策(さく): plan, policy 政策(せいさく): political measures, policy 方策(ほうさく): plan, policy 対策(たいさく): counter-plan, counter-measure Kunyomi: Onyomi: サク Lesson: 26 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	scheme 策 画数12 1019 Details Story Dictionary 策 scheme Heisig's Bamboo . . . belted tree (See frame 446). register Details Story Dictionary 簿 register Heisig's Bamboo . . . water . . . acupuncturist. Koohii #1 Note : the keyword is not a verb, think of a record book. This acupuncturist who uses bamboo in place of flowers to dilute water into his patients (see frame 227), managed somehow to appear on the register of acupuncturists. Chances are, he won´t stay on the register for long. My image is close to that of gorgon´s story. Koohii #2 This doctor dilutes (see 227) his patients with bamboo stalks rather than the flowers of a standard diluting acupuncturist hence he needs to be on the Bamboo Accumpunturist Diltuers (BAD) register. Pumping that much water into a body can be dangerous; see the huge bamboo stems with gallons of water sloshing in and out of the patient. Primitives register, bamboo, water, water droplets, water pistol, acupuncturist, specialty, drop, ten, needle, rice field, brains, glue 名簿(めいぼ): register of names Kunyomi: Onyomi: ボ Lesson: 26 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	register 簿 画数19 1020 Details Story Dictionary 簿 register Heisig's Bamboo . . . water . . . acupuncturist. fabricate Details Story Dictionary 築 fabricate Heisig's Bamboo . . . craft . . . mediocre . . . wood/tree. Koohii #1 Bamboo crafting is a mediocre substitute for wood when you are building or fabricating a house. While it may look good and might attract a chick (ちく) or two, the kids´ll (きず) just tear it to pieces as its not sturdy enough. Koohii #2 A bamboo fabrication is a mediocre substitute for wood. Primitives fabricate, bamboo, barge, craft, mediocre, wind, drop, tree, wood 築く(きずく): to build, to pile up, to amass 新築(しんちく): new building, new construction 建築(けんちく): construction, architecture Kunyomi: きず.く Onyomi: チク Lesson: 26 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 築く (きず.く)	fabricate 築 画数16 1021 Details Story Dictionary 築 fabricate Heisig's Bamboo . . . craft . . . mediocre . . . wood/tree. basket Details Story Dictionary 篭 籠 basket Heisig's Bamboo . . . dragon. Note that the older (and still official) form of this kanji uses the old character for dragon 龍, which is good to learn and is fun to write in any case. It is made up of five primitive elements: vase . . . flesh . . . slingshot . . . fishhook (enclosure) . . . three. Koohii #1 The only cage that can keep a dragon is made of bamboo. Koohii #2 A bamboo cage won´t hold a dragon! Primitives cage, bamboo, dragon, vase, stand up, eel, sun, day 篭る(こもる): to seclude oneself, to be confined in, to be implied, to be stuffy Kunyomi: かご、こ.める、こも.る、こ.む Onyomi: ロウ、ル Lesson: 26 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: Compounds:	basket 篭 籠 画数16 1022 Details Story Dictionary 篭 籠 basket Heisig's Bamboo . . . dragon. Note that the older (and still official) form of this kanji uses the old character for dragon 龍, which is good to learn and is fun to write in any case. It is made up of five primitive elements: vase . . . flesh . . . slingshot . . . fishhook (enclosure) . . . three. Koohii #1 The only cage that can keep a dragon is made of bamboo. Koohii #2 A bamboo cage won´t hold a dragon! Primitives cage, bamboo, dragon, vase, stand up, eel, sun, day 篭る(こもる): to seclude oneself, to be confined in, to be implied, to be stuffy Kunyomi: かご、こ.める、こも.る、こ.む Onyomi: ロウ、ル Lesson: 26 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: Compounds:
"person Details Story Dictionary 人 person Heisig's The character for enter (Frame 842) showed someone walking inwards (in terms of the direction of writing), the one for person, shown here, represents someone walking outwards. * As a primitive, it can keep its kanji form except when it appears to the left (its normal position), where it is made to stand up in the form ⺅ (Similar to イ). The primitive meaning is another matter. The abstract notion of person so often has a relation to the meaning of the kanji that confusion readily sets in. So many of the previous stories have included people in them that simply to use person for a primitive meaning would be risky. We need to be more specific, to focus on one particular person. Try to choose someone who has not figured in the stories so far, perhaps a colorful member of the family or a friend whom you have known for a long time. That individual will appear again and again, so be sure to choose someone who excites your imagination. Koohii #1 Behold Mister T (of ""A-Team"" fame)! I chose Mr.T because he´s sure to make amusing stories. He is a very versatile character since he´s both the big, tough guy and the “moralistic” person, telling kids not “to do drugs or alcohol”. He is easy to imagine, the heavy gold chains are probably the most prominent feature of the character. And last but not least you can always pepper your story with the famous line “I pity da foo!” * Fittingly, on the left side of the kanji, it looks like a “T”. Koohii #2 [I appreciate some people´s occasional habit of using P for person in shared stories. That makes it easier to substitute Mr. T, Captain Picard, or whomever else a student is using as person.]. Primitives person 商人(あきうど): trader, shopkeeper, merchant 他人(あだびと): another person, unrelated person, outsider, stranger 一人(いちにん): one person 玄人(くろうと): expert, professional, geisha, prostitute 故人(こじん): the deceased, old friend 殺人(さつじん): murder 産婦人科(さんふじんか): maternity and gynecology department 主人公(しゅじんこう): protagonist, main character, hero(ine) (of a story), head of household 証人(しょうにん): witness 使用人(しようにん): employee, servant 人(じん): man, person, people 人格(じんかく): personality, character, individuality 人材(じんざい): man of talent 新人(しんじん): new face, newcomer 人体(じんたい): human body 人民(じんみん): people, public 人目(じんもく): glimpse, public gaze 知人(ちじん): friend, acquaintance 仲人(ちゅうにん): go-between, matchmaker 当人(とうにん): the one concerned, the said person 二人(ににん): two persons, two people, pair, couple 人情(にんじょう): humanity, empathy, kindness, sympathy, human nature, common sense, customs and manners 万人(ばんじん): all people, everybody, 10000 people 人柄(ひとがら): personality, character, personal appearance, gentility 人質(ひとじち): hostage, prisoner 一人でに(ひとりでに): by itself, automatically, naturally 男の人(おとこのひと): man 女の人(おんなのひと): woman 恋人(こいびと): lover, sweetheart 個人(こじん): individual, personal, private 詩人(しじん): poet 商人(しょうにん): trader, shopkeeper, merchant 職人(しょくにん): worker, mechanic, artisan, craftsman 素人(しろうと): amateur, novice 人工(じんこう): artificial, man-made, human work, human skill, artificiality 人種(じんしゅ): race (of people) 人生(じんせい): (human) life (i.e. conception to death) 人造(じんぞう): man-made, synthetic, artificial 人物(じんぶつ): character, personality, person, man, personage, talented man 人文科学(じんぶんかがく): social sciences, humanities 人命(じんめい): (human) life 人類(じんるい): mankind, humanity 成人(せいじん): adult 他人(たにん): another person, unrelated person, outsider, stranger 人気(にんき): popular, business conditions, popular feeling 人間(にんげん): human being, man, person 犯人(はんにん): offender, criminal 美人(びじん): beautiful person (woman) 人込み(ひとごみ): crowd of people 人差指(ひとさしゆび): index finger 人通り(ひとどおり): pedestrian traffic 一人一人(ひとりひとり): one by one, each, one at a time 夫人(ふじん): wife, Mrs., madam 婦人(ふじん): woman, female 本人(ほんにん): the person himself 名人(めいじん): master, expert 役人(やくにん): government official 友人(ゆうじん): friend 老人(ろうじん): the aged, old person 人口(じんこう): population 人形(にんぎょう): doll 大人(おとな): adult 外国人(がいこくじん): foreigner 御主人(ごしゅじん): (polite) your husband, her husband 人(ひと): man, person, human being, mankind, people, character, personality, true man, man of talent, adult, other people, messenger, visitor 一人(ひとり): one person 二人(ふたり): two persons, two people, pair, couple Kunyomi: ひと、-り、-と Onyomi: ジン、ニン Lesson: 27 Jouyou: 1 JLPT Level: 5 Compounds: 人道 (じんどう), 人員 (じんいん), 成人 (せいじん), 人 (ひと)"	"person 人 画数2 1023 Details Story Dictionary 人 person Heisig's The character for enter (Frame 842) showed someone walking inwards (in terms of the direction of writing), the one for person, shown here, represents someone walking outwards. * As a primitive, it can keep its kanji form except when it appears to the left (its normal position), where it is made to stand up in the form ⺅ (Similar to イ). The primitive meaning is another matter. The abstract notion of person so often has a relation to the meaning of the kanji that confusion readily sets in. So many of the previous stories have included people in them that simply to use person for a primitive meaning would be risky. We need to be more specific, to focus on one particular person. Try to choose someone who has not figured in the stories so far, perhaps a colorful member of the family or a friend whom you have known for a long time. That individual will appear again and again, so be sure to choose someone who excites your imagination. Koohii #1 Behold Mister T (of ""A-Team"" fame)! I chose Mr.T because he´s sure to make amusing stories. He is a very versatile character since he´s both the big, tough guy and the “moralistic” person, telling kids not “to do drugs or alcohol”. He is easy to imagine, the heavy gold chains are probably the most prominent feature of the character. And last but not least you can always pepper your story with the famous line “I pity da foo!” * Fittingly, on the left side of the kanji, it looks like a “T”. Koohii #2 [I appreciate some people´s occasional habit of using P for person in shared stories. That makes it easier to substitute Mr. T, Captain Picard, or whomever else a student is using as person.]. Primitives person 商人(あきうど): trader, shopkeeper, merchant 他人(あだびと): another person, unrelated person, outsider, stranger 一人(いちにん): one person 玄人(くろうと): expert, professional, geisha, prostitute 故人(こじん): the deceased, old friend 殺人(さつじん): murder 産婦人科(さんふじんか): maternity and gynecology department 主人公(しゅじんこう): protagonist, main character, hero(ine) (of a story), head of household 証人(しょうにん): witness "assistant Details Story Dictionary 佐 assistant Heisig's Person . . . left. Koohii #1 Mr T´s assistant is on his left. Why? Because Mr T has this bad habit of suddenly extending his right arm (what with all the boxing that he did), and his assistant got inadvertently punched in the face more than once (ouch). So now his assistant is always to his left side, much safer - ""Stay on my left, foo!"". Koohii #2 On your right is your ""right-hand man"" that you credit for all your success....on the left...... is your assistant who does all the grunt work and gets no credit for anything... Primitives assistant, person, left, by one’s side, craft 佐(さ): help Kunyomi: Onyomi: サ Lesson: 27 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"	"assistant 佐 画数7 1024 Details Story Dictionary 佐 assistant Heisig's Person . . . left. Koohii #1 However drunk Mr T is when he comes back to his place, he always get up at nightbreak. “I pity da foo who gets up after nightbreak !”, says Mr. T. Koohii #2 MR.T leads a busy life, however he always makes sure to be in bed by NIGHTBREAK, however much he might want to stay up watching A-Team re-runs. dwell Details Story Dictionary 住 dwell Heisig's Person . . . candlestick. Koohii #1 When Mr T shows people round his dwelling he takes a big candlestick (with a candle in it!) so that the light shows off his collection of bling bling jewellery. Koohii #2 Mister T dwells in a big brass candlestick, the flame of which serves as a beacon for the boats in the nearby harbour. Sometimes in the morning, Mister T has to clear the wax that has landed and solidified in front of the door. Primitives dwell, person, candlestick, lord, drop, king, jewel, ball 移住(いじゅう): migration, immigration 居住(きょじゅう): residence 住(じゅう): dwelling, living 衣食住(いしょくじゅう): necessities of life (food, clothing, etc.) 住居(じゅうきょ): dwelling, house, residence, address 住宅(じゅうたく): resident, housing 住民(じゅうみん): citizens, inhabitants, residents, population 住まい(すまい): dwelling, house, residence, address 住所(じゅうしょ): address 住む(すむ): abide, reside, live in, inhabit, dwell Kunyomi: す.む、す.まう、-ず.まい Onyomi: ジュウ、ヂュウ、チュウ Lesson: 27 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds: 住まう (す.まう), 住む (す.む)	dwell 住 画数7 1027 Details Story Dictionary 住 dwell Heisig's Person . . . candlestick. body Details Story Dictionary 体 body Heisig's Person . . . book. Koohii #1 Mister T works out his body (body-building), using two piles of books (i.e. an exercise that can be done at home with two chairs, similar to push-ups but working mostly the shoulders, trapezius and triceps). Koohii #2 Mr. T works out his body then rips a book apart to test is body. His favorite to destroy is Dianetics. remote Details Story Dictionary 悠 remote Heisig's Person . . . walking stick . . . taskmaster . . . heart. Koohii #1 Mr. T ventured out into a remote area to visit with his wise, old taskmaster who must use a walking stick to get around and originally gave Mr. T the heart to fight crime for the good of the community. Koohii #2 Yoda, the Jedi with the walking stick who was a hard taskmaster for Luke but who had a big heart, was permanently exiled on the remote planet Dagobah. "affair Details Story Dictionary 件 affair My Story [Person + Cow] Well, you may know the *guy* from Monster Musume. He is capable of having an affair with a *cow3! Koohii #1 Note: this kanji refers to event or case. Current Affair headline: Mr. T has affair with cow. ""It´s only animal ´man´ enough for me"". Koohii #2 I´m having a hard time keep straight just which animal Mr. T is having an affair with. chamcham´s story made me realize that Mr. T is not having an ""affair"", he´s having an ""heifair."" Get it? Primitives affair, person, cow 件(くだん): example, precedent, the usual, the said, the above-mentioned, (man) in question 用件(ようけん): business 事件(じけん): event, affair, incident, case, plot, trouble, scandal 条件(じょうけん): conditions, terms Kunyomi: くだん Onyomi: ケン Lesson: 27 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds:"	"affair 件 画数6 1032 Details Story Dictionary 件 affair My Story [Person + Cow] Well, you may know the *guy* from Monster Musume. "attend Details Story Dictionary 仕 attend Heisig's Person . . . samurai. The key word means to wait on someone or serve them. Koohii #1 Back in the day, a person who stands beside a samurai is usually attending to them or working for them. Koohii #2 [+fuaburisu] Mr T attends to Tom Cruise in the Last Samurai, who is doing hara-kiri. Imagine Tom Cruise outside in the final scene, stabbing his knife into his stomach, while Mr T looks patiently on. ""I pity da foo....no, really."". Primitives attend, person, samurai 給仕(きゅうじ): office boy (girl), page, waiter 仕上がり(しあがり): finish, end, completion 仕上げ(しあげ): end, finishing touches, being finished 仕上げる(しあげる): to finish up, to complete 仕入れる(しいれる): to lay in stock, to replenish stock, to procure 仕掛け(しかけ): device, trick, mechanism, gadget, (small) scale, half finished, commencement, set up, challenge 仕掛ける(しかける): to commence, to lay (mines), to set (traps), to wage (war), to challenge 仕切る(しきる): to partition, to divide, to mark off, to settle accounts, to toe the mark 仕組み(しくみ): devising, plan, plot, contrivance, construction, arrangement 仕立てる(したてる): to tailor, to make, to prepare, to train, to send (a messenger) 仕付ける(しつける): to be used to a job, to begin to do, to baste, to tack, to plant 仕舞(しまい): end, termination, informal (Noh play) 仕舞う(しまう): to finish, to close, to do something completely, to put away, to put an end to 仕様(しよう): way, method, resource, remedy, (technical) specification 仕える(つかえる): to serve, to work for 奉仕(ほうし): attendance, service 仕上がる(しあがる): be finished 仕方(しかた): method, way 仕事(しごと): work, occupation, employment Kunyomi: つか.える Onyomi: シ、ジ Lesson: 27 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds: 仕事 (しごと), 出仕 (しゅつし), 仕える (つか.える)"	"attend 仕 画数5 1033 Details Story Dictionary 仕 attend Heisig's Person . . . samurai. other Details Story Dictionary 他 other Heisig's Person . . . scorpion. Koohii #1 Old latin saying: homo hominis scorpio (people are scorpions to other people). Koohii #2 It´s one or the other: fight Mr. T, or be thrown into the scorpion pit. Primitives other, person, scorpion 他人(あだびと): another person, unrelated person, outsider, stranger 他意(たい): ill will, malice, another intention, secret purpose, ulterior motive, fickleness, double-mindedness 他動詞(たどうし): transitive verb (direct obj) 他方(たほう): another side, different direction, (on) the other hand 他(た): other (especially people and abstract matters) 他人(たにん): another person, unrelated person, outsider, stranger 他(ほか): other (especially places and things) Kunyomi: ほか Onyomi: タ Lesson: 27 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds:	other 他 画数5 1034 Details Story Dictionary 他 other Heisig's Person . . . scorpion. "prostrated Details Story Dictionary 伏 prostrated Heisig's Person . . . chihuahua. Koohii #1 Don´t need a silly story for this one: prostration is when a person puts themselves in a low position like a dog, as an extreme gesture of humility. "transmit Details Story Dictionary 伝 transmit My Story [Person + rising clouds] A *person* who smokes transmits *rising clouds* to those around him/her. (Think second hand smoking). Koohii #1 Mister T transmits a message with rising clouds (smoke) signals, to a nearby American Indian tribe. The smoke signals spell : ""I p-i-t-y y-o-u f-o-o !"". Koohii #2 Hanging one-handed under Cloud City, the Jedi-in-training Luke, uses the force to transmit his distress to Leia. ""I pity da foo´ who´s so indecisive that he can´t make nothin´ permanent"". chief Details Story Dictionary 伯 chief Heisig's Person . . . white dove. Koohii #1 If Mr T was white I am sure he would have been commander in chief of the USA, he just the sort of clown Americans love to vote for. (NB: I tried with the indian chief motif but kept adding feathers by mistake). Koohii #2 Mr T was originally supposed to be the chief of the A-Team, but then the producers realized that America didn´t want to see a Black guy as the chief of a prime-time TV show. So here, we see Mr T doing a bunch of cocaine, and then spreading it all over his face to look white, and trying out for the part of Hannibal. The directors were so impressed that they let him stunt double for Hannibal in a few episodes. OR, Mr T chiefin´ on some crack cocaine. You make the call. Primitives chief, person, white, dove 伯父さん(おじさん): middle-aged gentleman, uncle 伯母さん(おばさん): aunt Kunyomi: Onyomi: ハク Lesson: 27 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	chief 伯 画数7 1041 Details Story Dictionary 伯 chief Heisig's Person . . . white dove. "excellent Details Story Dictionary 佳 excellent Heisig's Person . . . ivy. To distinguish from excel (Frame 980), eminent (Frame 52), esteem (Frame 196), and exquisite (Frame 130), give the key word its own unique connotation. Koohii #1 Mr T wants to go to an excellent school, so he enrolls in Harvard, an ivy-league school. Koohii #2 Bill and Ted are walking through medieval Europe when they see a humongous square jewel. "individual Details Story Dictionary 個 individual My Story [Person + Harden (Mouth + Old) {固} ] I know a *person* who works out everyday until each individual muscle has *hardened*. Koohii #1 This keyword gave me trouble, I could write the kanji from memory but could not remember the keyword the other way around. In such case the dictionary definition can be helpful : ""Middle English, single, indivisible"". Here we have Mr. T. who is so hardened (all the body workout he´s had) that he became in-dividual, that is, in-divisible. ""I pity da foo who can be divided into smaller units."". Koohii #2 Mr. T insists that people be individual. He appears on television, saying, ""Being an individual is hard! But you gotta do it! Harden yourself, and be individual!"". Primitives individual, person, harden, pent in, old, tombstone, gravestone, church, ten, needle, mouth 個(か): article counter 個々(ここ): individual, one by one 個性(こせい): individuality, personality, idiosyncrasy 個別(こべつ): particular case 個所(かしょ): passage, place, point, part 個人(こじん): individual, personal, private 個体(こたい): an individual Kunyomi: Onyomi: コ、カ Lesson: 27 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds:"	"individual 個 画数10 1047 Details Story Dictionary 個 individual My Story [Person + Harden (Mouth + Old) {固} ] I know a *person* who works out everyday until each individual muscle has *hardened*. Koohii #1 This keyword gave me trouble, I could write the kanji from memory but could not remember the keyword the other way around. In such case the dictionary definition can be helpful : ""Middle English, single, indivisible"". Here we have Mr. T. who is so hardened (all the body workout he´s had) that he became in-dividual, that is, in-divisible. ""I pity da foo who can be divided into smaller units."". Koohii #2 Mr. T insists that people be individual. He appears on television, saying, ""Being an individual is hard! But you gotta do it! Harden yourself, and be individual!"". Primitives individual, person, harden, pent in, old, tombstone, gravestone, church, ten, needle, mouth 個(か): article counter 個々(ここ): individual, one by one 個性(こせい): individuality, personality, idiosyncrasy 個別(こべつ): particular case 個所(かしょ): passage, place, point, part 個人(こじん): individual, personal, private 個体(こたい): an individual Kunyomi: Onyomi: コ、カ Lesson: 27 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds:"
"healthy Details Story Dictionary 健 healthy Heisig's Person . . . build. Koohii #1 Mr. T in a public service announcement yells, ""I´m healthy because every day I build a food pyramid, foo!"". Koohii #2 Mr.T, sir, how do you stay so healthy? I asked. ""Simple, foo,"" he answered, ""you gotta build the body up by bodybuilding!"". Primitives healthy, person, build, brush, stretch 健在(けんざい): in good health, well 健全(けんぜん): health, soundness, wholesome 健やか(すこやか): vigorous, healthy, sound 健康(けんこう): health, sound, wholesome 保健(ほけん): health preservation, hygiene, sanitation Kunyomi: すこ.やか Onyomi: ケン Lesson: 27 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 健やか (すこ.やか)"	"healthy 健 画数11 1048 Details Story Dictionary 健 healthy Heisig's Person . . . build. Koohii #2 Chuck Norris´s rules are easy to live by, just be on his side. "waiter Details Story Dictionary 侍 waiter Heisig's Person . . . Buddhist temple. The key word is deceptively modern, but the kanji is actually another way of writing ""samurai."" Be careful not to confuse with attend (Frame 1033). Koohii #1 Mr. T infiltrates the secret samurai Buddhist temple as a waiter with a tray of green tea. (Careful: attend (#960)). Koohii #2 Remember the kanji for wait, 待. Well, now we have a waiter, and he´s dropped a dish. See: 侍! 待 crash 侍. Primitives waiter, person, Buddhist temple, soil, dirt, ground, glue 侍(さむらい): Samurai, warrior Kunyomi: さむらい、はべ.る Onyomi: ジ、シ Lesson: 27 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 侍 (さむらい)"	"waiter 侍 画数8 1050 Details Story Dictionary 侍 waiter Heisig's Person . . . "halt Details Story Dictionary 停 halt Heisig's Person . . . pavilion. Koohii #1 Halt fool - Mr T acting as a bouncer at the pavillion. Koohii #2 Mister T makes a halt at the African pavilion at the World´s Fair. He eats all the snacks on offer, and chats up the ladies - ""“I pity da foo who does not halt by your pavilion, it´s the best !"". "price Details Story Dictionary 値 price My Story A person 亻will never tell you the real price *straightaway* 直. You need to haggle a bit. 価値、かち, value (ka-ching $$$): あの家はあまり価値がないです, ""That house is not worth very much."" 値段、ねだん, price (+ grade): このTシャツの値段はいくらですか, ""How much is the price of this T-shirt?"" に値する、にあたいする, to be worth, deserve: 将軍は勇者に「君は勲章に値する」と言った, ""The general said to the brave man, 'You deserve a medal.'"" Koohii #1 Mr. T (person) tells the used car salesman to tell him the real price straight away, and when he doesn´t he throws him through the windshield. Koohii #2 Mr. T is shopping for new chains. He knows what he wants and money isn´t an issue. ""Cut the jibba-jabba, tell me the price, straightaway!"". Primitives price, person, straightaway, ten, needle, eye, fishhook 値(あたい): value, price, cost, worth, merit 値する(あたいする): to be worth, to deserve, to merit 値打ち(ねうち): value, worth, price, dignity 値段(ねだん): price, cost 値引き(ねびき): price reduction, discount 価値(かち): value, worth, merit 値(ね): value, price, cost, worth, merit, (computer programming) variable Kunyomi: ね、あたい Onyomi: チ Lesson: 27 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 値 (あたい), 値 (ね)"	"price 値 画数10 1052 Details Story Dictionary 値 price My Story A person 亻will never tell you the real price *straightaway* 直. emulate Details Story Dictionary 倣 emulate Heisig's Person . . . set free. Koohii #1 Mr T downloads an emulator so that he can play his favorite game, Pokemon. He plays for a different reason, though - he hates to see them poor little foos in the ball so he spends his entire time setting them free. Koohii #2 The black slave who was set free (#496) decides to emulate Mr. T, his role model. He uses his compass to head to Cali to start anew. arrogance Details Story Dictionary 傲 arrogance Heisig's Person . . . soil . . . compass . . . taskmaster. You may, of course, take the character for emulate from the previous frame as the basis for this kanji, adding to it only the element for soil. Koohii #1 He showed his arrogance as he poured dirt on those who tried to emulate him. Koohii #2 Your arrogance has soiled your attempt to emulate such an honorable effort. Kunyomi: あなど.る、 おご.る Onyomi: ゴウ Lesson: 27 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: Compounds:	arrogance 傲 画数13 1054 Details Story Dictionary 傲 arrogance Heisig's Person . . . soil . . . compass . . . taskmaster. Koohii #2 In Return of the Jedi, after a climactic light sabre battle, Luke and Vader overthrow the emporer (literally throwing him over the balcony). ceremony Details Story Dictionary 儀 ceremony Heisig's Person . . . righteousness. Koohii #1 Mr. T is the master of ceremonies because he is a righteous dude. Koohii #2 Mr. T was briefly a rapper, that is an M.C., that is a master of CEREMONIES (the origin of the phrase). But he sang only RIGHTEOUS songs, no cursing or anything like that. (all true: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7_rBidCkJxo ). "reparation Details Story Dictionary 償 reparation Heisig's Person . . . prize. Koohii #1 Mr. T says, ""This ain´t no prize, foo! This is reparations for slavery!"". Koohii #2 NOTE: do not confuse with compensation (#476)賠. However, 賠 is always used in conjunction 賠償... But 償 is used in various other compounds. Mr. T sold all his jewelry to give as reparations to slave families. The governent tried to honor his charity by giving him a prize, but it was a shitty outhouse filled with clams. Primitives reparation, person, prize, outhouse, small, little, crown, mouth, shellfish, clam, oyster, eye, animal legs, eight 賠償(ばいしょう): reparations, indemnity, compensation 弁償(べんしょう): next word, compensation, reparation, indemnity, reimbursement 補償(ほしょう): compensation, reparation Kunyomi: つぐな.う Onyomi: ショウ Lesson: 27 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 償う (つぐな.う)"	"reparation 償 画数17 1060 Details Story Dictionary 償 reparation Heisig's Person . . . prize. Koohii #1 Mr. T says, ""This ain´t no prize, foo! This is reparations for slavery!"". Koohii #2 NOTE: do not confuse with compensation (#476)賠. However, 賠 is always used in conjunction 賠償... But 償 is used in various other compounds. Mr. T sold all his jewelry to give as reparations to slave families. The governent tried to honor his charity by giving him a prize, but it was a shitty outhouse filled with clams. Primitives reparation, person, prize, outhouse, small, little, crown, mouth, shellfish, clam, oyster, eye, animal legs, eight 賠償(ばいしょう): reparations, indemnity, compensation 弁償(べんしょう): next word, compensation, reparation, indemnity, reimbursement 補償(ほしょう): compensation, reparation Kunyomi: つぐな.う Onyomi: ショウ Lesson: 27 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 償う (つぐな.う)"

"sponsor Details Story Dictionary 催 sponsor Heisig's Hermit . . . turkey. Note what has happened to the mountain in the element for hermit. In order to make room for the turkey, it was raised and condensed. Koohii #1 And now a word from our sponsor. We see Mr. T, doing a sort of George Foreman thing, grilling Mountain Turkeys. ""I pity da foo who don´t have a Mr. T grill!"". Koohii #2 Mister T sponsors a meeting in the mountains (he´s an hermit), talking over a megaphone “I pity da foo who does not come to my event !”. The old turkey comes, and Mister T catches it and cooks it for dinner, muahaha. Primitives sponsor, person, mountain, turkey 開催(かいさい): holding a meeting, open an exhibition 主催(しゅさい): organization, sponsorship 催す(もよおす): to hold (a meeting), to give (a dinner), to feel, to show signs of, to develop symptoms of, to feel (sick) 催促(さいそく): request, demand, claim, urge (action), press for 催し(もよおし): event, festivities, function, social gathering, auspices, opening, holding (a meeting) Kunyomi: もよう.す、もよお.す Onyomi: サイ Lesson: 27 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 催す (もよお.す)"	"sponsor 催 画数13 1062 Details Story Dictionary 催 sponsor Heisig's Hermit . . . turkey. Note what has happened to the mountain in the element for hermit. In order to make room for the turkey, it was raised and condensed. Koohii #1 And now a word from our sponsor. We see Mr. T, doing a sort of George Foreman thing, grilling Mountain Turkeys. ""I pity da foo who don´t have a Mr. T grill!"". Koohii #2 Mister T sponsors a meeting in the mountains (he´s an hermit), talking over a megaphone “I pity da foo who does not come to my event !”. The old turkey comes, and Mister T catches it and cooks it for dinner, muahaha. Primitives sponsor, person, mountain, turkey 開催(かいさい): holding a meeting, open an exhibition 主催(しゅさい): organization, sponsorship 催す(もよおす): to hold (a meeting), to give (a dinner), to feel, to show signs of, to develop symptoms of, to feel (sick) 催促(さいそく): request, demand, claim, urge (action), press for 催し(もよおし): event, festivities, function, social gathering, auspices, opening, holding (a meeting) Kunyomi: もよう.す、もよお.す Onyomi: サイ Lesson: 27 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 催す (もよお.す)"
humanity Details Story Dictionary 仁 humanity Heisig's To refer to the fullness of humanity that can only be achieved in dialogue with another (person . . . two), Confucius used this character. Koohii #1 The beginning of humanity required at least TWO people. Mr. T and Mrs. T! Koohii #2 Mr. T shows his humanity by giving two bucks to every homeless person he sees. Primitives humanity, person, two Kunyomi: Onyomi: ジン、ニ、ニン Lesson: 27 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 仁義 (じんぎ), 仁術 (ひとしじゅつ)	humanity 仁 画数4 1063 Details Story Dictionary 仁 humanity Heisig's To refer to the fullness of humanity that can only be achieved in dialogue with another (person . . . two), Confucius used this character. Koohii #1 The beginning of humanity required at least TWO people. Mr. T and Mrs. T! Koohii #2 Mr. T shows his humanity by giving two bucks to every homeless person he sees. Not only does it stay open even if it grows late, they have brand new toilets, and a Post Office! Koohii #2 Mr. T takes a dump on the floor of a convenience store. Well, it was growing late and he couldn´t wait. He pities the fool who will have to clean it up! Koohii #1 Mr. T keeps his double muzzled ... he wants all the glory. Koohii #2 Mr T, like many holywood stars, has a butt double who is used only for scenes where T´s buttocks are exposed (he has issues with bearing his behind). The butt double has no speaking parts - he is muzzled. Of course T himself isn´t he´s rambling on about pity and foo. "fell Details Story Dictionary 伐 fell Heisig's Person . . . fiesta. Hint: recall the German legend of the English missionary, Saint Boniface, who felled the sacred oak tree dedicated to Thor at Geismar (in lower Hessia), occasioning a great fiesta for the Christians in the neighborhood to mark the defeat of their pagan competition. Be sure to fit your special person into the story if you use it. Koohii #1 At a fiesta, Mr. T tries to knock down a large pinata, but in his overly enthusiastic swings to get ""the sucka,"" he actually FELLS the tree the piñata is hanging from, crushing some party goers. “I pity da fools who got crushed by my FELLED tree!”. Koohii #2 Mr T at the fiesta fell over blind drunk. Koohii #1 Mr. T is praised for his protecting of the trees by being given a top hat and scarf which he wears over his mohawk and chains, respectively. "adhere Details Story Dictionary 付 adhere Heisig's Person . . . glue. The few cases in which this character serves as a primitive should include some connotation of ""adhering to"" that distinguishes it from ""glued to."" Two examples follow. Koohii #1 賀 TO EVERYONE WHO MADE IT TO 千 kanji!! Remember, after this, you´ll be 読ing japanese novels, the news, and the internet like a native. 吉 to ALL of you in your amazing japanese 往. :). Koohii #2 If a PERSON ADHERES to something, they stick to it like GLUE. Primitives adhere, person, glue 受け付ける(うけつける): to be accepted, to receive (an application) 思い付き(おもいつき): plan, idea, suggestion 顔付き(かおつき): (outward) looks, features, face, countenance, expression 片付け(かたづけ): tidying up, finishing 日付(かづけ): date, dating 体付き(からだつき): body build, figure 傷付く(きずつく): to be hurt, to be wounded, to get injured くっ付く(くっつく): to adhere to, to keep close to くっ付ける(くっつける): to attach 交付(こうふ): delivering, furnishing (with copies) 仕付ける(しつける): to be used to a job, to begin to do, to baste, to tack, to plant 据え付ける(すえつける): to install, to equip, to mount 備え付ける(そなえつける): to provide, to furnish, to equip, to install 近付く(ちかづく): to approach, to get near, to get acquainted with, to get closer 付き(つき): attached to, impression, sociality, appearance, furnished with, under, to 付き合う(つきあう): to associate with, to keep company with, to get on with 付け加える(つけくわえる): to add one thing to another 付ける(つける): to attach, to join, to stick, to glue, to fasten, to sew on, to furnish (a house with), to wear, to put on, to make an entry, to appraise, to set (a price), to apply (ointment), to bring alongside, to place (under guard or doctor), to follow, to shad 名付ける(なづける): to name (someone) 付属(ふぞく): attached, belonging, affiliated, annexed, associated, subordinate, incidental, dependent, auxiliary 打付ける(ぶつける): to knock, to run into, to nail on, to strike hard, to hit and attack 付録(ふろく): appendix, supplement 結び付き(むすびつき): connection, relation 結び付く(むすびつく): to be connected or related, to join together 結び付ける(むすびつける): to combine, to join, to tie on, to attach with a knot 目付き(めつき): look, expression of the eyes, eyes やっ付ける(やっつける): to beat 言い付ける(いいつける): tell, tell on (someone), to order, to charge, to direct 追い付く(おいつく): overtake, catch up (with) 思い付く(おもいつく): think of, hit upon, come into one´s mind 片付く(かたづく): be put in order, be put to rights, be disposed of, be solved, be finished, be married (off) 気付く(きづく): notice, recognize, become aware of, perceive, realize 寄付(きふ): contribution, donation 気を付ける(きをつける): be careful, pay attention 言付ける(ことづける): send word, send a message 近付ける(ちかづける): bring near, put close, let come near, associate with 付き合い(つきあい): association, socializing, fellowship 付合う(つきあう): associate with, keep company with, get on with 付く(つく): adjoin, be attached, adhere, be connected with, be dyed, be stained, be scarred, be recorded, start (fires), follow, become allied to, accompany, study with, increase, be added to 日付(ひづけ): date 付近(ふきん): neighbourhood, vicinity, environs 見付かる(みつかる): be found, be discovered 見付ける(みつける): discover, find fault, detect, find out, locate, be familiar 受付(うけつけ): reception 片付ける(かたづける): tidy up Kunyomi: つ.ける、-つ.ける、-づ.ける、つ.け、つ.け-、-つ.け、-づ.け、-づけ、つ.く、-づ.く、つ.き、-つ.き、-つき、-づ.き、-づき Onyomi: フ Lesson: 27 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 付く (つ.く), 付ける (つ.ける)"	"adhere 付 画数5 1075 Details Story Dictionary 付 adhere Heisig's Person . . . glue. The few cases in which this character serves as a primitive should include some connotation of ""adhering to"" that distinguishes it from ""glued to."" Two examples follow. Koohii #1 賀 TO EVERYONE WHO MADE IT TO 千 kanji!! Remember, after this, you´ll be 読ing japanese novels, the news, and the internet like a native. 吉 to ALL of you in your amazing japanese 往. :). Koohii #2 If a PERSON ADHERES to something, they stick to it like GLUE. Primitives adhere, person, glue 受け付ける(うけつける): to be accepted, to receive (an application) 思い付き(おもいつき): plan, idea, suggestion 顔付き(かおつき): (outward) looks, features, face, countenance, expression 片付け(かたづけ): tidying up, finishing 日付(かづけ): date, dating 体付き(からだつき): body build, figure 傷付く(きずつく): to be hurt, to be wounded, to get injured くっ付く(くっつく): to adhere to, to keep close to くっ付ける(くっつける): to attach 交付(こうふ): delivering, furnishing (with copies) 仕付ける(しつける): to be used to a job, to begin to do, to baste, to tack, to plant 据え付ける(すえつける): to install, to equip, to mount 備え付ける(そなえつける): to provide, to furnish, to equip, to install 近付く(ちかづく): to approach, to get near, to get acquainted with, to get closer 付き(つき): attached to, impression, sociality, appearance, furnished with, under, to 付き合う(つきあう): to associate with, to keep company with, to get on with 付け加える(つけくわえる): to add one thing to another 付ける(つける): to attach, to join, to stick, to glue, to fasten, to sew on, to furnish (a house with), to wear, to put on, to make an entry, to appraise, to set (a price), to apply (ointment), to bring alongside, to place (under guard or doctor), to follow, to shad 名付ける(なづける): to name (someone) 付属(ふぞく): attached, belonging, affiliated, annexed, associated, subordinate, incidental, dependent, auxiliary 打付ける(ぶつける): to knock, to run into, to nail on, to strike hard, to hit and attack 付録(ふろく): appendix, supplement 結び付き(むすびつき): connection, relation 結び付く(むすびつく): to be connected or related, to join together 結び付ける(むすびつける): to combine, to join, to tie on, to attach with a knot 目付き(めつき): look, expression of the eyes, eyes やっ付ける(やっつける): to beat 言い付ける(いいつける): tell, tell on (someone), to order, to charge, to direct 追い付く(おいつく): overtake, catch up (with) 思い付く(おもいつく): think of, hit upon, come into one´s mind 片付く(かたづく): be put in order, be put to rights, be disposed of, be solved, be finished, be married (off) 気付く(きづく): notice, recognize, become aware of, perceive, realize 寄付(きふ): contribution, donation 気を付ける(きをつける): be careful, pay attention 言付ける(ことづける): send word, send a message 近付ける(ちかづける): bring near, put close, let come near, associate with 付き合い(つきあい): association, token Details Story Dictionary 符 token Heisig's Bamboo . . . adhere. Koohii #1 I dropped my token down the drain, so I used a piece of bamboo with chewing gum on the end to retrieve it. Koohii #2 At the arcade, Mr. T adheres a bamboo rod to his token so that he can put it in the machine and pull it out repeatedly. municipality Details Story Dictionary 府 municipality My Story [Cave + adhere/stick to] Even if a municipality is in a *cave*, you have to *adhere* to its policies. Koohii #1 A municipality, like any type of government, adheres to having caves for offices (see government office (#591)). Koohii #2 Even if a municipality is in a cave, you have to adhere to its policies. Primitives borough, municipality, cave, adhere, sellotape, person, glue 政府(せいふ): government, administration Kunyomi: Onyomi: フ Lesson: 27 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds:	municipality 府 画数8 1077 Details Story Dictionary 府 municipality My Story [Cave + adhere/stick to] Even if a municipality is in a *cave*, you have to *adhere* to its policies. responsibility Details Story Dictionary 任 responsibility My Story [Person + King] A *person* living like a *king* has no responsibilities Koohii #1 It is always Mr. T´s responsibility to be the porter and carry around everyone´s luggage because he´s so strong. Koohii #2 In pregnancy (#507), the woman was the porter for the first nine months. Now, as a new father, Mr.T is assuming all the RESPONSIBILITIES that comes with it. Can´t you just see him here as the new porter, wearing a harness with a his little dude (who already has a little matching mohawk)? Primitives responsibility, person, porter, drop, samurai 就任(しゅうにん): inauguration 主任(しゅにん): person in charge, responsible official 信任(しんにん): trust, confidence, credence 転任(てんにん): change of post 任務(にんむ): duty, function, office, mission, task 任命(にんめい): appointment, nomination, ordination, commission, designation 赴任(ふにん): (proceeding to) new appointment 任す(まかす): to entrust, to leave to a person 責任(せきにん): duty, responsibility 任せる(まかせる): entrust to another, leave to, do something at one´s leisure Kunyomi: まか.せる、まか.す Onyomi: ニン Lesson: 27 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 任す (まか.す), 任せる (まか.せる)	responsibility 任 画数6 1078 Details Story Dictionary 任 responsibility My Story [Person + King] A *person* living like a *king* has no responsibilities Koohii #1 It is always Mr. T´s responsibility to be the porter and carry around everyone´s luggage because he´s so strong. Koohii #2 In pregnancy (#507), the woman was the porter for the first nine months. Now, as a new father, Mr.T is assuming all the RESPONSIBILITIES that comes with it. "fare Details Story Dictionary 賃 fare My Story The *responsibility* {任} of paying the rent *money* is like a painful blow to my CHIN. Koohii #1 It´s your own responsibility to pay the bus fare with the correct number of shells/money. Koohii #2 In Japan they have automatic ticket gates so you cant easily cheat on your train fare. In England however the ticket gates are fairly open. It is a different kind of system. In England you are given the RESPONSIBILITY to put in the right amount of MONEY, but if you are caught cheating, the fines are stiff and you feel like a real CHINCHIN. ""un.CHIN"". Primitives fare, responsibility, person, porter, drop, samurai, shellfish, clam, oyster, eye, animal legs, eight 運賃(うんちん): freight rates, shipping expenses, fare 賃金(ちんぎん): wages 家賃(やちん): rent Kunyomi: Onyomi: チン Lesson: 27 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"	"fare 賃 画数13 1079 Details Story Dictionary 賃 fare My Story The *responsibility* {任} of paying the rent *money* is like a painful blow to my CHIN. In England however the ticket gates are fairly open. It is a different kind of system. In England you are given the RESPONSIBILITY to put in the right amount of MONEY, but if you are caught cheating, the fines are stiff and you feel like a real CHINCHIN. ""un.CHIN"". Primitives fare, responsibility, person, porter, drop, samurai, shellfish, clam, oyster, eye, animal legs, eight 運賃(うんちん): freight rates, shipping expenses, fare 賃金(ちんぎん): wages 家賃(やちん): rent Kunyomi: Onyomi: チン Lesson: 27 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"
"substitute Details Story Dictionary 代 substitute Heisig's Person . . . arrow. Koohii #1 Mister T substitutes an arrow for a toothpick -- The keyword meaning is to replace something with something else, to act for another, to represent. It´s best to stick to the first meaning, because the last two are very close to ""mediator"" which will come in frame 1761. The idea here is that the arrow is not a toothpick, neither it is changed into one, but it can substitute for one. Koohii #2 Mr. T shot the substitute teacher with an arrow. Primitives substitute, person, arrow 代える(かえる): to exchange, to interchange, to substitute, to replace 代わる(かわる): to take the place of, to relieve, to be substituted for, to be exchanged, to change places with, to take turns, to be replaced 代わる代わる(かわるがわる): alternately 古代(こだい): ancient times 代(しろ): price, materials, substitution 世代(せだい): generation, the world, the age 先代(せんだい): family predecessor, previous age, previous generation 代弁(だいべん): pay by proxy, act for another, speak for another 代用(だいよう): substitution お代わり(おかわり): second helping, another cup 代る(かわる): take the place of, relieve, be substituted for, be exchanged, change places with, take turns, be replaced 近代(きんだい): present day 現代(げんだい): nowadays, modern times, present-day 代金(だいきん): price, payment, cost, charge, the money, the bill 代表(だいひょう): representative, representation, delegation, type, example, model 代名詞(だいめいし): pronoun 代理(だいり): representation, agency, proxy, deputy, agent, attorney, substitute, alternate, acting (principal, etc.) 年代(ねんだい): age, era, period, date 代わり(かわり): instead of 時代(じだい): age, period, generation Kunyomi: か.わる、かわ.る、かわ.り、-がわ.り、か.える、よ、しろ Onyomi: ダイ、タイ Lesson: 27 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds: 代理 (だいり), 世代 (せだい), 現代 (げんだい), 代える (か.える), 代わる (か.わる), 代 (しろ), 代 (よ)"	"substitute 代 画数5 1080 Details Story Dictionary 代 substitute Heisig's Person . . . arrow. "sack Details Story Dictionary 袋 sack My Story A *generation* of *cloth* (LID + KICK IN BALLS) was stashed in a sack Koohii #1 A sack is an easy substitute for a garment. Koohii #2 A worker who was recently sacked from his job, is wearing a sack of potatoes as a substitute garment (naked otherwise), in some kind of protest. The kanji is close to frame 1547 ""bag"", and although the later really refers to a ""straw sack"", I use the image of a sack of potatoes here, and that of a ""plastic bag"" for frame 1547. The keywords would have been better swapped in my opinion, but the relevancy is not so important at this point (see notes of Lesson 31 in the book). Primitives sack, substitute, person, arrow, garment 足袋(たび): Japanese socks (with split toe) 袋(ふくろ): bag, sack 手袋(てぶくろ): gloves Kunyomi: ふくろ Onyomi: タイ、ダイ Lesson: 27 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 袋 (ふくろ)"	"sack 袋 画数11 1081 Details Story Dictionary 袋 sack My Story A *generation* of *cloth* (LID + KICK IN BALLS) was stashed in a sack Koohii #1 A sack is an easy substitute for a garment. lend Details Story Dictionary 貸 lend My Story [ time period/ generation {代} + shellfish/money] A *generation* asked their elders to lend them some money/shellfish 貸す(かす) Koohii #1 In order for the bank to lend you money, you need to put up some sort of collateral as a substitute for the money. Koohii #2 The poor substitute teacher asks the class to lend him some money for the bus fare home. Primitives lend, substitute, person, arrow, shellfish, clam, oyster, eye, animal legs, eight 貸し(かし): loan, lending 貸し出し(かしだし): lending, loaning 貸間(かしま): room to let 貸家(かしや): house for rent 貸す(かす): lend Kunyomi: か.す、か.し-、かし- Onyomi: タイ Lesson: 27 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds: 貸す (か.す)	lend 貸 画数12 1082 Details Story Dictionary 貸 lend My Story [ time period/ generation {代} + shellfish/money] A *generation* asked their elders to lend them some money/shellfish 貸す(かす) Koohii #1 In order for the bank to lend you money, you need to put up some sort of collateral as a substitute for the money. Koohii #2 The poor substitute teacher asks the class to lend him some money for the bus fare home. "change Details Story Dictionary 化 change Heisig's Person . . . spoon. Koohii #1 Referring to a scene in the movie ""The Matrix"" where a girl bends a spoon with the power of her mind alone, I imagine Mister T who changes a spoon into something else (maybe the waiter forgot to bring knives or forks). Note: as a primitive, it can help to use the image of ""spare change"", this can help you keep it distinct from other similar kanji such as ""shape"" or ""turn into"". Koohii #2 Mr. T reaches into his wallet for some spare change but it has all changed into spoons. Primitives change, person, spoon, sitting on the ground 悪化(あっか): deterioration, growing worse, aggravation, degeneration, corruption 化合(かごう): chemical combination 化する(かする): to change into, to convert into, to transform, to be reduced, to influence, to improve (someone) 化石(かせき): fossil, petrifaction, fossilization 化繊(かせん): synthetic fibres 誤魔化す(ごまかす): to deceive, to falsify, to misrepresent 酸化(さんか): oxidation 進化(しんか): evolution, progress 退化(たいか): degeneration, retrogression 化ける(ばける): to appear in disguise, to take the form of, to change for the worse 文化財(ぶんかざい): cultural assets, cultural property 化学(かがく): chemistry 強化(きょうか): strengthen, intensify, reinforce, solidify 化粧(けしょう): make-up (cosmetic) 消化(しょうか): digestion 変化(へんか): change, variation, alteration, mutation, transition, transformation, variety, diversity, inflection, declension, conjugation 文化(ぶんか): culture Kunyomi: ば.ける、ば.かす、ふ.ける、け.する Onyomi: カ、ケ Lesson: 27 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 化石 (かせき), 化学 (かがく), 文化 (ぶんか), 化かす (ば.かす), 化ける (ば.ける)"	"change 化 画数4 1083 Details Story Dictionary 化 change Heisig's Person . . . spoon. flower Details Story Dictionary 花 flower Heisig's Flower . . . change. Koohii #1 The flowers change with the seasons. Koohii #2 The flower is the essence of transience. So, the conceptual flower involves both the concept of flower plus change. Primitives flowers, change, person, spoon, sitting on the ground 花壇(かだん): flower bed 花粉(かふん): pollen 花びら(はなびら): (flower) petal 火花(ひばな): spark 生け花(いけばな): flower arrangement 花火(はなび): fireworks 花見(はなみ): cherry blossom viewing, flower viewing 花嫁(はなよめ): bride 花瓶(かびん): (flower) vase 花(はな): flower Kunyomi: はな Onyomi: カ、ケ Lesson: 27 Jouyou: 1 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds: 花 (はな)	flower 花 画数7 1084 Details Story Dictionary 花 flower Heisig's Flower . . . change. Koohii #1 The flowers change with the seasons. Koohii #2 The flower is the essence of transience. So, the conceptual flower involves both the concept of flower plus change. Primitives flowers, change, person, spoon, sitting on the ground 花壇(かだん): flower bed 花粉(かふん): pollen 花びら(はなびら): (flower) petal 火花(ひばな): spark 生け花(いけばな): flower arrangement 花火(はなび): fireworks 花見(はなみ): cherry blossom viewing, flower viewing 花嫁(はなよめ): bride 花瓶(かびん): (flower) vase 花(はな): flower Kunyomi: はな Onyomi: カ、ケ Lesson: 27 Jouyou: 1 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds: 花 (はな)
freight Details Story Dictionary 貨 freight Heisig's Change . . . shells. Koohii #1 Freight is the shells (money) paid to change the location of something big. Don´t confuse with the similar 賃 fare (#1004). Koohii #2 This is a freight train that runs on spare change. Imagine getting on the freight train with a bunch of spare change. You put in some change and it starts up...goes for a few minutes, then starts to slow down. You look at the slot..there´s actually a slot for spare change and one for regular shells. Your call, but it seems to prefer spare change over shells. Primitives freight, change, person, spoon, sitting on the ground, shellfish, clam, oyster, eye, animal legs, eight 外貨(がいか): imported goods, foreign money 貨幣(かへい): money, currency, coinage 雑貨(ざっか): miscellaneous goods, general goods, sundries 貨物(かもつ): cargo, freight, money or assets 硬貨(こうか): coin 通貨(つうか): currency Kunyomi: たから Onyomi: カ Lesson: 27 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds:	freight 貨 画数11 1085 Details Story Dictionary 貨 freight Heisig's Change . . . shells. Koohii #1 Freight is the shells (money) paid to change the location of something big. Don´t confuse with the similar 賃 fare (#1004). Koohii #2 This is a freight train that runs on spare change. Imagine getting on the freight train with a bunch of spare change. You put in some change and it starts up...goes for a few minutes, then starts to slow down. You look at the slot..there´s actually a slot for spare change and one for regular shells. Your call, but it seems to prefer spare change over shells. Primitives freight, change, person, spoon, sitting on the ground, shellfish, clam, oyster, eye, animal legs, eight 外貨(がいか): imported goods, foreign money 貨幣(かへい): money, currency, coinage 雑貨(ざっか): miscellaneous goods, general goods, sundries 貨物(かもつ): cargo, freight, money or assets 硬貨(こうか): coin 通貨(つうか): currency Kunyomi: たから Onyomi: カ Lesson: 27 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds:
lean Details Story Dictionary 傾 lean Heisig's Change . . . head. The key word has the sense of leaning on or toward someone or something. Koohii #1 Mr. T gave a girl some change to lean over and give him head. Koohii #2 Leaning over changes the position of the head...　　　　　　　　　　RTK2:　ケイ　傾向　けいこう(tendency). what Details Story Dictionary 何 what Heisig's Person . . . can. Koohii #1 What can Mr T do? ´You mean: what can´t MR T do, you fool´. Koohii #2 What can´t Mr. T not do? Primitives what, person, can, mouth, street, nail, spike 如何(いかが): how, in what way 如何に(いかに): how?, in what way?, how much?, however, whatever 如何にも(いかにも): indeed, really, phrase meaning agreement 何れ(いずれ): where, which, who, anyway, anyhow, at any rate 何時(いつ): when, how soon 何時か(いつか): sometime, some day 何時でも(いつでも): (at) any time, always, at all times, never (neg), whenever 何時の間にか(いつのまにか): before one knows, unnoticed, unawares 何時も(いつも): always, usually, every time, never (with neg. verb) 如何しても(どうしても): by all means, at any cost, no matter what, after all, in the long run, cravingly, at any rate, surely 何方(どちら): which, who 何の(どの): which, what 何れ(どれ): well, now, let me see, which (of three or more) 何々(どれどれ): which (emphatic) 何故(なぜ): why, how 何気ない(なにげない): casual, unconcerned 何しろ(なにしろ): at any rate, anyhow, anyway, in any case 何卒(なにとぞ): please 何も(なにも): nothing 何より(なにより): most, best 何だか(なんだか): a little, somewhat, somehow 何て(なんて): how...!, what...! 何と(なんと): what, how, whatever 何となく(なんとなく): somehow or other, for some reason or another 何とも(なんとも): nothing (with neg. verb), quite, not a bit 何なり(なんなり): any, anything, whatever 何か(なにか): something 何々(なになに): such and such, What?, What is the matter? 何分(なにぶん): anyway, please 何で(なんで): Why? What for? 何でも(なんでも): by all means, everything 何とか(なんとか): somehow, anyhow, one way or another 何(なに): what Kunyomi: なに、なん、なに-、なん- Onyomi: カ Lesson: 27 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 5 Compounds: 何 (なに)	what 何 画数7 1087 Details Story Dictionary 何 what Heisig's Person . . . can. Koohii #1 The entire town wants to get rid of legal prostitutes, but the sagacious Mr T realizes that they are a benefit to the economy and society. So he lets the sa-geishas stay. Koohii #2 (re: sweetneet) Since he is not very sagacious, Mr. T failed his driver´s license and now needs to resort to his walking legs to get around. bystander Details Story Dictionary 傍 bystander Heisig's Person . . . stand . . . crown . . . compass. Koohii #1 In Japan, the emperor is a bystander - he stands on his crown but can´t really affect the direction of the country. (thx shimouma). Koohii #2 Mr. T is in the street, standing up, wearing an golden crown and a compass in his hand... he´s asking the bystander if they know how to get to buckingham palace (!).
