ax Details Story Dictionary 斤 ax Heisig's This character represents a picture of an ax, the two vertical lines being the handle and the horizontal strokes of the blade. Note the writing order carefully. Koohii #1 Errata: stroke order in 4th edition is wrong. Top stroke is first. Koohii #2 The axe-wielding maniac nails a poor victim, right under a cliff. Blood everywhere! (thanks scottamus!). Primitives axe Kunyomi: おの Onyomi: キン Lesson: 31 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	ax 斤 画数4 1206 Details Story Dictionary 斤 ax Heisig's This character represents a picture of an ax, the two vertical lines being the handle and the horizontal strokes of the blade. place Details Story Dictionary 所 place Heisig's Door . . . ax. Koohii #1 You outsiders better learn your place! An axe stuck in the door when you get home is a pretty good indicator that this might not be the best place for you. Koohii #2 A place for everything and everything in its place. To the right of the door is the standard place for the axe. Primitives place, door, one, ceiling, flag, axe 所謂(いわゆる): the so-called, so to speak 箇所(かしょ): passage, place, point, part 所在(しょざい): whereabouts 所持(しょじ): possession, owning 所々(しょしょ): here and there, some parts (of something) 所属(しょぞく): attached to, belong to 所定(しょてい): fixed, prescribed 所得(しょとく): income, earnings 所が(ところが): however, while, even if 所で(ところで): by the way, even if, no matter what 余所見(よそみ): looking away, looking aside 個所(かしょ): passage, place, point, part 所為(せい): act, deed, one´s doing 短所(たんしょ): defect, demerit, weak point, disadvantage 長所(ちょうしょ): strong point, merit, advantage 停留所(ていりゅうじょ): bus or tram stop 所々(ところどころ): here and there, some parts (of something) 場所(ばしょ): place, location 便所(べんじょ): toilet, lavatory, rest room, latrine 名所(めいしょ): famous place 役所(やくしょ): government office, public office 余所(よそ): another place, somewhere else, strange parts 近所(きんじょ): neighbor hood 事務所(じむしょ): office 住所(じゅうしょ): address 台所(だいどころ): kitchen 所(ところ): place Kunyomi: ところ、-ところ、どころ、とこ Onyomi: ショ Lesson: 31 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 所 (ところ)	place 所 画数8 1208 Details Story Dictionary 所 place Heisig's Door . . . ax. pray Details Story Dictionary 祈 pray My Story [ネkrophilia + Axe] The *ネkorophile* prayed to god for mercy before was killed with an *axe* Koohii #1 Religious freedom has not always been respected throughout history, and nobody knew how to force religion on an indigenous people like the Spanish missionaries. They posted conquistadors at either side of the altars at the local missions, and if anybody refused to pray, they would get the axe. Koohii #2 A warrior prays for victory before the battle. He kneels at the altar, his battle axe at the ready. Primitives pray, altar, axe 祈り(いのり): prayer, supplication 祈る(いのる): pray Kunyomi: いの.る Onyomi: キ Lesson: 31 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 祈る (いの.る)	pray 祈 画数8 1209 Details Story Dictionary 祈 pray My Story [ネkrophilia + Axe] The *ネkorophile* prayed to god for mercy before was killed with an *axe* Koohii #1 Religious freedom has not always been respected throughout history, and nobody knew how to force religion on an indigenous people like the Spanish missionaries. near Details Story Dictionary 近 near Heisig's Ax . . . road. Be careful not to confuse with draw near (Frame 204) or bystander (Frame 1090). Koohii #1 The end is near. The axe-murderer is waiting for you on the road... Koohii #2 An absurd image, but working for me: two points A and B are separated by a long road. To make A and B near, take an ax, cut a big chunk of road, and the work is done. Primitives near, axe, road 近眼(きんがん): nearsightedness, shortsightedness, myopia 近々(きんきん): nearness, before long 近郊(きんこう): suburbs, outskirts 近視(きんし): shortsightedness 近付く(ちかづく): to approach, to get near, to get acquainted with, to get closer 手近(てぢか): near, handy, familiar 身近(みぢか): near oneself, close to one, familiar 近代(きんだい): present day 接近(せっきん): getting closer, approaching 近頃(ちかごろ): lately, recently, nowadays 近々(ちかぢか): nearness, before long 近付ける(ちかづける): bring near, put close, let come near, associate with 近寄る(ちかよる): approach, draw near 付近(ふきん): neighbourhood, vicinity, environs 近所(きんじょ): neighbor hood 最近(さいきん): recently 近い(ちかい): near, close by, short 近く(ちかく): near, neighbourhood, vicinity Kunyomi: ちか.い Onyomi: キン、コン Lesson: 31 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds: 近い (ちか.い)	near 近 画数7 1210 Details Story Dictionary 近 near Heisig's Ax . . . road. "fold Details Story Dictionary 折 fold Heisig's Fingers . . . ax. Hint: make an image out of the Japanese art of ""origami"" (paper-folding). Koohii #1 It´s the latest Japanese game show: Forudo! Contestants are given a sheet of paper and are told to fold it into a complex origami shape. If they´re not done in 60 seconds, a huge axe descends from the ceiling and chops their work in half. Contestants know to recoil their hands from the falling axe, but some have been so absorbed in folding, they ignore the buzzer and get their fingers chopped off. Koohii #2 Fold some origami into the shape of an axe with your fingers. It´s even as sharp, so watch out for paper cuts! Primitives fold, finger, fingers, axe 折り返す(おりかえす): to turn up, to fold back 屈折(くっせつ): bending, indentation, refraction 折衷(せっちゅう): compromise, cross, blending, eclecticism 時折(ときおり): sometimes 折る(おる): break, fold, pick (flower) 骨折(こっせつ): bone fracture 折角(せっかく): with trouble, at great pains, long-awaited 折れる(おれる): break, snap Kunyomi: お.る、おり、お.り、-お.り、お.れる Onyomi: セツ Lesson: 31 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 折る (お.る), 折れる (お.れる), 折 (おり)"	"fold 折 画数7 1211 Details Story Dictionary 折 fold Heisig's Fingers . . . ax. philosophy Details Story Dictionary 哲 philosophy Heisig's Fold . . . mouth. Koohii #1 A two-hour lesson of philosophy in high school. All the students, bored to death, are folding sheets of paper into planes, love notes or whatever, while the mouth of the teacher is talking about Platon, Kierkegaard and many other notorious philosophers. Koohii #2 I fold my mouth, therefore I am. Primitives philosophy, fold, finger, fingers, axe, mouth 哲学(てつがく): philosophy Kunyomi: さとい、あき.らか、し.る、さば.く Onyomi: テツ Lesson: 31 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	philosophy 哲 画数10 1212 Details Story Dictionary 哲 philosophy Heisig's Fold . . . mouth. "departed Details Story Dictionary 逝 departed Heisig's The connotation is of a ""dearly departed"" who has passed away. The elements: fold . . . road. Koohii #1 One of the dearest of Japan´s dearly departed is Sasaki Sadako, who developed Leukemia after the bombing of Hiroshima, and became famous for folding more than a thousand paper cranes, never giving up hope. To this day, people in Hiroshima still fold origami cranes in her memory. For this character, let us imagine a parade in her honor, the entire road lined with folded cranes. Koohii #2 The BIG ONE hits Tokyo. You see a news report of the recently departed victims who died when the roads folded (from the earthquake). Primitives departed, fold, finger, fingers, axe, road Kunyomi: ゆ.く、い.く Onyomi: セイ Lesson: 31 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 逝く (ゆ.く)"	"departed 逝 画数10 1213 Details Story Dictionary 逝 departed Heisig's The connotation is of a ""dearly departed"" who has passed away. The elements: fold . . . road. Koohii #1 One of the dearest of Japan´s dearly departed is Sasaki Sadako, who developed Leukemia after the bombing of Hiroshima, and became famous for folding more than a thousand paper cranes, never giving up hope. To this day, people in Hiroshima still fold origami cranes in her memory. For this character, let us imagine a parade in her honor, the entire road lined with folded cranes. Koohii #2 The BIG ONE hits Tokyo. You see a news report of the recently departed victims who died when the roads folded (from the earthquake). "vow Details Story Dictionary 誓 vow Heisig's Fold . . . words. Koohii #1 This Japanese couple wrote the vows that they had made to each other onto a piece of paper and then folded it into an origami, and put it somewhere in their appartment. To everybody else it is an origami, but to them it is also a symbol of their vows. -- ""the folded words are vows"". Note : in this story and a few others I use the image of an origami for the primitive ""fold"". Koohii #2 A Japanese wedding tradition is to present each other with origami cranes with their vows written on the BOTTOM. Primitives vow, fold, finger, fingers, axe, say, words, keitai, mouth 誓う(ちかう): swear, vow, take an oath, pledge Kunyomi: ちか.う Onyomi: セイ Lesson: 31 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 誓う (ちか.う)"	"vow 誓 画数14 1214 Details Story Dictionary 誓 vow Heisig's Fold . . . words. To everybody else it is an origami, but to them it is also a symbol of their vows. -- ""the folded words are vows"". Note : in this story and a few others I use the image of an origami for the primitive ""fold"". Koohii #2 A Japanese wedding tradition is to present each other with origami cranes with their vows written on the BOTTOM. Primitives vow, fold, finger, fingers, axe, say, words, keitai, mouth 誓う(ちかう): swear, vow, take an oath, pledge Kunyomi: ちか.う Onyomi: セイ Lesson: 31 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 誓う (ちか.う)"
"chop off Details Story Dictionary 斬 chop off Heisig's Car . . . ax. Koohii #1 A ""chop shop"" is a place where stolen cars are taken, and parts chopped off with an axe, to be sold. Koohii #2 I wanted a convertible so I chopped off the top of my car with an axe. Primitives chop off, executioner, car, axe 斬る(きる): murder, behead Kunyomi: き.る Onyomi: ザン、サン、セン、ゼン Lesson: 31 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: Compounds: 斬る (き.る)"	"chop off 斬 画数11 1215 Details Story Dictionary 斬 chop off Heisig's Car . . . ax. temporarily Details Story Dictionary 暫 temporarily Heisig's Chop off . . . days. Koohii #1 Your car has been savagely (see steadily) attacked by an ax. It will be some days before your car is fixed. So you are temporarily without car. Koohii #2 Today is Car Axe Day. The day where you can temporarily (today only) attack cars using an axe without punishment. Primitives temporarily, executioner, chop off, car, axe, sun, day 暫く(しばらく): little while Kunyomi: しばら.く Onyomi: ザン Lesson: 31 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	temporarily 暫 画数15 1216 Details Story Dictionary 暫 temporarily Heisig's Chop off . . . days. steadily Details Story Dictionary 漸 steadily Heisig's Water . . . chop off. Koohii #1 I imagine firemen working steadily to rescue a man from a crashed car. First, they spray it with water; then, they use an axe to break through the window. Koohii #2 Water + Car + Axe: The steadily rising water was filling the car, but the firefighters took their axe and broke the window, getting me out. Primitives steadily, water, water droplets, water pistol, executioner, chop off, car, axe 漸く(ようやく): gradually, finally, hardly Kunyomi: やや Onyomi: ゼン Lesson: 31 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	steadily 漸 画数14 1217 Details Story Dictionary 漸 steadily Heisig's Water . . . chop off. "decision/judgement/refuse (sever Details Story Dictionary 断 decision/judgement/refuse (sever My Story [""L"" + Rice/America + Ax] Don't take *""L""* if your Hooked on *rice*. #Sever# your tie to your addiction by symbollically *axing* it. Koohii #1 [Based on fuaburisu´s] A man puts some rice on a fishhook as bait, but catches a fish so strong, he needs to take out his axe and sever the line lest he be dragged into the depths. Koohii #2 When you get the ax at work, use your severance pay to buy fishhooks and rice. At least that way you can eat sushi. Primitives severance, fishhook, rice, axe 決断(けつだん): decision, determination 断言(だんげん): declaration, affirmation 断然(だんぜん): firmly, absolutely, definitely 断面(だんめん): cross section 中断(ちゅうだん): interruption, suspension, break 無断(むだん): without permission, without notice 横断(おうだん): crossing 断る(ことわる): refuse, reject, dismiss, turn down, decline, inform, give notice, ask leave, excuse oneself (from) 診断(しんだん): diagnosis 断水(だんすい): water outage 断定(だんてい): conclusion, decision 判断(はんだん): judgement, decision, adjudication, conclusion, decipherment, divination 油断(ゆだん): negligence, unpreparedness Kunyomi: た.つ、ことわ.る、さだ.める Onyomi: ダン Lesson: 31 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 断る (ことわ.る), 断つ (た.つ)"	"decision/judgement/refuse (sever 断 画数11 1218 Details Story Dictionary 断 decision/judgement/refuse (sever My Story [""L"" + Rice/America + Ax] Don't take *""L""* if your Hooked on *rice*. #Sever# your tie to your addiction by symbollically *axing* it. Koohii #1 [Based on fuaburisu´s] A man puts some rice on a fishhook as bait, but catches a fish so strong, he needs to take out his axe and sever the line lest he be dragged into the depths. Koohii #2 When you get the ax at work, use your severance pay to buy fishhooks and rice. At least that way you can eat sushi. Primitives severance, fishhook, rice, axe 決断(けつだん): decision, determination 断言(だんげん): declaration, affirmation 断然(だんぜん): firmly, absolutely, definitely 断面(だんめん): cross section 中断(ちゅうだん): interruption, suspension, break 無断(むだん): without permission, without notice 横断(おうだん): crossing 断る(ことわる): refuse, reject, dismiss, turn down, decline, inform, give notice, ask leave, excuse oneself (from) 診断(しんだん): diagnosis 断水(だんすい): water outage 断定(だんてい): conclusion, decision 判断(はんだん): judgement, decision, adjudication, conclusion, decipherment, divination 油断(ゆだん): negligence, unpreparedness Kunyomi: た.つ、ことわ.る、さだ.める Onyomi: ダン Lesson: 31 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 断る (ことわ.る), 断つ (た.つ)"
substance / quality Details Story Dictionary 質 substance / quality My Story [Axes + shellfish/money] These *two axes* are the best-#quality# SHIT *money* can buy. They are an item of #substance# Koohii #1 What is this substance on this clam? I´ve already broken 2 axes on it! (Good question...質問). Koohii #2 Another keyword that I do not like by Heisig. 質【しつ】 (n,n-suf) quality. Story: Your at a local ax dealer and you have TWO AXES which you are testing for QUALITY by trying to split CLAMS right down the opening. Picture yourself succeeding with one AX and then some weird SUBSTANCE comes out of the shell...eww (I don´t like clams). Primitives substance, axe, shellfish, clam, oyster, eye, animal legs, eight, axe2 気質(かたぎ): spirit, character, trait, temperament, disposition 質疑(しつぎ): question 実質(じっしつ): substance, essence 質素(しっそ): simplicity, modesty, frugality 蛋白質(たんぱくしつ): protein 人質(ひとじち): hostage, prisoner 品質(ひんしつ): quality 本質(ほんしつ): essence, true nature, reality 良質(りょうしつ): good quality, superior quality 質(しつ): quality 性質(せいしつ): nature, property, disposition 素質(そしつ): character, qualities, genius 地質(ちしつ): geological features 物質(ぶっしつ): material, substance 質問(しつもん): question, inquiry Kunyomi: たち、ただ.す、もと、わりふ Onyomi: シツ、シチ、チ Lesson: 31 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds: 質問 (しつもん), 質実 (しつじつ), 本質 (ほんしつ), 質屋 (しちや), 人質 (ひとじち)	substance / quality 質 画数15 1219 Details Story Dictionary 質 substance / quality My Story [Axes + shellfish/money] These *two axes* are the best-#quality# SHIT *money* can buy. They are an item of #substance# Koohii #1 What is this substance on this clam? I´ve already broken 2 axes on it! (Good question...質問). Koohii #2 Another keyword that I do not like by Heisig. 質【しつ】 (n,n-suf) quality. Story: Your at a local ax dealer and you have TWO AXES which you are testing for QUALITY by trying to split CLAMS right down the opening. Picture yourself succeeding with one AX and then some weird SUBSTANCE comes out of the shell...eww (I don´t like clams). Primitives substance, axe, shellfish, clam, oyster, eye, animal legs, eight, axe2 気質(かたぎ): spirit, character, trait, temperament, disposition 質疑(しつぎ): question 実質(じっしつ): substance, essence 質素(しっそ): simplicity, modesty, frugality 蛋白質(たんぱくしつ): protein 人質(ひとじち): hostage, prisoner 品質(ひんしつ): quality 本質(ほんしつ): essence, true nature, reality 良質(りょうしつ): good quality, superior quality 質(しつ): quality 性質(せいしつ): nature, property, disposition 素質(そしつ): character, qualities, genius 地質(ちしつ): geological features 物質(ぶっしつ): material, substance 質問(しつもん): question, inquiry Kunyomi: たち、ただ.す、もと、わりふ Onyomi: シツ、シチ、チ Lesson: 31 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds: 質問 (しつもん), 質実 (しつじつ), 本質 (ほんしつ), 質屋 (しちや), 人質 (ひとじち)

See the drop of blood on it? Koohii #2 The quality expectations are very high in our axe manufacturing facility. If there´s one drop of rust on any axe, it gets rejected. lie Details Story Dictionary 詐 lie Heisig's The lie in this character refers to falsehoods and fibs. Its elements: words . . . saw. Koohii #1 Pinnochio gets frustrated that every time he utters a word of a lie, his nose grows and he has to get the saw out again. Koohii #2 Her lies are words that cut not like a knife, no not cleanly, but savagely like a saw. "make Details Story Dictionary 作 make Heisig's Person . . . saw. Koohii #1 Mr T.´s favorite magazine is Make. He loves to make things. But he´s a purist: he only uses saws, no power tools. Koohii #2 When the A-Team crash lands on a deserted island, Mr. T salvages a saw from the wreckage and says, ""I don´t know about y´all foos, but I´m gonna make a raft."". Primitives make, person, saw 凶作(きょうさく): bad harvest, poor crop 原作(げんさく): original work 工作(こうさく): work, construction, handicraft, maneuvering 耕作(こうさく): cultivation, farming 作(さく): a work, a harvest 作戦(さくせん): military or naval operations, tactics, strategy 作物(さくぶつ): literary work 作用(さよう): action, operation, effect, function 創作(そうさく): production, literary creation, work 駄作(ださく): poor work, rubbish 作り(つくり): make-up, sliced raw fish 豊作(ほうさく): abundant harvest, bumper crop 発作(ほっさ): fit, spasm 傑作(けっさく): masterpiece, best work, blunder 作業(さぎょう): work, operation, manufacturing, fatigue duty 作者(さくしゃ): author 作成(さくせい): frame, draw up, make, producing, creating, preparing, writing, 作製(さくせい): manufacture 作品(さくひん): work, opus, performance, production 作物(さくもつ): literary work 作家(さっか): author, writer, novelist, artist 作曲(さっきょく): composition, setting (of music) 作法(さほう): manners, etiquette, propriety 制作(せいさく): work (film, book) 製作(せいさく): manufacture, production 操作(そうさ): operation, management, processing 動作(どうさ): action, movements, motions, bearing, behaviour, manners 名作(めいさく): masterpiece 作文(さくぶん): composition, writing 作る(つくる): to make, create, manufacture, construct, draw up, write, compose, build, cultivate, organize, establish, make up (a face), trim (a tree), prepare (food), commit (sin) Kunyomi: つく.る、つく.り、-づく.り Onyomi: サク、サ Lesson: 31 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds: 作為 (さくい), 著作 (ちょさく), 豊作 (ほうさく), 作る (つく.る)"	"make 作 画数7 1224 Details Story Dictionary 作 make Heisig's Person . . . saw. snow Details Story Dictionary 雪 snow Heisig's Rain that undergoes a change so that it can be swept aside with a broom is snow. Koohii #1 SNOW isn´t all that different from RAIN, except it can be removed with a BROOM because it only forms in freezing temperatures. Koohii #2 Rain just soaks into the soil. Snow has to be swept away with a broom...　RTK2:　セツ　積雪　せきせつ(pilled up snow). record Details Story Dictionary 録 record Heisig's Metal . . . broom . . . rice. Note how the final stroke of the broom is extended slightly when an element below is attached directly to it. Koohii #1 A monk won a gold metal for breaking the current record for most swept rice in one minute. Koohii #2 This character is about a recording for a music box. The tines of the mechanism are like a metal broom and the little pins on the cylinder are like metal grains of rice. peel off Details Story Dictionary 剥 剝 peel off Heisig's Broom . . . rice grains . . . saber. Koohii #1 Peel off the outside of the broom that sweeps up rice grains to reveal a saber. Koohii #2 A multi-purpose broom! It cleans, it sweeps (rice!), it hits! In fact, peel off the mahogany exterior to uncover a sabre! It slices, it dices, it kills! "inquire Details Story Dictionary 尋 inquire Heisig's Broom . . . craft . . . mouth . . . glue. Koohii #1 The policed inquired into the erotica scandal. They tried to sweep away the evidence, but some of it stuck. (Note: katakana エロ ero in the middle of this kanji is the Japanese word for erotica.). Koohii #2 As a verb this means, this means ""to ask; to enquire; to search; to look for; to look into; to investigate;"". Imagine the police inquiring in an in-depth investigation. They are interrogating a suspect. But the suspect has a crafty mouth and is very sly. He/she also knows when to keep their mouth shut(glued) at the right moments to avoid self-incrimination. As a final measure, the police torture the suspect by tickling him/her with a broom while they inquire. Primitives inquire, broom, craft, mouth, glue 尋ねる(たずねる): ask Kunyomi: たず.ねる、ひろ Onyomi: ジン Lesson: 31 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 尋ねる (たず.ねる)"	"inquire 尋 画数12 1228 Details Story Dictionary 尋 inquire Heisig's Broom . . . craft . . . mouth . . . glue. calm Details Story Dictionary 穏 calm Heisig's Wheat . . . vulture . . . broom . . . heart. Koohii #1 The farmer is calm knowing that his wheat fields are protected from vultures by his strawman with a heart (all the better to do the job properly). Koohii #2 This whole kanji is a picture of calmness. The wheat has been harvested and even the vultures sit calmly watching the humans sweep and clean-up after the harvest is over. Hearts are peaceful and calm at this time of the year. Even the days are calm without storm. Primitives calm, wheat, cereal, hideaway, claw, vulture, broom, heart 穏やか(おだやか): calm, gentle, quiet Kunyomi: おだ.やか Onyomi: オン Lesson: 31 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 穏やか (おだ.やか)	calm 穏 画数16 1230 Details Story Dictionary 穏 calm Heisig's Wheat . . . vulture . . . broom . . . heart. lie down Details Story Dictionary 寝 lie down My Story [Crown + turtle + ヨ + lid + against/crotch] Koohii #1 After work, the French maid goes home and lies down with a turtle. Turtle? Well, he´s sloooow and always hard... (thanks to Nukemarine and Wakela!). Koohii #2 After being hit on the head encroach (#1148), the condom salesman goes back to his house to lie down. He hasn´t made a single sale today, so he doesn´t have enough money to buy a pillow. He lies down on his pet turtle and cries himself to sleep. Primitives lie down, house, turtle, French maid, tickle, broom, crown, crotch 寝かせる(ねかせる): to put to bed, to lay down, to ferment 寝台(しんだい): bed, couch 寝坊(ねぼう): sleeping in late 寝巻(ねまき): sleep-wear, nightclothes, pyjamas, nightgown, nightdress 昼寝(ひるね): nap (at home), siesta 朝寝坊(あさねぼう): over sleep 寝る(ねる): go to bed, lie down, sleep Kunyomi: ね.る、ね.かす、い.ぬ、みたまや、や.める Onyomi: シン Lesson: 31 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 寝かす (ね.かす), 寝る (ね.る)	lie down 寝 画数13 1233 Details Story Dictionary 寝 lie down My Story [Crown + turtle + ヨ + lid + against/crotch] Koohii #1 After work, the French maid goes home and lies down with a turtle. Turtle? Well, he´s sloooow and always hard... (thanks to Nukemarine and Wakela!). Koohii #2 After being hit on the head encroach (#1148), the condom salesman goes back to his house to lie down. Koohii #2 The LADY of the house is nothing more than a WOMAN who´s a HOUSEWIFE (BROOM and APRON anyone?). sweep Details Story Dictionary 掃 sweep Heisig's Fingers . . . broom . . . apron. Koohii #1 Whether I SWEEP something away with my FINGERS or my BROOM, I should always wear my APRON. Koohii #2 FINGERS of the HOUSEWIFE (in itself, holding a BROOM, with an APRON) busily SWEEP the floor. Primitives sweep, finger, fingers, feather duster, broom, apron, crown, towel 清掃(せいそう): cleaning 掃く(はく): to brush, sweep, gather up 掃除(そうじ): cleaning, sweeping Kunyomi: は.く Onyomi: ソウ、シュ Lesson: 31 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 掃く (は.く)	sweep 掃 画数11 1235 Details Story Dictionary 掃 sweep Heisig's Fingers . . . broom . . . apron. "hit Details Story Dictionary 当 hit Heisig's Little . . . broom. Koohii #1 Some mothers use a small broom to hit their children when they misbehave. Koohii #2 Here is a weird carnival game where you hold a broom like a javelin and throw it, trying to hit the center of a very small target. The target is so small, in fact, that if someone does manage to hit it, the operator turns in surprise and says, ""Whoa, really?! (本当?!)"". Primitives hit, small, broom 当たり(あたり): hit, success, reaching the mark, per ..., vicinity, neighborhood 当たり前(あたりまえ): usual, common, ordinary, natural, reasonable, obvious 当て(あて): object, aim, end, hopes, expectations 当て字(あてじ): phonetic-equivalent character, substitute character 当てはまる(あてはまる): to apply (a rule) 当てはめる(あてはめる): to apply, to adapt 該当(がいとう): corresponding, answering to, coming under 正当(せいとう): just, justifiable, right, due, proper, equitable, reasonable, legitimate, lawful 手当て(てあて): allowance, compensation, treatment, medical care 当選(とうせん): being elected, winning the prize 当人(とうにん): the one concerned, the said person 日当(にっとう): daily allowance 不当(ふとう): injustice, impropriety, unreasonableness, undeservedness, unfair, invalid 本当(ほんとう): truth, reality 割り当て(わりあて): allotment, assignment, allocation, quota, rationing 当たる(あたる): be hit, be successful, confront, lie (in the direction of), undertake, be equivalent to, be applicable, be assigned 当てる(あてる): to hit 見当(けんとう): be found, aim, mark, estimate, guess, approximation, direction, 心当たり(こころあたり): having some knowledge of, happening to know 相当(そうとう): suitable, fair, tolerable, proper, extremely 妥当(だとう): valid, proper, right, appropriate 担当(たんとう): (in) charge 突き当たり(つきあたり): end (e.g. of street) 突き当たる(つきあたる): run into, collide with 当時(とうじ): at that time, in those days 当日(とうじつ): appointed day 当番(とうばん): being on duty 日当たり(ひあたり): exposure to the sun, sunny place 弁当(べんとう): lunch box 適当(てきとう): appropriate お弁当(おべんとう): lunch box Kunyomi: あ.たる、あ.たり、あ.てる、あ.て、まさ.に、まさ.にべし Onyomi: トウ Lesson: 31 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 当たる (あ.たる), 当てる (あ.てる)"	"hit 当 画数6 1236 Details Story Dictionary 当 hit Heisig's Little . . . broom. "glossary Details Story Dictionary 彙 glossary Heisig's The top primitive of this character is actually an old form of broom. The remaining elements are: crown . . . fruit. Koohii #1 People who read the glossary are mutually exclusive (exclude the top line of mutually (#757) ) from those who eat crowned fruit イ はりねずみ same kind 語彙. Koohii #2 I was having mutual difficulties in my relationship. She was always the one wearing the crown and I was the one picking the fruit. In order to fix the problem I checked the glossary for ""mutual difficulties"" but found nothing. I guess we´re going to have to mutually end our relationship. Primitives glossary, broken broom, mutual, crown, fruit, rice field, brains, tree, wood, broom* 語彙(ごい): vocabulary, glossary Kunyomi: はりねずみ Onyomi: イ Lesson: 31 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: Compounds:"	"glossary 彙 画数13 1237 Details Story Dictionary 彙 glossary Heisig's The top primitive of this character is actually an old form of broom. contend Details Story Dictionary 争 contend Heisig's Bound up . . . rake. Koohii #1 This can be seen as a Retarius, a roman gladiator. The Retiarius always fought with a net to bound up his opponents, and with a trident, which was able to pierce enemies after tying them. They were terrific contenders, so they were only paired with gladiators specially equipped to fight them. Koohii #2 A boxing ring is bound up by the ropes. The contender is cheating and using a rake. Primitives contend, bound up, rake 争い(あらそい): dispute, strife, quarrel, dissension, conflict, rivalry, contest 抗争(こうそう): dispute, resistance 紛争(ふんそう): dispute, trouble, strife 争う(あらそう): argue, dispute 論争(ろんそう): controversy, dispute 競争(きょうそう): compete 戦争(せんそう): war Kunyomi: あらそ.う、いか.でか Onyomi: ソウ Lesson: 31 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 争う (あらそ.う)	contend 争 画数6 1238 Details Story Dictionary 争 contend Heisig's Bound up . . . rake. Koohii #2 The water contends against the dirt in the ultimate battle for cleaninless. matter Details Story Dictionary 事 matter Heisig's This key word here refers to abstract matters. The elements are: one . . . mouth . . . rake. Note how the rake handle reaches out the top and bottom of the character. Koohii #1 I had to take one day off from work due to ´personal matters´ after stepping on a rake and having the handle snap up and smack me across the mouth. I certainly wasn´t going to tell anyone about it. Koohii #2 Just one word about this matter from your mouth and you will find this rake across it. Primitives matter, one, ceiling, mouth, rake 大事(おおごと): important, valuable, serious matter お大事に(おだいじに): Take care of yourself 議事堂(ぎじどう): Diet building 旧事(くじ): past events, bygones 軍事(ぐんじ): military affairs 検事(けんじ): public prosecutor 事(こと): thing, matter, fact, circumstances, business, reason, experience 事柄(ことがら): matter, thing, affair, circumstance 事によると(ことによると): depending on the circumstances 些事(さじ): something small or petty, trifle 事業(じぎょう): project, enterprise, business, industry, operations 事項(じこう): matter, item, facts 事前(じぜん): prior, beforehand, in advance 従事(じゅうじ): engaging, pursuing, following 食事(しょくじ): meal 百科事典(ひゃっかじてん): encyclopedia 返事(へんじ): reply, answer 家事(かじ): housework, domestic chores 記事(きじ): article, news story, report, account 行事(ぎょうじ): event, function 刑事(けいじ): criminal case, (police) detective 工事(こうじ): construction work 事件(じけん): event, affair, incident, case, plot, trouble, scandal 事実(じじつ): fact, truth, reality 事情(じじょう): circumstances, consideration, conditions, situation, reasons 事態(じたい): situation, present state of affairs, circumstances 事務(じむ): business, office work 炊事(すいじ): cooking, culinary arts 知事(ちじ): prefectural governor 出来事(できごと): incident, affair, happening, event 判事(はんじ): judge, judiciary 無事(ぶじ): safety, peace, quietness 見事(みごと): splendid, magnificent, beautiful, admirable 物事(ものごと): things, everything 領事(りょうじ): consul 火事(かじ): fire 事故(じこ): accident 事務所(じむしょ): office 大事(だいじ): important 用事(ようじ): business, errand 仕事(しごと): work, occupation, employment Kunyomi: こと、つか.う、つか.える Onyomi: ジ、ズ Lesson: 31 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds: 事物 (じぶつ), 無事 (ぶじ), 師事 (しじ), 事 (こと)	matter 事 画数8 1240 Details Story Dictionary 事 matter Heisig's This key word here refers to abstract matters. "T'ang Details Story Dictionary 唐 T'ang Heisig's The key word here refers of course to the T'ang Dynasty in China (and not to the name of the drink astronauts take with them into outer space, though this could be useful for the next frame). Its elements: cave . . . rake . . . mouth. Koohii #1 Two archeologists are in a cave looking at Chinese artifacts from various eras. One picks up a rake and says, ""What about this – T´ang, do you think?"" The second puts the rake in his mouth and answers, ""Yes, it does tang a bit"". Koohii #2 Screw it, this character refers to the drink. The powdery orange substance is actually found on the floor of tropical caves, where trained aboriginal peoples use wooden rakes to rake the Tang into a pile before putting a bit of it in their mouths to see if it´s tasty or not. Primitives T’ang, cave, rake, mouth Kunyomi: から Onyomi: トウ Lesson: 31 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: Compounds: 唐 (から)"	"T'ang 唐 画数10 1241 Details Story Dictionary 唐 T'ang Heisig's The key word here refers of course to the T'ang Dynasty in China (and not to the name of the drink astronauts take with them into outer space, though this could be useful for the next frame). Its elements: cave . . . rake . . . mouth. Koohii #1 Two archeologists are in a cave looking at Chinese artifacts from various eras. One picks up a rake and says, ""What about this – T´ang, do you think?"" The second puts the rake in his mouth and answers, ""Yes, it does tang a bit"". Koohii #2 Screw it, this character refers to the drink. The powdery orange substance is actually found on the floor of tropical caves, where trained aboriginal peoples use wooden rakes to rake the Tang into a pile before putting a bit of it in their mouths to see if it´s tasty or not. Primitives T’ang, cave, rake, mouth Kunyomi: から Onyomi: トウ Lesson: 31 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: Compounds: 唐 (から)"
sugar Details Story Dictionary 糖 sugar Heisig's Rice . . . T'ang. Koohii #1 Sugar made from rice has a tangy flavour. Koohii #2 The T´ang are the ones who began using sugar in China--of course, the first thing they tried it on was rice. Primitives sugar, rice, T’ang, cave, rake, mouth 砂糖(さとう): sugar Kunyomi: Onyomi: トウ Lesson: 31 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	sugar 糖 画数16 1242 Details Story Dictionary 糖 sugar Heisig's Rice . . . sane Details Story Dictionary 康 sane Heisig's Cave . . . sieve. Koohii #1 A psychiatric hospital is located in a CAVE. To determine, which patients are sane and can be released, they are given a SIEVE and asked to empty a bathtub (the sane ones take out the plug and get the water out with ease). Koohii #2 People on the cave age became more sane after they started using sieves to avoid eating harmful things with their grains. (This kanji is almost exclusively used to write 健康, health). Primitives ease, sane, cave, sieve, rake, grains of rice 健康(けんこう): health, sound, wholesome Kunyomi: Onyomi: コウ Lesson: 31 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	sane 康 画数11 1243 Details Story Dictionary 康 sane Heisig's Cave . . . sieve. Koohii #2 People on the cave age became more sane after they started using sieves to avoid eating harmful things with their grains. (This kanji is almost exclusively used to write 健康, health). Primitives ease, sane, cave, sieve, rake, grains of rice 健康(けんこう): health, sound, wholesome Kunyomi: Onyomi: コウ Lesson: 31 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:
"apprehend Details Story Dictionary 逮 apprehend Heisig's Think of apprehending criminals. The elements are: sieve . . . road. Koohii #1 Think police roadblocks. They act like road sieves, letting good people through but apprehending criminals. Koohii #2 In Space Balls, they were combing the desert in order to apprehend Lone Star. Picture Dark Helmet saying ""Combing the desert failed, we must now sieve the road!"". Primitives apprehend, sieve, rake, grains of rice, road 逮捕(たいほ): arrest, apprehension, capture Kunyomi: Onyomi: タイ Lesson: 31 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"	"apprehend 逮 画数11 1244 Details Story Dictionary 逮 apprehend Heisig's Think of apprehending criminals. The elements are: sieve . . . road. Koohii #1 Think police roadblocks. They act like road sieves, letting good people through but apprehending criminals. Koohii #2 In Space Balls, they were combing the desert in order to apprehend Lone Star. Picture Dark Helmet saying ""Combing the desert failed, we must now sieve the road!"". Primitives apprehend, sieve, rake, grains of rice, road 逮捕(たいほ): arrest, apprehension, capture Kunyomi: Onyomi: タイ Lesson: 31 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"
"Italy Details Story Dictionary 伊 Italy Heisig's Used chiefly in proper names, and given the sound ""i,"" this kanji can be remembered as an abbreviation of Italy, for which it is still used today in Japan. Its primitives: person . . . mop. Koohii #1 The ""boot"" of Italy has gotten Europe all muddy. Who else could mop it up but Mr T? Koohii #2 Here I have Mister T cleaning up with a mop, a real mess of spaghetti, in front of the Piza (in Italy). Primitives italy, person, mop 伊井(いい): that one, Italy Kunyomi: かれ Onyomi: イ Lesson: 31 Jouyou: Names JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"	"Italy 伊 画数6 1245 Details Story Dictionary 伊 Italy Heisig's Used chiefly in proper names, and given the sound ""i,"" this kanji can be remembered as an abbreviation of Italy, for which it is still used today in Japan. Its primitives: person . . . mop. Koohii #1 The ""boot"" of Italy has gotten Europe all muddy. Who else could mop it up but Mr T? Koohii #2 Here I have Mister T cleaning up with a mop, a real mess of spaghetti, in front of the Piza (in Italy). Primitives italy, person, mop 伊井(いい): that one, Italy Kunyomi: かれ Onyomi: イ Lesson: 31 Jouyou: Names JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"
"old boy Details Story Dictionary 君 old boy Heisig's The somewhat highbrow British term of address is chosen hereto represent the kanji for a form of address used towards one's juniors. It is composed of: mop . . . mouth. Koohii #1 There´s a tendancy in Japan to make the younger members (kouhai) clean up after the older members (senpai) of a group, which results in a lot of grumbling and whining. ""Well old boy,"" a senpai might say, ""If you did as much work with the mop as you do with your mouth, you would have been done an hour ago"". Koohii #2 The Beatles, english old boys, had hairs like mop and a good singing mouth. Primitives old boy, mop, mouth 君(くん): Mr (junior), master, boy 君主(くんしゅ): ruler, monarch 諸君(しょくん): Gentlemen!, Ladies! 君(きみ): you Kunyomi: きみ、-ぎみ Onyomi: クン Lesson: 31 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 君 (きみ)"	"old boy 君 画数7 1246 Details Story Dictionary 君 old boy Heisig's The somewhat highbrow British term of address is chosen hereto represent the kanji for a form of address used towards one's juniors. It is composed of: mop . . . mouth. Koohii #1 There´s a tendancy in Japan to make the younger members (kouhai) clean up after the older members (senpai) of a group, which results in a lot of grumbling and whining. "flock Details Story Dictionary 群 flock Heisig's Old boys . . . sheep. Koohii #1 Good ol´ boys are like sheep; they tend to flock together. Koohii #2 A little girl herder calls out, ""羊君、きて！"" to the sheeps and they flock to her at once. "-proof Details Story Dictionary 耐 -proof Heisig's The key word is a suffix used to indicate ""safe from"" or ""protected against,"" as in the words rustproof, waterproof, and fireproof. It is composed of: comb . . . glue. Koohii #1 [akrodha] My comb is rust-proof, water-proof, and fire-proof. But unfortunately it is not idiot-proof--and I glued it to myself. Koohii #2 I spent $100 recently on this excellent rust-proof, water-proof, fire-proof comb. But two days after having bought it, I left it in my back pocket and sat down, snapping this expensive comb in half! I glued it back together, but now every time I try to comb through my thick hair, it just breaks apart again. I guess my comb is also glue-proof. Primitives proof, comb, glue 耐える(たえる): to bear, to endure Kunyomi: た.える Onyomi: タイ Lesson: 31 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 耐える (た.える)"	"-proof 耐 画数9 1248 Details Story Dictionary 耐 -proof Heisig's The key word is a suffix used to indicate ""safe from"" or ""protected against,"" as in the words rustproof, waterproof, and fireproof. "demand Details Story Dictionary 需 demand Heisig's The sense of demand is best captured by thinking of the economic principle of ""supply and demand."" The primitives: rain . . . comb. Koohii #1 Supply and demand is a simple concept: when it rains, the demand for combs goes up to deal with wet hair. Koohii #2 If it´s raining combs, then the demand for them sure does drop. Primitives demand, rain, weather, comb 需要(じゅよう): demand, request 必需品(ひつじゅひん): necessities, necessary article, requisite, essential Kunyomi: Onyomi: ジュ Lesson: 31 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"	"demand 需 画数14 1249 Details Story Dictionary 需 demand Heisig's The sense of demand is best captured by thinking of the economic principle of ""supply and demand."" "Confucian Details Story Dictionary 儒 Confucian Heisig's Person . . . demand. Koohii #1 No more Confucian jibba-jabba! I demand you tell me why it´s raining combs!"". Koohii #2 One day, Mr. T started reading the little proverbs he found in fortune cookies, and with this newfound wisdom he became a Confucian scholar. He was suddenly in high demand as people came from all over to ask for his sage advice, immensely satisfied with suggestions such as, ""You will find happiness with a new love"". Primitives confucian, person, demand, rain, weather, comb Kunyomi: Onyomi: ジュ Lesson: 31 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"	"Confucian 儒 画数16 1250 Details Story Dictionary 儒 Confucian Heisig's Person . . . demand. edge Details Story Dictionary 端 edge My Story *Stand* on the edge of the *mountain* and *comb* your hair (FYI you are super nonchalant) Koohii #1 Have you ever seen those shots in movies where the hero is standing at the edge of a sheer mountain face, hair blowing in the wind? It probably wouldn´t seem so heroic if you saw him ten minutes earlier, when a crew of stylists was carefully combing his hair so it would fall perfectly. Koohii #2 When you stand a comb on its edge, it looks like the mountain (#768) kanji. Primitives edge, vase, stand up, pick-axe, mountain, comb 極端(きょくたん): extreme, extremity 半端(はんぱ): remnant, fragment, incomplete set, fraction, odd sum, incompleteness 先端(せんたん): pointed end, tip, fine point, spearhead, cusp, vanguard, advanced, leading edge 途端(とたん): just (now, at the moment, etc.) 端(はし): edge, tip, margin, point, end (e.g. of street) Kunyomi: はし、は、はた、-ばた、はな Onyomi: タン Lesson: 31 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 端 (は), 端 (はし), 端 (はた)	edge 端 画数14 1251 Details Story Dictionary 端 edge My Story *Stand* on the edge of the *mountain* and *comb* your hair (FYI you are super nonchalant) Koohii #1 Have you ever seen those shots in movies where the hero is standing at the edge of a sheer mountain face, hair blowing in the wind? both Details Story Dictionary 両 both My Story 1. The bull dog's face has a *nail* shape with *George Micheal's mustache* and *a mountain* for a nose. 2. Looks like a bull dogs face; Koohii #1 Primatives celing; belt; mountain as per Cumulative Errata. See volfy post for link. Both effective ways to commit suicide, hang your self from the celing with your belt or jump off a mountain. full Details Story Dictionary 満 full Heisig's Water . . . flowers . . . both. Given the abstract nature of this last primitive, you may want to borrow the image from the previous frame. Koohii #1 Add water THEN the flowers. With both the vase will be full. Koohii #2 I was thirsty so I gulped down the water. Then I realized I was also hungry. So I ate the flowers. Yes, I am responsible for both the missing water and the missing flowers. Yes, I´m afraid both. Am I still hungry or thirsty? Thank you for asking! How kind! But no, I feel quite full now. Primitives full, water, water droplets, water pistol, flowers, both, street, nail, spike, belt, shovel 円満(えんまん): perfection, harmony, peace, smoothness, completeness, satisfaction, integrity 満月(まんげつ): full moon 満場(まんじょう): unanimous, whole audience 満たす(みたす): to satisfy, to ingratiate, to fill, to fulfill 不満(ふまん): dissatisfaction, displeasure, discontent, complaints, unhappiness 満員(まんいん): full house, no vacancy, sold out, standing room only, full (of people), crowded 満足(まんぞく): satisfaction 満点(まんてん): perfect score 満ちる(みちる): be full, rise (tide), mature, expire 未満(みまん): less than, insufficient Kunyomi: み.ちる、み.つ、み.たす Onyomi: マン、バン Lesson: 31 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 満たす (み.たす), 満ちる (み.ちる)	full 満 画数12 1253 Details Story Dictionary 満 full Heisig's Water . . . flowers . . . both. brush-stroke Details Story Dictionary 画 brush-stroke Heisig's In forming an image for the key word, it is helpful to know that this kanji is used for artistic representations (like a completed painting), and as a counter for the number of brush-strokes in a character (as, for instance, in Indexes II and III at the end of this book). Its elements are: ceiling . . . sprout . . . shovel. Koohii #1 You decide one day to paint a kanji on your ceiling. Unfortunately, you don’t have a brush, so, being innovative, you use a sprout. Knowing it could be messy, you search for a drop-cloth, but can’t find one. Instead, you put a shovel down on the floor to catch any drips resulting from the BRUSH-STROKEs. Koohii #2 To paint a kanji in your ceiling with only natural materials, you use a sprout as a brush and shovel some dirt to use as paint for your strokes. [modified from johnskb´s]. Primitives brush-stroke, one, ceiling, sprout, shoot, shovel 画(かく): stroke 画期(かっき): epoch-making 企画(きかく): planning, project 区画(くかく): division, section, compartment, boundary, area, block 版画(はんが): art print 絵画(かいが): picture 画家(がか): painter, artist 計画(けいかく): plan 漫画(まんが): cartoon 映画(えいが): movie, film 映画館(えいがかん): movie theatre (theater), cinema Kunyomi: えが.く、かく.する、かぎ.る、はかりごと、はか.る Onyomi: ガ、カク、エ、カイ Lesson: 31 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds: 画家 (がか), 図画 (ずが), 映画 (えいが)	brush-stroke 画 画数8 1254 Details Story Dictionary 画 brush-stroke Heisig's In forming an image for the key word, it is helpful to know that this kanji is used for artistic representations (like a completed painting), and as a counter for the number of brush-strokes in a character (as, for instance, in Indexes II and III at the end of this book). Its elements are: ceiling . . . sprout . . . shovel. Koohii #1 You decide one day to paint a kanji on your ceiling. Unfortunately, you don’t have a brush, so, being innovative, you use a sprout. Knowing it could be messy, you search for a drop-cloth, but can’t find one. Instead, you put a shovel down on the floor to catch any drips resulting from the BRUSH-STROKEs. tooth Details Story Dictionary 歯 tooth Heisig's Footprint . . . rice . . . shovel. Koohii #1 Stop shoveling rice into your mouth, you´ll hurt a tooth! Use chopsticks instead. Koohii #2 My dentist used his foot and a shovel to dislodge the rice stuck between my teeth. Primitives tooth, stop, footprint, bag of rice, shovel 歯科(しか): dentistry 歯車(はぐるま): gear, cog-wheel 歯磨き(はみがき): dentifrice, toothpaste 虫歯(むしば): cavity, tooth decay, decayed tooth 歯医者(はいしゃ): dentist 歯(は): tooth Kunyomi: よわい、は、よわ.い、よわい.する Onyomi: シ Lesson: 31 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 歯 (は)	tooth 歯 画数12 1255 Details Story Dictionary 歯 tooth Heisig's Footprint . . . rice . . . shovel. "bend Details Story Dictionary 曲 bend Heisig's Picture yourself grabbing hold of the two strokes poking out the top of the kanji and wrenching them apart, thus giving the sense of bend. If you think of them as deriving from the element for brains beneath (of course, the middle stroke has been reduplicated and pulled out to where it can be grabbed hold of), you can associate the key word with bending someone's mind to your own point of view. Koohii #1 It looks like the mouth of Bender the robot, from Matt Groening´s animated series ""Futurama"". Thus, I use the character Bender the robot as a primitive. Koohii #2 Also means ""melody"". Think of it as a pictogram of a guitar where you have to bend the strings to make a melody. Primitives bend, rice field, brains, stick 婉曲(えんきょく): euphemistic, circumlocution, roundabout, indirect, insinuating 戯曲(ぎきょく): play, drama 曲(きょく): tune, piece of music 曲がる(まがる): to turn, to bend 曲線(きょくせん): curve 作曲(さっきょく): composition, setting (of music) 曲げる(まげる): bend, lean, be crooked 曲る(まがる): curve, be bent, be crooked, turn Kunyomi: ま.がる、ま.げる Onyomi: キョク Lesson: 31 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 曲がる (ま.がる), 曲げる (ま.げる)"	"bend 曲 画数6 1256 Details Story Dictionary 曲 bend Heisig's Picture yourself grabbing hold of the two strokes poking out the top of the kanji and wrenching them apart, thus giving the sense of bend. "encounter Details Story Dictionary 遭 encounter Heisig's Cadet . . . road. Koohii #1 Close encounters of the third kind. The space cadet encounters aliens on the road. Koohii #2 Bender the cadet (see frame 1172) has an ""encounter of the third kind"" on the road. Reference to Steven Spielberg´s 1977 movie ""Close Encounters of the Third Kind"". Also a reference to popular stories of people reportedly chased by UFO´s while driving on the road. Primitives encounter, cadet, one, bend, sun, day, road 遭難(そうなん): disaster, shipwreck, accident 遭う(あう): meet, encounter (often something unpleasant) Kunyomi: あ.う、あ.わせる Onyomi: ソウ Lesson: 31 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 遭う (あ.う)"	"encounter 遭 画数14 1258 Details Story Dictionary 遭 encounter Heisig's Cadet . . . road. Reference to Steven Spielberg´s 1977 movie ""Close Encounters of the Third Kind"". Also a reference to popular stories of people reportedly chased by UFO´s while driving on the road. Koohii #2 The space cadet is in training, rowing in the water (see it splash). vat Details Story Dictionary 槽 vat Heisig's Tree . . . cadet. Koohii #1 Also as part of some army survival exercise, the cadets (including Bender see frame 1172) are sent into the woods to build a vat (for collecting water for example). Koohii #2 Bender the Cadet (kudos to Fuaburisu) is found on an army training exercise, hiding behind a tree, getting drunk on the famous scotch whiskey Vat 69. Primitives vat, tree, wood, cadet, one, bend, sun, day Kunyomi: ふね Onyomi: ソウ Lesson: 31 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	vat 槽 画数15 1260 Details Story Dictionary 槽 vat Heisig's Tree . . . cadet. Koohii #1 Also as part of some army survival exercise, the cadets (including Bender see frame 1172) are sent into the woods to build a vat (for collecting water for example). Koohii #2 Bender the Cadet (kudos to Fuaburisu) is found on an army training exercise, hiding behind a tree, getting drunk on the famous scotch whiskey Vat 69. Primitives vat, tree, wood, cadet, one, bend, sun, day Kunyomi: ふね Onyomi: ソウ Lesson: 31 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:
"Big Dipper Details Story Dictionary 斗 Big Dipper Heisig's The Big Dipper here is of course the constellation of Ursa Major, of which this kanji is a sort of pictographic representation. * Since we already have a primitive element for a ""dipper"" - namely, the ladle - we shall let this one stand for a measuring cup. By the way, it would make a rather large one, since the kanji is also used for a measure of about 18 liters! Koohii #1 Since the meaning of ""big dipper"" is rather specific and the sense of measurement seems to be a more common usage, I concentrate on the primative meaning of measuring cup. This is a pictograph, with the first two strokes representing the measuring ticks on the side of the cup. Koohii #2 Is it just me, or do all of these traditional kanji pictographs look like they were drawn by a retarded bunny rabbit? Primitives big dipper, measuring cup, big dipper, The Plough, drop, ten, needle Kunyomi: Onyomi: ト、トウ Lesson: 31 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"	"Big Dipper 斗 画数4 1261 Details Story Dictionary 斗 Big Dipper Heisig's The Big Dipper here is of course the constellation of Ursa Major, of which this kanji is a sort of pictographic representation. * Since we already have a primitive element for a ""dipper"" - namely, the ladle - we shall let this one stand for a measuring cup. By the way, it would make a rather large one, since the kanji is also used for a measure of about 18 liters! Koohii #1 Since the meaning of ""big dipper"" is rather specific and the sense of measurement seems to be a more common usage, I concentrate on the primative meaning of measuring cup. This is a pictograph, with the first two strokes representing the measuring ticks on the side of the cup. Koohii #2 Is it just me, or do all of these traditional kanji pictographs look like they were drawn by a retarded bunny rabbit? Primitives big dipper, measuring cup, big dipper, The Plough, drop, ten, needle Kunyomi: Onyomi: ト、トウ Lesson: 31 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"
fee (ingredients) Details Story Dictionary 料 fee (ingredients) My Story [Rice + Spice rack] The #ingredients# needed are *rice*, it can be found in the *spice rack*; there aint no #fee# Koohii #1 When buying rice, the fee is calculated by the cup. Naturally we don´t just use any cup; it has to be a proper measuring cup. Koohii #2 Samurai(s) once received their fee in the form of rice that had been carefully weighed in a measuring cup beforehand. Primitives fee, rice, measuring cup, big dipper, The Plough, drop, ten, needle 衣料(いりょう): clothing 香辛料(こうしんりょう): spices 燃料(ねんりょう): fuel 肥料(ひりょう): manure, fertilizer 料(りょう): material, charge, rate, fee 給料(きゅうりょう): salary, wages 原料(げんりょう): raw materials 材料(ざいりょう): ingredients, material 食料(しょくりょう): food 資料(しりょう): materials, data 送料(そうりょう): postage 調味料(ちょうみりょう): condiment, seasoning 無料(むりょう): free, no charge 有料(ゆうりょう): admission-paid, toll 料金(りょうきん): fee, charge, fare 食料品(しょくりょうひん): foods 料理(りょうり): cooking, cookery, cuisine Kunyomi: Onyomi: リョウ Lesson: 31 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds:	fee (ingredients) 料 画数10 1262 Details Story Dictionary 料 fee (ingredients) My Story [Rice + Spice rack] The #ingredients# needed are *rice*, it can be found in the *spice rack*; there aint no #fee# Koohii #1 When buying rice, the fee is calculated by the cup. department Details Story Dictionary 科 department My Story Weed (*wheat*) and spice (*spice rack*) are used for *SCIENCE* Koohii #1 The national DEPARTMENT of WHEATS and MEASURES. Get it? This one was hard until I came up with this. Koohii #2 Agriculture/astronomy departments...　　　　　　　　　　　　　　RTK2:　カ　科学　かがく (science). Primitives department, wheat, cereal, measuring cup, big dipper, The Plough, drop, ten, needle 亜科(あか): suborder, subfamily 科(か): department, section 眼科(がんか): ophthalmology 教科(きょうか): subject, curriculum 産婦人科(さんふじんか): maternity and gynecology department 歯科(しか): dentistry 耳鼻科(じびか): otolaryngology 小児科(しょうにか): pediatrics 百科事典(ひゃっかじてん): encyclopedia 百科辞典(ひゃっかじてん): encyclopedia 学科(がっか): study subject, course of study 科目(かもく): (school) subject, curriculum, course 教科書(きょうかしょ): text book 外科(げか): surgical department 自然科学(しぜんかがく): natural science 社会科学(しゃかいかがく): social science 人文科学(じんぶんかがく): social sciences, humanities 内科(ないか): internist clinic, internal medicine 理科(りか): science 科学(かがく): science Kunyomi: Onyomi: カ Lesson: 31 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds:	department 科 画数9 1263 Details Story Dictionary 科 department My Story Weed (*wheat*) and spice (*spice rack*) are used for *SCIENCE* Koohii #1 The national DEPARTMENT of WHEATS and MEASURES. "map Details Story Dictionary 図 map Heisig's Pent in . . . Big Dipper. Hint: among the songs dating from the days of slavery that have become part of American folklore is one called ""Follow the Drinking Gourd."" It referred to the nighttime travel of runaway slaves (those pent in) who had no maps other than the stars to guide them, among them the bright and predominant Big Dipper, the ""Drinking Gourd."" Koohii #1 Can´t see direct relation to Big Dipper (#1177) since its writing order is completely different. As raulir noted, it´s written as overlapping at the last stroke of ツ and the first of メ. I take it as a pictograph or treasure map. Two dots represent big trees and the cross (marking the treasure) is placed relative to them. Koohii #2 A pictograph of a treasure map. Two steps east then X marks the spot. 図る はかる attempt, deceive; 地図 ちず map; 意図する いとする make a goal, intend to do. Primitives map, pent in, measuring cup, big dipper, The Plough, drop, ten, needle 意図(いと): intention, aim, design 指図(さしず): instruction, mandate 図々しい(ずうずうしい): impudent, shameless 図る(はかる): to plot, to attempt, to plan, to take in, to deceive, to devise, to design, to refer A to B 合図(あいず): sign, signal 図(ず): drawing, picture, illustration 図鑑(ずかん): picture book 図形(ずけい): figure 図表(ずひょう): chart, diagram, graph 図書(としょ): books 地図(ちず): map 図書館(としょかん): library Kunyomi: え、はか.る Onyomi: ズ、ト Lesson: 31 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds: 図画 (ずが), 図表 (ずひょう), 地図 (ちず), 図る (はか.る)"	"map 図 画数7 1264 Details Story Dictionary 図 map Heisig's Pent in . . . Big Dipper. Hint: among the songs dating from the days of slavery that have become part of American folklore is one called ""Follow the Drinking Gourd."" It referred to the nighttime travel of runaway slaves (those pent in) who had no maps other than the stars to guide them, among them the bright and predominant Big Dipper, the ""Drinking Gourd."" I take it as a pictograph or treasure map. Two dots represent big trees and the cross (marking the treasure) is placed relative to them. Koohii #2 A pictograph of a treasure map. "utilize Details Story Dictionary 用 utilize Heisig's Meat . . . walking stick. Be sure to keep this key word distinct from that for use (Frame 1065). The stroke order is exactly as you would expect it from the order of the primitive elements as given. * As a primitive element, we shall substitute the image of a screwdriver, perhaps the most utilized of all tools around the house. Koohii #1 To tenderize meat in an emergency wilderness situation, just utilize your walking stick! Koohii #2 I´ll confuse this with use (#990), so build a distinction right from the start. For me, ""utilize"" has an artificial, business-speak connotation; you only utilize ""utilize"" when you´re trying to puff up what you´re saying and sound important. So: ""BioTools Inc introduces the FG2000 screwdriver, utilizing the our latest FleshGrip(tm) technology!"" I´m seeing this as a picture of a stubby screwdriver with a handle made of flesh, a short shaft, and prongs to hold a screw in place until you drive it. Primitives utilize, moon, month, flesh, part of the body, walking stick 運用(うんよう): making use of, application, investment, practical use 慣用(かんよう): common, customary 兼用(けんよう): multi-use, combined use, combination, serving two purposes 公用(こうよう): government business, public use, public expense 雇用(こよう): employment (long term), hire 採用(さいよう): use, adopt 作用(さよう): action, operation, effect, function 私用(しよう): personal use, private business 使用人(しようにん): employee, servant 専用(せんよう): exclusive use, personal use 代用(だいよう): substitution 無用(むよう): useless, futility, needlessness, unnecessariness 用件(ようけん): business 用紙(ようし): blank form 用品(ようひん): articles, supplies, parts 用法(ようほう): directions, rules of use 濫用(らんよう): abuse, misuse, misappropriation, using to excess 引用(いんよう): quotation, citation 応用(おうよう): application, put to practical use 活用(かつよう): conjugation, practical use 器用(きよう): skillful, handy 実用(じつよう): practical use, utility 信用(しんよう): confidence, dependence, credit, faith, reliance, belief, credence 使用(しよう): use, employment 通用(つうよう): popular use, circulation 適用(てきよう): applying 日用品(にちようひん): daily necessities 費用(ひよう): cost, expense 用いる(もちいる): use, make use of 用語(ようご): term, terminology 用心(ようじん): care, precaution, caution 用途(ようと): use, usefulness 用(よう): business, errand 用意(ようい): prepare 用事(ようじ): business, errand 利用(りよう): use Kunyomi: もち.いる Onyomi: ヨウ Lesson: 31 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds: 用いる (もち.いる)"	"utilize 用 画数5 1265 Details Story Dictionary 用 utilize Heisig's Meat . . . walking stick. comfortable Details Story Dictionary 庸 comfortable Heisig's Cave . . . rake . . . screwdriver. Koohii #1 To live a comfortable life, single men need only a cave for living, a rake for cleaning and a screwdriver for fixing. Koohii #2 When I first moved in to my new cave, all I had was a bed (see bed (#592)). But now I´ve settled in, got myself a few handy things like a rake and a screwdriver, and made myself more comfortable. Primitives commonplace, comfortable, cave, rake, screwdriver, utilise, utilize, moon, month, flesh, part of the body, walking stick Kunyomi: Onyomi: ヨウ Lesson: 31 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	comfortable 庸 画数11 1266 Details Story Dictionary 庸 comfortable Heisig's Cave . . . rake . . . screwdriver. equip Details Story Dictionary 備 equip My Story [Person + flowers + cliff (no dot) + Use {用}] A *person* who wants a *flower* and that will climb to the top of a cliff, will have many *uses*, you should equip them as a friend. Koohii #1 Mr. T wants to climb up and pick the flowers at the top of the cliff. He equips himself with screwdrivers to use as climbing spikes to reach the top of the cliff. Imagine a large AMMO belt full of philips screwdrivers instead of bullets. Koohii #2 An RPG where you´re using Mr T as a character. Before you enter a battle, you equip the flower cliff screwdriver. This is a small screwdriver obtained at the bottom of a cliff that, when used in battle, shoots out pink flowers. When they touch the ground in front of the enemy, they create a massive cliff, and the ground under the enemy falls away into the sea. Picture being at the item select menu and EQUIPping this item just before facing a tough boss. Primitives equip, person, flowers, cliff, screwdriver, utilise, utilize, moon, month, flesh, part of the body, walking stick 軍備(ぐんび): armaments, military preparations 守備(しゅび): defense 装備(そうび): equipment 備え付ける(そなえつける): to provide, to furnish, to equip, to install 備える(そなえる): to furnish, to provide for, to equip, to install, to have ready, to prepare for, to possess, to have, to be endowed with, to be armed with 備わる(そなわる): to be furnished with, to be endowed with, to possess, to be among, to be one of, to be possessed of 警備(けいび): defense, guard, policing, security 整備(せいび): adjustment, completion, consolidation 設備(せつび): equipment, device, facilities, installation 予備(よび): preparation, preliminaries, reserve, spare 準備(じゅんび): prepare Kunyomi: そな.える、そな.わる、つぶさ.に Onyomi: ビ Lesson: 31 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 備える (そな.える), 備わる (そな.わる)	equip 備 画数12 1267 Details Story Dictionary 備 equip My Story [Person + flowers + cliff (no dot) + Use {用}] A *person* who wants a *flower* and that will climb to the top of a cliff, will have many *uses*, you should equip them as a friend. "once upon a time Details Story Dictionary 昔 once upon a time My Story once upon a time there was a *fence* where the *sun* never rose Koohii #1 Once upon a time, the children were forced to eat their salad every day. Koohii #2 For those who don´t know the expression, ""salad days"" means the time of one´s youth. (originally from Shakespeare´s Antony and Cleopatra - see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Salad_days). I suspect Heisig chose ""salad"" as the name for the radical just for this phrase... Primitives once upon a time, salad, flowers, one, floor, sun, day 昔(むかし): old time, before, ago Kunyomi: むかし Onyomi: セキ、シャク Lesson: 32 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 昔日 (むかしにち), 昔年 (むかしねん), 昔時 (むかしとき), 昔 (むかし)"	"once upon a time 昔 画数8 1268 Details Story Dictionary 昔 once upon a time My Story once upon a time there was a *fence* where the *sun* never rose Koohii #1 Once upon a time, the children were forced to eat their salad every day. "confused Details Story Dictionary 錯 confused Heisig's Metal . . . once upon a time. Koohii #1 A long time ago, people of the world got confused because there were so many kinds of Metal coins. today we only have the euro. Koohii #2 Once upon a time, it was thought that the ancient ""art"" of alchemy could transform anything into gold. At that time, people were obviously confused about the difference between reality and myth. (Arguably people are still as confused as ever, just about different things now.). "borrow Details Story Dictionary 借 borrow My Story [Person + Back in the day {昔}] *Back in the day*, you'd borrow from a *person*. These days you go to a bank. 借りる (かりる) Koohii #1 Once upon a time I let Mr T borrow my salad bowl, but he won´t give it back. ""This be mine now, foo!"". Koohii #2 Mr. T borrowed a copy of Cinderella and won´t give it back. He keeps watching it over and over again, trying to figure out how the Fairy Godmother does her magic. Primitives borrow, person, once upon a time, storyteller, salad, sun, day 借り(かり): borrowing, debt, loan 拝借(はいしゃく): borrowing 借金(しゃっきん): debt, loan, liabilities 借りる(かりる): borrow, hire, rent, buy on credit Kunyomi: か.りる Onyomi: シャク Lesson: 32 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds: 借りる (か.りる)"	"borrow 借 画数10 1270 Details Story Dictionary 借 borrow My Story [Person + Back in the day {昔}] *Back in the day*, you'd borrow from a *person*. These days you go to a bank. 借りる (かりる) Koohii #1 Once upon a time I let Mr T borrow my salad bowl, but he won´t give it back. ""This be mine now, foo!"". Koohii #2 Mr. T borrowed a copy of Cinderella and won´t give it back. He keeps watching it over and over again, trying to figure out how the Fairy Godmother does her magic. Primitives borrow, person, once upon a time, storyteller, salad, sun, day 借り(かり): borrowing, debt, loan 拝借(はいしゃく): borrowing 借金(しゃっきん): debt, loan, liabilities 借りる(かりる): borrow, hire, rent, buy on credit Kunyomi: か.りる Onyomi: シャク Lesson: 32 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds: 借りる (か.りる)"
"pity Details Story Dictionary 惜 pity Heisig's State of mind . . . once upon a time. The sense of the key word is that of a lost opportunity or bad turn of affairs, as in the phrase ""What a pity!"" Koohii #1 What a pity! My state of mind when i think of the opportunities I missed from once upon a time. Koohii #2 Data says ""What a pity"" when he hears that once upon a time there were no robots. Primitives pity, Freud, state of mind, once upon a time, storyteller, salad, sun, day 惜しむ(おしむ): to be frugal, to value, to regret 惜しい(おしい): regrettable, disappointing, precious Kunyomi: お.しい、お.しむ Onyomi: セキ Lesson: 32 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 惜しい (お.しい), 惜しむ (お.しむ)"	"pity 惜 画数11 1271 Details Story Dictionary 惜 pity Heisig's State of mind . . . once upon a time. set aside Details Story Dictionary 措 set aside Heisig's Fingers . . . once upon a time. Koohii #1 Long ago our ancestors set aside the use of fingers and began to use cutlery. (Raichu,11-7-2006) The way I remember it´s 昔 once upon a time (#1184) rather than 旧 olden times (#35) is that they began to use cutlery to eat salad. (I also think about how when you visit the Medieval Times theme park, which is set in Once upon a time, their gimmick is that you eat with your fingers.). Koohii #2 Once upon a time... Oh hell, you´re just too old for this. You close your fairy tale book and set it aside, pushing it away with your fingers. Primitives set aside, finger, fingers, once upon a time, storyteller, salad, sun, day 措置(そち): measure, step Kunyomi: お.く Onyomi: ソ Lesson: 32 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	set aside 措 画数11 1272 Details Story Dictionary 措 set aside Heisig's Fingers . . . once upon a time. scatter Details Story Dictionary 散 scatter Heisig's Salad . . . flesh . . taskmaster. Koohii #1 The taskmaster is dissatisfied with the meal she´s served, and scatters the salad & meat across the floor for the servants to clean up. Koohii #2 Perhaps you´ve heard of Nyotaimori or Nantaimori (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nyotaimori) in which sushi is ate from the flesh of a naked person, the story comes easily. Scatter salad over the flesh of the taskmaster in preperation for some nantaimori :). Primitives scatter, salad, moon, month, flesh, part of the body, taskmaster 拡散(かくさん): scattering, diffusion 散蒔く(ばらまく): to disseminate, to scatter, to give money freely 分散(ぶんさん): dispersion, decentralization, variance (statistics) 解散(かいさん): breakup, dissolution 散らかす(ちらかす): scatter around, leave untidy 散らかる(ちらかる): be in disorder, lie scattered around 散らす(ちらす): scatter, disperse, distribute 散る(ちる): to fall, scatter 散歩(さんぽ): walk, stroll Kunyomi: ち.る、ち.らす、-ち.らす、ち.らかす、ち.らかる、ばら Onyomi: サン Lesson: 32 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 散らかす (ち.らかす), 散らかる (ち.らかる), 散らす (ち.らす), 散る (ち.る)	scatter 散 画数12 1273 Details Story Dictionary 散 scatter Heisig's Salad . . . flesh . . taskmaster. twenty Details Story Dictionary 廿 twenty Heisig's The two tens joined at the bottom by a short line is actually the old character for twenty, which we might as well learn since we need its primitive form. It is written the same as salad, except for the shorter final stroke. Koohii #1 A generation is 30, one stroke less is twenty. Koohii #2 Ten plus ten is twenty (see generation (#28)). Primitives twenty Kunyomi: にじゅう Onyomi: ジュウ、ニュウ Lesson: 32 Jouyou: Names JLPT Level: Compounds:	twenty 廿 画数4 1274 Details Story Dictionary 廿 twenty Heisig's The two tens joined at the bottom by a short line is actually the old character for twenty, which we might as well learn since we need its primitive form. commoner Details Story Dictionary 庶 commoner Heisig's Caverns . . . oven fire. Koohii #1 Commoners have to huddle in caverns around a campfire, while higher class people get heating and central air conditioning in a hotel. Koohii #2 If you are so poor that you are a commoner, you will have to live twenty commoners to a cavern, with only one fire for everyone to share. Koohii #2 If don´t want your secret message to be intercepted, make sure your deliveryman is dressed as a commoner while traveling on the road. seat Details Story Dictionary 席 seat My Story A farmer under a cliff is not sitting in his seat. Koohii #1 Remember those poor commoners huddled in groups of 20 in a cave? The only thing they had for a seat was some old toweling (while their lords could recline on luxurious couches). Koohii #2 You´re tired from walking the tour at this cavern and there´s no benches to sit down on, so you take a towel and sling it up into a hammock-like seat using the stalagmites. (Big no-no). Primitives seat, caverns, cave, twenty, towel 着席(ちゃくせき): sit down, seat 客席(きゃくせき): guest seating 欠席(けっせき): absence, non-attendance 座席(ざせき): seat 出席(しゅっせき): attend 席(せき): seat Kunyomi: むしろ Onyomi: セキ Lesson: 32 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds:	seat 席 画数10 1277 Details Story Dictionary 席 seat My Story A farmer under a cliff is not sitting in his seat. degrees Details Story Dictionary 度 degrees Heisig's This key word refers to a gradation of measurement, not to academic diplomas. Its primitives: caverns . . . crotch. Koohii #1 The cavern refugees are so poor that they can´t afford thermometers. So, the menfolk expose their crotches inside the cavern, and approximate the temperature in degrees from how shrivelled everything looks downstairs... Koohii #2 The cave is twenty degrees cooler than the outdoors. Twenty male crotches experience shrinkage. Primitives degrees, caverns, cave, twenty, crotch お目出度う(おめでとう): (ateji) (int) (uk) Congratulations!, an auspicious occasion! 感度(かんど): sensitivity, severity (quake) 屹度(きっと): (uk) surely, undoubtedly, certainly, without fail, sternly, severely 進度(しんど): progress 度々(たびたび): often, repeatedly, frequently 恰度(ちょうど): just, right, exactly 程度(ていど): degree, amount, grade, standard, of the order of (following a number) 度忘れ(どわすれ): lapse of memory, forget for a moment 密度(みつど): density 一度に(いちどに): all at once 緯度(いど): latitude (geography) 温度(おんど): temperature 角度(かくど): angle 加速度(かそくど): acceleration 経度(けいど): longitude 限度(げんど): limit, bounds 高度(こうど): altitude, height, advanced 支度(したく): preparation 湿度(しつど): level of humidity 制度(せいど): system, institution, organization 速度(そくど): speed, velocity, rate 態度(たいど): attitude, manner 度(たび): times (three times, etc.), degree 適度(てきど): moderate 度(ど): time (occurrence), system 年度(ねんど): year, fiscal year, school year, term 濃度(のうど): concentration, brightness 毎度(まいど): each time, common service-sector greeting 一度(いちど): once, one time 今度(こんど): next time Kunyomi: たび、-た.い Onyomi: ド、ト、タク Lesson: 32 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds: 度胸 (どきょう), 制度 (せいど), 限度 (げんど), 法度 (ほうど), 度 (たび)	degrees 度 画数9 1278 Details Story Dictionary 度 degrees Heisig's This key word refers to a gradation of measurement, not to academic diplomas. transit Details Story Dictionary 渡 transit Heisig's Water . . . degrees. Koohii #1 This particular form of transit is a ferry (one of the actual meanings of this character). Naturally it can only cross the water if it´s not frozen, so the temperature must be above 0 degrees. Koohii #2 The transit system in Tokyo is one of the best in the wrold, but why is it that when it is 35 degrees outside, it is about 2 degrees on the train? Or when it is 2 degrees outside, it is 35 degrees inside the train. This degree of difference means I am always sweating then getting the chills! I think I caught a fever! Primitives transit, water, water droplets, water pistol, degrees, caverns, cave, twenty, crotch 橋渡し(はしわたし): bridge building, mediation 見渡す(みわたす): to look out over, to survey (scene), to take an extensive view of 渡り鳥(わたりどり): migratory bird, bird of passage 渡す(わたす): pass over, hand over 渡る(わたる): cross over, go across Kunyomi: わた.る、-わた.る、わた.す Onyomi: ト Lesson: 32 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 渡す (わた.す), 渡る (わた.る)	transit 渡 画数12 1279 Details Story Dictionary 渡 transit Heisig's Water . . . degrees. bustle Details Story Dictionary 奔 bustle Heisig's The hustle and bustle of this character is depicted by a St. Bernard dog and a haystack. Koohii #1 Hustle and bustle = a big St. Bernard dog frisking about in a haystack, knocking it down and spreading the hay about, after the field hands just stacked it up. Koohii #2 A bustle is also the name for the big wire-framed skirts that women used to wear. Here´s a St. Bernard dog jammed ass-first into the top of a haystack, looking like some kind of proper Victorian-era lady as he struggles to get out. Primitives bustle, large, St. Bernard, haystack, ten, needle, needle3, ten3 Kunyomi: はし.る Onyomi: ホン Lesson: 32 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	bustle 奔 画数8 1280 Details Story Dictionary 奔 bustle Heisig's The hustle and bustle of this character is depicted by a St. Bernard dog and a haystack. erupt Details Story Dictionary 噴 erupt Heisig's Mouth . . . haystack . . . clams. Koohii #1 History of Pompei: An unexpect eruption and from the mouths of the volcano come lava that threatens the farmers collecting haystacks in the fields and the fisherman catching shells on the coast. Koohii #2 A bit nasty (but makes the whole thing much easier to remember) is to take the right side and call it a bearded clam. For erupt, you can make your own story about the mouth/opening on the left. Primitives erupt, mouth, pitchfork, haystack, ten, needle, shellfish, clam, oyster, eye, animal legs, eight, needle3, ten3 噴出(ふんしゅつ): spewing, gushing, spouting, eruption, effusion 噴火(ふんか): eruption 噴水(ふんすい): water fountain Kunyomi: ふ.く Onyomi: フン Lesson: 32 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 噴く (ふ.く)	erupt 噴 画数15 1281 Details Story Dictionary 噴 erupt Heisig's Mouth . . . haystack . . . clams. tomb Details Story Dictionary 墳 tomb Heisig's Soil . . . haystack . . . clams. In order not to confuse this kanji with that for a grave (Frame 246), something like the image of an Egyptian tomb should be adopted, with all its special connotations. Koohii #1 After the eruption all is a tomb. The soil has covered the remains of the farmers gathering haystacks and of the fisherman collecting shells. Koohii #2 Using soil and hay to make bricks, the Egyptians built the pyramids to entomb the Pharaohs along with all of their money. Primitives tomb, soil, dirt, ground, pitchfork, haystack, ten, needle, shellfish, clam, oyster, eye, animal legs, eight, needle3, ten3 Kunyomi: Onyomi: フン Lesson: 32 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	tomb 墳 画数15 1282 Details Story Dictionary 墳 tomb Heisig's Soil . . . haystack . . . clams. "aroused Details Story Dictionary 憤 aroused Heisig's State of mind . . . haystack . . . clams. Koohii #1 Note: this word in Japanese has the idea of ""indignant"". So aroused here refers to being aroused because of anger over some unjust or wrong act, unfairness etc. It doesn´t seem to carry a meaning associated with arousal in the sense of sex or pleasure. So, my story: think of the angry state of mind aroused at finding all your clams buried under your haystack stolen, gone! Koohii #2 Data was aroused/indignant when he saw what the volcano had done to the farmers building their haystacks and the fishermen collecting their shells . The tragedy of it all aroused him so much he didn´t even notice he was feeling emotion. Primitives aroused, Freud, state of mind, pitchfork, haystack, ten, needle, shellfish, clam, oyster, eye, animal legs, eight, needle3, ten3 憤慨(ふんがい): indignation, resentment Kunyomi: いきどお.る Onyomi: フン Lesson: 32 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 憤る (いきどお.る)"	"aroused 憤 画数15 1283 Details Story Dictionary 憤 aroused Heisig's State of mind . . . haystack . . . clams. So aroused here refers to being aroused because of anger over some unjust or wrong act, unfairness etc. It doesn´t seem to carry a meaning associated with arousal in the sense of sex or pleasure. The tragedy of it all aroused him so much he didn´t even notice he was feeling emotion. bake Details Story Dictionary 焼 bake My Story I got baked at Burning Man (where they light a giant *straw man* on *fire*) Koohii #1 Ah, there´s no better way to bake a pizza than an oven fueled by a burning strawman. And if you listen carefully, there are stifled strawman screams coming from the kitchen. Think of this image: http://users.mtrx.net/funnypics/content/-rdm1-ABCD1234-rdm1-/2005/2005-08-23-0002/Doughboy.jpg. Koohii #2 Too lofty (#2095)尭 a career choice for the strawman becoming a baker. He was fired soon after starting his first shift. Literally!...　　　RTK2:　ショウ　全焼　ぜんしょう(entirely destroyed by fire). Primitives bake, hearth fire, lofty, strawman, wickerman, haystack, ten, needle, one, human legs, needle3, ten3 燃焼(ねんしょう): burning, combustion 日焼け(ひやけ): sunburn 夕焼け(ゆうやけ): sunset 焼く(やく): bake, grill 焼ける(やける): be burned Kunyomi: や.く、や.き、や.き-、-や.き、や.ける Onyomi: ショウ Lesson: 32 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 焼く (や.く), 焼ける (や.ける)	bake 焼 画数12 1284 Details Story Dictionary 焼 bake My Story I got baked at Burning Man (where they light a giant *straw man* on *fire*) Koohii #1 Ah, there´s no better way to bake a pizza than an oven fueled by a burning strawman. And if you listen carefully, there are stifled strawman screams coming from the kitchen. Think of this image: http://users.mtrx.net/funnypics/content/-rdm1-ABCD1234-rdm1-/2005/2005-08-23-0002/Doughboy.jpg. Koohii #2 Too lofty (#2095)尭 a career choice for the strawman becoming a baker. He was fired soon after starting his first shift. Literally!...　　　RTK2:　ショウ　全焼　ぜんしょう(entirely destroyed by fire). Primitives bake, hearth fire, lofty, strawman, wickerman, haystack, ten, needle, one, human legs, needle3, ten3 燃焼(ねんしょう): burning, combustion 日焼け(ひやけ): sunburn 夕焼け(ゆうやけ): sunset 焼く(やく): bake, grill 焼ける(やける): be burned Kunyomi: や.く、や.き、や.き-、-や.き、や.ける Onyomi: ショウ Lesson: 32 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 焼く (や.く), 焼ける (や.ける)
daybreak Details Story Dictionary 暁 daybreak Heisig's Sun . . . straw man. Koohii #1 The sun rising beside a straw man in a corn field is a classic cartoon depiction of daybreak. Koohii #2 The first person to see the sun at daybreak is of course the straw man who stands outside all day. Primitives daybreak, sun, lofty, strawman, wickerman, haystack, ten, needle, one, human legs, needle3, ten3 Kunyomi: あかつき、さと.る Onyomi: ギョウ、キョウ Lesson: 32 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 暁 (あかつき)	daybreak 暁 画数12 1285 Details Story Dictionary 暁 daybreak Heisig's Sun . . . straw man. "half Details Story Dictionary 半 half Heisig's Although the writing order is different, one can remember the appearance of this character by seeing it as a little needle - the kind used for splitting hairs in half. (Again, according to rule, little takes a stroke beneath it in order to be placed over an element that has no horizontal line at the top.) Koohii #1 Imagine karate chopping the number three in half with a WALKING STICK and pausing the picture just as the first ""board"" breaks. Koohii #2 I think of this as a pictograph, there are three boards to cut, the first one is already in half and there are still two more to go. Primitives half, small, ten, needle 半端(はんぱ): remnant, fragment, incomplete set, fraction, odd sum, incompleteness 過半数(かはんすう): majority 大半(たいはん): majority, mostly, generally 半ば(なかば): middle, half, semi, halfway, partly 半径(はんけい): radius 半島(はんとう): peninsula 半(はん): half 半分(はんぶん): half Kunyomi: なか.ば Onyomi: ハン Lesson: 32 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 5 Compounds: 半ば (なか.ば)"	"half 半 画数5 1286 Details Story Dictionary 半 half Heisig's Although the writing order is different, one can remember the appearance of this character by seeing it as a little needle - the kind used for splitting hairs in half. paddy ridge Details Story Dictionary 畔 paddy ridge Heisig's Rice field . . . half. The key word here refers to the ridges that rise up between the sections of a rice paddy. Koohii #1 A PADDY-RIDGE divides the RICE FIELD in HALF. Koohii #2 Think about a large rice field as a big square. Then you draw a line down the middle, halving it into two. Then you draw a line across the middle, halving it again into four... These halvings are paddy-ridges that separate the rice field into separate sections. I dunno the reason why, but that´s how it´s done. Primitives paddy-ridge, rice field, brains, half Kunyomi: あぜ、くろ、ほとり Onyomi: ハン Lesson: 32 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	paddy ridge 畔 画数10 1288 Details Story Dictionary 畔 paddy ridge Heisig's Rice field . . . half.
