Primitives paddy-ridge, rice field, brains, half Kunyomi: あぜ、くろ、ほとり Onyomi: ハン Lesson: 32 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:
judgment Details Story Dictionary 判 judgment My Story [Half {半} + Realistic Saber] It takes good judgment to cut things in exactly *half* with a *realistic saber*. Koohii #1 In the bible, King Solomon´s JUDGMENT was admired not by saying to cut the baby in HALF with the SWORD, but that it revealed who the true mother was. Koohii #2 It takes good judgement to cut things in exactly half with a saber. Primitives judgement, half, sword, sabre, saber 審判(しんばん): refereeing, trial, judgement, umpire, referee 判(はん): seal, stamp, monogram signature, judgment 判(ばん): size (of paper or books) 判決(はんけつ): judicial decision, judgement, sentence, decree 判定(はんてい): judgement, decision, award, verdict 裁判(さいばん): trial, judgement 審判(しんぱん): refereeing, trial, judgement, umpire, referee 判子(はんこ): seal (used for signature) 判事(はんじ): judge, judiciary 判断(はんだん): judgement, decision, adjudication, conclusion, decipherment, divination 批判(ひはん): criticism, judgement, comment 評判(ひょうばん): fame, reputation, popularity, arrant Kunyomi: わか.る Onyomi: ハン、バン Lesson: 32 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 判定 (はんてい), 判明 (はんめい), 裁判 (さいばん)	judgment 判 画数7 1289 Details Story Dictionary 判 judgment My Story [Half {半} + Realistic Saber] It takes good judgment to cut things in exactly *half* with a *realistic saber*. fist Details Story Dictionary 拳 fist Heisig's Quarter . . . hand. Be careful to keep this key word distinct from the primitive element of the same meaning we met back in Frame 741. Koohii #1 1) I hold a roll of quarters in my hand when I make a fist. 2) I hold a quarter in my hand as I prepare to play the Iron Fist Tournament: 鉄拳 （てっけん） at the arcade. Koohii #2 Quarter, hand: If you have a roll of quarters in your hand, your fist will deliver a much more effective punch. Primitives fist, quarter, hand Kunyomi: こぶし Onyomi: ケン、ゲン Lesson: 32 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 拳 (こぶし)	fist 拳 画数10 1290 Details Story Dictionary 拳 fist Heisig's Quarter . . . hand. ticket Details Story Dictionary 券 ticket Heisig's Quarter . . . dagger. Koohii #1 Entering the movie, the dude asks for your ticket, so he can tear it in half. He looks at you funny when you hand him a ticket already torn in half. He quietly tears the stub into quarters after you show him your dagger with a smile. Koohii #2 In Japan, the JR railway ju-hachi-kippu seasonal discount ticket can be cut into quarters with a dagger and shared with your friends. (its actually sort-of true). Primitives ticket, quarter, sword, dagger 旅券(りょけん): passport 回数券(かいすうけん): book of tickets 券(けん): ticket, coupon, bond, certificate 定期券(ていきけん): commuter pass, season ticket Kunyomi: Onyomi: ケン Lesson: 32 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds:	ticket 券 画数8 1291 Details Story Dictionary 券 ticket Heisig's Quarter . . . dagger. scroll Details Story Dictionary 巻 scroll Heisig's Quarter . . . snake. The key word refers to a manuscript rolled up into a scroll, not to a hanging scroll (Frame 435). Koohii #1 At a mysterious bazaar, you happen to come across something interesting: a rolled-up scroll for only 25¢. You buy it up impulsively until you realize that the powerful spell contained within is cursed by a poisonous snake. If you try to cast this spell, the snake will pop out of nowhere and bite you! Hrmph. No wonder it was so cheap... Koohii #2 How to make snake maki: Take a snake. Roll it up in rice and nori (seaweed paper) like a scroll. Cut into quarters and serve on a wooden geta with ginger and wasabi. Primitives scroll, quarter, snake, self 取り巻く(とりまく): to surround, to circle, to enclose 巻(まき): volume 寝巻(ねまき): sleep-wear, nightclothes, pyjamas, nightgown, nightdress 巻く(まく): wind, coil, roll Kunyomi: ま.く、まき、ま.き Onyomi: カン、ケン Lesson: 32 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 巻き (ま.き), 巻く (ま.く)	scroll 巻 画数9 1292 Details Story Dictionary 巻 scroll Heisig's Quarter . . . snake. sphere Details Story Dictionary 圏 sphere Heisig's This key word refers to a realm or orbit, not to a ball. Its elements: pent in . . . scroll. Koohii #1 I assosiate scrolls with spell casting, the efect of this spell is pent in a certain sphere of influence, outside it no damage is done. Koohii #2 [RPG] You´re fighting a powerful enemy. Your mage uses a scroll/quartersnake of protection, and he´s pent in a sphere of protection. Primitives sphere, pent in, scroll, quarter, snake, self 圏(けん): sphere, circle, range Kunyomi: かこ.い Onyomi: ケン Lesson: 32 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	sphere 圏 画数12 1293 Details Story Dictionary 圏 sphere Heisig's This key word refers to a realm or orbit, not to a ball. victory Details Story Dictionary 勝 victory My Story [Moon/organs + Muscle + Power] After your VICTORY cut your enemy's flesh and *organs* into *QUARTER*s to show your *POWER*. Koohii #1 After your VICTORY cut your enemy´s FLESH into QUARTERs to show your POWER. Koohii #2 After England´s victory over Scottish rebel William Wallace, they had his flesh drawn and quartered and then sent around Britain to demonstrate their power. Primitives victory, edam, moon, month, flesh, part of the body, quarter, power, muscle, arnold 決勝(けっしょう): decision of a contest, finals (in sports) 勝負(しょうぶ): victory or defeat, match, contest, game, bout 勝利(しょうり): victory, triumph, conquest, success, win 勝る(まさる): to excel, to surpass, to outrival 勝ち(かち): win, victory 勝敗(しょうはい): victory or defeat, issue (of battle) 優勝(ゆうしょう): overall victory, championship 勝つ(かつ): to win Kunyomi: か.つ、-が.ち、まさ.る、すぐ.れる、かつ Onyomi: ショウ Lesson: 32 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 勝つ (か.つ), 勝る (まさ.る)	victory 勝 画数12 1294 Details Story Dictionary 勝 victory My Story [Moon/organs + Muscle + Power] After your VICTORY cut your enemy's flesh and *organs* into *QUARTER*s to show your *POWER*. wisteria Details Story Dictionary 藤 wisteria Heisig's Flower . . . moon . . . quarter . . . rice grains. Koohii #1 According to legend, the great Ogaki wisteria tree grew and flowered from magical rice grains that were planted under the quarter moon. Koohii #2 The wisteria is a type of hanging vine covered with flowers. By the light of the quarter moon, the flowers look like clusters of rice grains. Primitives wisteria, flowers, edam, moon, month, flesh, part of the body, quarter, grains of rice Kunyomi: ふじ Onyomi: トウ、ドウ Lesson: 32 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 藤 (ふじ)	wisteria 藤 画数18 1295 Details Story Dictionary 藤 wisteria Heisig's Flower . . . moon . . . quarter . . . rice grains. "facsimilie Details Story Dictionary 謄 facsimilie Heisig's Moon . . . quarter . . . words. Koohii #1 Sending a facsimile to the moon can be problematic only a quarter of the words actually get there. Koohii #2 As a prank, a guy sits with his butt flesh on the facsimile machine, inserts a quarter, and tries to fax it to his boss. However the facsimile machine has pattern recognition technology and instead of an image of his flesh, it just transmits the word ""asshole"". Don´t forget it´s flesh, not words, on the left side; the flesh image gets transformed into words. Primitives mimeograph, facsimile, edam, moon, month, flesh, part of the body, quarter, say, words, keitai, mouth Kunyomi: Onyomi: トウ Lesson: 32 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"	"facsimilie 謄 画数17 1296 Details Story Dictionary 謄 facsimilie Heisig's Moon . . . quarter . . . words. Koohii #2 As a prank, a guy sits with his butt flesh on the facsimile machine, inserts a quarter, and tries to fax it to his boss. However the facsimile machine has pattern recognition technology and instead of an image of his flesh, it just transmits the word ""asshole"". Don´t forget it´s flesh, not words, on the left side; the flesh image gets transformed into words. Primitives mimeograph, facsimile, edam, moon, month, flesh, part of the body, quarter, say, words, keitai, mouth Kunyomi: Onyomi: トウ Lesson: 32 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"
one-sided Details Story Dictionary 片 one-sided Heisig's This kanji is based on the pictograph of a tree with some branches going upwards and others hanging down, split right down the middle. When that picture's right side is isolated, it becomes the kanji for one-sided, in the sense of only one part of a whole. Koohii #1 Fuaburisu´s pictograph of a man kneeling and presenting the ring to his future wife is a one-sided version of the story. Others say he was giving her the finger. Koohii #2 Taking the keyword in the sense of only one part of a whole, I see this as a pictograph of a man kneeling and presenting the ring to his future wife (I couldn´t see any trees or branches in there). Primitives one-sided, waiter with wine on tray 片思い(かたおもい): unrequited love 片言(かたこと): a smattering, talk like a baby, speak haltingly 片付け(かたづけ): tidying up, finishing 鉄片(てっぺん): iron scraps 片付く(かたづく): be put in order, be put to rights, be disposed of, be solved, be finished, be married (off) 片道(かたみち): one-way (trip) 片寄る(かたよる): be one-sided, partial, prejudiced, biased, lean, be inclined 破片(はへん): fragment, splinter, broken piece 片付ける(かたづける): tidy up 片仮名(かたかな): katakana Kunyomi: かた-、かた Onyomi: ヘン Lesson: 32 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 片 (かた)	one-sided 片 画数4 1297 Details Story Dictionary 片 one-sided Heisig's This kanji is based on the pictograph of a tree with some branches going upwards and others hanging down, split right down the middle. When that picture's right side is isolated, it becomes the kanji for one-sided, in the sense of only one part of a whole. "printing block Details Story Dictionary 版 printing block Heisig's Although this character also carries the sense of an ""edition"" of a publication, the elements, one-sided and anti-, more readily suggest its other meaning of a printing block. Koohii #1 Before the advent of printers in Japan, typewriters couldn´t be built as they were in the west due to how many kanji there are. Lots of small printing blocks had to be used instead. One side of the printing block would have a mirrored (anti) image of the kanji. This is true. Koohii #2 Nazi propaganda. Picture the printing blocks producing very one-sided (Aryan), anti-Jewish propaganda spreading posters to hang around town. Primitives printing block, one-sided, waiter with wine on tray, anti-, demonstration, cliff, crotch 初版(しょはん): first edition 絶版(ぜっぱん): out of print 版(はん): edition 版画(はんが): art print 出版(しゅっぱん): publication Kunyomi: Onyomi: ハン Lesson: 32 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds:"	"printing block 版 画数8 1298 Details Story Dictionary 版 printing block Heisig's Although this character also carries the sense of an ""edition"" of a publication, the elements, one-sided and anti-, more readily suggest its other meaning of a printing block. Koohii #1 Before the advent of printers in Japan, typewriters couldn´t be built as they were in the west due to how many kanji there are. Lots of small printing blocks had to be used instead. One side of the printing block would have a mirrored (anti) image of the kanji. This is true. Koohii #2 Nazi propaganda. Picture the printing blocks producing very one-sided (Aryan), anti-Jewish propaganda spreading posters to hang around town. Primitives printing block, one-sided, waiter with wine on tray, anti-, demonstration, cliff, crotch 初版(しょはん): first edition 絶版(ぜっぱん): out of print 版(はん): edition 版画(はんが): art print 出版(しゅっぱん): publication Kunyomi: Onyomi: ハン Lesson: 32 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds:"
of Details Story Dictionary 之 of Heisig's This character is now used chiefly in proper names, and is best learned as the character closest to the hiragana え, though in fact it has no relation to it. * In order to give this kanji a more concrete meaning when it is used as a primitive element, think of it as referring to building blocks with the hiragana written on them, much the same as the A-B-C blocks you played with as a child. Koohii #1 Of all the kanji, this is the only one 之orro can write. Koohii #2 The Z of Zorro (and yes he has a hat). Primitives of, Zorro, building blocks, zig-zag Kunyomi: の、これ、おいて、ゆく、この Onyomi: シ Lesson: 32 Jouyou: Names JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	of 之 画数3 1299 Details Story Dictionary 之 of Heisig's This character is now used chiefly in proper names, and is best learned as the character closest to the hiragana え, though in fact it has no relation to it. * In order to give this kanji a more concrete meaning when it is used as a primitive element, think of it as referring to building blocks with the hiragana written on them, much the same as the A-B-C blocks you played with as a child. Koohii #1 Of all the kanji, this is the only one 之orro can write. Koohii #2 The Z of Zorro (and yes he has a hat). Primitives of, Zorro, building blocks, zig-zag Kunyomi: の、これ、おいて、ゆく、この Onyomi: シ Lesson: 32 Jouyou: Names JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:
destitution Details Story Dictionary 乏 destitution Heisig's Drop of . . . building blocks. Koohii #1 Children in complete destitution have no hope of ever getting toys to play with, so when they find even a tiny drop of a building block they are overjoyed. Koohii #2 Just one drop (of alcohol) and he starts walking in zig-zags – no wonder Zorro´s living in destitution. (Note: As a primitive let 之 be Zorro or Zig-Zag: it´s pictographic). Primitives destitution, drop, of, Zorro, building blocks, zig-zag 窮乏(きゅうぼう): poverty 欠乏(けつぼう): want, shortage, famine 乏しい(とぼしい): meagre, scarce, limited, destitute, hard up, scanty, poor 貧乏(びんぼう): poverty, destitute, poor Kunyomi: とぼ.しい、とも.しい Onyomi: ボウ Lesson: 32 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 乏しい (とぼ.しい)	destitution 乏 画数4 1300 Details Story Dictionary 乏 destitution Heisig's Drop of . . . building blocks. Koohii #1 Children in complete destitution have no hope of ever getting toys to play with, so when they find even a tiny drop of a building block they are overjoyed. Koohii #2 Just one drop (of alcohol) and he starts walking in zig-zags – no wonder Zorro´s living in destitution. (Note: As a primitive let 之 be Zorro or Zig-Zag: it´s pictographic). Primitives destitution, drop, of, Zorro, building blocks, zig-zag 窮乏(きゅうぼう): poverty 欠乏(けつぼう): want, shortage, famine 乏しい(とぼしい): meagre, scarce, limited, destitute, hard up, scanty, poor 貧乏(びんぼう): poverty, destitute, poor Kunyomi: とぼ.しい、とも.しい Onyomi: ボウ Lesson: 32 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 乏しい (とぼ.しい)
"turf Details Story Dictionary 芝 turf Heisig's Flowers . . . building blocks. Koohii #1 Artificial turf made easy: flowers stuck on top of building blocks that you can place anywhere. Koohii #2 Zorro, with a flower between his teeth for the ladies, defends his turf against evildoers. ""This is my turf! And this...is for the lady."". Primitives turf, flowers, of, Zorro, building blocks, zig-zag 芝(しば): lawn, sod, turf 芝居(しばい): play, drama 芝生(しばふ): lawn Kunyomi: しば Onyomi: シ Lesson: 32 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 芝 (しば)"	"turf 芝 画数6 1301 Details Story Dictionary 芝 turf Heisig's Flowers . . . building blocks. "negative Details Story Dictionary 不 negative Heisig's You may play with the primitives of this kanji as you wish (ceiling . . . person . . . a drop of), but you will probably find that its simplicity, and its frequency, make it easy to remember just as it is. Koohii #1 [Smithsonian] Scene: Mr. T hanging from the ceiling being tortured. He is asked if he is going to talk. Spitting (a drop of saliva) in the torturer´s face, he says ""Negative"". Koohii #2 One below zero is a negative number. Primitives negative, one, ceiling, person, drop 不意(ふい): sudden, abrupt, unexpected, unforeseen 不可欠(ふかけつ): indispensable, essential 不吉(ふきつ): ominous, sinister, bad luck, ill omen, inauspiciousness 不況(ふきょう): recession, depression, slump 不景気(ふけいき): business recession, hard times, depression, gloom, sullenness, cheerlessness 不在(ふざい): absence 不山戯る(ふざける): to romp, to gambol, to frolic, to joke, to make fun of, to flirt 不順(ふじゅん): irregularity, unseasonableness 不振(ふしん): dullness, depression, slump, stagnation 不審(ふしん): incomplete understanding, doubt, question, distrust, suspicion, strangeness, infidelity 不調(ふちょう): bad condition, not to work out (ie a deal), disagreement, break-off, disorder, slump, out of form 不当(ふとう): injustice, impropriety, unreasonableness, undeservedness, unfair, invalid 不動産(ふどうさん): real estate 不評(ふひょう): bad reputation, disgrace, unpopularity 不便(ふびん): pity, compassion 不服(ふふく): dissatisfaction, discontent, disapproval, objection, complaint, protest, disagreement 不明(ふめい): unknown, obscure, indistinct, uncertain, ambiguous, ignorant, lack of wisdom, anonymous, unidentified 不良(ふりょう): badness, delinquent, inferiority, failure 不味い(まずい): unappetising, unpleasant (taste appearance situation), ugly, unskilful, awkward, bungling, unwise, untimely 不安(ふあん): anxiety, uneasiness, insecurity, suspense 不運(ふうん): unlucky, misfortune, bad luck, fate 不可(ふか): wrong, bad, improper, unjustifiable, inadvisable 不規則(ふきそく): irregularity, unsteadiness, disorderly 不潔(ふけつ): unclean, dirty, filthy, impure 不幸(ふこう): unhappiness, sorrow, misfortune, disaster, accident, death 不思議(ふしぎ): wonder, miracle, strange, mystery, marvel, curiosity 不自由(ふじゆう): discomfort, disability, inconvenience, destitution 不正(ふせい): injustice, unfairness, iniquity, impropriety, irregularity, dishonesty, illegality 不足(ふそく): insufficiency, shortage, deficiency, lack 不通(ふつう): suspension, interruption, stoppage, tie-up, cessation 不平(ふへい): complaint, discontent, dissatisfaction 不満(ふまん): dissatisfaction, displeasure, discontent, complaints, unhappiness 不利(ふり): disadvantage, handicap, unfavorable, drawback 不便(ふべん): inconvenience Kunyomi: Onyomi: フ、ブ Lesson: 32 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds: 不当 (ふとう), 不利 (ふり), 不賛成 (ふさんせい)"	"negative 不 画数4 1302 Details Story Dictionary 不 negative Heisig's You may play with the primitives of this kanji as you wish (ceiling . . . person . . . a negate Details Story Dictionary 否 negate Heisig's Negative . . . mouth. Koohii #1 To distinguish between 否 negate, and 不 negative (#1217): Note that negate contains 口, which is a kind of gate. Koohii #2 Negative mouths negate everything. Primitives negate, negative, mouth 拒否(きょひ): denial, veto, rejection, refusal 否決(ひけつ): rejection, negation, voting down 否(いや): no, nay, yes, well 否定(ひてい): negation, denial, repudiation Kunyomi: いな、いや Onyomi: ヒ Lesson: 32 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 否 (いな)	negate 否 画数7 1303 Details Story Dictionary 否 negate Heisig's Negative . . . mouth. "dart Details Story Dictionary 矢 dart Heisig's When shot high into the heavens, the dart gets so small it looks like a mere drop. Although this character could as well mean ""arrow,"" it has no connection with the primitive of that meaning. Hence the new key word. Koohii #1 Zeus ran out of lightning bolts and has to drop darts from the heavens. Koohii #2 Do not mistake with LOSE 失. Primitives dart, drop, heavens 矢(や): arrow 矢っ張り(やっぱり): also, as I thought, still, in spite of, absolutely 矢印(やじるし): directing arrow Kunyomi: や Onyomi: シ Lesson: 33 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 矢 (や)"	"dart 矢 画数5 1305 Details Story Dictionary 矢 dart Heisig's When shot high into the heavens, the dart gets so small it looks like a mere drop. rectify Details Story Dictionary 矯 rectify Heisig's Dart . . . angel. Compare your stories for correct (Frame 405), revise (Frame 362), and reformation (Frame 567). Koohii #1 Angels have now been given a powerful tool to rectify human behavior instantly, without delay - they have been allowed to drop darts on those who misbehave... spare the dart and spoil the man... Koohii #2 The darts of the angel Cupid are supposed to bring people joy, but usually just make things a lot worse. Here we see another angel flying around shooting people with the anti-darts (antidote), to rectify the situation. Primitives rectify, dart, drop, heavens, angel, heavens, mouth, hood, mouth, mouth2 Kunyomi: た.める Onyomi: キョウ Lesson: 33 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 矯める (た.める)	rectify 矯 画数17 1306 Details Story Dictionary 矯 rectify Heisig's Dart . . . angel. Koohii #2 [know; wisdom] [An arrow 矢 like mouth 口] If you know the answers, they will fly like darts from your mouth. shove Details Story Dictionary 挨 shove Heisig's Fingers . . . elbow . . . dart. Koohii #1 In the busy pub, one of the dart players shoved his dart into my elbow by accident when it nearly slipped out of his fingers. Koohii #2 Your fingers slip when someone´s elbow shoves you, causing you to drop the dart you were about to throw. But as you can see, their elbow is very small, so you decide they´re too weak to shove back. Primitives shove, finger, fingers, elbow, dart, drop, heavens 挨拶(あいさつ): greeting Kunyomi: ひら.く Onyomi: アイ Lesson: 33 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: Compounds:	shove 挨 画数10 1310 Details Story Dictionary 挨 shove Heisig's Fingers . . . elbow . . . dart. halberd Details Story Dictionary 矛 halberd Heisig's The halberd's battle-ax head and long shaft are depicted here. Take care with the number and order of the strokes. Koohii #1 マオ Zedong always carried a halberd. Koohii #2 Make the halberd a heroic warrior (perhaps of scandinavian origin) who weilds this polearm - the most effective, brutal and vicious one - with great skill. He can use it to hook, pierce and chop (the three strokes). Primitives halberd, beforehand 矛盾(むじゅん): contradiction, inconsistency Kunyomi: ほこ Onyomi: ム、ボウ Lesson: 33 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 矛 (ほこ)	halberd 矛 画数5 1311 Details Story Dictionary 矛 halberd Heisig's The halberd's battle-ax head and long shaft are depicted here. "task Details Story Dictionary 務 task My Story *Mao Zedong's* task as the *director* of *force* and power is too spread communism Koohii #1 It is with the halberd he holds that the taskmaster exerts his power over those actually performing the task. Koohii #2 So many video games have a ""boss"" stage you must pass in order to advance to the next level. Here, your task is to use your halberd to beat the taskmaster with the huge, bulging muscles. Primitives task, halberd, beforehand, taskmaster, power, muscle, arnold 業務(ぎょうむ): business, affairs, duties, work 勤務(きんむ): service, duty, work 公務(こうむ): official business, public business 職務(しょくむ): professional duties 庶務(しょむ): general affairs 税務署(ぜいむしょ): tax office 責務(せきむ): duty, obligation 務める(つとめる): to serve, to fill a post, to serve under, to exert oneself, to endeavor, to be diligent, to play (the part of), to work (for) 任務(にんむ): duty, function, office, mission, task 義務(ぎむ): duty, obligation, responsibility 事務(じむ): business, office work 務め(つとめ): service, duty, business, responsibility, task 公務員(こうむいん): public servant 事務所(じむしょ): office Kunyomi: つと.める Onyomi: ム Lesson: 33 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 務める (つと.める)"	"task 務 画数11 1313 Details Story Dictionary 務 task My Story *Mao Zedong's* task as the *director* of *force* and power is too spread communism Koohii #1 It is with the halberd he holds that the taskmaster exerts his power over those actually performing the task. fog Details Story Dictionary 霧 fog Heisig's Weather/rain . . . task. Koohii #1 This fog is the perfect weather for us to perform our task undetected. Koohii #2 FOG is easy to associate with the RAIN primitive. So think of FOG as a type of RAIN that is slow at the TASK of getting the place wet. "squad Details Story Dictionary 班 squad Heisig's Spear . . . two balls. Koohii #1 Am I the only one who took this as penis and balls? In order to be in the man-squad, naturally you need to have two balls with your ""spear"" in the middle there. Koohii #2 Here we have two kings trying out for the cheer-leading squad. A spear on the floor separates their dancing areas. Primitives squad, sword, spear, cutlass, king, jewel, ball, king2, jewel2, ball2 班(はん): group, party, section (mil) Kunyomi: Onyomi: ハン Lesson: 33 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"	"squad 班 画数10 1315 Details Story Dictionary 班 squad Heisig's Spear . . . two balls. homecoming Details Story Dictionary 帰 homecoming Heisig's Spear . . . broom . . . apron. The character for lady (Frame 1234) shares the same right side as this character, which does not bode for a very happy homecoming. Koohii #1 A female warrior returns home from battle. Her husband takes away her spear to symbolize the end of fighting and gives her a broom and an apron. “Boy, this is some kind of HOMECOMING,” thinks the veteran. (Adapted from johnskb). Koohii #2 Well, the boss man warrior upon his homecoming has set aside his spear. Remember the lady (#1151) (who put aside her broom and apron)? I wonder what they´re doing now? Primitives homecoming, sword, spear, cutlass, feather duster, broom, apron, crown, towel 帰す(かえす): to send back 帰京(ききょう): returning to Tokyo 帰宅(きたく): returning home 日帰り(ひがえり): day trip 帰り(かえり): return (noun) 帰る(かえる): go back, go home, come home, return Kunyomi: かえ.る、かえ.す、おく.る、とつ.ぐ Onyomi: キ Lesson: 33 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds: 帰す (かえ.す), 帰る (かえ.る)	homecoming 帰 画数10 1316 Details Story Dictionary 帰 homecoming Heisig's Spear . . . broom . . . apron. bow Details Story Dictionary 弓 bow Heisig's This character pictures the bent wooden bow. Later we will learn how to make the bowstring that goes with it (Frame 1490). If you stretch this character out and see the indentation on the left as its handle, the pictography should be clearer. Koohii #1 My personification for this primative is Legolas from the Lord of the Rings: a master at the bow. I suppose robin hood etc would work too. Koohii #2 I have a BOW made from a SNAKE that I BOUND UP. He sure wasn´t happy! Primitives bow 弓(ゆみ): bow (and arrow) Kunyomi: ゆみ Onyomi: キュウ Lesson: 33 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 弓 (ゆみ)	bow 弓 画数3 1317 Details Story Dictionary 弓 bow Heisig's This character pictures the bent wooden bow. pull Details Story Dictionary 引 pull Heisig's Bow . . . walking stick. Koohii #1 Put a walking stick in the bow and pull it back, ready to fire at the geezer. Koohii #2 This is actually a bow and an arrow. (Real origin of this kanji). Pull and release to fire! Primitives pull, bow, stick 籤引(くじびき): lottery, drawn lot 差し引く(さしひく): to deduct 手引き(てびき): guidance, guide, introduction 取り引き(とりひき): transactions, dealings, business 値引き(ねびき): price reduction, discount 引き上げる(ひきあげる): to withdraw, to leave, to pull out, to retire 引き受ける(ひきうける): to undertake, to take up, to take over, to be responsible for, to guarantee, to contract (disease) 引き起こす(ひきおこす): to cause 引き下げる(ひきさげる): to pull down, to lower, to reduce, to withdraw 引きずる(ひきずる): to seduce, to drag along, to pull, to prolong, to support 引き出す(ひきだす): to pull out, to take out, to draw out, to withdraw 引き取る(ひきとる): to take charge of, to take over, to retire to a private place 引き分け(ひきわけ): a draw (in competition), tie game 引っ掻く(ひっかく): to scratch 引っ掛ける(ひっかける): to hang (something) on (something), to throw on (clothes), to hook, to catch, to trap, to ensnare, to cheat, to evade payment, to jump a bill, to drink (alcohol), to spit at (a person), to hit the ball off the end of the bat (baseball) turn over, overturn, knock over, upset, turn inside out 引っ繰り返る(ひっくりかえる): be overturned, be upset, topple over, be reversed 引越し(ひっこし): moving (dwelling, office, etc.), changing residence 引っ込む(ひっこむ): strong Details Story Dictionary 強 strong Heisig's Vast . . . insect. Note how the elbow of vast is shrunken and elevated to make room for the insect beneath. Koohii #1 An insect who can fly vast distances is strong. Koohii #2 Legolas is so strong that he can even shoot down vast numbers of tiny insects at vast distances with ease. weak Details Story Dictionary 弱 weak Heisig's Two bows . . with ice on them. Koohii #1 Two weak archers agree on a duel to the death. They constantly shoot at each other but never manage to hit their target. But what they lack in skill they make up in determination, and they keep shooting for hours, and days, and months, until it´s wintertime and their bows are coated in ice. Koohii #2 BOWS with ICE on them are brittle and WEAK. Primitives weak, bow, ice, bow2, ice2 弱(じゃく): weakness, the weak, little less then 薄弱(はくじゃく): feebleness, weakness, weak 貧弱(ひんじゃく): poor, meagre, insubstantial 弱まる(よわまる): to abate, to weaken, to be emaciated, to be dejected, to be perplexed 弱める(よわめる): to weaken 弱る(よわる): to weaken, to be troubled, to be downcast, to be emaciated, to be dejected, to be perplexed, to impair 弱点(じゃくてん): weak point, weakness 弱い(よわい): weak Kunyomi: よわ.い、よわ.る、よわ.まる、よわ.める Onyomi: ジャク Lesson: 33 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 弱い (よわ.い), 弱まる (よわ.まる), 弱める (よわ.める), 弱る (よわ.る)	weak 弱 画数10 1323 Details Story Dictionary 弱 weak Heisig's Two bows . . with ice on them. "drowning Details Story Dictionary 溺 drowning Heisig's Water . . . weak. Do not confuse the meaning of this key word with ""Drown"" (Frame 763), which is closer to ""founder."" Koohii #1 Weak people placed in the water start drowning. Get some strength in those arms and learn how to swim! Koohii #2 Weak swimmers drowning in the water. Primitives drowning, water, water droplets, water pistol, weak, bow, ice, bow2, ice2 溺れる(おぼれる): be drowned, indulge in Kunyomi: いばり、おぼ.れる Onyomi: デキ、ジョウ、ニョウ Lesson: 33 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: Compounds: 溺れる (おぼ.れる)"	"drowning 溺 画数13 1324 Details Story Dictionary 溺 drowning Heisig's Water . . . weak. Do not confuse the meaning of this key word with ""Drown"" (Frame 763), which is closer to ""founder."" Koohii #1 Weak people placed in the water start drowning. Get some strength in those arms and learn how to swim! Koohii #2 Weak swimmers drowning in the water. Primitives drowning, water, water droplets, water pistol, weak, bow, ice, bow2, ice2 溺れる(おぼれる): be drowned, indulge in Kunyomi: いばり、おぼ.れる Onyomi: デキ、ジョウ、ニョウ Lesson: 33 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: Compounds: 溺れる (おぼ.れる)"
seethe Details Story Dictionary 沸 seethe Heisig's Water . . . dollar sign. Koohii #1 Re CharleyGarrett: This liquid looks like ordinary water, but it will instantly seethe when it comes in contact with counterfeit dollar bills. The inventor must be rich (and probably has dollar signs in his eyes). Koohii #2 When his daughter used a lot of water for her shower, the father could practically see the dollar signs, so he was seething with anger. Primitives seethe, water, water droplets, water pistol, dollar, bow, stick, stick2 沸騰(ふっとう): boiling, seething 沸かす(わかす): boil 沸く(わく): boil Kunyomi: わ.く、わ.かす Onyomi: フツ Lesson: 33 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 沸かす (わ.かす), 沸く (わ.く)	seethe 沸 画数8 1325 Details Story Dictionary 沸 seethe Heisig's Water . . . dollar sign. expense Details Story Dictionary 費 expense My Story [Dollar sign ( long 2 + ル) + shellfish/money] A *dollar sign* next to an amount of *money* denotes an expense. Koohii #1 An expense is an expense, whether you put it in dollars or in local money. Koohii #2 A dollar sign next to an amount of money denotes an expense. Primitives expense, dollar, bow, stick, shellfish, clam, oyster, eye, animal legs, eight, stick2 経費(けいひ): expenses, cost, outlay 光熱費(こうねつひ): cost of fuel and light 実費(じっぴ): actual expense, cost price 出費(しゅっぴ): expenses, disbursements 費やす(ついやす): to spend, to devote, to waste 費(ひ): cost, expense 浪費(ろうひ): waste, extravagance 消費(しょうひ): consumption, expenditure 費用(ひよう): cost, expense Kunyomi: つい.やす、つい.える Onyomi: ヒ Lesson: 33 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 費える (つい.える), 費やす (つい.やす)	expense 費 画数12 1326 Details Story Dictionary 費 expense My Story [Dollar sign ( long 2 + ル) + shellfish/money] A *dollar sign* next to an amount of *money* denotes an expense. "No. Details Story Dictionary 第 No. Heisig's The key word No. is the abbreviation for ""number."" Its elements: bamboo . . . dollar sign. Koohii #1 The No. 1 currency in the world is the dollar. But, the Asian nations are fast catching up and may in reality have already surpassed it. So, let the bamboo represent the No. 2 currencies (the yen, etc.). The reverse order (bamboo on top and the dollar on the bottom) is really a look at the future. Koohii #2 Bamboo bling is the newest Asian Rapper, No. 1 on the charts right now. Primitives no., bamboo, dollar, bow, stick 第(だい): ordinal 第一(だいいち): first, foremost, # 1 次第(しだい): order, precedence, circumstances, immediate(ly), as soon as, dependent upon 落第(らくだい): failure, dropping out of a class Kunyomi: Onyomi: ダイ、テイ Lesson: 33 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"	"No. 第 画数11 1327 Details Story Dictionary 第 No. Heisig's The key word No. is the abbreviation for ""number."" younger brother Details Story Dictionary 弟 younger brother Heisig's Horns . . . dollar sign. Koohii #1 Younger brothers are always more prone to mischief. Mine, you can almost see the little horns on him and the dollar signs on his eyes when he comes up with a money-making scheme. Koohii #2 The younger brother was a horny dollar -chasing bastard. adroit Details Story Dictionary 巧 adroit Heisig's Craft . . . snare. Koohii #1 Adroit: dextrous, deft, skillful. Snare is a little generic so I´ll use BEAR TRAP, with huge teeth cartoon style that snares you around the ankle. In the crafting of a bear trap, one must be particularly adroit. Otherwise they will become the victim of their down device. Koohii #2 To be adroit one must have mastered the crafting of snares. Primitives adroit, craft, snare 巧妙(こうみょう): ingenious, skillful, clever, deft 精巧(せいこう): elaborate, delicate, exquisite 巧み(たくみ): skill, cleverness Kunyomi: たく.み、たく.む、うま.い Onyomi: コウ Lesson: 33 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 巧み (たく.み)	adroit 巧 画数5 1329 Details Story Dictionary 巧 adroit Heisig's Craft . . . snare. decay Details Story Dictionary 朽 decay Heisig's Tree . . . snare. Do not confuse with rot (Frame 1099). Koohii #1 This snare isn´t terribly effective, because it´s swinging from a decaying tree. Imagine the tree as being so decayed that when an animal gets caught in the snare, its struggles cause the tree to collapse into a putrid mess. Koohii #2 枯 wither The decay of an animal in the TREE was from something caught in a SNARE. Primitives decay, tree, wood, snare 朽ちる(くちる): to rot Kunyomi: く.ちる Onyomi: キュウ Lesson: 33 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 朽ちる (く.ちる)	decay 朽 画数6 1331 Details Story Dictionary 朽 decay Heisig's Tree . . . snare. "boast Details Story Dictionary 誇 boast Heisig's Words . . . St. Bernard dog . . . ceiling . . . snare. Koohii #1 The hunter´s boast: I say, it was a ""big one"", but the snare broke and it got away. (credit to many others before). Koohii #2 A dog owner boasts about how obedient, not how smart, his Saint Bernard dog is. ""Why, my dog will even walk right into a trap if I tell him to. Watch!"" With a single word, ""go!"", his dog obediently runs into a snare trap hanging from the ceiling. In a flash, the dog is netted tightly and swinging from the ceiling. Don´t forget the ceiling! Primitives boast, say, words, keitai, mouth, Batman, large, St. Bernard, chandelier, one, ceiling, snare 誇張(こちょう): exaggeration 誇る(ほこる): to boast of, to be proud of 誇り(ほこり): pride Kunyomi: ほこ.る Onyomi: コ Lesson: 33 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 誇る (ほこ.る)"	"boast 誇 画数13 1332 Details Story Dictionary 誇 boast Heisig's Words . . . Koohii #1 Your chin is the part of your head under your nostrils that forms the double snare that is your jaw. Koohii #2 Left side is crocodile primative. crocodile´s head´s most prominent feature is his jaw. dirty Details Story Dictionary 汚 dirty My Story [Water + ] きtanai. Backwards き with drops of dirt coming off it. Koohii #1 A hunter Washes, with WATER, his TWO SNAREs, because they are dirty. Koohii #2 Washing your dirty snare in water, the extra line represents the water level as you submerge the snare. Primitives dirty, water, water droplets, water pistol, snare, one, spike, stick 汚す(けがす): to disgrace, to dishonour 汚らわしい(けがらわしい): filthy, unfair 汚れ(けがれ): uncleanness, impurity, disgrace 汚れる(けがれる): to get dirty, to become dirty 汚染(おせん): pollution, contamination 汚す(よごす): disgrace, dishonour, pollute, contaminate, soil, make dirty, stain 汚れる(よごれる): get dirty 汚い(きたない): dirty, unclean, filthy Kunyomi: けが.す、けが.れる、けが.らわしい、よご.す、よご.れる、きたな.い Onyomi: オ Lesson: 33 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 汚い (きたな.い), 汚す (けが.す), 汚らわしい (けが.らわしい), 汚れる (けが.れる), 汚す (よご.す), 汚れる (よご.れる)	dirty 汚 画数6 1334 Details Story Dictionary 汚 dirty My Story [Water + ] きtanai. bestow Details Story Dictionary 与 bestow My Story [Sling shot prim (No flat line)] Part of the Kanji for 写真 {写} Koohii #1 David went to battle with a slingshot and it only took him one shot to slay Goliath. Partly because of this, the prophet Nathan was later instructed to bestow upon David the throne of all Israel. Koohii #2 In The Legend of Zelda Ocarina of Time, one of the first weapons bestowed on Link was the slingshot. Primitives bestow, slingshot, catapult, one 関与(かんよ): participation, taking part in, participating in, being concerned in 寄与(きよ): contribution, service 与党(よとう): government party, (ruling) party in power, government 与える(あたえる): give, to award 給与(きゅうよ): allowance, grant, supply Kunyomi: あた.える、あずか.る、くみ.する、ともに Onyomi: ヨ Lesson: 33 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 与える (あた.える)	bestow 与 画数3 1335 Details Story Dictionary 与 bestow My Story [Sling shot prim (No flat line)] Part of the Kanji for 写真 {写} Koohii #1 David went to battle with a slingshot and it only took him one shot to slay Goliath. Partly because of this, the prophet Nathan was later instructed to bestow upon David the throne of all Israel. copy Details Story Dictionary 写 copy My Story [hat + bestow{与}] The flat *crown* that is *bestowed* in coronation ceremonies is usually a copy. Koohii #1 A crown was bestowed to the British royalty museum, but it was only a copy. Koohii #2 True fact: in the UK the right to print a copy of the KJV Bible is bestowed by the crown -- there are only a few authorised bible printers. (see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/King_James_Bible#Copyright_status). Primitives copy, crown, bestow, slingshot, catapult, one 写し(うつし): copy, duplicate, facsimile, transcript 映写(えいしゃ): projection 描写(びょうしゃ): depiction, description, portrayal 写る(うつる): be photographed, be projected 写生(しゃせい): sketch, drawing from nature, portrayal, description 複写(ふくしゃ): copy, duplicate 写す(うつす): copy, photograph 写真(しゃしん): photograph Kunyomi: うつ.す、うつ.る、うつ-、うつ.し Onyomi: シャ、ジャ Lesson: 33 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds: 写す (うつ.す), 写る (うつ.る)	copy 写 画数5 1336 Details Story Dictionary 写 copy My Story [hat + bestow{与}] The flat *crown* that is *bestowed* in coronation ceremonies is usually a copy. Koohii #1 A crown was bestowed to the British royalty museum, but it was only a copy. Koohii #2 True fact: in the UK the right to print a copy of the KJV Bible is bestowed by the crown -- there are only a few authorised bible printers. (see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/King_James_Bible#Copyright_status). Primitives copy, crown, bestow, slingshot, catapult, one 写し(うつし): copy, duplicate, facsimile, transcript 映写(えいしゃ): projection 描写(びょうしゃ): depiction, description, portrayal 写る(うつる): be photographed, be projected 写生(しゃせい): sketch, drawing from nature, portrayal, description 複写(ふくしゃ): copy, duplicate 写す(うつす): copy, photograph 写真(しゃしん): photograph Kunyomi: うつ.す、うつ.る、うつ-、うつ.し Onyomi: シャ、ジャ Lesson: 33 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds: 写す (うつ.す), 写る (うつ.る)
somebody Details Story Dictionary 身 somebody Heisig's The key word somebody was chosen to convey the double meaning of this kanji: body and person. Its composition is based on the nose (which, you will recall, is also the kanji for oneself). The extension of the bottom and far right strokes of that element, together with the unusual diagonal stroke, forms the pictograph of somebody with a prominent paunch. Koohii #1 Somebody was just looking for you. He had a longnose that reaches down below his mouth, and a long jaw that sticks out past his nose, and a scar across his face. (greenapple,16-3-2006) The way to remember that this is somebody rather than someone (#1256) is that the story is full of body descriptions. Koohii #2 Somebody was just looking for you. He had a long nose that reaches down below his mouth, and a long jaw that sticks out past his nose, and a scar across his face. Primitives somebody, nose 受身(うけみ): passive, passive voice 身体(からだ): the body 中身(なかみ): contents, interior, substance, filling, (sword) blade 生身(なまみ): living flesh, flesh and blood, the quick 身近(みぢか): near oneself, close to one, familiar 身なり(みなり): personal appearance 身振り(みぶり): gesture 刺身(さしみ): sliced raw fish 自身(じしん): by oneself, personally 出身(しゅっしん): person´s place of origin, institution from which one graduated, director in charge of employee relations 心身(しんしん): mind and body 身体(しんたい): body, health 身長(しんちょう): height (of body), stature 全身(ぜんしん): the whole body, full-length (portrait) 独身(どくしん): bachelorhood, single, unmarried, celibate 身(み): body, main part, oneself, sword 身分(みぶん): social position, social status Kunyomi: み Onyomi: シン Lesson: 34 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: Compounds: 身 (み)	somebody 身 画数7 1337 Details Story Dictionary 身 somebody Heisig's The key word somebody was chosen to convey the double meaning of this kanji: body and person. Its composition is based on the nose (which, you will recall, is also the kanji for oneself). The extension of the bottom and far right strokes of that element, together with the unusual diagonal stroke, forms the pictograph of somebody with a prominent paunch. Koohii #1 Somebody was just looking for you. He had a longnose that reaches down below his mouth, and a long jaw that sticks out past his nose, and a scar across his face. (greenapple,16-3-2006) The way to remember that this is somebody rather than someone (#1256) is that the story is full of body descriptions. Koohii #2 Somebody was just looking for you. He had a long nose that reaches down below his mouth, and a long jaw that sticks out past his nose, and a scar across his face. Primitives somebody, nose 受身(うけみ): passive, passive voice 身体(からだ): the body 中身(なかみ): contents, interior, substance, filling, (sword) blade 生身(なまみ): living flesh, flesh and blood, the quick 身近(みぢか): near oneself, close to one, familiar 身なり(みなり): personal appearance 身振り(みぶり): gesture 刺身(さしみ): sliced raw fish 自身(じしん): by oneself, personally 出身(しゅっしん): person´s place of origin, institution from which one graduated, director in charge of employee relations 心身(しんしん): mind and body 身体(しんたい): body, health 身長(しんちょう): height (of body), stature 全身(ぜんしん): the whole body, full-length (portrait) 独身(どくしん): bachelorhood, single, unmarried, celibate 身(み): body, main part, oneself, sword 身分(みぶん): social position, social status Kunyomi: み Onyomi: シン Lesson: 34 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: Compounds: 身 (み)
"shoot Details Story Dictionary 射 shoot Heisig's ""I shot an arrow into the air, And it landed I know not where"" goes the poem. (The poor poet obviously loses a lot of arrows.) This kanji, however, tells us where it did land. Its elements: somebody . . . glued to. Koohii #1 You SHOOT SOMEBODY with a GLUE-gun. Koohii #2 The aim of shooting is to end up with a bullet stuck in someone´s body. Primitives shoot, somebody, nose, glue 反射(はんしゃ): reflection, reverberation 放射(ほうしゃ): radiation, emission 放射能(ほうしゃのう): radioactivity 射す(さす): to shine, to strike 発射(はっしゃ): firing, shooting, discharge, catapult 陽射(ひざし): sunlight 注射(ちゅうしゃ): inject Kunyomi: い.る、さ.す Onyomi: シャ Lesson: 34 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 射る (い.る)"	"shoot 射 画数10 1338 Details Story Dictionary 射 shoot Heisig's ""I shot an arrow into the air, And it landed I know not where"" goes the poem. (The poor poet obviously loses a lot of arrows.) This kanji, however, tells us where it did land. Its elements: somebody . . . glued to. Koohii #1 You SHOOT SOMEBODY with a GLUE-gun. Koohii #2 The aim of shooting is to end up with a bullet stuck in someone´s body. Primitives shoot, somebody, nose, glue 反射(はんしゃ): reflection, reverberation 放射(ほうしゃ): radiation, emission 放射能(ほうしゃのう): radioactivity 射す(さす): to shine, to strike 発射(はっしゃ): firing, shooting, discharge, catapult 陽射(ひざし): sunlight 注射(ちゅうしゃ): inject Kunyomi: い.る、さ.す Onyomi: シャ Lesson: 34 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 射る (い.る)"
"apologize Details Story Dictionary 謝 apologize Heisig's Words . . . shoot. Koohii #1 Dick Cheney... Koohii #2 The famous speech by the man that Dick Cheney shot in the face: ""I´m sorry for the trouble I have caused the Vice President"". Primitives apologize, say, words, keitai, mouth, shoot bang bang, somebody, nose, glue 月謝(げっしゃ): monthly tuition fee 謝絶(しゃぜつ): refusal 感謝(かんしゃ): thanks, gratitude 謝る(あやまる): apologize Kunyomi: あやま.る Onyomi: シャ Lesson: 34 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 謝る (あやま.る)"	"apologize 謝 画数17 1339 Details Story Dictionary 謝 apologize Heisig's Words . . . shoot. "old man Details Story Dictionary 老 old man Heisig's First, do not confuse this character with venerable old man (Frame 849), which is far more rarely used. The character for an old man begins with an abbreviation of the character for somebody, the nose having been shortened into a simple crisscross of lines. But there is another, simpler way to remember it all: the soil drawn first indicates that one has come close to the age when ""dust to dust"" begins to take on a personal meaning; the diagonal walking stick for getting around; and the spoon for being spoon-fed. * As a primitive, the meaning is the same, but the final two strokes are omitted so that they can be replaced with other elements. Koohii #1 An old man, wondering what it´s like in a grave, sits in a freshly dug plot. When a gravekeeper mistakes him for dead and begins burying him with soil, the old man saves himself by flailing his walking stick in the air. Koohii #2 Old man sits in the dirt, having a stroke. Primitives old man, old man, soil, dirt, ground, spoon, sitting on the ground 老いる(おいる): to age, to grow old 老ける(ふける): to age 老衰(ろうすい): senility, senile decay 老人(ろうじん): the aged, old person Kunyomi: お.いる、ふ.ける Onyomi: ロウ Lesson: 34 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 老いる (お.いる), 老ける (ふ.ける)"	"old man 老 画数6 1340 Details Story Dictionary 老 old man Heisig's First, do not confuse this character with venerable old man (Frame 849), which is far more rarely used. The character for an old man begins with an abbreviation of the character for somebody, the nose having been shortened into a simple crisscross of lines. But there is another, simpler way to remember it all: the soil drawn first indicates that one has come close to the age when ""dust to dust"" begins to take on a personal meaning; the diagonal walking stick for getting around; and the spoon for being spoon-fed. * As a primitive, the meaning is the same, but the final two strokes are omitted so that they can be replaced with other elements. Koohii #1 An old man, wondering what it´s like in a grave, sits in a freshly dug plot. When a gravekeeper mistakes him for dead and begins burying him with soil, the old man saves himself by flailing his walking stick in the air. Koohii #2 Old man sits in the dirt, having a stroke. consider Details Story Dictionary 考 consider Heisig's Old man . . . slingshot. Remember: you already have kanji for discriminating (Frame 521), deliberation (Frame 692), and think (Frame 651). Koohii #1 Before shooting an old man with a slingshot, one shold carefully consider the possible consequences. Koohii #2 Even though he had the old man Mr. Wilson within the sights of his slingshot, Dennis the Menace considered what he was doing and stopped. Primitives consider, old man, slingshot, catapult 考古学(こうこがく): archaeology 思考(しこう): thought 選考(せんこう): selection, screening 考え(かんがえ): thinking, thought, ideas, intention 考慮(こうりょ): consideration, taking into account 参考(さんこう): reference, consultation 考える(かんがえる): think Kunyomi: かんが.える、かんが.え Onyomi: コウ Lesson: 34 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds: 考える (かんが.える)	consider 考 画数6 1341 Details Story Dictionary 考 consider Heisig's Old man . . . slingshot. There is a picture of a statue depicting this here http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Filial_piety. "teach Details Story Dictionary 教 teach Heisig's Filial piety . . . taskmaster. Koohii #1 In early Japan, filial piety was the cornerstone of education, and harsh taskmasters were employed to teach it. Koohii #2 You could say that the taskmistress is teaching you filial piety when she whips you and asks, ""Who´s your daddy?!"". Primitives teach, filial piety, old man, child, taskmaster 教え(おしえ): teachings, precept, lesson, doctrine 教員(きょういん): teaching staff 教科(きょうか): subject, curriculum 教訓(きょうくん): lesson, precept, moral instruction 教材(きょうざい): teaching materials 教習(きょうしゅう): training, instruction 教職(きょうしょく): teaching certificate, the teaching profession 宣教(せんきょう): religious mission 教わる(おそわる): be taught 教科書(きょうかしょ): text book 教師(きょうし): classroom teacher 教授(きょうじゅ): teaching, instruction, professor 教養(きょうよう): culture, education, refinement, cultivation 宗教(しゅうきょう): religion 助教授(じょきょうじゅ): assistant professor 教育(きょういく): education 教会(きょうかい): church 教える(おしえる): teach, inform, instruct 教室(きょうしつ): classroom Kunyomi: おし.える、おそ.わる Onyomi: キョウ Lesson: 34 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds: 教える (おし.える), 教わる (おそ.わる)"	"teach 教 画数11 1343 Details Story Dictionary 教 teach Heisig's Filial piety . . . taskmaster. "torture Details Story Dictionary 拷 torture Heisig's Fingers . . . consider. Koohii #1 In Torture 101 class they teach you to Consider the Fingers as the first part to inflict pain to. Then you can move on to other parts (like feet, groin, head, etc. etc. ; ) ). Koohii #2 Aaaargh, stop! cries the victim of torture, his fingers being squeezed by the thumb screws. ""I´ll consider it,"" the torturer says coolly, ""if you tell me the names of all the agents in your organization."". Primitives torture, finger, fingers, consider, old man, slingshot, catapult Kunyomi: Onyomi: ゴウ Lesson: 34 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"	"torture 拷 画数9 1344 Details Story Dictionary 拷 torture Heisig's Fingers . . . consider. Koohii #2 Aaaargh, stop! cries the victim of torture, his fingers being squeezed by the thumb screws. "someone Details Story Dictionary 者 someone Heisig's Old man . . . sun. This key word looks to be difficult because of its proximity to somebody. In fact, it is a very common kanji that will cause you no difficulty at all. Its meaning should be seen as the human referent for the abstract noun ""something."" * As a primitive it means a puppet-on-a-string. Koohii #1 I find the best way of memorizing this kanji is in conjunction with the Japanese compound for ninja: 忍者 -- i.e. someone who endures (see FRAME 597 for the kanji 忍). A 忍者 is not just a 身 (somebody), it´s 者 who can 忍 great 拷! Koohii #2 Back in the day, the old man used to be someone. His name was in the papers and all that. I use CHUCKY from the movie Child´s Play as my major alternate meaning for this primitive. Primitives someone, puppet, sooty, old man, sun, day 業者(ぎょうしゃ): trader, merchant 信者(しんじゃ): believer, adherent, devotee, Christian 達者(たっしゃ): skillful, in good health 読者(どくしゃ): reader 配偶者(はいぐうしゃ): spouse, wife, husband 悪者(わるもの): bad fellow, rascal, ruffian, scoundrel 学者(がくしゃ): scholar 患者(かんじゃ): a patient 記者(きしゃ): reporter 後者(こうしゃ): the latter 作者(さくしゃ): author 前者(ぜんしゃ): the former 著者(ちょしゃ): author, writer 筆者(ひっしゃ): writer, author 者(もの): person 役者(やくしゃ): actor, actress 歯医者(はいしゃ): dentist 医者(いしゃ): doctor (medical) Kunyomi: もの Onyomi: シャ Lesson: 34 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds: 者 (もの)"	"someone 者 画数8 1345 Details Story Dictionary 者 someone Heisig's Old man . . . sun. Its meaning should be seen as the human referent for the abstract noun ""something."" * As a primitive it means a puppet-on-a-string. Koohii #1 I find the best way of memorizing this kanji is in conjunction with the Japanese compound for ninja: 忍者 -- i.e. someone who endures (see FRAME 597 for the kanji 忍). A 忍者 is not just a 身 (somebody), it´s 者 who can 忍 great 拷! Koohii #2 Back in the day, the old man used to be someone. His name was in the papers and all that. "boil Details Story Dictionary 煮 boil Heisig's Puppet . . . oven fire. Koohii #1 I had a hard time with the next several frame numbers trying to use ""puppet."" So i thought of ""voodoo doll"" but then found ""love doll"" (which is just a special type of puppet) fit well with these 8 frames. Observe: Here I am boiling my love doll over the flames to warm her up a bit... Koohii #2 There is a lesser known voodoo practice of boiling a puppet over an oven fire, to really make your victim feel the heat! Primitives boil, someone, puppet, sooty, old man, sun, day, oven-fire, barbecue 煮える(にえる): boil, cook, be cooked 煮る(にる): boil, cook Kunyomi: に.る、-に、に.える、に.やす Onyomi: シャ Lesson: 34 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 煮える (に.える), 煮やす (に.やす), 煮る (に.る)"	"boil 煮 画数12 1346 Details Story Dictionary 煮 boil Heisig's Puppet . . . oven fire. But well, what a problems she had getting those bamboo shoots into her mouth (which should not be that difficult, I would say!). Koohii #2 I´ve always wanted to use bamboo chopsticks to eat sushi off a naked woman. Unfortunately, there is no woman in my life, so this love doll will have to do. "sultry Details Story Dictionary 暑 sultry Heisig's The key word refers to the heat of summer. Its elements: sun . . . puppet. Koohii #1 Ahh, a fine sultry day with my love doll under the hot sun. I think she´s getting a tan! Koohii #2 [from decamer0n] This is the kanji for atsui (暑い) as in hot. If you´ve ever been in Japan in the summer no doubt you have heard hoards of people bellowing ""Atsui! Atsui!"" Here you are laying with your love doll under the hot sun. Luckily the manufacturers were smart and when the doll got to hot it would bellow ""Atsui! It´s so sultry!"". Primitives sultry, sun, day, someone, puppet, sooty, old man, sun2, day2 蒸し暑い(むしあつい): humid, sultry 暑い(あつい): hot, warm Kunyomi: あつ.い Onyomi: ショ Lesson: 34 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 暑い (あつ.い)"	"sultry 暑 画数12 1350 Details Story Dictionary 暑 sultry Heisig's The key word refers to the heat of summer. boar Details Story Dictionary 猪 boar Heisig's Pack of wild dogs . . . puppet. Koohii #1 My love doll is made of special pheremone impregnated vinyl. Unfortunately, a pack of wild dogs mistook her for a wild boar and tore her to pieces. Oh dear! Koohii #2 (Image: a pack of wild dogs chasing Pinocchio who´s trying to escape by riding on the back of a boar. See him bouncing around as they race along?). Primitives boar, pack of wild dogs, someone, puppet, sooty, old man, sun, day Kunyomi: い、いのしし Onyomi: チョ Lesson: 34 Jouyou: Names JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	boar 猪 画数11 1352 Details Story Dictionary 猪 boar Heisig's Pack of wild dogs . . . puppet. strand Details Story Dictionary 渚 strand Heisig's The strand referred to here is the stretch of land along a beach or shoreline. Its elements are: water . . . puppet. Koohii #1 I was stranded on a desert island surrounded by water for hundreds of miles on end. I wasn´t upset though - I had my love doll! What a great strand of sand to be stranded on - just me and my love doll! Koohii #2 A lovely romantic walk on the strand, splashing in the water with my love doll. Primitives strand, water, water droplets, water pistol, someone, puppet, sooty, old man, sun, day Kunyomi: なぎさ Onyomi: ショ Lesson: 34 Jouyou: Names JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	strand 渚 画数11 1353 Details Story Dictionary 渚 strand Heisig's The strand referred to here is the stretch of land along a beach or shoreline. Koohii #2 People who gamble compulsively are like puppets controlled by money. sandwiched Details Story Dictionary 挟 sandwiched Heisig's Fingers . . . scissors. Do not confuse with the kanji for pinch (Frame 709). Koohii #1 挟まる 【はさまる】 (v5r,vi) to get between; to be caught in; (P) Story: You know how in tokyo there are those really packed trains where train staff in gloves shove people in? Well imagine being sandwiched in so tight, that when the doors close, only your FINGERS are sticking out. The train staff have no choice... they must cut them off with SCISSORS =( snip snip.. Koohii #2 Fingers sandwiched between a pair of scissors. Don´t move or else! Primitives sandwiched, finger, fingers, scissors, husband, horns 挟まる(はさまる): get between, be caught in 挟む(はさむ): interpose, hold between, insert Kunyomi: はさ.む、はさ.まる、わきばさ.む、さしはさ.む Onyomi: キョウ、ショウ Lesson: 34 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 挟まる (はさ.まる), 挟む (はさ.む)	sandwiched 挟 画数9 1357 Details Story Dictionary 挟 sandwiched Heisig's Fingers . . . scissors. chase Details Story Dictionary 追 chase Heisig's Maestro . . . road. Koohii #1 Maestro, coattails flapping wildly, is being chased down the road by his fans. Koohii #2 Maestro primative = James Bond. Here he gives chase down the road to the bad guys. I´m thinking of the car chase in ´The Man with the Golden Gun´ - NOT pursue (#539). I think about ´Race N Chase´ (a scalextric type toy)...there were no pigs in ´Race N Chase´, only cars. large hill Details Story Dictionary 阜 large hill Heisig's Maestro . . . needle. Koohii #1 The maestro lives on top of a large hill so that he can play music at over ten decibels without anyone giving a damn. Koohii #2 Note to those who have not got this far in the book: This is the full kanji for the Pinnacle primitive (i.e. only the left-hand version of the primitive). The full kanji for the City Walls primitive is city walls (#2180). Beyonce went for an invigorating walk up a large hill on a summer´s afternoon. Since the grass was so lush and cool, she took off her sandals and immediately stepped on a used hypodermic needle. 岐阜県　ぎふけん Gifu Prefecture. Primitives large hill, maestro, ten, needle Kunyomi: Onyomi: フ、フウ Lesson: 34 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: Compounds:	large hill 阜 画数8 1360 Details Story Dictionary 阜 large hill Heisig's Maestro . . . needle. expert Details Story Dictionary 師 expert Heisig's Maestro . . . ceiling . . . towel. Koohii #1 A maestro in a large auditorium with high ceilings is conducting his orchestra of expert musicians at a fever-pitch, sweat pouring out of him. When the piece is over he reaches for his towel to wipe his brow. Koohii #2 Maestro is such as expert, he can conduct even with a towel hanging from the ceiling in front of him. bureaucrat Details Story Dictionary 官 bureaucrat Heisig's By replacing the maestro's baton (the drop) with the roof of a house, we have his equivalent in the institutional world of big government: the bureaucrat. Koohii #1 No one likes classical music anymore. Our Maestro is here at home without his baton sighing sadly before he heads off for another day as his new job as a bureaucrat. Koohii #2 Bureaucrat, def: The maestro without a baton, the one who orchestrates oppressive rules, regulations and taxes on every household. Primitives bureaucrat, house, maestro without baton 官僚(かんりょう): bureaucrat, bureaucracy 器官(きかん): organ (of body), instrument 長官(ちょうかん): chief, (government) secretary 官庁(かんちょう): government office, authorities 警官(けいかん): policeman Kunyomi: Onyomi: カン Lesson: 34 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds:	bureaucrat 官 画数8 1363 Details Story Dictionary 官 bureaucrat Heisig's By replacing the maestro's baton (the drop) with the roof of a house, we have his equivalent in the institutional world of big government: the bureaucrat. father Details Story Dictionary 父 father Heisig's The kindness and hard work of the ideal father is seen in this abbreviation of the taskmaster that leaves off his rod or whip (the first stroke) and replaces it with the sweat of the father's brow (the two drops at the top). Koohii #1 Luke, I am your father. Darth Vader (really surprised nobody put this one up before: 2 laserswords). Koohii #2 Not to confuse anyone, but I think if you put your mind to it, you can see the image of a father here. The first two strokes take on the form of his eye brows, and the third and fourth stroke make up the nose and mustache. Primitives father お祖父さん(おじいさん): grandfather, male senior-citizen 伯父さん(おじさん): middle-aged gentleman, uncle 父母(ちちはは): father and mother, parents 小父さん(おじさん): middle-aged gentleman, uncle 父親(ちちおや): father 父母(ふぼ): father and mother, parents 祖父(そふ): grand father 叔父(おじ): uncle (younger than one´s parent) お父さん(おとうさん): (polite) father Kunyomi: ちち Onyomi: フ Lesson: 34 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 5 Compounds: 父 (ちち)	father 父 画数4 1366 Details Story Dictionary 父 father Heisig's The kindness and hard work of the ideal father is seen in this abbreviation of the taskmaster that leaves off his rod or whip (the first stroke) and replaces it with the sweat of the father's brow (the two drops at the top). mingle Details Story Dictionary 交 mingle Heisig's Top hat . . . father. Koohii #1 Even though your FATHER is an old man, he can´t give up his party lifestyle. Once a week he still dons his cool TOP HAT (well, it was cool 40 years ago) and goes out on the town to MINGLE with the ladies. This is a pretty common thing in Japan, where old motherfuckers still think they can pick up 19 year old girls. Koohii #2 Darth Vader tries to mingle with his troops. He even weares one of the helmets of the stromtroopers. (one of them laughs: white helmet, black suit. Darth Vader thereby slashes him in 2). Primitives mingle, top hat, father 交わす(かわす): to exchange (messages), to dodge, to parry, to avoid, to turn aside 交易(こうえき): trade, commerce 交互(こうご): mutual, reciprocal, alternate 交渉(こうしょう): negotiations, discussions, connection 交付(こうふ): delivering, furnishing (with copies) 国交(こっこう): diplomatic relations 社交(しゃこう): social life, social intercourse 交ざる(まざる): to be mixed, to be blended with, to associate with, to mingle with, to join 交える(まじえる): to mix, to converse with, to cross (swords) 交じる(まじる): to be mixed, to be blended with, to associate with, to mingle with, to interest, to join 交わる(まじわる): to cross, to intersect, to associate with, to mingle with, to interest, to join 外交(がいこう): diplomacy 交換(こうかん): exchange, interchange, reciprocity, barter, substitution 交差(こうさ): cross 交際(こうさい): company, friendship, association, society, acquaintance 交差点(こうさてん): crossing, intersection 交替(こうたい): alternation, change, shift, relief, relay 交通機関(こうつうきかん): transportation facilities 交流(こうりゅう): alternating current, intercourse, (cultural) exchange, intermingling 交ぜる(まぜる): be mixed, be blended with 交通(こうつう): traffic 交番(こうばん): police box Kunyomi: まじ.わる、まじ.える、ま.じる、まじ.る、ま.ざる、ま.ぜる、-か.う、か.わす、かわ.す、こもごも Onyomi: コウ Lesson: 34 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 交う (か.う), 交わす (か.わす), 交ざる (ま.ざる), 交じる (ま.じる), 交ぜる (ま.ぜる), 交える (まじ.える), 交わる (まじ.わる)	mingle 交 画数6 1368 Details Story Dictionary 交 mingle Heisig's Top hat . . . father. Koohii #1 Even though your FATHER is an old man, he can´t give up his party lifestyle. Once a week he still dons his cool TOP HAT (well, it was cool 40 years ago) and goes out on the town to MINGLE with the ladies. This is a pretty common thing in Japan, where old motherfuckers still think they can pick up 19 year old girls. Koohii #2 Darth Vader tries to mingle with his troops. He even weares one of the helmets of the stromtroopers. (one of them laughs: white helmet, black suit. Darth Vader thereby slashes him in 2). Primitives mingle, top hat, father 交わす(かわす): to exchange (messages), to dodge, to parry, to avoid, to turn aside 交易(こうえき): trade, commerce 交互(こうご): mutual, reciprocal, alternate 交渉(こうしょう): negotiations, discussions, connection 交付(こうふ): delivering, furnishing (with copies) 国交(こっこう): diplomatic relations 社交(しゃこう): social life, social intercourse 交ざる(まざる): to be mixed, to be blended with, to associate with, to mingle with, to join 交える(まじえる): to mix, to converse with, to cross (swords) 交じる(まじる): to be mixed, to be blended with, to associate with, to mingle with, to interest, to join 交わる(まじわる): to cross, to intersect, to associate with, to mingle with, to interest, to join 外交(がいこう): diplomacy 交換(こうかん): exchange, interchange, reciprocity, barter, substitution 交差(こうさ): cross 交際(こうさい): company, friendship, association, society, acquaintance 交差点(こうさてん): crossing, intersection 交替(こうたい): alternation, change, shift, relief, relay 交通機関(こうつうきかん): transportation facilities 交流(こうりゅう): alternating current, intercourse, (cultural) exchange, intermingling 交ぜる(まぜる): be mixed, be blended with 交通(こうつう): traffic 交番(こうばん): police box Kunyomi: まじ.わる、まじ.える、ま.じる、まじ.る、ま.ざる、ま.ぜる、-か.う、か.わす、かわ.す、こもごも Onyomi: コウ Lesson: 34 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 交う (か.う), 交わす (か.わす), 交ざる (ま.ざる), 交じる (ま.じる), 交ぜる (ま.ぜる), 交える (まじ.える), 交わる (まじ.わる)

contrast Details Story Dictionary 較 contrast Heisig's Cars . . . mingle. Koohii #1 The people I had invited to the party were mingling quite well with one another, until they all suddenly started talking about the cars they own. Pretty soon the crowd divided itself into distinct, contrasting crowds: rich snobs with fancy cars, soccer moms with minivans, and hippies with bicycles. Koohii #2 Our world of today, cars mingling on busy streets, is in stark contrast to the one of yesteryear, where it was people who would mingle on the streets. exam Details Story Dictionary 校 exam Heisig's Tree . . . mingle. Koohii #1 With the exam scores posted on a TREE, the students MINGLED around looking at the results. test. 試. Koohii #2 Note: this Kanji does not mean exam. It means school. I find this keyword an choice odd as school by itself is not used elsewhere. Examples: 校長 is principal (lit. school chief); 中学校 is junior high school (lit. middle study/knowledge school). leg Details Story Dictionary 足 leg Heisig's Mouth . . . mending. Note that the last stroke of mouth and the first of mending overlap. * As a primitive on the left, it is amended to something similar to correct in place of mending. Its meaning remains leg, but should be thought of as a wooden leg in order to avoid confusion with other similar elements, namely human legs, animal legs, and walking legs. Koohii #1 Captain Ahab lost his leg to the great white whale´s mouth and had to mend it with a peg leg. Koohii #2 I´ll use my mouth to mend your leg, I´ll kiss it all better :). Primitives leg, mouth, mending, mend 駆け足(かけあし): running fast, double time 足し算(たしざん): addition 裸足(はだし): barefoot 発足(はっそく): starting, inauguration 補足(ほそく): supplement, complement 物足りない(ものたりない): unsatisfied, unsatisfactory 足跡(あしあと): footprints 遠足(えんそく): trip, hike, picnic 足袋(たび): Japanese socks (with split toe) 足りる(たりる): be sufficient, be enough 足る(たる): be sufficient, be enough 不足(ふそく): insufficiency, shortage, deficiency, lack 満足(まんぞく): satisfaction 足す(たす): add 足(あし): foot, pace, gait, leg Kunyomi: あし、た.りる、た.る、た.す Onyomi: ソク Lesson: 34 Jouyou: 1 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds: 足 (あし), 足す (た.す), 足りる (た.りる), 足る (た.る)	leg 足 画数7 1372 Details Story Dictionary 足 leg Heisig's Mouth . . . mending. One with a rubber stopper at the end for absorbing shocks on paved paths, and one with a wide foot to distribute weight better on mud paths. "step Details Story Dictionary 踏 step Heisig's The meaning of this character is virtually identical with that of the last frame. Be sure to come up with distinct connotations suggested by phrases in which each is commonly used. Wooden leg . . . water . . . sun. Koohii #1 You have to watch your step when moving your leg on a watery day. Koohii #2 So, we´ve walked on the moon, but it´s going to take a pirate with a wooden leg, with a huge supply of cooling water to land on the sun and take that ""one small step for a man"". Primitives step, wooden leg, mouth, stop, footprint, wednesday, boots, water, sun, day 踏まえる(ふまえる): to be based on, to have origin in 踏切(ふみきり): railway crossing, level crossing, starting line, scratch, crossover 踏む(ふむ): step on Kunyomi: ふ.む、ふ.まえる Onyomi: トウ Lesson: 34 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 踏まえる (ふ.まえる), 踏む (ふ.む)"	"step 踏 画数15 1381 Details Story Dictionary 踏 step Heisig's The meaning of this character is virtually identical with that of the last frame. skeleton Details Story Dictionary 骨 skeleton Heisig's This kanji and primitive refers to the part of the body composed of the bones and their joints. The top part of the kanji, terminating in the element for crown, is a pictograph of a bone joint. I leave it to you to put the pieces together, so to speak. Koohii #1 Your body meat is attached to the bone joints of your skeleton. Koohii #2 The top box 口 is the skull and the brain 田 has shriveled to the size of marble (but following kanji convention it is depicted as a square) and rolled into the bottom right hand corner. With all the hair and flesh gone the crown has slipped down to the shoulders like a necklace. 月 represents the rest of the body of the skeleton. [Idea for position of crown thanks to n1williams]. Primitives skeleton, joint, moon, month, flesh, part of the body 骨(こつ): knack, skill 骨董品(こっとうひん): curio 露骨(ろこつ): frank, blunt, plain, outspoken, conspicuous, open, broad, suggestive 骨折(こっせつ): bone fracture 骨(ほね): bone Kunyomi: ほね Onyomi: コツ Lesson: 34 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 骨 (ほね)	skeleton 骨 画数10 1383 Details Story Dictionary 骨 skeleton Heisig's This kanji and primitive refers to the part of the body composed of the bones and their joints. The top part of the kanji, terminating in the element for crown, is a pictograph of a bone joint. I leave it to you to put the pieces together, so to speak. Koohii #1 Your body meat is attached to the bone joints of your skeleton. Koohii #2 The top box 口 is the skull and the brain 田 has shriveled to the size of marble (but following kanji convention it is depicted as a square) and rolled into the bottom right hand corner. With all the hair and flesh gone the crown has slipped down to the shoulders like a necklace. 月 represents the rest of the body of the skeleton. [Idea for position of crown thanks to n1williams]. Primitives skeleton, joint, moon, month, flesh, part of the body 骨(こつ): knack, skill 骨董品(こっとうひん): curio 露骨(ろこつ): frank, blunt, plain, outspoken, conspicuous, open, broad, suggestive 骨折(こっせつ): bone fracture 骨(ほね): bone Kunyomi: ほね Onyomi: コツ Lesson: 34 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 骨 (ほね)
"slippery Details Story Dictionary 滑 slippery Heisig's Water . . . skeleton. Koohii #1 Don´t give water to a skeleton. When he drinks it, it´ll sluice right through his bones, forcing you to put one of those ""Caution - Slippery Floor"" signs up on the resultant puddle. Koohii #2 Slippery surfaces are very dangerous for skeletons, since their bone feet slip easily... a few drops of water, and zweep! A large mess of bones to pick up and reassemble! Primitives slippery, water, water droplets, water pistol, skeleton, joint, moon, month, flesh, part of the body 円滑(えんかつ): harmony, smoothness 滑稽(こっけい): funny, humorous, comical, laughable, ridiculous, joking 滑る(すべる): to slide, to slip, to glide 滑らか(なめらか): smoothness, glassiness 滑れる(ずれる): slide, slip off Kunyomi: すべ.る、なめ.らか Onyomi: カツ、コツ Lesson: 34 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 滑る (すべ.る), 滑らか (なめ.らか)"	"slippery 滑 画数13 1384 Details Story Dictionary 滑 slippery Heisig's Water . . . skeleton. "marrow Details Story Dictionary 髄 marrow Heisig's Skeleton . . . possess . . . road. Koohii #1 A skeleton is shuffling along the shoulder of the road, so you pull up next to him and ask where he is going. He says he´s going to donate his marrow to the hospital because he got into some financial trouble and lost everything; his marrow is the only thing he still possesses. Koohii #2 A skeleton by the side of the road, holding a sign ""Possess marrow, will travel"". Yeah, it makes no sense but I don´t foget the kanji. calamity Details Story Dictionary 禍 calamity Heisig's Altar . . . jawbone. Koohii #1 Continued from auspicious (#1088). Once a year, the people pray for a sign from the gods. But if the gods are feeling particularly mischievous, they´ll send down a jawbone to the altar. The people see this as a sign of calamity to come. The gods think of it as an amusing prank. Koohii #2 Calamity Jane went to the altar to confess her sins and the priest´s jawbone fell to the floor...　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　RTK2:　か　禍福　かふく (fortune and misfortune)...　Pure Group: 渦1292　過1293. overdo Details Story Dictionary 過 overdo Heisig's Jawbone . . . road. Koohii #1 Jaws XII~! Jaws strikes the highway! Man, they´re really overdoing it now. Koohii #2 In ´American History X´ Edward Norton´s character overdoes it when he makes the dude that tried to steal his car lie face down with his jawbone open over the pavement of the roadway and then stamps on the back of his head. My teeth still tingle when I think of that! "Heights Details Story Dictionary 阪 Heights Heisig's This character is used for proper names, much as the English word ""Heights"" is. Its primitives: pinnacle . . . anti-. Koohii #1 If you´re scared of Heights, you don´t want to stay at The Pinnacle; you are anti- The Pinnacle. Primitive: The Pinnacle is a dream-like gated community at the top of a mount. This allows for innumerable stories for all the kanji with this primitive since you have a whole city to work with. Also prevents confusion with ""mountain"". Koohii #2 People are being displaced in 大阪 to make room for a new development, Osaka Heights, the pinnacle of modern Japanese housing. An angry mob of protestors are outside with Anti-Osaka Heights signs. Primitives heights, pinnacle, parthenon, acropolis, anti-, demonstration, cliff, crotch Kunyomi: さか Onyomi: ハン Lesson: 35 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: Compounds: 阪 (さか)"	"Heights 阪 画数7 1390 Details Story Dictionary 阪 Heights Heisig's This character is used for proper names, much as the English word ""Heights"" is. Its primitives: pinnacle . . . anti-. Koohii #1 If you´re scared of Heights, you don´t want to stay at The Pinnacle; you are anti- The Pinnacle. Primitive: The Pinnacle is a dream-like gated community at the top of a mount. This allows for innumerable stories for all the kanji with this primitive since you have a whole city to work with. Also prevents confusion with ""mountain"". Koohii #2 People are being displaced in 大阪 to make room for a new development, Osaka Heights, the pinnacle of modern Japanese housing. An angry mob of protestors are outside with Anti-Osaka Heights signs. Primitives heights, pinnacle, parthenon, acropolis, anti-, demonstration, cliff, crotch Kunyomi: さか Onyomi: ハン Lesson: 35 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: Compounds: 阪 (さか)"
"Africa Details Story Dictionary 阿 Africa Heisig's This kanji, an abbreviation for Africa, is now used chiefly for its sound, ""a,"" not unlike the kanji for Italy and the sound ""i"" that we met earlier (Frame 1245). Its composite elements are: pinnacles . . . can. Koohii #1 Can you see Africa from The Pinnacle? I can! I can! Koohii #2 A kinda pictogram: ´BoT´, the first 3 letters in ´Botswana´ an African country. Primitives africa, pinnacle, parthenon, acropolis, can, mouth, street, nail, spike Kunyomi: おもね.る Onyomi: ア、オ Lesson: 35 Jouyou: Names JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"	"Africa 阿 画数8 1391 Details Story Dictionary 阿 Africa Heisig's This kanji, an abbreviation for Africa, is now used chiefly for its sound, ""a,"" not unlike the kanji for Italy and the sound ""i"" that we met earlier (Frame 1245). occasion Details Story Dictionary 際 occasion Heisig's Pinnacle . . . ritual. Koohii #1 Many rituals are practiced every day (blessing before meals, evening prayer, etc.) Only the peak rituals (wedding, Bar Mitzvah, etc.) qualify to be called an occasion. Koohii #2 On occasian, rituals are held at the very tip of The Pinnacle. hinder Details Story Dictionary 障 hinder Heisig's Pinnacle . . . badge. Koohii #1 The officer at the gate to The Pinnacle with a giant badge sewn to his chest hinders all visitors. But not the handicapped. They´re hindered enough already. They´re given a badge and can pass right into The Pinnacle. Koohii #2 The pinnacle of racism was that of the Nazis. They made the Jews wear a badge on their clothes to identify them. They hindered their every movement. Moreover the peace-loving Dutch all wore the badges so that the Jews would be unidentifiable. Effectively hindering the Nazi plot. Primitives hinder, pinnacle, parthenon, acropolis, badge, vase, stand up, sunflower, early, sun, day, ten, needle 気障(きざ): affectation, conceit, snobbery 障る(さわる): to hinder, to interfere with, to affect, to do one harm, to be harmful to 保障(ほしょう): guarantee, security, assurance, pledge, warranty 障害(しょうがい): obstacle, impediment (fault), damage 障子(しょうじ): paper sliding door 故障(こしょう): breakdown Kunyomi: さわ.る Onyomi: ショウ Lesson: 35 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 障る (さわ.る)	hinder 障 画数14 1393 Details Story Dictionary 障 hinder Heisig's Pinnacle . . . badge. chink Details Story Dictionary 隙 chink Heisig's Pinnacle . . . little . . . sun . . . little. Note that the form of the first element for little given here is the simpler form that has become standard in general-use characters (See Frame 110). For the time being, until typesetting fonts have made the adjustment, the official approved drawing has the drops similar to the bottom little. Koohii #1 There was only one chink in his plan. Even standing atop the highest pinnacle, standing above even the sun, the little man was still just as little as when he was under the sun. Koohii #2 Man those little chinks can do anything! They were the first to build rockets, and by launching one off the top of the highest pinnacle in China, one little chink was the first to ride above the sun, and see all the little chinks below! Primitives chink, pinnacle, parthenon, acropolis, small, little, sun, day, small2, little, 2 隙間(すきま): crevice, crack, gap, opening Kunyomi: すき、す.く、す.かす、ひま Onyomi: ゲキ、キャク、ケキ Lesson: 35 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: Compounds: 隙 (すき)	chink 隙 画数13 1394 Details Story Dictionary 隙 chink Heisig's Pinnacle . . . little . . . sun . . . little. follow Details Story Dictionary 随 follow Heisig's Pinnacle . . . possess . . . road. Koohii #1 [Image: Follow the ´Yellow-Brick Road´ to success] The pinnacle signifies your personal goal and destination. What you´re seeking to possess lies at the end of the yellow-brick road. You must follow the road to get what you want. Koohii #2 I fled to The Pinnacle for safety, but the demon followed me right up the road!
