"sunshine Details Story Dictionary 陽 sunshine Heisig's Different from the primitive for sun (which figures in the character) and the kanji for ray (Frame 125), the key word sunshine is meant to convey the meaning of the masculine principle in nature, or ""Yang."" (The dark is viewed mythically as the feminine principle; see frame 1718.) From there it comes to mean sun also. The elements are: pinnacle . . . piggy bank. Koohii #1 A kid is perched on a pinnacle with his piggy bank. He uses the coins to catch the sunshine, and redirect it into people´s eyes, far below. Koohii #2 The Pinnacle is environmentally friendly. They collect solar power through sunshine on their piggybank shaped solar arrays. Primitives sunshine, pinnacle, parthenon, acropolis, piggy bank, sun, day, piglets 太陽(たいよう): sun, solar 陽射(ひざし): sunlight 陽気(ようき): season, weather, cheerfulness Kunyomi: ひ Onyomi: ヨウ Lesson: 35 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds:"	"sunshine 陽 画数12 1397 Details Story Dictionary 陽 sunshine Heisig's Different from the primitive for sun (which figures in the character) and the kanji for ray (Frame 125), the key word sunshine is meant to convey the meaning of the masculine principle in nature, or ""Yang."" (The dark is viewed mythically as the feminine principle; see frame 1718.) From there it comes to mean sun also. The elements are: pinnacle . . . piggy bank. Koohii #1 A kid is perched on a pinnacle with his piggy bank. He uses the coins to catch the sunshine, and redirect it into people´s eyes, far below. Koohii #2 The Pinnacle is environmentally friendly. They collect solar power through sunshine on their piggybank shaped solar arrays. Primitives sunshine, pinnacle, parthenon, acropolis, piggy bank, sun, day, piglets 太陽(たいよう): sun, solar 陽射(ひざし): sunlight 陽気(ようき): season, weather, cheerfulness Kunyomi: ひ Onyomi: ヨウ Lesson: 35 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds:"
line up Details Story Dictionary 陳 line up Heisig's Pinnacle . . . east. Koohii #1 Every morning at The Pinnacle, the residents line upon the East side for morning stretches and leisure. Koohii #2 Hikers line up to get to the top of that great pinnacle of the East... Mount Fuji. Seriously, they really do! ...probably the only mountain in the world with a queue at the top. Primitives exhibit, line up, pinnacle, parthenon, acropolis, east, tree, wood, sun, day 陳列(ちんれつ): exhibition, display, show Kunyomi: ひ.ねる Onyomi: チン Lesson: 35 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	line up 陳 画数11 1398 Details Story Dictionary 陳 line up Heisig's Pinnacle . . . east. Koohii #1 Every morning at The Pinnacle, the residents line upon the East side for morning stretches and leisure. Koohii #2 Hikers line up to get to the top of that great pinnacle of the East... Mount Fuji. Seriously, they really do! ...probably the only mountain in the world with a queue at the top. Primitives exhibit, line up, pinnacle, parthenon, acropolis, east, tree, wood, sun, day 陳列(ちんれつ): exhibition, display, show Kunyomi: ひ.ねる Onyomi: チン Lesson: 35 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:
ward off Details Story Dictionary 防 ward off My Story [Town + direction] Koohii #1 A giant compass is The Pinnacle´s self-defense system. It points in the direction of any invaders so the city is prepared well ahead to ward off the intruders. Koohii #2 To ward off enemies, the ancient Greece kept watch from the Acropolis, where they had a clear view in all directions. "descend /rainfall / get out of v Details Story Dictionary 降 descend /rainfall / get out of v My Story [Town + each (bottom) + Fuck] When I descend at a *town*, I give *each* local a good *fuck* Koohii #1 Sunglasses-missing-one-lens is obviously the monocle. The proper, high-class way to descend The Pinnacle is wearing a monocle with your walking legs splayed to a full gentlemanly stride. Koohii #2 After a cool, hip businessman angered the executives at The Pinnacle, they beat him up, popping out a lens from his sunglasses, and tossed out the window, head first, walking legs second. One executive later commented, ""It was like he was descending into Hell from Heaven!"". Primitives descend, pinnacle, parthenon, acropolis, walking legs, sunglasses with one lens missing, monocle 降ろす(おろす): to take down, to launch, to drop, to lower, to let (a person) off, to unload, to discharge 降水(こうすい): rainfall, precipitation 降伏(こうふく): capitulation, surrender, submission 以降(いこう): on and after, hereafter, thereafter 下降(かこう): downward, descent, fall, drop 降りる(おりる): get off, descend (e.g. a mountain) 降る(ふる): to precipitate, to fall (e.g. rain) Kunyomi: お.りる、お.ろす、ふ.る、ふ.り、くだ.る、くだ.す Onyomi: コウ、ゴ Lesson: 35 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 降りる (お.りる), 降ろす (お.ろす), 降る (ふ.る)"	"descend /rainfall / get out of v 降 画数10 1405 Details Story Dictionary 降 descend /rainfall / get out of v My Story [Town + each (bottom) + Fuck] When I descend at a *town*, I give *each* local a good *fuck* Koohii #1 Sunglasses-missing-one-lens is obviously the monocle. story Details Story Dictionary 階 story My Story [Town + All {皆}] In this *town*, *all people* live in 3 story buildings (floors of a building) Koohii #1 All buildings of The Pinnacle are multi-storey. They don´t have much room, so they have to build up. It sucks when someone presses all the buttons on the elevator! You have to stop at each storey! Koohii #2 Some stupid kid has pushed all the buttons in the elevator. As it stops at all storeys you reach a pinnacle of impatience. Finally you reach your storey, the last one, at the pinnacle of the building. "hole Details Story Dictionary 穴 hole Heisig's House . . . eight. * As a primitive, this kanji uses an alternate form: the primitive for eight is replaced with that for human legs. Koohii #1 A black hole is a ""House of Infinity"". Infinity is of course represented by a sideways ""8"", but here we have a Japanese ""8"" instead. Koohii #2 Billiards anyone? House rules here state that the first person to pot the eight ball into the hole wins the game. Primitives hole, house, eight 穴(あな): hole Kunyomi: あな Onyomi: ケツ Lesson: 35 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 穴 (あな)"	"hole 穴 画数5 1413 Details Story Dictionary 穴 hole Heisig's House . . . eight. * As a primitive, this kanji uses an alternate form: the primitive for eight is replaced with that for human legs. Koohii #1 A black hole is a ""House of Infinity"". Infinity is of course represented by a sideways ""8"", but here we have a Japanese ""8"" instead. Koohii #2 Billiards anyone? House rules here state that the first person to pot the eight ball into the hole wins the game. Primitives hole, house, eight 穴(あな): hole Kunyomi: あな Onyomi: ケツ Lesson: 35 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 穴 (あな)"
empty Details Story Dictionary 空 empty Heisig's Hole . . . craft. Koohii #1 The craft of creating a black hole is in creating an emptiness which can attract things. Koohii #2 Hole-craft is the way of making empty spaces, like the sky. Primitives empty, hole, house, human legs, craft 空き(あき): room, time to spare, emptiness, vacant 空間(あきま): vacancy, room for rent or lease 空ろ(うつろ): blank, cavity, hollow, empty (space) 大空(おおぞら): heaven, firmament, the sky 空腹(くうふく): hunger 上空(じょうくう): sky, the skies, high-altitude sky, upper air 空く(すく): be less crowded, open, become open, become empty 空しい(むなしい): vacant, futile, vain, void, empty, ineffective, lifeless 架空(かくう): aerial, overhead, fiction, fanciful 空(から): emptiness 空っぽ(からっぽ): empty, vacant, hollow 空想(くうそう): daydream, fantasy, fancy, vision 空中(くうちゅう): sky, air 航空(こうくう): aviation, flying 真空(しんくう): vacuum, hollow, empty 空く(あく): become vacant 空気(くうき): air 空港(くうこう): air port 空(そら): sky Kunyomi: そら、あ.く、あ.き、あ.ける、から、す.く、す.かす、むな.しい Onyomi: クウ Lesson: 35 Jouyou: 1 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds: 空く (あ.く), 空ける (あ.ける), 空 (から), 空 (そら)	empty 空 画数8 1414 Details Story Dictionary 空 empty Heisig's Hole . . . craft. "withdraw Details Story Dictionary 控 withdraw Heisig's Fingers . . . empty. Koohii #1 With my fingers, I punch in my bank code and withdraw some money from my account. And now it´s empty again, as usual! Koohii #2 If you find yourself in a fight with a karate master with no weapons or martial art skills, just your empty fingers, you should withdraw because 空手 (karate=""empty hand"") is more powerful than 控 (=""empty fingers""). Primitives withdraw, finger, fingers, empty, sky, hole, house, human legs, craft 控除(こうじょ): subsidy, deduction 控室(ひかえしつ): waiting room 控える(ひかえる): to draw in, to hold back, to make notes, to be temperate in Kunyomi: ひか.える、ひか.え Onyomi: コウ Lesson: 35 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 控える (ひか.える)"	"withdraw 控 画数11 1415 Details Story Dictionary 控 withdraw Heisig's Fingers . . . empty. stab Details Story Dictionary 突 stab Heisig's Hole . . . St. Bernard dog. Koohii #1 When you stab something you often leave a big hole. Koohii #2 The police have recruited a special breed of St. Bernard that can lick the wounds of a stabbing victim. The bleeding will stop instantly, saving the victim´s life. One quirky side-effect, however, is that this treatment leaves behind a rather large hole... Primitives stab, hole, house, human legs, large, St. Bernard 突く(つつく): to thrust, to strike, to attack, to poke, to nudge, to pick at 突っ張る(つっぱる): to support, to become stiff, to become taut, to thrust (ones opponent), to stick to (ones opinion), to insist on 突如(とつじょ): suddenly, all of a sudden 突破(とっぱ): breaking through, breakthrough, penetration 煙突(えんとつ): chimney 衝突(しょうとつ): collision, conflict 突き当たり(つきあたり): end (e.g. of street) 突き当たる(つきあたる): run into, collide with 突く(つく): thrust, strike, attack, poke, nudge, pick at 突っ込む(つっこむ): thrust something into something, plunge into, go into deeply, meddle, interfere 突然(とつぜん): abruptly, suddenly, unexpectedly, all at once Kunyomi: つ.く Onyomi: トツ、カ Lesson: 35 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 突く (つ.く)	stab 突 画数8 1416 Details Story Dictionary 突 stab Heisig's Hole . . . depression Details Story Dictionary 窪 depression Heisig's Hole . . . water . . . ivy. The depression referred to here is a sunken place in the ground, rather than in one's spirits. Koohii #1 A depression is a hole in the ground. Water naturally collects there which provides moisture for vines to grow. Koohii #2 The depression in the ground become a trap: the hole was filled with water and covered with ivy. Primitives depression, hole, house, human legs, water, water droplets, water pistol, ivy, square jewel, soil, dirt, ground, soil2, dirt2, ground2 Kunyomi: くぼ.む、くぼ.み、くぼ.まる、くぼ Onyomi: ワ、ア Lesson: 35 Jouyou: Names JLPT Level: Compounds:	depression 窪 画数14 1421 Details Story Dictionary 窪 depression Heisig's Hole . . . water . . . ivy. Koohii #2 (Thanks DrJones) You squeeze the teats of the cow with your fingers but it´s your first try and you don´t have any milk come through the holes, so you take a saw and cut the teats to make bigger holes. Poor cow, this story squeezes my heart. kiln Details Story Dictionary 窯 kiln Heisig's Hole . . . sheep . . . oven fire. Koohii #1 Be sure to put a hole in that ceramic sheep before you put it over the fire. Otherwise, it´ll just explode in the kiln. (If you´ve never done ceramics before, it´s important that the object have a hole in it, or this really will happen.). Koohii #2 You put the sheep in the hole of the kiln and turn on the flames. Primitives kiln, hole, house, human legs, sheep, oven-fire, barbecue Kunyomi: かま Onyomi: ヨウ Lesson: 35 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 窯 (かま)	kiln 窯 画数15 1423 Details Story Dictionary 窯 kiln Heisig's Hole . . . sheep . . . oven fire. Koohii #2 Somebody so hard up for cash, the volunteered to explore a black hole with nothing but a bow. "grope / look for Details Story Dictionary 探 grope / look for My Story *My nigga MO* #looked# everywhere for his virginity, he checked underneath *the table* and under the *trees*, but he couldnt find it Koohii #1 A pictograph of a japanese schoolgirl getting groped by perverts on the train. The fingers of course, a crown (her too short skirt) and her legs below (which to be honest are pretty thick like tree trunks). Koohii #2 Note: The combination ""crown +human legs"" appears seven times in Heisig. In four cases (nos. 323, 1327, 1328, 2920) the crown is above the human legs, and in the other three cases (1888, 2472, 2679) one leg passes through the crown. The naming is inconsistent, so I call the first pattern ""Miss World"" (who is wearing a crown she won due to her attractive human legs) and the second ""garter"" (one human leg passes through the crown and wears it as a garter). Primitives grope, finger, fingers, paper punch, Miss World, hole, house, human legs, tree, wood 探検(たんけん): exploration, expedition 探る(さぐる): search, look for, sound out 探す(さがす): search for, look for Kunyomi: さぐ.る、さが.す Onyomi: タン Lesson: 35 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 探す (さが.す), 探る (さぐ.る)"	"grope / look for 探 画数11 1425 Details Story Dictionary 探 grope / look for My Story *My nigga MO* #looked# everywhere for his virginity, he checked underneath *the table* and under the *trees*, but he couldnt find it Koohii #1 A pictograph of a japanese schoolgirl getting groped by perverts on the train. The fingers of course, a crown (her too short skirt) and her legs below (which to be honest are pretty thick like tree trunks). Koohii #2 Note: The combination ""crown +human legs"" appears seven times in Heisig. In four cases (nos. 323, 1327, 1328, 2920) the crown is above the human legs, and in the other three cases (1888, 2472, 2679) one leg passes through the crown. The naming is inconsistent, so I call the first pattern ""Miss World"" (who is wearing a crown she won due to her attractive human legs) and the second ""garter"" (one human leg passes through the crown and wears it as a garter). Primitives grope, finger, fingers, paper punch, Miss World, hole, house, human legs, tree, wood 探検(たんけん): exploration, expedition 探る(さぐる): search, look for, sound out 探す(さがす): search for, look for Kunyomi: さぐ.る、さが.す Onyomi: タン Lesson: 35 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 探す (さが.す), 探る (さぐ.る)"

hill Details Story Dictionary 丘 hill Heisig's Since this supposedly pictographic representation of a hill looks like anything but, picture a row of axes driven into the ground up to their heads, and see if that doesn't present a more memorable image of hill - at least a riskier one sliding down! Koohii #1 Excalibur is the sword planted in a rock. Lesser known AXCAHILLBUR is the axe planted on top of a hill. Koohii #2 At Capitol Hill proposals get axed on the floor. Primitives hill, axe, one, floor 丘陵(きゅうりょう): hill 丘(おか): hill Kunyomi: おか Onyomi: キュウ Lesson: 35 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 丘 (おか)	hill 丘 画数5 1427 Details Story Dictionary 丘 hill Heisig's Since this supposedly pictographic representation of a hill looks like anything but, picture a row of axes driven into the ground up to their heads, and see if that doesn't present a more memorable image of hill - at least a riskier one sliding down! Koohii #1 Excalibur is the sword planted in a rock. Lesser known AXCAHILLBUR is the axe planted on top of a hill. Koohii #2 At Capitol Hill proposals get axed on the floor. Primitives hill, axe, one, floor 丘陵(きゅうりょう): hill 丘(おか): hill Kunyomi: おか Onyomi: キュウ Lesson: 35 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 丘 (おか)
Point Details Story Dictionary 岳 Point Heisig's Think of the key word as referring to proper names of mountains, but do not confuse with mountain pass (Frame 835). The elements are: hill . . . mountain. Koohii #1 A point is a extra little hill at the top of a mountain. We´ll call it ´Fireman´s Point´. Koohii #2 This actually means a high mountain. So, to cater to the keyword, it´s surely obvious (ahem) that if something gets such a fine title as Point, it must be more magnificent than the average mountain. It´s as if there was a hill on top of an average mountain, adding to its height. Primitives point, hill, axe, one, floor, mountain 山岳(さんがく): mountains Kunyomi: たけ Onyomi: ガク Lesson: 35 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 岳 (たけ)	Point 岳 画数8 1428 Details Story Dictionary 岳 Point Heisig's Think of the key word as referring to proper names of mountains, but do not confuse with mountain pass (Frame 835). The elements are: hill . . . mountain. Koohii #1 A point is a extra little hill at the top of a mountain. We´ll call it ´Fireman´s Point´. Koohii #2 This actually means a high mountain. So, to cater to the keyword, it´s surely obvious (ahem) that if something gets such a fine title as Point, it must be more magnificent than the average mountain. It´s as if there was a hill on top of an average mountain, adding to its height. Primitives point, hill, axe, one, floor, mountain 山岳(さんがく): mountains Kunyomi: たけ Onyomi: ガク Lesson: 35 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 岳 (たけ)
soldier Details Story Dictionary 兵 soldier Heisig's Hill . . . animal legs. Koohii #1 Listen up soldiers! We´re going to take that hill. You are no longer men with human legs. You are voracious animals, with animal legs! Got it? Animal legs! Now take that hill! Koohii #2 The hill is so steep that you almost have to have animal legs to walk on it. However, the soldiers have no problem because they´ve been trained to march there. Primitives soldier, hill, axe, one, floor, animal legs, eight 兵器(へいき): arms, weapons, ordinance 兵士(へいし): soldier 兵隊(へいたい): soldier, sailor Kunyomi: つわもの Onyomi: ヘイ、ヒョウ Lesson: 35 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 兵器 (へいき), 兵隊 (へいたい), 撤兵 (てっぺい)	soldier 兵 画数7 1429 Details Story Dictionary 兵 soldier Heisig's Hill . . . animal legs. Koohii #1 Listen up soldiers! We´re going to take that hill. You are no longer men with human legs. You are voracious animals, with animal legs! Got it? Animal legs! Now take that hill! Koohii #2 The hill is so steep that you almost have to have animal legs to walk on it. However, the soldiers have no problem because they´ve been trained to march there. Primitives soldier, hill, axe, one, floor, animal legs, eight 兵器(へいき): arms, weapons, ordinance 兵士(へいし): soldier 兵隊(へいたい): soldier, sailor Kunyomi: つわもの Onyomi: ヘイ、ヒョウ Lesson: 35 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 兵器 (へいき), 兵隊 (へいたい), 撤兵 (てっぺい)

thread Details Story Dictionary 糸 thread Heisig's Remember when your granny used to ask you to bend your arms at the elbows and hold them out so that she could use them like a rack to hold a skein of string or yarn (here thread) while she rolled it up into a little ball? Now can you see the two elbows (with the second stroke doubling up) at the top, and the character for little below? Koohii #1 I also went with Spiderman. However, in the cases where this primitive appears under other primitives, as opposed to on the left (I think there are ~5 times in this chapter) I´ve opted to use a similar character: Venom. This helps keep the positioning clear, especially on such characters as dainty (#1363) and accumulate (#1364). Koohii #2 You´ll be seeing this one a lot. Seriously. Primitives thread, spiderman 毛糸(けいと): knitting wool 糸(いと): thread Kunyomi: いと Onyomi: シ Lesson: 36 Jouyou: 1 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 糸 (いと)	thread 糸 画数6 1431 Details Story Dictionary 糸 thread Heisig's Remember when your granny used to ask you to bend your arms at the elbows and hold them out so that she could use them like a rack to hold a skein of string or yarn (here thread) while she rolled it up into a little ball? luxuriant Details Story Dictionary 繁 luxuriant Heisig's Cleverness . . . thread. Koohii #1 Important: Luxuriant does NOT mean luxurious, as the other stories indicate. Definition: abundant or lush in growth, as vegetation. When Venom realized he couldn´t beat Spider-Man in a fair fight, he showed his cleverness by spraying venom all over Spider-Man´s luxuriant garden. Koohii #2 Venom is covered in a luxuriant and surprisingly clever symbiotic suit, but it´s also the taskmaster for his every evil act. fine Details Story Dictionary 緻 fine Heisig's The key word should be taken to mean minute, detailed, or nuanced. Its primitive elements are: thread . . . doth. Koohii #1 THREAD, DOTH. fine THREADS DOTH make fine cloth. Think of a Shakespearean character stating this to someone else. Picture fine threads on one side of the picture and an aftershot of a fine cloth. Koohii #2 fine: If the thread doth fit through the eye of the needle, it is fine thread indeed. Kunyomi: こまか.い Onyomi: チ Lesson: 36 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: Compounds:	fine 緻 画数16 1437 Details Story Dictionary 緻 fine Heisig's The key word should be taken to mean minute, detailed, or nuanced. (it is some engineers at work) 温泉 Koohii #1 This kanji is used for train lines. Spiderman does a hot spring tour of Japan using the train lines. You can see the Spidey costume hanging on the washing line as he enjoys the onsen. Koohii #2 Japan´s train lines are like threads that spring from Tokyo station. tighten Details Story Dictionary 締 tighten My Story [String + Sovereign {帝}] Koohii #1 The sovereign appears to be ruling, but in reality someone behind him (for instance his wife) has a thread around his throat, and if he dares to make a decision she doesn´t like, she starts pulling the thread and tightens it around his throat. Koohii #2 (astridtops) Spiderman managed to get behind the sovereign. (pick your favourite nowadays country ruler who isn´t doing a good job). Spidey has tightend a web around the sovereing´s throat. As long as the sovereign says what spidey whispers, he will be fine. Sovereign yelping : ´ we will draw are troops back! and we will spend more money on healthcare, schools and less on wars!´ Spidey whispering: ´ If you continue at this pace, you might be doing good things AND the people will like you.´. Primitives tighten, thread, spiderman, sovereign, vase, stand up, apron, crown, towel 締め切り(しめきり): closing, cut-off, end, deadline, Closed, No Entrance 戸締り(とじまり): closing up, fastening the doors 取り締まり(とりしまり): control, management, supervision 取り締まる(とりしまる): to manage, to control, to supervise 締切(しめきり): closing, cut-off, end, deadline, Closed, No Entrance 締め切る(しめきる): shut up 締める(しめる): to tie, fasten Kunyomi: し.まる、し.まり、し.める、-し.め、-じ.め Onyomi: テイ Lesson: 36 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 締まる (し.まる), 締める (し.める)	tighten 締 画数15 1440 Details Story Dictionary 締 tighten My Story [String + Sovereign {帝}] Koohii #1 The sovereign appears to be ruling, but in reality someone behind him (for instance his wife) has a thread around his throat, and if he dares to make a decision she doesn´t like, she starts pulling the thread and tightens it around his throat. thong Details Story Dictionary 緒 thong Heisig's Thread . . . puppet. Although we usually think of a thong as coming at the end of a piece of string, this character's meaning allows for it to come at the beginning as well. Koohii #1 Spiderman has a secret fetish, he likes nothing better than to dress his lovedoll in a thong. Wierd, eh! Koohii #2 A thread is just the right size for a puppets thong. Primitives thong, thread, spiderman, someone, puppet, sooty, old man, sun, day 情緒(じょうしょ): emotion, feeling 一緒(いっしょ): together, meeting, company Kunyomi: お、いとぐち Onyomi: ショ、チョ Lesson: 36 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 緒戦 (しょせん), 由緒 (ゆいしょ), 端緒 (たんしょ), 緒 (お)	thong 緒 画数14 1444 Details Story Dictionary 緒 thong Heisig's Thread . . . puppet. Although we usually think of a thong as coming at the end of a piece of string, this character's meaning allows for it to come at the beginning as well. Koohii #1 Spiderman has a secret fetish, he likes nothing better than to dress his lovedoll in a thong. Wierd, eh! Koohii #2 A thread is just the right size for a puppets thong. Primitives thong, thread, spiderman, someone, puppet, sooty, old man, sun, day 情緒(じょうしょ): emotion, feeling 一緒(いっしょ): together, meeting, company Kunyomi: お、いとぐち Onyomi: ショ、チョ Lesson: 36 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 緒戦 (しょせん), 由緒 (ゆいしょ), 端緒 (たんしょ), 緒 (お)
continue Details Story Dictionary 続 continue My Story This *thread* (reddit thread) will continue to *sell* porn to people 続ける 続く 続き Koohii #1 If you attach strings to the things you sell, you will be able to continue making profit from them even after the fact. Koohii #2 Even though Peter Parker has become Spiderman, he continues to sell pictures that he takes as a photographer. Primitives continue, thread, spiderman, sell, samurai, crown, human legs 持続(じぞく): continuation 接続詞(せつぞくし): conjunction 存続(そんぞく): duration, continuance 継続(けいぞく): continuation 接続(せつぞく): connection, union, join, link, changing trains 相続(そうぞく): succession, inheritance 続々(ぞくぞく): successively, one after another 続き(つづき): sequel, continuation 手続き(てつづき): procedure, (legal) process, formalities 連続(れんぞく): serial, consecutive, continuity, occurring in succession, continuing 続く(つづく): continue (to be the case), keep up 続ける(つづける): continue, go on, follow Kunyomi: つづ.く、つづ.ける、つぐ.ない Onyomi: ゾク、ショク、コウ、キョウ Lesson: 36 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 続く (つづ.く), 続ける (つづ.ける)	continue 続 画数13 1445 Details Story Dictionary 続 continue My Story This *thread* (reddit thread) will continue to *sell* porn to people 続ける 続く 続き Koohii #1 If you attach strings to the things you sell, you will be able to continue making profit from them even after the fact. overall / tradition Details Story Dictionary 統 overall / tradition My Story (from eri401: This kanji means an overall link that shows key relationships - especially in the sense of who rules/governs. 系統 = けいとう = lineage; ancestry...... 伝統 = でんとう = tradition 統合 =とうごう =(1) unification (2) built-in) If you think of the *thread* stretching back through time, it shows your overall lineage, including what genetic traits have been *allotted* to you. Koohii #1 Spidey is alloted the biggest crime fighter jurisdiction in NYC because his OVERALL arrest record is the best. Koohii #2 According to Greek mythology, there´s a thread alloted to everyone, and its length is the overall determinant of your fate. Primitives overall, thread, spiderman, allot, infant, toddler, top hat, elbow, human legs 統合(とうごう): integration, unification, synthesis 統治(とうじ): rule, reign, government, governing 統制(とうせい): regulation, control 統率(とうそつ): command, lead, generalship, leadership 系統(けいとう): system, family line, lineage, ancestry, geological formation 大統領(だいとうりょう): president, chief executive 伝統(でんとう): tradition, convention 統一(とういつ): unity, consolidation, uniformity, unification, compatible 統計(とうけい): statistics Kunyomi: す.べる、ほび.る Onyomi: トウ Lesson: 36 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 統べる (す.べる)	overall / tradition 統 画数12 1447 Details Story Dictionary 統 overall / tradition My Story (from eri401: This kanji means an overall link that shows key relationships - especially in the sense of who rules/governs. 系統 = けいとう = lineage; ancestry...... 伝統 = でんとう = tradition 統合 =とうごう =(1) unification (2) built-in) If you think of the *thread* stretching back through time, it shows your overall lineage, including what genetic traits have been *allotted* to you. He wants to strangle someone after just a little small talk. Koohii #2 At the elegant cocktail party of VIP's, the spy, dressed like everyone else in formal evening wear, sneaks in and strangles his victim with a very thin wire - a thread. Afterwards he mingles in with the crowd and disappears. salary Details Story Dictionary 給 salary My Story [Thread/String + Fit {合}] The *thread*s you wear show if your salary is *fit* for this society Koohii #1 If your threads 糸 don't fit 合 right you're not going to be able to get a job with a decent salary. Koohii #2 Spiderman has so little free time in his schedule that he is unable to fit in a job with a good salary. Koohii #2 Spiderman entwines each villain in a tangled mess of spidersilk. "tie Details Story Dictionary 結 tie My Story [String + good omen {吉}] When my wife and I #tied# the knot (結婚・けっこん), Spider-Man {糸} was there to wish us *good luck*. Best. Wedding. Ever. Koohii #1 Ok, here, you have to think of the phrase ""TIE the knot"" , which means a wedding (this kanji is used in the marriage compound 結婚 けっこん ). Now, at US weddings, it ends with the couple driving away with cans being dragged behind the car. So here, think of SPIDERMAN, who will TIE the knot with Mary Jane. At his wedding, Spider THREAD attached (or TIED) to SPRAYCANS are being drug behind the limo as they drive off. Koohii #2 Spiderman and a fan have a competition to see who can tie up the most enemies fastest. Spidey´s using his webs and the fan is using an aerosol can of silly string. So far they are tied. Primitives tie, thread, spiderman, aerosol, samurai, mouth 結核(けっかく): tuberculosis, tubercule 結合(けつごう): combination, union 結晶(けっしょう): crystal, crystallization 結成(けっせい): formation 結束(けっそく): union, unity 妥結(だけつ): agreement 団結(だんけつ): unity, union, combination 結び(むすび): ending, conclusion, union 結び付き(むすびつき): connection, relation 結び付く(むすびつく): to be connected or related, to join together 結び付ける(むすびつける): to combine, to join, to tie on, to attach with a knot 結果(けっか): result, consequence 結局(けっきょく): after all, eventually 結論(けつろん): reason, sum up, conclude 結ぶ(むすぶ): tie, bind, link 結構(けっこう): splendid, nice, wonderful, delicious, sweet, construction, architecture, well enough, tolerably 結婚(けっこん): marriage Kunyomi: むす.ぶ、ゆ.う、ゆ.わえる Onyomi: ケツ、ケチ Lesson: 36 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 結ぶ (むす.ぶ), 結う (ゆ.う), 結わえる (ゆ.わえる)"	"tie 結 画数12 1451 Details Story Dictionary 結 tie My Story [String + good omen {吉}] When my wife and I #tied# the knot (結婚・けっこん), Spider-Man {糸} was there to wish us *good luck*. "class Details Story Dictionary 級 class Heisig's Threads . . . outstretched hands. Koohii #1 This Kanji is the same ones used in the Japanese Language proficiency tests; i.e. ikkyuu (一級) The Kanji doesnt describe class as in a ""class of students"" or ""classroom,"" but rather a grade of quality or ability. ---------- Spiderman is taking the JLPT Level 1. In desperation he REACHES OUT to grab his friend´s answer sheet next to him, who seems to be doing well. The other test takers are obviously a class above him. Looks like this test is above his class of knowledge. Koohii #2 We can almost see the outstreched hands of the lower classes wearing just a few threads in this kanji. Primitives class, thread, spiderman, reach out, outstretched hands 階級(かいきゅう): class, rank, grade 等級(とうきゅう): grade, class 同級(どうきゅう): the same grade, same class 学級(がっきゅう): grade in school 級(きゅう): class, grade, rank 高級(こうきゅう): high class, high grade 上級(じょうきゅう): advanced level, high grade, senior 初級(しょきゅう): elementary level Kunyomi: Onyomi: キュウ Lesson: 36 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"	"class 級 画数9 1453 Details Story Dictionary 級 class Heisig's Threads . . . outstretched hands. settlement Details Story Dictionary 納 settlement Heisig's Thread . . . inside. Koohii #1 Have you heard about patients who have surgery and the doctor mistakenly leaves a medical instrument INSIDE the patient’s body and proceeds to stitch up the patient’s incisions with stitching THREAD? Can you say “malpractice SETTLEMENT”?　. Koohii #2 Spider-Man was working as a surgeon´s assistant. By accident, he threw his spider webs inside the patient, causing his death. Fortunately, the hospital reached an out-of-court settlement with the victim´s family. Primitives settlement, thread, spiderman, inside, person, belt 納まる(おさまる): to be obtained, to end, to settle into, to fit into, to be settled, to be paid, to be delivered 納める(おさめる): to obtain, to reap, to pay, to supply, to accept 滞納(たいのう): non-payment, default 納入(のうにゅう): payment, supply 納得(なっとく): consent, assent, understanding, agreement, comprehension, grasp Kunyomi: おさ.める、-おさ.める、おさ.まる Onyomi: ノウ、ナッ、ナ、ナン、トウ Lesson: 36 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 納入 (のうにゅう), 納涼 (のうりょう), 収納 (しゅうのう), 納得 (なっとく), 納豆 (なっとう), 納屋 (なや), 納戸 (なんど), 納まる (おさ.まる), 納める (おさ.める)	settlement 納 画数10 1456 Details Story Dictionary 納 settlement Heisig's Thread . . . inside. Koohii #1 Have you heard about patients who have surgery and the doctor mistakenly leaves a medical instrument INSIDE the patient’s body and proceeds to stitch up the patient’s incisions with stitching THREAD? Can you say “malpractice SETTLEMENT”?　. Koohii #2 Spider-Man was working as a surgeon´s assistant. By accident, he threw his spider webs inside the patient, causing his death. Fortunately, the hospital reached an out-of-court settlement with the victim´s family. Primitives settlement, thread, spiderman, inside, person, belt 納まる(おさまる): to be obtained, to end, to settle into, to fit into, to be settled, to be paid, to be delivered 納める(おさめる): to obtain, to reap, to pay, to supply, to accept 滞納(たいのう): non-payment, default 納入(のうにゅう): payment, supply 納得(なっとく): consent, assent, understanding, agreement, comprehension, grasp Kunyomi: おさ.める、-おさ.める、おさ.まる Onyomi: ノウ、ナッ、ナ、ナン、トウ Lesson: 36 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 納入 (のうにゅう), 納涼 (のうりょう), 収納 (しゅうのう), 納得 (なっとく), 納豆 (なっとう), 納屋 (なや), 納戸 (なんど), 納まる (おさ.まる), 納める (おさ.める)

Koohii #2 Spiderman got distracted when someone yelled, ""Spiderman, wait a minute."" He turned around and flew into a building. (""part"" also means ""minute""). experience/sutra Details Story Dictionary 経 experience/sutra My Story This experience was like a *thread*, not like *Jesus taking a dump* Koohii #1 The word ‘sutra’ literally means a rope or thread that holds things together. Here we see that it is a spool that is holding the threads together. Koohii #2 Spiderman is intriqued by some of the positions of the karma sutra, but reluctant to take part in an sutra orgy as he´d have to reveal his soiled underwear. "promise Details Story Dictionary 約 promise My Story Blood oath is a promise, where a drop of blood turns into a binding thread. Koohii #1 He tied a thread around the ladle as a reminder of his promise to do more house work. Koohii #2 Spiderman promised to get Aunt Mae´s ladle back. He started to do a blood oath by spilling drops of blood but Aunt Mae stopped him and bound up the wound. ""It´s only a ladle Peter"". accumulate Details Story Dictionary 累 accumulate Heisig's Rice field . . . threads. Make use of the position of the elements to distinguish this kanji from that of the previous frame. Koohii #1 When you accumulate knowledge in your brain, neural pathways are constructed. All those pathways end up like a huge ball of thread tangled together. The more knowledge you accumulate the more threads you throw into the mix!! Koohii #2 (dingomick) Venom is upset because Spidey is just that much brainier than he is! He chooses to accumulate as many brains as he can, snatching them out of people´s heads and storing them on top of his own, till there´s just one massive brain on top of his head! Primitives accumulate, rice field, brains, thread, spiderman Kunyomi: Onyomi: ルイ Lesson: 36 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	accumulate 累 画数11 1464 Details Story Dictionary 累 accumulate Heisig's Rice field . . . threads. green Details Story Dictionary 緑 green My Story I have a RE-OCCURRING nightmare where green water pours out of my snout like a green string uncoiling. (see {録}, {線}) Koohii #1 When you attend a green tea (緑茶=りょくちゃ) ceremony, you can cherish the threadwork on the kimonos people don, the broom-like whisk (茶筌 =ちゃせん) you use to grind up your tea, and the delicious rice cakes you eat with your tea! Koohii #2 In summer, all of Japan turns green with the green threads that fan out like brooms to later produce grains of rice. An easy image if you have ever looked out the window of the train to see all the summer rice paddies... Primitives green, thread, spiderman, dustpan, broom, grains of rice 緑(みどり): green Kunyomi: みどり Onyomi: リョク、ロク Lesson: 36 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 緑茶 (りょくちゃ), 緑陰 (みどりいん), 新緑 (しんりょく), 緑 (みどり)	green 緑 画数14 1471 Details Story Dictionary 緑 green My Story I have a RE-OCCURRING nightmare where green water pours out of my snout like a green string uncoiling. affinity Details Story Dictionary 縁 affinity Heisig's Thread . . . broom . . . sow. Koohii #1 There once was a lonely little pig that constantly followed Spiderman, always nuzzling his leg and oinking tenderly. Spiderman finally caved in and decided to keep the little pig under one condition: the pig was to take a broom and sweep up all of Spiderman´s leftover threads after having fought crime. The pig felt such affinity for Spiderman, he happily accepted—and did a good job too. Koohii #2 Certain people have an affinity for romantic partners who are handy with thread and a broom - it is of no consequence if they look like pigs. hmm... Primitives affinity, thread, spiderman, broom, sow, pig 縁(えん): chance, fate, destiny, relation, bonds, connection, karma 縁側(えんがわ): veranda, porch, balcony, open corridor 縁談(えんだん): marriage proposal, engagement 縁(ふち): (surrounding) edge Kunyomi: ふち、ふちど.る、ゆかり、よすが、へり、えにし Onyomi: エン、ネン Lesson: 36 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 縁 (ふち)	affinity 縁 画数15 1472 Details Story Dictionary 縁 affinity Heisig's Thread . . . broom . . . sow. Koohii #1 There once was a lonely little pig that constantly followed Spiderman, always nuzzling his leg and oinking tenderly. Spiderman finally caved in and decided to keep the little pig under one condition: the pig was to take a broom and sweep up all of Spiderman´s leftover threads after having fought crime. The pig felt such affinity for Spiderman, he happily accepted—and did a good job too. Koohii #2 Certain people have an affinity for romantic partners who are handy with thread and a broom - it is of no consequence if they look like pigs. hmm... "straw rope Details Story Dictionary 縄 straw rope Heisig's Thread . . . eels. Koohii #1 The tortoise has escaped! We tied it up with a straw rope, but all that´s left of the rope are some torn threads, and the unbound tortoise is nowhere to be found. (Note that the right half here is not ""eels"". This is (in my opinion) a mistake in the RTK book, as we already decided in waterfall (#537) to refer to the simplified form of dragon as ""eels"". It is much better to call the right half of this character an ""unbound tortoise"".). Koohii #2 When Spiderman fights the giant tortoise, he grabs a straw rope from the edges of the sumo ring and swings it at his head. However, the tortoise quickly tucks his head back into his shell to avoid the blow (hence no head on the tortoise). Primitives straw rope, thread, spiderman, eels, sun, day 縄(なわ): rope, hemp Kunyomi: なわ、ただ.す Onyomi: ジョウ Lesson: 36 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 縄 (なわ)"	"straw rope 縄 画数15 1477 Details Story Dictionary 縄 straw rope Heisig's Thread . . . eels. infancy Details Story Dictionary 幼 infancy Heisig's Cocoon . . . muscle. Koohii #1 In its infancy, a butterfly is protected by a cocoon, as it doesn´t yet have any power of its own. Koohii #2 During their infancy, children are often wrapped up tight like a cocoon (i.e. in those Snugli carriers) and supported by the muscle of their parents. Koohii #2 after a grub goes through the cocoon stage, it leaves its walking legs behind for a life of flight. how many Details Story Dictionary 幾 how many Heisig's Two cocoons . . . person . . . fiesta. * As a primitive, this kanji will mean an abacus, the bead-instrument used in the Orient to calculate how many. Koohii #1 It is a little awkward when you are at a fiesta and the host serves some rare delicacy, like moth cocoons, the guests must decide how many it would be polite to eat. You do the math in your head and it comes out to two cocoons per person. This is why the horizontal line is a fraction bar with two cocoons on the top, and one person the bottom. Koohii #2 How many went to the party? Two aliens and one person (I feel sorry for that person). Primitives how many, cocoon, person, fiesta, cocoon2 幾多(いくた): many, numerous 幾つ(いくつ): how many?, how old? 幾分(いくぶん): somewhat 幾ら(いくら): how much?, how many? Kunyomi: いく-、いく.つ、いく.ら Onyomi: キ Lesson: 36 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 幾 (いく)	how many 幾 画数12 1481 Details Story Dictionary 幾 how many Heisig's Two cocoons . . . person . . . fiesta. * As a primitive, this kanji will mean an abacus, the bead-instrument used in the Orient to calculate how many. "mechanism Details Story Dictionary 機 mechanism Heisig's Tree . . . abacus. Koohii #1 An abacus is a mechanism made of wood used to calculate how many ´anythings´. Koohii #2 To avoid confusing with contraption (#677), focus on the ""ism"" of mechanism. For example, fetishism refers to having a fetish; mechanism here refers to having a mecha-like property, where mecha is a type of anime robot that can transform itself. Imagine a mecha that can transform itself between two forms: a huge immovable tree (as a form of defense) and a gigantic marching abacus that smashes enemies between its giant beads. Primitives mechanism, tree, wood, abacus, how many, cocoon, person, fiesta, cocoon2 危機(きき): crisis 機構(きこう): mechanism, organization 契機(けいき): opportunity, chance 動機(どうき): motive, incentive 機(はた): loom 有機(ゆうき): organic 機械(きかい): machine, mechanism 機関(きかん): organ, mechanism, facility, engine 機関車(きかんしゃ): locomotive, engine 機嫌(きげん): humour, temper, mood 機能(きのう): function, faculty 交通機関(こうつうきかん): transportation facilities ジェット機(ジェットき): jet airplane 扇風機(せんぷうき): electric fan 機会(きかい): opportunity, chance 飛行機(ひこうき): airplane Kunyomi: はた Onyomi: キ Lesson: 36 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 機 (はた)"	"mechanism 機 画数16 1482 Details Story Dictionary 機 mechanism Heisig's Tree . . . abacus. amass Details Story Dictionary 蓄 amass Heisig's Flowers . . . livestock. Koohii #1 One sneaky farmer wanted to amass a large collection of livestock. We all know that cows like to eat flowers, so he planted lines of flowers leading to his own fields. The livestock followed the lines, eating the flowers one by one, and amassed in his field. Koohii #2 Kobe beef. The Japanese amass a fortune pampering livestock feeding them flowers, offering beer, playing music and giving them massages… RTK2:　チク　蓄電池　ちくでんち(battery cell)…　Pure Group:　畜1384. hug Details Story Dictionary 擁 hug Heisig's Fingers . . . mysterious . . . turkey. Note that the top hat is extended across both elements, though it belongs only to the cocoon. This means that you may either use mysterious - as we did here - or take the three elements separately. Koohii #1 A mysterious turkey with human fingers wants to hug me... I will never go to Tokyo Disneyland again! Koohii #2 Imagine Gandalf hugging a turkey....ouch! It bit off his finger! Primitives hug, finger, fingers, mysterious, top hat, cocoon, turkey Kunyomi: Onyomi: ヨウ Lesson: 36 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	hug 擁 画数16 1488 Details Story Dictionary 擁 hug Heisig's Fingers . . . mysterious . . . turkey. Note that the top hat is extended across both elements, though it belongs only to the cocoon. This means that you may either use mysterious - as we did here - or take the three elements separately. Koohii #1 A mysterious turkey with human fingers wants to hug me... I will never go to Tokyo Disneyland again! Koohii #2 Imagine Gandalf hugging a turkey....ouch! It bit off his finger! Primitives hug, finger, fingers, mysterious, top hat, cocoon, turkey Kunyomi: Onyomi: ヨウ Lesson: 36 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:
nourishing Details Story Dictionary 滋 nourishing Heisig's Water . . . double-mysterious. Note the doubling up of the element for top hat in the primitive for mysterious and assign it a special image, as it will come up in the next two frames. Koohii #1 Water is doubly mysterious. It´s in all our nourishment...and yet, it´s really not nourishing at all. Koohii #2 Going off the idea of the right side meaning rapid growth/increase of small objects, I´ve decided to make the right side be Gremlins, those little mysterious creatures that double rapidly. Gremlins find water a little too nourishing, as it makes them instantly multiply. Primitives nourishing, water, water droplets, water pistol, double-mysterious, mothballs, horns, one, cocoon, cocoon2 Kunyomi: Onyomi: ジ Lesson: 36 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	nourishing 滋 画数12 1489 Details Story Dictionary 滋 nourishing Heisig's Water . . . double-mysterious. (see astridtops´ story). Koohii #2 I found some stones on the siamese twins. Turns out the stones were magnetic, and they weren´t siamese twins at all! lineage Details Story Dictionary 系 lineage My Story [Drop + Thread/String] (Primitive: #DNA#) a *drop* of looong spiraled *thread* that is the key to your #lineage#. * As a primitive, we shall give this kanji the meaning of yarn, as the uniting of many threads into a single strand is most obvious with yarn. Koohii #1 A single drop of your blood holds the proof of the unbroken thread of your lineage. Koohii #2 Spiderman´s lineage (who his family is etc...) can be found in his DNA in a drop of blood. The villain that gets blood of Spidey will be able to find out who is family and lineage is. be carfefull spidey... Primitives lineage, stick, drop, thread, spiderman 系(けい): system, lineage, group 系統(けいとう): system, family line, lineage, ancestry, geological formation 体系(たいけい): system, organization Kunyomi: Onyomi: ケイ Lesson: 36 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	lineage 系 画数7 1492 Details Story Dictionary 系 lineage My Story [Drop + Thread/String] (Primitive: #DNA#) a *drop* of looong spiraled *thread* that is the key to your #lineage#. * As a primitive, we shall give this kanji the meaning of yarn, as the uniting of many threads into a single strand is most obvious with yarn. "person in charge Details Story Dictionary 係 person in charge My Story [Person + group/tribe {系} ] Person 亻 with the royal lineage 系 is Kate so she's the person in charge. (""Kate"" implies the reading ケイ. Other reading: かかり.) 関係 (かんけい) connection. Mr. T is the person in charge of the DNA research center. Koohii #1 Mister T gets a DNA test, and discovers that he was meant to be the person in charge after all. Koohii #2 The person in charge usually must come from a long standing lineage of persons in charge. Primitives person in charge, person, lineage, drop, thread, spiderman 係り(かかり): official, duty, person in charge 係わる(かかわる): concern oneself in, have to do with, affect, influence 関係(かんけい): relationship Kunyomi: かか.る、かかり、-がかり、かか.わる Onyomi: ケイ Lesson: 36 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 係る (かか.る), 係 (かかり)"	"person in charge 係 画数9 1493 Details Story Dictionary 係 person in charge My Story [Person + group/tribe {系} ] Person 亻 with the royal lineage 系 is Kate so she's the person in charge. suspend Details Story Dictionary 懸 suspend My Story [Prefecture {県} + String + Heart] This *prefecture* would suspend (hang) people with a *string* until their *heart* stopped beating Used in: 一生懸命 (いっしょうけんめい) Koohii #1 The prefecture has suspended all DNA research for heart disease because of corruption. All involved will be suspended by their wrists. Koohii #2 There's a suspension bridge connecting one of the prefectures to the Japanese heartland. The supporting cables of the bridge actually look like DNA double-helices. That's Japan for you! Koohii #2 If you tried to attach money to an envelope to pay for postage it would be GONE before it arrived at the post office. That´s why we use STAMPS instead. shins Details Story Dictionary 脚 shins Heisig's Part of the body . . . instead. This character has more or less the same meaning as that for leg learned back in frame 1372. It can also indicate the part of the legs from the shins down, which explains the choice of the key word. Koohii #1 Shins are the part of the body that one uses instead of one´s eyes, for finding furniture in the dark. (Ouch!). Koohii #2 Shins are the part of the body that Japanese traditionally sit on instead of their asses. Primitives skids, shins, moon, month, flesh, part of the body, instead, gone, soil, dirt, ground, elbow, stamp 脚色(きゃくしょく): dramatization (e.g. film) 脚本(きゃくほん): scenario Kunyomi: あし Onyomi: キャク、キャ、カク Lesson: 37 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 脚部 (きゃくぶ), 脚本 (きゃくほん), 三脚 (さんきゃく), 脚 (あし)	shins 脚 画数11 1498 Details Story Dictionary 脚 shins Heisig's Part of the body . . . instead. wholesale Details Story Dictionary 卸 wholesale Heisig's The left primitive is a union of a horse and footprint. To the right, the stamp. Koohii #1 Wholesale refers to the sale of goods in quantity to retailers for resale. When this kanji was invented, large loads of goods needed to be transported by horses who left steep footprints because of the weight they carried. The wholesale goods needed a special stamp to indicate that they were legal for resale. Koohii #2 If you need horseshoes (shoes that fit your horse´s footprint), buy them at the wholesale shop. They lick and paste stamps in your membership card so you can get free merchandise later. Primitives wholesale, horseshoe, horse, pantomime horse, noon, sign of the horse, stop, footprint, stamp 卸す(おろす): sell wholesale, grated (vegetables) Kunyomi: おろ.す、おろし、おろ.し Onyomi: シャ Lesson: 37 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 卸す (おろ.す), 卸 (おろし)	wholesale 卸 画数9 1499 Details Story Dictionary 卸 wholesale Heisig's The left primitive is a union of a horse and footprint. honorable Details Story Dictionary 御 honorable Heisig's Line . . . wholesale. Koohii #1 An honorable man will not try to cut in front of the line at the wholesale stamp store. (Imagine just how much honor it takes facing those long lines at the post office!). Koohii #2 If a trader has an honorable reputation- then people will line up to buy his wholesale goods. clothing Details Story Dictionary 服 clothing My Story You gotta have a *wardrobe* of clothing to cover your *organs*, so you don't get arrested. Koohii #1 It´s customary to cover the flesh with clothing, but some designs are so outrageous they´re not bigger than a stamp that just covers your crotch. Koohii #2 Modern clothing shows a lot of flesh -- some is practically no more than a postage stamp covering your crotch! fate Details Story Dictionary 命 fate Heisig's This character connotes life in general, but also the particular life that is fated one by virtue of the distinctive character with which one is born. Its elements are: fit . . . stamp. The bottom portion of fit is nudged to the left in order to make room for the stamp. Koohii #1 When you´re born, your fate is measured, fitted, and stamped onto your soul. Good luck defying it. Koohii #2 Your ability to resist FATE can be fit on a postage stamp. Primitives fate, fit, meeting, umbrella, one, mouth, stamp 運命(うんめい): fate 革命(かくめい): revolution 使命(しめい): mission, errand, message 宿命(しゅくめい): fate, destiny, predestination 任命(にんめい): appointment, nomination, ordination, commission, designation 命中(めいちゅう): a hit 命(いのち): (mortal) life 寿命(じゅみょう): life span 人命(じんめい): (human) life 生命(せいめい): life, existence 命じる(めいじる): to order, command, appoint 命ずる(めいずる): to command, appoint 命令(めいれい): order, command, decree, directive, (software) instruction 一生懸命(いっしょうけんめい): as well as one can, as hard as one can Kunyomi: いのち Onyomi: メイ、ミョウ Lesson: 37 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 命令 (めいれい), 運命 (うんめい), 生命 (せいめい), 命 (いのち)	fate 命 画数8 1502 Details Story Dictionary 命 fate Heisig's This character connotes life in general, but also the particular life that is fated one by virtue of the distinctive character with which one is born. Its elements are: fit . . . stamp. The bottom portion of fit is nudged to the left in order to make room for the stamp. "orders Details Story Dictionary 令 orders Heisig's Meeting . . . chop-seal. Koohii #1 (re: dingomick) ""These are your orders,"" declares the general while passing out documents at the meeting. As everyone started to leave, the general exclaims ""Oh wait! I need to certify these orders!"" and went around stamping each paper with his personal chop-seal. Koohii #2 These are your orders, declares the general at the meeting as he stamps them with his chop-seal. (Primitive: chop-seal imaged as a papal ring, the one´s they would press into wax as their official seal. Also a cattle brand.). Primitives orders, meeting, chop-seal, hanko 指令(しれい): orders, instructions, directive 仮令(たとえ): example, even if, if, though, although 命令(めいれい): order, command, decree, directive, (software) instruction Kunyomi: Onyomi: レイ Lesson: 37 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds:"	"orders 令 画数5 1503 Details Story Dictionary 令 orders Heisig's Meeting . . . chop-seal. Koohii #1 (re: dingomick) ""These are your orders,"" declares the general while passing out documents at the meeting. As everyone started to leave, the general exclaims ""Oh wait! I need to certify these orders!"" and went around stamping each paper with his personal chop-seal. age Details Story Dictionary 齢 age Heisig's This character is used to express the years of one's age. Its elements: teeth . . . orders. Koohii #1 You know you are fast approaching a ripe old AGE when you get ORDERS from the dentist to get new TEETH. Koohii #2 This has the nuance of a life milestone. Here it's represented by the life-cycle of teeth: In childhood, your teeth give the orders, growing whenever they want. As a teenager, we give orders to the teeth, by putting braces on them. In old age, we order new teeth! Primitives age, teeth, tooth, stop, footprint, rice, shovel, orders, meeting, chop-seal, hanko 年齢(ねんれい): age, years Kunyomi: よわ.い、とし Onyomi: レイ Lesson: 37 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 2 Compounds:	age 齢 画数17 1505 Details Story Dictionary 齢 age Heisig's This character is used to express the years of one's age. In old age, we order new teeth! Koohii #2 The Japanese boss gives an order at the meeting: eat ice to stay cool (since they won´t be running the air conditioning anymore). Primitives cool, ice, orders, meeting, chop-seal, hanko 冷やかす(ひやかす): to banter, to make fun of, to jeer at, to cool, to refrigerate 冷酷(れいこく): cruelty, coldheartedness, relentless, ruthless 冷蔵(れいぞう): cold storage, refrigeration 冷淡(れいたん): coolness, indifference 冷ます(さます): cool, dampen, let cool, throw a damper on, spoil 冷める(さめる): become cool, wear off, abate, subside, dampen 冷やす(ひやす): cool, refrigerate 冷静(れいせい): calm, composure, coolness, serenity 冷凍(れいとう): freezing, cold storage, refrigeration 冷房(れいぼう): cooling, air-conditioning 冷える(ひえる): get cold 冷たい(つめたい): cold (to the touch), chilly, icy, freezing, coldhearted 冷蔵庫(れいぞうこ): refrigerator Kunyomi: つめ.たい、ひ.える、ひ.や、ひ.ややか、ひ.やす、ひ.やかす、さ.める、さ.ます Onyomi: レイ Lesson: 37 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 冷ます (さ.ます), 冷める (さ.める), 冷たい (つめ.たい), 冷える (ひ.える), 冷や (ひ.や), 冷やかす (ひ.やかす), 冷やす (ひ.やす)	cool 冷 画数7 1506 Details Story Dictionary 冷 cool Heisig's Ice . . . orders. jurisdiction / territory Details Story Dictionary 領 jurisdiction / territory My Story [Command/order + Head/Page] *Commands* are given by the *head* person in any #jurisdiction#. Koohii #1 Two cowboys are crossing a state limit. One says to him “Did you know that in this Jurisdiction there are Orders to get your head?”, so he takes out his gun and shoots him. He claims the reward afterwards. (Thanks Fuaburisu). Koohii #2 Orders are given by the head person in any jurisdiction. Primitives jurisdiction, orders, meeting, chop-seal, hanko, head, page, one, ceiling, drop, shellfish, clam, oyster, eye, animal legs, eight 占領(せんりょう): occupation, capture, possession, have a room to oneself 領域(りょういき): area, domain, territory, field, region, regime 領海(りょうかい): territorial waters 領地(りょうち): territory, dominion 領土(りょうど): dominion, territory, possession 大統領(だいとうりょう): president, chief executive 要領(ようりょう): point, gist, essentials, outline 領事(りょうじ): consul 領収(りょうしゅう): receipt, voucher Kunyomi: えり Onyomi: リョウ Lesson: 37 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds:	jurisdiction / territory 領 画数14 1507 Details Story Dictionary 領 jurisdiction / territory My Story [Command/order + Head/Page] *Commands* are given by the *head* person in any #jurisdiction#. courage Details Story Dictionary 勇 courage Heisig's Chop-seal . . . man. Koohii #1 I imagined some kind of initiation rite in old China, where every young man has to show his courage. They then receive a chopseal which is a mark of their courage. Koohii #2 Re: fuaburisu - The initiation rite in question is actually a reverse elbow chop to the brain, and you receive the chop seal if you have the power to withstand it. This initial imagery helps me with the altered chop seal and vertical placement. Primitives courage, chop-seal, hanko, male, rice field, brains, power, muscle, arnold 勇敢(ゆうかん): bravery, heroism, gallantry 勇ましい(いさましい): brave, valiant, gallant, courageous 勇気(ゆうき): courage, bravery, valour, nerve, boldness Kunyomi: いさ.む Onyomi: ユウ Lesson: 37 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 勇む (いさ.む)	courage 勇 画数9 1509 Details Story Dictionary 勇 courage Heisig's Chop-seal . . . man. traffic Details Story Dictionary 通 traffic My Story If yo *MA*MA and her *elephant* ass dont start *moving*, traffic will be the last of worries. Koohii #1 I bounce down the road on my pogo stick, easily getting through the dense traffic. (Note: New primitive: chop-seal + utilize = pogo stick. Because a chop-seal is long and thin with a rubbery bit at the end. If it were big enough, you could utilize it as a pogo stick). [Edit: pogo stick also appears in 1409, 1690, 2530]. Koohii #2 Building on gorgon´s story I now change mine to a much more silly and rememberable one. The Chinese police is using a helicopter to check and regulate the traffic. Hanging from the helicopter is a huge chopseal that they utilize to mark some of the cars that are causing trouble on the road. Primitives traffic, pogo stick, chop-seal, hanko, utilise, utilize, road 通(つう): connoisseur, counter for letters 通常(つうじょう): common, general, usually 通りかかる(とおりかかる): to happen to pass by 似通う(にかよう): to resemble closely 見通し(みとおし): perspective, unobstructed view, outlook, forecast, prospect, insight 遣り通す(やりとおす): to carry through, to achieve, to complete 融通(ゆうずう): lending (money), accommodation, adaptability, versatility, finance 流通(りゅうつう): circulation of money or goods, flow of water or air, distribution 大通り(おおどおり): main street 開通(かいつう): opening, open 共通(きょうつう): commonness, community 交通機関(こうつうきかん): transportation facilities 透き通る(すきとおる): be or become transparent 直通(ちょくつう): direct communication 通過(つうか): passage through, passing 通貨(つうか): currency 通学(つうがく): commuting to school 通勤(つうきん): commuting to work 通行(つうこう): passage, passing 通じる(つうじる): run to, lead to, communicate, understand, be well-informed 通信(つうしん): correspondence, communication, news, signal 通ずる(つうずる): run to, lead to, communicate, understand, be well-informed 通知(つうち): notice, notification 通帳(つうちょう): passbook 通訳(つうやく): interpretation 通用(つうよう): popular use, circulation 通路(つうろ): passage, pathway 通す(とおす): let pass, overlook, continue, keep, make way for, persist in 通り掛かる(とおりかかる): happen to pass by 通り過ぎる(とおりすぎる): pass, pass through 一通り(ひととおり): ordinary, usual, in general, briefly 人通り(ひとどおり): pedestrian traffic 不通(ふつう): suspension, interruption, stoppage, tie-up, cessation 通う(かよう): go to (school, work) 交通(こうつう): traffic 通り(とおり): street, road 通る(とおる): pass, go along 普通(ふつう): normally, usually Kunyomi: とお.る、とお.り、-とお.り、-どお.り、とお.す、とお.し、-どお.し、かよ.う Onyomi: ツウ、ツ Lesson: 37 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds: 通行 (つうこう), 通読 (つうどく), 普通 (ふつう), 通う (かよ.う), 通す (とお.す), 通る (とお.る)	traffic 通 画数10 1511 Details Story Dictionary 通 traffic My Story If yo *MA*MA and her *elephant* ass dont start *moving*, traffic will be the last of worries. "jump Details Story Dictionary 踊 jump My Story 踊る (to dance (2) ; to jump): With your mouth, stop passing through MA and her curvy elephant, while we are dancing Koohii #1 The winner of the long jump competition was disqualified when they found he used a pogo stick tied to his leg to jump further. Koohii #2 The high jumper has his wooden leg fitted with a pogo stick, and can now jump even higher. (See my note at traffic (#1408) for pogo stick). EDIT (2 years later): Keyword ""jump"" leads to confusion later on (see cjon256´s post), ""Dancing"" would be better (but be sure to keep it distinct from dance (#1774)). New Story: I was no good at dancing due to my wooden leg... until I had it fitted with a pogo stick! Primitives jump, wooden leg, mouth, stop, footprint, pogo stick, chop-seal, hanko, utilise, utilize 踊り(おどり): dancing 踊る(おどる): to dance Kunyomi: おど.る Onyomi: ヨウ Lesson: 37 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 踊り (おど.り), 踊る (おど.る)"	"jump 踊 画数14 1512 Details Story Dictionary 踊 jump My Story 踊る (to dance (2) ; to jump): With your mouth, stop passing through MA and her curvy elephant, while we are dancing Koohii #1 The winner of the long jump competition was disqualified when they found he used a pogo stick tied to his leg to jump further. doubt Details Story Dictionary 疑 doubt Heisig's Spoon . . . dart . . . chop-seal . . . zoo. Koohii #1 (Katsuo) You come at the zoo entrance. ´Here sir, a spoon to feed the animals.´ cool ´and a dart(gun) in case stuff go wrong´ ....´ please chop-seal (sign) here for in case of accidents the zoo is not responsible.´ ´lion feeding time is. bla bla´ You are having serious doubts about if you still want to go into this zoo. Koohii #2 A very doubtful story: At the entrance to my local zoo they issue you with a special spoon (to feed the animals) and a dart gun (to defend yourself in case of animal attack). You must then hanko (seal) a document to say you’ve received both these items, only after which will they let you enter the zoo. (Oh, and if you forget your hanko, I doubt they’ll let you in). Primitives doubt, spoon, sitting on the ground, dart, drop, heavens, chop-seal, hanko, zoo, critters 疑惑(ぎわく): doubt, misgivings, distrust, suspicion 質疑(しつぎ): question 疑う(うたがう): doubt, distrust, be suspicious of, suspect 疑問(ぎもん): question, problem, doubt, guess Kunyomi: うたが.う Onyomi: ギ Lesson: 37 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 疑う (うたが.う)	doubt 疑 画数14 1513 Details Story Dictionary 疑 doubt Heisig's Spoon . . . dart . . . chop-seal . . . zoo. Koohii #2 A very doubtful story: At the entrance to my local zoo they issue you with a special spoon (to feed the animals) and a dart gun (to defend yourself in case of animal attack). You must then hanko (seal) a document to say you’ve received both these items, only after which will they let you enter the zoo. (Oh, and if you forget your hanko, I doubt they’ll let you in). congeal Details Story Dictionary 凝 congeal Heisig's Ice . . . doubt. Koohii #1 I doubt that the jello would congeal sitting on the counter, so I placed it in the icebox. address Details Story Dictionary 宛 address My Story Your address is *crow* *evening*, *9*, zipcode Koohii #1 Your address should be displayed on your house and mailbox. Koohii #2 For the primitive: This is a hi-tech Japanese mailbox, it automatically lights up in the evening, and has a biometric fingerprint scanner. --- Each house´s address, even if it´s hard to see in the evening, is like its own unique fingerprint. detain Details Story Dictionary 留 detain Heisig's Receipt . . . dagger . . . rice field. Koohii #1 The use of RANSOM NOTE (think of a receipt with a dagger through it on a door) works great with DETAIN. Here the RANSOM NOTE says that the girl has been DETAINED in an undisclosed location. To get her back take the RANSOM to a empty FIELD. Koohii #2 Got a receipt for that dagger, son? If not, we´re going to detain you and send you to work in the rice fields. trade Details Story Dictionary 貿 trade My Story [Top of 留, but the 田 becomes 貝] The bottom of 留, was traded to a 貝, giving the final kanji as 貿 Koohii #1 There´s a buyback program where you can trade in your dagger for money. But it´s quite ineffective, since only registered dagger-owners with the original receipts can participate, and not criminals with illegally-purchased daggers. Koohii #2 The new RANSOM note (a receipt stuck to a door with a dagger) from DETAIN (1423) appears again (probably after you went to the field as instructed) now gives instruction to TRADE the victim for CURRENCY you were told to bring. Primitives trade, receipt, sword, dagger, shellfish, clam, oyster, eye, animal legs, eight 貿易(ぼうえき): trade Kunyomi: Onyomi: ボウ Lesson: 37 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds:	trade 貿 画数12 1529 Details Story Dictionary 貿 trade My Story [Top of 留, but the 田 becomes 貝] The bottom of 留, was traded to a 貝, giving the final kanji as 貿 Koohii #1 There´s a buyback program where you can trade in your dagger for money. mortar Details Story Dictionary 臼 mortar Heisig's The image here is of back-to-back staples. The mortar referred to in this key word is a stone or wooden basin used for grinding with a pestle. Koohii #1 I removed all the back to back staples and grinded them in a mortar to create metal dust. Koohii #2 The mortar bomb exploded, ripping the sun in half. "break Details Story Dictionary 毀 break Heisig's Mortar . . . soil . . . missile. Koohii #1 To ""break the soil"" is to make a symbolic gesture that indicates the beginning of construction. Like when a politician in a hardhat gets a shovel and lifts a piece of dirt. This particular project is behind schedule, so to speed things up, they blow it up with mortar and an air-to-ground missile. Koohii #2 Place your mortar on solid ground before firing missiles from it, otherwise it will break. Primitives break, mortar, soil, dirt, ground, cruise missile, missile, wind, crotch Kunyomi: こぼ.つ、こわ.す、こぼ.れる、こわ.れる、そし.る、やぶ.る Onyomi: キ Lesson: 37 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: Compounds:"	"break 毀 画数13 1532 Details Story Dictionary 毀 break Heisig's Mortar . . . soil . . . missile. Koohii #1 To ""break the soil"" is to make a symbolic gesture that indicates the beginning of construction. Like when a politician in a hardhat gets a shovel and lifts a piece of dirt. This particular project is behind schedule, so to speed things up, they blow it up with mortar and an air-to-ground missile. Koohii #2 Place your mortar on solid ground before firing missiles from it, otherwise it will break. Primitives break, mortar, soil, dirt, ground, cruise missile, missile, wind, crotch Kunyomi: こぼ.つ、こわ.す、こぼ.れる、こわ.れる、そし.る、やぶ.る Onyomi: キ Lesson: 37 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: Compounds:"
entertain Details Story Dictionary 興 entertain My Story Long E sandwich: Same {同} / legs Koohii #1 To me, this looks like a pictograph of a road leading to the big city (see the buildings?) where there are plenty of places to be entertained. Unfortunately in this city, every store is the same: staples. What tools! [ayoung24]. Koohii #2 Photographically, this kanji simply looks like a set of two speakers (the staples primitives) between the sub-woofer (primitive for same) -- all this as a tool to entertain a group of drunks at a club. Primitives entertain, staples, same, monks, hood, one, mouth, tool, animal legs, eight 興じる(きょうじる): to amuse oneself, to make merry 興業(こうぎょう): industrial enterprise 興奮(こうふん): excitement, stimulation, agitation, arousal 新興(しんこう): rising, developing, emergent 振興(しんこう): promotion, encouragement 復興(ふっこう): revival, renaissance, reconstruction 余興(よきょう): side show, entertainment 興味(きょうみ): interest Kunyomi: おこ.る、おこ.す Onyomi: コウ、キョウ Lesson: 37 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 興行 (こうぎょう), 復興 (ふっこう), 振興 (しんこう), 興す (おこ.す), 興る (おこ.る)	entertain 興 画数16 1533 Details Story Dictionary 興 entertain My Story Long E sandwich: Same {同} / legs Koohii #1 To me, this looks like a pictograph of a road leading to the big city (see the buildings?) where there are plenty of places to be entertained. "sign of the bird Details Story Dictionary 酉 sign of the bird Heisig's Though we shall later encounter the kanji for bird, we introduce this one for the tenth sign of the zodiac mainly because of its use as a primitive, where it has a different meaning. * As a primitive, it means whiskey bottle. In its pictograph, you can see the loosely corked lid, the bottle and the contents (about one-third full). You might also think of the Spanish ""porrón,"" a decanter shaped like a long-necked bird. Koohii #1 The sign of the bird on this whiskey bottle is of course the Famous Grouse blended Scotch. Koohii #2 Normally birds fly south, but one bird flew west. People were worried about it and kept asking ""Is there any sign of the bird – you know, the one that flew west?"". Primitives sign of the bird, whiskey bottle, west, one Kunyomi: とり Onyomi: ユウ Lesson: 38 Jouyou: Names JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"	"sign of the bird 酉 画数7 1534 Details Story Dictionary 酉 sign of the bird Heisig's Though we shall later encounter the kanji for bird, we introduce this one for the tenth sign of the zodiac mainly because of its use as a primitive, where it has a different meaning. * As a primitive, it means whiskey bottle. And a very popular alcoholic drink in Japan is whiskey and water. "hooch Details Story Dictionary 酎 hooch Heisig's This kanji is used for thick, low-grade saké made from various kinds of grains. Its primitives are: whisky bottle . . . glue. Koohii #1 While the keyword is ""hooch"", this usually means 焼酎. It has similar effect as whiskey and sniffing glue has: you get intoxicated. Koohii #2 This thick, illicitly-made beverage is actually just whiskey mixed with glue! Primitives hooch, whiskey bottle, glue Kunyomi: かも.す Onyomi: チュウ、チュ Lesson: 38 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: Compounds:"	"hooch 酎 画数10 1537 Details Story Dictionary 酎 hooch Heisig's This kanji is used for thick, low-grade saké made from various kinds of grains. fermentation Details Story Dictionary 酵 fermentation Heisig's Whiskey bottle . . . filial piety. Koohii #1 The secrets of fermentation are passed to the son who displays the most filial piety. Koohii #2 Since filial piety is all about respecting ones elders, and the older a whiskey bottle is (i.e. the time it have spent undergoing fermentation) the more respect you should give it, the meaning of this kanji becomes clear. If it doesn´t, sink back some whiskey and it will. "revered / esteem Details Story Dictionary 尊 revered / esteem My Story [Horny Western Alcoholic (horns + west (with 2 lines)) + glue] The *Horny Western Alcoholic* was *glued* to マンコ, his self-#esteem# shot up after seeing porn Koohii #1 People don't know this, but (""revered"" patriot) Paul Revere had trouble staying awake during his midnight ride, so he drank Red Bull (horns) and whiskey (a drink invented by his friend Sam Adams) and glued himself DOWN to the saddle. [thanks to akahige]. Koohii #2 Red Bull, the chieftain (#2906) is so revered in his clan that everyone sticks to him like glue. short Details Story Dictionary 短 short My Story [Arrow + Bean] He is so short that his *arrow* shot Mr *bean* and not your mom Koohii #1 He is so short so he has to throw darts from the table. Koohii #2 Sort of like ping pong, this kanji represents a game where you throw darts over a table at your opponent. The serve is rarely returned, so the games tend to be short.------------ This character apparently refers to duration, not just to height. Primitives short, dart, drop, heavens, beans, table, one, mouth 短歌(たんか): tanka, 31-syllable Japanese poem 短気(たんき): quick temper 短縮(たんしゅく): shortening, abbreviation, reduction 短大(たんだい): junior college 短波(たんぱ): short wave 短期(たんき): short term 短所(たんしょ): defect, demerit, weak point, disadvantage 短編(たんぺん): short (e.g. story, film) 長短(ちょうたん): length, long and short, advantages and disadvantages, pluses and minuses, strong and weak points, merits and demerits 短い(みじかい): short Kunyomi: みじか.い Onyomi: タン Lesson: 38 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 短い (みじか.い)	short 短 画数12 1550 Details Story Dictionary 短 short My Story [Arrow + Bean] He is so short that his *arrow* shot Mr *bean* and not your mom Koohii #1 He is so short so he has to throw darts from the table. Koohii #2 Sort of like ping pong, this kanji represents a game where you throw darts over a table at your opponent. bountiful Details Story Dictionary 豊 bountiful Heisig's Bend . . . table. Think of a bountiful harvest, and you will not be far from the meaning of this character. Koohii #1 The bountiful feast was so bountiful that it bent the table below it under its weight! いただきま〜す！. Koohii #2 Her bust and bum was so bountiful I couldn´t resist the urge to bend her over a nearby table and... Primitives bountiful, bend, beans, table, one, mouth 豊作(ほうさく): abundant harvest, bumper crop 豊富(ほうふ): abundance, wealth, plenty, bounty 豊か(ゆたか): abundant, wealthy, plentiful, rich Kunyomi: ゆた.か、とよ Onyomi: ホウ、ブ Lesson: 38 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 豊 (ゆたか)	bountiful 豊 画数13 1551 Details Story Dictionary 豊 bountiful Heisig's Bend . . . table. "drum Details Story Dictionary 鼓 drum Heisig's The full kanji for the drum adds a branch, apparently to serve as a drumstick, to the primitive for drum. Koohii #1 Japanese festivals have drums so big, a samurai has to SIT (not stand) on a table to beat one with a tree branch! http://www.d2.dion.ne.jp/~hidafyh/furukawayh/gyouji/image/maturi03.jpg. Koohii #2 I really hate the primitive meaning of ""table"" for ""bean."" I just use ""bean."" Anyways, for the DRUM primitive, imagine a SAMURAI who beats on a DRUM with two chopsticks, and a BEAN skewered on each end of the chopstick to produce a better sound. And the obvious story is: ""DRUMing on a DRUM with a huge BRANCH"". Primitives drum, samurai, beans, table, one, mouth, branch, ten, needle, crotch 太鼓(たいこ): drum, tambourine Kunyomi: つづみ Onyomi: コ Lesson: 38 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 鼓 (つづみ)"	"drum 鼓 画数13 1552 Details Story Dictionary 鼓 drum Heisig's The full kanji for the drum adds a branch, apparently to serve as a drumstick, to the primitive for drum. Koohii #1 Japanese festivals have drums so big, a samurai has to SIT (not stand) on a table to beat one with a tree branch! http://www.d2.dion.ne.jp/~hidafyh/furukawayh/gyouji/image/maturi03.jpg. Koohii #2 I really hate the primitive meaning of ""table"" for ""bean."" I just use ""bean."" Anyways, for the DRUM primitive, imagine a SAMURAI who beats on a DRUM with two chopsticks, and a BEAN skewered on each end of the chopstick to produce a better sound. And the obvious story is: ""DRUMing on a DRUM with a huge BRANCH"". Primitives drum, samurai, beans, table, one, mouth, branch, ten, needle, crotch 太鼓(たいこ): drum, tambourine Kunyomi: つづみ Onyomi: コ Lesson: 38 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 鼓 (つづみ)"
rejoice Details Story Dictionary 喜 rejoice Heisig's Drum . . . mouth. Koohii #1 The samurai sitting on the drum is on a stage, and the people below him are rejoicing with their mouths in unison. It helps me to imagine the placement this way. Koohii #2 In the taiko (drum (#1444)) song of rejoicing, the drummers shout with open mouths. "timber-trees Details Story Dictionary 樹 timber-trees Heisig's Trees . . . drum . . . glue. Koohii #1 The hippies object to trees being cut down for timber. They have glued themselves to the timber-trees and are beating their drums. Koohii #2 Everyone likes to see big trees fall down. For this kanji imagine hundreds of spectators glued to their chairs, then a drum roll and then a cry of ""timber!!!"" as the huge tree crashes to the ground. Primitives timber-trees, tree, wood, drum, samurai, beans, table, one, mouth, glue 樹木(じゅもく): trees and shrubs, arbour 樹立(じゅりつ): establish, create Kunyomi: き Onyomi: ジュ Lesson: 38 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"	"timber-trees 樹 画数16 1554 Details Story Dictionary 樹 timber-trees Heisig's Trees . . . drum . . . glue. dish Details Story Dictionary 皿 dish Heisig's The kanji for a dish is, clearly, the pictograph of a painted or carved bowl, seen from the side. Koohii #1 Three dishes stacked side-by-side in a dishwasher. Koohii #2 Pictograph of a dish with a three-layer cake slice on it. Primitives dish 灰皿(はいさら): ashtray 皿(さら): plate, dish お皿(おさら): (polite) dish, plate 灰皿(はいざら): ashtray Kunyomi: さら Onyomi: ベイ Lesson: 38 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 皿 (さら)	dish 皿 画数5 1555 Details Story Dictionary 皿 dish Heisig's The kanji for a dish is, clearly, the pictograph of a painted or carved bowl, seen from the side. blood Details Story Dictionary 血 blood Heisig's The drop in the dish is blood. It is similar to the drop we saw earlier on the dagger in the character for blade (Frame 88). Koohii #1 Vampire orders blood in one of those posh restaurants. Imagine his shock when all he gets is a giant white bowl and just a single drop of blood in the centre and a drizzling of balsamic around the edge. Disgusted he calls the manager over tells him its overpriced tosh and bites into his neck with a huge gush of blood spraying everywhere. Koohii #2 Image: Holy Grail with a drop of Jesus blood on it. Primitives blood, drop, dish 血管(けっかん): blood vessel 混血(こんけつ): mixed race, mixed parentage 出血(しゅっけつ): bleeding, haemorrhage 血圧(けつあつ): blood pressure 血液(けつえき): blood 輸血(ゆけつ): blood transfusion 血(ち): blood Kunyomi: ち Onyomi: ケツ Lesson: 38 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 血 (ち)	blood 血 画数6 1556 Details Story Dictionary 血 blood Heisig's The drop in the dish is blood. basin Details Story Dictionary 盆 basin Heisig's Part . . . dish. Koohii #1 The part of the kitchen sink in which you wash dishes in is the basin. Koohii #2 I'm not an expert, but it seems that as a basin this refers more to an oceanic basin that a kitchen one, and in any case seems most common in reference to the famous O-Bon festival. So, a story: in the O-Bon festival, so many dishes are broken that all the parts have to be thrown into a deep oceanic basin. Primitives basin, part, eight, sword, dagger, dish 盆(ぼん): Lantern Festival, Festival of the Dead, tray 盆地(ぼんち): basin (e.g. between mountains) Kunyomi: Onyomi: ボン Lesson: 38 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	basin 盆 画数9 1557 Details Story Dictionary 盆 basin Heisig's Part . . . dish. "alliance Details Story Dictionary 盟 alliance Heisig's Bright . . . dish. Koohii #1 In order to form alliances, you should sit down for a meal and eat until your dish is bright or clear; in other words, get to know people first, before you talk business. Koohii #2 A new alliance is proclaimed at the end of a meal between officials. As a symbol of their alliance they clean up together one dish, and present it to the photographers. The clean dish under the flash lights appears very bright, and it´s pretty much all you can see on the photo that appears on the next morning´s newspapers, with the title ""New alliance, one bright dish!"". Primitives alliance, bright, sun, day, moon, month, flesh, part of the body, dish 同盟(どうめい): alliance, union, league 連盟(れんめい): league, union, alliance Kunyomi: Onyomi: メイ Lesson: 38 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"	"alliance 盟 画数13 1558 Details Story Dictionary 盟 alliance Heisig's Bright . . . dish. Koohii #2 A new alliance is proclaimed at the end of a meal between officials. As a symbol of their alliance they clean up together one dish, and present it to the photographers. The clean dish under the flash lights appears very bright, and it´s pretty much all you can see on the photo that appears on the next morning´s newspapers, with the title ""New alliance, one bright dish!"". warm Details Story Dictionary 温 warm My Story [Water + Sun/day + Dish/plate] To warm *water*, leave it in *a dish* in the afternoon *sun*. Koohii #1 If you leave water out in the sun in a dish, naturally it will get warm. Koohii #2 To distinguish from warmth (#1949), which refers to warm weather, remember that this means warm objects or feelings. Imagine a plastic kiddy pool in the backyard full of lukewarm water. The kiddy pool is shaped like a huge dish, and it's been under the sun all day - that's why the water is warm now. Primitives warm, water, water droplets, water pistol, sun, day, dish 温和(おんわ): gentle, mild, moderate 生温い(なまぬるい): lukewarm, halfhearted 保温(ほおん): retaining warmth, keeping heat in, heat insulation 温室(おんしつ): greenhouse 温泉(おんせん): spa, hot spring 温帯(おんたい): temperate zone 温暖(おんだん): warmth 温度(おんど): temperature 気温(きおん): temperature 体温(たいおん): temperature (body) 温い(ぬるい): lukewarm, tepid Kunyomi: あたた.か、あたた.かい、あたた.まる、あたた.める、ぬく Onyomi: オン Lesson: 38 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 温か (あたた.か), 温かい (あたた.かい), 温まる (あたた.まる), 温める (あたた.める)	warm 温 画数12 1560 Details Story Dictionary 温 warm My Story [Water + Sun/day + Dish/plate] To warm *water*, leave it in *a dish* in the afternoon *sun*.
