Koohii #2 To distinguish from warmth (#1949), which refers to warm weather, remember that this means warm objects or feelings. Imagine a plastic kiddy pool in the backyard full of lukewarm water. "oversee Details Story Dictionary 監 oversee Heisig's Slaves . . . reclining . . . floor/one . . . dish. Koohii #1 While the slave-buyer is perusing (perusal (#855)) the stack of slaves reclining on the floor, the slaves' overseer supplies them with dishes of gruel -- don't want the slaves starving to death before they can be sold! Koohii #2 The slaves are reclining on the floor when the overseer comes in. They tell him ""We´re not goofing off, a dish fell and broke and we´re cleaning it off the floor"". Koohii #2 (Thanks bodhisamaya) The authorities are suspicious about the athlete that won GOLD at the olympics. They are now OVERSEEING a thorough drug test, taking all sorts of SPECIMENS. "indigo Details Story Dictionary 藍 indigo Heisig's Flowers . . . oversee. Koohii #1 Indigo flowers have to be overseen because they are often picked for their beauty. Koohii #2 Traditionally, 青 blue (#1534) could be used to describe blue OR green. However, two kanji that describe the hues specifically are 藍 and 緑. This kanji is the ""blue"" counterpart of green (#1371). Story: The overseer, master of the slaves, wore a cloak dyed with indigo, and flowers in his hair. Primitives indigo, flowers, oversee, retainer, slave, reclining, lying down, one, floor, dish 藍褸(ぼろ): rag, scrap, tattered clothes, fault (esp. in a pretense), defect, run-down or junky Kunyomi: あい Onyomi: ラン Lesson: 38 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 藍 (あい)"	"indigo 藍 画数18 1565 Details Story Dictionary 藍 indigo Heisig's Flowers . . . oversee. Koohii #1 Indigo flowers have to be overseen because they are often picked for their beauty. Koohii #2 Traditionally, 青 blue (#1534) could be used to describe blue OR green. However, two kanji that describe the hues specifically are 藍 and 緑. This kanji is the ""blue"" counterpart of green (#1371). Story: The overseer, master of the slaves, wore a cloak dyed with indigo, and flowers in his hair. Primitives indigo, flowers, oversee, retainer, slave, reclining, lying down, one, floor, dish 藍褸(ぼろ): rag, scrap, tattered clothes, fault (esp. in a pretense), defect, run-down or junky Kunyomi: あい Onyomi: ラン Lesson: 38 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 藍 (あい)"
fierce Details Story Dictionary 猛 fierce Heisig's Wild dogs . . . child . . . dish. Koohii #1 The fierce WILD DOG attacked the CHILD who came near his feeding DISH. Koohii #2 If you want to make your wild dogs fierce, feed them a child. Children are the holy grail of dogfood you know... Koohii #1 Japan´s economic boom turned their empty plates into full ones. Koohii #2 The boom of satellite TV has made antennas turn into dishes. Koohii #2 The eccentric explorer lay down on the earth 土, opened his mouth 口, and licked it. ""As I suspected!"" he said, ""It's salt. Something to spice up our dishes 皿 with!"" silver Details Story Dictionary 銀 silver My Story Like *gold*, *silver* is a metal. Silver is almost as {良} as gold, but not quite (one stroke missing). Koohii #1 Like gold, silver is a metal. Koohii #2 Not sure why Heisig find the right side so troublesome. My grandma´s hairpin (just before long (#1920)) is made of silver, the metal that best reflects sun light. I´m sure you can see the flash from her hair as she walks by on a sunny day. Note that the two elements (sun and hairpin) share not only a horizontal stroke, but also the left vertical one. Therefore a bit odd stroke order. "eat Details Story Dictionary 食 eat Heisig's If halo and umbrella aren't enough, break the halo down into drop and silver - or ""silverware,"" an additional primitive. * As a primitive, this kanji can mean either eating or food. As with silver, on the left the final two strokes of this element are combined into one. Koohii #1 That umbrella looks good enough to eat! Koohii #2 Umbrella + Good: Let's go eat at that restaurant - the table with the umbrella looks good. "previously Details Story Dictionary 既 previously Heisig's Silver . . . waitress. Do not confuse this kanji's key word with before (Frame 263). Koohii #1 Distinguish from formerly (#501). Think of previously as ""the previous customer"" in a restaurant. At a cheap sleazy diner, the waitress gives you unwashed silverware that was previously used by the previous customer. Yuck. Koohii #2 For the waitress primitive, I don´t really see the receipt. So instead, I imagine a waitress holding a plate above her head, using those legs to weave through the tables. outline Details Story Dictionary 概 outline Heisig's Roots . . . waitress. Note that the kanji meaning of the two primitives to the right is not used here because we shall later meet a primitive meaning beforehand and want to preempt any confusion. The same holds true in the following frame. Koohii #1 The police tried to draw a chalk outline around the dead waitress, but it was kinda tough with all the tree roots underneath her. Koohii #2 If you attempted to outline the biography of most famous actresses, you´d find that they have roots working as waitresses before getting their big break. Primitives outline, roots, tree, wood, silver, waitress, previously 一概に(いちがいに): unconditionally, as a rule 概説(がいせつ): general statement, outline 概念(がいねん): general idea, concept, notion 概略(がいりゃく): outline, summary, gist, in brief 大概(たいがい): in general, mainly 概論(がいろん): introduction, outline, general remarks Kunyomi: おうむ.ね Onyomi: ガイ Lesson: 38 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	outline 概 画数14 1594 Details Story Dictionary 概 outline Heisig's Roots . . . waitress. even Details Story Dictionary 平 even Heisig's This character is easiest remembered as a pictograph of a water lily floating on the surface of the water, which gives it its meaning of even. The fourth stroke represents the calm, smooth surface of a pond, and the final stroke the long stem of the plant reaching underwater. * As a primitive, this kanji can keep its pictographic meaning of a water lily. Koohii #1 There´s an even covering of water lilies on the pond at 金閣寺（きんかくじ） the Golden Pavilion in Kyoto. Koohii #2 Frogs stay dry (#1648) 干 even as rain drops on their lily pads... RTK2:　ヘイ　　平均　へいきん(an average)　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　ビョウ　平等　びょうどう(equality). Primitives even, water-lily, lily pad 平均(ならし): equilibrium, balance, average, mean 平たい(ひらたい): flat, even, level, simple, plain 平行(へいこう): (going) side by side, concurrent, abreast, at the same time, occurring together, parallel, parallelism 平常(へいじょう): normal, usual 平方(へいほう): square (e.g. metre), square 公平(こうへい): fairness, impartial, justice 水平(すいへい): water level, horizon 水平線(すいへいせん): horizon 平ら(たいら): flatness, level, smooth, calm, plain 地平線(ちへいせん): horizon 平等(びょうどう): equality, impartiality, evenness 不平(ふへい): complaint, discontent, dissatisfaction 平気(へいき): coolness, calmness, composure, unconcern 平均(へいきん): equilibrium, balance, average, mean 平日(へいじつ): weekday, ordinary days 平凡(へいぼん): common, commonplace, ordinary, mediocre 平野(へいや): plain, open field 平和(へいわ): peace, harmony 平仮名(ひらがな): hiragana, 47 syllables, the cursive syllabary Kunyomi: たい.ら、-だいら、ひら、ひら- Onyomi: ヘイ、ビョウ、ヒョウ Lesson: 39 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 平面 (へいめん), 平和 (へいわ), 公平 (こうへい), 平ら (たい.ら), 平 (ひら)	even 平 画数5 1596 Details Story Dictionary 平 even Heisig's This character is easiest remembered as a pictograph of a water lily floating on the surface of the water, which gives it its meaning of even. The fourth stroke represents the calm, smooth surface of a pond, and the final stroke the long stem of the plant reaching underwater. * As a primitive, this kanji can keep its pictographic meaning of a water lily. Koohii #1 There´s an even covering of water lilies on the pond at 金閣寺（きんかくじ） the Golden Pavilion in Kyoto. Koohii #2 Frogs stay dry (#1648) 干 even as rain drops on their lily pads... RTK2:　ヘイ　　平均　へいきん(an average)　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　ビョウ　平等　びょうどう(equality). "call Details Story Dictionary 呼 call Heisig's Mouth . . . water lily. Note: this is the one time that the ""stem"" has a barb at the end. Work this fact into your story. Koohii #1 'Budd' - 'weis' - 'er' call the frogs mouths from the liliy pads, working to get you hooked on beer. Koohii #2 I´m a lazy fisher, so I genetically engineered a lily pad with a fishing hook at the stem and a mouth to call me whenever it catches something. two-mat area Details Story Dictionary 坪 two-mat area Heisig's This kanji belongs to an old Japanese system of measurement and indicates an area of about 36 square feet, or the area taken up by two tatami mats. Its elements: ground . . . water lily. Koohii #1 A two-mat area is just about as much ground as you will need for a lily pond. Koohii #2 A two-mat area is plenty of space for sleeping in a tent but you won´t be comfortable unless the ground is even. Primitives two-mat area, soil, dirt, ground, even, water-lily, lily pad Kunyomi: つぼ Onyomi: ヘイ Lesson: 39 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 坪 (つぼ)	two-mat area 坪 画数8 1598 Details Story Dictionary 坪 two-mat area Heisig's This kanji belongs to an old Japanese system of measurement and indicates an area of about 36 square feet, or the area taken up by two tatami mats. "moment Details Story Dictionary 刹 moment Heisig's The key word here is the noun meaning ""a breif moment."" Its elements: sheaf . . . tree . . . saber. Koohii #1 The kendo artist takes a brief moment to practice his skills: he throws sheafs over the tree and tries to cut them with his saber when they come down again. Koohii #2 Wtf moment? bosom Details Story Dictionary 胸 bosom Heisig's Part of the body . . . bound up . . . villain. Koohii #1 Just think of the heroine's bosom in a movie. The villain ties up the heroine (to the traintracks or the conveyor belt etc) but her bosom is the body part that is always left sticking out. Koohii #2 As you know, female comics villains are always binding the flesh of their bosom up in interesting ways. One has to wonder how these clothes stay on their body at all... "detach Details Story Dictionary 離 detach Heisig's Top hat . . . villain . . . belt . . . elbow . . . turkey. This is potentially one of the most difficult characters to remember. Tackle it positively and let the image ""sink in"" by carrying it around with you today and calling it up in your spare moments. Koohii #1 I´ve finally met my arch-rival, the evilest of all villains. Finally, I´m about to fight him. But what´s this? He´s suspiciously quiet. I move to attack him, and his right arm falls off at the elbow. Strange. I walk up to him and detach his left arm. Very strange. I undo his belt, and take off his top hat... BLAST! It was just a decoy turkey! Koohii #2 The left side isn't too hard---a top-hatted villain whose villainy involves belts around elbows? Clearly he's a drug dealer. And the best way to detach yourself from the drug dealer's influence is to go cold turkey. Primitives detach, sheik, top hat, villain, sheaf, shovel, belt, elbow, turkey 距離(きょり): distance, range 分離(ぶんり): separation, detachment, segregation, isolation 離す(はなす): part, divide, separate 離れる(はなれる): be separated from, leave, go away, be a long way off 離婚(りこん): divorce Kunyomi: はな.れる、はな.す Onyomi: リ Lesson: 39 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 離す (はな.す), 離れる (はな.れる)"	"detach 離 画数18 1605 Details Story Dictionary 離 detach Heisig's Top hat . . . villain . . . belt . . . elbow . . . turkey. bracing Details Story Dictionary 爽 bracing Heisig's The sense of the key word is of something refreshing and invigorating. It is made up of the St. Bernard and a pair of sheaves on each side. Koohii #1 The St Bernard is bracing itself for an operation requiring four stitches. Koohii #2 St. Bernard dog had a refreshing bracing bath and now is shaking all the water out of his fur. The drops are thrown in all direction and that's why the have an x shape in the pictogram. Primitives bracing, large, St. Bernard, sheaf, sheaf4 爽やか(さわやか): fresh, refreshing, invigorating, clear, fluent, eloquent Kunyomi: あき.らか、さわ.やか、たがう Onyomi: ソウ Lesson: 39 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 爽やか (さわ.やか)	bracing 爽 画数11 1608 Details Story Dictionary 爽 bracing Heisig's The sense of the key word is of something refreshing and invigorating. genuine Details Story Dictionary 純 genuine Heisig's Thread . . . earthworm. Koohii #1 For remembering the primitive earthworm: Drops of rain were falling so I took my shovel to dig up some earthworms to put them on my fishook..... My story: To have a genuine fishing line you don't just pick up a stick but you also attach some thread onto it and at the end an earthworm must be hung. Koohii #2 You need to attach a genuine earthworm to the thread. With plastic bait you won´t catch anything. dull Details Story Dictionary 鈍 dull Heisig's Metal . . . earthworm. Koohii #1 The metal hook is too dull to even pierce an earthworm.... Koohii #2 From the earthworm´s perspective, it most be pretty dull when you are put in a metal bowl, just waiting for being put on the hook on the fishing trip the next day. Primitives dull, metal, gold, earthworm, drop, shovel, fishhook 鈍感(どんかん): thickheadedness, stolidity 鈍る(なまる): to become less capable, to grow dull, to become blunt, to weaken 鈍い(にぶい): dull (e.g. a knife), thickheaded, slow, stupid 鈍い(のろい): dull (e.g. a knife), thickheaded, slow, stupid Kunyomi: にぶ.い、にぶ.る、にぶ-、なま.る、なまく.ら Onyomi: ドン Lesson: 39 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 鈍い (にぶ.い), 鈍る (にぶ.る)	dull 鈍 画数12 1611 Details Story Dictionary 鈍 dull Heisig's Metal . . . earthworm. Koohii #1 The metal hook is too dull to even pierce an earthworm.... Koohii #2 From the earthworm´s perspective, it most be pretty dull when you are put in a metal bowl, just waiting for being put on the hook on the fishing trip the next day. spicy Details Story Dictionary 辛 spicy My Story This spicy sauce is hotter than *ten* peppers *standing* end to end. * As a primitive, we shall use this meaning of spicy, except when the two extra strokes are added to the bottom, giving it the form of a tree. Then we take its alternate meaning of a red pepper plant. The connection is obvious. Koohii #1 Eating spicy food makes you stand up ten times faster than usual, ´cause you just need to get something to drink! Koohii #2 Eating spicy food makes you stand up as if you had sat on a needle. Primitives spicy, stand up, vase, ten, needle 辛うじて(かろうじて): barely, narrowly, just manage to do st 香辛料(こうしんりょう): spices 辛抱(しんぼう): patience, endurance 塩辛い(しおからい): salty (flavor) 辛い(つらい): painful, heart-breaking 辛い(からい): painful, heart-breaking Kunyomi: から.い、つら.い、-づら.い、かのと Onyomi: シン Lesson: 39 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 辛い (から.い)	spicy 辛 画数7 1612 Details Story Dictionary 辛 spicy My Story This spicy sauce is hotter than *ten* peppers *standing* end to end. * As a primitive, we shall use this meaning of spicy, except when the two extra strokes are added to the bottom, giving it the form of a tree. Then we take its alternate meaning of a red pepper plant. The connection is obvious. Koohii #1 Eating spicy food makes you stand up ten times faster than usual, ´cause you just need to get something to drink! resign / quit Details Story Dictionary 辞 resign / quit My Story [Tongue {舌} + Spicy {辛}] A CEO lashed out his spicy tongue (ie. made an inappropriate comment) and is being made to resign for it. Koohii #1 This guy´s job is tasting the spicy curry at the local Indian Food Factory. He has to resign from his job before his tongue is rendered completely useless after all the spicy food that he has to try all day long... Koohii #2 After my tongue touched the most spicy pepper of all, I had to resign from the contest...too hot for me! Primitives resign, tongue, thousand, mouth, spicy, stand up, vase, ten, needle お世辞(おせじ): flattery, compliment 辞職(じしょく): resignation 辞退(じたい): refusal 世辞(せじ): flattery, compliment 百科辞典(ひゃっかじてん): encyclopedia 御辞儀(おじぎ): bow 辞める(やめる): retire 辞典(じてん): dictionary 辞書(じしょ): dictionary, lexicon Kunyomi: や.める、いな.む Onyomi: ジ Lesson: 39 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 辞める (や.める)	resign / quit 辞 画数13 1613 Details Story Dictionary 辞 resign / quit My Story [Tongue {舌} + Spicy {辛}] A CEO lashed out his spicy tongue (ie. made an inappropriate comment) and is being made to resign for it. Koohii #1 This guy´s job is tasting the spicy curry at the local Indian Food Factory. He has to resign from his job before his tongue is rendered completely useless after all the spicy food that he has to try all day long... "catalpa Details Story Dictionary 梓 catalpa Heisig's Tree . . . spicy. Koohii #1 The CATALPA is the tree that bears the SPICY Indian bean (NOTE - The Catalpa is also known as the ""Indian Bean"" due to the bean pods that grow from it). Koohii #2 The caterpillar´s favorite tree is the catalpa because it tastes spicy. Primitives catalpa, tree, wood, spicy, stand up, vase, ten, needle Kunyomi: あずさ Onyomi: シ Lesson: 39 Jouyou: Names JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"	"catalpa 梓 画数11 1614 Details Story Dictionary 梓 catalpa Heisig's Tree . . . spicy. superintend Details Story Dictionary 宰 superintend Heisig's House . . . spicy. Koohii #1 The superintendent of a Japanese school district needs a spicy relationship at home after watching girls in miniskirts all day. Koohii #2 The superintendent of an old-age house has to make sure the food is never too spicy. wall Details Story Dictionary 壁 wall Heisig's Ketchup . . . ground. Koohii #1 Did anyone else used to put ketchup packets on the ground and jump on them so they spattered on the wall? Koohii #2 Primitive for Ketchup: When the taste is too spicy your mouth has basically given up trying to handle it ..or in other words raised the white flag of surrender. But unlike war , putting Ketchup on it will usually solve the problem. Wall(dingomick); Did anyone else used to put ketchup packets on the ground and jump on them so they spattered on the wall? Primitives wall, ketchup, flag, mouth, spicy, stand up, vase, ten, needle, soil, dirt, ground 壁(かべ): wall Kunyomi: かべ Onyomi: ヘキ Lesson: 39 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 壁 (かべ)	wall 壁 画数16 1616 Details Story Dictionary 壁 wall Heisig's Ketchup . . . ground. holed gem Details Story Dictionary 璧 holed gem Heisig's The holed gem to which this kanji refers is a flat, circular object of about a foot in length, made of stone or glass and having a large hole in the middle. It's elements: ketchup . . . ball. Koohii #1 Even more valuable and perfect (完璧) than a holed gem is a delicious meatball (ball = たま = 玉) with ketchup. Yum! Koohii #2 It's a little known fact that ketchup is highly corrosive and is used to cut holes into gemstones so they can be put onto chains. This kanji shows a piece of Jade with a blob of ketchup on the top eating a hole through it. Kunyomi: たま Onyomi: ヘキ Lesson: 39 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: Compounds:	holed gem 璧 画数18 1617 Details Story Dictionary 璧 holed gem Heisig's The holed gem to which this kanji refers is a flat, circular object of about a foot in length, made of stone or glass and having a large hole in the middle. It's elements: ketchup . . . ball. Koohii #1 Even more valuable and perfect (完璧) than a holed gem is a delicious meatball (ball = たま = 玉) with ketchup. Yum! Koohii #2 It's a little known fact that ketchup is highly corrosive and is used to cut holes into gemstones so they can be put onto chains. This kanji shows a piece of Jade with a blob of ketchup on the top eating a hole through it. Kunyomi: たま Onyomi: ヘキ Lesson: 39 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: Compounds:
evade Details Story Dictionary 避 evade Heisig's Ketchup . . . road. Koohii #1 You can try and evade them, but they´ll ketchup with you on the road... Sorry, couldn´t resist it. Koohii #2 In order to evade the bear, you lie down on the road, put ketchup on yourself, and play dead. Primitives evade, ketchup, flag, mouth, spicy, stand up, vase, ten, needle, road 避難(ひなん): taking refuge, finding shelter 避ける(さける): avoid (situation), ward off, to avert Kunyomi: さ.ける、よ.ける Onyomi: ヒ Lesson: 39 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 避ける (さ.ける)	evade 避 画数16 1618 Details Story Dictionary 避 evade Heisig's Ketchup . . . road. new Details Story Dictionary 新 new Heisig's Red pepper . . . ax. Koohii #1 Don't confuse left primitive with catalpa (#1498). Every time the farmer cuts down the peppers from the red pepper plant, he has to use a brand new axe. This is because the spicy peppers cause the metal to erode very quickly, thereby rendering the axe completely useless. Koohii #2 Axe-man grows a patch of red pepper plants in his back garden. He rubs red peppers on the edge of his axes, and this seems to keep them sharp like brand new. Primitives new, red pepper, stand up, vase, tree, wood, axe 革新(かくしん): reform, innovation 新(しん): new 新興(しんこう): rising, developing, emergent 新婚(しんこん): newly-wed 新人(しんじん): new face, newcomer 新築(しんちく): new building, new construction 新入生(しんにゅうせい): freshman, first-year student 新た(あらた): new, fresh 新幹線(しんかんせん): bullet train 新鮮(しんせん): fresh 新聞社(しんぶんしゃ): newspaper office 新しい(あたらしい): new 新聞(しんぶん): newspaper Kunyomi: あたら.しい、あら.た、あら-、にい- Onyomi: シン Lesson: 39 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds: 新しい (あたら.しい), 新た (あら.た), 新 (にい)	new 新 画数13 1619 Details Story Dictionary 新 new Heisig's Red pepper . . . ax. firewood Details Story Dictionary 薪 firewood Heisig's Flowers . . . new. Koohii #1 New flowers grow in areas of forests which have been chopped down for firewood. Koohii #2 If your firewood is too new and still has flowers on it, it´s unsuitable for burning. You need drier wood. Primitives fuel, firewood, flowers, new, red pepper, stand up, vase, tree, wood, axe Kunyomi: たきぎ、まき Onyomi: シン Lesson: 39 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 薪 (たきぎ)	firewood 薪 画数16 1620 Details Story Dictionary 薪 firewood Heisig's Flowers . . . new. You need drier wood. Primitives fuel, firewood, flowers, new, red pepper, stand up, vase, tree, wood, axe Kunyomi: たきぎ、まき Onyomi: シン Lesson: 39 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 薪 (たきぎ)
"parent Details Story Dictionary 親 parent My Story [Stand/rise {立} + Tree + see {見}] *Standing* on top of this *tree*, I can *see* my parents' house! Hi, Mom! Hi, Dad! Koohii #1 A wise parent lets their kids learn. A kid wants to try to eat the red pepper plant, the wise parent says ""Try it and see for yourself"". Koohii #2 I remember this one the way the Japanese do: a parent standing on top of a tree watching what his or her kid is doing. Primitives parent, red pepper, stand up, vase, tree, wood, see, telescope, eye, human legs 親しむ(したしむ): to be intimate with, to befriend 親善(しんぜん): friendship 肉親(にくしん): blood relationship, blood relative 親(おや): parents 親指(おやゆび): thumb 親しい(したしい): intimate, close 親友(しんゆう): close friend 親戚(しんせき): relative 親類(しんるい): relation, kin 父親(ちちおや): father 母親(ははおや): mother 親切(しんせつ): kind 両親(りょうしん): parents, both parents Kunyomi: おや、おや-、した.しい、した.しむ Onyomi: シン Lesson: 39 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds: 親 (おや), 親しい (した.しい), 親しむ (した.しむ)"	"parent 親 画数16 1621 Details Story Dictionary 親 parent My Story [Stand/rise {立} + Tree + see {見}] *Standing* on top of this *tree*, I can *see* my parents' house! happiness Details Story Dictionary 幸 happiness Heisig's Simply by turning the dot at the top of the primitive for spicy into a cross shape, we move from things bitter and spicy to things happy. Koohii #1 Happiness adds a bit (or ten) of spice to your life. Koohii #2 This is one of those rare occasions when I forgo Heisig for other methods. 「幸せから一本取ると辛い」 -- if you take but one stroke away from happiness, you get painfulness. (oh well, Heisig used similar one for 百). Primitives happiness, ten, needle, stand up, vase, ten, needle, ten2, needle2 幸運(こううん): good luck, fortune 幸福(こうふく): happiness, blessedness 幸い(さいわい): happiness, blessedness 幸せ(しあわせ): happiness, good fortune, luck, blessing 不幸(ふこう): unhappiness, sorrow, misfortune, disaster, accident, death Kunyomi: さいわ.い、さち、しあわ.せ Onyomi: コウ Lesson: 39 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 幸い (さいわ.い), 幸 (さち), 幸せ (しあわ.せ)	happiness 幸 画数8 1622 Details Story Dictionary 幸 happiness Heisig's Simply by turning the dot at the top of the primitive for spicy into a cross shape, we move from things bitter and spicy to things happy. tenacious Details Story Dictionary 執 tenacious Heisig's Happiness . . . fat man. Koohii #1 Tenacious-D is happy band led by a fat man. (It´s Tenacious-D time, ya muthafucka´, gwaoh!). Koohii #2 To be tenacious, you need to have deep stores of happiness (so troubles don´t discourage you) and you need to be big and round (so hunger doesn´t drive you to give up). The most tenacious person of all time was happy round Buddha! Primitives tenacious, happiness, ten, needle, stand up, vase, fat man, musashimaru, nine, baseball, drop, ten2, needle2 執着(しゅうじゃく): attachment, adhesion, tenacity 執筆(しっぴつ): writing Kunyomi: と.る Onyomi: シツ、シュウ Lesson: 39 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 執務 (しつむ), 執筆 (しっぴつ), 確執 (かくしつ), 執る (と.る)	tenacious 執 画数11 1623 Details Story Dictionary 執 tenacious Heisig's Happiness . . . fat man. Koohii #2 To be tenacious, you need to have deep stores of happiness (so troubles don´t discourage you) and you need to be big and round (so hunger doesn´t drive you to give up). clasp Details Story Dictionary 摯 clasp Heisig's Of the many and widely different meanings of this kanji, we select the verbal meaning of clasp, which fits in well with its primitive elements: tenacious . . . hand. Koohii #1 When you clasp something you tenaciously 執 hold on to it with your hand 手, te. 真摯、しんし, sincerity, earnestness. Koohii #2 This kanji shows Santa Claus (refer to frame tenacious (#1506)) clasping the reins of his deers with his hands, holding onto dear life as he almost falls off his carriage. Kunyomi: いた.る Onyomi: シ Lesson: 39 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: Compounds:	clasp 摯 画数15 1624 Details Story Dictionary 摯 clasp Heisig's Of the many and widely different meanings of this kanji, we select the verbal meaning of clasp, which fits in well with its primitive elements: tenacious . . . hand. Koohii #1 When you clasp something you tenaciously 執 hold on to it with your hand 手, te. 真摯、しんし, sincerity, earnestness. Koohii #2 This kanji shows Santa Claus (refer to frame tenacious (#1506)) clasping the reins of his deers with his hands, holding onto dear life as he almost falls off his carriage. report Details Story Dictionary 報 report My Story There was a report saying that un*happy* people were found in their *closest* (wardrobe) Koohii #1 Recall the fashion model wearing just a stamp over his crotch (clothing (#1399)). When he got happy, of course, it ended up in the news report. Koohii #2 The long awaited report, 'Maximising Male Happiness In The Workplace' concluded that making bikinis, with only a stamp sized piece of cloth covering the crotch, compulsory for attractive female staff, was the most cost-effective means of achieving this aim. Primitives report, happiness, ten, needle, stand up, vase, underpants, stamp, crotch, ten2, needle2 報酬(ほうしゅう): remuneration, recompense, reward, toll 報じる(ほうじる): to inform, to report 報ずる(ほうずる): to inform, to report 報道(ほうどう): information, report 情報(じょうほう): information, news, (military) intelligence, gossip 報告(ほうこく): report, information 予報(よほう): forecast, prediction 天気予報(てんきよほう): weather forecast 電報(でんぽう): telegram Kunyomi: むく.いる Onyomi: ホウ Lesson: 39 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 報いる (むく.いる)	report 報 画数12 1625 Details Story Dictionary 報 report My Story There was a report saying that un*happy* people were found in their *closest* (wardrobe) Koohii #1 Recall the fashion model wearing just a stamp over his crotch (clothing (#1399)). When he got happy, of course, it ended up in the news report. Koohii #2 The long awaited report, 'Maximising Male Happiness In The Workplace' concluded that making bikinis, with only a stamp sized piece of cloth covering the crotch, compulsory for attractive female staff, was the most cost-effective means of achieving this aim. Primitives report, happiness, ten, needle, stand up, vase, underpants, stamp, crotch, ten2, needle2 報酬(ほうしゅう): remuneration, recompense, reward, toll 報じる(ほうじる): to inform, to report 報ずる(ほうずる): to inform, to report 報道(ほうどう): information, report 情報(じょうほう): information, news, (military) intelligence, gossip 報告(ほうこく): report, information 予報(よほう): forecast, prediction 天気予報(てんきよほう): weather forecast 電報(でんぽう): telegram Kunyomi: むく.いる Onyomi: ホウ Lesson: 39 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 報いる (むく.いる)
shout Details Story Dictionary 叫 shout Heisig's Mouth . . . cornucopia. Koohii #1 There was a man in a village who had a special gift : whenever he shouted and screamed, his mouth became a cornucopia, overflowing with fruits and food of all sorts. Many of the locals thought he was a cruel man, always screaming at his wife, until they realised he was in fact very kind, and his gift brought prosperity to his family. Koohii #2 You can hold a CORNUCOPIA up to your MOUTH (like a megaphone) to SHOUT lounder. Also notice that the shape of CORNUCOPIA implies the shouts are 4 letter words. Primitives shout, mouth, cornucopia 叫び(さけび): shout, scream, outcry 叫ぶ(さけぶ): shout, cry out Kunyomi: さけ.ぶ Onyomi: キョウ Lesson: 39 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 叫ぶ (さけ.ぶ)	shout 叫 画数6 1626 Details Story Dictionary 叫 shout Heisig's Mouth . . . cornucopia. Koohii #1 There was a man in a village who had a special gift : whenever he shouted and screamed, his mouth became a cornucopia, overflowing with fruits and food of all sorts. Many of the locals thought he was a cruel man, always screaming at his wife, until they realised he was in fact very kind, and his gift brought prosperity to his family. twist Details Story Dictionary 糾 twist Heisig's Thread . . . cornucopia. Koohii #1 A cornucopia is a twisted goat's horn decorated with coloured threads. Koohii #2 [twist; ask; investigate; verify] Stories full of twists are difficult to write, because of the cornucopia of threads the author has to manage. Primitives twist, thread, spiderman, cornucopia Kunyomi: ただ.す Onyomi: キュウ Lesson: 39 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	twist 糾 画数9 1627 Details Story Dictionary 糾 twist Heisig's Thread . . . cornucopia. "income Details Story Dictionary 収 income Heisig's Cornucopia . . . crotch. Keep distinct from both fare (Frame 1079) and salary (Frame 1449). Koohii #1 Prostitutes can make a veritable cornucopia of income by using their crotches -- they put the ""come"" in ""income."" (A bit lewd perhaps, but effective in keeping this character distinct from similar keywords like profit (#906) or earnings (#893)). Koohii #2 Women love men with money. If you have a high income you can get a cornicopia of crotches. Primitives income, cornucopia, crotch 収まる(おさまる): to be obtained, to end, to settle into, to fit into, to be settled, to be paid, to be delivered 収める(おさめる): to obtain, to reap, to pay, to supply, to accept 回収(かいしゅう): collection, recovery 収益(しゅうえき): earnings, proceeds, returns 収支(しゅうし): income and expenditure 収集(しゅうしゅう): gathering up, collection, accumulation 収容(しゅうよう): accommodation, reception, seating, housing, custody, admission, entering (in a dictionary) 徴収(ちょうしゅう): collection, levy 没収(ぼっしゅう): forfeited 吸収(きゅうしゅう): absorption, suction, attraction 収穫(しゅうかく): harvest, crop, ingathering 収入(しゅうにゅう): income, receipts, revenue 領収(りょうしゅう): receipt, voucher Kunyomi: おさ.める、おさ.まる Onyomi: シュウ Lesson: 39 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 収まる (おさ.まる), 収める (おさ.める)"	"income 収 画数4 1628 Details Story Dictionary 収 income Heisig's Cornucopia . . . crotch. lowly Details Story Dictionary 卑 lowly My Story A lowly *grain of rice* is *glued* to the bottom of a lowly field with a single grain of rice Koohii #1 Lowly people only have a drop of brains and use nothing but 4-letter words. Koohii #2 A LOWLY single rice grain, DROPPED in an empty FIELD, can produce a CORNUCOPIA of food. Primitives lowly, Wayne Slob, drop, rice field, brains, cornucopia, ten, needle 卑しい(いやしい): greedy, vulgar, shabby, humble, base, mean, vile 卑怯(ひきょう): cowardice, meanness, unfairness Kunyomi: いや.しい、いや.しむ、いや.しめる Onyomi: ヒ Lesson: 39 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 卑しい (いや.しい), 卑しむ (いや.しむ), 卑しめる (いや.しめる)	lowly 卑 画数9 1629 Details Story Dictionary 卑 lowly My Story A lowly *grain of rice* is *glued* to the bottom of a lowly field with a single grain of rice Koohii #1 Lowly people only have a drop of brains and use nothing but 4-letter words. tombstone Details Story Dictionary 碑 tombstone Heisig's Rock . . . lowly. Koohii #1 There is a grave of a lowly man with a tombstone made of a simple, small stone. If you bow really low you can read the very small inscription engraved on the stone, it says - “Now that you bowed so low to read this, you are as lowly as I once was”. Koohii #2 A STONE makes a LOWLY TOMBSTONE. Primitives tombstone, stone, rock, lowly, Wayne Slob, drop, rice field, brains, cornucopia, ten, needle 碑(いしぶみ): stone monument bearing an inscription Kunyomi: いしぶみ Onyomi: ヒ Lesson: 39 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	tombstone 碑 画数14 1630 Details Story Dictionary 碑 tombstone Heisig's Rock . . . lowly. "land Details Story Dictionary 陸 land Heisig's The sense of land carried by this kanji is distinct from soil (Frame 161) and ground (Frame 554) in that it is meant to represent land seen from a distance, that is, land as opposed to ""water."" Its elements: pinnacle . . . rice seedlings . . . ground. Koohii #1 My rice-seedlings have become sentient and will go on a mission. I can only apologise for the next 6 frames. In the distance, there is a pinnacle, which the newly-awakened rice-seedlings who are still stuck in the ground can see. Could it be the Promised Land? Koohii #2 When sailors see land in the distance, they first see the pinnacles of the new land, but when they come close enough they´ll be able to make out the rice seedlings, and finally the ground! Primitives land, pinnacle, parthenon, acropolis, mini-tractor, rice seedlings, soil, dirt, ground, human legs, soil2, dirt2, ground2 上陸(じょうりく): landing, disembarkation 着陸(ちゃくりく): landing, alighting, touch down 内陸(ないりく): inland 大陸(たいりく): continent 陸(りく): land, shore Kunyomi: おか Onyomi: リク、ロク Lesson: 39 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds:"	"land 陸 画数11 1631 Details Story Dictionary 陸 land Heisig's The sense of land carried by this kanji is distinct from soil (Frame 161) and ground (Frame 554) in that it is meant to represent land seen from a distance, that is, land as opposed to ""water."" intimate Details Story Dictionary 睦 intimate Heisig's Eye . . . rice seedlings . . . ground. Koohii #1 The farmer was never very intimate with his wife. He always kept his eye on his precious rice seedlings in the soil. Koohii #2 I keep an intimate relationship with my rice seedlings -- I never take my eye from the soil. forces Details Story Dictionary 勢 forces Heisig's Rice seedlings . . ground . . . fat man . . . muscle. Koohii #1 What power makes rice seedlings in the ground grow into well rounded plants? The forces of nature. Koohii #2 The forces of nature need to be just right for the rice seedlings in the ground to become fat and strong. Primitives forces, mini-tractor, rice seedlings, soil, dirt, ground, human legs, fat man, musashimaru, round, nine, baseball, drop, power, muscle, arnold, soil2, dirt2, ground2 形勢(けいせい): condition, situation, prospects 情勢(じょうせい): state of things, condition, situation 勢力(せいりょく): influence, power, might, strength, potency, force, energy 態勢(たいせい): attitude, conditions, preparations 優勢(ゆうせい): superiority, superior power, predominance, preponderance 勢い(いきおい): force, vigor, energy, spirit, life, authority, influence, power, might, tendency, necessarily 姿勢(しせい): attitude, posture 大勢(おおぜい): many, a great number (of people) Kunyomi: いきお.い、はずみ Onyomi: セイ、ゼイ Lesson: 39 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 勢い (いきお.い)	forces 勢 画数13 1633 Details Story Dictionary 勢 forces Heisig's Rice seedlings . . ground . . . fat man . . . muscle. "heat / fever Details Story Dictionary 熱 heat / fever My Story [termite pie + round {丸} + fire] Koohii #1 Heat up those RICE SEEDLINGS you pulled from the SOIL in a ROUND pan over a low FLAME. (Note: the hot pan image helps reinforce the idea that this kanji for ""atsui"" refers to something hot to the touch, as opposed to hot weather). Koohii #2 Just a comment on Erikkusan's story: Although one of the pronunciations of this kanji is ""atsui"" this isn't the atsui that you feel in Tokyo in August, (which is Frame 1260's ""sultry' 暑). This atsui is the one when you touch something hot, like a fry pan. Another reading of this is ""netsu,"" which is the ""fever"" this fat man may feel after planting the rice seedlings. Primitives heat, mini-tractor, rice seedlings, soil, dirt, ground, human legs, fat man, musashimaru, round, nine, baseball, drop, oven-fire, barbecue, soil2, dirt2, ground2 光熱費(こうねつひ): cost of fuel and light 情熱(じょうねつ): passion, enthusiasm, zeal 熱意(ねつい): zeal, enthusiasm 熱湯(ねっとう): boiling water 熱量(ねつりょう): temperature 加熱(かねつ): heating 熱する(ねっする): to heat 熱帯(ねったい): tropics 熱中(ねっちゅう): enthusiasm, zeal, mania 熱(ねつ): heat, fever 熱心(ねっしん): eagerness 熱い(あつい): hot (thing) Kunyomi: あつ.い Onyomi: ネツ Lesson: 39 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 熱い (あつ.い)"	"heat / fever 熱 画数15 1634 Details Story Dictionary 熱 heat / fever My Story [termite pie + round {丸} + fire] Koohii #1 Heat up those RICE SEEDLINGS you pulled from the SOIL in a ROUND pan over a low FLAME. diamond Details Story Dictionary 菱 diamond Heisig's Named after a diamond-shaped flower (the water caltrop), this key word refers to things shaped like a diamond. Its elements: flower . . . rice seedlings . . . walking legs. Koohii #1 Some girls want diamonds, but others will be satisfied with just flowers. However if you think you can win her over with rice seedlings, expect her to get up on her walking legs and walk on out! Koohii #2 Not a real diamond but a baseball one. No proper bases so we improvise, 1st is a bunch of flowers, 2nd is the pile of rice seedlings and so on... watch the running legs charge around after a big hit! Primitives diamond, flowers, Mao, soil, dirt, ground, human legs, walking legs Kunyomi: ひし Onyomi: リョウ Lesson: 39 Jouyou: Names JLPT Level: Compounds:	diamond 菱 画数11 1635 Details Story Dictionary 菱 diamond Heisig's Named after a diamond-shaped flower (the water caltrop), this key word refers to things shaped like a diamond. Primitives diamond, flowers, Mao, soil, dirt, ground, human legs, walking legs Kunyomi: ひし Onyomi: リョウ Lesson: 39 Jouyou: Names JLPT Level: Compounds:
"mausoleum Details Story Dictionary 陵 mausoleum Heisig's Pinnacle . . . rice seedlings . . . walking legs. Koohii #1 Ancient Japanese built a mausoleum for the ""unknown rice farmer"". It's on the pinnacle of Mt. Fuji, and it has a statue of a guy with huge walking legs planting rice seedlings as he goes. Koohii #2 At the pinnicle is a mausolem. The ground is sown with rice seedings to stop the dead from rising on walking legs. Primitives mausoleum, pinnacle, parthenon, acropolis, Mao, soil, dirt, ground, human legs, walking legs 丘陵(きゅうりょう): hill Kunyomi: みささぎ Onyomi: リョウ Lesson: 39 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 陵 (みささぎ)"	"mausoleum 陵 画数11 1636 Details Story Dictionary 陵 mausoleum Heisig's Pinnacle . . . rice seedlings . . . walking legs. Koohii #1 Ancient Japanese built a mausoleum for the ""unknown rice farmer"". It's on the pinnacle of Mt. Fuji, and it has a statue of a guy with huge walking legs planting rice seedlings as he goes. Koohii #2 At the pinnicle is a mausolem. The ground is sown with rice seedings to stop the dead from rising on walking legs. Primitives mausoleum, pinnacle, parthenon, acropolis, Mao, soil, dirt, ground, human legs, walking legs 丘陵(きゅうりょう): hill Kunyomi: みささぎ Onyomi: リョウ Lesson: 39 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 陵 (みささぎ)"
sign of the hog Details Story Dictionary 亥 sign of the hog Heisig's This kanji is the 12th sign of the Chinese zodiac: the sign of the hog. It is best learned by thinking of an acorn-eating hog in connection with the primitive meaning given below. * The top hat represents the external shape of the acorn, and the unusual but easily written complex of strokes beneath it (which you might also see as distortions of an elbow and person) stands for the mysterious secret whereby the acorn contains the oak tree in a nutshell. Koohii #1 A greedy hog in a top hat who has eaten all of the acorns. He even elbows people out of the way to get them. Koohii #2 Top Hat + Elbow + Person: The sign of the hog was a very recognizable tattoo - a hog with a big grin in a top hat, sticking his elbow into the person next to him. Primitives sign of the hog, acorn, top hat Kunyomi: い Onyomi: ガイ、カイ Lesson: 39 Jouyou: Names JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	sign of the hog 亥 画数6 1637 Details Story Dictionary 亥 sign of the hog Heisig's This kanji is the 12th sign of the Chinese zodiac: the sign of the hog. It is best learned by thinking of an acorn-eating hog in connection with the primitive meaning given below. * The top hat represents the external shape of the acorn, and the unusual but easily written complex of strokes beneath it (which you might also see as distortions of an elbow and person) stands for the mysterious secret whereby the acorn contains the oak tree in a nutshell. Koohii #1 A greedy hog in a top hat who has eaten all of the acorns. He even elbows people out of the way to get them. Koohii #2 Top Hat + Elbow + Person: The sign of the hog was a very recognizable tattoo - a hog with a big grin in a top hat, sticking his elbow into the person next to him. Primitives sign of the hog, acorn, top hat Kunyomi: い Onyomi: ガイ、カイ Lesson: 39 Jouyou: Names JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:
nucleus Details Story Dictionary 核 nucleus Heisig's Tree . . . acorn. Koohii #1 In the nucleus of the acorn, all the DNA is stored -- the building blocks for a new tree. Koohii #2 The nucleus of an oak TREE is an ACORN. Primitives nucleus, tree, wood, sign of the hog, acorn, top hat 核(かく): nucleus, kernel 結核(けっかく): tuberculosis, tubercule Kunyomi: Onyomi: カク Lesson: 39 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	nucleus 核 画数10 1638 Details Story Dictionary 核 nucleus Heisig's Tree . . . acorn. Koohii #1 In the nucleus of the acorn, all the DNA is stored -- the building blocks for a new tree. Koohii #2 The nucleus of an oak TREE is an ACORN. Primitives nucleus, tree, wood, sign of the hog, acorn, top hat 核(かく): nucleus, kernel 結核(けっかく): tuberculosis, tubercule Kunyomi: Onyomi: カク Lesson: 39 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:
engrave Details Story Dictionary 刻 engrave Heisig's Acorn . . . saber. Koohii #1 This famous ninja (I always use ninjas with sabres, distinct from samurai) used to engrave the kanji for his name onto acorns, and throw the acorns to distract his enemies. The legend goes that by the time his victims would pick up the acorn and read the engraved kanji, they were already dead. Koohii #2 While it´s traditional for lovers to engrave their names on a tree in many countries, in Japan, however, it was traditional for a samurai to signify his undying love for a woman by engraving the kanji of her name on an acorn with his sabre. Primitives engrave, sign of the hog, acorn, top hat, sword, sabre, saber 時刻表(じこくひょう): table, diagram, chart, timetable, schedule 刻む(きざむ): mince, chop up, carve, engrave, cut fine, hash, chisel, notch 時刻(じこく): instant, time, moment 深刻(しんこく): serious 遅刻(ちこく): lateness, late coming 彫刻(ちょうこく): carving, engraving, sculpture Kunyomi: きざ.む、きざ.み Onyomi: コク Lesson: 39 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 刻む (きざ.む)	engrave 刻 画数8 1639 Details Story Dictionary 刻 engrave Heisig's Acorn . . . saber. Koohii #1 This famous ninja (I always use ninjas with sabres, distinct from samurai) used to engrave the kanji for his name onto acorns, and throw the acorns to distract his enemies. The legend goes that by the time his victims would pick up the acorn and read the engraved kanji, they were already dead. Koohii #2 While it´s traditional for lovers to engrave their names on a tree in many countries, in Japan, however, it was traditional for a samurai to signify his undying love for a woman by engraving the kanji of her name on an acorn with his sabre. Primitives engrave, sign of the hog, acorn, top hat, sword, sabre, saber 時刻表(じこくひょう): table, diagram, chart, timetable, schedule 刻む(きざむ): mince, chop up, carve, engrave, cut fine, hash, chisel, notch 時刻(じこく): instant, time, moment 深刻(しんこく): serious 遅刻(ちこく): lateness, late coming 彫刻(ちょうこく): carving, engraving, sculpture Kunyomi: きざ.む、きざ.み Onyomi: コク Lesson: 39 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 刻む (きざ.む)
above-stated Details Story Dictionary 該 above-stated Heisig's Words . . . acorn. Koohii #1 I asked my teacher what this strange word meant, and she furiously replied that it was explained in the above-stated paragraph before throwing an acorn at me! Koohii #2 The above-stated words are the acorn from which the following statement grows. Primitives above-stated, say, words, keitai, mouth, sign of the hog, acorn, top hat 該当(がいとう): corresponding, answering to, coming under Kunyomi: Onyomi: ガイ Lesson: 39 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	above-stated 該 画数13 1640 Details Story Dictionary 該 above-stated Heisig's Words . . . acorn. Koohii #1 I asked my teacher what this strange word meant, and she furiously replied that it was explained in the above-stated paragraph before throwing an acorn at me! Koohii #2 The above-stated words are the acorn from which the following statement grows. Primitives above-stated, say, words, keitai, mouth, sign of the hog, acorn, top hat 該当(がいとう): corresponding, answering to, coming under Kunyomi: Onyomi: ガイ Lesson: 39 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:

"censure Details Story Dictionary 劾 censure Heisig's Acorn . . . muscle. Koohii #1 Censure is the political equivalent of a ""strongly worded letter,"" according to Cornell's School of Law. It is a flex of muscle by congress against the current president, but it is a very weak one. Imagine censure as congress flexing as hard as it can, only to have a little acorn-sized bump of muscle pop up suddenly. Koohii #2 Acorn Power is the people´s way to CENSURE a congressman you don´t agree with. Pelt your Senator with acorns today. Primitives censure, sign of the hog, acorn, top hat, power, muscle, arnold Kunyomi: Onyomi: ガイ Lesson: 39 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"	"censure 劾 画数8 1642 Details Story Dictionary 劾 censure Heisig's Acorn . . . muscle. "art Details Story Dictionary 術 art My Story *Go*ing to art shows is *ホ*'rrible Don't *go* watch this *ホ*'rrible art! A person who can make sandwich of the kanji {行} and the katakana ホ truly knows art. Koohii #1 Behold the ""Boulev´Art"" : a life-size section of a boulevard cast in a huge block of resin. Some call it ... art. Koohii #2 The definition of art is getting more and more loose these days. Why even some resin spilled onto the boulevard is now counted as art! Hmmph! cold Details Story Dictionary 寒 cold My Story [Crow + 3-legged fence + legs + 2 dots ] Koohii #1 Don't mix up with cool (#1404), when the cool boys order each other around. This kind of cold has to do with weather. When its cold outside, I stay at home and have hot celery soup with chicken legs to keep out the ice. 寒い　＝　さむい　＝cold. Koohii #2 Some strange animal tried to steal a stalk of celery from my house. However, it was freezing and the floor was covered in ice, so the mysterious animal couldn´t get any traction. Picture a stalk of celery and a pair of animal legs slipping and sliding clumsily around the ice, and never able to leave the house. Eventually it got so cold that the little animal froze to death. Primitives cold, Baba Yaga’s hut, house, celery, animal legs, ice 寒気(かんき): cold, frost, chill 寒帯(かんたい): frigid zone 寒い(さむい): cold (e.g. weather) Kunyomi: さむ.い Onyomi: カン Lesson: 39 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 寒い (さむ.い)	cold 寒 画数12 1645 Details Story Dictionary 寒 cold My Story [Crow + 3-legged fence + legs + 2 dots ] Koohii #1 Don't mix up with cool (#1404), when the cool boys order each other around. "defer Details Story Dictionary 譲 defer Heisig's Words . . . grass skirt. Koohii #1 Speaking complicated words to set her head spinning, the island girl in the grass skirt says demurely ""I defer (yield) to your judgment, wise one"". Koohii #2 I talked to my Japanese spouse, who confirmed that this kanji does not mean ""defer"" as in ""put off, delay"". It means ""defer"" in the sense of ""submit"" or ""yield"". Primitives defer, say, words, keitai, mouth, grass skirt, top hat, eight, six, animal legs, celery, scarf 譲歩(じょうほ): concession, conciliation, compromise 譲る(ゆずる): turn over, assign, hand over, transmit, convey, sell, dispose of, yield, surrender Kunyomi: ゆず.る Onyomi: ジョウ Lesson: 39 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 譲る (ゆず.る)"	"defer 譲 画数20 1648 Details Story Dictionary 譲 defer Heisig's Words . . . grass skirt. lot Details Story Dictionary 壌 lot Heisig's Ground . . . grass skirt. The lot of this key word refers to a portion of land. Koohii #1 My dream is to buy a small lot on a tropical island and spend the rest of my days relaxing in a grass skirt. Koohii #2 On the island of JOU, in order to be considered a lot, a ground must be big enough to grow sufficient grass for a grass skirt. elementary Details Story Dictionary 素 elementary My Story [Master {主} + String] The *Master* killed his wife a *string*, elementary my dear Watson Koohii #1 This kanji has nothing to do with elementary school - it means element, elemental, basic, bare. Imagine the thread as a thread connecting all life, starting from the basic elements and growing up into everything. Koohii #2 This is a pictogram of string theory. Strings are the most elementary particles of matter, which then grow up to become matter itself. Primitives elementary, grow up, thread, spiderman 簡素(かんそ): simplicity, plain 元素(げんそ): chemical element 酸素(さんそ): oxygen 質素(しっそ): simplicity, modesty, frugality 素敵(すてき): lovely, dreamy, beautiful, great, fantastic, superb, cool, capital 素早い(すばやい): fast, quick, prompt, agile 素晴らしい(すばらしい): wonderful, splendid, magnificent 素材(そざい): raw materials, subject matter 素っ気ない(そっけない): cold, short, curt, blunt 素朴(そぼく): simplicity, artlessness, naivete 炭素(たんそ): carbon (C) 素人(しろうと): amateur, novice 水素(すいそ): hydrogen 素直(すなお): obedient, meek, docile, unaffected 素質(そしつ): character, qualities, genius 要素(ようそ): element Kunyomi: もと Onyomi: ソ、ス Lesson: 40 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 素材 (そざい), 元素 (げんそ), 平素 (へいそ)	elementary 素 画数10 1652 Details Story Dictionary 素 elementary My Story [Master {主} + String] The *Master* killed his wife a *string*, elementary my dear Watson Koohii #1 This kanji has nothing to do with elementary school - it means element, elemental, basic, bare. "blue Details Story Dictionary 青 blue Heisig's Grow up . . . moon. Koohii #1 The last time I saw a blue moon was in my youth when I was growing up. Koohii #2 Once in a blue moon refers to a rare event. But originally ""blue moon"" refers to a full moon, in other words a fully grown-up moon. Whether once a month is rare or not depends on what we´re talking about, but that happens to be the origin of the expression. Primitives blue, grow up, moon, flesh 青白い(あおじろい): pale 青春(せいしゅん): youth, springtime of life, adolescent 青(あお): the color blue, the color green (noun), green light 青少年(せいしょうねん): youth, young person 青年(せいねん): youth, young man 真っ青(まっさお): deep blue, ghastly pale 青い(あおい): blue, pale, green, unripe, inexperienced Kunyomi: あお、あお-、あお.い Onyomi: セイ、ショウ Lesson: 40 Jouyou: 1 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds: 青天 (せいてん), 青銅 (せいどう), 青年 (せいねん), 青 (あお), 青い (あお.い)"	"blue 青 画数8 1654 Details Story Dictionary 青 blue Heisig's Grow up . . . moon. "refined Details Story Dictionary 精 refined Heisig's Rice . . . blue. Koohii #1 Very refined people in the upper classes have skin as pale as rice and blue blood. Koohii #2 ""Uh, why is your rice blue?"" ""It's been refined! And by 'refined' I mean it's been in the back of my fridge for a few months."". Primitives refined, rice, blue, grow up, moon, flesh 精巧(せいこう): elaborate, delicate, exquisite 精密(せいみつ): precise, exact, detailed, minute, close 精神(せいしん): mind, soul, heart, spirit, intention 精々(せいぜい): at the most, at best, to the utmost, as much (far) as possible Kunyomi: Onyomi: セイ、ショウ、シヤウ Lesson: 40 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 精米 (せいまい), 精密 (せいみつ), 精力 (せいりょく)"	"refined 精 画数14 1655 Details Story Dictionary 精 refined Heisig's Rice . . . blue. "solicit Details Story Dictionary 請 solicit Heisig's Words . . . blue. There´s a big sign on my front door, and the words clearly say ""No Soliciting"". feelings Details Story Dictionary 情 feelings My Story Q: What emotion are you feeling ? A: My *heart* is *blue* ever since JOE Stalin left me. Feeling blue is a state of mind where you're dominated by your feelings . Koohii #1 Data is feeling blue about not having any feelings ... hey, wait a minute. Koohii #2 Feeling blue is a state of mind where you´re dominated by your feelings. Koohii #2 When we speak of clearing up we easily think of both the sun and blue skies. But in another since to clear up is the absence of weather. quiet Details Story Dictionary 静 quiet Heisig's Blue . . . contend. Do not confuse with calm (Frame 1230). Koohii #1 When someone you know who is normally talkative goes quiet, it´s usually a sign that they are contending with the blues. Koohii #2 Don't confuse with silence (#240), something achieved through action. On the other hand, quiet refers to a personal quality of not speaking out. Members of Blue-man group jump into the wrestling ring of contenders for tag-team wrestling. Though the other contenders are screaming, the blue men never say anything - they are a very quiet bunch, that Blue-man group. Primitive order: blue man group's first and main characteristic is being blue and quiet; only later did they decide to become wrestling contenders. Primitives quiet, blue, grow up, moon, flesh, contend, bound up, rake 安静(あんせい): rest 静止(せいし): stillness, repose, standing still 静的(せいてき): static 静まる(しずまる): calm down, subside, die down, abate, be suppressed 冷静(れいせい): calm, composure, coolness, serenity 静か(しずか): quiet, peaceful Kunyomi: しず-、しず.か、しず.まる、しず.める Onyomi: セイ、ジョウ Lesson: 40 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 静止 (せいし), 静穏 (せいおん), 安静 (あんせい), 静 (しず), 静か (しず.か), 静まる (しず.まる), 静める (しず.める)	quiet 静 画数14 1660 Details Story Dictionary 静 quiet Heisig's Blue . . . contend. blame Details Story Dictionary 責 blame My Story [Master {主} + money/shellfish {貝}] The *master* blames all his problems on money/shellfish {貝} and women. The *master* blames you for being too SEXY, and as punishment, takes your money/shellfish {貝}. Koohii #1 As one grows up, one typically starts to blame all of their problems on money. Koohii #2 This is the story of a poor fisherman and his wife. A long time ago he caught an oyster with a small but precious pearl. The intelligent wife told him to sell the pearl immediately: the greedy husband figured if he kept the oyster and fed it, it would grow up and yield an even bigger pearl. One day the oyster grew so big, it crashed through the house and escaped back to sea. The angry wife left her husband, blaming his blind greed for their poverty. Primitives blame, grow up, shellfish, clam, oyster, eye, animal legs, eight 責務(せきむ): duty, obligation 責任(せきにん): duty, responsibility 責める(せめる): condemn, blame, criticize Kunyomi: せ.める Onyomi: セキ Lesson: 40 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 責める (せ.める)	blame 責 画数11 1661 Details Story Dictionary 責 blame My Story [Master {主} + money/shellfish {貝}] The *master* blames all his problems on money/shellfish {貝} and women. "volume Details Story Dictionary 積 volume Heisig's Wheat . . . blame. This key word has to do with measurement, and should be kept distinct from the kanji for quantity (Frame 189) - even though the meanings are similar. Koohii #1 On many wheat cereal boxes, there is a disclaimer stating that ""This package is sold by weight, not by volume. Some settling of contents may have occurred."" well they only say that because they don´t want to be blamed by people getting really disappointed after they see what a small volume of cereal the box really contains. Koohii #2 The volume of the wheat crop is way down this year! Blame the weather! Primitives volume, wheat, cereal, blame, grow up, shellfish, clam, oyster, eye, animal legs, eight 蓄積(ちくせき): accumulation, accumulate, store 積もり(つもり): intention, plan 見積り(みつもり): estimation, quotation 積極的(せっきょくてき): positive, active, proactive 体積(たいせき): capacity, volume 積む(つむ): pile up, stack 積もる(つもる): pile up 面積(めんせき): area 容積(ようせき): capacity, volume Kunyomi: つ.む、-づ.み、つ.もる、つ.もり Onyomi: セキ Lesson: 40 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 積む (つ.む), 積もる (つ.もる)"	"volume 積 画数16 1663 Details Story Dictionary 積 volume Heisig's Wheat . . . blame. bag Details Story Dictionary 俵 bag Heisig's Keep this kanji distinct from that for sack (Frame 1081). Its elements are: person . . . surface. Koohii #1 Superficial people (ie those who are only concerned about the surface) are obsessed with expensive bags. Koohii #2 Do you know why every person in Japan has a Louis Vuitton bag? After the 1985 JAL air crash that killed 520 people (the world´s worst). An image on tv of the crash showed Louis Vuitton bags (whose LV logo covered surface was somehow impervious) litering the crash site. From that point on they stuck in Japanese people´s mind´s as durable and high quality. (True story). Primitives bag, person, surface, grow up, scarf 土俵(どひょう): arena Kunyomi: たわら Onyomi: ヒョウ Lesson: 40 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 俵 (たわら)	bag 俵 画数10 1667 Details Story Dictionary 俵 bag Heisig's Keep this kanji distinct from that for sack (Frame 1081). undefiled Details Story Dictionary 潔 undefiled Heisig's Water . . . grow up . . . dagger . . . thread. Do not confuse with upright (Frame 58). Koohii #1 To ensure she remained undefiled, a young girl growing up in a rough area always kept a dagger concealed under her threads, even when she went into the water. Koohii #2 (rgravina) To ensure she remained undefiled, a young girl growing up in a rough area always kept a dagger concealed under her Spiderman underwear (to remember the position of thread), even when she went into the water. pledge Details Story Dictionary 契 pledge Heisig's Grow up . . . dagger . . . St. Bernard dog. The connotation of this character should be kept distinct from that for vow (Frame 1214) and promise (Frame 1462). Koohii #1 Imagine a totalitarian regime where, while growing up, you have to pledge allegiance to the flag at dagger-point and with St. Bernard guard dogs watching you. Koohii #2 In order to pledge into her sorority, Alice had to stab a St. Bernard with a dagger. (Come on! DO it, Alice!). Primitives pledge, flick knife, grow up, dagger, large, St. Bernard 契機(けいき): opportunity, chance 契る(ちぎる): to pledge, to promise, to swear 契約(けいやく): contract, compact, agreement Kunyomi: ちぎ.る Onyomi: ケイ Lesson: 40 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 契る (ちぎ.る)	pledge 契 画数9 1669 Details Story Dictionary 契 pledge Heisig's Grow up . . . dagger . . . St. Bernard dog. The connotation of this character should be kept distinct from that for vow (Frame 1214) and promise (Frame 1462). Koohii #1 Imagine a totalitarian regime where, while growing up, you have to pledge allegiance to the flag at dagger-point and with St. Bernard guard dogs watching you. consume Details Story Dictionary 喫 consume Heisig's Mouth . . . pledge. Koohii #1 This means eat/drink/smoke. Maybe you make a pledge to stop gutsing/binging/puffing, but your own mouth is tempting you to put something in it. Koohii #2 I make my mouth pledge to consume less. harm Details Story Dictionary 害 harm Heisig's House . . . grow up . . . mouth. Koohii #1 With kids growing up in your house, you have to keep them from harm of putting anything in their mouth, paint chips, bleach, knvies, etc. Koohii #2 This is silly, but.. If a house suddenly grows up from your mouth, you will come to great harm. Primitives harm, mansion, house, grow up, mouth 害する(がいする): to injure, to damage, to harm, to kill, to hinder 危害(きがい): injury, harm, danger 災害(さいがい): calamity, disaster, misfortune 迫害(はくがい): persecution 妨害(ぼうがい): disturbance, obstruction, hindrance, jamming, interference 害(がい): injury, harm, damage, evil influence 公害(こうがい): public nuisance, pollution 障害(しょうがい): obstacle, impediment (fault), damage 損害(そんがい): damage, injury, loss 被害(ひがい): damage 利害(りがい): advantages and disadvantages, interest Kunyomi: Onyomi: ガイ Lesson: 40 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds:	harm 害 画数10 1671 Details Story Dictionary 害 harm Heisig's House . . . grow up . . . mouth. "control Details Story Dictionary 轄 control Heisig's Car . . . harm. Hint: the image of an auto going ""out of control"" may help keep this key word distinct from others like it, such as manipulate (Frame 864). Koohii #1 The roads are icy, and a whole bunch of cars have spun out of control! Luckily, it was just a couple of dents; nobody was harmed. Koohii #2 Control is very important! Especially when operating a car. Few people realize the harm they can cause just by losing control of their car for a second. Tremendous harm. Stay in control! Primitives control, car, harm, mansion, house, grow up, mouth Kunyomi: くさび Onyomi: カツ Lesson: 40 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"	"control 轄 画数17 1672 Details Story Dictionary 轄 control Heisig's Car . . . harm. proportion Details Story Dictionary 割 proportion Heisig's Harm . . . saber. Koohii #1 [proportion; comparatively; divide; cut; separate; split] Hey, don´t take this out of proportion! I did you just a little harm, no need to come over here with a saber... Koohii #2 As shown on this pie-chart, the proportion of people harmed by sabres is relatively a small slice compared to those harmed by guns. Primitives proportion, harm, mansion, house, grow up, mouth, sword, sabre, saber 割(かつ): divide, cut, halve, separate, split, rip, break, crack, smash, dilute 割合(わりあい): rate, ratio, proportion, comparatively, contrary to expectations 割り当て(わりあて): allotment, assignment, allocation, quota, rationing 割り込む(わりこむ): to cut in, to thrust oneself into, to wedge oneself in, to muscle in on, to interrupt, to disturb 割り算(わりざん): division (math) 時間割(じかんわり): timetable, schedule 役割(やくわり): part, assigning (allotment of) parts, role, duties 割算(わりざん): (mathematics) division 割と(わりと): relatively, comparatively 割引(わりびき): discount, reduction, rebate, tenths discounted 割る(わる): divide, cut, break, halve, separate, split, rip, crack, smash, dilute 割合に(わりあいに): comparatively 割れる(われる): split, crack Kunyomi: わ.る、わり、わ.り、わ.れる、さ.く Onyomi: カツ Lesson: 40 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 割く (さ.く), 割る (わ.る), 割れる (わ.れる), 割 (わり)	proportion 割 画数12 1673 Details Story Dictionary 割 proportion Heisig's Harm . . . saber. constitution Details Story Dictionary 憲 constitution My Story [Crown + Master + net + heart] The *crowned* *master* has banned all dark *nets* and illegal *heart* stealing operations in his latest version of the constitution V69.420 Koohii #1 The constitution is important. At least my parents thought so. In the house where I grew up, it was framed on the wall. Under the watchful (sideways) eye of my mother, we had to study it until we knew it by heart. Koohii #2 The constitution states the following rights: You may live in your own house and grow up. And you will never be watched by big brother's eye so they cannot control your heart (your believes). Primitives constitution, mansion, house, grow up, eye, cross-eyed, net, heart 憲法(けんぽう): constitution Kunyomi: Onyomi: ケン Lesson: 40 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	constitution 憲 画数16 1674 Details Story Dictionary 憲 constitution My Story [Crown + Master + net + heart] The *crowned* *master* has banned all dark *nets* and illegal *heart* stealing operations in his latest version of the constitution V69.420 Koohii #1 The constitution is important. life Details Story Dictionary 生 life Heisig's A single drop added to the element for grow up gives us the character for life. * As a primitive, we may think of a microscopic cell, that miraculous unit that grows up to become a living being. Koohii #1 This is the first CELL of a human, the foundation of its entire LIFE, a small DROP that will GROW UP to form a complex organism. Koohii #2 Growing Up is just a Drop of our LIFE. Primitives life, This is Your Life, cell, drop, grow up 生かす(いかす): to revive, to resuscitate, to make use of 生まれつき(うまれつき): by nature, by birth, native 衛生(えいせい): health, hygiene, sanitation, medical 生(き): pure, undiluted, raw, crude 生真面目(きまじめ): too serious, person who is too serious, honesty, sincerity 再生(さいせい): playback, regeneration, resuscitation, return to life, rebirth, reincarnation, narrow escape, reclamation, regrowth 出生(しゅっしょう): birth 新入生(しんにゅうせい): freshman, first-year student 生育(せいいく): growth, development, breeding 生活(せいかつ): living, life (one´s daily existence), livelihood 生計(せいけい): livelihood, living 生死(せいし): life and death 生長(せいちょう): growth, increment 生理(せいり): physiology, menses 畜生(ちくしょう): beast, brute, damn 生臭い(なまぐさい): smelling of fish or blood, fish or meat 生温い(なまぬるい): lukewarm, halfhearted 生身(なまみ): living flesh, flesh and blood, the quick 年生(ねんせい): pupil in .... year, student in .... year 発生(はっせい): outbreak, spring forth, occurrence, incidence, origin 生やす(はやす): to grow, to cultivate, to wear beard 野生(やせい): wild 生き生き(いきいき): vividly, lively 生き物(いきもの): animal 生け花(いけばな): flower arrangement 一生(いっしょう): lifetime, all through life, generation, age, era, the whole world 生まれ(うまれ): birth, birth-place 生地(きじ): cloth, material, texture, one´s true character, unglazed pottery 芝生(しばふ): lawn 写生(しゃせい): sketch, drawing from nature, portrayal, description 小学生(しょうがくせい): grade school student 生じる(しょうじる): produce, yield, result from, arise, be generated 生ずる(しょうずる): cause, arise, be generated 人生(じんせい): (human) life (i.e. conception to death) 生産(せいさん): production, manufacture 生存(せいぞん): existence, being, survival 生年月日(せいねんがっぴ): birth date 生物(せいぶつ): living things, creature 生命(せいめい): life, existence 誕生(たんじょう): birth 生(なま): raw, unprocessed 生意気(なまいき): impertinent, saucy, cheeky, conceit, audacious, brazen 生る(なる): bear fruit 生える(はえる): grow, spring up 生きる(いきる): live, exist 一生懸命(いっしょうけんめい): as well as one can, as hard as one can 高校生(こうこうせい): high school student 大学生(だいがくせい): university student 生まれる(うまれる): be born 学生(がくせい): student 生徒(せいと): pupil 先生(せんせい): teacher, master, doctor 誕生日(たんじょうび): birthday 留学生(りゅうがくせい): overseas student Kunyomi: animal sacrifice Details Story Dictionary 牲 animal sacrifice Heisig's Cow . . . cell. Koohii #1 Animal sacrifice = taking the life of a cow. Koohii #2 In the 21st century, animal sacrifice is no longer really necessary. We can take a single cell from a cow, with no harm to the cow. We create a viable cell line from this single cell, and feed the resulting biomatter into a furnace at the exact rate necessary to appease the gods. Primitives animal sacrifice, cow, life, This is Your Life, cell, drop, grow up 犠牲(ぎせい): sacrifice Kunyomi: Onyomi: セイ Lesson: 40 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	animal sacrifice 牲 画数9 1680 Details Story Dictionary 牲 animal sacrifice Heisig's Cow . . . cell. We create a viable cell line from this single cell, and feed the resulting biomatter into a furnace at the exact rate necessary to appease the gods. "products Details Story Dictionary 産 products Heisig's Vase . . . cliff . . . cell. Koohii #1 If you were to stand up all the products you have accumulated over the course of your entire life on top of one another, the result would probably be as tall as a cliff. Koohii #2 The salesman is standing on the cliff´s edge. ""Buy my products!! Buy my products! Or else I´ll take my own life""! Man, that´s selling on pressure. Primitives products, vase, stand up, cliff, life, This is Your Life, cell, drop, grow up 産む(うむ): to give birth, to deliver, to produce お産(おさん): (giving) birth 国産(こくさん): domestic products 産休(さんきゅう): maternity leave 産後(さんご): postpartum, after childbirth 産出(さんしゅつ): yield, produce 産婦人科(さんふじんか): maternity and gynecology department 産物(さんぶつ): product, result, fruit 資産(しさん): property, fortune, means, assets 出産(しゅっさん): (child)birth, delivery, production (of goods) 畜産(ちくさん): animal husbandry 倒産(とうさん): (corporate) bankruptcy, insolvency 特産(とくさん): specialty, special product 土産(どさん): product of the land 不動産(ふどうさん): real estate 名産(めいさん): noted product 共産(きょうさん): communism 原産(げんさん): place of origin, habitat 財産(ざいさん): property, fortune, assets 産業(さんぎょう): industry 産地(さんち): producing area 水産(すいさん): marine products, fisheries 生産(せいさん): production, manufacture 農産物(のうさんぶつ): agricultural produce 破産(はさん): (personal) bankruptcy 土産(みやげ): product of the land お土産(おみやげ): souvenir Kunyomi: う.む、う.まれる、うぶ-、む.す Onyomi: サン Lesson: 40 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 産まれる (う.まれる), 産む (う.む), 産 (うぶ)"	"products 産 画数11 1681 Details Story Dictionary 産 products Heisig's Vase . . . cliff . . . cell. "hump Details Story Dictionary 隆 hump Heisig's This character, used for everything from little humps of hills to camel humps, easily suggests the hunch on the pig's back and hind parts where the best cuts of meat are to be found (and hence the English expression for luxury, ""living high off the hog."") The elements we have to work with are: pinnacle . . . walking legs . . . cell. Koohii #1 You are struggling to the top across the humps, but you suddenly see the pinnacle and you feel new life in your walking legs. Koohii #2 A woman takes her bra off and what happens? Nine months later the hump in her belly pops out between her legs as a new life. Primitives hump, pinnacle, parthenon, acropolis, walking legs, life, This is Your Life, cell, drop, grow up Kunyomi: Onyomi: リュウ Lesson: 40 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"	"hump 隆 画数11 1682 Details Story Dictionary 隆 hump Heisig's This character, used for everything from little humps of hills to camel humps, easily suggests the hunch on the pig's back and hind parts where the best cuts of meat are to be found (and hence the English expression for luxury, ""living high off the hog."") The elements we have to work with are: pinnacle . . . walking legs . . . cell. Koohii #1 You are struggling to the top across the humps, but you suddenly see the pinnacle and you feel new life in your walking legs. Koohii #2 A woman takes her bra off and what happens? Nine months later the hump in her belly pops out between her legs as a new life. Primitives hump, pinnacle, parthenon, acropolis, walking legs, life, This is Your Life, cell, drop, grow up Kunyomi: Onyomi: リュウ Lesson: 40 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"
"summit Details Story Dictionary 峰 summit Heisig's Mountain . . . walking legs . . . bushes. Koohii #1 Walking legs over ""bushes"" needs to have a primitive meaning of its own. It appears in several kanji, such as 縫 sew (#1563), 逢 tryst (#2417), 蜂 bee (#2687), and 鋒 sword´s point (#2768), and it is clumsy to work bushes and walking legs into every story. ""Pointy"" works fairly well: the walking legs are stuck on top of the pointy part of the bush; and for this character: a summit is the pointy end of a mountain. Koohii #2 Upon reaching the summit of the mountain, I noticed my walking legs were all gouged up from walking through prickly bushes. Primitives summit, mountain, Segway, Macbeth, walking legs, bushes 峰(みね): peak, ridge Kunyomi: みね、ね Onyomi: ホウ Lesson: 40 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 峰 (みね)"	"summit 峰 画数10 1683 Details Story Dictionary 峰 summit Heisig's Mountain . . . walking legs . . . bushes. Koohii #1 Walking legs over ""bushes"" needs to have a primitive meaning of its own. It appears in several kanji, such as 縫 sew (#1563), 逢 tryst (#2417), 蜂 bee (#2687), and 鋒 sword´s point (#2768), and it is clumsy to work bushes and walking legs into every story. ""Pointy"" works fairly well: the walking legs are stuck on top of the pointy part of the bush; and for this character: a summit is the pointy end of a mountain. Koohii #2 Upon reaching the summit of the mountain, I noticed my walking legs were all gouged up from walking through prickly bushes. Koohii #2 The insect that interrupted our tryst (#2417) was a bee! sew Details Story Dictionary 縫 sew Heisig's Thread . . . walking legs . . . bushes . . . road. Koohii #1 Pointy primitive; with a pointy needle you sew a road (-------) of threads. Koohii #2 Good thing I brought some thread, cause I need to sew my pants that I tore up walking through the bushes (see summit (#1562)) before we hit the road to go back down the mountain. worship Details Story Dictionary 拝 worship Heisig's Fingers . . . bush . . . suspended from the ceiling. Koohii #1 I put my fingers together in worship of the bush that hangs from the ceiling -- that wonderful mistletoe which has gotten me kissed by many a girl. Koohii #2 Because I worship her, I only finger ONE BUSH, her´s, and no others! Primitives worship, finger, fingers, one, ceiling, bushes 崇拝(すうはい): worship, adoration, admiration, cult 拝啓(はいけい): Dear (so and so) 拝借(はいしゃく): borrowing 拝む(おがむ): worship, beg 拝見(はいけん): see, look Kunyomi: おが.む、おろが.む Onyomi: ハイ Lesson: 40 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 拝む (おが.む)	worship 拝 画数8 1686 Details Story Dictionary 拝 worship Heisig's Fingers . . . bush . . . suspended from the ceiling. longevity Details Story Dictionary 寿 longevity My Story Your *NO*se (ノ) has *3* (三) times the lifespan and longevity of *glue*. Koohii #1 In an attempt to increase a bush's longevity, an incompitent gardener glues all the leaves back on that have fallen off. Maybe he should have tried watering it instead. Koohii #2 This old China man glued shrubs to his body. The added intake of oxygen from the shrubs was, according to him, the secret of his longevity. Sometimes he would sit all day in meditation without moving, and the locals believed the old man had actually turned into a shrub ! Primitives longevity, bushes, glue 寿命(じゅみょう): life span Kunyomi: ことぶき、ことぶ.く、ことほ.ぐ Onyomi: ジュ、ス、シュウ Lesson: 40 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: Compounds: 寿 (ことぶき)	longevity 寿 画数7 1687 Details Story Dictionary 寿 longevity My Story Your *NO*se (ノ) has *3* (三) times the lifespan and longevity of *glue*. casting Details Story Dictionary 鋳 casting Heisig's Metal . . . longevity. As you probably guessed from the elements, the key word refers to the casting of metals. Koohii #1 We take a casting because metal will have much greater longevity than the original. Koohii #2 They made a metal casting of the Chinese man who glued shrubs to himself to increase his longevity. It´s now sold around the world as it´s thought that having one will increase your own longevity.. Primitives casting, metal, gold, longevity, bushes, glue Kunyomi: い.る Onyomi: チュウ、イ、シュ、シュウ Lesson: 40 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 鋳る (い.る)	casting 鋳 画数15 1688 Details Story Dictionary 鋳 casting Heisig's Metal . . . longevity. enroll Details Story Dictionary 籍 enroll Heisig's Bamboo . . . Christmas tree . . . once upon a time. Koohii #1 Japanese father enrolls his student in a well-rounded school: they teach eastern traditions (the way of the bamboo), western traditions (like Christmas trees), and also teach literature (once upon a time). Koohii #2 Once upon a time, in order to enroll in a Christian school you had to answer a series of questions to ensure that you were really Christian. For example, the principal might show you a picture of a Christmas tree and a picture of some bamboo and ask you which one is most suitable for decoration at Christmas time. Primitives enroll, bamboo, christmas tree, wood, once upon a time, storyteller 戸籍(こせき): census, family register 国籍(こくせき): nationality 書籍(しょせき): book, publication Kunyomi: Onyomi: セキ Lesson: 40 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 2 Compounds:	enroll 籍 画数20 1689 Details Story Dictionary 籍 enroll Heisig's Bamboo . . . springtime Details Story Dictionary 春 springtime My Story A more simple Primitive than bonsai: #3 people 三　＋　人# Springtime: #3 people# sitting enjoying the escape from winter, soaking in the #sun#. 3 Stooges frolic and play on a spring day. Koohii #1 In the springtime bonsai get plenty of sun. Koohii #2 When it´s springtime you can only leave the bonsai out when the sun has gone down. Their little leaves can´t handle too much heat. camellia Details Story Dictionary 椿 camellia Heisig's Tree . . . springtime. Koohii #1 The tree of spring. Fact: Camellia are highly valued in Japan and elsewhere for their very early flowering, often among the first flowers to appear in the late winter [early spring?]. Koohii #2 Anyone who´s lived in Japan knows camellia are by far the first tree of spring to flower. And how can you miss those shockingly pink flowers! Primitives camellia, tree, wood, springtime, bonsai, sun, day Kunyomi: つばき Onyomi: チン、チュン Lesson: 40 Jouyou: Names JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	camellia 椿 画数13 1691 Details Story Dictionary 椿 camellia Heisig's Tree . . . springtime. play music Details Story Dictionary 奏 play music Heisig's Bonsai . . . heavens. Koohii #1 When you play music to them, your bonsai will grow like they are in heaven. Koohii #2 In heaven you are surrounded by bonsai trees (full-sized ones fall through the clouds) while you play music on your harp. I always have trouble remembering that the bonsai tree is on top, so think of them growing on top of the clouds. Primitives play music, bonsai, heavens 吹奏(すいそう): playing wind instruments 演奏(えんそう): musical performance Kunyomi: かな.でる Onyomi: ソウ Lesson: 40 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 奏でる (かな.でる)	play music 奏 画数9 1693 Details Story Dictionary 奏 play music Heisig's Bonsai . . . heavens. reality Details Story Dictionary 実 reality My Story [Crown + Bonsai (Master + animal legs)] In reality, *Crowned* men never stood a chance against the *bonsai* Koohii #1 Bonsais are grown in a house, away from the harsh reality of the real world where they wouldn´t survive. Koohii #2 On this rather boring ´big brother´ type reality show, they have locked up bonsai inside a house and everyone is watching them on TV 24x7. The viewers have to vote on which bonsai shall remain in the house and which one has to leave. Primitives reality, house, bonsai 真実(さな): truth, reality 実(じつ): truth, reality, sincerity, fidelity, kindness, faith, substance, essence 実業家(じつぎょうか): industrialist, businessman 実質(じっしつ): substance, essence 実情(じつじょう): real condition, actual circumstances, actual state of affairs 実践(じっせん): practice, put into practice 実態(じったい): truth, fact 実は(じつは): as a matter of fact, by the way 実費(じっぴ): actual expense, cost price 充実(じゅうじつ): fullness, completion, perfection, substantiality, enrichment 誠実(せいじつ): sincere, honest, faithful 切実(せつじつ): compelling, serious, severe, acute, earnest, pressing, urgent 忠実(ちゅうじつ): fidelity, faithfulness 確実(かくじつ): certainty, reliability, soundness 果実(かじつ): fruit, nut, berry 現実(げんじつ): reality 口実(こうじつ): excuse 事実(じじつ): fact, truth, reality 実感(じっかん): feelings (actual, true) 実験(じっけん): experiment 実現(じつげん): implementation, materialization, realization 実行(じっこう): practice, performance, realization, execution (e.g. program) 実際(じっさい): practical, actual condition, status quo 実施(じっし): enforcement, enact, put into practice, carry out, operation 実習(じっしゅう): practice, training 実績(じっせき): achievements, actual results 実に(じつに): indeed, truly, surely 実物(じつぶつ): real thing, original 実用(じつよう): practical use, utility 実力(じつりょく): merit, efficiency, arms, force 実例(じつれい): example, illustration 実(み): fruit, nut, seed, content, good result 実る(みのる): bear fruit, ripen Kunyomi: み、みの.る、まこと、まことに、みの、みち.る Onyomi: ジツ、シツ Lesson: 40 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 実 (み), 実る (みの.る)	reality 実 画数8 1694 Details Story Dictionary 実 reality My Story [Crown + Bonsai (Master + animal legs)] In reality, *Crowned* men never stood a chance against the *bonsai* Koohii #1 Bonsais are grown in a house, away from the harsh reality of the real world where they wouldn´t survive.
