"dedicate Details Story Dictionary 奉 dedicate Heisig's Bonsai . . . cornstalk. Use a ritualistic, religious meaning. Koohii #1 To join the temple, you have to dedicate yourself to raising bonsai for enlightenment, and cornstalks for sustenance. Koohii #2 A Japanese farmer who was growing corn tried to dedicate himself to the god of corn (in the hope it would bring better harvests). He had a little room with prayer beads, incense, etc. One day he brought an offerand that he thought would please the god of corn : a bonsai - corn (a corn plant turned into a bonsai). The god was infuriated and yelled at him ""HOW DARE YOU TORTURE MY CORN IN SUCH WAYS!"". The End. Primitives observance, dedicate, bonsai, cornstalk 奉る(たてまつる): to offer, to present, to revere, to do respectfully 奉仕(ほうし): attendance, service Kunyomi: たてまつ.る、まつ.る、ほう.ずる Onyomi: ホウ、ブ Lesson: 40 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 奉納 (ほうのう), 奉仕 (ほうし), 信奉 (しんぽう), 奉る (たてまつ.る)"	"dedicate 奉 画数8 1695 Details Story Dictionary 奉 dedicate Heisig's Bonsai . . . cornstalk. Use a ritualistic, religious meaning. Koohii #1 To join the temple, you have to dedicate yourself to raising bonsai for enlightenment, and cornstalks for sustenance. Koohii #2 A Japanese farmer who was growing corn tried to dedicate himself to the god of corn (in the hope it would bring better harvests). He had a little room with prayer beads, incense, etc. One day he brought an offerand that he thought would please the god of corn : a bonsai - corn (a corn plant turned into a bonsai). The god was infuriated and yelled at him ""HOW DARE YOU TORTURE MY CORN IN SUCH WAYS!"". The End. Primitives observance, dedicate, bonsai, cornstalk 奉る(たてまつる): to offer, to present, to revere, to do respectfully 奉仕(ほうし): attendance, service Kunyomi: たてまつ.る、まつ.る、ほう.ずる Onyomi: ホウ、ブ Lesson: 40 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 奉納 (ほうのう), 奉仕 (ほうし), 信奉 (しんぽう), 奉る (たてまつ.る)"

Koohii #2 People who are highly dedicated to their jobs get good salaries/stipends. "rod Details Story Dictionary 棒 rod Heisig's Tree . . . dedicate. Koohii #1 This wooden rod has one very simple dedication engraved on it: ""Spare the rod, spoil the child..."". Koohii #2 The wood from this tree is dedicated to making rods to flog naughty kids. discreet Details Story Dictionary 謹 discreet Heisig's Words . . . cabbage. Koohii #1 Muttering words of gratitude for a wonderful meal, I discreetly slipped my cabbage under the table for the dog. Koohii #2 Cabbage primitive: When a cabbage is growing up, you must put it in your mouth before it flowers, because that´s when it becomes bitter. Seriously, it´s called ´bolting´ or something. When you´re discreet, you try to make your words like a cabbage: well-layered, but in an unassuming way. Primitives discreet, say, words, keitai, mouth, cabbage, flowers, mouth, grow up Kunyomi: つつし.む Onyomi: キン Lesson: 40 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 謹む (つつし.む)	discreet 謹 画数17 1698 Details Story Dictionary 謹 discreet Heisig's Words . . . cabbage. "trifle Details Story Dictionary 僅 trifle Heisig's Person . . . cabbage. Koohii #1 To a big guy like Mr. T, eating a whole cabbage at once is nothing. ""What? a cabbage? That's just a trifle, foo, where's the meat?"". Koohii #2 To MR.T swallowing a whole CABBAGE is no more than a TRIFLE. Primitives trifle, person, cabbage, flowers, mouth, grow up 僅(きん): a little, small quantity 僅か(わずか): only, merely, a little, small quantity Kunyomi: わずか Onyomi: キン、ゴン Lesson: 40 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: Compounds: 僅 (わずか)"	"trifle 僅 画数12 1699 Details Story Dictionary 僅 trifle Heisig's Person . . . cabbage. diligence Details Story Dictionary 勤 diligence Heisig's Cabbage . . . muscle. Koohii #1 With enough diligence, Koreans can turn ordinary cabbage into powerful kimchi. "Sino- Details Story Dictionary 漢 Sino- Heisig's Water . . . scarecrow. The key word has come to refer to things Chinese in general, including the kanji themselves (for which this character is used). Koohii #1 Sino- (Chinese) people had to put a lot of sweat/water into learning the kanji. For right-hand kanji primitive - The dumb Western husband of a Japanese woman buys her flowers to apologise, after he opened his big mouth and said ""kanji are a stupid writing system"".. Koohii #2 In the water between Japan and China, the Sino- side has put scarecrows in the water to try and keep the Japanese away. Primitives sino, water, water droplets, water pistol, scarecrow, flowers, mouth, husband 漢語(かんご): Chinese word, Sino-Japanese word 漢和(かんわ): Chinese-Japanese (e.g. dictionary) 漢字(かんじ): Chinese characters, kanji Kunyomi: Onyomi: カン Lesson: 40 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds:"	"Sino- 漢 画数13 1701 Details Story Dictionary 漢 Sino- Heisig's Water . . . scarecrow. The key word has come to refer to things Chinese in general, including the kanji themselves (for which this character is used). Koohii #1 Sino- (Chinese) people had to put a lot of sweat/water into learning the kanji. difficult Details Story Dictionary 難 difficult Heisig's Scarecrow . . . turkey. Koohii #1 Learning Kanji is difficult for Turkeys. Koohii #2 It is difficult for a scarecrow to scare a turkey or else they would´ve been called scareturkeys. Primitives difficult, scarecrow, flowers, mouth, husband, turkey 有難う(ありがとう): Thank you 難い(かたい): difficult, hard 遭難(そうなん): disaster, shipwreck, accident 難(なん): difficulty, hardships, defect 避難(ひなん): taking refuge, finding shelter 非難(ひなん): blame, attack, criticism 無難(ぶなん): safety, security 有難い(ありがたい): grateful, thankful, welcome, appreciated 困難(こんなん): difficulty, distress 災難(さいなん): calamity, misfortune 盗難(とうなん): theft, robbery 難しい(むずかしい): difficult Kunyomi: かた.い、-がた.い、むずか.しい、むづか.しい、むつか.しい、-にく.い Onyomi: ナン Lesson: 40 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 難い (かた.い), 難しい (むずか.しい)	difficult 難 画数18 1703 Details Story Dictionary 難 difficult Heisig's Scarecrow . . . turkey. splendor Details Story Dictionary 華 splendor My Story 華やか = showy; brilliant; gorgeous; florid; gay 華々しい = brilliant; magnificent; spectacular Hint: Splendor in the Grass. Compare with 草. This is just a more splendid version of that kanji. It also has some cool flowers on top Koohii #1 The Queen of England taking a walk round a village: ´Excuse me, I couldn´t help noticing the splendour of the flowers in your garden. Simply splendid. Ten out of ten.´ The villager gruffly replies: ´No it ´aint. It´s all muck. An´ I´m gonna cut it all down and sell it to the farmer for silage.´. Koohii #2 (I'm substituting greenhouse for silage. It is also full of all types of plants, and the shape resembles the windows that cover the building to let in the light.) See the splendor of the roses filling the greenhouse, beauty atop a stem of needles (thorns). Primitives splendor, flowers, silage, ten, needle 華奢(かしゃ): luxury, pomp, delicate, slender, gorgeous 華美(かび): pomp, splendor, gaudiness 華々しい(はなばなしい): brilliant, magnificent, spectacular 華やか(はなやか): gay, showy, brilliant, gorgeous, florid 豪華(ごうか): wonderful, gorgeous, splendor, pomp, extravagance Kunyomi: はな Onyomi: カ、ケ Lesson: 40 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 華美 (かび), 繁華 (はんか), 栄華 (えいが), 華 (はな)	splendor 華 画数10 1704 Details Story Dictionary 華 splendor My Story 華やか = showy; brilliant; gorgeous; florid; gay 華々しい = brilliant; magnificent; spectacular Hint: Splendor in the Grass. droop Details Story Dictionary 垂 droop Heisig's A drop of . . . silage . . . walking stick . . . floor. The character is written in the order of its elements. Koohii #1 The thousand head of cattle let their heads droop as they devour the silage (animal fodder) that is lying on the floor around them. Koohii #2 Even a drop of silage is enough to make an old man with a walking stick droop low down to the floor. (rgravina - fixed up order). Primitives droop, drop, silage, walking cane, stick, one, floor 垂れる(たれる): to hang, to droop, to drop, to lower, to pull down, to dangle, to sag, to drip, to ooze, to trickle, to leave behind (at death), to give, to confer 垂直(すいちょく): vertical, perpendicular Kunyomi: た.れる、た.らす、た.れ、-た.れ、なんなんと.す Onyomi: スイ Lesson: 40 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 垂らす (た.らす), 垂れる (た.れる)	droop 垂 画数8 1705 Details Story Dictionary 垂 droop Heisig's A drop of . . . silage . . . walking stick . . . floor. spindle Details Story Dictionary 錘 spindle Heisig's Metal . . . droop. Koohii #1 Wasn´t it a cursed spindle that Sleeping Beauty pricked her finger on? Viola. ride Details Story Dictionary 乗 ride Heisig's The simplest way to remember this character is to find the sprig of wheat in it, hidden because it doubles up with one stroke of silage. Koohii #1 It´s a hay ride! You sit on piles of silage and everyone likes to imitate old-time farmers with a piece of wheat sticking out of their mouths. Koohii #2 [ride; power; multiplication; record; counter for vehicles; board; mount; join] In the near future, we hope to ride on biomass fueled vehicles. Good news for those who have wheat silage surplus. Primitives ride, wheat, cereal, silage 乗客(じょうかく): passenger 乗せる(のせる): to place on (something), to take on board, to give a ride, to let (one) take part, to impose on, to record, to mention, to load (luggage), to publish, to run (an ad) 乗っ取る(のっとる): to capture, to occupy, to usurp 乗り換え(のりかえ): transfer (trains buses etc.) 乗り込む(のりこむ): to board, to embark on, to get into (a car), to ship (passengers), to man (a ship), to help (someone) into, to march into, to enter 乗客(じょうきゃく): passenger 乗車(じょうしゃ): taking a train 乗換(のりかえ): transfer (trains, buses, etc.) 乗り換える(のりかえる): transfer 乗り物(のりもの): vehicle, vessel 乗る(のる): get on, get up on, ride in, be taken in, share in, join, feel like doing, be mentioned in, be in harmony with Kunyomi: の.る、-の.り、の.せる Onyomi: ジョウ、ショウ Lesson: 40 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 乗せる (の.せる), 乗る (の.る)	ride 乗 画数9 1709 Details Story Dictionary 乗 ride Heisig's The simplest way to remember this character is to find the sprig of wheat in it, hidden because it doubles up with one stroke of silage. surplus Details Story Dictionary 剰 surplus Heisig's Ride . . . saber. Koohii #1 If you go for a ride and find a saber beside you, perhaps you got into an Army surplus jeep. Koohii #2 Remember the wheat we cut with scythes (farmer's equivalent of a saber) for profit (#906)?　Well, we harvested too much and have to use the surplus for silage. 過剰 (かじょう) : excess. Primitives surplus, ride, wheat, cereal, silage, sword, sabre, saber 過剰(かじょう): excess Kunyomi: あまつさえ、あま.り、あま.る Onyomi: ジョウ Lesson: 40 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	surplus 剰 画数11 1710 Details Story Dictionary 剰 surplus Heisig's Ride . . . saber. Koohii #1 If you go for a ride and find a saber beside you, perhaps you got into an Army surplus jeep. Koohii #2 Remember the wheat we cut with scythes (farmer's equivalent of a saber) for profit (#906)?　Well, we harvested too much and have to use the surplus for silage. 過剰 (かじょう) : excess. Primitives surplus, ride, wheat, cereal, silage, sword, sabre, saber 過剰(かじょう): excess Kunyomi: あまつさえ、あま.り、あま.る Onyomi: ジョウ Lesson: 40 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:
now Details Story Dictionary 今 now Heisig's The final stroke of this kanji is a rare shape, which we have not met before and will only meet in this character and others that include it as a primitive. We are more accustomed to seeing it straightened out as part of other shapes - for instance, as the second stroke of mouth. If you need any help at all with this character, you may picture it as two hands of a clock pointing to what time it is now. The element above it, meeting, should easily relate to that image. * We shall use clock as the primitive meaning of this character, in line with the above explanation. Koohii #1 My MEETING is at 7- but that´s NOW! Koohii #2 (re: ruuku35) The meeting is not at quarter to seven but now! Primitives now, meeting, umbrella, one, 7 今更(いまさら): now, at this late hour 今日は(こんにちは): hello, good day (daytime greeting id) 今に(いまに): before long, even now 今にも(いまにも): at any time, soon 今回(こんかい): now, this time, lately 今後(こんご): from now on, hereafter 今日(こんにち): today 今夜(こんや): tonight 今度(こんど): next time 今(いま): this, now 今日(きょう): today, this day 今朝(けさ): this morning 今年(ことし): this year 今月(こんげつ): this month 今週(こんしゅう): this week 今晩(こんばん): tonight, this evening Kunyomi: いま Onyomi: コン、キン Lesson: 41 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 5 Compounds: 今後 (こんご), 今日 (きょう), 今朝 (けさ), 今年 (こんねん), 昨今 (さっこん), 今 (いま)	now 今 画数4 1711 Details Story Dictionary 今 now Heisig's The final stroke of this kanji is a rare shape, which we have not met before and will only meet in this character and others that include it as a primitive. include Details Story Dictionary 含 include Heisig's Clock . . . mouth. Koohii #1 This clock includes a mouth that will tell you what the time is now. Hearing impaired people have this kind of watches... now imagine them as a big mouth under the clock. Koohii #2 Batteries included with this clock. Open the mouth at the back and insert them after purchase. covet Details Story Dictionary 貪 covet Heisig's Clock . . . shellfish. Koohii #1 Whatever you covet at the moment (now), can be bought with money. Well, _almost_ anything.... Remember to always put time over money (in this kanji and in life). versify Details Story Dictionary 吟 versify Heisig's As we have already learned characters for poem (Frame 370), chant (Frame 21), and song (Frame 508), it is important to protect this key word with an image all its own. Its elements are the same as those above; only the position has changed: mouth . . . clock. Koohii #1 Versify this kanji as follows: Hickery dickery dock, the mouth ran by the clock. Koohii #2 To versify, words of rhythm needs to shoot out of your MOUTH with a CLOCK-like regularity. Primitives versify, mouth, now, clock 吟味(ぎんみ): testing, scrutiny, careful investigation Kunyomi: Onyomi: ギン Lesson: 41 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	versify 吟 画数7 1714 Details Story Dictionary 吟 versify Heisig's As we have already learned characters for poem (Frame 370), chant (Frame 21), and song (Frame 508), it is important to protect this key word with an image all its own. Koohii #1 Someone wishing from the bottom of their heart that the clock would stop. A mid-life crisis perhaps. Koohii #2 Remember in the Wizard of Oz when the tin man wished for a heart and the wizard gave him that dinky little clock instead? wrench Details Story Dictionary 捻 wrench Heisig's This kanji does not refer to the tool but to the act of twisting. Its elements: fingers . . . wish. Koohii #1 Ever try WRENCHING a bolt with just your FINGERS? Trust me, you´ll WISH you had a wrench for WRENCHING to save your FINGERS. Koohii #2 I have an unfortunate habit of wrenching off other people’s fingers when I pull a wishbone with them. Primitives wrenching, finger, fingers, wish, wishbone, now, clock, heart 捻子(ねじ): screw, helix, spiral 捻じれる(ねじれる): to twist, to wrench, to screw 捻る(ひねる): turn (a switch) on or off, twist, puzzle over Kunyomi: ね.じる、ねじ.る、ひね.くる、ひね.る Onyomi: ネン、ジョウ Lesson: 41 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: Compounds:	wrench 捻 画数11 1716 Details Story Dictionary 捻 wrench Heisig's This kanji does not refer to the tool but to the act of twisting. "harp Details Story Dictionary 琴 harp Heisig's A pair of jewels . . . clock. Koohii #1 Two kings were fighting over a beautiful koto (harp). shade Details Story Dictionary 陰 shade Heisig's Just as the sunshine (Frame 1397) represents the masculine principle in nature (Yang), the shade stands for the feminine principle (Yin). Its elements are: pinnacle . . . clock . . . rising cloud. Koohii #1 There are three types of shade: 1. natural (a high pinnacle), 2. man-made buildings (a clock tower), 3. meteorological (a cloud). Koohii #2 Frosty the snowman is running around the pinnacle, staying in the shade. As he looks at his clock to see how much longer he can last, small clouds rise (steam) from his body. Nooo, Frosty! Primitives shade, pinnacle, parthenon, acropolis, now, clock, rising cloud, two, elbow, wall 陰気(いんき): gloom, melancholy 日陰(ひかげ): shadow 陰(かげ): shade, shadow, other side Kunyomi: かげ、かげ.る Onyomi: イン Lesson: 41 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 陰 (かげ), 陰る (かげ.る)	shade 陰 画数11 1718 Details Story Dictionary 陰 shade Heisig's Just as the sunshine (Frame 1397) represents the masculine principle in nature (Yang), the shade stands for the feminine principle (Yin). beforehand Details Story Dictionary 予 beforehand My Story Beforehand, Your *MA* *nailed* me hard Koohii #1 Beforehand, this was a halberd but I cut it short so it could be for hand to hand combat. Koohii #2 Your halberd doesn´t have a handguard? You should have thought of that beforehand (i.e., before you were missing your hand). "preface Details Story Dictionary 序 preface Heisig's Cave . . . beforehand. Koohii #1 The preface to all human history was written beforehand in caves. Koohii #2 Rename the ""beforehand"" part to be glove (because you have to wear gloves beforehand if you want to wield the halberd, which is why this primitive is an incomplete halberd). The story: a winter morning. A textbook author is holed up in his tiny office, a veritable cave. He wants to start his masterpiece textbook by first writing the preface. But he can´t get started. He sits and stares at empty paper until evening. It gets cold and he puts on gloves, shivering, but still unable to start his preface. Primitives preface, cave, beforehand 秩序(ちつじょ): order, regularity, system, method 順序(じゅんじょ): order, sequence, procedure Kunyomi: つい.で、ついで Onyomi: ジョ Lesson: 41 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"	"preface 序 画数7 1720 Details Story Dictionary 序 preface Heisig's Cave . . . beforehand. plains Details Story Dictionary 野 plains Heisig's This character refers to rustic life and rustic fields primarily, and from there gets derived meanings. Its elements: computer. . beforehand. Koohii #1 These days we all work in front of computers. Beforehand we all worked out in the fields, in the plains. Koohii #2 The plains are a challenging place to get any work done. Be sure you recharge your computer´s battery beforehand, or you won´t get anything done. concurrently Details Story Dictionary 兼 concurrently My Story The *horny one* and his *fork* are concurrently flexing their トs backwards and forwards Koohii #1 Our ninja hero, disguised as a gardener with a rake, is suddenly attacked from both left and right concurrently by bulls with animal horns. Our hero lets out a blood-curdling scream and tears his rake handle vertically in half, so he now has two wooden staffs (split rake handle) to fight with. He grips each staff (left side and right side) and rams it into the horns of the charging bulls. The force of each charging bull causes the tips of each staff to split again (split bottom of each rake handle). Koohii #2 You decide to take the bull by the horns and do both chores concurrently, grabbing your double-handled rake before attempting to clean up both your´s and your neighbours´ garden. But unfortunately, it´s not long until your rake splits in two. Primitives concurrently, animal horns, rake, stick, stick2 兼ねて(かねて): simultaneously 気兼ね(きがね): hesitance, diffidence, feeling constraint, fear of troubling someone, having scruples about doing something 兼用(けんよう): multi-use, combined use, combination, serving two purposes 兼業(けんぎょう): side line, second business 兼ねる(かねる): hold (position), serve, be unable, be beyond one´s ability, cannot, hesitate to, combine with, use with, be impatient Kunyomi: か.ねる、-か.ねる Onyomi: ケン Lesson: 41 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 兼ねる (か.ねる)	concurrently 兼 画数10 1723 Details Story Dictionary 兼 concurrently My Story The *horny one* and his *fork* are concurrently flexing their トs backwards and forwards Koohii #1 Our ninja hero, disguised as a gardener with a rake, is suddenly attacked from both left and right concurrently by bulls with animal horns. sickle Details Story Dictionary 鎌 sickle Heisig's Metal . . . concurrently. Koohii #1 This is a special sickle with metal blades on both sides. It can cut many things concurrently! Koohii #2 The gold sickle of the USSR flag represents both leaders and workers laboring concurrently. Primitives sickle, metal, gold, concurrently, animal horns, rake Kunyomi: かま Onyomi: レン、ケン Lesson: 41 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 鎌 (かま)	sickle 鎌 画数18 1725 Details Story Dictionary 鎌 sickle Heisig's Metal . . . concurrently. self-effacing Details Story Dictionary 謙 self-effacing Heisig's Words . . . concurrently. Koohii #1 When you are self-effacing you use words to concurrently bring yourself down and make yourself look better. Koohii #2 Though the man´s words were self-effacing, his actions concurrently made it clear that his modesty was false. Primitives self-effacing, say, words, keitai, mouth, concurrently, animal horns, rake 謙る(へりくだる): to deprecate oneself and praise the listener 謙虚(けんきょ): modesty, humility 謙遜(けんそん): humble, humility, modesty Kunyomi: Onyomi: ケン Lesson: 41 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	self-effacing 謙 画数17 1726 Details Story Dictionary 謙 self-effacing Heisig's Words . . . concurrently. Koohii #1 Stores don´t want you to know it, but if you find the secret cave, they run bargains there concurrently to their regular prices. west Details Story Dictionary 西 west Heisig's To our way of counting directions, the west always comes fourth. So it is convenient to find the character for four in this kanji. But since we want only one of the four directions, the west adds the one at the top and sucks the human legs a bit out of their mouth in the process. * As a primitive, the meaning of west can be expanded to refer to the Old West of cowboy-movie fame, just as the meaning of the character for east was expanded into the East. Note, however, that in its primitive form the legs are straightened out and reach down to the bottom of the mouth. Hence, we get the shape ⻃. With the exception of one kanji, given in the following frame, this element always appears at the top of its relative primitives. Koohii #1 The old west represented by a completely empty whiskey bottle (compare sign of the bird (#1427) whiskey bottle about one third full). Koohii #2 Note: this kanji is also used to denote Spain. Primitives west, one, four 西日(にしび): westering sun 関西(かんさい): Kansai (SW half of Japan, including Osaka) 西暦(せいれき): Christian Era, Anno Domini (A.D.) 東西(とうざい): East and West, Orient and Occident, whole country, Your attention, please! 西洋(せいよう): West, Western countries 西(にし): west Kunyomi: にし Onyomi: セイ、サイ、ス Lesson: 41 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 5 Compounds: 西暦 (せいれき), 西部 (せいぶ), 北西 (ほくせい), 西 (にし)	west 西 画数6 1728 Details Story Dictionary 西 west Heisig's To our way of counting directions, the west always comes fourth. So it is convenient to find the character for four in this kanji. But since we want only one of the four directions, the west adds the one at the top and sucks the human legs a bit out of their mouth in the process. * As a primitive, the meaning of west can be expanded to refer to the Old West of cowboy-movie fame, just as the meaning of the character for east was expanded into the East. Note, however, that in its primitive form the legs are straightened out and reach down to the bottom of the mouth. Hence, we get the shape ⻃. With the exception of one kanji, given in the following frame, this element always appears at the top of its relative primitives. Koohii #1 The old west represented by a completely empty whiskey bottle (compare sign of the bird (#1427) whiskey bottle about one third full). Koohii #2 Note: this kanji is also used to denote Spain. Primitives west, one, four 西日(にしび): westering sun 関西(かんさい): Kansai (SW half of Japan, including Osaka) 西暦(せいれき): Christian Era, Anno Domini (A.D.) 東西(とうざい): East and West, Orient and Occident, whole country, Your attention, please! 西洋(せいよう): West, Western countries 西(にし): west Kunyomi: にし Onyomi: セイ、サイ、ス Lesson: 41 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 5 Compounds: 西暦 (せいれき), 西部 (せいぶ), 北西 (ほくせい), 西 (にし)
"value Details Story Dictionary 価 value Heisig's Person . . . Old West. Koohii #1 In the West, people have no value. Only money is important. Koohii #2 What might it mean for a person in the old west to be of value? Their face is on a ""Wanted!"" poster, of course. Imagine the reward... Primitives value, person, old west 価格(かかく): price, value, cost 価値(かち): value, worth, merit 高価(こうか): high price 定価(ていか): established price 評価(ひょうか): valuation, estimation, assessment, evaluation 物価(ぶっか): prices of commodities, prices (in general), cost-of-living Kunyomi: あたい Onyomi: カ、ケ Lesson: 41 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 価 (あたい)"	"value 価 画数8 1729 Details Story Dictionary 価 value Heisig's Person . . . need Details Story Dictionary 要 need My Story The Old West needed -- really, really needed- more women. Koohii #1 (ヨウ) When Clint needs a woman, he likes to be on top. Koohii #2 In some movie with the theme of the Old West, the population of a town finds themselve in dire need of women, after all of the town´s womens became crazy and started gunshooting and participating in duels and such. Primitives need, old west, woman 要因(よういん): primary factor, main cause 要する(ようする): to demand, to require, to take 要請(ようせい): claim, demand, request, application 要望(ようぼう): demand for, request 重要(じゅうよう): important, momentous, essential, principal, major 主要(しゅよう): chief, main, principal, major 需要(じゅよう): demand, request 要求(ようきゅう): request, demand, requisition 要旨(ようし): gist, essentials, summary, fundamentals 要するに(ようするに): in a word, after all, the point is ..., in short ... 要素(ようそ): element 要点(ようてん): gist, main point 要領(ようりょう): point, gist, essentials, outline 必要(ひつよう): necessary 要る(いる): need Kunyomi: い.る Onyomi: ヨウ Lesson: 41 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 要る (い.る)	need 要 画数9 1730 Details Story Dictionary 要 need My Story The Old West needed -- really, really needed- more women. "loins Details Story Dictionary 腰 loins Heisig's Part of the body . . . need. Koohii #1 If you want to get closer to the actual meaning, then I think that 腰(こし) is more like the hips or the small of the back. After being sat down in the office too long, people often say 腰がいたい！It´s the part of the body that needs massaging. Koohii #2 To the puritans reading this site - please stop reporting stories that have anything to do with sex! Although (as wrightak said) this kanji really refers to the hips, Heisig clearly chose the keyword ´loins´ because it was anatomically close enough, and the primitives lent themselves to an easy-to-remember story. Just because you´re all sexually repressed doesn´t mean other people won´t benefit from a story such as ""the part of the body people need more than any other are the loins"". Primitives loins, moon, month, flesh, part of the body, need, old west, woman 腰(こし): hip 腰掛け(こしかけ): seat, bench 腰掛ける(こしかける): sit (down) Kunyomi: こし Onyomi: ヨウ Lesson: 41 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 腰 (こし)"	"loins 腰 画数13 1731 Details Story Dictionary 腰 loins Heisig's Part of the body . . . need. Koohii #1 If you want to get closer to the actual meaning, then I think that 腰(こし) is more like the hips or the small of the back. After being sat down in the office too long, people often say 腰がいたい！It´s the part of the body that needs massaging. Koohii #2 To the puritans reading this site - please stop reporting stories that have anything to do with sex! Although (as wrightak said) this kanji really refers to the hips, Heisig clearly chose the keyword ´loins´ because it was anatomically close enough, and the primitives lent themselves to an easy-to-remember story. Just because you´re all sexually repressed doesn´t mean other people won´t benefit from a story such as ""the part of the body people need more than any other are the loins"". Primitives loins, moon, month, flesh, part of the body, need, old west, woman 腰(こし): hip 腰掛け(こしかけ): seat, bench 腰掛ける(こしかける): sit (down) Kunyomi: こし Onyomi: ヨウ Lesson: 41 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 腰 (こし)"
ballot Details Story Dictionary 票 ballot Heisig's Old West . . . altar. Koohii #1 In the Old West there were no ballot boxes. Afraid of fraud and fighting among the gunslingers, the ballots were posted into a slot in the top of the local church altar instead. They may have been rough, but the cowboys wouldn´t fight in the church. Koohii #2 In western political elections (US), peoples ballots will often depend on religion and at which altar the prospective president prays. Primitives ballot, old west, altar, show, two, small 票(ひょう): label, ballot, ticket, sign 投票(とうひょう): voting, poll Kunyomi: Onyomi: ヒョウ Lesson: 41 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	ballot 票 画数11 1732 Details Story Dictionary 票 ballot Heisig's Old West . . . altar. Koohii #2 The political fanatic stole all the ballots and dumped them in the stream. He calmly watched them drift away as the cops came to a screech behind him. "signpost Details Story Dictionary 標 signpost Heisig's Tree . . . ballot. Koohii #1 Trees were frequenly used as signposts in those days, indicating where one had to go to cast their ballots. Koohii #2 Large wooden signposts are planted on peoples lawns, with the faces of their representatives all saying: ""Vote [1] Me!"" for the upcoming ballot. shudder Details Story Dictionary 慄 shudder Heisig's State of mind . . . chestnut. Koohii #1 Shudder. If chestnut trees were sentient, shudder would be their state of mind as the tree shaker approaches. Note: Tree shakers are used commercially to harvest nuts and cider apples. A tree shaker makes a tree shudder causing all the ripe chestnuts to fall. Koohii #2 shudder: You’re in the state of mind of shuddering with fear when the chestnut tree is falling over towards you. Kunyomi: おそ.れる、 おのの.く、 ふる.える Onyomi: リツ Lesson: 41 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: Compounds:	shudder 慄 画数13 1736 Details Story Dictionary 慄 shudder Heisig's State of mind . . . chestnut. Koohii #1 Shudder. A tree shaker makes a tree shudder causing all the ripe chestnuts to fall. Koohii #2 shudder: You’re in the state of mind of shuddering with fear when the chestnut tree is falling over towards you. transition Details Story Dictionary 遷 transition Heisig's West . . . St. Bernard dog . . . snake . . . road. Koohii #1 Since the days of the Old West, traveling has transitioned from trying not to step on big snakes to driving on big roads. Koohii #2 The west has gone through quite a transition, gone are the days when dogs and snakes roamed the desert, it´s all roads and casinos now. Primitives transition, old west, large, St. Bernard, snake, self, road 変遷(へんせん): change, transition, vicissitudes Kunyomi: うつ.る、うつ.す、みやこがえ Onyomi: セン Lesson: 41 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	transition 遷 画数15 1737 Details Story Dictionary 遷 transition Heisig's West . . . capsize Details Story Dictionary 覆 capsize Heisig's West . . . restore. Koohii #1 The U.S.S. Old West has capsized, and all the cowboys on board are trying to restore her upright. Koohii #2 Remember Oregon Trail? Remember how you had to float your wagon across rivers to get to the Old West? Well, sometimes that wagon capsizes. Once that happens you´d better quickly head to the nearest town to restore. Primitives capsize, old west, restore, Nelson, column, going, line, fold back, double back, reclining, lying down, sun, day, walking legs 覆す(くつがえす): to overturn, to upset, to overthrow, to undermine 覆面(ふくめん): mask, veil, disguise 覆う(おおう): cover, hide, conceal, wrap, disguise Kunyomi: おお.う、くつがえ.す、くつがえ.る Onyomi: フク Lesson: 41 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 覆う (おお.う), 覆す (くつがえ.す), 覆る (くつがえ.る)	capsize 覆 画数18 1738 Details Story Dictionary 覆 capsize Heisig's West . . . restore. "smoke Details Story Dictionary 煙 smoke Heisig's Hearth . . . Old West . . . ground. Koohii #1 In the Old West, they used to light fires in the ground to make smoke signals. Koohii #2 Should be easy. SMOKE brings to mind ""Where there´s SMOKE, there´s FIRE"". So, the FIRE in the OLD WEST can tell people we´re you´re at, so put out the FIRE with SOIL to keep the SMOKE to a minimum. Primitives smoke, hearth fire, old west, soil, dirt, ground 煙たい(けむたい): smoky, feeling awkward 煙る(けむる): to smoke (e.g. fire) 煙草(たばこ): (pt:) (n) (uk) tobacco (pt: tabaco), cigarettes 煙突(えんとつ): chimney 禁煙(きんえん): No Smoking! 煙い(けむい): smoky 煙(けむり): smoke, fumes Kunyomi: けむ.る、けむり、けむ.い Onyomi: エン Lesson: 41 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 煙い (けむ.い), 煙る (けむ.る), 煙 (けむり)"	"smoke 煙 画数13 1739 Details Story Dictionary 煙 smoke Heisig's Hearth . . . So, the FIRE in the OLD WEST can tell people we´re you´re at, so put out the FIRE with SOIL to keep the SMOKE to a minimum. "south Details Story Dictionary 南 south Heisig's Belt . . . happiness. Note how the belt runs through the middle of happiness. Koohii #1 South of my belt leads to happiness. Koohii #2 In the south (Southern Alabama, Southern Africa, picture any south, but choose one and stick with it) ""they measure happyness by the belt"". If someone has a larger belly (and a longer belt), it is believed they are well fed and thus are happy. Primitives south, ten, needle, belt, happiness, ten, needle, stand up, vase, ten2, needle2 南(なん): south 南極(なんきょく): south pole, Antarctic 南米(なんべい): South America 南北(なんぼく): south and north 南(みなみ): South, proceeding south Kunyomi: みなみ Onyomi: ナン、ナ Lesson: 41 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 5 Compounds: 南北 (なんぼく), 南端 (なんたん), 指南 (しなん), 南 (みなみ)"	"south 南 画数9 1740 Details Story Dictionary 南 south Heisig's Belt . . . happiness. Note how the belt runs through the middle of happiness. Koohii #1 South of my belt leads to happiness. Koohii #2 In the south (Southern Alabama, Southern Africa, picture any south, but choose one and stick with it) ""they measure happyness by the belt"". If someone has a larger belly (and a longer belt), it is believed they are well fed and thus are happy. Primitives south, ten, needle, belt, happiness, ten, needle, stand up, vase, ten2, needle2 南(なん): south 南極(なんきょく): south pole, Antarctic 南米(なんべい): South America 南北(なんぼく): south and north 南(みなみ): South, proceeding south Kunyomi: みなみ Onyomi: ナン、ナ Lesson: 41 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 5 Compounds: 南北 (なんぼく), 南端 (なんたん), 指南 (しなん), 南 (みなみ)"
camphor tree Details Story Dictionary 楠 camphor tree Heisig's Tree . . . south. Koohii #1 We traveled to southern Japan just to see a camphor tree. It´s what we came for. "gates Details Story Dictionary 門 gates Heisig's The pictograph of two swinging gates is so clear in this kanji that only its stroke order needs to be memorized. In case you should have any trouble, though, you might doodle with the shapes on a piece of paper, taking care to note the difference in the stroke order of the two facing doors. The gates usually serve as an enclosure, and are written BEFORE whatever it is they enclose. * As a primitive, we shall continue to give it the meaning of gates, but recommend the image of swinging doors (like the kind once common at entrances to saloons) to distinguish it from the primitive for door. Koohii #1 Heisig´s stroke order in the 4th edition (and earlier) is wrong, so be careful -- first is the left-most vertical stroke, then draw the rest of the ""sun"" attachment as you would normally. In fact, if you just wrote it out as two suns with elongated sides, you´ll get the stroke order exactly correct. Koohii #2 The gates to Hell. guarded by Cerebus or ... Bill Gates? Primitives gates 門(かど): gate 正門(せいもん): main gate, main entrance 部門(ぶもん): class, group, category, department, field, branch 門(もん): gate Kunyomi: かど、と Onyomi: モン Lesson: 42 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 門 (かど)"	"gates 門 画数8 1743 Details Story Dictionary 門 gates Heisig's The pictograph of two swinging gates is so clear in this kanji that only its stroke order needs to be memorized. review Details Story Dictionary 閲 review Heisig's Gates . . . devil. Keep the connotation of this key word distinct from those of inspection (Frame 1174), revise (Frame 362), and perusal (Frame 919). Koohii #1 A little devil at the gates of hell reviews your record to see if you´re evil enough to get in. Koohii #2 As I was reviewing for my exam at a quiet saloon, the devil popped out of nowhere and offered to make sure I pass. But I told him no way, since that´s cheating. Besides, I´m just reviewing things I already know. I won´t fail. But he kept insisting, so I kicked him and sent him crashing through the entrance gates. Primitives review, gates, devil, horns, elder brother, teenager, mouth, human legs 閲覧(えつらん): inspection, reading Kunyomi: けみ.する Onyomi: エツ Lesson: 42 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	review 閲 画数15 1745 Details Story Dictionary 閲 review Heisig's Gates . . . devil. interval Details Story Dictionary 間 interval Heisig's Gates . . . sun/day. This interval applies to time and space alike, but the latter is better for creating an image. Koohii #1 The interval between star systems (suns) was too large, so the stargates were created to travel between them. Koohii #2 We open the gates at regular intervals to let a bit of sun in. Primitives interval, gates, sun, day 間柄(あいだがら): relation(ship) 合間(あいま): interval 空間(あきま): vacancy, room for rent or lease 何時の間にか(いつのまにか): before one knows, unnoticed, unawares 区間(くかん): section (of track etc) この間(このあいだ): the other day, lately, recently 週間(しゅうかん): week, weekly 茶の間(ちゃのま): living room (Japanese style) 昼間(ちゅうかん): daytime, during the day 束の間(つかのま): moment, brief time, brief, transient 間違う(まちがう): to make a mistake, to be incorrect, to be mistaken 間に合う(まにあう): to be in time (for) 間々(まま): occasionally, frequently 間もなく(まもなく): soon, before long, in a short time 間(あいだ): space, interval 居間(いま): living room (Western style) 貸間(かしま): room to let 間隔(かんかく): space, interval 間接(かんせつ): indirectness 期間(きかん): period, term 客間(きゃくま): parlor, guest room 時間割(じかんわり): timetable, schedule 瞬間(しゅんかん): moment, second, instant 隙間(すきま): crevice, crack, gap, opening 世間(せけん): world, society 中間(ちゅうかん): middle, midway, interim 手間(てま): time, labour 床の間(とこのま): alcove 仲間(なかま): company, fellow, colleague, associate, comrade, mate, group, circle of friends, partner 人間(にんげん): human being, man, person 年間(ねんかん): year (interval of time) 間(ま): space, room, time, pause 間違い(まちがい): mistake 民間(みんかん): private, civilian, civil, popular, folk, unofficial 夜間(やかん): at night, nighttime 昼間(ひるま): daytime, during the daytime 間違える(まちがえる): make a mistake 時間(じかん): time Kunyomi: あいだ、ま、あい Onyomi: カン、ケン Lesson: 42 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 5 Compounds: 間隔 (かんかく), 中間 (ちゅうかん), 時間 (じかん), 間 (あいだ), 間 (ま)	interval 間 画数12 1747 Details Story Dictionary 間 interval Heisig's Gates . . . sun/day. simplicity Details Story Dictionary 簡 simplicity Heisig's Bamboo . . . interval. Koohii #1 [simplicity; brevity] The ししおどし is a bamboo device for scaring birds from the gates of your garden by clacking against a stone at regular intervals. Its design is simplicity itself. (Inspired by PepeSeco). Koohii #2 The simplicity of bamboo plant is in all its joints being at equal intervals. Koohii #1 Press your ear to the gates and see if you can hear what is going on inside. Koohii #2 To distinguish from listen, you hear someone at the door (gate). wet Details Story Dictionary 潤 wet Heisig's Water . . . gates . . . king. Koohii #1 Forgetting about the moat, the king stepped out of his gate and landed in the water. Needless to say he got wet. Koohii #2 (I had the same idea as Dingomick) I imagine some prankster who put a bucket full of water on top of the huge gates, so that it would fall on the king as he came through them. See the king now, between the gates, all wet, dripping drops of water. fight Details Story Dictionary 闘 fight Heisig's Gates . . . table . . . glue. Do not confuse with contend (Frame 1238). Koohii #1 During the saloon brawl, one guy got glued to a table and was tossed out through the saloon gates. But he really wanted to fight, so he ran back through those gates (with the table still glued to his back) only to be tossed out again. Imagine him repeatedly running in and being tossed back out. Koohii #2 Food fight! Look, beans are stuck to the gates like glue. Primitives fight, gates, beans, table, one, mouth, glue 戦闘(せんとう): battle, fight, combat 奮闘(ふんとう): hard struggle, strenuous effort Kunyomi: たたか.う、あらそ.う Onyomi: トウ Lesson: 42 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 闘う (たたか.う)	fight 闘 画数18 1757 Details Story Dictionary 闘 fight Heisig's Gates . . . table . . . glue. godown Details Story Dictionary 倉 godown Heisig's The single gate is used here not in order to represent one gate, but many of them, indeed a meeting of gates. Add mouth (as an entrance here) and you end up with godown. That should help keep this character distinct from warehouse (Frame 633). Koohii #1 A godown is a dockside warehouse. This is actually a meeting of large doors and mouths. The stroke order is the same as door, not gates, just with the top stroke moved down into the now larger door. Koohii #2 Note: this is not gate but actually a variation of door and is written as such, with the vertical stroke last not first. Primitives godown, meeting, single gate, umbrella, stable door, mouth 倉庫(そうこ): storehouse, warehouse Kunyomi: くら Onyomi: ソウ Lesson: 42 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 倉 (くら)	godown 倉 画数10 1758 Details Story Dictionary 倉 godown Heisig's The single gate is used here not in order to represent one gate, but many of them, indeed a meeting of gates. This is actually a meeting of large doors and mouths. The stroke order is the same as door, not gates, just with the top stroke moved down into the now larger door. Koohii #2 Note: this is not gate but actually a variation of door and is written as such, with the vertical stroke last not first. Primitives godown, meeting, single gate, umbrella, stable door, mouth 倉庫(そうこ): storehouse, warehouse Kunyomi: くら Onyomi: ソウ Lesson: 42 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 倉 (くら)

"un- Details Story Dictionary 非 un- Heisig's This key word, a negating prefix, is a doodle of a heavy iron pole with bars extending in both directions, to create the picture of a jail cell. From there to ""un-"" is but a short step. * As a primitive, we shall draw on the explanation above for the meaning of jail cell. Koohii #1 This looks like a pictogram of 3 fingers from each hand trying to open up a crack in a wall. That´s an un-believable way to escape from prison OR the UN- have a prison in the Hague. Koohii #2 People in the jail cell are un-friendly, un-comely, and un-cooperative. Primitives un-, jail cell, prison bars 是非とも(ぜひとも): by all means (with sense of not taking ""no"" for an answer) 非(ひ): faulty-, non- 非行(ひこう): delinquency, misconduct 非難(ひなん): blame, attack, criticism 是非(ぜひ): certainly, without fail 非常(ひじょう): emergency, extraordinary, unusual 非常に(ひじょうに): very, greatly Kunyomi: あら.ず Onyomi: ヒ Lesson: 42 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds:"	"un- 非 画数8 1760 Details Story Dictionary 非 un- Heisig's This key word, a negating prefix, is a doodle of a heavy iron pole with bars extending in both directions, to create the picture of a jail cell. Koohii #1 This looks like a pictogram of 3 fingers from each hand trying to open up a crack in a wall. That´s an un-believable way to escape from prison OR the UN- have a prison in the Hague. Koohii #2 People in the jail cell are un-friendly, un-comely, and un-cooperative. repudiate Details Story Dictionary 排 repudiate Heisig's Fingers . . . jail cell. Koohii #1 When ordered to go to the jail cell, the defendant gave the judge the finger and said he repudiated all that the legal system stood for if they were going to send an innocent man like him to jail. Koohii #2 He reached his fingers through the bars of his jail cell, trying to touch his beloved. But she repudiated him and left. sad Details Story Dictionary 悲 sad Heisig's Jail cell . . . heart. Koohii #1 Saddness is like having your heart captured and jailed because of some sad or terrible event, etc. Here the sad heart waits for someone to come and un-lock their jail cell and set them free again. Koohii #2 Stuck in a jail cell with his heart crying out to see his family again, the prisoner has never felt so sad. "front door Details Story Dictionary 扉 front door Heisig's Door . . . jail cell. Koohii #1 The only way out of a jail cell is to serve your time and walk out the front door. There are no other doors. Koohii #2 An old man serving a very long jail sentence painted a life-like door at the back of his jail cell, hlafway open, with the blue sky, clouds, etc, as some kind of symbol of freedom. Every time the prison officers come to take him they ask him to come to the door. The old man with a grin always answers ""Which door?"", looking at his painted door with a grin. And the prison officer always answer, sighing - ""The front door !"". Primitives front door, door, one, ceiling, flag, un-, jail cell, prison bars 扉(とびら): door, opening Kunyomi: とびら Onyomi: ヒ Lesson: 42 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 扉 (とびら)"	"front door 扉 画数12 1766 Details Story Dictionary 扉 front door Heisig's Door . . . jail cell. "decide Details Story Dictionary 決 decide Heisig's The etymology of decide (de-cidere = cut off) will help here; the elements are: water . . . guillotine. Koohii #1 Decide! ""Decide?! Death by drowning in polluted water or death by guillotine. How can I decide?"" I asked. Koohii #2 To decide if someone is a witch or not first dunk them in water. If they don´t drown they are a witch and can be sent to the guillotine. Primitives decide, water, water droplets, water pistol, guillotine, key, St. Bernard 議決(ぎけつ): resolution, decision, vote 決まり悪い(きまりわるい): feeling awkward, being ashamed 決意(けつい): decision, determination 決議(けつぎ): resolution, vote, decision 決行(けっこう): doing (with resolve), carrying out (i.e. a plan) 決算(けっさん): balance sheet, settlement of accounts 決勝(けっしょう): decision of a contest, finals (in sports) 決断(けつだん): decision, determination 採決(さいけつ): vote, roll call 対決(たいけつ): confrontation, showdown 多数決(たすうけつ): majority rule 判決(はんけつ): judicial decision, judgement, sentence, decree 否決(ひけつ): rejection, negation, voting down 解決(かいけつ): settlement, solution, resolution 可決(かけつ): approval, adoption (e.g. motion, bill), passage 決まり(きまり): settlement, conclusion, regulation, rule, custom 決心(けっしん): determination, resolution 決定(けってい): decision, determination 決まる(きまる): be decided 決める(きめる): decide 決して(けっして): definitely, by no means, not at all Kunyomi: き.める、-ぎ.め、き.まる、さ.く Onyomi: ケツ Lesson: 42 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 決まる (き.まる), 決める (き.める)"	"decide 決 画数7 1770 Details Story Dictionary 決 decide Heisig's The etymology of decide (de-cidere = cut off) will help here; the elements are: water . . . guillotine. Koohii #1 Decide! ""Decide?! Death by drowning in polluted water or death by guillotine. How can I decide?"" I asked. Koohii #2 To decide if someone is a witch or not first dunk them in water. If they don´t drown they are a witch and can be sent to the guillotine. Primitives decide, water, water droplets, water pistol, guillotine, key, St. Bernard 議決(ぎけつ): resolution, decision, vote 決まり悪い(きまりわるい): feeling awkward, being ashamed 決意(けつい): decision, determination 決議(けつぎ): resolution, vote, decision 決行(けっこう): doing (with resolve), carrying out (i.e. a plan) 決算(けっさん): balance sheet, settlement of accounts 決勝(けっしょう): decision of a contest, finals (in sports) 決断(けつだん): decision, determination 採決(さいけつ): vote, roll call 対決(たいけつ): confrontation, showdown 多数決(たすうけつ): majority rule 判決(はんけつ): judicial decision, judgement, sentence, decree 否決(ひけつ): rejection, negation, voting down 解決(かいけつ): settlement, solution, resolution 可決(かけつ): approval, adoption (e.g. motion, bill), passage 決まり(きまり): settlement, conclusion, regulation, rule, custom 決心(けっしん): determination, resolution 決定(けってい): decision, determination 決まる(きまる): be decided 決める(きめる): decide 決して(けっして): definitely, by no means, not at all Kunyomi: き.める、-ぎ.め、き.まる、さ.く Onyomi: ケツ Lesson: 42 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 決まる (き.まる), 決める (き.める)"

"admirable Details Story Dictionary 偉 admirable Heisig's Person . . . locket. Koohii #1 LOCKETs often carry inside them a picture of a PERSON we find ADMIRABLE. Koohii #2 For locket: The locket (key dangling from something, the vertical stroke) opens like a mouth, but you need a jeweler´s monocle to make out the pictures within. ----- Dracula survives a staking attempt when the locket with Mina´s admirable picture deflects the blow. ""It was an admirable attempt,"" he admits as he sucks his attacker´s blood. Primitives admirable, person, locket, stick, key, mouth, monocle, sunglasses with one lens missing 偉大(いだい): greatness 偉い(えらい): great, celebrated, eminent, terrible, awful, famous, remarkable, excellent Kunyomi: えら.い Onyomi: イ Lesson: 42 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 偉い (えら.い)"	"admirable 偉 画数12 1772 Details Story Dictionary 偉 admirable Heisig's Person . . . locket. "difference Details Story Dictionary 違 difference My Story [Orgy (Five + Mouth + Fuck) + Motion] At *orgies*, the difference between me and you is that I use lots of *motion* Koohii #1 You lose your precious locket on the road to somewhere. You ask people if they´ve seen it, but no luck. ""Just buy another one,"" someone says. ""I mean, what´s the difference?"" Then of course you say ""Well, it makes a huge difference!! Since it has sentimental value, I don´t want a different one! "" Then of course they understand. Koohii #2 An odd version of The Road Less Traveled: ""I found a locket in the road, and that has made all the difference."". Primitives difference, locket, stick, key, mouth, monocle, sunglasses with one lens missing, road 行き違い(いきちがい): misunderstanding, estrangement, disagreement, crossing without meeting, going astray 食い違う(くいちがう): to cross each other, to run counter to, to differ, to clash, to go awry 擦れ違い(すれちがい): chance encounter すれ違う(すれちがう): to pass by one another, to disagree, to miss each other 違える(ちがえる): to change 間違う(まちがう): to make a mistake, to be incorrect, to be mistaken 違反(いはん): violation (of law), transgression 勘違い(かんちがい): misunderstanding, wrong guess 相違(そうい): difference, discrepancy, variation 違い(ちがい): difference, discrepancy 違いない(ちがいない): sure, no mistaking it, for certain 間違い(まちがい): mistake 間違える(まちがえる): make a mistake 違う(ちがう): differ (from) Kunyomi: ちが.う、ちが.い、ちが.える、-ちが.える、たが.う、たが.える Onyomi: イ Lesson: 42 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 違う (ちが.う), 違える (ちが.える)"	"difference 違 画数13 1773 Details Story Dictionary 違 difference My Story [Orgy (Five + Mouth + Fuck) + Motion] At *orgies*, the difference between me and you is that I use lots of *motion* Koohii #1 You lose your precious locket on the road to somewhere. "horizontal Details Story Dictionary 緯 horizontal Heisig's Thread . . . locket. Koohii #1 The thread that holds the locket around my neck is choker-length so it stays horizontal. Koohii #2 Hint : this kanji also means ""latitude"", which are the horizontal lines on a globe. Do you remember James Heisig's story for frame 175 ""black ink"" ? Here a cartographer on a ship, is using his ""thread locket"" to mark horizontal lines on a map. He pulls a chalked thread from the locket, and snaps it to mark horizontal lines. Imagine the ""thread-locket"" in the shape of a globe, filled with dark powder and a little bobbin of thread. "Korea Details Story Dictionary 韓 Korea Heisig's As with Italy (Frame 1245) and Africa (Frame 1391), this character simply abbreviates the full name of Korea. Its elements: mist . . . locket. Koohii #1 There´s a young Korean male actor, Yon-sama, famous amongst middle-aged Japanese women. Extremely famous. Read about his affect on Japan/Korean relations on Everything2.com. In any case, women just flipped over this guy, traveled to Korea to see his home, started taking Korean language classes, etc. So, imagine here the misty eyes of the Japanese women as they clutch their lockets with Yon-sama´s picture inside watching his Korean romantic mini series called ""Winter Sonata"". Koohii #2 This character represents the flag of South Korea: a locket (circular taegeuk) in the middle of the mist (white background). http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_South_Korea. Primitives korea, mist, ten, needle, early, sun, day, locket, stick, key, mouth, monocle, sunglasses with one lens missing, ten2, needle2 Kunyomi: から、いげた Onyomi: カン Lesson: 42 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: Compounds:"	"Korea 韓 画数18 1776 Details Story Dictionary 韓 Korea Heisig's As with Italy (Frame 1245) and Africa (Frame 1391), this character simply abbreviates the full name of Korea. dry Details Story Dictionary 干 dry Heisig's It is best to see this kanji as a pictograph of a revolving circular clothesline (viewed from the side). Spin it around quickly in your mind's eye to give it the connotation of to dry. * The primitive meaning is clothesline. Koohii #1 Dry one item in ten minutes on the clothesline. Koohii #2 Note: the book shows the strokes for potato rather than dry...dry does not have the hook at the end. Primitives dry, clothesline 梅干(うめぼし): dried plum 干渉(かんしょう): interference, intervention 若干(じゃっかん): some, few, number of 干し物(ほしもの): dried washing (clothes) 干す(ほす): to air, dry, desiccate, drain (off), drink up Kunyomi: ほ.す、ほ.し-、-ぼ.し、ひ.る Onyomi: カン Lesson: 43 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 干る (ひ.る), 干す (ほ.す)	dry 干 画数3 1777 Details Story Dictionary 干 dry Heisig's It is best to see this kanji as a pictograph of a revolving circular clothesline (viewed from the side). Koohii #1 Well you all know that the liver is the part of the body that would be quite grateful if you led a dry lifestyle (i.e. no alcohol). Koohii #2 The slaughterhouse prefers to ship dried liver to the supermarkets (can you imagine boxes soaked in blood on the truck that delivers them?). Imagine them lifting the slabs of flesh and hanging them on the clothesline to dry. publish Details Story Dictionary 刊 publish Heisig's Dry . . . saber. Koohii #1 The newspaper pages are hung on the clotheseline to dry and then cut down with a sabre to be published. Koohii #2 The newspaper pages are hung on the clotheseline to dry. This gives the government a chance to censor the news: they cut up unwanted stories with a sabre. Therefore, only state-approved stories are published. Primitives publish, dry, clothesline, sword, sabre, saber 刊行(かんこう): publication, issue 季刊(きかん): quarterly (e.g. magazine) 創刊(そうかん): launching (e.g. newspaper), first issue 夕刊(ゆうかん): evening paper Kunyomi: Onyomi: カン Lesson: 43 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds:	publish 刊 画数5 1779 Details Story Dictionary 刊 publish Heisig's Dry . . . saber. Koohii #2 When you sweat your clothes become soaked with water, prompting you to hang them to dry on a clothesline. beach / shore / coast Details Story Dictionary 岸 beach / shore / coast My Story [Mountain + Cliff + Dry out {干}] (Nude) beach : Can see *Mountains*; Is under a *cliff*; can *dry out* dick in private A nude #beach# has *mountain* in sight, its hidden under a *cliff*, where the bathers can *dry out* in privacy. Koohii #1 At the base of mountain cliffs, there is usually a beach. You often can see people lying there, drying off after a swim. Koohii #2 Three impossibilities for a beach: There cannot be a beach at the top of a mountain. There cannot be a beach on the top of a cliff. There cannot be a beach that is completely dry. Primitives beach, mountain, cliff, dry, clothesline 沿岸(えんがん): coast, shore 岸(きし): bank, shore, coast 海岸(かいがん): sea shore Kunyomi: きし Onyomi: ガン Lesson: 43 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 岸 (きし)	beach / shore / coast 岸 画数8 1782 Details Story Dictionary 岸 beach / shore / coast My Story [Mountain + Cliff + Dry out {干}] (Nude) beach : Can see *Mountains*; Is under a *cliff*; can *dry out* dick in private A nude #beach# has *mountain* in sight, its hidden under a *cliff*, where the bathers can *dry out* in privacy. tree trunk Details Story Dictionary 幹 tree trunk Heisig's Mist . . . umbrella . . . dry. The meaning of this key word extends beyond tree trunks to represent the main stem or line of anything from railway lines to managerial staffs. This should help distinguish it from the stories used earlier for book (Frame 224) and body (Frame 1030), both of which made use of the image of a tree trunk, as well as the kanji for trunk (Frame 194). Koohii #1 A fine mist is falling, and so everyone gathers around near the tree-trunk, effectively using the rest of the tree as an umbrella in order to keep dry. Koohii #2 By astridtops - In the rainy mist, Totoro is standing in front of a tree-trunk at the bus stop, under the umbrella he just received. Look at him smiling: even when the big drops fall, he remains dry! Great story...which I get to by thinking: tree-trunk->TT ->Tonari no Totoro. I also imagine Mickey Mouse is there too as the KUNyomi for this kanji is みき. Primitives tree trunk, mist, ten, needle, early, sun, day, umbrella, dry, clothesline, ten2, needle2 幹(かん): (tree) trunk 幹線(かんせん): main line, trunk line 幹部(かんぶ): management, (executive) staff, leaders 新幹線(しんかんせん): bullet train Kunyomi: みき Onyomi: カン Lesson: 43 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 幹 (みき)	tree trunk 幹 画数13 1783 Details Story Dictionary 幹 tree trunk Heisig's Mist . . . umbrella . . . dry. This should help distinguish it from the stories used earlier for book (Frame 224) and body (Frame 1030), both of which made use of the image of a tree trunk, as well as the kanji for trunk (Frame 194). Koohii #2 By astridtops - In the rainy mist, Totoro is standing in front of a tree-trunk at the bus stop, under the umbrella he just received. Look at him smiling: even when the big drops fall, he remains dry! Great story...which I get to by thinking: tree-trunk->TT ->Tonari no Totoro. potato Details Story Dictionary 芋 potato Heisig's Flowers . . . potato. Koohii #1 If your potatos are growing flowers and those little hooked roots, you should either buy less or eat them faster. Koohii #2 If your potatoes are growing flowers, you need to store them in a more dry place, like hanging them on hooks so they don´t accumulate moisture on the floor. Primitives potato, flowers, potato Kunyomi: いも Onyomi: ウ Lesson: 43 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 芋 (いも)	potato 芋 画数6 1784 Details Story Dictionary 芋 potato Heisig's Flowers . . . potato. Koohii #2 If your potatoes are growing flowers, you need to store them in a more dry place, like hanging them on hooks so they don´t accumulate moisture on the floor. Primitives potato, flowers, potato Kunyomi: いも Onyomi: ウ Lesson: 43 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 芋 (いも)
eaves / Universe Details Story Dictionary 宇 eaves / Universe My Story [Crown + dry out {干}] \t I was *crowned* god of the universe, but my power *dried out* too soon Koohii #1 Under the eaves of the house the poor family has potate plants. Koohii #2 Very good image Erik. To help those who struggleded with this, the eaves of a house is usually the bit where you hang the roof gutter along, usually made of zinc or plastic and shaped as a half-pipe. It catches rain water, so it flows to a drain pipe instead of down onto people and windows. And in this family the potato plants grow along the eaves so the water pours down on them. They are poor. so no gutter. Primitives eaves, house, potato 宇宙(うちゅう): universe, cosmos, space Kunyomi: Onyomi: ウ Lesson: 43 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds:	eaves / Universe 宇 画数6 1785 Details Story Dictionary 宇 eaves / Universe My Story [Crown + dry out {干}] \t I was *crowned* god of the universe, but my power *dried out* too soon Koohii #1 Under the eaves of the house the poor family has potate plants. Koohii #2 Very good image Erik. To help those who struggleded with this, the eaves of a house is usually the bit where you hang the roof gutter along, usually made of zinc or plastic and shaped as a half-pipe. It catches rain water, so it flows to a drain pipe instead of down onto people and windows. And in this family the potato plants grow along the eaves so the water pours down on them. They are poor. so no gutter. Primitives eaves, house, potato 宇宙(うちゅう): universe, cosmos, space Kunyomi: Onyomi: ウ Lesson: 43 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds:
"too much Details Story Dictionary 余 too much Heisig's Umbrella . . . potato . . . little. The last stroke of potato and the first of little coincide in this character. * Since the phrase ""too much"" is overly abstract, we shall take the image of a scale whose indicator spins round and round on the dial because too much weight has been set on it. It will help to use this image in learning the kanji itself. Koohii #1 You hang an umbrella upside-down on a hook of the scales and fill it with little potatoes. No luck: it weights too much. Koohii #2 This is the kanji for 「あまり Amari」, which means too little in negative sentences and too much in the rest (always with a negative sense). I take the liberty of using the symbol "">"" (more than, another meaning!!) as the umbrella component, and using two (#2) and little (#105) for the potato primitive. So, this kanji either means ""two much"" (more than 2) or ""two little"". (thanks, Virtua_leaf and Thunderball!). Primitives too much, umbrella, potato, small 余り(あんまり): not very (this form only used as adverb), not much, remainder, rest, remnant, surplus, balance, excess, remains, scraps, residue, fullness, other, too much 余暇(よか): leisure, leisure time, spare time 余興(よきょう): side show, entertainment 余所見(よそみ): looking away, looking aside 余地(よち): place, room, margin, scope 余程(よっぽど): very, greatly, much, to a large extent, quite 余り(あまり): remainder, remnant, surplus, balance, excess, scraps, residue 余り(あまり): not very, not much 余る(あまる): remain, be left over, be too many 余計(よけい): too much, unnecessary, abundance, surplus, excess 余所(よそ): another place, somewhere else, strange parts 余分(よぶん): extra, excess, surplus 余裕(よゆう): surplus, composure, margin, room, time, allowance, scope, rope Kunyomi: あま.る、あま.り、あま.す、あんま.り Onyomi: ヨ Lesson: 43 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 余す (あま.す), 余る (あま.る)"	"too much 余 画数7 1786 Details Story Dictionary 余 too much Heisig's Umbrella . . . potato . . . little. exclude Details Story Dictionary 除 exclude Heisig's Pinnacle . . . scale. Koohii #1 You won´t make it unless you exclude something. The climb to the pinacle cannot be completed if you are carrying too much. You just have to decide what you can afford to exclude. Koohii #2 To become a member of The Pinnacle, they test you on a scale. If you weigh too much, they exclude you. Primitives exclude, pinnacle, parthenon, acropolis, scales, too much, umbrella, potato, small 解除(かいじょ): cancellation, rescinding, release, calling off 控除(こうじょ): subsidy, deduction 除外(じょがい): exception, exclusion 取り除く(とりのぞく): to remove, to take away, to set apart 排除(はいじょ): exclusion, removal, rejection 免除(めんじょ): exemption, exoneration, discharge 削除(さくじょ): elimination, cancellation, deletion, erasure 除く(のぞく): remove, exclude 掃除(そうじ): cleaning, sweeping Kunyomi: のぞ.く、-よ.け Onyomi: ジョ、ジ Lesson: 43 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 除外 (じょがい), 除数 (じょすう), 解除 (かいじょ), 除く (のぞ.く)	exclude 除 画数10 1787 Details Story Dictionary 除 exclude Heisig's Pinnacle . . . scale. gradually Details Story Dictionary 徐 gradually Heisig's Line . . . scale. Koohii #1 You can´t expect weight loss to happen overnight. You should limit going to the scale to weigh yourself to once a day or once a week, in order to observe the anticipated weight loss gradually. Koohii #2 I set up a column chart next to my scales so I could record my weight gradually changing. Primitives gradually, Nelson, column, going, line, scales, too much, umbrella, potato, small 徐行(じょこう): going slowly 徐々(そろそろ): gradually, steadily, quietly, slowly, soon 徐々に(じょじょに): slowly, little by little, gradually, steadily, quietly Kunyomi: おもむ.ろに Onyomi: ジョ Lesson: 43 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	gradually 徐 画数10 1788 Details Story Dictionary 徐 gradually Heisig's Line . . . scale. confer Details Story Dictionary 叙 confer Heisig's Scale . . crotch. The key word has to do with conferring ranks, titles, and awards. It should not be confused with bestow (Frame 1335) or impart (Frame 795). Koohii #1 Amazed at the weight of his crotch, they conferred every honor upon him. (Image: guy with his junk on a scale getting a medal pinned to his chest/around his neck/being knighted, etc.). Koohii #2 If there is such a thing as too much crotch, the guy who gets that much should have an honor conferred upon him. Primitives confer, scales, too much, umbrella, potato, small, crotch Kunyomi: つい.ず、ついで Onyomi: ジョ Lesson: 43 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	confer 叙 画数9 1789 Details Story Dictionary 叙 confer Heisig's Scale . . crotch. In other words, exercise! Koohii #1 On this route, all trucks have to check in at the scales before they can get on the road. Koohii #2 There are too many roads, so you need to plan a route. "diagonal Details Story Dictionary 斜 diagonal Heisig's Scale . . . measuring cup. bundle Details Story Dictionary 束 bundle Heisig's In the same way that we were able to see the sun in the tree within the kanji for east, here we see a square container in the shape of a mouth. Koohii #1 Mnemonic: Bundle of joy. Here I see the proverbial stork with a baby hanging from its mouth fly straight into a tree. Painful, but he doesn´t drop the bundle. Koohii #2 Unlike in 杏, this big mouth isn´t content to wait for apricots to fall in his mouth, so he has climbed the tree and is taking them in bundles. Primitives bundle, Chaplin, tree, wood, mouth 結束(けっそく): union, unity 拘束(こうそく): restriction, restraint 束縛(そくばく): restraint, shackles, restriction, confinement, binding 束の間(つかのま): moment, brief time, brief, transient 束(たば): bundle, bunch, sheaf, coil 約束(やくそく): promise Kunyomi: たば、たば.ねる、つか、つか.ねる Onyomi: ソク Lesson: 43 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 束 (たば)	bundle 束 画数7 1793 Details Story Dictionary 束 bundle Heisig's In the same way that we were able to see the sun in the tree within the kanji for east, here we see a square container in the shape of a mouth. rapids Details Story Dictionary 瀬 rapids Heisig's Water . . . bundle . . . head. Koohii #1 You need complete trust in your water guide to attempt Class 5 rapids. Koohii #2 You can never trust the water in the rapids, it will do everything it can to pull you under. imperial order Details Story Dictionary 勅 imperial order Heisig's In order to keep this character distinct from that for an imperial edict (Frame 366), we must draw again on a pun. Think of the order here as a mail order or an order of pizza phoned in by the Emperor for delivery to the imperial palace. Then it will not be hard to put together bundle and muscle to form a story about an imperial order. Koohii #1 This is an imperial order for pizza. To deliver the huge bundle of pizzas to the emperor, the pizza boy needs huge muscles. Koohii #2 Imperial order carries quite a bundle of executive power. Primitives imperial order, bundle, Chaplin, tree, wood, mouth, power, muscle, arnold Kunyomi: いまし.める、みことのり Onyomi: チョク Lesson: 43 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	imperial order 勅 画数9 1796 Details Story Dictionary 勅 imperial order Heisig's In order to keep this character distinct from that for an imperial edict (Frame 366), we must draw again on a pun. alienate Details Story Dictionary 疎 alienate Heisig's Zoo . . . bundle. Note that the element for zoo is flattened out on the left just as leg (Frame 1372) had been. This is the only time we will meet this form in this book. Koohii #1 [True story] In Osaka the homeless (the alienated) live in large numbers around the city zoo. Picture them in winter all bundled up in rags trying to keep warm, alienated from the society, living literally worst than the animals in the zoo who at least are bundled in their natural furs and have pens to live in sheltered from the elements. Koohii #2 This kanji is so strange that it was alienated at the kanji zoo. The bundle of joy stork bundles this kanji up and takes it to a kanji foster home. Primitives alienate, zoo, critters, stop, footprint, bundle, Chaplin, tree, wood, mouth 疎か(おろそか): neglect, negligence, carelessness 過疎(かそ): depopulation Kunyomi: うと.い、うと.む、まば.ら Onyomi: ソ、ショ Lesson: 43 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 疎い (うと.い), 疎む (うと.む)	alienate 疎 画数12 1797 Details Story Dictionary 疎 alienate Heisig's Zoo . . . bundle. quick Details Story Dictionary 速 quick My Story A *fag* (bundle) that *moves* quickly wont get shot in the US Koohii #1 Jack be nimble, Jack be quick, Jack jump over the bundled sticks in the middle of the road. (dingomick). Koohii #2 Uh oh. The stork just dropped the bundle of joy in the middle of the road. Somebody save it, quick! Primitives quick, bundle, Chaplin, tree, wood, mouth, road 迅速(じんそく): quick, fast, rapid, swift, prompt 速力(そくりょく): speed 加速(かそく): acceleration 加速度(かそくど): acceleration 急速(きゅうそく): rapid (e.g. progress) 高速(こうそく): high speed, high gear 早速(さっそく): at once, immediately, without delay, promptly 時速(じそく): speed (per hour) 速達(そくたつ): express, special delivery 速度(そくど): speed, velocity, rate 速い(はやい): quick, fast, swift Kunyomi: はや.い、はや-、はや.める、すみ.やか Onyomi: ソク Lesson: 43 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 速やか (すみ.やか), 速い (はや.い), 速める (はや.める)	quick 速 画数10 1799 Details Story Dictionary 速 quick My Story A *fag* (bundle) that *moves* quickly wont get shot in the US Koohii #1 Jack be nimble, Jack be quick, Jack jump over the bundled sticks in the middle of the road. organize Details Story Dictionary 整 organize Heisig's Bundle . . . taskmaster . . . correct. Koohii #1 Recycling in Japan, you have to make sure all your bundles are organized correctly otherwise the taskmasters won´t accept them. Koohii #2 When a bundle of taskmasters organize something chances are it won´t be done correctly because they are constantly arguing. Primitives organise, bundle, Chaplin, tree, wood, mouth, taskmaster, correct, one, ceiling, stop, footprint 整然(せいぜん): orderly, regular, well-organized, trim, accurate 整列(せいれつ): stand in a row, form a line 整える(ととのえる): to put in order, to get ready, to arrange, to adjust 整数(せいすう): integer 整備(せいび): adjustment, completion, consolidation 整理(せいり): sorting, arrangement, adjustment, regulation 調整(ちょうせい): regulation, adjustment, tuning 整う(ととのう): be prepared, be in order, be put in order, be arranged Kunyomi: ととの.える、ととの.う Onyomi: セイ Lesson: 43 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 整う (ととの.う), 整える (ととの.える)	organize 整 画数16 1800 Details Story Dictionary 整 organize Heisig's Bundle . . . taskmaster . . . correct. "saber Details Story Dictionary 剣 saber My Story Saber swallowers *risk* not being able to *ri* (reeeeeeee) as much as possible Koohii #1 If it helps, make the awl primitive ice pick instead. They´re basically the same thing. This kanji is an easy David vs. Goliath story of the icepick vs. the saber... Koohii #2 Every self-respecting ninja knows the story of ""The Awl and the Sabre"". According to the legend, a woman once defended herself by using an awl against a sabre! She used to work all day with that awl. However, the bandit using the sabre had no skill. And thus the awl beat the sabre. And from there the saying goes : ""The sabre is powerless against the awl, if one can´t use the sabre."". Primitives sabre, saber, awl, fit, meeting, umbrella, mouth, person, sword, sabre, saber 真剣(しんけん): seriousness, earnestness Kunyomi: つるぎ Onyomi: ケン Lesson: 43 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 剣 (つるぎ)"	"saber 剣 画数10 1801 Details Story Dictionary 剣 saber My Story Saber swallowers *risk* not being able to *ri* (reeeeeeee) as much as possible Koohii #1 If it helps, make the awl primitive ice pick instead. precipitous Details Story Dictionary 険 precipitous Heisig's Pinnacle . . . awl. Koohii #1 The rock climber trying to get up to the pinnacle is dangling from a precipitous edge, hanging only one with his icepick. Koohii #2 Well I have someone climbing an inflatable precipitous pinnacle. Once at the top it is so precipitous that the person is afraid to climb down and instead punctures the inflatable pinnacle with an awl to get safely and slowly back to the ground. Primitives precipitous, pinnacle, parthenon, acropolis, awl, fit, meeting, umbrella, mouth, person 保険(ほけん): insurance, guarantee 険しい(けわしい): inaccessible place, impregnable position, steep place, sharp eyes 冒険(ぼうけん): risk, venture, adventure 危険(きけん): danger Kunyomi: けわ.しい Onyomi: ケン Lesson: 43 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 険しい (けわ.しい)	precipitous 険 画数11 1802 Details Story Dictionary 険 precipitous Heisig's Pinnacle . . . awl. "examination Details Story Dictionary 検 examination Heisig's Tree . . . awl. Koohii #1 After intense cross-examination from the prosecutor, the tree confessed to murdering the wood-pecker with an awl... ""He just kept at it, he kept poking at me with that beak, so I thought I'd see how HE liked it!!"" The autopsy examination revealed at least a dozen puncture wounds, what a brutal case. Koohii #2 Don´t confuse with exam (#1278), test (#354), evaluate (#1487). Think of examination as a doctor´s examination. You´re having problems getting wood in bed. You go in for a doctor´s examination. The doctor shoves an icepick into your manhood as part of the examination. frugal Details Story Dictionary 倹 frugal Heisig's Person . . . awl. Koohii #1 Mr. T is as frugal as they come. He uses his one ice pick for everything: to eat, pick his teeth, clean his toilet, kill people, cook, etc. Koohii #2 Khatzumoto needs to be frugal after spending all his money on Japanese media and none on food. His waist has shrunk and he needs a new belt, but being frugal he just punches another hole with his awl. Primitives frugal, person, awl, fit, meeting, umbrella, mouth, person, person2 倹約(けんやく): thrift, economy, frugality Kunyomi: つま.しい、つづまやか Onyomi: ケン Lesson: 43 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	frugal 倹 画数10 1804 Details Story Dictionary 倹 frugal Heisig's Person . . . awl. "heavy Details Story Dictionary 重 heavy Heisig's Thousand . . . ri. Note how the long vertical stroke doubles up to serve both elements. Koohii #1 The first computer in the world was as heavy as thousand computers are now. Koohii #2 To me it looks like a car with two extra wheels, like a truck. As it is a very heavy vehicle I suggest an image of a huge mining truck, like the yellow Liebherr T282B. Remember that the first ""wheel"" is a bit bent. http://www.primidi.com/2004/06/21.html. Primitives heavy, thousand, computer, rice field, brains, soil, dirt, ground 重(え): -fold, -ply 重なる(おもなる): main, principal, important 重役(おもやく): heavy responsibilities, director 重んじる(おもんじる): to respect, to honor, to esteem, to prize 重んずる(おもんずる): to honor, to respect, to esteem, to prize 重複(じゅうふく): duplication, repetition, overlapping, redundancy, restoration 重宝(じゅうほう): priceless treasure, convenience, usefulness 比重(ひじゅう): specific gravity 重たい(おもたい): heavy, massive, serious, important, severe, oppressed 重なる(かさなる): be piled up, lie on top of one another, overlap each other 重ねる(かさねる): pile up, add, repeat 貴重(きちょう): precious, valuable 厳重(げんじゅう): strict, severe, firm, strong, secure, rigour 重視(じゅうし): importance, stress, serious consideration 重体(じゅうたい): seriously ill, serious condition, critical state 重大(じゅうだい): serious, important, grave, weighty 重点(じゅうてん): important point, lay stress on, emphasis, colon 重役(じゅうやく): heavy responsibilities, director 重要(じゅうよう): important, momentous, essential, principal, major 重量(じゅうりょう): weight, heavyweight boxer 重力(じゅうりょく): gravity 慎重(しんちょう): discretion, prudence 尊重(そんちょう): respect, esteem, regard 重い(おもい): heavy, massive, serious, important, severe, oppressed Kunyomi: え、おも.い、おも.り、おも.なう、かさ.ねる、かさ.なる、おも Onyomi: ジュウ、チョウ Lesson: 43 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds: 重量 (じゅうりょう), 重大 (じゅうだい), 二重 (にじゅう), 重 (え), 重い (おも.い), 重なる (かさ.なる), 重ねる (かさ.ねる)"	"heavy 重 画数9 1805 Details Story Dictionary 重 heavy Heisig's Thousand . . . ri. move Details Story Dictionary 動 move Heisig's Heavy . . . muscle. Koohii #1 Even though the furniture is heavy, it´ll be easy to move with all the muscles that he has. Koohii #2 His MUSCLES are so HEAVY, he barely can move...thats ironic. Primitives move, heavy, thousand, ri, computer, power, muscle, arnold 異動(いどう): a change 動き(うごき): movement, activity, trend, development, change 動く(うごく): to move, to stir, to shift, to shake, to swing, to operate, to run, to go, to work, to be touched, to be influenced, to waver, to fluctuate, to vary, to change, to be transferred 自動詞(じどうし): intransitive verb (no direct obj) 出動(しゅつどう): sailing, marching, going out 助動詞(じょどうし): auxiliary verb 振動(しんどう): oscillation, vibration 騒動(そうどう): strife, riot, rebellion 他動詞(たどうし): transitive verb (direct obj) 動員(どういん): mobilization 動機(どうき): motive, incentive 動向(どうこう): trend, tendency, movement, attitude 動的(どうてき): dynamic, kinetic 動揺(どうよう): disturbance, unrest, shaking, trembling, pitching, rolling, oscillation, agitation, excitement, commotion 動力(どうりょく): power, motive power, dynamic force 不動産(ふどうさん): real estate 変動(へんどう): change, fluctuation 暴動(ぼうどう): insurrection, rebellion, revolt, riot, uprising 移動(いどう): removal, migration, movement 動かす(うごかす): move, shift, set in motion, operate, inspire,, rouse, ,influence, mobilize, deny, change 運動(うんどう): motion, exercise 活動(かつどう): action, activity 感動(かんどう): being deeply moved, deep emotion, excitement, impression 形容動詞(けいようどうし): adjectival noun, quasi-adjective 行動(こうどう): action, conduct, behaviour, mobilization 自動(じどう): automatic 動作(どうさ): action, movements, motions, bearing, behaviour, manners 動詞(どうし): verb 動く(うごく): move 動物園(どうぶつえん): zoo 自動車(じどうしゃ): automobile 動物(どうぶつ): animal Kunyomi: うご.く、うご.かす Onyomi: ドウ Lesson: 43 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds: 動かす (うご.かす), 動く (うご.く)	move 動 画数11 1806 Details Story Dictionary 動 move Heisig's Heavy . . . muscle. meritorious deed Details Story Dictionary 勲 meritorious deed Heisig's Move . . . oven fire. So as not to confuse this kanji with the general character for merit (Frame 1369), you may associate the key word with military decorations and medals of distinction, both of which it is used for. Koohii #1 A meritorious deed? Like moving a damsel in distress out of a fire, maybe. Koohii #2 Prometheus did a meritous deed for humanity by MOVING FIRE from the gods to us humans. Primitives meritorious deed, move, heavy, thousand, ri, computer, power, muscle, arnold, oven-fire, barbecue Kunyomi: いさお Onyomi: クン Lesson: 43 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	meritorious deed 勲 画数15 1808 Details Story Dictionary 勲 meritorious deed Heisig's Move . . . oven fire.
