"species Details Story Dictionary 種 species My Story [Wheat + Heavy] *Wheat* is eaten by all the *heavy* species (cows, horses, Americans, etc.) Koohii #1 Our species has a wheat heavy diet... Koohii #2 This kanji also means ""Seed."" STORY: Scientists have developed a new SPECIES of WHEAT that has large HEAVY seeds. Now we can feed the world. Primitives species, wheat, cereal, heavy, thousand, ri, computer 各種(かくしゅ): every kind, all sorts 種々(くさぐさ): variety 種(しゅ): kind, variety, species 品種(ひんしゅ): brand, kind, description 一種(いっしゅ): species, kind, variety 種類(しゅるい): variety, kind, type, category, counter for different sorts of things 人種(じんしゅ): race (of people) 種(たね): seed, kind, variety, quality, tone, material, matter, subject, theme, (news) copy, cause, source, trick, secret, inside story Kunyomi: たね、-ぐさ Onyomi: シュ Lesson: 43 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 種 (たね)"	"species 種 画数14 1810 Details Story Dictionary 種 species My Story [Wheat + Heavy] *Wheat* is eaten by all the *heavy* species (cows, horses, Americans, etc.) Koohii #1 Our species has a wheat heavy diet... Koohii #2 This kanji also means ""Seed."" STORY: Scientists have developed a new SPECIES of WHEAT that has large HEAVY seeds. Now we can feed the world. Primitives species, wheat, cereal, heavy, thousand, ri, computer 各種(かくしゅ): every kind, all sorts 種々(くさぐさ): variety 種(しゅ): kind, variety, species 品種(ひんしゅ): brand, kind, description 一種(いっしゅ): species, kind, variety 種類(しゅるい): variety, kind, type, category, counter for different sorts of things 人種(じんしゅ): race (of people) 種(たね): seed, kind, variety, quality, tone, material, matter, subject, theme, (news) copy, cause, source, trick, secret, inside story Kunyomi: たね、-ぐさ Onyomi: シュ Lesson: 43 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 種 (たね)"
collide Details Story Dictionary 衝 collide Heisig's Boulevard . . . heavy. Koohii #1 Two heavy trucks in a game of chicken collide while racing toward each other on the boulevard. Koohii #2 衝 【しょう】 (n) (1) important point (e.g. on a route); (2) important role (responsibility, etc.); (3) (astronomical) opposition. STORY:Two HEAVY trucks are playing a game of chicken on the BOULEVARD. However, they both missed the IMPORTANT POINT: that they have to turn in different directions. Naturally, they COLLIDE when they both turn in the same direction. (ty dingomick). Primitives collide, boulevard, going, heavy, thousand, ri, computer 衝撃(しょうげき): shock, crash, impact, ballistic 衝突(しょうとつ): collision, conflict Kunyomi: つ.く Onyomi: ショウ Lesson: 43 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	collide 衝 画数15 1811 Details Story Dictionary 衝 collide Heisig's Boulevard . . . heavy. Koohii #1 Two heavy trucks in a game of chicken collide while racing toward each other on the boulevard. fragrant Details Story Dictionary 薫 fragrant Heisig's Flowers . . . heavy . . . oven fire. Do not confuse with incense (Frame 977) or perfumed (Frame 532). Koohii #1 Do you know how they make those FRAGRANT air fresheners? Well you take some FLOWERS, compress them with a HEAVY weight, and put them on an OVEN FIRE for a while... (cmp perfume (#493)). Koohii #2 The heavier the flowers the stronger their fragrance when you burn them. Primitives fragrant, flowers, heavy, thousand, ri, computer, oven-fire, barbecue Kunyomi: かお.る Onyomi: クン Lesson: 43 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 薫る (かお.る)	fragrant 薫 画数16 1812 Details Story Dictionary 薫 fragrant Heisig's Flowers . . . heavy . . . oven fire. ill Details Story Dictionary 病 ill Heisig's Sickness . . . third class. Koohii #1 Caveman got ill after flying third class. The cabin air and food got to him. (Primitive: these all got MUCH easier when using CAVEMAN instead. ). Koohii #2 If you hang around a third class hospital, you´ll get ill with the sickness everyone else has. Primitives ill, sickness, hospital, third class, one, ceiling, inside 臆病(おくびょう): cowardice, timidity 発病(はつびょう): attack (disease) 病(やまい): illness, disease 病む(やむ): to fall ill, to be ill 看病(かんびょう): nursing (a patient) 病院(びょういん): hospital 病気(びょうき): illness, disease, sickness Kunyomi: や.む、-や.み、やまい Onyomi: ビョウ、ヘイ Lesson: 44 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds: 病気 (びょうき), 病根 (びょうこん), 看病 (かんびょう), 病む (や.む), 病 (やまい)	ill 病 画数10 1813 Details Story Dictionary 病 ill Heisig's Sickness . . . third class. "stupid Details Story Dictionary 痴 stupid Heisig's Know . . . sickness. Koohii #1 Of course caveman is stupid. He doesn´t know anything. He´s a caveman! Koohii #2 This kanji shows stupidity as a ""knowledge-sickness"". Everybody can be stupid at times, and it usually happens because of a lack of experience. Hence the stupidity is a ""knowledge sickness"". Primitives stupid, sickness, hospital, know, dart, drop, heavens, mouth 愚痴(ぐち): idle complaint, grumble Kunyomi: し.れる、おろか Onyomi: チ Lesson: 44 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"	"stupid 痴 画数13 1814 Details Story Dictionary 痴 stupid Heisig's Know . . . sickness. carbuncle Details Story Dictionary 瘍 carbuncle Heisig's Sickness . . . piggy bank. Koohii #1 His sickness caused numerous carbuncles, which when emptied by the doctors also emptied his piggy bank. Koohii #2 The witches piggy bank was cursed with a spell causing any thief who stole it's contents to fall ill. The illness would result in the victim being covered from head to toe in a mass of carbuncles. Crime doesn't pay! Kunyomi: かさ Onyomi: ヨウ Lesson: 44 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: Compounds:	carbuncle 瘍 画数14 1817 Details Story Dictionary 瘍 carbuncle Heisig's Sickness . . . piggy bank. lose weight Details Story Dictionary 痩 lose weight Heisig's Sickness . . . monkey . . . crotch. Koohii #1 The most horrific way to lose weight is from that devastating sickness that came from a monkey's crotch. Koohii #2 The poor monkey obviously had a sickness. He was scratching his crotch the whole time and when he started to lose weight heavily, the caretakers knew they couldn´t save him anymore. "rapidly Details Story Dictionary 疾 rapidly Heisig's Be sure to keep this character distinct from quick (Frame 1799) and swift (Frame 298). Picture a succession of poison darts (the sort that inflict sickness) flying out rapid-fire from a blowgun, so that ""rapid-fire"" can conjure up the proper image. Koohii #1 I picture a sick caveman, and two people rapidly blowing darts at him. One is blowing poison darts, the other is blowing antidote darts. Will the sick caveman live or die? Depends on how rapidly they fire. Koohii #2 If shot with a poison dart, sickness develops rapidly. Primitives rapidly, sickness, hospital, dart, drop, heavens Kunyomi: はや.い Onyomi: シツ Lesson: 44 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"	"rapidly 疾 画数10 1819 Details Story Dictionary 疾 rapidly Heisig's Be sure to keep this character distinct from quick (Frame 1799) and swift (Frame 298). Koohii #2 Your body feels tired when you have a sickness. All you want to do is wrap yourself up in a nice warm pelt and get better. "epidemic Details Story Dictionary 疫 epidemic Heisig's Sickness . . . missile. Koohii #1 Sickness-missiles are being engineered by bio-terrorists to spread epidemics all over the world. Imagine seeing footage of a place where those sickness-missiles are built : rows after rows of missiles, and if you look closely on each is inscribed in tiny letters the name of different sickness such as ""flu"", ""plague"", etc. Koohii #2 SICKNESS / MISSILE ** Hint: True fact about biochemical warfare: in the medieval and ancient world, SICKNESS in the form of the corpses of those who had died from some EPIDEMIC or plague were often hurled at the enemy via the crude MISSILE launchers of the time. [C]. Primitives epidemic, sickness, hospital, cruise missile, missile, wind, crotch Kunyomi: Onyomi: エキ、ヤク Lesson: 44 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 疫病 (えきびょう), 悪疫 (あくえき), 防疫 (ぼうえき)"	"epidemic 疫 画数9 1824 Details Story Dictionary 疫 epidemic Heisig's Sickness . . . missile. Koohii #1 Sickness-missiles are being engineered by bio-terrorists to spread epidemics all over the world. Imagine seeing footage of a place where those sickness-missiles are built : rows after rows of missiles, and if you look closely on each is inscribed in tiny letters the name of different sickness such as ""flu"", ""plague"", etc. Koohii #2 SICKNESS / MISSILE ** Hint: True fact about biochemical warfare: in the medieval and ancient world, SICKNESS in the form of the corpses of those who had died from some EPIDEMIC or plague were often hurled at the enemy via the crude MISSILE launchers of the time. [C]. Primitives epidemic, sickness, hospital, cruise missile, missile, wind, crotch Kunyomi: Onyomi: エキ、ヤク Lesson: 44 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 疫病 (えきびょう), 悪疫 (あくえき), 防疫 (ぼうえき)"
pain Details Story Dictionary 痛 pain Heisig's Sickness . . . chop-seal . . . utilize. Koohii #1 Think of the phrase pain in the xxx. Then think of a pogostick up your xxx. That's painful, right? The real question is why a pogostick is up your xxx. That's sick, dude. Koohii #2 When I was feeling sick my mum said I shouldn´t go out to play on my pogo stick until I felt better. Well I wasn´t strong enough to stay up on it and so fell over and have the pain to prove my mum right. Primitives pain, sickness, hospital, pogo stick, chop-seal, hanko, utilise, utilize 痛む(いたむ): to hurt, to feel a pain, to be injured 痛める(いためる): to hurt, to injure, to cause pain, to worry, to bother, to afflict, to be grieved over 痛感(つうかん): feeling keenly, fully realizing 痛切(つうせつ): keen, acute 痛み(いたみ): pain, ache, sore, grief, distress 苦痛(くつう): pain, agony 頭痛(ずつう): headache 痛い(いたい): painful Kunyomi: いた.い、いた.む、いた.ましい、いた.める Onyomi: ツウ Lesson: 44 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 痛い (いた.い), 痛む (いた.む), 痛める (いた.める)	pain 痛 画数12 1825 Details Story Dictionary 痛 pain Heisig's Sickness . . . chop-seal . . . utilize. mannerism Details Story Dictionary 癖 mannerism Heisig's Sickness . . . ketchup. Koohii #1 Caveman has a bad mannerism of putting ketchup on everything he eats. I guess that´s ok since raw mammoth can´t be too good... Koohii #2 This mannerism is a sickness of the modern generation. It was only recently that we started putting ketchup on everything. Primitives mannerism, sickness, hospital, ketchup, flag, mouth, spicy, stand up, vase, ten, needle 癖(くせ): a habit (often a bad habit, i.e. vice), peculiarity Kunyomi: くせ、くせ.に Onyomi: ヘキ Lesson: 44 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 癖 (くせ)	mannerism 癖 画数18 1826 Details Story Dictionary 癖 mannerism Heisig's Sickness . . . ketchup. hide Details Story Dictionary 匿 hide Heisig's Box . . . young. Koohii #1 Young kids likes to hide in cardboard boxes. (Primitive: CARDBOARD BOX, especially kids playing with them.). Koohii #2 Note that stroke order with box primitive is as follows: first horizontal line, then enclosed element, and then a hook (it´s incorrect in 4th edition). artisan Details Story Dictionary 匠 artisan Heisig's Box . . . ax. Koohii #1 Hint: Artisan/Ax Def: An artisan is a skilled manual worker; a craftsperson. Here we see his tools represented by the artisan's ax stored in his toolbox. Koohii #2 We here have the axe-man who´s an artisan at making sculptures with his axe... The only thing is, he never shows anyone, keeping all his sculptures inside a box down in the basement. He doesn´t want any attention. doctor Details Story Dictionary 医 doctor Heisig's Box . . . dart. Koohii #1 Easily confused: Dr. (#47), doctor (#1694), examination (#1673), check-up (#1724), medicine (#1736). To avoid confusion I renamed this medic, and picture the medic from Team Fortress 2 returning to his box of darts in the supply cupboard every time his syringe gun is empty. Koohii #2 This DOCTOR prefers to use DARTS instead of syringes for injections. Here, he pulls out his BOX of DARTS, and the child on the examination table squirms. Primitives doctor, box, dart, drop, heavens 医師(いし): doctor 医療(いりょう): medical care, medical treatment 医学(いがく): medical science 歯医者(はいしゃ): dentist 医者(いしゃ): doctor (medical) Kunyomi: い.やす、い.する、くすし Onyomi: イ Lesson: 44 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds:	doctor 医 画数7 1829 Details Story Dictionary 医 doctor Heisig's Box . . . dart. Koohii #1 Easily confused: Dr. (#47), doctor (#1694), examination (#1673), check-up (#1724), medicine (#1736). To avoid confusion I renamed this medic, and picture the medic from Team Fortress 2 returning to his box of darts in the supply cupboard every time his syringe gun is empty. Koohii #2 This DOCTOR prefers to use DARTS instead of syringes for injections. Here, he pulls out his BOX of DARTS, and the child on the examination table squirms. equal Details Story Dictionary 匹 equal Heisig's Box . . . human legs. Koohii #1 This kanji is used commonly as a counter for small animals. This is a pictograph of a SMALL ANIMAL´S view from inside a CARDBOARD BOX looking out at his masters HUMAN LEGS. He´s probably hiding so the master does not COUNT him with the other animals which will probably be eaten (thus he avoids everyones EQUAL fate on the farm: the kitchen table). Koohii #2 Imagine a magician doing that trick where he puts his assistant in a box and proceeds to saw her in half. Don’t the human legs sticking horizontally out of the box remind you of an equal sign? Primitives equal, box, human legs 匹(ひき): head, small animal counter, roll of cloth 匹敵(ひってき): comparing with, match, rival, equal Kunyomi: ひき Onyomi: ヒツ Lesson: 44 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 匹 (ひき)	equal 匹 画数4 1830 Details Story Dictionary 匹 equal Heisig's Box . . . human legs. ward Details Story Dictionary 区 ward Heisig's The ward referred to here is a subdivision of a large city. Its elements: box . . . sheaves. When used as a primitive element, it may be helpful at times to break it up into these same composite elements. Koohii #1 In the homeless ward of the city you see people sleeping in CARDBOARD BOXES using a SHEAF as a pillow. Koohii #2 That´s the homeless ward of the city. Wolverine lives in a cardboard box there. Primitives ward, box, sheaf 区(く): ward, district, section 区画(くかく): division, section, compartment, boundary, area, block 区間(くかん): section (of track etc) 区切り(くぎり): an end, a stop, punctuation 区々(まちまち): several, various, divergent, conflicting, different, diverse, trivial 区域(くいき): limits, boundary, domain, zone, sphere, territory 区切る(くぎる): punctuate, cut off, mark off, stop, put an end to 区分(くぶん): division, section, compartment, demarcation, (traffic) lane, classification, sorting 区別(くべつ): distinction, differentiation, classification 地区(ちく): district, section, sector Kunyomi: Onyomi: ク、オウ、コウ Lesson: 44 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds:	ward 区 画数4 1831 Details Story Dictionary 区 ward Heisig's The ward referred to here is a subdivision of a large city. assault Details Story Dictionary 殴 assault Heisig's Ward . . . missile. Koohii #1 The biggest assault on Japan during WW2 is when the wards in Hiroshima and Nagasaki were wiped out by nuclear missiles. Koohii #2 In this hospital ward, the personnel is assaulted by missiles. Think of a ward where crazy old people assault the personnel because they don´t like the food, they don´t want to take their medicines, they want to go home, etc. The patients use whatever they can get their hands on as missiles. Europe Details Story Dictionary 欧 Europe My Story [Ward {区} + Lack] In Europe, we LACK wards, we prefer to divide areas into counties and boroughs. Koohii #1 Do japanese consider Europe like just a ward, boring enough to make them yawn?? This kanji is offensive! Koohii #2 [Europe] X-Box was first released in America and Japan (the biggest videogame markets). Europe had an X-Box lack for a while... "faceup Details Story Dictionary 仰 faceup Heisig's This character is used both for lying on one's back faceup, and for looking up to someone with respect and awe. Its elements: person . . . box . . . stamps. Koohii #1 Mr T with the post package at the post office: ´these stamps don´t stick to the box, foo´ Postguy:´ Try it again but this time with the stamp, face-up.´. Koohii #2 Mr. T, his ""acting career"" in its twilight, must now FACE-UP to the fact that his mug will never appear on a BOX of cereal or on a STAMP. Primitives face up, person, stamp album, box, stamps 仰ぐ(あおぐ): to look up (to), to respect, to depend on, to ask for, to seek, to revere, to drink, to take 仰っしゃる(おっしゃる): to say, to speak, to tell, to talk 信仰(しんこう): (religious) faith, belief, creed Kunyomi: あお.ぐ、おお.せ、お.っしゃる、おっしゃ.る Onyomi: ギョウ、コウ Lesson: 44 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 仰視 (ぎょうし), 仰天 (ぎょうてん), 仰角 (ぎょうかく), 仰ぐ (あお.ぐ), 仰せ (おお.せ)"	"faceup 仰 画数6 1836 Details Story Dictionary 仰 faceup Heisig's This character is used both for lying on one's back faceup, and for looking up to someone with respect and awe. ascend Details Story Dictionary 登 ascend Heisig's Teepee . . . table. Do not confuse with rise up (Frame 43). Koohii #1 When an American Indian warrior dies, his body is placed on a TABLE inside a TEEPEE, and a ritualistic ceremony is held to encourage his spirit to ASCEND to that big buffalo hunting ground in the sky. Koohii #2 When I was a kid I went out camping in a teepee. I ate beans for dinner, and afterwards I produced so much gas that my teepee actually ascended in the air! Primitives ascend, teepee, wigwam, beans, table, one, mouth 登校(とうこう): attendance (at school) 登録(とうろく): registration, register, entry, record 登場(とうじょう): entry (on stage), appearance (on screen), entrance, introduction (into a market) 登山(とざん): mountain climbing 登る(のぼる): climb Kunyomi: のぼ.る、あ.がる Onyomi: トウ、ト、ドウ、ショウ、チョウ Lesson: 44 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 登壇 (とうだん), 登校 (とうこう), 登記 (とうき), 登る (のぼ.る)	ascend 登 画数12 1838 Details Story Dictionary 登 ascend Heisig's Teepee . . . table. lucidity Details Story Dictionary 澄 lucidity Heisig's Water . . . ascend. Koohii #1 Scuba divers know that when you ascend in the water, your lucidity increases (For non-divers, the deeper you go, the more you become mentally impaired by nitrogen narcosis, every 50 feet is like drinking one martini). Scuba divers also know that as you ascend in the water, the lucidity of the water improves, too. Koohii #2 A few drops of acid/peyote and the Indians obtain lucidity on their vision quest, as if they were floating in the lucid sky. Primitives lucidity, water, water droplets, water pistol, ascend, teepee, wigwam, beans, table, one, mouth 澄ます(すます): to clear, to make clear, to be unruffled, to look unconcerned, to look demure, look prim, put on airs 澄む(すむ): to clear (e.g. weather), to become transparent Kunyomi: す.む、す.ます、-す.ます Onyomi: チョウ Lesson: 44 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 澄ます (す.ます), 澄む (す.む)	lucidity 澄 画数15 1839 Details Story Dictionary 澄 lucidity Heisig's Water . . . ascend. discharge Details Story Dictionary 発 discharge Heisig's This key word refers to the discharging of guns, trains, people, and even words. The elements: teepee . . . two . . . human legs. Contrast the writing with frame 63. Koohii #1 Two pairs of human legs poking out of a teepee: you know there´ll be a discharge soon, be it sexual, violent (husband returns home with a weapon), or dishonourable (soldier caught molesting a native), or perhaps all of the above. Koohii #2 I spent some time in her TEEPEE...just the TWO of us...but I looked between her HUMAN LEGS and I saw a nasty DISCHARGE...so I made my 出発　rather hastily. Primitives discharge, teepee, wigwam, two, human legs 開発(かいはつ): development, exploitation 活発(かっぱつ): vigor, active 再発(さいはつ): return, relapse, reoccurrence 始発(しはつ): first train 発(はつ): departure, beginning, counter for gunshots 発育(はついく): (physical) growth, development 発芽(はつが): burgeoning 発掘(はっくつ): excavation, exhumation 発言(はつげん): utterance, speech, proposal 発生(はっせい): outbreak, spring forth, occurrence, incidence, origin 発足(はっそく): starting, inauguration 発病(はつびょう): attack (disease) 発条(ばね): spring (e.g. coil leaf) 反発(はんぱつ): repelling, rebound, recover, oppose 発作(ほっさ): fit, spasm 蒸発(じょうはつ): evaporation, unexplained disappearance 発つ(たつ): depart (on a plane, train, etc.) 爆発(ばくはつ): explosion, detonation, eruption 発揮(はっき): exhibition, demonstration, utilization, display 発見(はっけん): discovery, detection, finding 発行(はっこう): issue (publications) 発車(はっしゃ): departure of a vehicle 発射(はっしゃ): firing, shooting, discharge, catapult 発想(はっそう): expression (music), conceptualization 発達(はったつ): development, growth 発展(はってん): development, growth 発電(はつでん): generation (e.g. power) 発売(はつばい): sale 発表(はっぴょう): announcement, publication 発明(はつめい): invention 出発(しゅっぱつ): depart 発音(はつおん): pronunciation Kunyomi: た.つ、あば.く、おこ.る、つか.わす、はな.つ Onyomi: ハツ、ホツ Lesson: 44 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds: 発明 (はつめい), 発射 (はっしゃ), 突発 (とっぱつ)	discharge 発 画数9 1840 Details Story Dictionary 発 discharge Heisig's This key word refers to the discharging of guns, trains, people, and even words. abolish Details Story Dictionary 廃 abolish Heisig's Cave . . . discharge. Koohii #1 Slaves have been discharged from the caves where they were kept thanks to the abolition of slavery. Koohii #2 Guns were abolished, so gun enthusiats left for the hills to discharge their guns in caves. Primitives abolish, cave, dicharge, teepee, wigwam, two, human legs 荒廃(こうはい): ruin 廃れる(すたれる): to go out of use, to become obsolete, to die out, to go out of fashion 廃棄(はいき): annullment, disposal, abandon, scrap, discarding, repeal 廃止(はいし): abolition, repeal Kunyomi: すた.れる、すた.る Onyomi: ハイ Lesson: 44 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 廃る (すた.る), 廃れる (すた.れる)	abolish 廃 画数12 1841 Details Story Dictionary 廃 abolish Heisig's Cave . . . discharge. Koohii #2 Guns were abolished, so gun enthusiats left for the hills to discharge their guns in caves. "colleague Details Story Dictionary 僚 colleague Heisig's Person . . . pup tent. Choose some connotation of the key word that will keep it distinct for you from companion (Frame 19), friend (Frame 760), consort (Frame 1287), and comrade (Frame 1765). Koohii #1 A colleague implies someone that you share work with, such as in your company or profession, etc. Here your colleague helps you to erect your pup tent during a company outing. Note: Heisig's warning to keep this distinct from other similiar kanji such as companion (#19), friend (#704), consort (#1203) and comrade (#1637). That is why I chose to have the person element pictured as someone (the colleague in this case) helping with the work of building the pup tent. Koohii #2 Mr. T began working in a japanese compagny. As he sees that his colleague accept to do some extra work during the week-end and even sleep at the office, he says to them: ""I pity da fool who work during week-end! You might as well install a pup tent in the office and forget about your home"". Primitives colleague, person, pup tent, large, St. Bernard, sun, day, small, little 官僚(かんりょう): bureaucrat, bureaucracy 同僚(どうりょう): coworker, colleague, associate Kunyomi: Onyomi: リョウ Lesson: 44 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"	"colleague 僚 画数14 1842 Details Story Dictionary 僚 colleague Heisig's Person . . . pup tent. Choose some connotation of the key word that will keep it distinct for you from companion (Frame 19), friend (Frame 760), consort (Frame 1287), and comrade (Frame 1765). Koohii #1 A colleague implies someone that you share work with, such as in your company or profession, etc. Here your colleague helps you to erect your pup tent during a company outing. Note: Heisig's warning to keep this distinct from other similiar kanji such as companion (#19), friend (#704), consort (#1203) and comrade (#1637). That is why I chose to have the person element pictured as someone (the colleague in this case) helping with the work of building the pup tent. Koohii #2 Mr. T began working in a japanese compagny. As he sees that his colleague accept to do some extra work during the week-end and even sleep at the office, he says to them: ""I pity da fool who work during week-end! You might as well install a pup tent in the office and forget about your home"". Primitives colleague, person, pup tent, large, St. Bernard, sun, day, small, little 官僚(かんりょう): bureaucrat, bureaucracy 同僚(どうりょう): coworker, colleague, associate Kunyomi: Onyomi: リョウ Lesson: 44 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"

Koohii #2 It´s obvious that the pup tent with a huge eye on the side belongs to the dark lord Sauron. dormitory Details Story Dictionary 寮 dormitory Heisig's House . . . pup tent. Koohii #1 A dormitory is right in the middle between living in a house and living in a pup tent. Koohii #2 This guy would rather use his pup-tent as a house, than sleep in the dormitory. So he effectively turned that pup-tent into a house by getting a postal address for it etc. (just to emphasize house). heal Details Story Dictionary 療 heal Heisig's Sickness . . . pup tent. Koohii #1 On the battlefield, the only place to heal from your sickness is inside the medic's pup tent. Think of M.A.S.H. Koohii #2 Sick caveman has to sleep in his pup tent. Not the cave because to humid and cold but a nice small pup tent in the sun will heal him from his cold. carve Details Story Dictionary 彫 carve Heisig's The two primitives here, circumference and shape, belong naturally to the special connotations that differentiate carving from engraving (see frame 1639). Koohii #1 A lathe is used to carve a shape with circumference into wood or metal. Koohii #2 Start with a circumference and carve away until you get the shape you want. "shape Details Story Dictionary 形 shape Heisig's Two hands . . . shape. Koohii #1 Everyone in the kindergarten came up with fun and interesting shapes made out of Play-Doh, except for the kid with the amputated arm. Seems like you really need both hands. Koohii #2 With your two hands, outline the shape of a curvaceous woman. Is that a universally understood gesture? [Careful: mould (#680) which has two hands and soil/clay]. Primitives shape, two hands, shape 形成(けいせい): formation 形勢(けいせい): condition, situation, prospects 形態(けいたい): form, shape, figure 原形(げんけい): original form, base form 地形(じぎょう): terrain, geographical features, topography 形式(けいしき): form, formality, format, mathematics expression 形容詞(けいようし): ""true"" adjective 形容動詞(けいようどうし): adjectival noun, quasi-adjective 図形(ずけい): figure 正方形(せいほうけい): square 長方形(ちょうほうけい): rectangle, oblong 形(かたち): form, shape 人形(にんぎょう): doll Kunyomi: かた、-がた、かたち、なり Onyomi: ケイ、ギョウ Lesson: 45 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 形態 (けいたい), 形成 (けいせい), 図形 (ずけい), 形 (かた), 形 (かたち)"	"shape 形 画数7 1847 Details Story Dictionary 形 shape Heisig's Two hands . . . shape. cedar Details Story Dictionary 杉 cedar Heisig's Tree . . . shape. Koohii #1 Cedar is an evergreen tree that keeps its SHAPE all year long. That is, it doesn´t loose its needles/leaves in the winter. Koohii #2 Cedar is a wood that keeps its shape. (This is true, it's rot resistant.). ought Details Story Dictionary 須 ought Heisig's Shape . . . head. This is the only time that shape is placed to the left of its relative element, the head. Koohii #1 Why, I OUGHT to RESHAPE your HEAD... Koohii #2 Since this Kanji is exceptional, the shape ought to be on the left side. Got that into your head? "swell Details Story Dictionary 膨 swell Heisig's Part of the body . . . drum . . . shape. Compare expand (Frame 1199). Koohii #1 This kanji does not mean swell as in a inflammation. There is a different kanji for that meaning (腫れる). This kanji means swell as in, a tire swelling/expanding, your income swelling/expanding, dough swelling/expanding, etc. Johnskb's story is best b/c it does not involve swelling in the sense of inflammation, just general expansion of the stomach. STORY: ""If a PART OF your BODY begins to SWELL/EXPAND and resembles the SHAPE of a bass DRUM, you’re either pregnant or in desperate need of a diet."". Koohii #2 Which part of your body can change shape and, when it does, swells up and throbs like a drumb? Hmmm... Primitives swell, moon, month, flesh, part of the body, drum, samurai, beans, table, one, mouth, shape 膨れる(ふくれる): to get cross, to get sulky, to swell (out), to expand, to be inflated, to distend, to bulge 膨脹(ぼうちょう): expansion, swelling, increase, growth 膨らます(ふくらます): swell, expand, inflate, bulge 膨らむ(ふくらむ): expand, get big, become inflated 膨大(ぼうだい): huge, bulky, enormous, extensive, swelling, expansion Kunyomi: ふく.らむ、ふく.れる Onyomi: ボウ Lesson: 45 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 膨らむ (ふく.らむ), 膨れる (ふく.れる)"	"swell 膨 画数16 1855 Details Story Dictionary 膨 swell Heisig's Part of the body . . . drum . . . shape. I hope he will be all right! Koohii #2 Whenever the postman has to pay a visit to this place, he brings an elbow-shaped thingy that he throws to the St. Bernard. discipline Details Story Dictionary 修 discipline Heisig's Person . . . walking stick . . . taskmaster . . . shape. Koohii #1 Mr. T is a harsh taskmaster who will discipline you (beat you into shape) with his walking stick. Koohii #2 You may not have known it, but Mr. T is into discispline. Not just self discipline, in order to get into shape, but what he really likes is when the Task master spanks him with her walking stick. Don´t tell Mr. T I told you. I pity da fool, and da fool would be me!!! Primitives discipline, person, stick, fred astaire, taskmaster, shape 改修(かいしゅう): repair, improvement 修学(しゅうがく): learning 修行(しゅうぎょう): pursuit of knowledge, studying, learning, training, ascetic practice, discipline 修士(しゅうし): Masters degree program 修飾(しゅうしょく): ornamentation, embellishment, decoration, adornment, polish up (writing), modification (gram) 修了(しゅうりょう): completion (of a course) 専修(せんしゅう): specialization 必修(ひっしゅう): required (subject) 研修(けんしゅう): training 修正(しゅうせい): amendment, correction, revision 修繕(しゅうぜん): repair, mending 修理(しゅうり): repairing, mending Kunyomi: おさ.める、おさ.まる Onyomi: シュウ、シュ Lesson: 45 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 修飾 (しゅうしょく), 修養 (しゅうよう), 改修 (かいしゅう), 修まる (おさ.まる), 修める (おさ.める)	discipline 修 画数10 1858 Details Story Dictionary 修 discipline Heisig's Person . . . walking stick . . . taskmaster . . . shape. Not just self discipline, in order to get into shape, but what he really likes is when the Task master spanks him with her walking stick. Don´t tell Mr. T I told you. I pity da fool, and da fool would be me!!! Primitives discipline, person, stick, fred astaire, taskmaster, shape 改修(かいしゅう): repair, improvement 修学(しゅうがく): learning 修行(しゅうぎょう): pursuit of knowledge, studying, learning, training, ascetic practice, discipline 修士(しゅうし): Masters degree program 修飾(しゅうしょく): ornamentation, embellishment, decoration, adornment, polish up (writing), modification (gram) 修了(しゅうりょう): completion (of a course) 専修(せんしゅう): specialization 必修(ひっしゅう): required (subject) 研修(けんしゅう): training 修正(しゅうせい): amendment, correction, revision 修繕(しゅうぜん): repair, mending 修理(しゅうり): repairing, mending Kunyomi: おさ.める、おさ.まる Onyomi: シュウ、シュ Lesson: 45 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 修飾 (しゅうしょく), 修養 (しゅうよう), 改修 (かいしゅう), 修まる (おさ.まる), 修める (おさ.める)
"rare Details Story Dictionary 珍 rare Heisig's Jewel . . . umbrella . . . shape. Koohii #1 It's rare to see the king carrying his own parasol - typically he gets one of his attendants to do it for him (thanks to Katsuo for umbrella + shape = parasol and to Peppi for the story idea). Koohii #2 Tip: umbrella + shape : This combination of primitives appears four times in Heisig, so it may be worthwhile giving it a name. I suggest ""parasol"" (because it is the same shape as an umbrella). REF: rare (FRAME 1723) , check-up (#1724), measles (#2574), fallible (#2720). Primitives rare, king, jewel, ball, parasol, umbrella, shape 珍しい(めずらしい): unusual, strange Kunyomi: めずら.しい、たから Onyomi: チン Lesson: 45 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 珍しい (めずら.しい)"	"rare 珍 画数9 1859 Details Story Dictionary 珍 rare Heisig's Jewel . . . umbrella . . . shape. "checkup Details Story Dictionary 診 checkup Heisig's Words . . . umbrella . . . shape. The key word refers to a medical examination. Koohii #1 At my last check-up, the doctor said to me: ""Start carrying a parasol, or you might get skin cancer. You've been tanning too much!"" [Umbrella over shape = parasol]. Koohii #2 The doctor at my checkup was expressing words of concern about my umbrella shaped gut. Primitives check up, say, words, keitai, mouth, parasol, umbrella, shape 診療(しんりょう): medical examination and treatment, diagnosis 聴診器(ちょうしんき): stethoscope 診察(しんさつ): medical examination 診断(しんだん): diagnosis 診る(みる): (medicine) examine Kunyomi: み.る Onyomi: シン Lesson: 45 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 診る (み.る)"	"checkup 診 画数12 1860 Details Story Dictionary 診 checkup Heisig's Words . . . umbrella . . . shape. sentence Details Story Dictionary 文 sentence Heisig's Under the familiar top hat we see a crisscross pattern or design, like that found on woodwork or garments. This should make an ugly enough image to help remember it. It can be associated with sentence by thinking of a sentence as a grammatical pattern. * The primitive meaning for this character will be plaid, the familiar crisscross pattern frequently used in textiles. Koohii #1 A twist on greenapple: The teacher puts a tophat on all pupils with gramatically correct sentences, while the rest are left with a big red X on their homework. Koohii #2 The teacher in the tophat puts an X on all the grammatically incorrect sentences. Primitives sentence, plaid, kilt, Billy Connolly 原文(げんぶん): the text, original 注文(ちゅうもん): order, request 文(ふみ): letter, writings 文化財(ぶんかざい): cultural assets, cultural property 文語(ぶんご): written language, literary language 文書(ぶんしょ): document, writing, letter, note, records, archives 本文(ほんぶん): text (of document), body (of letter) 文字(もじ): letter (of alphabet), character 和文(わぶん): Japanese text, sentence in Japanese 英文(えいぶん): sentence in English 人文科学(じんぶんかがく): social sciences, humanities 文(ぶん): sentence 文芸(ぶんげい): literature, art and literature 文献(ぶんけん): literature, books (reference) 文章(ぶんしょう): sentence, article 文体(ぶんたい): literary style 文房具(ぶんぼうぐ): stationery 文脈(ぶんみゃく): context 文明(ぶんめい): civilization, culture 文句(もんく): phrase, complaint 論文(ろんぶん): thesis, essay, treatise, paper 文化(ぶんか): culture 文学(ぶんがく): literature 文法(ぶんぽう): grammar 作文(さくぶん): composition, writing Kunyomi: ふみ、あや Onyomi: ブン、モン Lesson: 45 Jouyou: 1 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds: 文学 (ぶんがく), 文化 (ぶんか), 作文 (さくぶん), 文 (ふみ)	sentence 文 画数4 1861 Details Story Dictionary 文 sentence Heisig's Under the familiar top hat we see a crisscross pattern or design, like that found on woodwork or garments. "adjusted Details Story Dictionary 斉 adjusted My Story His *SENTENCES* ADJUSTED the *LADDER* Koohii #1 The Scotsman goalkeeper adjusted himself. He reached down and adjusted the two things between his skinny fencepost legs. Koohii #2 HINT: this kanji as a primitive can mean goalkeeper. The ""fence posts"" are goalposts, and the two goalkeepers wear plaid uniforms (this kanji also means uniform as in even), making them uniform with each other and distinguishing them as goalkeepers from the rest of the team. "purification Details Story Dictionary 斎 purification Heisig's Plaid . . . fenceposts . . . altar. This is a ""religious"" purification, which distinguishes it from the simple kanji for pure (Frame 1659). Koohii #1 Purification? I think of Japanese during new year's eve praying(saying sentences) in front of Itsukushima's shrine torii(fenceposts) and its altar. They expect to enter the new year totally purified. Koohii #2 Kind of vulgar, but here the SCOTSMAN got tired of adjusting himself so decided try PURIFICATION. Sadly, he did it by straddling the ALTAR with his skinny LEGS. solemn Details Story Dictionary 粛 solemn Heisig's Rake . . . rice . . . fenceposts. Take special care to draw this character in the same order as the primitive. Note too, that the fourth stroke for rice is already taken care of by the fourth stroke of rake. Koohii #1 Even though it´s a maddening task, the monks stay solemn as they rake rice between the fenceposts. Koohii #2 Note: This is not sieve as it has a full rice and not rice grains and the hook is missing from rake. Also the given stroke order is incorrect (fenceposts should come last). Primitives solemn, rake, fenceposts, cabers, rice Kunyomi: つつし.む Onyomi: シュク、スク Lesson: 45 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	solemn 粛 画数11 1870 Details Story Dictionary 粛 solemn Heisig's Rake . . . rice . . . fenceposts. bases Details Story Dictionary 塁 bases Heisig's The kanji of this frame refers to the four bases that are placed at the corners of a baseball infield. The elements: field . . . sparkler . . . ground. Koohii #1 Playing baseball in a rice field with sparklers stuck into the ground to act as bases. Koohii #2 The traditional New Year´s baseball game in Japan is held at midnight in a rice field. They stick sparklers in the ground for the bases so they can be seen, and to be more festive. Primitives bases, rice field, brains, sparkler, soil, dirt, ground Kunyomi: とりで Onyomi: ルイ、ライ、スイ Lesson: 45 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	bases 塁 画数12 1871 Details Story Dictionary 塁 bases Heisig's The kanji of this frame refers to the four bases that are placed at the corners of a baseball infield. ratio Details Story Dictionary 率 ratio Heisig's Mysterious . . . sparkler . . . ten. Do not confuse with proportion (Frame 1673). Koohii #1 It´s quite mysterious how each sparkler gives of sparkles at a precise ratio of ten to one. Physicists have been studying this effect for decades, known as the Sparkler Effect, and using it to explain why stars look like sparklers in the night sky. Koohii #2 It's mysterious how there's always a ratio of ten sparklers to one package. Primitives ratio, mysterious, question mark, top hat, cocoon, sparkler, ten, needle 軽率(けいそつ): rash, thoughtless, careless, hasty 効率(こうりつ): efficiency 率直(そっちょく): frankness, candour, openheartedness 統率(とうそつ): command, lead, generalship, leadership 倍率(ばいりつ): diameter, magnification 率いる(ひきいる): to lead, to spearhead (a group), to command (troops) 比率(ひりつ): ratio, proportion, percentage 確率(かくりつ): probability 能率(のうりつ): efficiency 率(りつ): rate, ratio, proportion, percentage Kunyomi: ひき.いる Onyomi: ソツ、リツ、シュツ Lesson: 45 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 率先 (そっせん), 引率 (いんそつ), 軽率 (けいそつ), 率いる (ひき.いる)	ratio 率 画数11 1874 Details Story Dictionary 率 ratio Heisig's Mysterious . . . sparkler . . . ten. Do not confuse with proportion (Frame 1673). Koohii #1 It´s quite mysterious how each sparkler gives of sparkles at a precise ratio of ten to one. Physicists have been studying this effect for decades, known as the Sparkler Effect, and using it to explain why stars look like sparklers in the night sky. Koohii #2 It's mysterious how there's always a ratio of ten sparklers to one package. Primitives ratio, mysterious, question mark, top hat, cocoon, sparkler, ten, needle 軽率(けいそつ): rash, thoughtless, careless, hasty 効率(こうりつ): efficiency 率直(そっちょく): frankness, candour, openheartedness 統率(とうそつ): command, lead, generalship, leadership 倍率(ばいりつ): diameter, magnification 率いる(ひきいる): to lead, to spearhead (a group), to command (troops) 比率(ひりつ): ratio, proportion, percentage 確率(かくりつ): probability 能率(のうりつ): efficiency 率(りつ): rate, ratio, proportion, percentage Kunyomi: ひき.いる Onyomi: ソツ、リツ、シュツ Lesson: 45 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 率先 (そっせん), 引率 (いんそつ), 軽率 (けいそつ), 率いる (ひき.いる)
"astringent Details Story Dictionary 渋 astringent Heisig's Water . . . footprint . . . sparkler. Koohii #1 I think that Heisig meant this as the ""slightly bitter but fresh"" meaning that it can have to describe foods like lemons (しぶい). So imagine a guy trying a cocktail (water), feeling like he´s been kicked in the face (footprint) and sparks are flying from his tongue. ´How did it taste?´. ´Hmm, yes, slightly bitter, but fresh"". Koohii #2 If you eat something astringent water will stop the sparkly sensation in your mouth. Primitives astringent, water, water droplets, water pistol, stop, footprint, sparkler 渋い(しぶい): tasteful (clothing), ""cool"", an aura of refined masculinity, astringent, sullen, bitter (taste), grim, quiet, sober, stingy 渋滞(じゅうたい): congestion (e.g. traffic), delay, stagnation Kunyomi: しぶ、しぶ.い、しぶ.る Onyomi: ジュウ、シュウ Lesson: 45 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 渋 (しぶ), 渋い (しぶ.い), 渋る (しぶ.る)"	"astringent 渋 画数11 1875 Details Story Dictionary 渋 astringent Heisig's Water . . . footprint . . . sparkler. reflect / project Details Story Dictionary 映 reflect / project My Story [Sun/day + central {央}] Can also mean #project#. Picture a rudimentary cinema (映画) where the *sun* is #projected/reflected# into the *center* of the screen. Koohii #1 In the solar system, the Sun is the central source of all light, everything else just reflects it. Koohii #2 A solar power plant consists of thousands of mirrors reflecting the sun´s rays, concentrating the energy on a focal point at the centre. See here: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Solar_Two. Primitives reflect, sun, day, centre, center, large, St. Bernard 映写(えいしゃ): projection 映像(えいぞう): reflection, image 映える(はえる): to shine, to look attractive, to look pretty 映す(うつす): project, reflect, cast (shadow) 映る(うつる): be reflected, harmonize with 反映(はんえい): reflection, influence 映画(えいが): movie, film 映画館(えいがかん): movie theatre (theater), cinema Kunyomi: うつ.る、うつ.す、は.える、-ば.え Onyomi: エイ Lesson: 45 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds: 映す (うつ.す), 映る (うつ.る), 映える (は.える)	reflect / project 映 画数9 1879 Details Story Dictionary 映 reflect / project My Story [Sun/day + central {央}] Can also mean #project#. red Details Story Dictionary 赤 red Heisig's Ground . . . dagger . . . little. The two strokes of the dagger take the place of the middle stroke of little. * As a primitive on the left, this kanji keeps the same form. Elsewhere, the first two strokes are abbreviated to a single dot. This latter form will take the meaning of an apple. Koohii #1 He was stabbed with a dagger, and little drops of red blood dropped onto the ground. Koohii #2 There was red all over the soil after Little Red Riding Hood plunged a dagger into the wolf. Those two dots we see are wolfies animal legs we see, by the way (a la smithsonian). color Details Story Dictionary 色 color Heisig's Bound up . . . mosaic. Koohii #1 Ever look closely at mosaics? They contain a bunch of images bound up into a larger one. It seems amazing until you realize that the only quality of the smaller images that really matters is their colour. Koohii #2 Bound up in the Rubik´s cube are the 6 different colours. Primitives color, bound up, mosaic 色々(いろいろ): various 黄色(おうしょく): yellow 音色(おんいろ): tone color, tone quality, timbre, synthesizer patch 脚色(きゃくしょく): dramatization (e.g. film) 色彩(しきさい): colour, hue, tints 着色(ちゃくしょく): colouring, coloring 黄色(きいろ): the color yellow (noun) 茶色い(ちゃいろい): brown (adjective) 特色(とくしょく): characteristic, feature 灰色(はいいろ): grey, ashen 景色(けしき): scenery 色(いろ): color, sensuality, lust 黄色い(きいろい): yellow 茶色(ちゃいろ): light brown, tawny Kunyomi: いろ Onyomi: ショク、シキ Lesson: 45 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds: 原色 (げんしょく), 特色 (とくしょく), 物色 (ぶっしょく), 色 (いろ)	color 色 画数6 1890 Details Story Dictionary 色 color Heisig's Bound up . . . mosaic. It seems amazing until you realize that the only quality of the smaller images that really matters is their colour. Koohii #2 Bound up in the Rubik´s cube are the 6 different colours. discontinue Details Story Dictionary 絶 discontinue My Story They discontinued my favorite *thread* *color*, how will I sew this patch ? Koohii #1 I can't finish my sewing project because the thread color I was using was discontinued. Koohii #2 As times move on and fashion tastes inevitably change, threads of certain colors often get discontinued. Primitives discontinue, thread, spiderman, colour, color, bound up, mosaic 拒絶(きょぜつ): refusal, rejection 謝絶(しゃぜつ): refusal 絶版(ぜっぱん): out of print 絶望(ぜつぼう): despair, hopelessness 絶える(たえる): to die out, to peter out, to become extinct 絶つ(たつ): to sever, to cut off, to suppress, to abstain (from) 途絶える(とだえる): to stop, to cease, to come to an end 絶対(ぜったい): absolute, unconditional, absoluteness 絶滅(ぜつめつ): destruction, extinction 絶えず(たえず): constantly Kunyomi: た.える、た.やす、た.つ Onyomi: ゼツ Lesson: 45 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 絶える (た.える), 絶つ (た.つ), 絶やす (た.やす)	discontinue 絶 画数12 1891 Details Story Dictionary 絶 discontinue My Story They discontinued my favorite *thread* *color*, how will I sew this patch ? fertilizer Details Story Dictionary 肥 fertilizer Heisig's Flesh . . . mosaic. Koohii #1 PART OF YOUR BODY excretes something that is commonly used for FERTILIZER. Sometimes this process is slow, so you solve a RUBIK´S CUBE while you sit and wait. Koohii #2 If you´re sick, a part of your body may produce fertilizer that makes a colorful mosaic. Primitives fertilizer, moon, month, flesh, part of the body, mosaic 肥料(ひりょう): manure, fertilizer Kunyomi: こ.える、こえ、こ.やす、こ.やし、ふと.る Onyomi: ヒ Lesson: 45 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 肥える (こ.える), 肥やし (こ.やし), 肥やす (こ.やす), 肥 (こえ)	fertilizer 肥 画数8 1893 Details Story Dictionary 肥 fertilizer Heisig's Flesh . . . mosaic. sweet Details Story Dictionary 甘 sweet Heisig's This kanji is a pictograph of a small wicker basket. (The extra short stroke in the middle helps keep it distinct from the character for twenty.) All one needs to add is some image of sweet cakes or breads carried in the basket, and the union of picture and meaning is complete. Take care not to confuse with confectionary (Frame 1203). * As a primitive, the pictograph's meaning of a wicker basket is used, a small one like the kind used for picnics. Koohii #1 Little red riding hood is carrying around a wicker basket filled with sweet baked cookies for granny. Koohii #2 Girls are kinda sweet and sexy until they reach their twenties. So 20 minus ONE. Primitives sweet, wicker basket, picnic basket 甘える(あまえる): to behave like a spoiled child, to fawn on 甘口(あまくち): sweet flavour, mildness, flattery, stupidity 甘い(うまい): delicious 甘やかす(あまやかす): pamper, spoil 甘い(あまい): delicious Kunyomi: あま.い、あま.える、あま.やかす、うま.い Onyomi: カン Lesson: 46 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 甘い (あま.い), 甘える (あま.える), 甘やかす (あま.やかす)	sweet 甘 画数5 1894 Details Story Dictionary 甘 sweet Heisig's This kanji is a pictograph of a small wicker basket. (The extra short stroke in the middle helps keep it distinct from the character for twenty.) All one needs to add is some image of sweet cakes or breads carried in the basket, and the union of picture and meaning is complete. Take care not to confuse with confectionary (Frame 1203). * As a primitive, the pictograph's meaning of a wicker basket is used, a small one like the kind used for picnics. Koohii #1 Little red riding hood is carrying around a wicker basket filled with sweet baked cookies for granny. Koohii #2 Girls are kinda sweet and sexy until they reach their twenties. navy blue Details Story Dictionary 紺 navy blue Heisig's Thread . . . wicker basket. Koohii #1 Thanks raulir - As many Japanese perverts know, navy blue threads conceal school girl sweetness underneath. Koohii #2 Much like Violet Beauregarde from Charlie and the Chocolate Factory, Spiderman failed to heed Willy Wonka´s warnings, and upon chewing on the 3 course meal chewing gum turned a very navy shade of navy blue. Primitives navy blue, thread, spiderman, sweet, wicker basket, picnic basket 紺(こん): navy blue, deep blue Kunyomi: Onyomi: コン Lesson: 46 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	navy blue 紺 画数11 1895 Details Story Dictionary 紺 navy blue Heisig's Thread . . . wicker basket. so-and-so Details Story Dictionary 某 so-and-so Heisig's The key word here refers to the adjective for an unspecified person or thing. Its elements: wicker basket . . . tree. Koohii #1 I had the same idea as fuabrisu. A generic person is described here as having body sort of like a tree trunk and head sort of like a wicker basket. Koohii #2 Two girls with a lollipop in a tree gossiping´ so-and so did this.´ ´really? so-and what did she do´ ´ o she is sooo wrong..´. Primitives so-and-so, sweet, wicker basket, picnic basket, tree, wood Kunyomi: それがし、なにがし Onyomi: ボウ Lesson: 46 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	so-and-so 某 画数9 1896 Details Story Dictionary 某 so-and-so Heisig's The key word here refers to the adjective for an unspecified person or thing. "conspire Details Story Dictionary 謀 conspire Heisig's Words . . . so-and-so. Koohii #1 I imagine a clique of catty girls conspiring against a another girl...they are exchanging lots of words, chatting about how so-and-so girl is now up to such-and-such (gasp!), and how they will spread the word about it. Koohii #2 You might hear the words of someone conspiring... ""If you do so-and-so..."". Primitives conspire, say, words, keitai, mouth, so-and-so, sweet, wicker basket, picnic basket, tree, wood Kunyomi: はか.る、たばか.る、はかりごと Onyomi: ボウ、ム Lesson: 46 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 謀略 (ぼうりゃく), 無謀 (むぼう), 首謀者 (しゅぼうしゃ), 謀る (はか.る)"	"conspire 謀 画数16 1897 Details Story Dictionary 謀 conspire Heisig's Words . . . so-and-so. "mediator Details Story Dictionary 媒 mediator Heisig's Woman . . . so-and-so. Koohii #1 The woman 女 hoped her friend would act as mediator to set her up with the guy she liked. She didn't mention his name, just referred to him as ""A certain unnamed person -- I'll call him 'Mr. So-and-So 某' ...."" Koohii #2 The two little gossiping girls with their lollipops are having a fight. Now an adult woman (mom or teacher) has to come between them an serve as a mediator. deceit Details Story Dictionary 欺 deceit Heisig's Bushel basket . . . yawn. Koohii #1 He escaped using deceit. That is, he ran past while the guard was yawning and hid in the bushel basket. Koohii #2 Every day, a smuggler takes bushel baskets on donkeys across the border. But the border patrols can never arrest him for lack of evidence no matter how much they search the bushel baskets: they can´t find whatever he is smuggling. What was his deceit? He was smuggling donkeys! Primitives deceit, bushel basket, hamper, animal legs, eight, lack, yawn 欺く(あざむく): to deceive 詐欺(さぎ): fraud, swindle Kunyomi: あざむ.く Onyomi: ギ Lesson: 46 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 欺く (あざむ.く)	deceit 欺 画数12 1899 Details Story Dictionary 欺 deceit Heisig's Bushel basket . . . yawn. But the border patrols can never arrest him for lack of evidence no matter how much they search the bushel baskets: they can´t find whatever he is smuggling. What was his deceit? chess piece Details Story Dictionary 棋 chess piece Heisig's Tree . . . bushel basket. Koohii #1 Tree + Bushel Bucket: Chess pieces carved from trees were tossed into a bushel bucket for sorting into sets. Koohii #2 Ever seen those huge chess games in parks? The large wooden chess pieces need to be carted in a shopping trolley. national flag Details Story Dictionary 旗 national flag Heisig's Banner . . . bushel basket. Koohii #1 The national flag of Croatia. It's a banner with the Croatian coat of arms, commonly referred to as the Chessboard (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coat_of_arms_of_Croatia). Koohii #2 The national flag is the banner of a country; stored in a whicker basket at night and taken out to the flagpole in the morning. Primitives national flag, banner, compass, direction reclining, lying down, bushel basket, hamper, animal legs, eight 旗(はた): flag Kunyomi: はた Onyomi: キ Lesson: 46 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 旗 (はた)	national flag 旗 画数14 1901 Details Story Dictionary 旗 national flag Heisig's Banner . . . bushel basket. Koohii #2 The national flag is the banner of a country; stored in a whicker basket at night and taken out to the flagpole in the morning. period Details Story Dictionary 期 period Heisig's Bushel basket . . . month. As the month indicates, this has to do with periods of time. Koohii #1 The slowest remote chess game ever: a one month period between every move. Koohii #2 The girl´s panties are all in the bushel basket as it´s that time of the month again... her period. Primitives period, bushel basket, hamper, animal legs, eight, moon, month, flesh, part of the body 画期(かっき): epoch-making 期(き): period, time 期日(きじつ): fixed date, settlement date 期末(きまつ): end of term 周期(しゅうき): cycle, period 末期(まっき): closing years (period days), last stage 延期(えんき): postponement, adjournment 学期(がっき): school term 期間(きかん): period, term 期限(きげん): term, period 期待(きたい): expectation, anticipation, hope 時期(じき): time, season, period 短期(たんき): short term 長期(ちょうき): long time period 定期(ていき): fixed term 定期券(ていきけん): commuter pass, season ticket 予期(よき): expectation, assume will happen, forecast Kunyomi: Onyomi: キ、ゴ Lesson: 46 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 期間 (きかん), 期待 (きたい), 予期 (よき)	period 期 画数12 1902 Details Story Dictionary 期 period Heisig's Bushel basket . . . month. Koohii #2 The girl´s panties are all in the bushel basket as it´s that time of the month again... her period. Go Details Story Dictionary 碁 Go Heisig's Bushel basket . . . stones. The key word refers to the Japanese game played with black and white colored stones on a lined board. Koohii #1 Go is chess played with stones. Koohii #2 The ignorant gaijin put a rook on top of his opponent´s stone when playing Go, much to the consternation of the Japanese players. Primitives go, bushel basket, hamper, animal legs, eight, stone, rock 碁盤(ごばん): Go board 碁(ご): go (board game) Kunyomi: Onyomi: ゴ Lesson: 46 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	Go 碁 画数13 1903 Details Story Dictionary 碁 Go Heisig's Bushel basket . . . stones. Koohii #2 The ignorant gaijin put a rook on top of his opponent´s stone when playing Go, much to the consternation of the Japanese players. fundamentals Details Story Dictionary 基 fundamentals Heisig's Bushel basket . . . soil. Koohii #1 Fundamentals of chess: use the rooks to protect your ground. Koohii #2 A Bushel-basket full of earth contains the fundementals of farming. i.e. earth. tremendously Details Story Dictionary 甚 tremendously Heisig's Bushel basket . . . equal. Note how the first stroke of equal doubles up with the sixth stroke of the bushel basket, and how the animal legs of the bushel basket are dropped to make room for the human legs of equal. Koohii #1 It´s a tremendous match between the two chess-players. They are clearly eachother´s equal. Koohii #2 These two bushel baskets are tremendously huge. But not only they are huge, they are also perfectly equal in size. Primitives tremendously, bushel basket, hamper, equal, human legs 甚だ(はなはだ): very, greatly, exceedingly 甚だしい(はなはだしい): extreme, excessive, terrible, intense, severe, serious, tremendous Kunyomi: はなは.だ、はなは.だしい Onyomi: ジン Lesson: 46 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 甚だ (はなは.だ), 甚だしい (はなは.だしい)	tremendously 甚 画数9 1905 Details Story Dictionary 甚 tremendously Heisig's Bushel basket . . . equal. Note how the first stroke of equal doubles up with the sixth stroke of the bushel basket, and how the animal legs of the bushel basket are dropped to make room for the human legs of equal. Koohii #1 It´s a tremendous match between the two chess-players. They are clearly eachother´s equal. Koohii #2 These two bushel baskets are tremendously huge. But not only they are huge, they are also perfectly equal in size. Primitives tremendously, bushel basket, hamper, equal, human legs 甚だ(はなはだ): very, greatly, exceedingly 甚だしい(はなはだしい): extreme, excessive, terrible, intense, severe, serious, tremendous Kunyomi: はなは.だ、はなは.だしい Onyomi: ジン Lesson: 46 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 甚だ (はなは.だ), 甚だしい (はなは.だしい)
"intuition Details Story Dictionary 勘 intuition Heisig's Tremendously . . . muscle. Koohii #1 Intuition is a tremendously powerful resource of the mind. Koohii #2 Using Zareon´s story for the previous frame ""tremendously""... The two chessplayers who are eachother´s equals are so good at chess that they don´t have to even move a muscle. Their brain power does it for them. Furthermore, they don´t even have to think, really. Their intuition takes control. This is: extreme chess. Primitives intuition, tremendously, bushel basket, hamper, equal, human legs, power, muscle, arnold 勘弁(かんべん): pardon, forgiveness, forbearance 勘(かん): perception, intuition 勘定(かんじょう): calculation, settlement of an account, allowance 勘違い(かんちがい): misunderstanding, wrong guess Kunyomi: Onyomi: カン Lesson: 46 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"	"intuition 勘 画数11 1906 Details Story Dictionary 勘 intuition Heisig's Tremendously . . . muscle. "precious Details Story Dictionary 貴 precious Heisig's Purse . . . shells. Koohii #1 Inside your purse is all of your money and your keys (き) etc. All of your precious valuables. Koohii #2 Frodo kept the precious in the purse but did a switch with some worthless shells when he went to sleep. Heres gollum opening the purse ""ahhh my preciousssssss.....why you m***** *****!!!!!. "bequeath Details Story Dictionary 遺 bequeath Heisig's Precious . . . road. Koohii #1 Bequeath is an odd old word, isn´t it? Basically, it just deals with how I want my precious possessions dealt out, after I die, later down the road. ""Being of sound, but antiquated, mind, I bequeath this to you!"". Koohii #2 Bilbo bequeathes the ""PRECIOUS"" to Frodo, who will carry it on the long ROAD to Mordor. Primitives bequeath, precious, Takanohana, purse, in, one, floor, shellfish, clam, oyster, eye, animal legs, eight, road 遺跡(いせき): historic ruins (remains relics) Kunyomi: のこ.す Onyomi: イ、ユイ Lesson: 46 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 遺棄 (いき), 遺産 (いさん), 遺失 (いしつ)"	"bequeath 遺 画数15 1909 Details Story Dictionary 遺 bequeath Heisig's Precious . . . road. ""Being of sound, but antiquated, mind, I bequeath this to you!"". Koohii #2 Bilbo bequeathes the ""PRECIOUS"" to Frodo, who will carry it on the long ROAD to Mordor. "dispatch Details Story Dictionary 遣 dispatch Heisig's This kanji takes away the maestro's baton and replaces it with a purse. The road represents his being dispatched on his way a san obvious misfit. You will remember that when he did have his baton, he was being chased down the road by his fans. All of which shows what a difference a single stroke can make! Koohii #1 Bond has stolen a lady spy's purse while she was asleep after their evening together. When she discovers it's gone, she dispatches some henchmen on the road after him to dispatch him, but Bond evades them and escapes with the purse. Koohii #2 Apart from meaning DISPATCH, this kanji can mean ""to give (to someone lower than you),"" ""to do,"" and to even ""have intercourse."" STORY: The MAESTRO is on the ROAD waiting for a pimp to DISPATCH some new ladies (lower than him) so that he can GIVE THEM money from his PURSE and then DO IT with them. Where is the MAESTRO´S baton? You don´t wanna know... Primitives dispatch, purse, in, one, floor, maestro without baton, road 遣い(つかい): mission, simple task, doing 派遣(はけん): dispatch, send 無駄遣い(むだづかい): waste money on, squander money on, flog a dead horse 遣り通す(やりとおす): to carry through, to achieve, to complete 遣る(やる): to do, to have sexual intercourse, to kill, to give (to inferiors animals etc.), to dispatch (a letter), to send, to study, to perform, to play (sports game), to have (eat drink smoke), to row (a boat), to run or operate (a restaurant) 仮名遣い(かなづかい): kana orthography, syllabary spelling 小遣い(こづかい): personal expenses, pocket money, spending money, incidental expenses, allowance 言葉遣い(ことばづかい): speech, expression, wording Kunyomi: つか.う、-つか.い、-づか.い、つか.わす、や.る Onyomi: ケン Lesson: 46 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 遣う (つか.う), 遣わす (つか.わす)"	"dispatch 遣 画数13 1910 Details Story Dictionary 遣 dispatch Heisig's This kanji takes away the maestro's baton and replaces it with a purse. "defile Details Story Dictionary 潰 defile Heisig's Water . . . precious. Koohii #1 Man continues to defile precious water and it may prove to be his downfall (Think of Exxon, BP, etc.). Koohii #2 ...Faramir and Frodo watched the tiny creature far below. ""Shall we shoot him?"" Faramir asked. ""This Gollum has defiled the waters of the Forbidden pond, looking for his Precious, and for that the penalty is death""... Primitives defile, water, water droplets, water pistol, precious, Takanohana, purse, in, one, floor, shellfish, clam, oyster, eye, animal legs, eight 潰す(つぶす): smash, waste 潰れる(つぶれる): be smashed, go bankrupt Kunyomi: つぶ.す、つぶ.れる、つい.える Onyomi: カイ、エ Lesson: 46 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: Compounds:"	"defile 潰 画数15 1911 Details Story Dictionary 潰 defile Heisig's Water . . . precious. dance / flutter Details Story Dictionary 舞 dance / flutter My Story [Nothing/without {無} + date (evening + fuck)] Because of your poor #dancing#, you remain *without* a *date* (an evening fuck). Be careful of {踊} Koohii #1 The yakuza boss reclines in the oaken bathtub wearing his shades while his personal harem dances naked for him. Koohii #2 I learned nothingness (#1775) first because it is a very common kanji. Probably easier to think of this kanji in that context. Attractive dancers should dance wearing nothing but sunglasses. Primitives dance, reclining, lying down, tub, sunglasses, dancing legs, ballerina, evening 仕舞(しまい): end, termination, informal (Noh play) 仕舞う(しまう): to finish, to close, to do something completely, to put away, to put an end to 舞う(まう): to dance, to flutter about, to revolve 見舞(みまい): enquiry, expression of sympathy, expression of concern 舞台(ぶたい): stage (theatre), scene or setting (e.g. of novel, play, etc.) 振舞う(ふるまう): behave, conduct oneself, entertain 見舞い(みまい): enquiry, expression of sympathy or concern 見舞う(みまう): ask after (health), visit お見舞い(おみまい): asking after (a person´s health) Kunyomi: ま.う、-ま.う、まい Onyomi: ブ Lesson: 46 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 舞い (ま.い), 舞う (ま.う)	dance / flutter 舞 画数15 1912 Details Story Dictionary 舞 dance / flutter My Story [Nothing/without {無} + date (evening + fuck)] Because of your poor #dancing#, you remain *without* a *date* (an evening fuck). nothingness Details Story Dictionary 無 nothingness Heisig's This character is the Japanese character for the supreme philosophical principle of much Oriental thought: nothingness. Make use of the oaken tub from the previous frame, and add to that the oven fire at the bottom. Koohii #1 When I enter the wooden tub heated by flames in the onsen, I can let all my worries slip away and be submerged into nothingness. Koohii #2 In a hot tub you can relax and have your stress vanish into nothingness. Primitives nothingness, reclining, lying down, tub, oven-fire, barbecue 感無量(かんむりょう): deep feeling, inexpressible feeling, filled with emotion ご無沙汰(ごぶさた): not writing or contacting for a while 台無し(だいなし): mess, spoiled, (come to) nothing 無難(ぶなん): safety, security 無礼(ぶれい): impolite, rude 無意味(むいみ): nonsense, no meaning 無口(むくち): reticence 無効(むこう): invalid, no effect, unavailable 無言(むごん): silence 無邪気(むじゃき): innocence, simple-mindedness 無線(むせん): wireless, radio 無駄遣い(むだづかい): waste money on, squander money on, flog a dead horse 無断(むだん): without permission, without notice 無知(むち): ignorance 無茶(むちゃ): absurd, unreasonable, excessive, rash, absurdity, nonsense 無茶苦茶(むちゃくちゃ): confused, jumbled, mixed up, unreasonable 無念(むねん): chagrin, regret 無能(むのう): inefficiency, incompetence 無闇に(むやみに): unreasonably, absurdly, recklessly, indiscreetly, at random 無用(むよう): useless, futility, needlessness, unnecessariness 無論(むろん): of course, naturally 有無(うむ): yes or no, existence, presence or absence marker 無し(なし): without 無沙汰(ぶさた): neglecting to stay in contact 無事(ぶじ): safety, peace, quietness 無(む): nothing, nil, zero 無限(むげん): infinite 無視(むし): disregard, ignore 無地(むじ): plain, unfigured 無数(むすう): countless number, infinite number 無駄(むだ): futility, uselessness 無料(むりょう): free, no charge 無くす(なくす): lose 無くなる(なくなる): be lost 無理(むり): compulsion Kunyomi: な.い Onyomi: ム、ブ Lesson: 46 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: Compounds: 無名 (むめい), 無理 (むり), 皆無 (かいむ), 無い (な.い)	nothingness 無 画数12 1913 Details Story Dictionary 無 nothingness Heisig's This character is the Japanese character for the supreme philosophical principle of much Oriental thought: nothingness. association Details Story Dictionary 組 association Heisig's Thread . . . shelf. Koohii #1 A common thread associates the knick-knacks on your knick-knack shelf. Souveneirs from Spain on one, from Japan on the other. Koohii #2 Watch this: http://i146.photobucket.com/albums/r249/sith_lord10/updated%20showroom%20july/s29.jpg The leader of the Spiderman association has tons of Spiderman figurines lined up on his shelf.(Zactacular). coarse Details Story Dictionary 粗 coarse Heisig's Rice . . . shelf. Koohii #1 Japanese carpenters don't use sandpaper, they use rice-paper(rice glued on to some paper). Here the carpenter is using the coarse paper to smooth out the shelf he's making. Koohii #2 Ugh, why does this shelf feel so coarse? Because it´s made of rice, of coarse! Get it? Of coarse?? Hahahahahahahahahah god i hate my life. Primitives coarse, rice, shelf, my bookshelves 粗筋(あらすじ): outline, summary 粗い(あらい): coarse, rough 粗末(そまつ): crude, rough, plain, humble Kunyomi: あら.い、あら- Onyomi: ソ Lesson: 47 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 粗い (あら.い)	coarse 粗 画数11 1915 Details Story Dictionary 粗 coarse Heisig's Rice . . . shelf. tariff Details Story Dictionary 租 tariff Heisig's Wheat . . . shelf. Koohii #1 The EU and US impose such high tariffs on food imports that third world wheat (the most basic of staples) never reaches first world supermarket shelves. Koohii #2 According to Henshall, this kanji originally represented the harvested rice (the wheat primitive) that farmers paid as a tithe. Its meaning today would seem to be very similar. Imagine the farmer putting aside some of his harvested wheat on a shelf in order to pay the tariff to his lord. Primitives tariff, wheat, cereal, shelf, my bookshelves Kunyomi: Onyomi: ソ Lesson: 47 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	tariff 租 画数10 1916 Details Story Dictionary 租 tariff Heisig's Wheat . . . shelf. Koohii #1 The EU and US impose such high tariffs on food imports that third world wheat (the most basic of staples) never reaches first world supermarket shelves. Koohii #2 According to Henshall, this kanji originally represented the harvested rice (the wheat primitive) that farmers paid as a tithe. Its meaning today would seem to be very similar. Imagine the farmer putting aside some of his harvested wheat on a shelf in order to pay the tariff to his lord. Primitives tariff, wheat, cereal, shelf, my bookshelves Kunyomi: Onyomi: ソ Lesson: 47 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:

best regards Details Story Dictionary 宜 best regards Heisig's This kanji, a polite way of expressing one's best regards to another. Its elements: house . . . shelf. Koohii #1 It seems like every time my Japanese friends send me their best regards, they accompany them with a gift. Over time, I´ve gotten so many that I had to buy a second house which contains nothing but several fancy shelves. Each shelf is dedicated to a certain friend of mine and contains every last one of their presents. Koohii #2 We have a shelf in our house where we put Christmas cards from people who send best regards for the holiday season...　　　　　　　　　　　RTK2:　ギ　便宜主義　べんぎしゅぎ(opportunism). tatami mat Details Story Dictionary 畳 tatami mat Heisig's Rice field . . . crown . . . shelf. Koohii #1 The king is peacefully sleeping on his new tatami mat when all of a sudden a shelf falls over and kills him. You can see his crown poking out and the brains splatter out the top of his head from all the pressure. Koohii #2 Making tatami mats from rice field waste was Japan´s crowning achievement, but for some reason other countries just shelved the idea. Primitives tatami mat, rice field, brains, crown, shelf, my bookshelves 畳(じょう): counter for tatami mats, measure of room size (in mat units) 畳む(たたむ): fold (clothes) 畳(たたみ): tatami mat Kunyomi: たた.む、たたみ、かさ.なる Onyomi: ジョウ、チョウ Lesson: 47 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 畳む (たた.む), 畳 (たたみ)	tatami mat 畳 画数12 1923 Details Story Dictionary 畳 tatami mat Heisig's Rice field . . . crown . . . shelf. "row Details Story Dictionary 並 row My Story The Row-man numeral II with two rows of *animal horns*. * The primitive meaning remains the same as that of the kanji, but special attention has to be given to the varieties of shape this element can undergo. It is the most difficult one you will meet in this book. When it appears BENEATH its relative primitive, the top three strokes are omitted, though the third horizontal stroke may be doubled up with the bottom horizontal stroke of the element above it. ATOP its relative primitive, it can keep its kanji shape. When it does not, the top three strokes are removed and all of them are replaced BELOW the primitive's bottom line. We shall acknowledge this latter transformation by changing its meaning to upside down in a row. Koohii #1 This is a simplification of 竝, a ideogram of two people standing in a row. Koohii #2 Hint : as a primitive I use the image of a rowing boat. In a rowing boat people sit in rows, but also side-by-side (another meaning of the kanji), working together (yet another meaning of this kanji). Note : there will also be a kanji for ""rowboat"" coming at frame 1876. The rowing boat is associated with the sport, and is a primitive, while the kanji for ""rowboat"" has a generic meaning of ""a small boat"". In any case, the kanji for ""rowboat"" will not appear as a primitive in the book. Primitives row 月並み(つきなみ): every month, common 並み(なみ): average, medium, common, ordinary 並びに(ならびに): and 軒並み(のきなみ): row of houses 並列(へいれつ): arrangement, parallel, abreast 並木(なみき): roadside tree, row of trees 並行(へいこう): (going) side by side, concurrent, abreast, at the same time, occurring together, parallel, parallelism 並ぶ(ならぶ): line up, stand in a line 並べる(ならべる): line up, set up Kunyomi: な.み、なら.べる、なら.ぶ、なら.びに Onyomi: ヘイ、ホウ Lesson: 47 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 並 (なみ), 並びに (なら.びに), 並ぶ (なら.ぶ), 並べる (なら.べる)"	"row 並 画数8 1924 Details Story Dictionary 並 row My Story The Row-man numeral II with two rows of *animal horns*. * The primitive meaning remains the same as that of the kanji, but special attention has to be given to the varieties of shape this element can undergo. universal Details Story Dictionary 普 universal Heisig's Row . . . sun. Koohii #1 A row of suns is actually a normal, plain, and ordinary occurrence in an infinitely large and expanding universe. FUtsuu. Koohii #2 To me, row is way too close to file (#812), so I´m adopting Fab´s meaning of rowboat from the previous frame. Universal Studios went through a number of logo animations before settling on the one they are most famous for: the letters UNIVERSAL orbiting the Earth. One of the most ridiculous of these involved a man rowing himself in a boat around the sun. Primitives universal, row, sun, day 普遍(ふへん): universality, ubiquity, omnipresence 普及(ふきゅう): diffusion, spread 普段(ふだん): usually, habitually, ordinarily, always 普通(ふつう): normally, usually Kunyomi: あまね.く、あまねし Onyomi: フ Lesson: 47 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 2 Compounds:	universal 普 画数12 1925 Details Story Dictionary 普 universal Heisig's Row . . . sun. Koohii #1 You first wash you clothes with water and wring them until they are just damp before hanging them in a row under the sun to dry. If you don´t wring them damp first they will take days to dry! Koohii #2 If your things are damp, lay them up in a row under the sun and let the water evaporate. slender Details Story Dictionary 繊 slender Heisig's Thread . . . Thanksgiving . . . row. Koohii #1 At the end of Thanksgiving it's tradition for everyone to stand in a row and measure their waist with a strip of thread. Whoever is the most slender wins the leftovers. Koohii #2 At the time of Thanksgiving, there´s a row of all sorts of food on the table, which you mustn´t eat if you want to stay as slender as a thread. "spirits Details Story Dictionary 霊 spirits Heisig's Rain . . . two . . . row. This character will refer only to the inhabitants of the ""spirit world,"" and not to moods or temperaments, for which we will learn another character in frame 2030. Koohii #1 After raining for two days in a row, you plead with the SPIRITS for some relief. (Adapted from johnskb,21-5-2006). Koohii #2 When it rains, two worlds come together and spirits can be seen in the forest, dancing in a row. profession Details Story Dictionary 業 profession Heisig's In a row upside down . . . not yet. Koohii #1 The oldest profession: prostitution. I was once in a brothel in Amsterdam where the working girls had a group of businessmen blindfolded and hanging upside down in a row, not yet spanked and whipped, but waiting eagerly. Koohii #2 A bunch of kids are hanging upside down in a row on the monkeybars. Naturally, they haven't chosen a profession, at least not yet. Primitives business, profession, upside down in a row, not yet, tree, wood 業者(ぎょうしゃ): trader, merchant 業績(ぎょうせき): achievement, performance, results, work, contribution 業務(ぎょうむ): business, affairs, duties, work 兼業(けんぎょう): side line, second business 業(ごう): Buddhist karma, actions committed in a former life 興業(こうぎょう): industrial enterprise 鉱業(こうぎょう): mining industry 事業(じぎょう): project, enterprise, business, industry, operations 実業家(じつぎょうか): industrialist, businessman 就業(しゅうぎょう): employment, starting work 従業員(じゅうぎょういん): employee, worker 分業(ぶんぎょう): division of labor, specialization, assembly-line production 林業(りんぎょう): forestry 営業(えいぎょう): business, trade, sales, operations 企業(きぎょう): enterprise, undertaking 休業(きゅうぎょう): closed (e.g. store), business suspended, shutdown, holiday 漁業(ぎょぎょう): fishing (industry) 作業(さぎょう): work, operation, manufacturing, fatigue duty 産業(さんぎょう): industry 失業(しつぎょう): unemployment 商業(しょうぎょう): commerce, trade, business 職業(しょくぎょう): occupation, business 農業(のうぎょう): agriculture 工業(こうぎょう): industry 卒業(そつぎょう): graduate 授業(じゅぎょう): lesson, class work Kunyomi: わざ Onyomi: ギョウ、ゴウ Lesson: 47 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds: 業績 (ぎょうせき), 職業 (しょくぎょう), 卒業 (そつぎょう), 業 (わざ)	profession 業 画数13 1931 Details Story Dictionary 業 profession Heisig's In a row upside down . . . not yet. slap Details Story Dictionary 撲 slap Heisig's Fingers . . . upside down in a row . . . husbands. Koohii #1 After a row husbands take their wives upsides down over the knee and slap them with their fingers on the bottom (if that doesn´t get me banned…). Koohii #2 Here we have badly behaving HUSBANDs, whose wives have had them hung UPSIDE DOWN IN A ROW. Each wife approaches her HUSBAND, berates him, gives him a sharp SLAP in the face and, Three-Stooges style, pokes him in the eyes with her FINGERS. Primitives slap, finger, fingers, upside down in a row, husband 相撲(すもう): sumo wrestling Kunyomi: Onyomi: ボク Lesson: 47 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	slap 撲 画数15 1932 Details Story Dictionary 撲 slap Heisig's Fingers . . . upside down in a row . . . husbands. "me Details Story Dictionary 僕 me My Story [Person + Hedgehog + Horny King + legs] I am a *person* who likes *hedgehogs* and the *2 legged* *horny king* Koohii #1 Mr. T also finds himself as one of the HUSBANDs, whose wives have had them hung UPSIDE DOWN IN A ROW. But when his wife comes up to punish him, he pleads, “It’s ME, Baby. I wasn’t behaving badly like these other foo’s.”. Koohii #2 Building on johnskb: Although it goes against the Heisig method, this story is a lot easier to remember when you know it´s the kanji for ""boku."" Males usually use either ""boku"" or ""ore"" (instead of ""watashi"") to refer themselves. ""Boku"" is slightly boyish and soft; ""ore"" is rough & tough. Mr. T would definitely use ""ore"" -- but when he´s one of the husbands hung upside down in a row about to be punished by his wife, he puts on a sweet act and switches to ""boku"" when he pleads ""come on baby, it´s ME!"". Primitives me, person, upside down in a row, husband 僕(しもべ): manservant, servant (of God) 僕(ぼく): I (used by men with close acquaintances) Kunyomi: しもべ Onyomi: ボク Lesson: 47 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"	"me 僕 画数14 1933 Details Story Dictionary 僕 me My Story [Person + Hedgehog + Horny King + legs] I am a *person* who likes *hedgehogs* and the *2 legged* *horny king* Koohii #1 Mr. T also finds himself as one of the HUSBANDs, whose wives have had them hung UPSIDE DOWN IN A ROW. But when his wife comes up to punish him, he pleads, “It’s ME, Baby. I wasn’t behaving badly like these other foo’s.”. Koohii #2 Building on johnskb: Although it goes against the Heisig method, this story is a lot easier to remember when you know it´s the kanji for ""boku."" Males usually use either ""boku"" or ""ore"" (instead of ""watashi"") to refer themselves. ""Boku"" is slightly boyish and soft; ""ore"" is rough & tough. Mr. T would definitely use ""ore"" -- but when he´s one of the husbands hung upside down in a row about to be punished by his wife, he puts on a sweet act and switches to ""boku"" when he pleads ""come on baby, it´s ME!"". together Details Story Dictionary 共 together My Story A fence with 2 legs that are together is moving on legs! WTF * The primitive retains the meaning of together. Imagine things strung together like fish on a line, beads on a thread, or whatever. The main thing is to avoid putting them in a straight row, which would confound this element with the previous one. As we saw with bushel basket, this primitive can join its legs to the final horizontal stroke and stretch them to form an enclosure. Koohii #1 The character for deluge (#1799) gave me the idea to use together as a primitive for Noah´s Ark. Noah kept plenty of salad on board to entice the animals with their animal legs to scurry on board together, two by two. Koohii #2 The conjoined twins, who are always together, have trouble eating together because one is a vegetarian, eating salad and the other is a avid meat eater, eating chicken legs.[Thanks fuaburisu!]. Primitives together, salad, animal legs, eight 共(きょう): both, neither (neg), all, and, as well as, including, with, together with, plural ending 共学(きょうがく): coeducation 共感(きょうかん): sympathy, response 共存(きょうそん): coexistence 共鳴(きょうめい): resonance, sympathy 共和(きょうわ): republicanism, cooperation 共稼ぎ(ともかせぎ): working together, (husband and wife) earning a living together 共働き(ともばたらき): dual income 共産(きょうさん): communism 共通(きょうつう): commonness, community 共同(きょうどう): cooperation, association, collaboration, joint 公共(こうきょう): public, community, public service, society, communal 共に(ともに): sharing with, participate in, both, alike, together, along with, with, including Kunyomi: とも、とも.に、-ども Onyomi: キョウ Lesson: 47 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 共 (とも)	together 共 画数6 1934 Details Story Dictionary 共 together My Story A fence with 2 legs that are together is moving on legs! submit Details Story Dictionary 供 submit Heisig's Submit here is a transitive verb, meaning to offer or present. Its elements: person . . . strung together. Koohii #1 You have to SUBMIT all required documents together, in person! Koohii #2 When people are together and form a group, they suddenly submit their personal responsibility to the mob mentality. accept humbly Details Story Dictionary 戴 accept humbly Heisig's Thanksgiving . . . uncommon. Koohii #1 At Thanksgiving, it’s uncommon for people to accept humbly the food: most people just dig in. Koohii #2 You´re invited to a Thanksgiving party in Japan! Awesome! You´re so happy that your Japanese friends are trying to make you feel at home (you´ve been homesick recently). You sit down to the table, and they bring out some..uh...uncommon food. Really uncommon. Like just imagine the most uncommon Thanksgiving food ever, and that´s what you´re given (i don´t know, a frisbee or something?). Of course, you have to be Japanese and accept humbly their food. deluge Details Story Dictionary 洪 deluge My Story Water + Together = damp A Deluge is when so much *Water* is *Together* it creates a flood. Koohii #1 Lots of water coming together is called a deluge. Koohii #2 A real deluge of water, as if all water worked together, as if strung together haphazardly. Primitives deluge, water, water droplets, water pistol, strung together, salad, animal legs, eight 洪水(こうずい): flood Kunyomi: Onyomi: コウ Lesson: 47 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	deluge 洪 画数9 1939 Details Story Dictionary 洪 deluge My Story Water + Together = damp A Deluge is when so much *Water* is *Together* it creates a flood.
