harbor Details Story Dictionary 港 harbor My Story During a *deluge* {洪}, all the poor *snakes* get washed into the harbor. Koohii #1 During a deluge, all the poor snakes get washed into the harbour. Koohii #2 All throughout the deluge Noah had been kicking himself for forgetting to bring any snakes onto the Ark. It wasn´t until the deluge had finished, and Noah had brought the Ark safely back to the harbour that he realised that the snakes had been under the Ark all along. Koohii #2 Having spent all day stringing together grains of rice he suddenly had an outburst, ""I can take it any longer!"". elect Details Story Dictionary 選 elect Heisig's Two snakes . . . strung together . . . road. Koohii #1 Isn't this how the US presedential election works? You are given a choice between two snakes. Their politics are actually strung together but you get to feel as though you chose which one you want to lead you down the political road for the next four years. So which snake are you going to elect? Koohii #2 You´re driving on the road and you see two snakes together. You can´t avoid both, so you have to elect which one gets run over. Primitives elect, southeast, snake, self, strung together, salad, animal legs, eight, road, snake2, self2 選挙(せんきょ): election 選考(せんこう): selection, screening 抽選(ちゅうせん): lottery, raffle, drawing (of lots) 当選(とうせん): being elected, winning the prize 選手(せんしゅ): player (in game), team 選択(せんたく): selection, choice 選ぶ(えらぶ): choose Kunyomi: えら.ぶ Onyomi: セン Lesson: 47 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 選ぶ (えら.ぶ)	elect 選 画数15 1944 Details Story Dictionary 選 elect Heisig's Two snakes . . . strung together . . . road. Their politics are actually strung together but you get to feel as though you chose which one you want to lead you down the political road for the next four years. So which snake are you going to elect? Koohii #2 You´re driving on the road and you see two snakes together. You can´t avoid both, so you have to elect which one gets run over. Primitives elect, southeast, snake, self, strung together, salad, animal legs, eight, road, snake2, self2 選挙(せんきょ): election 選考(せんこう): selection, screening 抽選(ちゅうせん): lottery, raffle, drawing (of lots) 当選(とうせん): being elected, winning the prize 選手(せんしゅ): player (in game), team 選択(せんたく): selection, choice 選ぶ(えらぶ): choose Kunyomi: えら.ぶ Onyomi: セン Lesson: 47 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 選ぶ (えら.ぶ)
Mr. Details Story Dictionary 殿 Mr. Heisig's Flags . . . strung together . . . missile. Koohii #1 Mr. President in his palace, ordering missiles to be fired at a harmless enemy in order to unite us together under the flag. Koohii #2 Mr. President! We all stand here together under a national flag. One thing is certain: we´ll never give in. We are launching nuclear missiles now to implement mutually assured destruction protocol. "well Details Story Dictionary 井 well My Story it looks like tic-tac-toe, so you can say, ""I play tic-tac-toe in the bottom of the well while waiting to be rescued."" Koohii #1 I nearly died by falling in a well. Actually, on two separate occasions. I´m glad to see they´ve added these fence posts. Now the well will be much safer. Koohii #2 Have you ever seen an old fashioned japanese well? == http://cruises.about.com/od/southeastasiacruise1/ig/Osaka-Japan/Ancient-Well-at-Osaka-Castle.htm. Primitives well 伊井(いい): that one, Italy 天井(てんじょう): ceiling, ceiling price 井戸(いど): water well Kunyomi: い Onyomi: セイ、ショウ Lesson: 48 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 油井 (ゆい), 市井 (しせい), 井 (い)"	"well 井 画数4 1946 Details Story Dictionary 井 well My Story it looks like tic-tac-toe, so you can say, ""I play tic-tac-toe in the bottom of the well while waiting to be rescued."" donburi Details Story Dictionary 丼 donburi Heisig's Donburi is a bowl of rice with eel or meat on it. The character is a pictograph, perhaps designed by someone who felt that the portion of meat he was served with his bowl of rice looked to be no more than a tiny drop in the well. Koohii #1 A little one is eating a domburi while standing over, looking down into, a WELL. He drops it, and it falls down & down until it looks like nothing more than a DROP, landing at the bottom of the well! Koohii #2 I drop a domburi down into the well for the goblin living there. Primitives domburi, well, drop 丼(どんぶり): porcelain bowl, bowl of rice with food on top Kunyomi: どんぶり Onyomi: トン、タン、ショウ、セイ Lesson: 48 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: Compounds: 丼 (どんぶりどん)	donburi 丼 画数5 1947 Details Story Dictionary 丼 donburi Heisig's Donburi is a bowl of rice with eel or meat on it. Koohii #1 A little one is eating a domburi while standing over, looking down into, a WELL. He drops it, and it falls down & down until it looks like nothing more than a DROP, landing at the bottom of the well! Koohii #2 I drop a domburi down into the well for the goblin living there. Koohii #2 You get good surround sound when your pent-up in well. till Details Story Dictionary 耕 till Heisig's Christmas tree . . . well. Koohii #1 If you just grow your christmas tree in a well, there will be no need to till the soil. Koohii #2 A man was tilling a new plot to plant xmas trees but his tractor hit an old covered-up well and fell halfway in, he´s asking for a new tractor for xmas.. Asia Details Story Dictionary 亜 Asia Heisig's In this kanji, the abbreviation for Asia, you should be able to see the character for mouth behind the Roman numeral II. Koohii #1 In Asian countries, people use II chopsticks to get things into their mouths. Just imagine someone shoving a piece of sushi into their mouths with chopsticks. Koohii #2 A mouth barred up and not aloud to speak freely is the sign of asia (korea, China, pakistan etc). Primitives Asia, roman two, mouth 亜科(あか): suborder, subfamily Kunyomi: つ.ぐ Onyomi: ア、アシア Lesson: 48 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	Asia 亜 画数7 1950 Details Story Dictionary 亜 Asia Heisig's In this kanji, the abbreviation for Asia, you should be able to see the character for mouth behind the Roman numeral II. bad Details Story Dictionary 悪 bad My Story Even though *beetles* have *hearts*, I still think they are bad Koohii #1 Because Asian people started to eat Western food, their hearts became bad and they started having heart attacks. Koohii #2 Asian hearts are bad and evil. They invented so much martial arts: karate, judo, kungfu, muay thai, silat, etc... just to hurt each other. They torture their own people (China, North Korea). They torture other people (Japan in China and Korea). And they are able to hide all this behind their nice facade of kindness. Bad, bad Asians. (did i shatter some people´s ideas on Asia? my bad). Primitives bad, Asia, roman two, mouth, heart 悪(あく): evil, wickedness 悪日(あくび): unlucky day 悪化(あっか): deterioration, growing worse, aggravation, degeneration, corruption 悪口(あっこう): abuse, insult, slander, evil speaking 悪戯(いたずら): tease, prank, trick, practical joke, mischief 改悪(かいあく): deterioration, changing for the worse 決まり悪い(きまりわるい): feeling awkward, being ashamed 悪い(にくい): hateful, abominable, poor-looking 善し悪し(よしあし): good or bad, merits or demerits, quality, suitability 悪者(わるもの): bad fellow, rascal, ruffian, scoundrel 悪魔(あくま): evil spirit, devil, demon 意地悪(いじわる): malicious, ill-tempered, unkind 悪口(わるくち): abuse, insult, slander, evil speaking 悪い(わるい): bad, inferior Kunyomi: わる.い、わる-、あ.し、にく.い、-にく.い、ああ、いずくに、いずくんぞ、にく.む Onyomi: アク、オ Lesson: 48 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds: 悪事 (あくじ), 悪意 (あくい), 醜悪 (しゅうあく), 悪い (わる.い)	bad 悪 画数11 1951 Details Story Dictionary 悪 bad My Story Even though *beetles* have *hearts*, I still think they are bad Koohii #1 Because Asian people started to eat Western food, their hearts became bad and they started having heart attacks. "circle Details Story Dictionary 円 circle Heisig's This kanji, also used for Yen, is one you are not likely to need to study formally, since you can hardly get around in Japan without it. The connection is that the yennies, like pennies, are circular in shape. In any case, the elements are: glass canopy . . . walking stick . . . one. Koohii #1 The shape of a Yen coin. Koohii #2 A poor old man is almost killing himself trying to lift a huge glass hood with his cane (using it as a lever), to get to just one yen coin. Note : the kanji refers to a circular, round object, but also to the Japanese currency (pronounced ""en""). Primitives circle, yen 円滑(えんかつ): harmony, smoothness 円満(えんまん): perfection, harmony, peace, smoothness, completeness, satisfaction, integrity 円(えん): yen, circle 円周(えんしゅう): circumference 楕円(だえん): ellipse 円(まる): circle, money 円い(まるい): round, circular, spherical Kunyomi: まる.い、まる、まど、まど.か、まろ.やか Onyomi: エン Lesson: 48 Jouyou: 1 JLPT Level: 5 Compounds: 円い (まる.い)"	"circle 円 画数4 1952 Details Story Dictionary 円 circle Heisig's This kanji, also used for Yen, is one you are not likely to need to study formally, since you can hardly get around in Japan without it. "angle Details Story Dictionary 角 angle Heisig's Bound up . . . glass canopy . . . walking stick . . . two. If you write the character once, you will see why we avoided using the element for soil, which would prompt you to write it in improper order. * As a primitive, imagine the tool used by draftsmen and carpenters to draw right-angles. Koohii #1 A museum display of two walking sticks bound together under a glass canopy, showing the first device used to measure an angle. Koohii #2 The gates have been bound up together leaving no angle to get through...　RTK2:　カク　兎に角　とにかく(anyhow)　""horns on a rabbit"". Primitives angle, bound up, glass canopy, hood, walking cane, stick, two 角(かく): angle, bishop (shogi) 兎角(とかく): anyhow, anyway, somehow or other, generally speaking, in any case, this and that, many, be apt to 角度(かくど): angle 三角(さんかく): triangle, triangular 四角(しかく): square 四角い(しかくい): square 角(すみ): corner, nook 折角(せっかく): with trouble, at great pains, long-awaited 直角(ちょっかく): right angle 方角(ほうがく): direction, way, compass point 街角(まちかど): street corner 四つ角(よつかど): four corners, crossroads 角(かど): corner, horn Kunyomi: かど、つの Onyomi: カク Lesson: 48 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 角 (かど), 角 (つの)"	"angle 角 画数7 1953 Details Story Dictionary 角 angle Heisig's Bound up . . . glass canopy . . . walking stick . . . two. contact Details Story Dictionary 触 contact My Story The bug came in contact with the windshield at a sharp angle. It didnt make it. Koohii #1 For insects to get in contact with each other, they need to place their antennae at just the right angle. Koohii #2 Wow, he threw that BOOMERANG with such skill, it made CONTACT with that INSECT in mid flight. Primitives contact, angle, bound up, glass canopy, hood, walking cane, stick, two, insect 気触れる(かぶれる): to react to, to be influenced by, to go overboard for 感触(かんしょく): sense of touch, feeling, sensation 接触(せっしょく): touch, contact 触れる(ふれる): touch, be touched, touch on a subject, feel, violate (law, copyright, etc.), perceive, be moved (emotionally) 触る(さわる): touch Kunyomi: ふ.れる、さわ.る、さわ Onyomi: ショク Lesson: 48 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 触る (さわ.る), 触れる (ふ.れる)	contact 触 画数13 1954 Details Story Dictionary 触 contact My Story The bug came in contact with the windshield at a sharp angle. unravel Details Story Dictionary 解 unravel My Story [Angle {角} + Sword + Cow] Sherlock solved the mystery by unraveling at what *ANGLE* the *SWORD* went into the *COW*. Koohii #1 Did you know that you can unravel a cow? If you stick the dagger in at exactly the correct angle, the whole cow will just unravel. Koohii #2 Unravel the mystery by determining at what ANGLE the SWORD went into the COW. Primitives unravel, angle, bound up, glass canopy, hood, walking cane, stick, two, sword, dagger, cow 解除(かいじょ): cancellation, rescinding, release, calling off 解剖(かいぼう): dissection, autopsy 正解(せいかい): correct, right, correct interpretation (answer solution) 弁解(べんかい): explanation, justification, defence, excuse 解く(ほどく): to unfasten 了解(りょうかい): comprehension, consent, understanding, roger (on the radio) 解決(かいけつ): settlement, solution, resolution 解散(かいさん): breakup, dissolution 解釈(かいしゃく): explanation, interpretation 解説(かいせつ): explanation, commentary 解答(かいとう): answer, solution 解放(かいほう): release, liberation, emancipation 見解(けんかい): opinion, point of view 誤解(ごかい): misunderstanding 解く(とく): solve, answer, unravel, untie 解ける(とける): loosen 分解(ぶんかい): analysis, disassembly 理解(りかい): understanding, comprehension Kunyomi: と.く、と.かす、と.ける、ほど.く、ほど.ける、わか.る、さと.る Onyomi: カイ、ゲ Lesson: 48 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 解決 (かいけつ), 解禁 (かいきん), 理解 (りかい), 解かす (と.かす), 解く (と.く), 解ける (と.ける)	unravel 解 画数13 1955 Details Story Dictionary 解 unravel My Story [Angle {角} + Sword + Cow] Sherlock solved the mystery by unraveling at what *ANGLE* the *SWORD* went into the *COW*. "again Details Story Dictionary 再 again Heisig's Jewel . . . with a belt hung on it. Note how the belt is drawn right after the first stroke of jewel. Koohii #1 The king has eaten too much and has to get a new belt again. See his fat rolls hanging over? Koohii #2 This is a belt with a non-adjustable jeweled buckle. Everytime you go back to the leathersmith telling him to move the buckle because you´ve packed on a few pounds (but that this is the last time!), he says ""Again?!? Weren´t you just here last month?"". Primitives again, king, jewel, ball, belt 再(さい): re-, again, repeated 再会(さいかい): another meeting, meeting again, reunion 再建(さいけん): rebuilding, reconstruction, rehabilitation 再現(さいげん): reappearance, reproduction, return, revival 再生(さいせい): playback, regeneration, resuscitation, return to life, rebirth, reincarnation, narrow escape, reclamation, regrowth 再発(さいはつ): return, relapse, reoccurrence 再三(さいさん): again and again, repeatedly 再来月(さらいげつ): month after next 再来週(さらいしゅう): week after next 再び(ふたたび): again, once more, a second time 再来年(さらいねん): year after next Kunyomi: ふたた.び Onyomi: サイ、サ Lesson: 48 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 再度 (さいど), 再選 (さいせん), 再出発 (さいしゅっぱつ), 再び (ふたた.び)"	"again 再 画数6 1956 Details Story Dictionary 再 again Heisig's Jewel . . . with a belt hung on it. Everytime you go back to the leathersmith telling him to move the buckle because you´ve packed on a few pounds (but that this is the last time!), he says ""Again?!? Weren´t you just here last month?"". Primitives again, king, jewel, ball, belt 再(さい): re-, again, repeated 再会(さいかい): another meeting, meeting again, reunion 再建(さいけん): rebuilding, reconstruction, rehabilitation 再現(さいげん): reappearance, reproduction, return, revival 再生(さいせい): playback, regeneration, resuscitation, return to life, rebirth, reincarnation, narrow escape, reclamation, regrowth 再発(さいはつ): return, relapse, reoccurrence 再三(さいさん): again and again, repeatedly 再来月(さらいげつ): month after next 再来週(さらいしゅう): week after next 再び(ふたたび): again, once more, a second time 再来年(さらいねん): year after next Kunyomi: ふたた.び Onyomi: サイ、サ Lesson: 48 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 再度 (さいど), 再選 (さいせん), 再出発 (さいしゅっぱつ), 再び (ふたた.び)"
lecture Details Story Dictionary 講 lecture My Story [Say + funnel ] Koohii #1 I have a funnel attached to my laptop that takes my prof´s lecture and puts the words into a text file. The bigger the funnel, the more accurate the conversion, so picture a bunch of laptops with large, unwieldy funnels attached to the USB port. Koohii #2 Image: a professor walking around with a funnel and simply pouring his words into each students head instead of a lecture. (Primitive: FUNNEL, who got the celery stuck in the funnel again?! You know it´s not supposed to be used for that!). Primitives lecture, say, words, keitai, mouth, funnel, cone, celery, again 講習(こうしゅう): short course, training 講読(こうどく): reading, translation 聴講(ちょうこう): lecture attendance, auditing 休講(きゅうこう): lecture cancelled 講演(こうえん): lecture, address 講師(こうし): lecturer 講義(こうぎ): lecture 講堂(こうどう): lecture hall Kunyomi: Onyomi: コウ Lesson: 48 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds:	lecture 講 画数17 1957 Details Story Dictionary 講 lecture My Story [Say + funnel ] Koohii #1 I have a funnel attached to my laptop that takes my prof´s lecture and puts the words into a text file. subscription Details Story Dictionary 購 subscription Heisig's Shells . . . funnel. The key word is meant to suggest magazine subscriptions and the like. Koohii #1 Subscription is like a money funnel, because the receiving end is small (just one company) and the other end is wide (the whole country). Koohii #2 My subscription to Money magazine came with a free coin funnel. Primitives subscription, shellfish, clam, oyster, eye, animal legs, eight, funnel, cone, celery, again 購読(こうどく): subscription (e.g. magazine) 購入(こうにゅう): purchase, buy 購買(こうばい): purchase, buy Kunyomi: Onyomi: コウ Lesson: 48 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	subscription 購 画数17 1958 Details Story Dictionary 購 subscription Heisig's Shells . . . funnel. posture Details Story Dictionary 構 posture Heisig's Tree . . . funnel. Koohii #1 Ideal posture is standing tall like a tree and having a V shape like a funnel Koohii #2 I fell out of a tree and broke my neck. Koohii #2 A gutter takes the water that falls as rain and funnels it off to where it can be dealt with appropriately. argument Details Story Dictionary 論 argument Heisig's Words . . . meeting . . . scrapbook. The argument here is a process of academic reasoning, not a personal quarrel or spat. Koohii #1 Right part: academic conference (a meeting, some of the attendees making notes in scrapbooks during presentation). Argument at academic conferences is naturally carried out using words. Koohii #2 It´s very difficult to present a good argument if you don´t bring along a scrapbook with some key words jotted down to the meeting. Primitives argument, say, words, keitai, mouth, post-it note, meeting, scrapbook, glass canopy, hood, flowers 異論(いろん): different opinion, objection 言論(げんろん): discussion 世論(せろん): public opinion 討論(とうろん): debate, discussion 弁論(べんろん): discussion, debate, argument 無論(むろん): of course, naturally 目論見(もくろみ): a plan, a scheme, a project, a program, intention, goal 理論(りろん): theory 論議(ろんぎ): discussion 論理(ろんり): logic 概論(がいろん): introduction, outline, general remarks 議論(ぎろん): argument, discussion, dispute 結論(けつろん): reason, sum up, conclude 評論(ひょうろん): criticism, critique 勿論(もちろん): of course, certainly, naturally 論じる(ろんじる): argue, discuss, debate 論ずる(ろんずる): argue, discuss, debate 論争(ろんそう): controversy, dispute 論文(ろんぶん): thesis, essay, treatise, paper Kunyomi: Onyomi: ロン Lesson: 48 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds:	argument 論 画数15 1961 Details Story Dictionary 論 argument Heisig's Words . . . meeting . . . scrapbook. "ethics Details Story Dictionary 倫 ethics Heisig's Person . . . meeting . . . scrapbook. Koohii #1 Mr. T talks about ethics at the academic conference. ""I pity the fool who gets caught plagarizing someone else´s stuff!"". Koohii #2 Mr. T has no ethics at the scrapbooking convention. He´ll do whatever it takes to beat all those ladies. Primitives ethics, person, post-it note, meeting, scrapbook, glass canopy, hood, flowers Kunyomi: Onyomi: リン Lesson: 48 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"	"ethics 倫 画数10 1962 Details Story Dictionary 倫 ethics Heisig's Person . . . meeting . . . scrapbook. "wheel Details Story Dictionary 輪 wheel My Story The *car's* wheels crashed while we were going to the *bookstore*. At the car {車} buffs' meeting 合, they spoke volumes {冊} on the subject of their wheels. 車輪、しゃりん, car wheel: 車輪は車軸で回転する, ""Car wheels rotate on axles."" Rolled-up scrolls also have axes; how tomes 冊 were written in the old days. リン -> ""rim"" -> wheel. 指輪、ゆびわ, finger ring. Be careful: - {輸} Koohii #1 During a talk at the academic conference, speaker shows an introductory slide depicting the structure of car, and then moves on to the more narrow topic of wheels. Koohii #2 Someone stole all the wheels off the ladies´ cars at the scrapbook convention. Primitives wheel, car, post-it note, meeting, scrapbook, glass canopy, hood, flowers 首輪(くびわ): necklace, choker 年輪(ねんりん): annual tree ring 輪(りん): counter for wheels and flowers 車輪(しゃりん): (car) wheel 輪(わ): ring, hoop, circle 指輪(ゆびわ): ring Kunyomi: わ Onyomi: リン Lesson: 48 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 輪 (わ)"	"wheel 輪 画数15 1963 Details Story Dictionary 輪 wheel My Story The *car's* wheels crashed while we were going to the *bookstore*. partial Details Story Dictionary 偏 partial Heisig's Person . . . door . . . scrapbook. The sense of the key-word is that of having a bias or preference for someone or something. Koohii #1 Mr. T is partial to konbini hentai. He reads them for hours every day after work at his local konbini. (Primitive: KONBINI HENTAI, all the magazines(scrapbooks) by every konbini door in Japan). Koohii #2 Mr. T is very partial to hentai comic books. I know because he dropped a pile of them when I accidentally bumped into him at the door to kinokuniya! Primitives partial, person, fishfinger, door, one, ceiling, flag, scrapbook, glass canopy, hood, flowers 偏る(かたよる): to be one-sided, to incline, to be partial, to be prejudiced, to lean, to be biased 偏(へん): side, left radical of a character, inclining, inclining toward, biased 偏見(へんけん): prejudice, narrow view Kunyomi: かたよ.る Onyomi: ヘン Lesson: 48 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 偏る (かたよ.る)	partial 偏 画数11 1964 Details Story Dictionary 偏 partial Heisig's Person . . . door . . . scrapbook. everywhere Details Story Dictionary 遍 everywhere Heisig's Door . . . scrapbook . . . a road. Koohii #1 Go down the road in Japan and you will find comics EVERYWHERE, newpaper stands, 7-11, Tsutaya, even the supermarket. Comics are everywhere here along the road. Koohii #2 Go down any road in Japan and you´ll find konbini hentai everywhere. Primitives everywhere, fishfinger, door, one, ceiling, flag, scrapbook, glass canopy, hood, flowers, road 普遍(ふへん): universality, ubiquity, omnipresence Kunyomi: あまね.く Onyomi: ヘン Lesson: 48 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	everywhere 遍 画数12 1965 Details Story Dictionary 遍 everywhere Heisig's Door . . . scrapbook . . . a road. compilation Details Story Dictionary 編 compilation Heisig's Thread . . . door . . . scrapbook. Koohii #1 Raulir has a good idea. I prefer to think of the manga compilations as the individual comics (serials from the anthologies) bound together with a coarse thread down the spine, produced quickly and put on the market. Good way to recycle those pulpy manga, and since when has the consumer not gotten screwed in Japan? ;-). Koohii #2 A Japanese comic book is a compilation of the individual chapters (which have already appeared in weekly comic magazines) with a thread (story arc) going through it. Primitives compilation, thread, spiderman, fishfinger, door, one, ceiling, flag, scrapbook, glass canopy, hood, flowers 長編(ちょうへん): long (e.g. novel film) 編(へん): compilation, editing, completed poem, book, part of book 編物(あみもの): knitting, web 編む(あむ): to knit, to braid, compile (anthology, dictionary, etc.), edit 短編(たんぺん): short (e.g. story, film) 編集(へんしゅう): editing, compilation, editorial (e.g. committee) Kunyomi: あ.む、-あ.み Onyomi: ヘン Lesson: 48 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 編む (あ.む)	compilation 編 画数15 1966 Details Story Dictionary 編 compilation Heisig's Thread . . . door . . . scrapbook. Koohii #1 Raulir has a good idea. I prefer to think of the manga compilations as the individual comics (serials from the anthologies) bound together with a coarse thread down the spine, produced quickly and put on the market. Good way to recycle those pulpy manga, and since when has the consumer not gotten screwed in Japan? ;-). Koohii #2 A Japanese comic book is a compilation of the individual chapters (which have already appeared in weekly comic magazines) with a thread (story arc) going through it. tome Details Story Dictionary 冊 tome Heisig's This key word is a counter for books. It differs from scrapbook both in the writing order and in the extension of the second horizontal stroke. Koohii #1 Pictograph. I think of that Harry Potter spell book that had to be bound shut coz it wanted to eat you. Koohii #2 冊 さつ 1: counter for books A heavy scrapbook so full that flowers are sticking out. Only if a scrapbook is that full, it can be called a heavy book. Primitives tome 冊(さつ): counter for books Kunyomi: ふみ Onyomi: サツ、サク Lesson: 48 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 冊子 (さっし), 別冊 (べっさつ)	tome 冊 画数5 1967 Details Story Dictionary 冊 tome Heisig's This key word is a counter for books. It differs from scrapbook both in the writing order and in the extension of the second horizontal stroke. Koohii #1 Pictograph. I think of that Harry Potter spell book that had to be bound shut coz it wanted to eat you. Koohii #2 冊 さつ 1: counter for books A heavy scrapbook so full that flowers are sticking out. Only if a scrapbook is that full, it can be called a heavy book. Primitives tome 冊(さつ): counter for books Kunyomi: ふみ Onyomi: サツ、サク Lesson: 48 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 冊子 (さっし), 別冊 (べっさつ)
"palisade Details Story Dictionary 柵 palisade Heisig's Tree . . . tome. Koohii #1 A palisade is a ""fence of stakes especially for defense,"" usually the stakes are very strong, set closely together, and pointed on top. Tome can be seen as a pictograph of several close-set wooden stakes, braced by one horizontal bar. Koohii #2 An army of scholars build a wooden palisade to protect their precious tome of literature. Primitives palisade, tree, wood, tome 柵(さく): fence, paling Kunyomi: しがら.む、しがらみ、とりで、やらい Onyomi: サク、サン Lesson: 48 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: Compounds:"	"palisade 柵 画数9 1968 Details Story Dictionary 柵 palisade Heisig's Tree . . . tome. Koohii #1 A palisade is a ""fence of stakes especially for defense,"" usually the stakes are very strong, set closely together, and pointed on top. Tome can be seen as a pictograph of several close-set wooden stakes, braced by one horizontal bar. Koohii #2 An army of scholars build a wooden palisade to protect their precious tome of literature. Primitives palisade, tree, wood, tome 柵(さく): fence, paling Kunyomi: しがら.む、しがらみ、とりで、やらい Onyomi: サク、サン Lesson: 48 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: Compounds:"
"code Details Story Dictionary 典 code Heisig's We introduce this character here because of its connection to the book-related kanji treated above. It is based on the character for bend (frame 1256), whose last stroke is lengthened to coincide with the first stroke of the element for tool. Koohii #1 Coding is a tool which you can use to bend the computer to your will. Koohii #2 Think ""codex"" (mnemonic help) or ""code of laws"", or even Leonardo Da Vinci´s code. Here I see a codex as a tool used to bend the masses into submission. Picture a huge codex book lifted down on crowds to bend them down in submission. Another: if you bend to the code without asking questions, you are a tool! Primitives code, bend, tool 原典(げんてん): original (text) 百科事典(ひゃっかじてん): encyclopedia 百科辞典(ひゃっかじてん): encyclopedia 古典(こてん): old book, classic, classics 典型(てんけい): type, pattern, archetypal 辞典(じてん): dictionary Kunyomi: Onyomi: テン、デン Lesson: 48 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"	"code 典 画数8 1969 Details Story Dictionary 典 code Heisig's We introduce this character here because of its connection to the book-related kanji treated above. It is based on the character for bend (frame 1256), whose last stroke is lengthened to coincide with the first stroke of the element for tool. Koohii #1 Coding is a tool which you can use to bend the computer to your will. Koohii #2 Think ""codex"" (mnemonic help) or ""code of laws"", or even Leonardo Da Vinci´s code. Here I see a codex as a tool used to bend the masses into submission. Picture a huge codex book lifted down on crowds to bend them down in submission. Another: if you bend to the code without asking questions, you are a tool! Primitives code, bend, tool 原典(げんてん): original (text) 百科事典(ひゃっかじてん): encyclopedia 百科辞典(ひゃっかじてん): encyclopedia 古典(こてん): old book, classic, classics 典型(てんけい): type, pattern, archetypal 辞典(じてん): dictionary Kunyomi: Onyomi: テン、デン Lesson: 48 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"
family name Details Story Dictionary 氏 family name Heisig's Pay close attention to the stroke order of the elements when learning to write this character. The elements: a long drop . . . fishhook . . . a one . . . fishhook. Koohii #1 Looks a bit like Ft => Family title => Family name. Koohii #2 The family name is important to me! Drop me from a building, torture me with a fishhook, I´m keeping my one family name. Hook me with a second fishhook, I refuse to change my family name. Primitives family name, drop, fishhook, fishhook2 氏(うじ): family name 氏(し): family name, lineage 氏名(しめい): full name, identity Kunyomi: うじ、-うじ Onyomi: シ Lesson: 49 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 氏 (うじ)	family name 氏 画数4 1970 Details Story Dictionary 氏 family name Heisig's Pay close attention to the stroke order of the elements when learning to write this character. The elements: a long drop . . . fishhook . . . a one . . . fishhook. Koohii #1 Looks a bit like Ft => Family title => Family name. Koohii #2 The family name is important to me! Drop me from a building, torture me with a fishhook, I´m keeping my one family name. Hook me with a second fishhook, I refuse to change my family name. Primitives family name, drop, fishhook, fishhook2 氏(うじ): family name 氏(し): family name, lineage 氏名(しめい): full name, identity Kunyomi: うじ、-うじ Onyomi: シ Lesson: 49 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 氏 (うじ)
paper Details Story Dictionary 紙 paper Heisig's Thread . . . family name. Koohii #1 All that threads you to your family name is a piece of paper. (birth certificate). Koohii #2 I imagine a ridiculously expensive, and rather pointless, Japanese type of paper for writing letters, with one´s family name woven in fine thread somewhere in a corner. Primitives paper, thread, spiderman, family name 張り紙(はりがみ): paper patch, paper backing, poster 用紙(ようし): blank form 紙屑(かみくず): wastepaper 紙幣(しへい): paper money, notes, bills 塵紙(ちりがみ): tissue paper, toilet paper 表紙(ひょうし): front cover, binding 紙(かみ): paper 手紙(てがみ): letter Kunyomi: かみ Onyomi: シ Lesson: 49 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds: 紙 (かみ)	paper 紙 画数10 1971 Details Story Dictionary 紙 paper Heisig's Thread . . . family name. Koohii #1 All that threads you to your family name is a piece of paper. (birth certificate). Koohii #2 I imagine a ridiculously expensive, and rather pointless, Japanese type of paper for writing letters, with one´s family name woven in fine thread somewhere in a corner. Koohii #2 Tip: Heisig later introduces the kanji 昏 dusk (#2451). Story: Never enter into marriage with a woman at dusk (wait until you see them in daylight). Note: This is an ancient proverb . . . (probably). resist Details Story Dictionary 抵 resist Heisig's Fingers . . . calling card. Koohii #1 Japan business etiquette tip: When someone hands you a business card, resist the impulse to fiddle around with it with your fingers, and by all means resist the urge to use the card to pick gunk from under your fingernails. Just examine it carefully, ask politely about the (few by now) kanji that you don´t know, and put it away carefully in a location that shows your counterparts how important they are to you. Koohii #2 Most japanese find it impossible to resist pushy businessmen in Japan when they push their damned business cards into your fingers. Primitives resist, finger, fingers, calling card, family name, one, floor 大抵(たいてい): usually, generally 抵抗(ていこう): electrical resistance, resistance, opposition Kunyomi: Onyomi: テイ Lesson: 49 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	resist 抵 画数8 1974 Details Story Dictionary 抵 resist Heisig's Fingers . . . calling card. catch Details Story Dictionary 捕 catch My Story *My nigga Mo* out here, goofin around on his *unicycle* {甫}, trying to catch an elephant or some shiz Koohii #1 I was retreating from the battlefield. In the chaos, my friend threw his dogtags at me to give to his family. I managed to catch them with my fingers as the chopper was lifting off. Koohii #2 Dog tag: This is a wild animal track device. It has an arrowhead and screwdriver-shaped radio beacon. It´s evidently fired in animals to track their movements. When animal has a dog tag, it´s easy to catch it: just take a dog tag in your fingers. Primitives catch, finger, fingers, dog-tag, arrowhead, screwdriver, utilize, utilise 捕らえる(とらえる): to seize, to grasp, to capture, to arrest 捕獲(ほかく): capture, seizure 捕鯨(ほげい): whaling, whale fishing 捕吏(ほり): constable 捕虜(ほりょ): prisoner (of war) 逮捕(たいほ): arrest, apprehension, capture 捕まる(つかまる): be caught, be arrested 捕える(とらえる): seize, grasp, capture, arrest 捕る(とる): take, catch (fish), capture 捕まえる(つかまえる): catch Kunyomi: と.らえる、と.らわれる、と.る、とら.える、とら.われる、つか.まえる、つか.まる Onyomi: ホ Lesson: 49 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 捕まえる (つか.まえる), 捕まる (つか.まる), 捕らえる (と.らえる), 捕らわれる (と.らわれる), 捕る (と.る)	catch 捕 画数10 1978 Details Story Dictionary 捕 catch My Story *My nigga Mo* out here, goofin around on his *unicycle* {甫}, trying to catch an elephant or some shiz Koohii #1 I was retreating from the battlefield. shop Details Story Dictionary 舗 shop Heisig's Cottage . . . dog tag. The key word refers to the noun, not the verb. Koohii #1 A shop in an impoverished country is just a cottage with a dog tag identifying it. So you´re given a cloak for extra fibre and dogtags for extra iron. Keeps you regular and stops you feeling tired and run-down. Koohii #2 The name and number printed on a soldier´s cloak is a supplement to his main I.D. tag; his dog-tag, in helping identify the soldier. metropolis Details Story Dictionary 都 metropolis My Story A *ninja* climbs the metropolis walls to infiltrate the right-side *village* Koohii #1 In a metropolis people are just puppets inside city walls, there is no individuality if you live so close together. Koohii #2 A vision of a futuristic METROPOLIS: standing at the window of your 400th floor apartment, hand in hand with your LOVE DOLL, gazing out at the gigantic CITY WALLS that you can never escape. hometown Details Story Dictionary 郷 hometown My Story *Eazy E* left the his hometown to for *silver*, the new *town* was way richer Eazy E: looks like an E Koohii #1 Your hometown is where you broke out of your cocoon (born), and where you left when your hair was silver (died), your whole life was spent inside the city walls. Koohii #2 Your home town is where you earned enough silver to enable you to break out of your giant cocoon (leave home) and explore outside the city walls. corridor Details Story Dictionary 廊 corridor My Story Your SON {郎} plays in the CAVE {广}, pretending he's exploring a corridor. Wait a minute... Koohii #1 Your son plays in the corridor pretending he´s exploring a cave. Koohii #2 (ロウ) I think of the corridor found in the cave that Yoda made Luke Skywalker walk through as part of his Jedi training in Empire Strikes Back. It was in this corridor that Luke met Darth Vadar, cut off his head and found himself behind Darth Vadar´s mask. An early little hint that Luke was Darth Vadar´s son. "shield Details Story Dictionary 盾 shield Heisig's Dragging . . . ten eyes. Koohii #1 You paint 10 huge eyes on your shield to scare the enemy, but consequently your shield is so big and heavy that you have to drag it. Koohii #2 From Wikipedia: ""If a Spartan hoplite were to return to Sparta alive and without his shield, it was assumed that he threw his shield at the enemy in an effort to flee; an act punishable by death or banishment."" Picture the enemy of a Spartan soldier poking his eyes out with a sewing needle and trying to steal his shield. However, the Spartan desperately clutches on, and is dragged around for a while, preferring to die than to lose his shield. Primitives shield, drag, ten, needle, eye 盾(たて): shield, buckler, escutcheon, pretext 矛盾(むじゅん): contradiction, inconsistency Kunyomi: たて Onyomi: ジュン Lesson: 50 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 盾 (たて)"	"shield 盾 画数9 1997 Details Story Dictionary 盾 shield Heisig's Dragging . . . ten eyes. "sequential Details Story Dictionary 循 sequential Heisig's Line . . . shield. Koohii #1 This is mostly used in the word 循環, ""circulation"" (of buses through their routes, of blood, etc). So I think of a column of little Roman soldiers with their shields marching sequentially through the veins of a person, as an anthropomorphization of the immune system. Koohii #2 A column of shielded soldiers advancing sequentially to avoid revealing the size of their army (Think ""Sandpeople always ride single file to hide their numbers"" from Star Wars). Primitives sequential, Nelson, column, going, line, shield, drag, ten, needle, eye 循環(じゅんかん): circulation, rotation, cycle Kunyomi: Onyomi: ジュン Lesson: 50 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"	"sequential 循 画数12 1998 Details Story Dictionary 循 sequential Heisig's Line . . . shield. Koohii #1 Drag + rag gave me trouble until I came up with zombie for it. The zombie population became more diverse, separating into different factions. One of them being the water Zombies. Koohii #2 The radical faction is almost eliminated, sir. They´re living in the sewers dressed in rags and dragging their supplies. Koohii #2 To get blood drawn from a vein you present the part of the body to the nurse, and they drag an alcohol swab (rag) across the vein. parcel post Details Story Dictionary 逓 parcel post Heisig's Drag . . . cornstalk . . . belt . . . road. Koohii #1 Picture a crude drag-sled - in this case, made from cornstalks that have been belted together - filled with parcels, that the postman drags along behind him down the road along his delivery route. Koohii #2 (I prefer 2 towels over cornstalk and belt) - Have you ever wondered why your parcels always end up in such bad condition when you get them? Or why you never get them at all? That´s because you´ve never looked at how they´re actually delivered - each postman is given a load of parcel post and 2 towels to drag them down the road on. Primitives parcel post, drag, cornstalk, belt, road Kunyomi: かわ.る、たがいに Onyomi: テイ Lesson: 50 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	parcel post 逓 画数10 2002 Details Story Dictionary 逓 parcel post Heisig's Drag . . . cornstalk . . . belt . . . road. grade Details Story Dictionary 段 grade Heisig's The kanji connoting rank or class shows us a new element on the left: the familiar primitive for staples with an additional stroke cutting through the vertical stroke. It is easiest in these cases to make a primitive related to what we already know. Hence, we call it a staple gun. To the right, missile. Koohii #1 This is a military-grade staple gun! It can be loaded with real missiles. Koohii #2 1st grade: staple gun, 9th grade: missiles. Primitives grade, staple gun, cruise missile, missile, wind, crotch 段々(だんだん): gradually, by degrees 値段(ねだん): price, cost 一段と(いちだんと): greater, more, further, still more 手段(しゅだん): means, way, measure 段(だん): step, stair, flight of steps, grade, rank, level 段階(だんかい): gradation, grade, stage 普段(ふだん): usually, habitually, ordinarily, always 階段(かいだん): stairs Kunyomi: Onyomi: ダン、タン Lesson: 50 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds:	grade 段 画数9 2003 Details Story Dictionary 段 grade Heisig's The kanji connoting rank or class shows us a new element on the left: the familiar primitive for staples with an additional stroke cutting through the vertical stroke. forge Details Story Dictionary 鍛 forge Heisig's Metal . . . grade. Koohii #1 As a discriminating metalsmith, I use the highest grade metals when forging such precision devices as staple guns and missiles. Koohii #2 Metal has to be forged many times over in order to reach a high grade. Primitives forge, metal, gold, grade, staple gun, cruise missile, missile, wind, crotch 鍛える(きたえる): to forge, to drill, to temper, to train, to discipline Kunyomi: きた.える Onyomi: タン Lesson: 50 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 鍛える (きた.える)	forge 鍛 画数17 2004 Details Story Dictionary 鍛 forge Heisig's Metal . . . grade. Koohii #1 As a discriminating metalsmith, I use the highest grade metals when forging such precision devices as staple guns and missiles. Koohii #2 Metal has to be forged many times over in order to reach a high grade. Primitives forge, metal, gold, grade, staple gun, cruise missile, missile, wind, crotch 鍛える(きたえる): to forge, to drill, to temper, to train, to discipline Kunyomi: きた.える Onyomi: タン Lesson: 50 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 鍛える (きた.える)

Normally she´ll violently pull her servants by the ear when they´ve failed to follow orders. But one time she dragged this one guy around the palace by the mouth. She must have been really angry—ever since that moment, he´s never been seen again. Koohii #2 The F word often comes out of the mouth of the empress. Koohii #1 That person, being the director, is someone you need to pay your respects to. heir Details Story Dictionary 嗣 heir Heisig's Mouth . . . scrapbook . . . director. Koohii #1 The lawyer called all the heirs into a meeting. Everybody else received cars, property, and the like. When it got to be my turn the lawyer informed me I would be receiving a scrapbook. My mouth dropped open. A scrapbook?! No Ferrari, no mansion, ...scrapbook?! Turns out the scrapbook was of my great uncle's company, and I had been named the new director of the multi-million dollar business. My mouth literally hit the scrapbook when I learned I'd be director. Koohii #2 My mouth hung open when I found out I was the heir to not only my father's scrapbooks, but he also left me as director of the company. Primitives heir, mouth, scrapbook, glass canopy, hood, flowers, director, Ken Russel, clothes hanger, coat hanger, one, mouth Kunyomi: Onyomi: シ Lesson: 50 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	heir 嗣 画数13 2011 Details Story Dictionary 嗣 heir Heisig's Mouth . . . scrapbook . . . director. boat Details Story Dictionary 舟 boat Heisig's After the drop and the glass canopy, we come to a combination of three strokes that we met only once before, in the character for mama (frame 105). The pictographic meaning we gave it there has no etymological relationship to this character, but use it if it helps. Koohii #1 I see this kanji as a pictograph of a two story boat seen from the front. The glass canopy is the body of the boat. The drop on top is the chimney. The horizontal line is the ceiling/floor between the the 1st/2nd floor. Finally, the two drops in the middle are the lights on the decks. Koohii #2 Cinnabar (丹) colored boat, the extra drop signifying that the paint hasn´t dried yet. The stick represents the oars. Primitives boat 舟(ふね): ship, boat, watercraft, shipping, vessel, steamship Kunyomi: ふね、ふな-、-ぶね Onyomi: シュウ Lesson: 50 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 舟 (ふね)	boat 舟 画数6 2012 Details Story Dictionary 舟 boat Heisig's After the drop and the glass canopy, we come to a combination of three strokes that we met only once before, in the character for mama (frame 105). The pictographic meaning we gave it there has no etymological relationship to this character, but use it if it helps. Koohii #1 I see this kanji as a pictograph of a two story boat seen from the front. The glass canopy is the body of the boat. The drop on top is the chimney. The horizontal line is the ceiling/floor between the the 1st/2nd floor. Finally, the two drops in the middle are the lights on the decks. Koohii #2 Cinnabar (丹) colored boat, the extra drop signifying that the paint hasn´t dried yet. The stick represents the oars. Primitives boat 舟(ふね): ship, boat, watercraft, shipping, vessel, steamship Kunyomi: ふね、ふな-、-ぶね Onyomi: シュウ Lesson: 50 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 舟 (ふね)
liner Details Story Dictionary 舶 liner Heisig's The type of boat connoted by this key word is a large oceangoing liner. The important thing here is to work with the elements boat and dove to make an image distinct from that of the former frame. Don't count on size alone to distinguish the boat from the liner. Koohii #1 The most famous LINER is the Titanic, which struck an iceberg and sunk. Just imagine that huge LINER strucking an even huger mass of white ice. Koohii #2 A liner is to boat as an emperor (#261) is to a king (#255), or a chief (#967) is to a person (#951): in each case we need only add white to the latter in order to get the former. Primitives liner, boat, white, dove 船舶(せんぱく): ship Kunyomi: Onyomi: ハク Lesson: 50 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	liner 舶 画数11 2013 Details Story Dictionary 舶 liner Heisig's The type of boat connoted by this key word is a large oceangoing liner. "gunwale Details Story Dictionary 舷 gunwale Heisig's Boat . . . mysterious. Koohii #1 The gunwale is perhaps the most mysterious part of a boat for it is neither a gun nor a whale. Koohii #2 Gunwale (rhymes with ""tunnel"") is the top edge of the side of a boat, for example the widened lip on the sides of a canoe. The mysterious origin of this part of a boat comes from the strengthened sides of warships that used artillery (it means ""gun ridge""). Primitives gunwale, boat, mysterious, top hat, cocoon Kunyomi: ふなべい、ふなばた Onyomi: ゲン Lesson: 50 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: Compounds:"	"gunwale 舷 画数11 2015 Details Story Dictionary 舷 gunwale Heisig's Boat . . . mysterious. Koohii #2 Gunwale (rhymes with ""tunnel"") is the top edge of the side of a boat, for example the widened lip on the sides of a canoe. The mysterious origin of this part of a boat comes from the strengthened sides of warships that used artillery (it means ""gun ridge""). Primitives gunwale, boat, mysterious, top hat, cocoon Kunyomi: ふなべい、ふなばた Onyomi: ゲン Lesson: 50 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: Compounds:"

Carriers, i.e. boats with missiles, are not available to the general public. Koohii #2 In general, carrier boats have missiles. conveyor Details Story Dictionary 搬 conveyor Heisig's Fingers . . . carrier. Koohii #1 When workers neglect workplace safety, their fingers get cut off and carried away by the conveyor belt, which looks like a ´finger carrier´ in that case. Koohii #2 During WWII, morse code was the primary means of communication from sea. The morse code specialist was the conveyor of messages to and from the crew of the carrier, using his fingers to tap out the secret messages. (This works especially well for 搬送周波数 carrier frequency and 搬送波 carrier wave, being the radio waves/frequencies used in morse code). Primitives conveyor, finger, fingers, carrier, boat, cruise missile, missile, wind, crotch 運搬(うんぱん): transport, carriage Kunyomi: Onyomi: ハン Lesson: 50 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	conveyor 搬 画数13 2018 Details Story Dictionary 搬 conveyor Heisig's Fingers . . . carrier. Koohii #1 When workers neglect workplace safety, their fingers get cut off and carried away by the conveyor belt, which looks like a ´finger carrier´ in that case. Koohii #2 During WWII, morse code was the primary means of communication from sea. The morse code specialist was the conveyor of messages to and from the crew of the carrier, using his fingers to tap out the secret messages. (This works especially well for 搬送周波数 carrier frequency and 搬送波 carrier wave, being the radio waves/frequencies used in morse code). Primitives conveyor, finger, fingers, carrier, boat, cruise missile, missile, wind, crotch 運搬(うんぱん): transport, carriage Kunyomi: Onyomi: ハン Lesson: 50 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:
"ship Details Story Dictionary 船 ship My Story SEND for the caterer! I have *eight* *mouths* to feed on this here *boat*! Koohii #1 A boy floats his toy boat in a gully and imagines it as an immense ship. Koohii #2 Aargh, hard to keep this separate from boat. How about this: the phrase ""shape up or ship out!"" This phrase originally meant that a soldier had better get his act together, or else face being shipped off into a combat zone. Here we see a poor WW-I soldier who has been shipped off to a combat zone. He´s riding in the boat overseas to fight in the trenches (gulley). Primitives ship, boat, gully, eight, mouth 汽船(きせん): steamship 漁船(ぎょせん): fishing boat 船舶(せんぱく): ship 船(ふね): ship, boat, watercraft, shipping, vessel, steamship 造船(ぞうせん): shipbuilding 風船(ふうせん): balloon 船便(ふなびん): surface mail (ship) Kunyomi: ふね、ふな- Onyomi: セン Lesson: 50 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 船 (ふね)"	"ship 船 画数11 2019 Details Story Dictionary 船 ship My Story SEND for the caterer! orphan Details Story Dictionary 孤 orphan Heisig's Child . . . melon. Koohii #1 An orphan will never know the joys on sucking on his mother´s melons........ Koohii #2 Unlike the celebrated story of Momotaro the peach boy, no one knows the story of the melon boy who was left an orphan. Primitives orphan, child, melon, claw, vulture, elbow 孤児(こじ): orphan 孤独(こどく): isolation, loneliness, solitude 孤立(こりつ): isolation, helplessness Kunyomi: Onyomi: コ Lesson: 50 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	orphan 孤 画数9 2024 Details Story Dictionary 孤 orphan Heisig's Child . . . melon. Koohii #1 An orphan will never know the joys on sucking on his mother´s melons........ Koohii #2 Unlike the celebrated story of Momotaro the peach boy, no one knows the story of the melon boy who was left an orphan. Primitives orphan, child, melon, claw, vulture, elbow 孤児(こじ): orphan 孤独(こどく): isolation, loneliness, solitude 孤立(こりつ): isolation, helplessness Kunyomi: Onyomi: コ Lesson: 50 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:
cocoon Details Story Dictionary 繭 cocoon Heisig's Though it's a good thing that the primitive for cocoon has been radically abbreviated from this, its full form as a kanji, the story it holds is a charming one. The silkworm (insect) eats the leaves of the mulberry bush (the flowers), digests them and transforms them into thread with which it spins about itself, in mystic wisdom, its own coffin (the hood). The dividing line that separates the two elements helps the picture of the little worm cutting itself off from contact with the outside world, but as a character stroke, it is a clear exception. Koohii #1 This is a simple two-column manga showing the metamorphosis of a caterpillar into a cocoon. First, the caterpillar gets under a large flower (bees tend to hang around flowers, which scare away other predators). Then, in the first frame, we see the caterpillar (insect). Then, a bar separating this frame from the next frame (remember that Japanese manga run the other way!), in which we see the insect covered with thread, making a beautiful cocoon. Koohii #2 The magic flower is the reason why Spider-Man ended up miniaturized and confined inside a hood-like cocoon together with an insect. Now, only a walking stick separates them both. Primitives cocoon, flowers, hood, stick, thread, spiderman, insect Kunyomi: まゆ、きぬ Onyomi: ケン Lesson: 51 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 繭 (まゆ)	cocoon 繭 画数18 2025 Details Story Dictionary 繭 cocoon Heisig's Though it's a good thing that the primitive for cocoon has been radically abbreviated from this, its full form as a kanji, the story it holds is a charming one. The silkworm (insect) eats the leaves of the mulberry bush (the flowers), digests them and transforms them into thread with which it spins about itself, in mystic wisdom, its own coffin (the hood). The dividing line that separates the two elements helps the picture of the little worm cutting itself off from contact with the outside world, but as a character stroke, it is a clear exception. Koohii #1 This is a simple two-column manga showing the metamorphosis of a caterpillar into a cocoon. First, the caterpillar gets under a large flower (bees tend to hang around flowers, which scare away other predators). Then, in the first frame, we see the caterpillar (insect). Then, a bar separating this frame from the next frame (remember that Japanese manga run the other way!), in which we see the insect covered with thread, making a beautiful cocoon. Koohii #2 The magic flower is the reason why Spider-Man ended up miniaturized and confined inside a hood-like cocoon together with an insect. Now, only a walking stick separates them both. Primitives cocoon, flowers, hood, stick, thread, spiderman, insect Kunyomi: まゆ、きぬ Onyomi: ケン Lesson: 51 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 繭 (まゆ)
benefit Details Story Dictionary 益 benefit Heisig's Poised over the dish here is a pair of animal horns that are attached to a pair of animal legs by a single horizontal stroke. Koohii #1 The benefit of having sharp horns and fast legs is that an animal can get to the food dish first. Koohii #2 The benefit of being an animal with horns and fast legs is in keeping it from becoming a dish for the other animals! (shaydwyrm). Primitives benefit, animal horns, one, floor, animal legs, eight, dish 収益(しゅうえき): earnings, proceeds, returns 益々(ますます): increasingly, more and more 有益(ゆうえき): beneficial, profitable 利益(りえき): profits, gains, (political, economic) interest Kunyomi: ま.す Onyomi: エキ、ヤク Lesson: 51 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 有益 (ゆうえき), 利益 (りえき), 益する (まする), 益 (やく)	benefit 益 画数10 2026 Details Story Dictionary 益 benefit Heisig's Poised over the dish here is a pair of animal horns that are attached to a pair of animal legs by a single horizontal stroke. Koohii #1 The benefit of having sharp horns and fast legs is that an animal can get to the food dish first. Koohii #2 The benefit of being an animal with horns and fast legs is in keeping it from becoming a dish for the other animals! (shaydwyrm). Primitives benefit, animal horns, one, floor, animal legs, eight, dish 収益(しゅうえき): earnings, proceeds, returns 益々(ますます): increasingly, more and more 有益(ゆうえき): beneficial, profitable 利益(りえき): profits, gains, (political, economic) interest Kunyomi: ま.す Onyomi: エキ、ヤク Lesson: 51 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 有益 (ゆうえき), 利益 (りえき), 益する (まする), 益 (やく)
"spare time Details Story Dictionary 暇 spare time Heisig's The element for day on the left is logical enough. Next to it we see staples being held in mouth (one stroke is doubled up), indicating working in one's hobby or handicrafts at home on one's spare time. The small box at the top right is facing backwards, or more properly ""inside out."" Finally, we have the crotch at the bottom. Koohii #1 Some jackass-like people have way too much spare time. You can find video´s of them all over the internet, if you like such things, you can watch it all day. You see them stapling their mouths shut, or throwing eachother upside down in boxes or kicking each other in the crotch. Koohii #2 Tip: The complex right side of this kanji appears twice more in Heisig. He later names it ""hobby"". REF: shrimp (#2689), haze (#2779). Primitives spare time, sun, day, hobby, staples, mouth, box, crotch, box2 暇(いとま): free time, leisure, leave, spare time, farewell 余暇(よか): leisure, leisure time, spare time 休暇(きゅうか): holiday, day off, furlough 暇(ひま): free time, leisure, leave, spare time, farewell Kunyomi: ひま、いとま Onyomi: カ Lesson: 51 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 暇 (ひま)"	"spare time 暇 画数13 2027 Details Story Dictionary 暇 spare time Heisig's The element for day on the left is logical enough. Next to it we see staples being held in mouth (one stroke is doubled up), indicating working in one's hobby or handicrafts at home on one's spare time. The small box at the top right is facing backwards, or more properly ""inside out."" Finally, we have the crotch at the bottom. Koohii #1 Some jackass-like people have way too much spare time. You can find video´s of them all over the internet, if you like such things, you can watch it all day. You see them stapling their mouths shut, or throwing eachother upside down in boxes or kicking each other in the crotch. Koohii #2 Tip: The complex right side of this kanji appears twice more in Heisig. He later names it ""hobby"". REF: shrimp (#2689), haze (#2779). Primitives spare time, sun, day, hobby, staples, mouth, box, crotch, box2 暇(いとま): free time, leisure, leave, spare time, farewell 余暇(よか): leisure, leisure time, spare time 休暇(きゅうか): holiday, day off, furlough 暇(ひま): free time, leisure, leave, spare time, farewell Kunyomi: ひま、いとま Onyomi: カ Lesson: 51 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 暇 (ひま)"
spread Details Story Dictionary 敷 spread Heisig's At the top we have the arrowhead whose vertical line joins it to the rice field (or brains) below it. Beneath it, the compass; and to the right, the taskmaster. Koohii #1 Instead of being glued to one specialty (#46) 専, I decided to spread my attention in many directions 方, and be a taskmaster at none. Koohii #2 Arrowheads are spread all over the field. The taskmaster profiteerer forces you to find them all using a compass. Primitives spread, arrowhead, rice field, brains, compass, direction, taskmaster 屋敷(やしき): mansion 座敷(ざしき): tatami room 敷地(しきち): site 敷く(しく): spread out, to lay out, take a position 風呂敷(ふろしき): wrapping cloth, cloth wrapper Kunyomi: し.く、-し.き Onyomi: フ Lesson: 51 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 敷く (し.く)	spread 敷 画数15 2028 Details Story Dictionary 敷 spread Heisig's At the top we have the arrowhead whose vertical line joins it to the rice field (or brains) below it. Beneath it, the compass; and to the right, the taskmaster. Koohii #1 Instead of being glued to one specialty (#46) 専, I decided to spread my attention in many directions 方, and be a taskmaster at none. Koohii #2 Arrowheads are spread all over the field. The taskmaster profiteerer forces you to find them all using a compass. Primitives spread, arrowhead, rice field, brains, compass, direction, taskmaster 屋敷(やしき): mansion 座敷(ざしき): tatami room 敷地(しきち): site 敷く(しく): spread out, to lay out, take a position 風呂敷(ふろしき): wrapping cloth, cloth wrapper Kunyomi: し.く、-し.き Onyomi: フ Lesson: 51 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 敷く (し.く)
"come Details Story Dictionary 来 come Heisig's This odd but common kanji is built up of the character for not yet into which a pair of animal horns has been inserted. Koohii #1 You horny bastard, don´t come, at least not yet! Koohii #2 Here I see, of all things, Bambi. His animal horns have not yet come out. (As we can see in the kanji, the animal horns are not at the top, not ""poking through"". ) Remember: Bambi will soon come to have a great set of animal horns but they have not yet come out. Primitives come, not yet, animal horns 外来(がいらい): imported, outpatient clinic 元来(がんらい): originally, primarily, essentially, logically, naturally 来る(きたる): to come, to arrive, to be due to, to be next, to be forthcoming 家来(けらい): retainer, retinue, servant 為来り(しきたり): customs 従来(じゅうらい): up to now, so far, traditional 出来物(できもの): able man, tumour, growth, boil, ulcer, abcess, rash, pimple 伝来(でんらい): ancestral, hereditary, imported, transmitted, handed down 来場(らいじょう): attendance 以来(いらい): since, henceforth 再来月(さらいげつ): month after next 再来週(さらいしゅう): week after next 出来上がり(できあがり): finish, completion, ready, made for, cut out 出来上がる(できあがる): be finished, be ready, by definition, be very drunk 出来事(できごと): incident, affair, happening, event 出来るだけ(できるだけ): if at all possible 本来(ほんらい): essentially, naturally, by nature, in (and of) itself, originally 未来(みらい): future tense, the future (usually distant), the world to come 来(らい): since (last month), for (10 days), next (year) 来日(らいにち): arrival in Japan, coming to Japan, visit to Japan さ来月(さらいげつ): the month after next さ来週(さらいしゅう): the week after next 将来(しょうらい): future 来る(くる): come, come to hand, arrive, approach, call on, set in, be due, become, grow, get, come from, be caused by, derive from 再来年(さらいねん): year after next 来月(らいげつ): next month 来週(らいしゅう): next week 来年(らいねん): next year Kunyomi: く.る、きた.る、きた.す、き.たす、き.たる、き、こ Onyomi: ライ、タイ Lesson: 51 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 5 Compounds: 来す (きた.す), 来る (きた.る), 来る (く.る)"	"come 来 画数7 2029 Details Story Dictionary 来 come Heisig's This odd but common kanji is built up of the character for not yet into which a pair of animal horns has been inserted. Koohii #1 You horny bastard, don´t come, at least not yet! Koohii #2 Here I see, of all things, Bambi. His animal horns have not yet come out. (As we can see in the kanji, the animal horns are not at the top, not ""poking through"". ) Remember: Bambi will soon come to have a great set of animal horns but they have not yet come out. spirit Details Story Dictionary 気 spirit Heisig's The spirit in this character refers to the changeable moods and airs of one's personality as well as to the more essential combination of vital forces that distinguish things and individuals one from the other. Its elements are: reclining . . . floor . . . fishhook . . . sheaf. Do not confuse with spirits (Frame 1930). Koohii #1 You´re reclining on the floor trying to hook a sheaf with a small hook through the cracks. That you´ve been doing this for seven hours without success shows your burning spirit. Koohii #2 Captain Hook, his spirit crushed, is lying on the ground cursing Wolverine who has defeated him with his far superior claws. Primitives spirit, landed fish, reclining, lying down, one, floor, fishhook, sheaf 呆気ない(あっけない): not enough, too quick (short long etc.) 意気込む(いきごむ): to be enthusiastic about 一気(いっき): drink!(said repeatedly as a party cheer) 陰気(いんき): gloom, melancholy 浮気(うわき): flighty, fickle, wanton, unfaithful 気質(かたぎ): spirit, character, trait, temperament, disposition 気触れる(かぶれる): to react to, to be influenced by, to go overboard for 寒気(かんき): cold, frost, chill 気兼ね(きがね): hesitance, diffidence, feeling constraint, fear of troubling someone, having scruples about doing something 気軽(きがる): cheerful, buoyant, lighthearted 気障(きざ): affectation, conceit, snobbery 気象(きしょう): weather, climate 気立て(きだて): disposition, nature 気配(きはい): indication, market trend, worry 気品(きひん): aroma 気風(きふう): character, traits, ethos 気まぐれ(きまぐれ): whim, caprice, whimsy, fickle, moody, uneven temper 気楽(きらく): at ease, comfortable 気流(きりゅう): atmospheric current 強気(ごうぎ): great, grand 根気(こんき): patience, perseverance, energy 磁気(じき): magnetism 湿気る(しける): to be damp, to be moist 湿気(しっき): moisture, humidity, dampness 水気(すいき): moisture, dampness, vapor, dropsy, edema 素っ気ない(そっけない): cold, short, curt, blunt 短気(たんき): quick temper 何気ない(なにげない): casual, unconcerned 不景気(ふけいき): business recession, hard times, depression, gloom, sullenness, cheerlessness 本気(ほんき): seriousness, truth, sanctity 無邪気(むじゃき): innocence, simple-mindedness 活気(かっき): energy, liveliness 換気(かんき): ventilation 気圧(きあつ): atmospheric pressure 気温(きおん): temperature 気候(きこう): climate 気体(きたい): vapour, gas 気付く(きづく): notice, recognize, become aware of, perceive, realize 気に入る(きにいる): be pleased with, to suit 気の毒(きのどく): pitiful, a pity 気味(きみ): sensation, feeling 気を付ける(きをつける): be careful, pay attention 景気(けいき): condition, state, business conditions, the times 気配(けはい): indication, market trend, worry 蒸気(じょうき): steam, vapour 水蒸気(すいじょうき): water vapour, steam 大気(たいき): atmosphere 強気(つよき): firm, strong 生意気(なまいき): impertinent, saucy, cheeky, conceit, audacious, brazen 人気(にんき): popular, business conditions, popular feeling 呑気(のんき): carefree, optimistic, careless, reckless, heedless, happy-go-lucky, easygoing 吐き気(はきけ): nausea, sickness in the stomach 雰囲気(ふんいき): atmosphere (e.g. musical), mood, ambience 平気(へいき): coolness, calmness, composure, unconcern 勇気(ゆうき): courage, bravery, valour, nerve, boldness 湯気(ゆげ): steam, vapour 陽気(ようき): season, weather, cheerfulness 気(き): spirit, mind 気分(きぶん): mood 気持ち(きもち): feelings 空気(くうき): air 天気予報(てんきよほう): weather forecast 元気(げんき): health(y), robust, vigor, energy, vitality, vim, stamina, spirit, courage, pep 天気(てんき): weather, the elements, fine weather 電気(でんき): electricity, (electric) light 病気(びょうき): illness, disease, sickness Kunyomi: いき Onyomi: キ、ケ Lesson: 51 Jouyou: 1 JLPT Level: 5 Compounds: 気体 (きたい), 気候 (きこう), 元気 (げんき)	spirit 気 画数6 2030 Details Story Dictionary 気 spirit Heisig's The spirit in this character refers to the changeable moods and airs of one's personality as well vapor Details Story Dictionary 汽 vapor Heisig's Think of this character as a sibling of that for spirit. Simply replace sheaves with drops of water on the left in order to get vapor. Koohii #1 Water vapor almost looks like a spirit but has no soul. Koohii #2 Wolverine disappears into water vapor, seemingly his spirit dissipating into nothingness. Primitives vapor, water, water droplets, water pistol, landed fish, reclining, lying down, one, floor, fishhook 汽船(きせん): steamship 汽車(きしゃ): train (locomotive) Kunyomi: Onyomi: キ Lesson: 51 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	vapor 汽 画数7 2031 Details Story Dictionary 汽 vapor Heisig's Think of this character as a sibling of that for spirit. Simply replace sheaves with drops of water on the left in order to get vapor. Koohii #1 Water vapor almost looks like a spirit but has no soul. Koohii #2 Wolverine disappears into water vapor, seemingly his spirit dissipating into nothingness. Primitives vapor, water, water droplets, water pistol, landed fish, reclining, lying down, one, floor, fishhook 汽船(きせん): steamship 汽車(きしゃ): train (locomotive) Kunyomi: Onyomi: キ Lesson: 51 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:
fly Details Story Dictionary 飛 fly My Story Captain *hook* flying in a *measuring* box with two *propellers*. Koohii #1 Hooks with small wings attached look like hummingbirds with a long beak. Two hummingbirds are trying to fly away with our little measuring box. What do they want it for? Koohii #2 Two hummingbirds flying into a measuring box serving as a bird feeder…　RTK2:　ヒ　飛行機　ひこうき(airplane). Primitives fly, hook, propeller, measuring box, thousand, needles, propeller2 蹴飛ばす(けとばす): to kick away, to kick off, to kick (someone), to refuse, to reject 飛ばす(とばす): skip over, omit 飛び込む(とびこむ): jump in, leap in, plunge into, dive 飛び出す(とびだす): jump out, rush out, fly out, appear suddenly, protrude, project 飛行(ひこう): flying, flight, aviation 飛行場(ひこうじょう): airfield, airport 飛ぶ(とぶ): jump, fly, leap, spring, bound, hop 飛行機(ひこうき): airplane Kunyomi: と.ぶ、と.ばす、-と.ばす Onyomi: ヒ Lesson: 51 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 飛ばす (と.ばす), 飛ぶ (と.ぶ)	fly 飛 画数9 2032 Details Story Dictionary 飛 fly My Story Captain *hook* flying in a *measuring* box with two *propellers*. Koohii #1 Hooks with small wings attached look like hummingbirds with a long beak. Two hummingbirds are trying to fly away with our little measuring box. What do they want it for? Koohii #2 Two hummingbirds flying into a measuring box serving as a bird feeder…　RTK2:　ヒ　飛行機　ひこうき(airplane). Primitives fly, hook, propeller, measuring box, thousand, needles, propeller2 蹴飛ばす(けとばす): to kick away, to kick off, to kick (someone), to refuse, to reject 飛ばす(とばす): skip over, omit 飛び込む(とびこむ): jump in, leap in, plunge into, dive 飛び出す(とびだす): jump out, rush out, fly out, appear suddenly, protrude, project 飛行(ひこう): flying, flight, aviation 飛行場(ひこうじょう): airfield, airport 飛ぶ(とぶ): jump, fly, leap, spring, bound, hop 飛行機(ひこうき): airplane Kunyomi: と.ぶ、と.ばす、-と.ばす Onyomi: ヒ Lesson: 51 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 飛ばす (と.ばす), 飛ぶ (と.ぶ)
"sink Details Story Dictionary 沈 sink Heisig's The technique for sinking used in this kanji is unique. Rather than the biblical image of tying a millstone about the victim's neck, here we see a crown tied about one leg before the unfortunate party is tossed into the water. Koohii #1 (thx geezer) The maimed waitress (no head and arms just her legs and trunk) is dropped into the water with a cement crown to make sure she sinks. She shouldn´t have been so nosy about her yakuza-boyfriend´s schemes. Koohii #2 This is the famous story of Archimedes and the Crown, where buoyancy was discovered. Watching the crown sink in the water, Archimedes detected the fraud and ran naked through the city (human legs distorted from running) yelling ""Eureka! Eureka!"" See http://math.nyu.edu/~crorres/Archimedes/Crown/CrownIntro.html and http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eureka_%28word%29. Primitives sink, water, water droplets, water pistol, garter, crown, human legs 沈める(しずめる): to sink, to submerge 沈殿(ちんでん): precipitation, settlement 沈没(ちんぼつ): sinking, foundering 沈黙(ちんもく): silence, reticence 沈む(しずむ): sink, feel depressed Kunyomi: しず.む、しず.める Onyomi: チン、ジン Lesson: 51 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 沈む (しず.む), 沈める (しず.める)"	"sink 沈 画数7 2033 Details Story Dictionary 沈 sink Heisig's The technique for sinking used in this kanji is unique. Rather than the biblical image of tying a millstone about the victim's neck, here we see a crown tied about one leg before the unfortunate party is tossed into the water. Koohii #1 (thx geezer) The maimed waitress (no head and arms just her legs and trunk) is dropped into the water with a cement crown to make sure she sinks. She shouldn´t have been so nosy about her yakuza-boyfriend´s schemes. Koohii #2 This is the famous story of Archimedes and the Crown, where buoyancy was discovered. Watching the crown sink in the water, Archimedes detected the fraud and ran naked through the city (human legs distorted from running) yelling ""Eureka! Eureka!"" See http://math.nyu.edu/~crorres/Archimedes/Crown/CrownIntro.html and http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eureka_%28word%29. "pillow Details Story Dictionary 枕 pillow Heisig's Tree . . . crown tied around leg of person. Koohii #1 The guy who was thrown into the river to sink was given one last request. ""If I´m gonna be sleeping with the fishes,"" he said, ""can I at least have a pillow? I´m real sensitive."" The mafia bosses laughed. ""Look, my doctor said I can only use wooden pillows, I have a real serious condition. Can I at least die comfortable-like?"" The mafia dudes said fine, and let him have his pillow. They tossed him the river and drove off...and after a minute, he bobbed to the top, thanks to his floating wood pillow. Koohii #2 WOODEN PILLOWS do not sink (#1888) in water. Primitives pillow, tree, wood, garter, crown, human legs 枕(まくら): pillow, bolster Kunyomi: まくら Onyomi: チン、シン Lesson: 51 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: Compounds: 枕 (まくら)"	"pillow 枕 画数8 2034 Details Story Dictionary 枕 pillow Heisig's Tree . . . crown tied around leg of person. The mafia bosses laughed. ""Look, my doctor said I can only use wooden pillows, I have a real serious condition. Can I at least die comfortable-like?"" The mafia dudes said fine, and let him have his pillow. They tossed him the river and drove off...and after a minute, he bobbed to the top, thanks to his floating wood pillow. "wife Details Story Dictionary 妻 wife Heisig's Ten . . . rakes . . . woman. Koohii #1 Ten rakes woman. your wife digs her fingernails into you and it feels like 10 rakes when she finds you ontop of another woman. Koohii #2 (I´m really not sexist, this just helps me remember the kanji): I make my WIFE do all the yard work, and as a really mean joke, I bought her TEN RAKES for her birthday this year. ""Do the yardwork, WOMAN! You have TEN perfectly good RAKES to choose from!"". Primitives wife, ten, needle, rake, woman 夫妻(ふさい): man and wife, married couple 妻(つま): wife Kunyomi: つま Onyomi: サイ Lesson: 51 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 妻 (つま)"	"wife 妻 画数8 2035 Details Story Dictionary 妻 wife Heisig's Ten . . . rakes . . . woman. Primitives nifty, ice, wife, ten, needle, rake, woman 凄い(すごい): terrible, dreadful, terrific, amazing, great, wonderful, to a great extent 物凄い(ものすごい): earth-shattering, staggering, to a very great extent Kunyomi: さむ.い、すご.い、すさ.まじい Onyomi: セイ、サイ Lesson: 51 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: Compounds:	nifty 凄 画数10 2036 Details Story Dictionary 凄 nifty Heisig's Ice . . . wife. decline Details Story Dictionary 衰 decline Heisig's Let this key word connote the decline and fall of the Roman Empire. It shows a fellow in a top hat and scarf, trying hard to look happy by putting a walking stick in his mouth sideways to twist his face into a grotesque but semi permanent smile. Koohii #1 If you thought that the dude in 哀 was pathetic, you haven´t seen him after his decline. Here he is carrying a stick around in his mouth like a dog, begging people to throw it for him. Note that the mouth is closed only after the stick goes in, as is only logical. Koohii #2 If you thought that the dude in 哀 was pathetic, you haven´t seen him after his decline. Here he is carrying a stick around in his mouth like a dog, allowing people to rent him and play catch with him for money! Primitives decline, pathetic, stick, top hat, scarf, mouth 衰える(おとろえる): to become weak, to decline, to wear, to abate, to decay, to wither, to waste away 老衰(ろうすい): senility, senile decay Kunyomi: おとろ.える Onyomi: スイ Lesson: 51 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 衰える (おとろ.える)	decline 衰 画数10 2037 Details Story Dictionary 衰 decline Heisig's Let this key word connote the decline and fall of the Roman Empire. It shows a fellow in a top hat and scarf, trying hard to look happy by putting a walking stick in his mouth sideways to twist his face into a grotesque but semi permanent smile. Koohii #1 If you thought that the dude in 哀 was pathetic, you haven´t seen him after his decline. Here he is carrying a stick around in his mouth like a dog, begging people to throw it for him. inmost Details Story Dictionary 衷 inmost Heisig's Between the top hat and the scarf you will see the character for in which is truncated at the bottom so as not to interfere with the scarf. You can think of this character forming as a pair with that of the former frame: there the in (the walking stick in the mouth) was set on its side; here it is set upright. Koohii #1 The guy from pathetic (#401) shared his inmost feelings with a girl and she rammed a walking stick down his throat. It ruptured his inmost organs. Koohii #2 Besides making money from acting like a dog (see decline), the pathetic man has risked his inmost internal organs by becoming a cane swallower! Primitives inmost, ten, needle, mouth, scarf 折衷(せっちゅう): compromise, cross, blending, eclecticism Kunyomi: Onyomi: チュウ Lesson: 51 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	inmost 衷 画数9 2038 Details Story Dictionary 衷 inmost Heisig's Between the top hat and the scarf you will see the character for in which is truncated at the bottom so as not to interfere with the scarf. mask Details Story Dictionary 面 mask Heisig's Imagine a mask over your head with eyes peeping out from all over the head, a hundred in all (the element for eye displacing the fifth stroke of that for hundred). Koohii #1 If you´re wearing a mask, a hundred eyes can look at you but none of them will know who you are. Koohii #2 When Jim Carrey puts on The Mask, he can make it seem like he has 100 eyes popping out of his head. Primitives mask, hundred, one, ceiling, drop, pent in, eye 一面(いちめん): one side, one phase, front page, the other hand, the whole surface 面(おも): face 面白い(おもしろい): interesting, amusing 几帳面(きちょうめん): methodical, punctual, steady 生真面目(きまじめ): too serious, person who is too serious, honesty, sincerity 斜面(しゃめん): slope, slanting surface, bevel 側面(そくめん): side, flank, sidelight, lateral 対面(たいめん): interview, meeting 断面(だんめん): cross section 直面(ちょくめん): confrontation 面皰(にきび): pimple, acne 覆面(ふくめん): mask, veil, disguise 面会(めんかい): interview 面する(めんする): to face on, to look out on to 面目(めんぼく): face, honour, reputation, prestige, dignity, credit 正面(しょうめん): front, frontage, facade, main 場面(ばめん): scene, setting (e.g. of novel) 表面(ひょうめん): surface, outside, face, appearance 方面(ほうめん): direction, district, field (of study) 真面目(まじめ): diligent, serious, honest 面(めん): face, surface, facial features, mask, side or facet, corner, page 面積(めんせき): area 面接(めんせつ): interview 面倒(めんどう): trouble, difficulty, care, attention 面倒臭い(めんどうくさい): bother to do, tiresome Kunyomi: おも、おもて、つら Onyomi: メン、ベン Lesson: 51 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 面 (おも), 面 (おもて), 面 (つら)	mask 面 画数9 2039 Details Story Dictionary 面 mask Heisig's Imagine a mask over your head with eyes peeping out from all over the head, a hundred in all (the element for eye displacing the fifth stroke of that for hundred). Also everyone else grows up from his table and uses his walking legs to get the hell out of here. Koohii #2 There is a certain restaurant in West-Shinjuku that serves its noodles made of BARLEY in a MASK instead of a plate. I love these theme-restaurants! "leather Details Story Dictionary 革 leather My Story [""Cowboy head"" {廿} + Mouth + Needle/ten] Female cowboy with big tits and a thicc ass Koohii #1 I asked the street vendor the price of the LEATHER jacket. He said TWENTY, but with my MOUTH, I talked him down to TEN. (correct stroke order). Koohii #2 You can feed twenty mouths for a year for the price of ten leather coats. hegemony Details Story Dictionary 覇 hegemony Heisig's Old West . . . leather . . . moon. Koohii #1 In the old west, animal skins were made into leather and their flesh was eaten, thus using the whole animal, which viewed from the animal side could be taken as humans asserting complete hegemony over them. All your base are belong to us. Koohii #2 In the Old West, cowboys had hegemony OVER the Indians despite their leathercraft and ability to navigate by the moon. Primitives hegemony, old west, leather, flowers, car, mouth, ten, needle, moon, month, flesh, part of the body Kunyomi: はたがしら Onyomi: ハ、ハク Lesson: 51 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	hegemony 覇 画数19 2043 Details Story Dictionary 覇 hegemony Heisig's Old West . . . leather . . . moon. voice Details Story Dictionary 声 voice My Story [Jesus + stripped flag] *Jesus* rose above the *striped flag* and sung with the voice of an angle Koohii #1 Having lost his voice, the samurai comunicated to his troops with a striped flag. Koohii #2 When an enemy´s flag is raised, a true samurai can split it in half with just his voice. "give Details Story Dictionary 呉 give Heisig's The complex of strokes in this kanji is unusual and difficult, because of the fourth stroke, which is rare (see frames 33 and 34). The mouth and tool are already familiar. Koohii #1 Picture of a person facing you. 口 is the head. His right arm is raised (your left), to give you something from a tray 一. His legs ハ are below the tray. 呉れる、くれる, to give: 伯父がこの時計を呉れました, ""My uncle gave me this watch."" Following -て form of another verb, means ""to do the favor of"": 窓を開けて呉れませんか, ""Won't you open the window [do the favor of opening/kindly open the window]?"" Usu. written in hiragana. Koohii #2 I see this as a pictograph of an old-style phonograph - a stand, record, crank and bell (the mouth). Even the primitives work out - a tool with a crank which plays music out of the bell mouth. Imaginge giving one of these old and beautiful phonographs to a classical or jazz music buff! Primitives give, mouth, chair, tool, animal legs 呉れる(くれる): to give, to let one have, to do for one, to be given Kunyomi: く.れる、くれ Onyomi: ゴ Lesson: 51 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"	"give 呉 画数7 2046 Details Story Dictionary 呉 give Heisig's The complex of strokes in this kanji is unusual and difficult, because of the fourth stroke, which is rare (see frames 33 and 34). The mouth and tool are already familiar. Koohii #1 Picture of a person facing you. 口 is the head. His right arm is raised (your left), to give you something from a tray 一. His legs ハ are below the tray. 呉れる、くれる, to give: 伯父がこの時計を呉れました, ""My uncle gave me this watch."" Following -て form of another verb, means ""to do the favor of"": 窓を開けて呉れませんか, ""Won't you open the window [do the favor of opening/kindly open the window]?"" Usu. written in hiragana. Koohii #2 I see this as a pictograph of an old-style phonograph - a stand, record, crank and bell (the mouth). Even the primitives work out - a tool with a crank which plays music out of the bell mouth. Imaginge giving one of these old and beautiful phonographs to a classical or jazz music buff! Primitives give, mouth, chair, tool, animal legs 呉れる(くれる): to give, to let one have, to do for one, to be given Kunyomi: く.れる、くれ Onyomi: ゴ Lesson: 51 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"
"recreation Details Story Dictionary 娯 recreation Heisig's Woman . . . give. Koohii #1 A woman gives up her recreation time in order to raise a family. Koohii #2 Typical male fantasy of recreation: women ""giving it up"". Primitives recreation, woman, give, mouth, chair, tool, animal legs 娯楽(ごらく): pleasure, amusement Kunyomi: Onyomi: ゴ Lesson: 51 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"	"recreation 娯 画数10 2047 Details Story Dictionary 娯 recreation Heisig's Woman . . . give.
