"mistake Details Story Dictionary 誤 mistake Heisig's Words . . . give. Koohii #1 You must give words of apology when you make a mistake. Koohii #2 It is a rookie mistake to believe the words when your sweetie says ""You don´t have to give me anything for my birthday."" Trust me, your sweetie wants something, something shiny, and if you disappoint, you will suffer. Primitives mistake, say, words, keitai, mouth, give, mouth, chair, tool, animal legs, mouth2 誤る(あやまる): to make a mistake 誤差(ごさ): error 誤魔化す(ごまかす): to deceive, to falsify, to misrepresent 錯誤(さくご): mistake 誤り(あやまり): error 誤解(ごかい): misunderstanding Kunyomi: あやま.る、-あやま.る Onyomi: ゴ Lesson: 51 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 誤る (あやま.る)"	"mistake 誤 画数14 2048 Details Story Dictionary 誤 mistake Heisig's Words . . . give. steam Details Story Dictionary 蒸 steam My Story Note: *complete + water + floor* are later combined into 丞 {丞}. Story: The maker of a steam tea machine asks you for a *helping hand* and explains that your job is to throw Jasmine *flowers* on the *fire* to make the steam. RTK2:　ジョウ　蒸発　じょうはつ(evaporation). Koohii #1 Think of a picture of someone steaming vegetables. On top you see the flowers of cauliflower or something else that is being steamed. Underneath, the pan is completely full of water. Below the pan is a floor - that's the hotplate - and under that the oven fire. Caution: don't confuse with boil (#1257), or the steam radical in spirit (#1885). Koohii #2 When you want to steam some flowers/vegetation you don't cover them completely with water, rather you have just a little at the floor of the saucepan and then heat. Primitives steam, flowers, helping hand, complete, water, one, floor, oven-fire, barbecue 蒸留(じょうりゅう): distillation 蒸気(じょうき): steam, vapour 蒸発(じょうはつ): evaporation, unexplained disappearance 水蒸気(すいじょうき): water vapour, steam 蒸し暑い(むしあつい): humid, sultry 蒸す(むす): to steam, poultice, be sultry Kunyomi: む.す、む.れる、む.らす Onyomi: ジョウ、セイ Lesson: 51 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 蒸す (む.す), 蒸らす (む.らす), 蒸れる (む.れる)	steam 蒸 画数13 2049 Details Story Dictionary 蒸 steam My Story Note: *complete + water + floor* are later combined into 丞 {丞}. "acquiesce Details Story Dictionary 承 acquiesce Heisig's The sense of passive acceptance or reception of information is contained in this key word. The form is based on the middle portion of the preceding character, with three additional strokes, best thought of as the kanji for three. Koohii #1 To get someone to completely acquiesce it takes 3 dunks in the water before they give. Koohii #2 To get someone to acquiesce, duck them completely in aqua (=water) three times. (variation on dingomick´s). Primitives acquiesce, water, complete, three 承諾(しょうだく): consent, acquiescence, agreement 了承(りょうしょう): acknowledgement, understanding (e.g. ""please be understanding of the mess during our renovation"") 承る(うけたまわる): (humble) hear, be told, know 承認(しょうにん): recognition, acknowledgement, approval, consent, agreement 承知(しょうち): consent, agree Kunyomi: うけたまわ.る、う.ける、ささ.げる、とど.める、たす.ける、こ.らす、つい.で、すく.う Onyomi: ショウ、ジョウ Lesson: 51 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 承る (うけたまわ.る)"	"acquiesce 承 画数8 2050 Details Story Dictionary 承 acquiesce Heisig's The sense of passive acceptance or reception of information is contained in this key word. The form is based on the middle portion of the preceding character, with three additional strokes, best thought of as the kanji for three. Koohii #1 To get someone to completely acquiesce it takes 3 dunks in the water before they give. Koohii #2 To get someone to acquiesce, duck them completely in aqua (=water) three times. (variation on dingomick´s). Primitives acquiesce, water, complete, three 承諾(しょうだく): consent, acquiescence, agreement 了承(りょうしょう): acknowledgement, understanding (e.g. ""please be understanding of the mess during our renovation"") 承る(うけたまわる): (humble) hear, be told, know 承認(しょうにん): recognition, acknowledgement, approval, consent, agreement 承知(しょうち): consent, agree Kunyomi: うけたまわ.る、う.ける、ささ.げる、とど.める、たす.ける、こ.らす、つい.で、すく.う Onyomi: ショウ、ジョウ Lesson: 51 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 承る (うけたまわ.る)"
bin Details Story Dictionary 函 bin Heisig's This is the character from which the element for shovel derives. Within it comes the element for snare, with the sparkler surrounding it. Koohii #1 Damn racoons ill show them. I put a snare in the bin as well as a few phosphorous sparklers so as to scare the shit out of the buggers as they rummage through my bin. Koohii #2 (thegeezer3) Damn racoons... I´ll show them. I´ll put a SNARE in the BIN as well as a few SPARKLERS so as to scare the shit out of the buggers, then hit them with a SHOVEL. Primitives bin, snare, sparkler, shovel Kunyomi: はこ、い.れる Onyomi: カン Lesson: 51 Jouyou: Names JLPT Level: Compounds:	bin 函 画数8 2051 Details Story Dictionary 函 bin Heisig's This is the character from which the element for shovel derives. I put a snare in the bin as well as a few phosphorous sparklers so as to scare the shit out of the buggers as they rummage through my bin. Koohii #2 (thegeezer3) Damn racoons... I´ll show them. I´ll put a SNARE in the BIN as well as a few SPARKLERS so as to scare the shit out of the buggers, then hit them with a SHOVEL. Primitives bin, snare, sparkler, shovel Kunyomi: はこ、い.れる Onyomi: カン Lesson: 51 Jouyou: Names JLPT Level: Compounds:
poles Details Story Dictionary 極 poles Heisig's The poles this key word refers to are the extremities of the earth or the terminals of an electric field. The elements are: tree . . . snare . . . mouth . . . crotch . . . floor. Koohii #1 Can simplify this using decay (#1243). Then: The expedition to the poles is bad for your health, and the decay that started in your mouth spreads to your crotch – at which point you fall to the floor. Koohii #2 (modified Katsuo) Can simplify this using decay (#1243). You travel to the poles, a frozen wasteland. In desperate need of food you try to set up a snare but the tree is decayed (see story for decay (#1243)) so you catch no prey. The brutal cold first attacks your mouth as your lips turn blue, then your crotch also gets cold as your body fails; finally you fall to the floor. Primitives poles, decay, tree, wood, snare, mouth, crotch, one, floor 究極(きゅうきょく): ultimate, final, eventual 極端(きょくたん): extreme, extremity 極めて(きわめて): exceedingly, extremely 極楽(ごくらく): paradise 両極(りょうきょく): both extremities, north and south poles, positive and negative poles 極(ごく): pole, climax, extreme, extremity, culmination, height, zenith, nadir 消極的(しょうきょくてき): passive 積極的(せっきょくてき): positive, active, proactive 南極(なんきょく): south pole, Antarctic 北極(ほっきょく): North Pole Kunyomi: きわ.める、きわ.まる、きわ.まり、きわ.み、き.める、-ぎ.め、き.まる Onyomi: キョク、ゴク Lesson: 51 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 極限 (きょくげん), 終極 (おわりきょく), 積極的 (せっきょくてき), 極まる (きわ.まる), 極み (きわ.み), 極める (きわ.める)	poles 極 画数12 2052 Details Story Dictionary 極 poles Heisig's The poles this key word refers to are the extremities of the earth or the terminals of an electric field. tusk Details Story Dictionary 牙 tusk My Story This looks like a T on top of the katakana オ. T for the TUSK and Ohh for what could happen if you get to close to it. The elephant vampire used his tusk and fangs * Since this kanji has 4 strokes, you would expect that as a primitive it would also have 4 - but in fact it has 5 in the following two frames (the second stroke between divided into 2 strokes) and reverts to 4 again in frame 2056. Koohii #1 The kanji looks like an elephant with tusks. the box is the elephant´s eye. The final stroke is the tusk. Koohii #2 He stored the tusks into a box, along with the broken halberds. Primitives tusk Kunyomi: きば、は、きばへん Onyomi: ガ、ゲ Lesson: 52 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: Compounds: 牙 (きば)	tusk 牙 画数4 2053 Details Story Dictionary 牙 tusk My Story This looks like a T on top of the katakana オ. Koohii #1 The kanji looks like an elephant with tusks. the box is the elephant´s eye. The final stroke is the tusk. Koohii #2 He stored the tusks into a box, along with the broken halberds. Primitives tusk Kunyomi: きば、は、きばへん Onyomi: ガ、ゲ Lesson: 52 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: Compounds: 牙 (きば)

wicked Details Story Dictionary 邪 wicked My Story *Tusks* are fastened to the *city walls* to keep out the wicked Koohii #1 The wicked queen builds her city walls out of menacing tusks. Koohii #2 As everyone knows, rhinoceroses and elephants are often killed for the value of their TUSKS. Here we see a WICKED city mayor who has had countless elephants killed just to make his CITY WALLS out of TUSKS. Primitives wicked, tusk, city walls お邪魔します(おじゃまします): Excuse me for disturbing (interrupting) you 邪魔(じゃま): obstacle, intrusion 無邪気(むじゃき): innocence, simple-mindedness 風邪(かぜ): common cold Kunyomi: よこし.ま Onyomi: ジャ Lesson: 52 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	wicked 邪 画数8 2055 Details Story Dictionary 邪 wicked My Story *Tusks* are fastened to the *city walls* to keep out the wicked Koohii #1 The wicked queen builds her city walls out of menacing tusks. "gracious Details Story Dictionary 雅 gracious Heisig's Tusk . . . an old turkey. Koohii #1 Goodness gracious! Such an elegant turkey with a tusk. This mnemonic is meant to join RtK´s keyword with a better proposition. Heisig could have used ""elegant"" here, which is not confounded so easily with graceful (#721), and accurately represents the character´s meaning (it is also the chosen keyword in Kodansha´s Kanji Learner´s Dictionary). Koohii #2 To not confuse it with grace (#606) or graceful (#721), think of the phrase ""Goodness gracious."" Like: ""Goodness gracious! A turkey with tusks!"". Primitives gracious, tusk, turkey 雅致(がち): artistry, good taste, elegance, grace Kunyomi: みや.び Onyomi: ガ Lesson: 52 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"	"gracious 雅 画数13 2056 Details Story Dictionary 雅 gracious Heisig's Tusk . . . an old turkey. Heisig could have used ""elegant"" here, which is not confounded so easily with graceful (#721), and accurately represents the character´s meaning (it is also the chosen keyword in Kodansha´s Kanji Learner´s Dictionary). Koohii #2 To not confuse it with grace (#606) or graceful (#721), think of the phrase ""Goodness gracious."" Like: ""Goodness gracious! A turkey with tusks!"". interpretation Details Story Dictionary 釈 interpretation Heisig's Animal tracks . . . shakuhachi. Koohii #1 Animal track primitive: As expected, animal tracks were left in place of the trail of rice I´d purposely dropped the night before. EDIT - also try the footprint for a primitive meaning, the classic symbol of detective films. STORY: This shakuhachi player is so talented, he can do interpretations of animal noises too. They´re so realistic he soon has animal tracks leading straight to wherever he´s playing. Koohii #2 An interpretive dance of some kind where somebody follows animal tracks, a shakuhachi providing the soundtrack, suggesting the tracker's thoughts and intentions. Primitives explanation, animal tracks, drop, rice, shaku-hachi, flag, stick 解釈(かいしゃく): explanation, interpretation Kunyomi: とく、す.てる、ゆる.す Onyomi: シャク、セキ Lesson: 52 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	interpretation 釈 画数11 2057 Details Story Dictionary 釈 interpretation Heisig's Animal tracks . . . shakuhachi. turn Details Story Dictionary 番 turn Heisig's This key word has been chosen for its overlay of several meanings similar to those of the kanji: a turn of duty, a round, a number, and so forth. Its composite elements: animal tracks . . . rice field. * As a primitive element, we choose the image of a pair of dice which it is your turn to throw. Koohii #1 The famers take it in turns to watch out for any animal tracks on their rice field. Koohii #2 They take turns alternating between wheat and rice in this field…　　RTK2:　バン　電話番号　でんわばんごう(telephone number). Primitives turn, dice, animal tracks, drop, rice, rice field, brains 下番(かばん): going off duty 番目(ばんめ): cardinal number suffix 順番(じゅんばん): turn (in line), order of things 当番(とうばん): being on duty 番地(ばんち): house number, address 留守番(るすばん): care-taking, caretaker, house-watching 番組(ばんぐみ): TV program 一番(いちばん): best, first, number one, a game, a round, a bout, a fall, an event (in a meet) 交番(こうばん): police box 番号(ばんごう): number, series of digits Kunyomi: つが.い Onyomi: バン Lesson: 52 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds:	turn 番 画数12 2058 Details Story Dictionary 番 turn Heisig's This key word has been chosen for its overlay of several meanings similar to those of the kanji: a turn of duty, a round, a number, and so forth. Its composite elements: animal tracks . . . rice field. * As a primitive element, we choose the image of a pair of dice which it is your turn to throw. Koohii #1 The famers take it in turns to watch out for any animal tracks on their rice field. Koohii #2 They take turns alternating between wheat and rice in this field…　　RTK2:　バン　電話番号　でんわばんごう(telephone number). "hearing Details Story Dictionary 審 hearing Heisig's The hearing referred to in this character relates to trials in the courts. The elements: house . . . dice. Koohii #1 At your divorce hearing the judge tells you to roll dice to see who keeps the house. (""I can´t believe what I´m hearing!"" you say). Koohii #2 In the courthouse the judge decides your hearing with a roll of the dice. Primitives hearing, house, dice, animal tracks, drop, rice, rice field, brains 審議(しんぎ): deliberation 審査(しんさ): judging, inspection, examination, investigation 審判(しんばん): refereeing, trial, judgement, umpire, referee 不審(ふしん): incomplete understanding, doubt, question, distrust, suspicion, strangeness, infidelity 審判(しんぱん): refereeing, trial, judgement, umpire, referee Kunyomi: つまび.らか、つぶさ.に Onyomi: シン Lesson: 52 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"	"hearing 審 画数15 2059 Details Story Dictionary 審 hearing Heisig's The hearing referred to in this character relates to trials in the courts. Koohii #2 In the courthouse the judge decides your hearing with a roll of the dice. flip Details Story Dictionary 翻 flip My Story [a drop of rice + Rice field + feathers {羽}] *A drop of rice* was stolen from a *rice field*, the farmer flipped his shit when he saw a crow's feather. used in 翻訳 (to translate) Koohii #1 Flipping the bird: After finding out the dice is crooked, you kindly present the middle feather to the dealer. Koohii #2 When the birds out the back are playing dice, they flip their feathers (not their finger) at their opponents. Primitives flip, dice, animal tracks, drop, rice, rice field, brains, feathers, wings 翻訳(ほんやく): translate Kunyomi: ひるがえ.る、ひるがえ.す Onyomi: ホン、ハン Lesson: 52 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 翻す (ひるがえ.す), 翻る (ひるがえ.る)	flip 翻 画数18 2060 Details Story Dictionary 翻 flip My Story [a drop of rice + Rice field + feathers {羽}] *A drop of rice* was stolen from a *rice field*, the farmer flipped his shit when he saw a crow's feather. used in 翻訳 (to translate) Koohii #1 Flipping the bird: After finding out the dice is crooked, you kindly present the middle feather to the dealer. Koohii #2 When the birds out the back are playing dice, they flip their feathers (not their finger) at their opponents. Primitives flip, dice, animal tracks, drop, rice, rice field, brains, feathers, wings 翻訳(ほんやく): translate Kunyomi: ひるがえ.る、ひるがえ.す Onyomi: ホン、ハン Lesson: 52 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 翻す (ひるがえ.す), 翻る (ひるがえ.る)
clan Details Story Dictionary 藩 clan Heisig's Flowers . . . water . . . dice. Koohii #1 This character refers to feudal clans that were abolished in 1871 (Meiji 4) in favor of prefectures (廃藩置県), and thus were predecessors of the modern prefectures. As we know from 落, flowers and water drops each have their own way of falling. This character says that clans´ location was decided in the way flowers, water drops and dice fall: at random. See http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Han_%28country_subdivision%29. Koohii #2 In the particular clan depicted by this character, each member has to take his or her turn watering the flowers. Primitives clan, flowers, water, water droplets, water pistol, dice, animal tracks, drop, rice, rice field, brains Kunyomi: Onyomi: ハン Lesson: 52 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	clan 藩 画数18 2061 Details Story Dictionary 藩 clan Heisig's Flowers . . . water . . . dice. Koohii #1 This character refers to feudal clans that were abolished in 1871 (Meiji 4) in favor of prefectures (廃藩置県), and thus were predecessors of the modern prefectures. As we know from 落, flowers and water drops each have their own way of falling. This character says that clans´ location was decided in the way flowers, water drops and dice fall: at random. See http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Han_%28country_subdivision%29. Koohii #2 In the particular clan depicted by this character, each member has to take his or her turn watering the flowers. Primitives clan, flowers, water, water droplets, water pistol, dice, animal tracks, drop, rice, rice field, brains Kunyomi: Onyomi: ハン Lesson: 52 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:
fur Details Story Dictionary 毛 fur Heisig's This character simply reverses the direction of the final stroke of hand to produce fur. If you reverse your hand and put its palm down, you will have the side on which fur grows. Koohii #1 I´ve heard of people having hair on the back of their hands, but this is ridiculous! That´s not hair, that´s fur! Koohii #2 Be careful not to pet a cat the wrong way - most cats don´t like you rubbing your hand backwards over their fur. Primitives fur 毛(け): fur, hair, wool 髪の毛(かみのけ): hair (on head) 毛糸(けいと): knitting wool 毛皮(けがわ): fur, skin, pelt 毛布(もうふ): blanket 羊毛(ようもう): wool Kunyomi: け Onyomi: モウ Lesson: 52 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 毛 (け)	fur 毛 画数4 2062 Details Story Dictionary 毛 fur Heisig's This character simply reverses the direction of the final stroke of hand to produce fur. "home Details Story Dictionary 宅 home Heisig's House . . . lock of hair. Koohii #1 This kanji is, of course, pronounced ""taku"", and it seems the owner of this home is a little bit otaku himself. He has hung up locks of hair suruptitiously obtained from various females all over his house. A veritable hair fetishist, and certainly someone whose home you wouldn´t want to visit. Koohii #2 Home is where the hair is. "do Details Story Dictionary 為 do Heisig's This character rightly belongs to the previous lesson, but we held it until now because of the final element, the tail feathers. After the drop at the outset, the next three strokes are completely novel and should be given special attention. Koohii #1 In this kanji, you can see 3 katakana characters: ソ, ユ, and then ユ again followed by TAIL FEATHERS. STORY: ""So (ソ) you (ユ) wanna DO it?"" ""Only if you (ユ) do"" says the female bird as she raises her TAIL FEATHERS. Koohii #2 Do me from behind, says the bird, as she shakes her tailfeathers. Primitives do, so, strange building, tail feathers 行為(こうい): act, deed, conduct 為来り(しきたり): customs その為(そのため): hence, for that reason 為さる(なさる): to do 為替(かわせ): money order, exchange 為る(する): do, try, play, practice, cost, serve as, pass, elapse 所為(せい): act, deed, one´s doing 為(ため): for, in order to 為す(なす): accomplish, do 為る(なる): change, be of use, reach to Kunyomi: ため、な.る、な.す、す.る、たり、つく.る、なり Onyomi: イ Lesson: 52 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"	"do 為 画数9 2067 Details Story Dictionary 為 do Heisig's This character rightly belongs to the previous lesson, but we held it until now because of the final element, the tail feathers. long Details Story Dictionary 長 long Heisig's In line with the story of the preceding frame, the hair that needs the hairpin is long. * The primitive of this kanji has two more shapes in addition to that of the kanji itself. Above its relative primitive, it is abbreviated form will mean hair. Further abbreviated, it will mean the long, mangy mane of an animal. Koohii #1 The Geisha with long hair uses an ornate lacquered hairpin to bundle it all up. Koohii #2 The top of this one reminds me of the staple primitive. So here´s my story: The girl´s hair was so long that she had to use staples instead of hairpins. It worked, but stapling her hair to her head was kinda painful. Primitives long, hair, hairpin, safety-pin 長(おさ): chief, head 生長(せいちょう): growth, increment 長官(ちょうかん): chief, (government) secretary 長大(ちょうだい): very long, great length 長編(ちょうへん): long (e.g. novel film) 長々(ながなが): long, drawn-out, very long 年長(ねんちょう): seniority 長閑(のどか): tranquil, calm, quiet 延長(えんちょう): extension, elongation, prolongation, lengthening 議長(ぎちょう): chairman 身長(しんちょう): height (of body), stature 成長(せいちょう): growth, grow to adulthood 長期(ちょうき): long time period 長所(ちょうしょ): strong point, merit, advantage 長女(ちょうじょ): eldest daughter 長短(ちょうたん): length, long and short, advantages and disadvantages, pluses and minuses, strong and weak points, merits and demerits 長男(ちょうなん): eldest son 長方形(ちょうほうけい): rectangle, oblong 特長(とくちょう): forte, merit 長引く(ながびく): be prolonged, drag on 校長(こうちょう): principal 社長(しゃちょう): president 長い(ながい): long Kunyomi: なが.い、おさ Onyomi: チョウ Lesson: 52 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 5 Compounds: 長い (なが.い)	long 長 画数8 2070 Details Story Dictionary 長 long Heisig's In line with the story of the preceding frame, the hair that needs the hairpin is long. * The primitive of this kanji has two more shapes in addition to that of the kanji itself. unfold Details Story Dictionary 展 unfold My Story [Flag + Salad (fence) + Kick in the nuts/Hairpin] The *flag* had been used for a picnic so when I unfolded it, bits of *salad* and *hairpins* fell out of the folds. Koohii #1 Unfold flag, take out the salad, pin the flag down with hairpins and have a picnic. Koohii #2 You use an American flag to wrap up a salad for a picnic and bind it with a hairpin. Now imagine unfolding it to open up the bounty you´ve fixed up for yourself. Primitives unfold, flag, salad, hairpin, safety-pin 進展(しんてん): progress, development 展示(てんじ): exhibition, display 展望(てんぼう): view, outlook, prospect 展開(てんかい): develop, expansion (opposite of compression) 発展(はってん): development, growth 展覧会(てんらんかい): exhibition Kunyomi: Onyomi: テン Lesson: 52 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	unfold 展 画数10 2075 Details Story Dictionary 展 unfold My Story [Flag + Salad (fence) + Kick in the nuts/Hairpin] The *flag* had been used for a picnic so when I unfolded it, bits of *salad* and *hairpins* fell out of the folds. "miss Details Story Dictionary 喪 miss Heisig's Soil . . . two mouths . . . hairpin. Hint: see spit (Frame 162). The key word carries the wide range of meanings readily associated with it: error, loss, absence, and so on. Koohii #1 I miss my parents dearly. Here they lay, under a big cross, their mouths side by side. I stick hairpins in their graves. CAREFUL: the stroke order/primitive order is: ten, L mouth, R mouth, hairpin. ""Soil"" is not drawn in its stroke order. Koohii #2 This kanji means miss as in ""miss a (dearly departed) person"", not as in ""miss a target"".　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　Here the dearly departed has been buried in the ground, with her favourite hairpin in place of a gravestone, and two mourners stand around crying with open mouths. Primitives miss, soil, dirt, ground, mouth, hairpin, safety-pin, mouth2 Kunyomi: も Onyomi: ソウ Lesson: 52 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 喪 (も)"	"miss 喪 画数12 2076 Details Story Dictionary 喪 miss Heisig's Soil . . . two mouths . . . hairpin. Hint: see spit (Frame 162). The key word carries the wide range of meanings readily associated with it: error, loss, absence, and so on. Koohii #1 I miss my parents dearly. Here they lay, under a big cross, their mouths side by side. I stick hairpins in their graves. CAREFUL: the stroke order/primitive order is: ten, L mouth, R mouth, hairpin. ""Soil"" is not drawn in its stroke order. Koohii #2 This kanji means miss as in ""miss a (dearly departed) person"", not as in ""miss a target"".　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　Here the dearly departed has been buried in the ground, with her favourite hairpin in place of a gravestone, and two mourners stand around crying with open mouths. nest Details Story Dictionary 巣 nest Heisig's Owl . . . fruit. Koohii #1 The nest atop of a tree contains the fruit of the owl: its offspring. Koohii #2 The wise old OWL makes her nest out of FRUIT, carving out the middle for her chicks, because then it´s less work: no running back & forth to get food! simple Details Story Dictionary 単 simple My Story [Owl (three dots) + Rice field + Ten/Needle] It's simple for an owl to find a needle in a rice field 田, because an owl's eyesight is ten 十 times better than a human's. The key word does not connote easy or facile, but rather simple as the opposite of complex. Koohii #1 Owls are smart...for this owl everything is simple coz his brain is ten times more powerful than mine. Koohii #2 An owl´s brain is ten times smarter than other simple minded birds…　RTK2:　タン　簡単　かんたん(simple). Primitives simple, owl, rice field, brains, ten, needle 単一(たんいつ): single, simple, sole, individual, unitory 単調(たんちょう): monotony, monotone, dullness 単独(たんどく): sole, independence, single, solo (flight) 単(ひとえ): one layer, single 単位(たんい): unit, denomination, credit (in school) 単語(たんご): word, vocabulary, (usually) single-character word 単純(たんじゅん): simplicity 単数(たんすう): singular (number) 単なる(たんなる): mere, simple, sheer 単に(たんに): simply, merely, only, solely 簡単(かんたん): easy, simple Kunyomi: ひとえ Onyomi: タン Lesson: 53 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds:	simple 単 画数9 2078 Details Story Dictionary 単 simple My Story [Owl (three dots) + Rice field + Ten/Needle] It's simple for an owl to find a needle in a rice field 田, because an owl's eyesight is ten 十 times better than a human's. "Zen Details Story Dictionary 禅 Zen Heisig's Altar . . . simple. Koohii #1 Knowing ZEN’s emphasis on “nothingness,” it’s not hard to envision a ZEN ALTAR being quite clean and SIMPLE. Koohii #2 Simple-minded blond girl (see frame 1928) is very good at Zen, which isn´t surprising since she doesn´t think much. She has this bad habit of meditating perched on the main temple altar, which infuriates the Zen buddhists. When they get up to her and tell her rudely to step down the altar, she just smiles and teases them : ""Not very zen are you ?"". Who would have thought simple-minded blond girl would teach the Zen buddhists a lesson ! It´s really my favorite picture , just don´t tell her that. Koohii #2 The tree in Japan that represents both wisdom (the owl) and femininity (the woman). This is a sakura (さくら), or cherry tree. "animal Details Story Dictionary 獣 animal Heisig's Owl . . . rice field . . . one . . . mouth . . . chihuahua. Koohii #1 The owl looks for its prey in the rice field. It sees so many potential animals to eat but since it only has one mouth, it decides that the tasty looking chihuahua will be its meal for tonight. (adapted from Copycatken,1-9-2006). Koohii #2 I have a strange story for this one but it works. I imagine a owl getting into a rice field which serves as a boxing ring. His opponent is a little chihuahua. The fight starts, the owl takes one punch to the mouth and is out cold. In the chihuahua´s corner is that coach from Rocky saying ""Your an ANIMAL!!"". A vivid image of this story works pretty well for me. "trouble Details Story Dictionary 悩 trouble My Story [Heart (standing) + Owl (3 dots) + Terrible/villain {凶}] Too much *heart (standing)* and not enough *brain* are what cause trouble and worry in society The *state of mind* of someone who is both a night *owl*, and a *villain* is ""looking for trouble."" Koohii #1 When I am in trouble, my state of mind is on two sides: 1. The wise part of me (owl) 2. The villain part of me (villain) Think of the devil and the angel on your shoulders in a troubled situation. Koohii #2 The owl villain is the one that troubles me most of all the super-villains. He´s just so smart... you never know what he´ll do! Definitely enough to put you in a troubled state of mind. Primitives trouble, Freud, state of mind, owl, villain, sheaf, shovel 悩ましい(なやましい): seductive, melancholy, languid 悩ます(なやます): to afflict, to torment, to harass, to molest 悩み(なやみ): trouble(s), worry, distress, anguish, agony, problem 悩む(なやむ): be worried, be troubled Kunyomi: なや.む、なや.ます、なや.ましい、なやみ Onyomi: ノウ Lesson: 53 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 悩ます (なや.ます), 悩む (なや.む)"	"trouble 悩 画数10 2085 Details Story Dictionary 悩 trouble My Story [Heart (standing) + Owl (3 dots) + Terrible/villain {凶}] Too much *heart (standing)* and not enough *brain* are what cause trouble and worry in society The *state of mind* of someone who is both a night *owl*, and a *villain* is ""looking for trouble."" raise Details Story Dictionary 挙 raise My Story You can raise *pi* to *3 decimal places* with your *hands* Koohii #1 The owl was asked to raise his hand if he needed anything, but he had a wing, not a hand! So he made a tool that looked like a hand which he used when he needed to raise his hand. For raiseing, owl has a tool hand. Koohii #2 What raises mankind above others is the wisdom of an owl, the use of tools, and his hand with an opposable thumb. (compare with reputation (#1939)). game hunting Details Story Dictionary 猟 game hunting Heisig's Pack of wild dogs . . . owl . . . wind . . . cornstalk. Koohii #1 [game-hunting; shooting; game; bag] According to unicode.org and wwwjdic, 鼡 and 鼠 (mouse (#2065)) are variants. So, for 鼡 (which I´ll call rat) I have: an owl, flying in the wind, can easily spot a rat even if it´s hiding in the cornstalks. Now 猟 is easy: wild dogs are having fun by game-hunting rats. Koohii #2 The WILD DOGS are GAME HUNTING the OWL who flies like the WIND through the CORN STORKS. Primitives game hunting, pack of wild dogs, anemometer, owl, wind, cornstalk Kunyomi: かり、か.る Onyomi: リョウ、レフ Lesson: 53 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	game hunting 猟 画数11 2090 Details Story Dictionary 猟 game hunting Heisig's Pack of wild dogs . . . owl . . . wind . . . cornstalk. bird Details Story Dictionary 鳥 bird Heisig's Dove . . . one . . . tail feathers. This is, of course, the character from which we derived the primitive meaning of dove. Note the lengthening of the second stroke. Koohii #1 There is only one bird with such beautiful white tail feathers: the albino peakcock. Koohii #2 The BIRD let loose a WHITE ONE from it´s TAIL FEATHERS...right on my new car! chirp Details Story Dictionary 鳴 chirp Heisig's Mouth . . . bird. Koohii #1 A chirp is quite simply the sound that comes from the mouth of birds. Koohii #2 This kanji is not limited to the chirp of a bird, but stands for the sound of any kind of animal. Picture a very weird bird that can imitate with its mouth (a bird with mouth, heh) the voice of many different animals: Meeow! Woof! Mooo! Cuack!!! (Maybe the bird has Kirby powers and obtains the abilities of the animals it eats). Primitives chirp, mouth, bird 共鳴(きょうめい): resonance, sympathy 怒鳴る(どなる): to shout, to yell 悲鳴(ひめい): shriek, scream 鳴らす(ならす): ring, sound, chime, beat 鳴る(なる): sound, ring 鳴く(なく): bark, purr, chirp, make sound (animal) Kunyomi: な.く、な.る、な.らす Onyomi: メイ Lesson: 53 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 鳴く (な.く), 鳴らす (な.らす), 鳴る (な.る)	chirp 鳴 画数14 2092 Details Story Dictionary 鳴 chirp Heisig's Mouth . . . bird. "crane Details Story Dictionary 鶴 crane Heisig's Turkey house . . . bird. The first element appears on only one other occasion, back in frame 609. Koohii #1 Do you know how cranes came to be? Well, they used to keep the poor bird cooped all the time. But the crane really wanted to be free, so it would always streatch its head and neck out of the coop trying to be free. Koohii #2 The original version of the ""Ugly Duckling"" was about a crane who grew up in a turkey coop. All the other birds made fun of it for not having a wattle or a snood or fanning its tail... crow Details Story Dictionary 烏 crow Heisig's The only thing that distinguishes this character from that for bird is the omission of the one stroke that makes it white. Which is logical enough, when you consider that there are no crows of that color. Koohii #1 The book´s story is just fine, but I found a kanji dictionary explanation also interesting: As crows are all black, it´s hard to see where their eyes are (black on black), so a stroke is removed from the part in the pictograph where the eyes would be. Koohii #2 A crow is a bird, but not a white one. MEANING: write bird, but skip writing one in white. Primitives crow, drop, mouth, one, tail feathers Kunyomi: からす、いずくんぞ、なんぞ Onyomi: ウ、オ Lesson: 53 Jouyou: Names JLPT Level: Compounds:	crow 烏 画数10 2094 Details Story Dictionary 烏 crow Heisig's The only thing that distinguishes this character from that for bird is the omission of the one stroke that makes it white. "vine Details Story Dictionary 蔦 vine Heisig's Flower . . . bird. Koohii #1 In the jungle there is a flowery vine called hedera rhombea that attracts humming birds by the dozens. They scoot around the flowers sucking up nectar off the vine. Koohii #2 Note : if you´ll remember we already have a primitive for ""ivy"", but it was completely made up from the ""square jewel"" kanji. The kanji here refers to ivy, or vine, and is used in a particular compound for ""Hedera rhombea"", which is a type of ivy native to Japan. This vine here produces a lot of flowers, and attracts many small birds, which is sure to cheer up even the most depressed Japanese gardener. Primitives vine, flowers, bird Kunyomi: つた Onyomi: チョウ Lesson: 53 Jouyou: Names JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"	"vine 蔦 画数14 2095 Details Story Dictionary 蔦 vine Heisig's Flower . . . bird. Koohii #2 Note : if you´ll remember we already have a primitive for ""ivy"", but it was completely made up from the ""square jewel"" kanji. The kanji here refers to ivy, or vine, and is used in a particular compound for ""Hedera rhombea"", which is a type of ivy native to Japan. This vine here produces a lot of flowers, and attracts many small birds, which is sure to cheer up even the most depressed Japanese gardener. Primitives vine, flowers, bird Kunyomi: つた Onyomi: チョウ Lesson: 53 Jouyou: Names JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"

island Details Story Dictionary 島 island Heisig's The bird's tail is tucked under here, because it has come to stop on a mountain to rest from its journey across the waters. Thus the kanji comes to mean an island. Koohii #1 This island is the home of the terrible mythical bird Roc. It sits mighty atop the mountain waiting for the next hapless ship to pass by. Koohii #2 Birds living on remote mountainous islands have few preditors. Tail feathers aren´t really needed are they? Evolutionary process at work!...　RTK2:　トウ　半島　はんとう(peninsula). Primitives island, bird, mountain 半島(はんとう): peninsula 列島(れっとう): chain of islands 島(しま): island Kunyomi: しま Onyomi: トウ Lesson: 53 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 島 (しま)	island 島 画数10 2098 Details Story Dictionary 島 island Heisig's The bird's tail is tucked under here, because it has come to stop on a mountain to rest from its journey across the waters. warmth Details Story Dictionary 暖 warmth Heisig's Unlike the character for warm weather learned earlier (Frame 1560), this kanji and its key word can also refer to the warmth of human congeniality. Its elements are: sun . . . migrating ducks. Koohii #1 Note: Just confirming Heisig has confused these two characters. This is used primarily for weather and climate (and colours). Koohii #2 A massive group of migrating ducks is blocking the warmth of the sun as they pass over your house/barbecue/picnic. Their formation is so humongous they block the warmth for a good 10 minutes while they pass over. Mnemonic for the migrating ducks primitive : the migrating ducks stick together like the best of friends, flying together as one (fifth stroke), they are not easy prey for the great eagles / vultures. Primitives warmth, sun, day, migrating ducks, claw, vulture, one, friend 暖まる(あたたまる): to warm oneself, to sun oneself, to warm up, to get warm 暖める(あたためる): to warm, to heat 温暖(おんだん): warmth 暖房(だんぼう): heating 暖かい(あたたかい): warm, mild, genial Kunyomi: あたた.か、あたた.かい、あたた.まる、あたた.める Onyomi: ダン、ノン Lesson: 53 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 暖か (あたた.か), 暖かい (あたた.かい), 暖まる (あたた.まる), 暖める (あたた.める)	warmth 暖 画数13 2099 Details Story Dictionary 暖 warmth Heisig's Unlike the character for warm weather learned earlier (Frame 1560), this kanji and its key word can also refer to the warmth of human congeniality. abet Details Story Dictionary 援 abet Heisig's Fingers . . . migrating ducks. Koohii #1 You abet the escape of migrating ducks by pointing them the way. Koohii #2 Aiding and abetting: You are accuse of abetting a drug dealer, by smuggling drugs in migrating ducks. Of course, this means you have to stick your fingers in their mouths. loosen Details Story Dictionary 緩 loosen My Story I tied a *string* around a *crow's* neck but it got loose, and then it got loose. Koohii #1 [slacken; loosen; relax; lessen; be moderate; ease] The thread in this story is a cable line, something like a power or phone line. The thread was tense with all the migrating ducks perched on it, but got back to being slackened when the entire flock flew away. (darg_sama-modified,2-11-2005). Koohii #2 Spiderman is a slacken off. He lays around all day in the park watching migrating ducks...　RTK2:　カン　緩和　かんわ(mitigation). interview Details Story Dictionary 遇 interview Heisig's Talking Cricket . . . road. Koohii #1 On the road to my interview I accidentally bump into Jiminy Cricket who gives me some good advice. Koohii #2 I was finally able to score an interview with the wisest being around: Jiminy Cricket. However, his schedule is really packed, so they had to squeeze me in while his tour bus rode between gigs. In fact, it was really short---after a few miles I was kicked out of the bus and stranded in the middle of the interstate. But man, it was worth it! Primitives interview, talking cricket, brains, insect, belt, road 境遇(きょうぐう): environment, circumstances 待遇(たいぐう): treatment, reception Kunyomi: あ.う Onyomi: グウ Lesson: 53 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	interview 遇 画数12 2106 Details Story Dictionary 遇 interview Heisig's Talking Cricket . . . road. Koohii #1 On the road to my interview I accidentally bump into Jiminy Cricket who gives me some good advice. Koohii #2 I was finally able to score an interview with the wisest being around: Jiminy Cricket. However, his schedule is really packed, so they had to squeeze me in while his tour bus rode between gigs. In fact, it was really short---after a few miles I was kicked out of the bus and stranded in the middle of the interstate. But man, it was worth it! "foolish Details Story Dictionary 愚 foolish Heisig's Talking Cricket . . . heart. Koohii #1 Don´t be foolish! says Jiminy Cricket as he lashes you with his belt. Follow logic, like me, not your heart. Koohii #2 I simply imagine Jiminy Cricket jumping all over the place, like a mad man, yelling ""yeeeeehaaaaa!"". Maybe he just fell in love? Mnemonic - ""Jiminy Cricket has a foolish heart"". Primitives foolish, talking cricket, brains, insect, belt, heart 愚か(おろか): foolish, stupid 愚痴(ぐち): idle complaint, grumble Kunyomi: おろ.か Onyomi: グ Lesson: 53 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 愚か (おろ.か)"	"foolish 愚 画数13 2107 Details Story Dictionary 愚 foolish Heisig's Talking Cricket . . . heart. corner Details Story Dictionary 隅 corner Heisig's Pinnacle . . . Talking Cricket. Koohii #1 If you behave badly at THE PINNACLE, JIMINY CRICKET will send you to sit in the corner. Koohii #2 Oh how the pious fall from their lofty pinnacles! Jiminy Cricket now deals drugs on the street corner. Primitives corner, pinnacle, parthenon, acropolis, talking cricket, brains, insect, belt 隅(すみ): corner Kunyomi: すみ Onyomi: グウ Lesson: 53 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 隅 (すみ)	corner 隅 画数12 2108 Details Story Dictionary 隅 corner Heisig's Pinnacle . . . Talking Cricket. Koohii #1 If you behave badly at THE PINNACLE, JIMINY CRICKET will send you to sit in the corner. Koohii #2 Oh how the pious fall from their lofty pinnacles! Jiminy Cricket now deals drugs on the street corner. Primitives corner, pinnacle, parthenon, acropolis, talking cricket, brains, insect, belt 隅(すみ): corner Kunyomi: すみ Onyomi: グウ Lesson: 53 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 隅 (すみ)
inverted Details Story Dictionary 逆 inverted Heisig's Mountain goat . . . road. Koohii #1 There´s a road that´s been inverted- it´s gone from horizontal to directly vertical! The only beast that could possibly climb it is a mountain goat of course. Koohii #2 This reminds me of a cartoon I saw once, perhaps it was with Donald Duck. he is startled and furious when he chases this mountain billygoat further and further up the mountain road, untill the angle is so steep that he finds himself inverted. And falls down, while the goat stands solidly placed inverted and laughs a goaty laughter as Donald plumments and makes that typical Donald shaped cartoon crater at the bottom. Primitives inverted, mountain goat, horns, mountain, road 逆転(ぎゃくてん): (sudden) change, reversal, turn-around, coming from behind (baseball) 逆立ち(さかだち): handstand, headstand 逆上る(さかのぼる): to go back, to go upstream, to make retroactive 吃逆(しゃっくり): hiccough, hiccup 逆(ぎゃく): reverse, opposite 逆さ(さかさ): reverse, inversion, upside down 逆様(さかさま): inversion, upside down 逆らう(さからう): go against, oppose, disobey, defy Kunyomi: さか、さか.さ、さか.らう Onyomi: ギャク、ゲキ Lesson: 53 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 逆 (さか), 逆らう (さか.らう)	inverted 逆 画数9 2109 Details Story Dictionary 逆 inverted Heisig's Mountain goat . . . road. Koohii #1 There´s a road that´s been inverted- it´s gone from horizontal to directly vertical! The only beast that could possibly climb it is a mountain goat of course. Koohii #2 This reminds me of a cartoon I saw once, perhaps it was with Donald Duck. he is startled and furious when he chases this mountain billygoat further and further up the mountain road, untill the angle is so steep that he finds himself inverted. And falls down, while the goat stands solidly placed inverted and laughs a goaty laughter as Donald plumments and makes that typical Donald shaped cartoon crater at the bottom. model Details Story Dictionary 塑 model Heisig's This kanji depicts the art of modeling clay or wood into a figure of your choice. The elements for composing it are: mountain goat . . . moon . . . soil. Koohii #1 This guy is such a gifted sculptor. He can model a MOUNTAIN GOAT and a MOON with just SOIL mold. Koohii #2 A legend says that if you model a mountain goat (with tail and everything) from dirt and leave to the light of the moon on the first day of the month (#2846), the dirt will became flesh. (blackstockc). Primitives model, first day of the month, mountain goat, horns, mountain, moon, month, flesh, part of the body, soil, dirt, ground Kunyomi: でく Onyomi: ソ Lesson: 53 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	model 塑 画数13 2110 Details Story Dictionary 塑 model Heisig's This kanji depicts the art of modeling clay or wood into a figure of your choice. The elements for composing it are: mountain goat . . . moon . . . soil. Koohii #1 This guy is such a gifted sculptor. He can model a MOUNTAIN GOAT and a MOON with just SOIL mold. Koohii #2 A legend says that if you model a mountain goat (with tail and everything) from dirt and leave to the light of the moon on the first day of the month (#2846), the dirt will became flesh. (blackstockc). Primitives model, first day of the month, mountain goat, horns, mountain, moon, month, flesh, part of the body, soil, dirt, ground Kunyomi: でく Onyomi: ソ Lesson: 53 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:
go upstream Details Story Dictionary 遡 go upstream Heisig's Mountain goat . . . moon . . . road. Koohii #1 You decide to go salmon fishing, so you ride a mountain goat to the top of the road. Under the light of the moon, as it's illegal, you catch the salmon going upstream. Koohii #2 In this kanji we see a mountain goat that decided to go upstream along a road, but for some reason it will only go upstream when the full moon is up. It's actually stubborn like a mountain goat about not going upstream along the road at any other period of time. The road itself is also very confused about this. Primitives go upstream, first day of the month, mountain goat, horns, mountain, moon, month, flesh, part of the body, road 遡る(さかのぼる): go back, go upstream, make retroactive Kunyomi: さかのぼ.る Onyomi: ソ、サク Lesson: 53 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: Compounds: 遡る (さかのぼ.る)	go upstream 遡 画数13 2111 Details Story Dictionary 遡 go upstream Heisig's Mountain goat . . . moon . . . road. Koohii #1 You decide to go salmon fishing, so you ride a mountain goat to the top of the road. Under the light of the moon, as it's illegal, you catch the salmon going upstream. Koohii #2 In this kanji we see a mountain goat that decided to go upstream along a road, but for some reason it will only go upstream when the full moon is up. It's actually stubborn like a mountain goat about not going upstream along the road at any other period of time. The road itself is also very confused about this. Primitives go upstream, first day of the month, mountain goat, horns, mountain, moon, month, flesh, part of the body, road 遡る(さかのぼる): go back, go upstream, make retroactive Kunyomi: さかのぼ.る Onyomi: ソ、サク Lesson: 53 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: Compounds: 遡る (さかのぼ.る)
"Mount Details Story Dictionary 岡 Mount Heisig's Here we see a mountain goat ""mounted"" under a glass canopy. In this and the following frames, think of a particular Mount you know. Koohii #1 White mount , Fuji mount , olympus mount whatever ....The choice is yours but wherever you go they sell those snowglobe souvenir : under a GLASS HOOD you can see the mount with a MOUTAIN GOAT standing on top of it .... So kitsch you just can´t forget it . Koohii #2 This has the same meaning as 丘, so my ""Mount"" is a hill with mountain goats on it under a glass canopy. It´s obviously an effort by the locals to add some Mount atmosphere to their hill. As a primitive, it has the meaning ""sturdy"" (really), which Heisig has not used for some reason, but I will. The glass canopy must be pretty sturdy to keep the goats inside (bulletproof glass, I´m sure). Primitives mount, glass canopy, hood, mountain goat, horns, mountain Kunyomi: おか Onyomi: コウ Lesson: 53 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: Compounds: 岡 (おか)"	"Mount 岡 画数8 2112 Details Story Dictionary 岡 Mount Heisig's Here we see a mountain goat ""mounted"" under a glass canopy. So kitsch you just can´t forget it . Koohii #2 This has the same meaning as 丘, so my ""Mount"" is a hill with mountain goats on it under a glass canopy. It´s obviously an effort by the locals to add some Mount atmosphere to their hill. As a primitive, it has the meaning ""sturdy"" (really), which Heisig has not used for some reason, but I will. The glass canopy must be pretty sturdy to keep the goats inside (bulletproof glass, I´m sure). Primitives mount, glass canopy, hood, mountain goat, horns, mountain Kunyomi: おか Onyomi: コウ Lesson: 53 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: Compounds: 岡 (おか)"
steel Details Story Dictionary 鋼 steel Heisig's Metal . . . Mount. Koohii #1 Mount Fuji is completely made up of a metal known as steel. hawser Details Story Dictionary 綱 hawser Heisig's Thread . . . Mount. Koohii #1 A sturdy thread is equally obviously hawser (heavy rope). (see previous frame). Koohii #2 Spiderman saves Japan from floating away by tying Mt. Fuji to mainland Asia using a hawser made of web. Primitives hawser, thread, spiderman, mount 横綱(よこづな): sumo grand champion 綱(つな): rope Kunyomi: つな Onyomi: コウ Lesson: 53 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 綱 (つな)	hawser 綱 画数14 2114 Details Story Dictionary 綱 hawser Heisig's Thread . . . sturdy Details Story Dictionary 剛 sturdy Heisig's Mount . . . saber. Koohii #1 Mount everest is very sturdy, you can hit it all day with a saber and it wont even wobble. Koohii #2 Anything sturdy in Japan is associated with Mount Fuji. Perhaps this is because it´s symmetry is believed to make it rather sturdy itself, unlike all those crooked mountains that are around and tend to fall apart (think rock slides, avalanches, etc.). Here we see Sturdy-brand sabers with Mount Fuji engraved on the blade. Primitives sturdy, mount, sword, sabre, saber Kunyomi: Onyomi: ゴウ Lesson: 53 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	sturdy 剛 画数10 2115 Details Story Dictionary 剛 sturdy Heisig's Mount . . . saber. Koohii #1 Mount everest is very sturdy, you can hit it all day with a saber and it wont even wobble. Koohii #2 Anything sturdy in Japan is associated with Mount Fuji. Perhaps this is because it´s symmetry is believed to make it rather sturdy itself, unlike all those crooked mountains that are around and tend to fall apart (think rock slides, avalanches, etc.). Here we see Sturdy-brand sabers with Mount Fuji engraved on the blade. Primitives sturdy, mount, sword, sabre, saber Kunyomi: Onyomi: ゴウ Lesson: 53 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:
tin can Details Story Dictionary 缶 tin can Heisig's Though the meaning has no reference to animals, the parts do: horse with a mountain underneath. Koohii #1 Horses kept in the mountains have a unique savory taste. At least so the text on this tin can would have us believe, which contains 100% authentic mountain horse. Koohii #2 The starving horse, stranded on the mountain, is forced to eat a tasty tin can. Primitives tin can, noon, sign of the horse, shovel 缶(かん): can, tin 缶詰(かんづめ): canning, canned goods, tin can 薬缶(やかん): kettle Kunyomi: かま Onyomi: カン Lesson: 53 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 2 Compounds:	tin can 缶 画数6 2116 Details Story Dictionary 缶 tin can Heisig's Though the meaning has no reference to animals, the parts do: horse with a mountain underneath. pottery Details Story Dictionary 陶 pottery Heisig's Pinnacle . . . bound up . . . tin can. Koohii #1 Pottery is used for food preservation, the pinnacle of which today is food bound up in tin cans. Koohii #2 This chinese man was making the best china pottery in all of ... China. For some reason he insisted on working at the top of a pinnacle, away from the distractions of the world. He kept in touch with the local people, and took orders, through bound tin cans (tin cans bound with rope, the children's version of the telephone). Primitives pottery, pinnacle, parthenon, acropolis, bound up, tin can, noon, sign of the horse, shovel 鬱陶しい(うっとうしい): gloomy, depressing 陶器(とうき): pottery, ceramics Kunyomi: Onyomi: トウ Lesson: 53 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	pottery 陶 画数11 2117 Details Story Dictionary 陶 pottery Heisig's Pinnacle . . . bound up . . . tin can. Koohii #1 Pottery is used for food preservation, the pinnacle of which today is food bound up in tin cans. Koohii #2 This chinese man was making the best china pottery in all of ... China. For some reason he insisted on working at the top of a pinnacle, away from the distractions of the world. He kept in touch with the local people, and took orders, through bound tin cans (tin cans bound with rope, the children's version of the telephone). Primitives pottery, pinnacle, parthenon, acropolis, bound up, tin can, noon, sign of the horse, shovel 鬱陶しい(うっとうしい): gloomy, depressing 陶器(とうき): pottery, ceramics Kunyomi: Onyomi: トウ Lesson: 53 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:
swing Details Story Dictionary 揺 swing Heisig's Fingers . . . condor. Koohii #1 Primitive: A condor is like a vulture but twice the size and lives in mountainous regions (+1 Elphalpo). Story: I swing my fingers back and forth, trying to fend off the attacking condor. Koohii #2 For the condor primitive: A condor is like a vulture, but twice as big and it lives near mountains (a suitable place for such a majestic bird). For swing: I´m sitting on a swing when a condor comes by and picks up the whole swing set with its big finger-like claws and now I´m swinging in mid-air. Weeeeeeeee!!!!! Primitives swing, finger, fingers, condor, claw, vulture, king, mountain 動揺(どうよう): disturbance, unrest, shaking, trembling, pitching, rolling, oscillation, agitation, excitement, commotion 揺さぶる(ゆさぶる): to shake, to jolt, to rock, to swing 揺らぐ(ゆらぐ): to swing, to sway, to shake, to tremble 揺れる(ゆれる): shake, quake Kunyomi: ゆ.れる、ゆ.る、ゆ.らぐ、ゆ.るぐ、ゆ.する、ゆ.さぶる、ゆ.すぶる、うご.く Onyomi: ヨウ Lesson: 53 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 揺さぶる (ゆ.さぶる), 揺すぶる (ゆ.すぶる), 揺する (ゆ.する), 揺らぐ (ゆ.らぐ), 揺る (ゆ.る), 揺るぐ (ゆ.るぐ), 揺れる (ゆ.れる)	swing 揺 画数12 2118 Details Story Dictionary 揺 swing Heisig's Fingers . . . condor. Koohii #1 Primitive: A condor is like a vulture but twice the size and lives in mountainous regions (+1 Elphalpo). Story: I swing my fingers back and forth, trying to fend off the attacking condor. Koohii #2 For the condor primitive: A condor is like a vulture, but twice as big and it lives near mountains (a suitable place for such a majestic bird). For swing: I´m sitting on a swing when a condor comes by and picks up the whole swing set with its big finger-like claws and now I´m swinging in mid-air. Weeeeeeeee!!!!! Primitives swing, finger, fingers, condor, claw, vulture, king, mountain 動揺(どうよう): disturbance, unrest, shaking, trembling, pitching, rolling, oscillation, agitation, excitement, commotion 揺さぶる(ゆさぶる): to shake, to jolt, to rock, to swing 揺らぐ(ゆらぐ): to swing, to sway, to shake, to tremble 揺れる(ゆれる): shake, quake Kunyomi: ゆ.れる、ゆ.る、ゆ.らぐ、ゆ.るぐ、ゆ.する、ゆ.さぶる、ゆ.すぶる、うご.く Onyomi: ヨウ Lesson: 53 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 揺さぶる (ゆ.さぶる), 揺すぶる (ゆ.すぶる), 揺する (ゆ.する), 揺らぐ (ゆ.らぐ), 揺る (ゆ.る), 揺るぐ (ゆ.るぐ), 揺れる (ゆ.れる)
"Noh chanting Details Story Dictionary 謡 Noh chanting Heisig's Words . . . condor. Koohii #1 Noh chanting?!? I meant ""NO CHANTING!"" Now all you, just shut up! Not another word! Don´t you know that chanting can provoke attacks from the local condor? So, no chanting, and especially no Noh chanting. Koohii #2 Picture guy dressed in a condor mask up on stage during Noh performance chanting some words nobody understands. Primitives noh chanting, say, words, keitai, mouth, condor, claw, vulture, king, mountain 歌謡(かよう): song, ballad 民謡(みんよう): folk song, popular song Kunyomi: うた.い、うた.う Onyomi: ヨウ Lesson: 53 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 謡う (うた.う), 謡 (うたい)"	"Noh chanting 謡 画数16 2119 Details Story Dictionary 謡 Noh chanting Heisig's Words . . . condor. Koohii #1 Noh chanting?!? I meant ""NO CHANTING!"" Now all you, just shut up! Not another word! Don´t you know that chanting can provoke attacks from the local condor? So, no chanting, and especially no Noh chanting. Koohii #2 Picture guy dressed in a condor mask up on stage during Noh performance chanting some words nobody understands. Primitives noh chanting, say, words, keitai, mouth, condor, claw, vulture, king, mountain 歌謡(かよう): song, ballad 民謡(みんよう): folk song, popular song Kunyomi: うた.い、うた.う Onyomi: ヨウ Lesson: 53 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 謡う (うた.う), 謡 (うたい)"
"gloom Details Story Dictionary 鬱 gloom Heisig's Learning this character will take a little doing. Before we start, it is a good idea to keep the key word distinct from melancholy (Frame 663), with which it combines to create the psychological condition of depression (a metaphor based on the hollow or sinking of the material depression we met in Frame 1421). The picture of gloom begins with a small grove of trees, under which we see a crown made out of used tin cans. Next (the lower half of the kanji) we find a combination that appears only a few times in modern characters and only once in those treated in the volumes of Remembering the Kanji. It is composed of a shovel with a sheaf dotted with small drops on all sides. Think of it as a large scoop shovel attached to the front of a bulldozer, whose driver is singing: ♪ ""Bulldozing in the sheaves, bulldozing in the sheaves..."" ♪ The drops represent the chaff flying about as the sheaves are tossed about by the heavy machinery. There is someone sitting on the ground alongside, watching as the machinery makes its way around the neighboring farmland - and it's you, wearing your tin-can crown. You feel overwhelmed by the impending doom as the invasion of agro-business draws closer and closer to the grove, the only patch of woods that remains of what once was a vast forest. The whole scene represents a re-shaping of the natural environment that brings the heavy weight of gloom down upon you. A bit much, perhaps, but there are enough elements to allow for any number of other combinations. Koohii #1 The pixie, wearing a tin can crown, watches from the middle of the grove, the sparkling villain approach. She sits down in gloom wondering if she belongs amongst the trees, for she has never seen such a beautiful shape. Koohii #2 The context of gloom here refers to an environmental disaster that humans make. The story begins at a GROVE with TIN CANS shaped like CROWNS which are really soda cans. They belonged to workers who bulldozes (or SHOVELS) lots and lots of SHEAVES with DROPS of its pieces. Afar, a boy is SITTING while watching the workers reSHAPING the environment. His face now has a very gloomy expression. Kunyomi: うっ.する、 しげ.る、 ふさ.ぐ Onyomi: ウツ Lesson: 53 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: Compounds:"	"gloom 鬱 画数29 2120 Details Story Dictionary 鬱 gloom Heisig's Learning this character will take a little doing. Before we start, it is a good idea to keep the key word distinct from melancholy (Frame 663), with which it combines to create the psychological condition of depression (a metaphor based on the hollow or sinking of the material depression we met in Frame 1421). concerning Details Story Dictionary 就 concerning My Story [Capital {京} + dog (not quite, better kanji is {尤})] In the *Capital* I saw *a dog* with one human leg, quite concerning. Koohii #1 In the capital they have been having hearings concerning bioethics and bioengineering they call as their first witness a chihuahua with one human leg. Koohii #2 Ahem...CONCERNING your recent science fair project, it was a CAPITAL idea, but the CHIHUAHUA with a HUMAN LEG is freaking out the other contestants! Primitives concerning, capital, tall, top hat, mouth, small, little, understandably, chihuahua with one human leg 就業(しゅうぎょう): employment, starting work 就任(しゅうにん): inauguration 就職(しゅうしょく): finding employment, inauguration 就く(つく): settle in (place), take (seat, position), study (under teacher) Kunyomi: つ.く、つ.ける Onyomi: シュウ、ジュ Lesson: 53 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 就任 (しゅうにん), 就寝 (しゅうしん), 去就 (きょしゅう), 就く (つ.く), 就ける (つ.ける)	concerning 就 画数12 2121 Details Story Dictionary 就 concerning My Story [Capital {京} + dog (not quite, better kanji is {尤})] In the *Capital* I saw *a dog* with one human leg, quite concerning. Koohii #2 Ahem...CONCERNING your recent science fair project, it was a CAPITAL idea, but the CHIHUAHUA with a HUMAN LEG is freaking out the other contestants! kick Details Story Dictionary 蹴 kick Heisig's Wooden leg . . . concerning. Koohii #1 The soccer player was concerned that his peg leg would affect his ability to kick. Koohii #2 I kick with my FEET in the CAPITAL of all the ONE LEGGED CHIHUAHUAS. It is such a great fun, since they cannot kick me back! lol. Primitives kick, wooden leg, mouth, stop, footprint, concerning, capital, tall, top hat, mouth, small, little, understandably, chihuahua with one human leg, mouth2 蹴飛ばす(けとばす): to kick away, to kick off, to kick (someone), to refuse, to reject 蹴る(ける): kick Kunyomi: け.る Onyomi: シュク、シュウ Lesson: 53 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: Compounds: 蹴る (け.る)	kick 蹴 画数19 2122 Details Story Dictionary 蹴 kick Heisig's Wooden leg . . . concerning. It is such a great fun, since they cannot kick me back! lol. "sociable Details Story Dictionary 懇 sociable Heisig's Skunk . . . silver . . . heart. Koohii #1 The skunk here is Pepe LePew of Looney Tunes fame. He´s a very sociable skunk, as far as skunks go, but instead of having a ""heart of gold"" he has a heart of silver (since he always finishes second in the game of love). Koohii #2 The skunk here is Pepe LePew of Looney Tunes fame. He´s a very sociable skunk, as far as skunks go, but instead of having a ""heart of gold"" he has a heart of silver. Primitives sociable, skunk, silver, heart Kunyomi: ねんご.ろ Onyomi: コン Lesson: 53 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 懇ろ (ねんご.ろ)"	"sociable 懇 画数17 2123 Details Story Dictionary 懇 sociable Heisig's Skunk . . . silver . . . heart. He´s a very sociable skunk, as far as skunks go, but instead of having a ""heart of gold"" he has a heart of silver (since he always finishes second in the game of love). groundbreaking Details Story Dictionary 墾 groundbreaking Heisig's The groundbreaking referred to here is not for the erection of new buildings but for the opening of farmlands. The elements: skunk . . . silver . . . soil. Koohii #1 It was the groundbreaking of the new farm, but there was an uninvited guest to the ceremony. It was a famous skunk, the one with the familiar silver stripe. The feet of the crowd rushing from the ceremony site churned up the soil very nicely. The ceremony was ruined but the groundbreaking was a great success. Koohii #2 I got sprayed by a skunk, so no one is helping me with the groundbreaking of my farm. On a positive note, I found silver laying all over the soil. Mine all mine! Primitives groundbreaking, skunk, silver, soil, dirt, ground Kunyomi: Onyomi: コン Lesson: 53 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	groundbreaking 墾 画数16 2124 Details Story Dictionary 墾 groundbreaking Heisig's The groundbreaking referred to here is not for the erection of new buildings but for the opening of farmlands. The ceremony was ruined but the groundbreaking was a great success. Koohii #2 I got sprayed by a skunk, so no one is helping me with the groundbreaking of my farm. On a positive note, I found silver laying all over the soil. Mine all mine! Primitives groundbreaking, skunk, silver, soil, dirt, ground Kunyomi: Onyomi: コン Lesson: 53 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:
countenance Details Story Dictionary 貌 countenance Heisig's Skunk . . . white . . . human legs. Koohii #1 Anyone who watched a looney tunes cartoon know those kind of scene : pepe embraces a poor kitty mistaken for a SKUNK and the smell of pepe make the unfortunate girl loose all countenance : she turns WHITE then runs as fast as her LEGS can carry her . So much for cat s dignity and countenance. Koohii #2 The shocked countenance on girl's face when Pepe started to hump her white legs. Primitives countenance, skunk, badger, white, dove, human legs Kunyomi: かたち、かたどる Onyomi: ボウ、バク Lesson: 53 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: Compounds:	countenance 貌 画数14 2125 Details Story Dictionary 貌 countenance Heisig's Skunk . . . white . . . human legs. excuse Details Story Dictionary 免 excuse Heisig's This character is used for excusing oneself for a failure of courtesy. The elements are: bound up . . . sun (oddly enough, laid on its side) . . . human legs. * For the primitive meaning, we shall refer to this character as a rabbit, for which the old form of the character is 兔. Koohii #1 Obviously this is the rabbit from Alice, excusing himself and rushing away on his legs, as he has a binding day schedule. This is at the same time an image, with bound=ears, day=head and legs are just legs. The image is used in rabbit (#2093). Koohii #2 What is the rabbit´s excuse for being such a jerk? Well he was bound up for a whole day while being stepped on by peoples human legs in some make-up labratory. Yeah I think I can excuse him after knowing that. Primitives excuse, village stocks, rabbit, bound up, human legs 御免ください(ごめんください): May I come in? 御免なさい(ごめんなさい): I beg your pardon, excuse me 免れる(まぬかれる): to escape from, to be rescued from, to avoid, to evade, to avert, to elude, to be exempted, to be relieved from pain, to get rid of 免除(めんじょ): exemption, exoneration, discharge 御免(ごめん): your pardon, declining (something), dismissal, permission 免許(めんきょ): license, permit, certificate 免税(めんぜい): tax exemption Kunyomi: まぬか.れる、まぬが.れる Onyomi: メン Lesson: 53 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 免れる (まぬか.れる)	excuse 免 画数8 2126 Details Story Dictionary 免 excuse Heisig's This character is used for excusing oneself for a failure of courtesy. The elements are: bound up . . . sun (oddly enough, laid on its side) . . . human legs. * For the primitive meaning, we shall refer to this character as a rabbit, for which the old form of the character is 兔. Koohii #1 Obviously this is the rabbit from Alice, excusing himself and rushing away on his legs, as he has a binding day schedule. This is at the same time an image, with bound=ears, day=head and legs are just legs. The image is used in rabbit (#2093). Koohii #2 What is the rabbit´s excuse for being such a jerk? elude Details Story Dictionary 逸 elude Heisig's Rabbit . . . road. Koohii #1 Word play to differentiate elude/evade: elude ~= e-lewd. Alice is following Mr. Rabbit on the road. Mr. Rabbit flashes her in a lewd way and disappears, completely eluding her. Koohii #2 Even though the white rabbit was late, he eluded the wrath of the the Queen of Hearts because Alice was coming up the road. Primitives deviate, elude, village stocks, rabbit, bound up, human legs, road 逸らす(そらす): to turn away, to avert 逸れる(それる): stray from subject, get lost, go astray Kunyomi: そ.れる、そ.らす、はぐ.れる Onyomi: イツ Lesson: 53 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	elude 逸 画数11 2127 Details Story Dictionary 逸 elude Heisig's Rabbit . . . road. nightfall Details Story Dictionary 晩 nightfall Heisig's Sun . . . rabbit. Koohii #1 At nightfall the sun excuses itself and goes to sleep. Koohii #2 This is EASY!!! Japanese people see a RABBIT ON THE MOON (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Moon_rabbit ) and so nightfall is when the sun leaves to make way for the rabbit. Primitives nightfall, sun, day, village stocks, rabbit, bound up, human legs 今晩(こんばん): tonight, this evening 晩(ばん): evening 晩御飯(ばんごはん): dinner, evening meal 毎晩(まいばん): every night Kunyomi: Onyomi: バン Lesson: 53 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds:	nightfall 晩 画数12 2128 Details Story Dictionary 晩 nightfall Heisig's Sun . . . rabbit. exertion Details Story Dictionary 勉 exertion Heisig's Rabbit . . . muscle. Notice how the last stroke of rabbit is stretched out to underlie the element for muscle. Koohii #1 When RABBITS hop around, they EXERT tremendous force using their MUSCULAR legs. Koohii #2 The energizer bunny's exertion of power keeps going and going... Primitives exertion, village stocks, rabbit, bound up, human legs, power, muscle, arnold 勤勉(きんべん): industry, diligence 勉強(べんきょう): study, diligence, discount, reduction Kunyomi: つと.める Onyomi: ベン Lesson: 53 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds:	exertion 勉 画数10 2129 Details Story Dictionary 勉 exertion Heisig's Rabbit . . . muscle. "elephant Details Story Dictionary 象 elephant Heisig's A rabbit's head with the body of a sow represents an elephant. Little wonder that the kanji also means ""phenomenon""! Koohii #1 An elephant has huge ears, like a rabbit, and a big, fat body, like a sow. Koohii #2 An animal with huge ears like a rabbit, and a body fat like a pig... ¡An ELEPHANT! For the ""phenomenon"" connotation you could use Dumbo, or Joseph Merrick (the ""elephant man"") ( http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joseph_Merrick ). Primitives elephant, colour, color, bound up, sow, pig 気象(きしょう): weather, climate 象(しょう): phenomenon 象徴(しょうちょう): symbol 印象(いんしょう): impression 現象(げんしょう): phenomenon 象(ぞう): elephant 対象(たいしょう): target, object (of worship, study, etc.) 抽象(ちゅうしょう): abstract Kunyomi: かたど.る Onyomi: ショウ、ゾウ Lesson: 53 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 象徴 (しょうちょう), 対象 (たいしょう), 現象 (げんしょう)"	"elephant 象 画数12 2130 Details Story Dictionary 象 elephant Heisig's A rabbit's head with the body of a sow represents an elephant. Little wonder that the kanji also means ""phenomenon""! Koohii #1 An elephant has huge ears, like a rabbit, and a big, fat body, like a sow. Koohii #2 An animal with huge ears like a rabbit, and a body fat like a pig... ¡An ELEPHANT! For the ""phenomenon"" connotation you could use Dumbo, or Joseph Merrick (the ""elephant man"") ( http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joseph_Merrick ). Primitives elephant, colour, color, bound up, sow, pig 気象(きしょう): weather, climate 象(しょう): phenomenon 象徴(しょうちょう): symbol 印象(いんしょう): impression 現象(げんしょう): phenomenon 象(ぞう): elephant 対象(たいしょう): target, object (of worship, study, etc.) 抽象(ちゅうしょう): abstract Kunyomi: かたど.る Onyomi: ショウ、ゾウ Lesson: 53 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 象徴 (しょうちょう), 対象 (たいしょう), 現象 (げんしょう)"
statue Details Story Dictionary 像 statue My Story The statue of liberty is being replaced by a statue of Mr. T riding an elephant. Koohii #1 Statues of people are made the same size as statues of elephants. Koohii #2 One of the most famous statues is of course the Statue of Liberty, which is known for the first thing a person sees when coming into New York. However, did you know that the first thing a person used to see (between the years of 1885 to 1896) was actually a huge elephant statue on Coney Island? It's true too... ( http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coney_Island - search Coney Island Elephant). Primitives statue, person, elephant, colour, color, bound up, sow, pig 映像(えいぞう): reflection, image 現像(げんぞう): developing (film) 像(ぞう): statue, image, figure, picture, portrait 仏像(ぶつぞう): Buddhist image (statue) 想像(そうぞう): imagination, guess Kunyomi: Onyomi: ゾウ Lesson: 53 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds:	statue 像 画数14 2131 Details Story Dictionary 像 statue My Story The statue of liberty is being replaced by a statue of Mr. T riding an elephant. Koohii #1 Statues of people are made the same size as statues of elephants. Koohii #2 One of the most famous statues is of course the Statue of Liberty, which is known for the first thing a person sees when coming into New York. However, did you know that the first thing a person used to see (between the years of 1885 to 1896) was actually a huge elephant statue on Coney Island? It's true too... ( http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coney_Island - search Coney Island Elephant). Primitives statue, person, elephant, colour, color, bound up, sow, pig 映像(えいぞう): reflection, image 現像(げんぞう): developing (film) 像(ぞう): statue, image, figure, picture, portrait 仏像(ぶつぞう): Buddhist image (statue) 想像(そうぞう): imagination, guess Kunyomi: Onyomi: ゾウ Lesson: 53 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds:
"horse Details Story Dictionary 馬 horse Heisig's Let the extra vertical stroke in the mane combine with the first vertical stroke to give an image of the horse's long neck. The only odd thing is the tail feathers at the end, but that should present a good image to remember the character by. The fact that the last stroke of mane and the first of tail feathers coincide should no longer surprise you. * As a primitive, this kanji will mean a team of horses as distinct from the single horse whose primitive we met earlier. Koohii #1 Turkey with the drops at the top removed and tail feathers added (this matches stroke order and there are the tail feathers already, why not have the whole bird). If you take the two drops of 隹 as wings, then horses are like turkeys, but have no wings and have more prominent tail ""feathers"". Both are actually supposed to be pictographs, though. Koohii #2 The top part is half a comb (see frame 1920) with an extra vertical stroke to account for a sturdier version used to comb a horse mane. As a primitive I used the theme of the Trojan Horse. Not the modern computer viruses, but the large wooden horse which led to the demise of Troy and of the Trojans. Either its size (much greater than a live horse), or the fact that it conceals things into its belly, will set it appart from the horse primitive that came in frame 568 (""noon""). Primitives horse, team of horses 馬鹿馬鹿しい(ばかばかしい): stupid 馬鹿らしい(ばからしい): absurd 馬(うま): horse 競馬(けいば): horse racing 馬鹿(ばか): fool, idiot, trivial matter, folly Kunyomi: うま、うま-、ま Onyomi: バ Lesson: 54 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 馬 (うま)"	"horse 馬 画数10 2132 Details Story Dictionary 馬 horse Heisig's Let the extra vertical stroke in the mane combine with the first vertical stroke to give an image of the horse's long neck. The only odd thing is the tail feathers at the end, but that should present a good image to remember the character by. The fact that the last stroke of mane and the first of tail feathers coincide should no longer surprise you. * As a primitive, this kanji will mean a team of horses as distinct from the single horse whose primitive we met earlier. Koohii #1 Turkey with the drops at the top removed and tail feathers added (this matches stroke order and there are the tail feathers already, why not have the whole bird). If you take the two drops of 隹 as wings, then horses are like turkeys, but have no wings and have more prominent tail ""feathers"". Both are actually supposed to be pictographs, though. Koohii #2 The top part is half a comb (see frame 1920) with an extra vertical stroke to account for a sturdier version used to comb a horse mane. As a primitive I used the theme of the Trojan Horse. Not the modern computer viruses, but the large wooden horse which led to the demise of Troy and of the Trojans. Either its size (much greater than a live horse), or the fact that it conceals things into its belly, will set it appart from the horse primitive that came in frame 568 (""noon""). Primitives horse, team of horses 馬鹿馬鹿しい(ばかばかしい): stupid 馬鹿らしい(ばからしい): absurd 馬(うま): horse 競馬(けいば): horse racing 馬鹿(ばか): fool, idiot, trivial matter, folly Kunyomi: うま、うま-、ま Onyomi: バ Lesson: 54 Jouyou: 2 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds: 馬 (うま)"
"pony Details Story Dictionary 駒 pony Heisig's Team of horses . . . phrase. In American slang, a pony is an underground translation of a classical text, which students who cannot manage the difficult phrases of the original language consult and pass on from one generation to the next. Koohii #1 The new My Little Ponies show is all about magic horses who utter cute catch phrases. Koohii #2 A particular My Little Pony has a string that when you pull it, it repeats the same dumb phrase like ""I love you"". Primitives pony, team of horses, phrase, bound up, mouth Kunyomi: こま Onyomi: ク Lesson: 54 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 駒 (こま)"	"pony 駒 画数15 2133 Details Story Dictionary 駒 pony Heisig's Team of horses . . . phrase. Koohii #1 The new My Little Ponies show is all about magic horses who utter cute catch phrases. Koohii #2 A particular My Little Pony has a string that when you pull it, it repeats the same dumb phrase like ""I love you"". Primitives pony, team of horses, phrase, bound up, mouth Kunyomi: こま Onyomi: ク Lesson: 54 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 駒 (こま)"
verification (test) Details Story Dictionary 験 verification (test) My Story [Horse {馬} + risk] I need to verify (#test#) that the *horses* arent at *risk*, said the horse fucker Koohii #1 We just verification that there are indeed no soldiers in the belly of this trojan horse. We´re just gonna stab it in the belly with this awl to check. Koohii #2 The verification proves the horse is real by poking it with an ice pick. Primitives verification, team of horses, awl, fit, meeting, umbrella, mouth, person 体験(たいけん): personal experience 実験(じっけん): experiment 受験(じゅけん): taking an examination 経験(けいけん): experience 試験(しけん): examination Kunyomi: あかし、しるし、ため.す、ためし Onyomi: ケン、ゲン Lesson: 54 Jouyou: 4 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds: 試験 (しけん), 経験 (けいけん), 実験 (じっけん)	verification (test) 験 画数18 2134 Details Story Dictionary 験 verification (test) My Story [Horse {馬} + risk] I need to verify (#test#) that the *horses* arent at *risk*, said the horse fucker Koohii #1 We just verification that there are indeed no soldiers in the belly of this trojan horse. We´re just gonna stab it in the belly with this awl to check. Koohii #2 The verification proves the horse is real by poking it with an ice pick. equestrian Details Story Dictionary 騎 equestrian Heisig's Team of horses . . . strange. Koohii #1 Equestrian events are where you get horses to do strange things. Koohii #2 If the equestrian team used trojan horses, it would be really strange. Primitives equestrian, team of horses, strange, large, St. Bernard, street, nail, spike, mouth Kunyomi: Onyomi: キ Lesson: 54 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	equestrian 騎 画数18 2135 Details Story Dictionary 騎 equestrian Heisig's Team of horses . . . strange. parking Details Story Dictionary 駐 parking Heisig's Team of horses . . . candlestick. Koohii #1 In the olden days you had to park your horse next to a candlestick, a primitive parking meter that you start by lighting a fire and tracks the time by burning down. Koohii #2 In the olden days parking lots used to have reserved spaces for where the lord (of the set of houses, shops, whatever) could park his team of horses. nowadays it´s pretty much the same...reserved parking in front for the big bosses´ cars.... Primitives stop-over, parking, team of horses, candlestick, lord, drop, king, jewel, ball 駐車(ちゅうしゃ): parking (e.g. car) 駐車場(ちゅうしゃじょう): parking lot Kunyomi: Onyomi: チュウ Lesson: 54 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 2 Compounds:	parking 駐 画数15 2136 Details Story Dictionary 駐 parking Heisig's Team of horses . . . candlestick. Koohii #2 In the olden days parking lots used to have reserved spaces for where the lord (of the set of houses, shops, whatever) could park his team of horses. nowadays it´s pretty much the same...reserved parking in front for the big bosses´ cars.... Koohii #2 You use teams of horses to drive you and your carriage around the ward. station Details Story Dictionary 駅 station Heisig's Team of horses . . . shakuhachi. Koohii #1 Anyone living in Japan knows that train stations play little melodies when the train is about to arrive. In Ye Olden Days, when horses and carriages were used for transport, the carriage driver would play a little melody on his shakuhachi to let the passengers know the carriage was arriving at the next station. Koohii #2 A homeless horse playing the flute at the station to make a dime. Primitives station, team of horses, shaku-hachi, flag, stick 駅(えき): station Kunyomi: Onyomi: エキ Lesson: 54 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 4 Compounds:	station 駅 画数14 2138 Details Story Dictionary 駅 station Heisig's Team of horses . . . shakuhachi. boisterous Details Story Dictionary 騒 boisterous Heisig's Team of horses . . . crotch . . . insect. Koohii #1 Or more precisely: the team of horses are getting boisterous because one of them got bitten in the crotch by a horse fly. The kanji also means to roar, make up noise, to kick up a fuss and to make merry. Perhaps it is exactly the etymology behind this kanji. Koohii #2 The hidden Greeks inside the Trojan Horse are getting boisterous as one of them is bitten in the crotch by a nasty insect. If they don´t shut up, the Trojans will hear them... Primitives boisterous, team of horses, crotch, insect 騒動(そうどう): strife, riot, rebellion 騒がしい(さわがしい): noisy 騒ぎ(さわぎ): uproar, disturbance 騒音(そうおん): noise 騒々しい(そうぞうしい): noisy, boisterous 物騒(ぶっそう): dangerous, disturbed, insecure 騒ぐ(さわぐ): make a noise Kunyomi: さわ.ぐ、うれい、さわ.がしい Onyomi: ソウ Lesson: 54 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 騒ぐ (さわ.ぐ)	boisterous 騒 画数18 2139 Details Story Dictionary 騒 boisterous Heisig's Team of horses . . . crotch . . . insect. burdensome Details Story Dictionary 駄 burdensome Heisig's Team of horses . . . plump. Koohii #1 If a passenger is too plump and heavy, its too burdensome for the horse. Koohii #2 If your horses get so plump to be good for nothing they just become burdensome.
