"wonder Details Story Dictionary 驚 wonder Heisig's Awe . . . team of horses. Koohii #1 You stand in AWE at the 8th WONDER of the world, a huge TROJAN HORSE. Koohii #2 This is another word for surprise. 驚く＝おどろく= surprise. The Trojans stood in awe of the magnificent Trojan Horse that they thought was a gift. But imagine their surprise (wonder) when a bunch of Greeks came rushing out of it! (To further cement the connection between the primitives, if needed: It´s a wonder that the Trojans managed to speak keigo 敬語 even then, saying ""わたくしたちを殺さないでください!!お願い致します!!""). Primitives wonder, awe, flowers, phrase, bound up, mouth, taskmaster, team of horses 驚き(おどろき): surprise, astonishment, wonder 驚異(きょうい): wonder, miracle 吃驚(びっくり): be surprised, be amazed, be frightened, astonishment 驚かす(おどろかす): surprise, frighten, create a stir 驚く(おどろく): to surprise Kunyomi: おどろ.く、おどろ.かす Onyomi: キョウ Lesson: 54 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 驚かす (おどろ.かす), 驚く (おどろ.く)"	"wonder 驚 画数22 2141 Details Story Dictionary 驚 wonder Heisig's Awe . . . team of horses. fervent Details Story Dictionary 篤 fervent Heisig's Bamboo . . . team of horses. Koohii #1 A fervent horse doesnt need to be whipped with a bamboo stick during a race, it will go fast by itself. Koohii #2 A fervent history otaku rebuild the the Trojan Horse. But since he was Japanese, he used bamboo instead of normal wood. insult Details Story Dictionary 罵 insult Heisig's Eyeball . . . team of horses. Koohii #1 In ancient Japan, the most grievous insult was to poke a rival´s horse in the eye (consider how rare an expensive a steed was in those days). It was the final step in preparation for a duel to the death. Koohii #2 In Japan, is is considered insulting to look at someone from atop your horse. You have to step down and face people properly. Primitives insult, eye, cross-eyed, net, team of horses 罵る(ののしる): to speak ill of, to abuse Kunyomi: ののし.る Onyomi: バ Lesson: 54 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: Compounds: 罵る (ののし.る)	insult 罵 画数15 2143 Details Story Dictionary 罵 insult Heisig's Eyeball . . . team of horses. inflation Details Story Dictionary 騰 inflation Heisig's Meat . . . quarter . . . team of horses. Koohii #1 Flesh+quarter=McDonald´s quarter pounder. Due to inflation, McDonald´s has had to start making quarter pounders out of horse meat. Koohii #2 Every quarter moon, the cost of a trojan horse rises one quarter by inflation. Primitives inflation, edam, moon, month, flesh, part of the body, quarter, team of horses 沸騰(ふっとう): boiling, seething Kunyomi: Onyomi: トウ Lesson: 54 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	inflation 騰 画数20 2144 Details Story Dictionary 騰 inflation Heisig's Meat . . . quarter . . . team of horses. Koohii #2 Every quarter moon, the cost of a trojan horse rises one quarter by inflation. Primitives inflation, edam, moon, month, flesh, part of the body, quarter, team of horses 沸騰(ふっとう): boiling, seething Kunyomi: Onyomi: トウ Lesson: 54 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:
"tiger Details Story Dictionary 虎 tiger Heisig's The kanji in this frame recalls the famous Bengali fable about the group of magicians (the magic wand) who decided to make a tiger. It seems that each of them knew how to make one part of the beast, so they pooled their talents and brought all the pieces (diced into pieces) together, at which point the fabricated tiger promptly ate its makers up (the bodiless human legs). Whatever the parable's significance for modern civilization and its arsenals, it should help with this kanji. Oh yes, we should not forget that cliff-like element. Think of it as an abbreviation of the primitive for zoo (the first and fourth strokes, actually), in order to fit the tiger somewhere into the picture. In fact, the abbreviation is perfectly logical, since the bottom elements usurp the room for the rest of the primitive for zoo. * As a primitive element itself, the human legs are also swallowed up, but the meaning of tiger is kept, and the whole serves as a roof for what comes beneath 虍, giving the tiger something else to eat. Koohii #1 Magic wand + first two strokes of pelt (皮) + diced + human legs. A wizard who turns people he doesn´t like into newts with his magic wand goes for variety - he has always wanted a tiger pelt - but things go awry when the tiger promptly dices and eats him, leaving only a pair of legs. (a fitting end for a wicked wizard). Koohii #2 Tigger, the tiger, (from Pooh stories) is happy to have found a magic wand. Using it he can bounce up to a the top of a cliff, seven times as high as some human legs could bounce. Tigger thinks ""Its great to be a tiger! Primitives tiger, magic wand, augury, cliff, hook, diced, seven, human legs 虎(とら): tiger Kunyomi: とら Onyomi: コ Lesson: 54 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 虎 (とら)"	"tiger 虎 画数8 2145 Details Story Dictionary 虎 tiger Heisig's The kanji in this frame recalls the famous Bengali fable about the group of magicians (the magic wand) who decided to make a tiger. "skin Details Story Dictionary 膚 skin Heisig's Tiger . . . stomach. Koohii #1 Ending up in a tiger´s stomach is not good for your skin, as it´s full of stomach acids. Koohii #2 They say, ""there's more than one way to skin a cat"", but if you try to skin a tiger you might end up in its stomach. void Details Story Dictionary 虚 void Heisig's Tigers . . . row. Koohii #1 In Japanese folklore there is no hell, but there is the void. There, a row of tigers waits in the blackness to devour those souls who have failed in their spiritual life. Koohii #2 Warning to Sigfreid and Roy: Your entertainment contract will be null and void unless you can make all the tigers stand in a row. Primitives void, tiger, row 謙虚(けんきょ): modesty, humility Kunyomi: むな.しい、うつ.ろ Onyomi: キョ、コ Lesson: 54 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 虚無 (きょむ), 虚偽 (きょぎ), 空虚 (くうきょ)	void 虚 画数11 2148 Details Story Dictionary 虚 void Heisig's Tigers . . . row. frolic Details Story Dictionary 戯 frolic Heisig's Void . . . fiesta. Koohii #1 This is a story about the end of the universe. The universe is turning into a featureless void. There´s nothing we can do about it except for throw a fiesta and frolic a little bit before it´s all over. Koohii #2 Sigfreid and Roy´s contract having been voided, the tiger is free to frolic about at the fiesta. Primitives frolic, void, tiger, row, fiesta 悪戯(いたずら): tease, prank, trick, practical joke, mischief 戯曲(ぎきょく): play, drama 不山戯る(ふざける): to romp, to gambol, to frolic, to joke, to make fun of, to flirt Kunyomi: たわむ.れる、ざ.れる、じゃ.れる Onyomi: ギ、ゲ Lesson: 54 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 戯れる (たわむ.れる)	frolic 戯 画数15 2149 Details Story Dictionary 戯 frolic Heisig's Void . . . fiesta. "prudence Details Story Dictionary 慮 prudence Heisig's Tiger . . . think. Koohii #1 Real meaning: ""to ponder"". You have to think with prudence (ponder carefully) about approaching a tiger, as is evident from 虎. Koohii #2 You have to think with prudence about approaching a tiger. If not, it will eat your brains and heart. Thanks raulir. Primitives prudence, tiger, think, rice field, brains, heart 配慮(はいりょ): consideration, concern, forethought 遠慮(えんりょ): diffidence, restraint, reserve 考慮(こうりょ): consideration, taking into account Kunyomi: おもんぱく.る、おもんぱか.る Onyomi: リョ Lesson: 54 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"	"prudence 慮 画数15 2151 Details Story Dictionary 慮 prudence Heisig's Tiger . . . think. drama Details Story Dictionary 劇 drama My Story This is a play (drama) about a *tiger* killing a *pig* with his *REE*alistic sword (*reeeee*).. Koohii #1 There would be a lot of drama if a tiger tried to eat a sow but then the sow attacked it with a saber. Koohii #2 A great Indian drama acted out every year is how a poor Bengali boy fended off the tigers from his pigs using only a sabre. Primitives drama, tiger, sow, pig, sword, sabre, saber 喜劇(きげき): comedy, funny show 劇団(げきだん): troupe, theatrical company 演劇(えんげき): theatre play 劇(げき): performance, play 劇場(げきじょう): theatre 悲劇(ひげき): tragedy Kunyomi: Onyomi: ゲキ Lesson: 54 Jouyou: 6 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds:	drama 劇 画数15 2152 Details Story Dictionary 劇 drama My Story This is a play (drama) about a *tiger* killing a *pig* with his *REE*alistic sword (*reeeee*).. "tyrannize Details Story Dictionary 虐 tyrannize Heisig's Tiger . . . box with a one in it (or a backwards broom, if that makes it easier). Koohii #1 Here we see the evil tyrannizing tiger. What is on his chest? A giant E, for EVIL, of course. Koohii #2 The ""E"" shape actually means claws here, and the real etymology is a tiger tyrannizing other animals with its claws (the etymologies actually make sense once in a blue moon!). I think of the claws here as two hooks, representing the front paws. (stroke order of that part: 二＋last of 直). Primitives tyrannize, tiger, one, box Kunyomi: しいた.げる Onyomi: ギャク Lesson: 54 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 虐げる (しいた.げる)"	"tyrannize 虐 画数9 2153 Details Story Dictionary 虐 tyrannize Heisig's Tiger . . . box with a one in it (or a backwards broom, if that makes it easier). Koohii #1 Here we see the evil tyrannizing tiger. What is on his chest? A giant E, for EVIL, of course. Koohii #2 The ""E"" shape actually means claws here, and the real etymology is a tiger tyrannizing other animals with its claws (the etymologies actually make sense once in a blue moon!). I think of the claws here as two hooks, representing the front paws. (stroke order of that part: 二＋last of 直). Primitives tyrannize, tiger, one, box Kunyomi: しいた.げる Onyomi: ギャク Lesson: 54 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 虐げる (しいた.げる)"
"deer Details Story Dictionary 鹿 deer Heisig's Drawn on the walls of a complex of caves near Niaux in southern France are a number of animal likenesses dating from the Upper Paleolithic period. Among them we find pictures of deer, some of them showing men in deer masks. By comparing their drawings to real deer, Stone Age people hoped to acquire power over the animal in the hunt; and by comparing themselves to the deer, to take on that animal's characteristics. But time has locked with a ""double-key"" (the extra stroke through the element for key) the real secret of this art form from us, and we can only surmise such meanings. But more important than the enigmas of the troglodytic mind is the way in which caves, a double-key, and comparing gives us the kanji for deer. * As a primitive, this kanji is abbreviated much the same as the tiger was: the lower element is dropped to leave room for a replacement. Its meaning, however, remains the same. There are a very few cases (see frame 2158) in which there is no abbreviation. When this happens, we may keep the image suggested by the above explanation: painting of a deer. Koohii #1 Bambi wanders into a cave and sees a side order of salad and 2 spoons...but what´s the main course? Koohii #2 Santa´s reindeer, Rudolf, opens a nightclub in a cave. It´s popular with all the deer and reindeer in the world. The cave speciality is a salad w/ dressing on the side. There is no other deer club that can compare. How many other deer nightclubs are there? Primitives deer, cave, antlers, compare, spoon, sitting on the ground, spoon2, sitting on the ground2 馬鹿馬鹿しい(ばかばかしい): stupid 馬鹿らしい(ばからしい): absurd 馬鹿(ばか): fool, idiot, trivial matter, folly Kunyomi: しか、か Onyomi: ロク Lesson: 54 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 鹿 (しかか)"	"deer 鹿 画数11 2154 Details Story Dictionary 鹿 deer Heisig's Drawn on the walls of a complex of caves near Niaux in southern France are a number of animal likenesses dating from the Upper Paleolithic period. Among them we find pictures of deer, some of them showing men in deer masks. By comparing their drawings to real deer, Stone Age people hoped to acquire power over the animal in the hunt; and by comparing themselves to the deer, to take on that animal's characteristics. But time has locked with a ""double-key"" (the extra stroke through the element for key) the real secret of this art form from us, and we can only surmise such meanings. But more important than the enigmas of the troglodytic mind is the way in which caves, a double-key, and comparing gives us the kanji for deer. * As a primitive, this kanji is abbreviated much the same as the tiger was: the lower element is dropped to leave room for a replacement. Its meaning, however, remains the same. There are a very few cases (see frame 2158) in which there is no abbreviation. When this happens, we may keep the image suggested by the above explanation: painting of a deer. Koohii #1 Bambi wanders into a cave and sees a side order of salad and 2 spoons...but what´s the main course? Koohii #2 Santa´s reindeer, Rudolf, opens a nightclub in a cave. It´s popular with all the deer and reindeer in the world. The cave speciality is a salad w/ dressing on the side. There is no other deer club that can compare. How many other deer nightclubs are there? Primitives deer, cave, antlers, compare, spoon, sitting on the ground, spoon2, sitting on the ground2 馬鹿馬鹿しい(ばかばかしい): stupid 馬鹿らしい(ばからしい): absurd 馬鹿(ばか): fool, idiot, trivial matter, folly Kunyomi: しか、か Onyomi: ロク Lesson: 54 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 鹿 (しかか)"
foot of a mountain Details Story Dictionary 麓 foot of a mountain Heisig's Grove . . . deer. Koohii #1 Many deer can be found in the grove at the foot of a mountain. Koohii #2 Deer are well known for frolicking in groves of trees. However, they are not well known for actually watching where the heck they are bounding about. Here we have a bunch of dead deer bodies that you find at the foot of a mountain. You are trying to figure why there are so many dead deer in one spot, and then you trace a line up the mountain - leaves and such are scattered all the way up...to a grove. Looks like they hopped through some leaves to their doom. Primitives foot of a mountain, grove, tree, wood, deer, cave, antlers, compare, spoon, sitting on the ground, spoon2, sitting on the ground2 麓(ふもと): foot, the bottom, base (of a mountain) Kunyomi: ふもと Onyomi: ロク Lesson: 54 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: Compounds: 麓 (ふもと)	foot of a mountain 麓 画数19 2155 Details Story Dictionary 麓 foot of a mountain Heisig's Grove . . . deer. Koohii #1 Many deer can be found in the grove at the foot of a mountain. Koohii #2 Deer are well known for frolicking in groves of trees. However, they are not well known for actually watching where the heck they are bounding about. Here we have a bunch of dead deer bodies that you find at the foot of a mountain. You are trying to figure why there are so many dead deer in one spot, and then you trace a line up the mountain - leaves and such are scattered all the way up...to a grove. Looks like they hopped through some leaves to their doom. Primitives foot of a mountain, grove, tree, wood, deer, cave, antlers, compare, spoon, sitting on the ground, spoon2, sitting on the ground2 麓(ふもと): foot, the bottom, base (of a mountain) Kunyomi: ふもと Onyomi: ロク Lesson: 54 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: Compounds: 麓 (ふもと)
"recommend Details Story Dictionary 薦 recommend My Story [Flower + deer {鹿} + slingshot (looks like {与}) + tail feather] Hunting recommendations: use *flowers* to lure *deer*, and use a *slingshot* to kill birds, take a *feather* as a reward. Koohii #1 Customer in restaurant asks you (waiter) what you recommend: ""I recommend ze deer or ze 'eadless chicken. And I recommend you garnish it wiz some flowers."" (let last six strokes = headless chicken). Koohii #2 It is recommended that deers stick to eating flowers. If they try to eat birds, they may end up choking on them, like this one here. Note that the head (白) is gone and the visible part of the body which is normally written with a stroke of the head must by necessity be drawn with a stroke of the tail. Primitives recommend, flowers, deer, cave, antlers, slingshot, catapult, tail feathers 推薦(すいせん): recommendation Kunyomi: すす.める Onyomi: セン Lesson: 54 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 薦める (すす.める)"	"recommend 薦 画数16 2156 Details Story Dictionary 薦 recommend My Story [Flower + deer {鹿} + slingshot (looks like {与}) + tail feather] Hunting recommendations: use *flowers* to lure *deer*, and use a *slingshot* to kill birds, take a *feather* as a reward. Koohii #1 Customer in restaurant asks you (waiter) what you recommend: ""I recommend ze deer or ze 'eadless chicken. And I recommend you garnish it wiz some flowers."" (let last six strokes = headless chicken). Koohii #2 It is recommended that deers stick to eating flowers. If they try to eat birds, they may end up choking on them, like this one here. Note that the head (白) is gone and the visible part of the body which is normally written with a stroke of the head must by necessity be drawn with a stroke of the tail. Primitives recommend, flowers, deer, cave, antlers, slingshot, catapult, tail feathers 推薦(すいせん): recommendation Kunyomi: すす.める Onyomi: セン Lesson: 54 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 薦める (すす.める)"
"jubilation Details Story Dictionary 慶 jubilation Heisig's Deer . . . crown (note the doubling up) . . . heart . . . walking legs. You may recall that we met the relative primitives at the bottom here before, in the kanji for melancholy (Frame 663). Koohii #1 The hunter experienced jubilation when the deer with melancholy walked up to him and said, ""just shoot me, whats the point in running. Everyone dies someday..."" Koohii #2 Bambi was melancholy at the death of his mother, but is now in jubilation as he´s made friends with thumper. Primitives jubilation, deer, cave, antlers, crown, heart, walking legs 慶び(よろこび): joy, delight, rapture, pleasure, gratification, rejoicing, congratulations, felicitations 慶ぶ(よろこぶ): be delighted, be glad Kunyomi: よろこ.び Onyomi: ケイ Lesson: 54 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"	"jubilation 慶 画数15 2157 Details Story Dictionary 慶 jubilation Heisig's Deer . . . crown (note the doubling up) . . . heart . . . walking legs. You may recall that we met the relative primitives at the bottom here before, in the kanji for melancholy (Frame 663). Koohii #1 The hunter experienced jubilation when the deer with melancholy walked up to him and said, ""just shoot me, whats the point in running. Everyone dies someday..."" Koohii #2 Bambi was melancholy at the death of his mother, but is now in jubilation as he´s made friends with thumper. Primitives jubilation, deer, cave, antlers, crown, heart, walking legs 慶び(よろこび): joy, delight, rapture, pleasure, gratification, rejoicing, congratulations, felicitations 慶ぶ(よろこぶ): be delighted, be glad Kunyomi: よろこ.び Onyomi: ケイ Lesson: 54 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"
"lovely Details Story Dictionary 麗 lovely Heisig's The painting of a deer itself with its form and color is enough to fill the bill for an image of something lovely. But to give a bit of contrast, we see two mediocre drawings from a later age on two patches of ceiling above. Note that the drop in mediocre has been lengthened somewhat and the second stroke drawn down straight. Koohii #1 The anthropologist made an exact deer painting from the cave ceiling on the ceiling of his house. Too bad they´re both mediocre. All his wife could say was, ""How...lovely."". Koohii #2 Lovely bambi.... pictographe : just take a look at those innocent open eyes (part 1 it´s not more far fetched than seeing mediocre in it) with thin eyebrows what a lovely deer ...(part 2). Primitives lovely, one, ceiling, mediocre, deer, cave, antlers, compare, ceiling2, mediocre2, compare2 奇麗(きれい): pretty, clean, nice, tidy, beautiful, fair Kunyomi: うるわ.しい、うら.らか Onyomi: レイ Lesson: 54 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 麗しい (うるわ.しい)"	"lovely 麗 画数19 2158 Details Story Dictionary 麗 lovely Heisig's The painting of a deer itself with its form and color is enough to fill the bill for an image of something lovely. But to give a bit of contrast, we see two mediocre drawings from a later age on two patches of ceiling above. Note that the drop in mediocre has been lengthened somewhat and the second stroke drawn down straight. Koohii #1 The anthropologist made an exact deer painting from the cave ceiling on the ceiling of his house. Too bad they´re both mediocre. All his wife could say was, ""How...lovely."". Koohii #2 Lovely bambi.... pictographe : just take a look at those innocent open eyes (part 1 it´s not more far fetched than seeing mediocre in it) with thin eyebrows what a lovely deer ...(part 2). Primitives lovely, one, ceiling, mediocre, deer, cave, antlers, compare, ceiling2, mediocre2, compare2 奇麗(きれい): pretty, clean, nice, tidy, beautiful, fair Kunyomi: うるわ.しい、うら.らか Onyomi: レイ Lesson: 54 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 麗しい (うるわ.しい)"
"bear Details Story Dictionary 熊 bear My Story A bear has no *ability* {能} (ノウ）to make *fire* 灬. 熊、くま, bear, like くまモン, mascot of 熊本県、くまもとけん, Kumamoto Prefecture. 熊は火を作る能力がない, ""A bear does not have the ability to make fire."" 猟師は熊の足跡を辿った, ""The hunter followed down the bear's tracks."" 虎に比べれば熊は優しい動物です, ""Compared to a tiger, a bear is a gentle animal."" Koohii #1 Most don´t know it, but bears have the ability to walk on fire. They´re invincible creatures! Koohii #2 Note : I don´t know why James Heisig put ""bear"" ahead of ""ability"" (next frame), but I sugget to skip this, learn the next kanji (""ability"") then go back here and use ability as a primitive. Primitives bear, ability, elbow, moon, month, flesh, part of the body, spoon, sitting on the ground, oven-fire, barbecue, spoon2, sitting on the ground2 Kunyomi: くま Onyomi: ユウ Lesson: 54 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 熊 (くま)"	"bear 熊 画数14 2159 Details Story Dictionary 熊 bear My Story A bear has no *ability* {能} (ノウ）to make *fire* 灬. 熊、くま, bear, like くまモン, mascot of 熊本県、くまもとけん, Kumamoto Prefecture. 熊は火を作る能力がない, ""A bear does not have the ability to make fire."" 猟師は熊の足跡を辿った, ""The hunter followed down the bear's tracks."" 虎に比べれば熊は優しい動物です, ""Compared to a tiger, a bear is a gentle animal."" Koohii #1 Most don´t know it, but bears have the ability to walk on fire. They´re invincible creatures! Koohii #2 Note : I don´t know why James Heisig put ""bear"" ahead of ""ability"" (next frame), but I sugget to skip this, learn the next kanji (""ability"") then go back here and use ability as a primitive. Primitives bear, ability, elbow, moon, month, flesh, part of the body, spoon, sitting on the ground, oven-fire, barbecue, spoon2, sitting on the ground2 Kunyomi: くま Onyomi: ユウ Lesson: 54 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 熊 (くま)"
"ability Details Story Dictionary 能 ability My Story On top of the *moon*, MUlan did the Micheal Jackson: ""*HI* *HI*"" Sound. This was probably not the best of her abilities Koohii #1 This man may have the dis-ability of no flesh below the elbows, but he can eat with 2 spoons, on in each foot. Koohii #2 Kid from the Oracle´s place in the Matrix (whose head is shining like the moon) is holding a a spoon and making it bend using his special ability. When Neo asks to learn this ability the child replies, "" Remember the truth Neo, there is no spoon."" Neo Proceeds to the kitchen pondering these words of wisdom. The Child smiles mischeviously and pulls a second spoon hidden up his sleeve in the crook of his elbow. ""That´s right Neo,"" the child laughs, ""there is no spoon...there are two spoons!"". Primitives ability, elbow, moon, month, flesh, part of the body, spoon, sitting on the ground, spoon2, sitting on the ground2 技能(ぎのう): technical skill, ability, capacity 万能(ばんのう): all-purpose, almighty, omnipotent 放射能(ほうしゃのう): radioactivity 本能(ほんのう): instinct 無能(むのう): inefficiency, incompetence 可能(かのう): possible, practicable, feasible 機能(きのう): function, faculty 芸能(げいのう): public entertainment, accomplishments, attainments 才能(さいのう): talent, ability 性能(せいのう): ability, efficiency 知能(ちのう): intelligence, brains 能(のう): talent, gift, function, Noh play 能率(のうりつ): efficiency 能力(のうりょく): ability, faculty 有能(ゆうのう): able, capable, efficient, skill Kunyomi: よ.く Onyomi: ノウ Lesson: 54 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds:"	"ability 能 画数10 2160 Details Story Dictionary 能 ability My Story On top of the *moon*, MUlan did the Micheal Jackson: ""*HI* *HI*"" Sound. This was probably not the best of her abilities Koohii #1 This man may have the dis-ability of no flesh below the elbows, but he can eat with 2 spoons, on in each foot. Koohii #2 Kid from the Oracle´s place in the Matrix (whose head is shining like the moon) is holding a a spoon and making it bend using his special ability. When Neo asks to learn this ability the child replies, "" Remember the truth Neo, there is no spoon."" Neo Proceeds to the kitchen pondering these words of wisdom. The Child smiles mischeviously and pulls a second spoon hidden up his sleeve in the crook of his elbow. ""That´s right Neo,"" the child laughs, ""there is no spoon...there are two spoons!"". attitude Details Story Dictionary 態 attitude Heisig's Ability . . . heart. Koohii #1 This guy has an attitude problem – lots of ability, but his heart´s not in it. Koohii #2 Having a good attitude means believing in your heart that you have the ability to do anything - like memorizing more than 2000 kanji, for example. Primitives attitude, ability, elbow, moon, month, flesh, part of the body, spoon, sitting on the ground, heart, spoon2, sitting on the ground2 形態(けいたい): form, shape, figure 実態(じったい): truth, fact 態勢(たいせい): attitude, conditions, preparations 態々(わざわざ): expressly, specially, doing something especially rather than incidentally 事態(じたい): situation, present state of affairs, circumstances 状態(じょうたい): current status, condition, situation, circumstances, state 態度(たいど): attitude, manner Kunyomi: わざ.と Onyomi: タイ Lesson: 54 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	attitude 態 画数14 2161 Details Story Dictionary 態 attitude Heisig's Ability . . . heart. "sign of the tiger Details Story Dictionary 寅 sign of the tiger Heisig's House . . . ceiling . . . sprout . . . animal legs. Compare, and do not confuse with, the kanji in frame 1887. Koohii #1 I don't know why but when I read sign of the tiger I get the ""eye of the tiger song"" stuck in my head. So I see rocky training in his house. Hes hitting the ceiling (no punching bag) eating brussel sprouts to keep in good health and running with only the animal legs his dog. Koohii #2 The sign of the tiger is that he´s eaten all of the yellow (#1750) salad in the house. Primitives sign of the tiger, house, caterpillar, one, ceiling, sprout, shoot, animal legs, eight Kunyomi: とら Onyomi: イン Lesson: 55 Jouyou: Names JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"	"sign of the tiger 寅 画数11 2162 Details Story Dictionary 寅 sign of the tiger Heisig's House . . . ceiling . . . sprout . . . animal legs. Compare, and do not confuse with, the kanji in frame 1887. Koohii #1 I don't know why but when I read sign of the tiger I get the ""eye of the tiger song"" stuck in my head. So I see rocky training in his house. Hes hitting the ceiling (no punching bag) eating brussel sprouts to keep in good health and running with only the animal legs his dog. Koohii #2 The sign of the tiger is that he´s eaten all of the yellow (#1750) salad in the house. Primitives sign of the tiger, house, caterpillar, one, ceiling, sprout, shoot, animal legs, eight Kunyomi: とら Onyomi: イン Lesson: 55 Jouyou: Names JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"
"performance Details Story Dictionary 演 performance My Story You'll ENJOY the performance. A stream of *water* falls on a *crown*, causing it to topple onto a *TNT plunger* which crushes some *animal legs* and blows up the whole theater!! Koohii #1 Studies have shown that Rocky's PERFORMANCE increases if he downs WATER mixed with gatorade while in a match. Koohii #2 I remember seeing advertisements growing up with the sign of the tiger saying to ""Put a tiger in your tank"", meaning that it would increase the performance of the drops of gasoline you put in. Primitives performance, water, water droplets, water pistol, sign of the tiger, house, caterpillar, one, ceiling, sprout, shoot, animal legs, eight 演習(えんしゅう): practice, exercises, manoeuvers 演出(えんしゅつ): production (e.g. play), direction 演じる(えんじる): to perform (a play), to play (a part), to act (a part), to commit (a blunder) 演ずる(えんずる): to perform, to play 公演(こうえん): public performance 主演(しゅえん): starring, playing the leading part 出演(しゅつえん): performance, stage appearance 上演(じょうえん): performance (e.g. music) 演技(えんぎ): acting, performance 演劇(えんげき): theatre play 演説(えんぜつ): speech, address 演奏(えんそう): musical performance 講演(こうえん): lecture, address Kunyomi: Onyomi: エン Lesson: 55 Jouyou: 5 JLPT Level: 3 Compounds:"	"performance 演 画数14 2163 Details Story Dictionary 演 performance My Story You'll ENJOY the performance. "sign of the dragon Details Story Dictionary 辰 sign of the dragon Heisig's Cliff . . . two . . . hairpins. Koohii #1 I'm going with the Mortal Kombat Symbol, as it's the closest thing to a sign of the dragon I know. In that game, there's a place called the pit to which you can throw your opponent on round two, but only with a hairpin punch. Koohii #2 The kid said ""I don´t believe you! Dragons don´t exist!"" so we made a little surprise for him: we pinned a huge dragon (it was just a sign really) on a nearby cliff. ""Whoaaa! Dragon!"" the kid said. ""But why won´t it move?"" ""I tell you why, cause it´s pinned there with two hairpins"" I thought to myself. Primitives sign of the dragon, cliff, two, hairpin, safety-pin Kunyomi: たつ Onyomi: シン、ジン Lesson: 55 Jouyou: Names JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"	"sign of the dragon 辰 画数7 2164 Details Story Dictionary 辰 sign of the dragon Heisig's Cliff . . . two . . . hairpins. Koohii #1 I'm going with the Mortal Kombat Symbol, as it's the closest thing to a sign of the dragon I know. In that game, there's a place called the pit to which you can throw your opponent on round two, but only with a hairpin punch. Koohii #2 The kid said ""I don´t believe you! Dragons don´t exist!"" so we made a little surprise for him: we pinned a huge dragon (it was just a sign really) on a nearby cliff. ""Whoaaa! Dragon!"" the kid said. ""But why won´t it move?"" ""I tell you why, cause it´s pinned there with two hairpins"" I thought to myself. Primitives sign of the dragon, cliff, two, hairpin, safety-pin Kunyomi: たつ Onyomi: シン、ジン Lesson: 55 Jouyou: Names JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"
embarrass Details Story Dictionary 辱 embarrass Heisig's Sign of the dragon . . . glue. Koohii #1 If you get too close to a fire-breathing dragon, your skin can turn red from the burn. When someone is embarrassed, it's as though they have this sign of the dragon stuck to their face. Koohii #2 The sign of the dragon falls off the cliff, to our great embarassment (see sign of the dragon (#2008)) We should have glued it there! Primitives embarrass, sign of the dragon, cliff, two, hairpin, safety-pin, glue 侮辱(ぶじょく): insult, contempt, slight Kunyomi: はずかし.める Onyomi: ジョク Lesson: 55 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 辱める (はずかし.める)	embarrass 辱 画数10 2165 Details Story Dictionary 辱 embarrass Heisig's Sign of the dragon . . . glue. Koohii #1 If you get too close to a fire-breathing dragon, your skin can turn red from the burn. When someone is embarrassed, it's as though they have this sign of the dragon stuck to their face. Koohii #2 The sign of the dragon falls off the cliff, to our great embarassment (see sign of the dragon (#2008)) We should have glued it there! Primitives embarrass, sign of the dragon, cliff, two, hairpin, safety-pin, glue 侮辱(ぶじょく): insult, contempt, slight Kunyomi: はずかし.める Onyomi: ジョク Lesson: 55 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 辱める (はずかし.める)
quake Details Story Dictionary 震 quake Heisig's Weather . . . sign of the dragon. Koohii #1 An earthquake is a sign that a dragon is awakening after a heavy rain... It is angry for having been woken up and it makes the earth thunder and quake above it. Koohii #2 Instant mythology: When heavy rains disturb a dragon hiding under the earth, an earthquake may result. Primitives quake, rain, weather, sign of the dragon, cliff, two, hairpin, safety-pin 震わせる(ふるわせる): to be shaking, to be trembling 震える(ふるえる): shiver, shake, quake 地震(じしん): earthquake Kunyomi: ふる.う、ふる.える Onyomi: シン Lesson: 55 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 2 Compounds: 震う (ふる.う), 震える (ふる.える)	quake 震 画数15 2166 Details Story Dictionary 震 quake Heisig's Weather . . . sign of the dragon. shake Details Story Dictionary 振 shake My Story [My nigga MO + Payback (kanji damage)] *My Nigga MO* had to shake his ass to *payback* his debt Koohii #1 Your mother shakes herfinger violently - no, no, no - no Mortal Kombat today! Koohii #2 If you're talking to someone and notice that theirfingers are starting to shake, it's often a sign of the dragon being behind you where the other person can see him coming. "with child Details Story Dictionary 娠 with child Heisig's Woman . . . sign of the dragon. The key word is a synonym for pregnant, whose character we met earlier (Frame 546). Although the two kanji are often used together, they should be kept distinct. Koohii #1 A woman who is with child can't be sacrificed to the dragon; virgins only need apply. Koohii #2 The woman hides the dragon from poachers under her shirt, pretending she's with child. ""Seen any sign of the dragon?"" ask the poachers. ""Nope, haven't seen him,"" replies the woman. Primitives with child, woman, sign of the dragon, cliff, two, hairpin, safety-pin 妊娠(にんしん): conception, pregnancy Kunyomi: Onyomi: シン Lesson: 55 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"	"with child 娠 画数10 2168 Details Story Dictionary 娠 with child Heisig's Woman . . . sign of the dragon. Koohii #2 As I approached her lips, I began to sense the sign of the dragon breath coming from her mouth, and I almost fainted. agriculture Details Story Dictionary 農 agriculture Heisig's Bend . . . sign of the dragon. Koohii #1 Imagine if you could bend a dragon to your will. Helpful in war, yes, but also a boon for agriculture. The dragon could use its sharp claws to plough the ground, and use its firey breath to clear the land. But first you'd have to bend the dragon to your will -- not an easy task. Koohii #2 It's a good agricultural sign when, as the farmer is bending down, he discovers some plants arranged in the sign of the dragon. It means the weather and earth will be supportive of the crops. Primitives agriculture, bend, sign of the dragon, cliff, two, hairpin, safety-pin 農耕(のうこう): farming, agriculture 農場(のうじょう): farm (agriculture) 農村(のうそん): agricultural community, farm village, rural 農地(のうち): agricultural land 酪農(らくのう): dairy (farm) 農家(のうか): farmer, farm family 農業(のうぎょう): agriculture 農産物(のうさんぶつ): agricultural produce 農民(のうみん): farmers, peasants 農薬(のうやく): agricultural chemicals Kunyomi: Onyomi: ノウ Lesson: 55 Jouyou: 3 JLPT Level: 2 Compounds:	agriculture 農 画数13 2170 Details Story Dictionary 農 agriculture Heisig's Bend . . . sign of the dragon. In this frame Cerberus is seen along the road to hell, escorting those who have been sent off to join Hades in his realm. Koohii #2 The woolly mammoth got quite a send off before he wandered up that road never to be seen alive again. connection Details Story Dictionary 関 connection My Story [Gate + Horny Heavens] The *gate* to the *Horny Heavens* is my connection to God Koohii #1 At the airport, the woolly mammoth was too big. When he tried to go through his flight's gate he got stuck and missed his connecting flight. Koohii #2 The wooly mammoth Smashes the gates down restoring the connection between the glacier and the low lands. "ghost Details Story Dictionary 鬼 ghost Heisig's Drop of . . . brains . . . human legs . . . elbow. Koohii #1 鬼(おに) is not a ghost. An ogre or a troll would be a more fitting translation. Such a thing has but a drop of brains and uses its legs and elbows as deadly weapons (a concept which should be familiar from the license (#765) to kill). I'll use ""ogre"" for this. Koohii #2 A ghost, or oni, wandering slowly on its human legs, searching for brains to eat. What looks like an elbow here is actually a pictoral representation of the forked tail protruding out of its rear. Primitives ghost, oni, drop, brains, rice field, human legs, elbow 鬼(おに): ogre, demon Kunyomi: おに、おに- Onyomi: キ Lesson: 55 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 鬼 (おに)"	"ghost 鬼 画数10 2175 Details Story Dictionary 鬼 ghost Heisig's Drop of . . . brains . . . human legs . . . elbow. "witch Details Story Dictionary 魔 witch My Story *Caves* 广, sacred *groves* 林, and *demons* 鬼 are often associated with witches. So is the use of drugs, like *hemp* 麻. 魔女、まじょ, witch (cf *mago* or *mage*); 魔法、まほう, witchcraft, sorcery: 魔女は魔法を使うことができます, ""A witch is able to use witchcraft."" 魔術、まじゅつ, sorcery, black arts (cf ""magic""); 魔術師、まじゅつし, magician, illusionist. Koohii #1 This modern version of the witch lives in some hippie community. She smokes a lot of hemp, and spends the day talking to ghosts, which not surprisingly appears only to her. Koohii #2 The witch sold me some hemp that made me see ghosts don´t do drugs. Primitives witch, hemp, cliff, grove, tree, wood, ghost, oni, drop, brains, rice field, human legs, elbow, tree2, wood2 お邪魔します(おじゃまします): Excuse me for disturbing (interrupting) you 誤魔化す(ごまかす): to deceive, to falsify, to misrepresent 邪魔(じゃま): obstacle, intrusion 悪魔(あくま): evil spirit, devil, demon Kunyomi: Onyomi: マ Lesson: 55 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"	"witch 魔 画数21 2178 Details Story Dictionary 魔 witch My Story *Caves* 广, sacred *groves* 林, and *demons* 鬼 are often associated with witches. "fascination Details Story Dictionary 魅 fascination Heisig's Ghost . . . not yet. Koohii #1 Ghosts have not yet left the world, they must still have a deep fascination with their past life on Earth. Koohii #2 Here the ""Ghostbusters"" founder talks about his fascination for ghosts (picture Dan Arkroyd in the movie if that helps). He says he has a fascination for ghosts ever since he saw one as a teenager. Since then he´s been scouring all of the world, trying to capture them on tape, on video... A journalist asks ""When will it end ? Aren´t you tired of chasing ghosts ?"" ""Oh no, not yet ! Not until I become a ghost myself anyway !"". Primitives fascination, ghost, oni, drop, brains, rice field, human legs, elbow, not yet, one, tree, wood 魅力(みりょく): charm, fascination, glamour Kunyomi: Onyomi: ミ Lesson: 55 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"	"fascination 魅 画数15 2179 Details Story Dictionary 魅 fascination Heisig's Ghost . . . not yet. (Adapted from dingomick because zombie was used as a primitive for drag+rag). Koohii #2 All too often I find myself vaccuming clods of dirt with my Dirt Devil. "attack Details Story Dictionary 襲 attack Heisig's Vase . . . meat . . . slingshot (doubled up with) snake . . . three . . . garment. The top half of this character is the old form for the kanji in frame 575. Koohii #1 The top 16 strokes are the chinese radical for ""dragon"". Joining up both meanings of the radical we can name the top part of this kanji ""imperial dragon"". Two-headed snakes do exist as biological curiosities, and they look a bit like a slingshot (with the heads splitting at a junction). Our imperial dragon here, the pet of a Chinese emperor, is a rare ""three-headed slingshot-snake"" kept in a vase and fed with meat. When the emperor attacked neighbours, his army wore the imperial dragon garment. Koohii #2 You attack an old dragon 龍 and take his clothes. REF: dragon [old] (#2981). Primitives attack, old dragon, vase, stand up, moon, month, flesh, part of the body, slingshot, catapult, snake, self, three, cloth, clothes, clothing, garment, dragon* 襲う(おそう): to attack 襲撃(しゅうげき): attack, charge, raid Kunyomi: おそ.う、かさ.ね Onyomi: シュウ Lesson: 55 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 襲う (おそ.う)"	"attack 襲 画数22 2181 Details Story Dictionary 襲 attack Heisig's Vase . . . meat . . . slingshot (doubled up with) snake . . . three . . . garment. The top half of this character is the old form for the kanji in frame 575. Koohii #1 The top 16 strokes are the chinese radical for ""dragon"". Joining up both meanings of the radical we can name the top part of this kanji ""imperial dragon"". Two-headed snakes do exist as biological curiosities, and they look a bit like a slingshot (with the heads splitting at a junction). Our imperial dragon here, the pet of a Chinese emperor, is a rare ""three-headed slingshot-snake"" kept in a vase and fed with meat. When the emperor attacked neighbours, his army wore the imperial dragon garment. Koohii #2 You attack an old dragon 龍 and take his clothes. REF: dragon [old] (#2981). Primitives attack, old dragon, vase, stand up, moon, month, flesh, part of the body, slingshot, catapult, snake, self, three, cloth, clothes, clothing, garment, dragon* 襲う(おそう): to attack 襲撃(しゅうげき): attack, charge, raid Kunyomi: おそ.う、かさ.ね Onyomi: シュウ Lesson: 55 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 襲う (おそ.う)"
"upbraid Details Story Dictionary 嚇 upbraid Heisig's Koohii #1 To upbraid someone, you criticize them in a menacing way. In other words, you jaw at them with your MOUTH until both sides of their face turn RED (hence the double-red). Koohii #2 Tip: Heisig later names 赫 ""red + red"" as incandescent (#2908). Story: ""So the boss upbraided you, huh?"". ""Yep, his mouth was incandescent. Primitives menacing, upbraid, mouth, incandescent, red, red2 Kunyomi: おど.かす Onyomi: カク Lesson: 56 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"	"upbraid 嚇 画数17 2182 Details Story Dictionary 嚇 upbraid Heisig's Koohii #1 To upbraid someone, you criticize them in a menacing way. In other words, you jaw at them with your MOUTH until both sides of their face turn RED (hence the double-red). Koohii #2 Tip: Heisig later names 赫 ""red + red"" as incandescent (#2908). "atmosphere Details Story Dictionary 雰 atmosphere My Story [Rain + understand] Looks like an old and stoned cat ** hits DMT pipe **, "" With the pouring of the rain, I will soon come to understand the true nature of the universe and its atmosphere "" Koohii #1 The part of the sky that is responsible for weather and rain is known as the atmosphere. It only occupies part of the sky though. Koohii #2 (This is atmosphere as in ambiance, mood). Rain is only part of the atmosphere for a romantic porch date. Food, music, and candles are the rest. Primitives atmosphere, rain, weather, part 雰囲気(ふんいき): atmosphere (e.g. musical), mood, ambience Kunyomi: Onyomi: フン Lesson: 56 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"	"atmosphere 雰 画数12 2184 Details Story Dictionary 雰 atmosphere My Story [Rain + understand] Looks like an old and stoned cat ** hits DMT pipe **, "" With the pouring of the rain, I will soon come to understand the true nature of the universe and its atmosphere "" Koohii #1 The part of the sky that is responsible for weather and rain is known as the atmosphere. "item Details Story Dictionary 箇 item Heisig's Koohii #1 Dragon Quest - You find a hardened bamboo stick, perfect for a weapon, but you can´t pick it up because your items are full. Koohii #2 You´ve entered in a chinese shop where apparently the only item in sale is old, dusty, hardened bamboo (for construction for example). It looks like these items have been there forever. Asking the clerk if anything else is available, he doesn´t understand and instead asks - ""Two items? Three items?"" (the kanji is a counter for items) - thinking you want to buy something. Primitives item, bamboo, harden, pent in, old, tombstone, gravestone, church, ten, needle, mouth 箇所(かしょ): passage, place, point, part 箇条書き(かじょうがき): itemized form, itemization 箇箇(ここ): individual, separate Kunyomi: Onyomi: カ、コ Lesson: 56 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:"	"item 箇 画数14 2185 Details Story Dictionary 箇 item Heisig's Koohii #1 Dragon Quest - You find a hardened bamboo stick, perfect for a weapon, but you can´t pick it up because your items are full. tempering Details Story Dictionary 錬 tempering Heisig's Koohii #1 In the East, especially Japan ...there are masters of tempering metal to great strength....on the Spring of Trivia show in Japan I saw how a Japanese sword ...actually split flying bullets...all because of special Eastern tempering techniques. Koohii #2 Tempering should be done with the metal facing east. (If not, the metal may pick up the earth´s magnetic field). "moreover Details Story Dictionary 且 moreover Heisig's Koohii #1 Moreover is a literary term to shelve what you had just been talking about, to come back to it later. Koohii #2 Same as darg_sama. Play on words. I imagine visiting someone who has an impressive collection of medals and trophies (chess champion, for example). After spending an hour showing you all the trophies in the glass shelf, you think ""Whew! It´s over."" ... but the person says ""... and wait, there´s ""moreover"" !"", pointing at more trophies lined atop the glass shelf. Primitives moreover, shelf, my bookshelves 且つ(かつ): yet, and Kunyomi: か.つ Onyomi: ショ、ソ、ショウ Lesson: 56 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 且つ (か.つ)"	"moreover 且 画数5 2190 Details Story Dictionary 且 moreover Heisig's Koohii #1 Moreover is a literary term to shelve what you had just been talking about, to come back to it later. Koohii #2 Same as darg_sama. Play on words. I imagine visiting someone who has an impressive collection of medals and trophies (chess champion, for example). After spending an hour showing you all the trophies in the glass shelf, you think ""Whew! It´s over."" ... but the person says ""... and wait, there´s ""moreover"" !"", pointing at more trophies lined atop the glass shelf. Primitives moreover, shelf, my bookshelves 且つ(かつ): yet, and Kunyomi: か.つ Onyomi: ショ、ソ、ショウ Lesson: 56 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 且つ (か.つ)"
seaweed Details Story Dictionary 藻 seaweed Heisig's Koohii #1 Goods + wood = paper. You know how nori, ie: seaweed, comes in sheets for putting in your ramen or for your sushi? Well that's because it's water paper! Seaweed is also a sea flower of sorts, so it all just works out. Koohii #2 Let wooden goods = furniture. Then: Walking along the sea shore you see some washed-up furniture with water (waves) splashing against it. From a distance it looks like flowers are growing out the top, but as you get closer you see it is in fact seaweed. Primitives seaweed, flowers, water, water droplets, water pistol, furniture, goods, mouth, tree, wood, mouth3 藻掻く(もがく): to struggle, to wriggle, to be impatient Kunyomi: も Onyomi: ソウ Lesson: 56 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 藻 (も)	seaweed 藻 画数19 2191 Details Story Dictionary 藻 seaweed Heisig's Koohii #1 Goods + wood = paper. You know how nori, ie: seaweed, comes in sheets for putting in your ramen or for your sushi? Well that's because it's water paper! Seaweed is also a sea flower of sorts, so it all just works out. Koohii #2 Let wooden goods = furniture. Then: Walking along the sea shore you see some washed-up furniture with water (waves) splashing against it. slave Details Story Dictionary 隷 slave Heisig's Koohii #1 In an attempt to free them from being slaves to their desires, the samurai stands behind the altar likening a clear mind to a sieve that lets only the purest thoughts through. Koohii #2 Careful: retainer (#848). Think of slave in the virtual sense (a slave to your passions). The samurai is standing on the altar lecturing about goodwill (see goodwill (#1097)). He notices the boredom of most of the crowd. However some audience members are attentive about the message of goodwill. The samurai views his sermon as a sieve of character: those of good character pass through and see the merit; those of poor character - slaves to their passions - are blocked from understanding. Primitives slave, samurai, altar, show, two, small, sieve, rake, grains of rice Kunyomi: したが.う、しもべ Onyomi: レイ Lesson: 56 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	slave 隷 画数16 2192 Details Story Dictionary 隷 slave Heisig's Koohii #1 In an attempt to free them from being slaves to their desires, the samurai stands behind the altar likening a clear mind to a sieve that lets only the purest thoughts through. healing Details Story Dictionary 癒 healing Heisig's Koohii #1 (Think rpg!) We were in dire need of healing. Our party was fighting the cavemen, but we didn't fare too well. It was more like a butcher's meeting than a fight... just as they were about to pierce my heart, luckily a priest came along and used his healing spell in the nick of time (#2433). Koohii #2 Note: meeting of butchers + heart are later combined into 愈 in the nick of time (#2433). Story: For healing to take place, you must catch the sickness in the nick of time. Primitives healing, sickness, hospital, in the nick of time, meeting of butchers, moon, month, flesh, part of the body, sword, sabre, saber, heart Kunyomi: い.える、いや.す Onyomi: ユ Lesson: 56 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	healing 癒 画数18 2193 Details Story Dictionary 癒 healing Heisig's Koohii #1 (Think rpg!) imperial seal Details Story Dictionary 璽 imperial seal Heisig's Koohii #1 The imperial seal is usually an impressive mark made with a jewel. However when the letter arrives it has been raining on it and you see that the drops of rain have been transformed into little x’s where some animal legs have run over it. Koohii #2 Primitives (to give correct stroke order): tool bench, towel, 4 Xs, jewel. Story: the Imperial Seal is like a kind of coat-of-arms the Emperor can stamp on stuff. Picture that coat-of-arms as depicting a big jewel (say, a diamond) with a motto on a banner above it saying 'let it be (#2074)'. (The emperor must have been a huge Beatles fan). Primitives imperial seal, let it be, noren, one, ceiling, eight, towel, stitching, patchwork quilt, jewel, earring Kunyomi: Onyomi: ジ Lesson: 56 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: Compounds:	imperial seal 璽 画数19 2194 Details Story Dictionary 璽 imperial seal Heisig's Koohii #1 The imperial seal is usually an impressive mark made with a jewel. However when the letter arrives it has been raining on it and you see that the drops of rain have been transformed into little x’s where some animal legs have run over it. Koohii #2 Primitives (to give correct stroke order): tool bench, towel, 4 Xs, jewel. Story: the Imperial Seal is like a kind of coat-of-arms the Emperor can stamp on stuff. Picture that coat-of-arms as depicting a big jewel (say, a diamond) with a motto on a banner above it saying 'let it be (#2074)'. (The emperor must have been a huge Beatles fan). Primitives imperial seal, let it be, noren, one, ceiling, eight, towel, stitching, patchwork quilt, jewel, earring Kunyomi: Onyomi: ジ Lesson: 56 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: Compounds:
lagoon Details Story Dictionary 潟 lagoon Heisig's Koohii #1 Right part: mortar bound up over oven fire, comprising boiling cauldron. Lagoon is a shallow pond, thus easily warmed by sun, large-scale equivalent of a boiling cauldron. Koohii #2 I stapled both sides of some tail feathers to a waterfall towering over the lagoon to give it a more tropical feel…　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　RTK2:　On list of rare or no official Chinese reading. Primitives lagoon, water, water droplets, water pistol, mortar, tail feathers Kunyomi: かた、-がた Onyomi: セキ Lesson: 56 Jouyou: JH JLPT Level: 1 Compounds: 潟 (かた)	lagoon 潟 画数15 2195 Details Story Dictionary 潟 lagoon Heisig's Koohii #1 Right part: mortar bound up over oven fire, comprising boiling cauldron. sign of the cow Details Story Dictionary 丑 sign of the cow Heisig's Koohii #1 Pictograph of a stanchion, which includes two vertical posts to restrain cows so they can be milked, with a horizontal stroke showing the number of cows per stanchion: one. A stanchion is a great symbol for the SIGN OF THE COW, since modern, domesticated cows are often stanchioned in barns. Koohii #2 77 cows behind a fence. Primitives sign of the cow, dagger, two Kunyomi: うし Onyomi: チュウ Lesson: 56 Jouyou: Names JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	sign of the cow 丑 画数5 2197 Details Story Dictionary 丑 sign of the cow Heisig's Koohii #1 Pictograph of a stanchion, which includes two vertical posts to restrain cows so they can be milked, with a horizontal stroke showing the number of cows per stanchion: one. humiliate Details Story Dictionary 羞 humiliate Heisig's Wool . . sign of the cow. Koohii #1 The sheep had his coat shaven in the winter and a sign of th cow branded on him. How humiliating. Koohii #2 [+melchan] The sheep was humiliated by being branded with the sign of the cow (which is a major insult to anyone, even sheep) and tries to cover it up with it's wool. sign of the hare Details Story Dictionary 卯 sign of the hare Heisig's Koohii #1 You know how missing childrens´ pictures often appear on milk cartons? Well here we have a missing hare. His concerned family is having his picture printed on the backs of receipts and even on stamps. So far, however, there has been no SIGN OF THE HARE. Koohii #2 rabbit ears. Primitives sign of the hare, blown eggs 卯(ぼう): fourth sign of Chinese zodiac (The Hare 5am-7am east February) Kunyomi: う Onyomi: ボウ、モウ Lesson: 56 Jouyou: Names JLPT Level: 1 Compounds:	sign of the hare 卯 画数5 2199 Details Story Dictionary 卯 sign of the hare Heisig's Koohii #1 You know how missing childrens´ pictures often appear on milk cartons? chatter Details Story Dictionary 喋 chatter My Story [Mouth + Generation {世} + Tree] Older *Mouths* like to chatter about the new *generation* on the *tree*. Chattering *mouths* do nothing to save *generations* of *trees* being cut down worldwide. Greta Thunberg needs to take action.
